description:
I found hamburger heaven in San Francisco. Hamburger and hot dog, onions, sauce.  All this on a really good bun. Ordered fries and onion rings.  Pearl's is located in an unpretentious store with a few tables. Check out the menu, it's exhausting.  So many choices, so little time. The minute I first tasted the burger, the gene that tells me when to stop eating went recessive. Why I never found this place before is a mystery since it's close to the Donatello. The five stars is well deserved. 

Operators are very friendly and welcoming.
author: Bill L.

description:
My quest to find SF's best burger continues. My coworker reccomended me this place and it didnt disappoint. 

I had the phat bob burger, (bacon, jack cheese, onion rings, and bbq) frings, (half fries half onion rings, and a nutella milkshake. The burger and the onion rings were good but the fries and milkshake were godly. 

Off taste its a 5 star spot for sure but prices have increased alot from whats on yelp and a standard meal without upgrading to kobe or buffalo meat can end up running you like 30 bucks which is high for gourmet kobe burger meals iv had so its kind of odd for a hole in the wall diner. Definitely big portions tho and put me in a food coma.
author: Sean G.

description:
I told myself, never make a review without actual pictures of the food, but I must apologize. We were so hungry and beyond impressed that there was no chance!

This place is simply amazing and friendly as well as one of the best burger spots I've been to in quite sometime. It is on the lower cost when it comes to eating in Downtown San Francisco.

Things I can personally recommend as amazing for a family of 4. Bula burger, deluxe and mini deluxe and the avocado chicken sandwich as well as the milkshakes, also garlic and chili cheese fries. 

Everything tastes fresh and delicious and I guarantee you will not be disappointed. It is a smaller restaurant with limited seating, but in my time there, people were coming in by the dozens and ordering to-go. The wait was really really limited, they work quickly.

When you're in San Francisco, this place is a must!
author: Kareem G.

description:
Excellent burgers and possibly the best fast food fries I've ever eaten. The staff seem upbeat and helpful, and overall the vibe is good. I had their Deluxe burger and it was very tasty, especially for the fact it's a very small joint.
The burgers are so delicious!! Highly recommend this place! Yum!
author: Quinn S.

description:
After 10 years in the city I've FINALLLLLLLY made it to Pearls... What took me so long?! 

Anyways, a small joint with a large selection of burger options catering to anyone and everyone's preferences. 

We ordered the mini deluxe with cheese and bacon medium rare, and their special, California Dreamin (mini deluxe size as well).

First off, for minis they were good sized. They we're also cooked perfectly. 

They have like 4 tables and 3 window seats so it's difficult to get a spot if you want to dine in, but people were nice enough to share their table.

Next time I'm craving a burger, I'll definitely swing over.
author: Mandi W.

description:
Price $$
Taste 3.5/5

Popular hamburger restaurant in SF.

Small place. It was little hard to find a table and many people in line. 

Cheese hamburger -  I always order cheese burger in other hamburger restaurants. This time, I also got cheese burger. I had a high expectation but it was below expectation. It was okay burger. Thick fat tasty patty and fresh vege. Nothing special. Patty was not that fantastic, bread was simple. It was little too big for one bit. It might be good cheese burger but not enogh. 

Fries and onion ring were okay.
author: Da Won L.

description: Came here after being in an Uber and him suggesting we try it out for lunch. It's a small spot so we had to wait to get a table. You walk to the counter, order your food, and then they bring it to you. The burgers are just delicious. It's one of those big juicy burgers that are exploding with flavor. The BBQ burger was perfect with the caramalized onions, bacon, and cheddar cheese. My bf ordered one of their daily specials and also loved it. If you come here DO NOT forget to order their garlic fries, OMG are they good. I was stuffed, but could not stop eating them. We also liked the fact that you can order half and half of fries. That is what we did, we got half sweet potato and half garlic. We ordered the sweet potato fries, but once we had some garlic ones, it was all over. The staff is friendly and also offer suggestions on picking a burger.
author: Denise C.

description:
The fries!!!! I can't stop thinking about their fries.... sweet baby Jesus blessed them with a magnificent recipe. They were crunchy on the outside and soft and flavorful on the inside, just how I like them!!! I kept talking about them later that night....

We went on a Saturday afternoon, wasn't too busy but there was no tables available. Place is pretty small but they do have a bathroom and a few tables. Luckily while we were waiting for our food, one of the employees offered us a table that had just opened up. We were relieved cause it helps to be sitting while enjoying these burgers. 

The turkey burger was awesome!!! The toppings were fresh and crisp, and I loved the wheat bun! I do feel that the turkey patty wasn't seasoned enough, but with the fries and the toppings included it all worked out. I will definitely be back :) I am removing one star simply because I need some salt or something on that turkey patty! Until next time Pearl, until next time....
author: Leslie H.

description:
While I was waiting for my order someone came in to congratulate the employees for being on the news earlier today (as the #7 place to get a burger in the country). He turned to me and laughed and said "I could've told you that," so I knew it must be pretty good! Though he didn't order any food...

The store front is unremarkable and it could be easy be miss. However, Now that I have tried the food I can completely see why they have such great reviews. I got a (gluten free) lettuce wrap burger with onion and cheddar cheese and a side of sweet potato fries. Both were amazing, but I wish I'd tried something more adventurous than a standard burger. Next time! 

They accept credit cards now. There was a few open tables, but I got my meal to go. ~10/15 for a very filling meal
author: Tess G.

description: A delicious, well made, old school burger without all of the "frew frew" add ons (of course you have that option too). The mini burger is big enough to fill you up, especially if you get a side of fries. I recommend sharing the basket where u can mix-and-match regular fries, sweet potato or onion rings, all of which were delicious. The service is friendly and attentive too. A few negatives are the location of the restaurant, which is around the TL, as well as the lack of seating, which was also uncomfortable. Aside from these, this restaurant is a hidden gem.
author: Adriana G.

description:
"I still eat a burger at a counter with ketchup dripping down my face." - Scarlett Johansson

Oh Scarlett! I've been here before, in fact, I used to live in a loft a couple blocks away. Yet, those were pre-yelp days, a decade or so ago, and in fairness had to experience Pearl's in real-time again. And so glad I re-visited Pearl's Deluxe Burgers! 

The last time here I was maybe with my ex-wife? Sadly not Scarlett! This time around I was flying solo. Pearl's is on a busy street corner in the heart of the city, very urban, but as you enter you feel stress falling away at the doorway. You know you're entering awesome burger territory! Enjoy! 

Pearl's is somewhat cramped, but it works for a burger joint. It's clean and has maybe four tables and counters at the window. You place your order at the cashier and a huge menu sits on the wall to help you with choices. I order the Pearl's Deluxe w/ Cheese, French Fries, and San Pellegrino as my drink. I sit near the window, near someone talking to them-self, but it's harmless, so all is good;P

Pearl's is a "good busy", not overly crowded, just people coming and going. Some still talking to themselves lol. The decor is like a small diner with the "graffiti" art bathroom in the back. Place is very clean too. And before I can count to 100 bottles... my order is brought to me. It's piping and all mine!

All in all, I have only good things to say about Pearl's Deluxe Burgers - it's pretty awesome! It's probably a 4.5-Stars in my book, but not sure if I rank the burger as top rate! It's good, don't get me wrong, in fact, the crispy on the outside, tender inside, French fries are to die for... maybe the best fries, ever! Oh my ex-wife was French... is why 4.5?
author: Eric R.

description: Small but truly a local and unique place located at Jones and Post, limited seating, but a large menu. Their specialty are burgers with 100% beef, Kolbe Beef or Buffalo. Since they prepare your food once ordered there is a wait.  You can call ahead if your limited for time, had the SpicySly loaded with peppers, onions and pepper Jack cheese. The onion rings are totally delicious cut thin and lightly battered,some of the best I have had. Will be back
author: Rob W.

description:
WOW! Best burger ever granted I am not a burger guy but I had to show Pearl Deluxe some local love considering all the headlines of it having the 7th best burger in the United States! So I made the trip on foot, up the hill through Union Square and to my surprise the joint did not have a line out the door which, considering this week's news about Pearl's having one of the best burgers in the country. 

The San Francisco location is like three blocks up from Union Square and worth the uphill walk. It is a small location that has seats for about 20 people or less but nowadays we have options to have this deliciousness delivered to us aka DoorDash! The staff was working very hard and they were very nice, I ordered a BBQ burger and a classic Pearl Deluxe burger with sides of fries (burgers don't come with fries). You have mustard, ketchup and very good quality pickles to serve yourself oh and water that you may pour while you wait. It was the shortest wait, less than ten minutes and my order was ready which was impressive considering business was coming in today because all seats were taken, people were walking in to take to-go's and the guys looked like they had been working very hard by the time I got there at 5 pm--trust me I know things, I did work in the food biz once upon a time. 

Flavors on absolutely hit! The fries had a very light crispy seasoned batter on them that made them crunchy but not so battered they felt like tempura. The burgers....wow...so good!

I had the Pearl Deluxe, the classic with no substitutions or custom options,  I got the burger just how they make it with mayo lightly spread on a toasted sesame bun that had  a lettuce bed (not leaf) with red onions and a slice of tomato followed by a patty with melted cheddar cheese. The cheese was perfectly melted on the juicy patty, and the crunch from the red onion, lettuce and tomato in every bite of the Pearl Deluxe was amazing. This is a good classic burger I highly recommend it! 

Next time I'm going for a milkshake to really do it proper. 

Keep up the great work Pearl's you have something special, I'll be back!
author: Karlos G.

description:
Dropped by here based on yelp reviews that I saw with a friend.

Ended up getting a prized pearl shared a frings (half fries and onion rings). My friend had ended up getting a mini burger and that by itself was a pretty good size for the price point so I was excited for mine. It turned out a lot bigger than I expected. It was a little bigger than size of a five guys burger.

The place is kind of small, probably with three tables and some window seats supporting at most 20-25 people if you really squeeze.

It turned out tasting pretty good but unfortunately, mine started breaking apart because it was big and it was really greasy. The burger itself was pretty average but the condiments really made a majority of the taste.

It was my first time here but it seems that they just started taking credit cards as they mentioned that to us. They do have an atm machine in there if you ever need cash.
author: Timothy D.

description:
today was a kinda burger day, so I went to Pearl based on a girl I met on Lyft line who told me about this place.
the place is pretty small, friendly, cozy and clean.
I saw the menu on the board, I decided to order the Mushrooms Burger with Buffalo meat and a side of fries.
total cost was $24.44
it was a premium price I told you.
but while the meat was of a premium quality, fries were good, pickles were free and self service and the place was comfortable, this place is good but not the best burger shop in San Francisco.
that title belongs to my favorite tiny hole in the wall burger place on 9th Ave & Irving in the Sunset.
hey Jordan, meet me at Jenny's Burger instead!
author: Rudy H.

description: Best damn burger I've had. Juicy, fresh ingredients perfect size as a 1/4 pounder. I got their special which was the California burger with no bacon. Delicious!
author: Stephany C.

description:
What's there really left for me to say about my favorite burger place? 

I started coming here in 2008, moved to NorCal so it became easier to come here, moved from NorCal so it became more difficult for me to come here, and now it's 2018 and I'm STILL coming here any time I come back to the city. 

If you've never been here, the burgers are amaze! I've had nearly ever special burger on the menu, and the best ones are the Phat Bob (the first one I ever had and IMO still my favorite), the Prized Pearl, and the Bula Burger. Definitely replace the beef patty with Kobe meat or buffalo, you won't regret it!

And if you think the burgers are better, the fries are EVEN BETTER. Not even kidding about this, last time I came here I didn't even bother getting a burger. Went straight for the frings (fries and onion rings)! They're extra crispy because they do throw the fries in flour before frying them (so if you need to stay gluten-free, stay away from the fries). Legitimately proved I would come back here just to eat the fries. :P

Last, if you love milkshakes, THEY GOT MILKSHAKES TOO. Trust me, they're excellent. Maybe don't order it with a burger and fries, that's a tad too aggressive. But ordering one on its own? Just what the doctor ordered!

Service here has always taken a while, but that's because they make every order only once it's been ordered. Guarantees the highest quality available! In all my times here, they've always been great to me. 

And last but not least, my last review of this place said Pearl's had sadly become cash only. Well not only do they take cards again, they have Apple Pay too! No idea about Android Pay though.

Now that I'm not in NorCal anymore, I really do make it a point to come back to Pearl's every time I visit SF. Here's to another 10 more years. :)
author: Alexander Y.

description:
Came here because of an article on SF gate claiming this place was one of the best in the Bay Area from a recent TripAdvisor vote. I would disagree with those voters. 

Place was so tiny, fitting probably 20 people at most. There was no sign indicating paying before seating. Cashier told people there was about ten minutes wait. That was fine except that there was no room for people to wait. 

Burger was decent, juicy and flavorful. It's super duper level of quality but the burger bun felt like shelf bun. It was soggy. They should toast it more. Fries were just ok. 

For the price, probably I would go to super duper. At least you have a nicer and cleaner eating environment. 

Btw, be careful with hot water when washing hands in the bathroom. Don't get burnt. It's super hot.
author: Carrie Z.

description:
The absolute best garlic fries I have ever ever ever tasted. For dinner there was Phat Bob, frings fries, garlic fries and deluxe burger. All of it delicious. The burger was just the right amount of juiciness without being too soggy. Small place for sit down, gets crowded fast so beware. 

Definitely will be back!
author: Lourdes R.

description:
Came to this place because my burger place was close. BUT WHOA! My burger place should be sorry they closed 17 mins early that night because this could be my new burger place! Wow! 
I got the mini delux burger and it was more then enough! They stacked it with all the favorites including avo! YAS! 
We got chili cheese fries and yum! Was disappointed at first because I thought it was just cheese fries but the give you a WHOLE side of chili to fix it yourself! 
Definitely recommend!!
author: Megan M.

description: It's been awhile since I had a delicious burger like this and what really set it off were the garlic fries. Made fresh to order and the staff was very friendly and attentive. If you're looking for a great burger when visiting San Francisco this is the place to be.
author: Michael A.

description:
Pretty amazing stuff going on here.

Let me start off by saying there's literally a tub, A TUB, of pickles on the self serve counter.  YUP.  So thanks for that, Pearl.

I had a mini deluxe mushroom cheeseburger and it was beautiful.  I didn't take a picture because I lack the self-control to wait a few more seconds.  I also inhaled the spries (sweet potato/fries).  They were cooked to perfection, extra crispy!

It's a tiny location, so that might interfere with dining in to enjoy your fresh meal.  I would recommend to try planning your visit around a less busy time of day.  Honestly, I may not even consider my own words because I have no idea if/when I'd be back.
author: Alyssa Mae C.

description:
I came here after it was rated the #7 burger spot in the US by TripAdvisor. It was very crowded and unfortunately did not follow suit with all of the other restaurants in the area (it's in a bad area so I wouldn't recommend a night visit) in having low prices. I paid $12 for just a burger (fries will cost you at least $4.50 extra). 

The burger itself was very good, although calling it #7 is a bit of a stretch. I got the Fat Bob which was packed with flavor and was enough that I was pretty full even without the fries.

There were a few small tables and if you don't mind eating at the same table as someone else not too hard to find a place to sit.
author: Eric W.

description:
Picked up an avocado burger from here and it was pretty good. It was $9.99 if my memory is spot on . I also got bacon added on and my wife and I both thought it was decent but not a great burger.

I think the price point makes it attractive since there are more pricier burger options nearby if you're trying to be a baller on a budget.

The employees were super friendly here and they do take credit cards/atm , I think a recent review review indicated cash only but that is not the case.
author: Rod M.

description: This was a highly rated burger shacks, listed as one of the best in the nation! When we tried it, their burgers, fries, onion rings & chocolate malt was very, very good! One of the best in the nation? Um, I don't know about that, but certainly one of the best in San Francisco & Bay Area! Good enough to make my revisit list the next time I'm in the city. Stop by, give it a try and tell me what YOU think!
author: Puka M.

description:
Great Burger place... Adding to my fave list. Had the Kobe, Mushroom Burger, and fries... All delicious. 
Place: small and clean
Staff: Awesome. Customer oriented and friendly.
author: Richard C.

description:
I absolutely love Pearl's! Warning though- it's cash only, unless you order online. They do have an ATM but just be aware ahead of time if possible. 

I appreciate the fact that they have the smaller or larger burgers. With all the add-ins, the smaller one is usually just about right for me. I also like the fact that they offer fries, onion rings and sweet potato fries as sides. And milkshakes! 

Service is always friendly and it's always a great experience going over to Pearl's.
author: Leina K.

description: Prices on the website dont match in store prices which was extremely annoying. Burger was just average but again, its super annoying to go out of your way for a decently priced burger and then have to spend more than you wanted to for again, an average burger. Its 2018 Pearls, either update your website or get rid of to it to erase the image that you guys are modern.
author: Gilbert M.

description:
To quote Jules Winnfield "MMmmm That is a tasty burger"..

Need a quality bite to eat with crispy fries and a Coke? Stop on by and pick from a great menu of options, the prepare to be dazzled. For once soggy fries were not served, a rare thing today, but also some great onion rings to boot. The 1/4 or 1/2 pound burgers are cooked medium as a rule. Chicken, Turkey, Buffalo, and Kobe are offered as well for your protein.

The place is small so be ready to eat outside or "to go" unless you are cool with sharing the bar or an end table.

Soda can be refilled. I didn't try the shakes, but others with me did and said they were terrific.

Go and fill up. You won't be disappointed.
author: John W.

description:
A deeply, importantly, meaningfully greasy bacon cheeseburger awaits you at Pearls. Pair it with hand cut onion rings and a (somewhat ubiquitous) salted caramel milkshake, and your Doctor will never forgive you for the joyously frolicsome cholesterol fest you'll enjoy. 

Greasy means tasty here. The burgers are not for the faint of heart although mini versions are available. There are clever options with broiled pineapple as well the pile-driving bacon encrusted monster I enjoyed. 

You can help yourself to as many non-homemade pickles as you want. 

It's counterservice and seating goes fast so don't bring a large group. 

The bathroom is an unexpected treasure for the Area -- they have one! -- and it is clean and something of an artistic gem since the walls are emblazoned with tags, graffiti and the odd off-color joke. 

I wouldn't eat here often unless I wanted to gain five pounds each visit, but when you want an authentically American burger -- not fancied up -- this is a great place for it. Legendary.
author: Tim P.

description:
I read an article where Pearl's was voted #7 burger in the nation. THE NATION! 

I really want to try those other burgers cause Pearl's is #1 to me. I love about an hour a way and thank god cause I'd probably have to just get a job there cause the amount of money I'd spend on the Phat Bob and springs is ridiculous! 

What you do is pick up your Phat Bob and remove the wrapper, place the springs under the area where you're holding the burger and just enjoy! Those juices that run down your hand/arm as well as those juices that fall onto the springs or fries or onion rings or whatever you want, are not to be wasted. Don't do it! Don't deny yourself that deliciousness! 

Go get you a Phat Bob now!!!!! NOW!!!!
author: Frankie R.

description: Delicious burgers and the most fresh tasting sweet and regular fries. It's really small and might have to wait 10 mins for a seat. Best tasting sweet potato fries. If you're a pickles person omg the most delicious pickles. 5 star service.
author: Dawla A.

description:
Delish!!! Came to San Francisco to take my daughter to college and came across this little burger place which is just around the corner from her dorm. It was fabulous!! Enjoyed an Burger with avocado lettuce wrapped and my daughter had a grilled cheese. We shared garlic fries... omg such goodness!
The service was fantastic, they were so friendly and food came out quick!!!
author: Tiffany R.

description:
The burgers here are well worth the hype!

The mushroom burger is one of the juiciest burgers I have had in the past five years and they do not skimp out on the toppings! Mushroom overload, anyone? I want to try out their other burgers and compare them to one & other. The spries are also fantastic, you can tell the onion rings are fresh cut and fried. 

The staff is friendly and try to help first timers with any questions. The only thing I didn't like about here is they are a cash-only establishment. It doesn't really make sense when your burgers are more than $10 each and a side of fried stuff ranges from five to seven dollars. This place isn't exactly cheap. 

If you do come out here for a burger, make sure you bring a hearty appetite and cash!
author: Philip M.

description:
Super clean place, the first restaurant I've seen with a health score of 100.

They seem to use real high quality ingredients for everything and it shows. You can have your burger cooked however you want it.

BBQ burger: very messy (real onions and bbq sauce falling out with each bite) but good.

Garlic fries: you can see real chopped up garlic pieces on the fries, however they reminded me a bit of those fries you get at street fairs. A little too fried for my liking.
author: Tom P.

description: Great little spot with delicious cheeseburgers & a really good meal that won't cost you your nest egg! We went on a night there were a bunch of police officers ordering in front of us - which was a tip that this place was going to be good. They know what's up!
author: Rebecca G.

description:
Stopped here for lunch on Friday about noon. We picked it based on yelp reviews and it's proximity to our hotel. It is is a very small place with about 15 or so seats with a few tables and some counter seating. They only take cash but you can order online and pay with a card or use the ATM they have inside.

We checked out the menu, placed our orders at the counter and had a seat. The place really filled up while we were there. They even had people waiting for to go orders. 

I ordered the mini (1/4 lb) BBQ burger (burger, bacon, cheddar, BBQ sauce and grilled onions on a bun). My wife ordered the mini bacon cheese burger. We also had an order of half onion rings and half fries. Our order was delivered to our table rather quickly.

The food was good, the service was good, the place was small. This place is solid for burgers.
author: Mike B.

description: Good service and del food. Will visit again
author: Julie W.

description: Perfect greasy hangover food. I like the garlic fries and the cheeseburger. I live close by, so I don't eat there and I can see why people get frustrated. It is a small place and there is nowhere to sit. Kind of pricey, but it's SF.
author: Mayra E.

description:
Pearl's is located in Lower Nob Hill off Jones and Post St. There's plenty of street meter parking in the area. 

The interior is small with a couple tables and bar style seating along the front window. The bathroom is located in the rear. 

I tried their Spries (Sweet Potato & Regular Fries). They were regular cut and cooked very well (not soggy or burnt). The batter is definitely unique on the fries. It was light and crispy but reminded me of a light tempura batter. This is what separates them from any other Burger spot. Very generous portion served.

I tried the Pearl Deluxe Burger served with Red Onions, Tomato, and Lettuce. The Sesame Seed Bun was different from any other I tried. It looked think but was light, airy, and held the everything up well while not falling apart. The Burger Pattie was on  the juicy side but very tasty. The meat was fresh, tender, and very flavorful. 

I also had the Oreo Cookie Milk Shake. The consistency was on the thick side but still able to use straw or spoon to enjoy it. The shake was very flavorful and they weren't skimpy with the Oreos.

If you're in the area looking for a good Burger then come by and give Pearl's a try. This is my regular spot when I am in the area. Make sure to bring Cash but if not then there's an ATM near by.
author: Paul V.

description: Very good! I ordered a Vegetarian Avocado Burger and it was delicious. Always would eat here again!
author: Jacqueline W.

description: They close at 10. Came all the way here  for nothing and they knew the incorrect time posted. They could have easily emailed them for an update.
author: Phil H.

description:
Pearls is a secret wonder. I remember stopping in here randomly years ago on a SF adventure and calling it a hidden gem because it was so affordable and filling and fast. Unfortunately, I couldn't find it again... until now. It has the best and cheapest sweet potato fries. And regular fries. And burgers. Everything tastes like gourmet fast food because it's nice and greasy and filling, but so much tastier than any fast food chain. 
Be warned, it's cash only. They only offer tiny water cups so if you're really thirsty just order a water. They have a variety of burger and meal options. There's not much seating inside, so if you have a group you'll have to order it to go. You don't have to wait long because service is fast and direct. It's not a place to really have a sit down meal but if you're insanely hungry or in a rush, it's worth checking out!
author: Katie D.

description:
My go to burger joint when I'm in town. The place is really small, so if you have no where to sit don't be surprised. 

The burgers are absolutely phenomenal. They have Kobe beef and buffalo burgers, along with a myriad of options. The shakes are really good and the fries are even better. 

For me, it's a must every time I'm in town. You will not be disappointed.
author: Dean W.

description: Came here with the kids after the Color Factory. Had the teriyaki burger. It was super messy, but pretty good. I would call this place a bit of a "greasy spoon".  Awesome milkshakes!!!
author: Elizabeth S.

description: The burger hands down was one of the best I've ever had! My boyfriend and I both got the teriyaki burger and split an order of frings both are highly recommended. We will be back!
author: Bethany R.

description: Great burgers friendly staff I believe this restaurant closed down because of the high prices
author: J W.

description: Pearl's has been on my radar for awhile now and I finally made it in this evening for a deluxe w/cheese, fries, and a soda. Believe it or not $16 for an old school combo meal in SF is a deal in 2018 and when the quality is at this level, I'll definitely be back. I love that they ask for temp on your burger without assuming and double check that you're cool with all the condiments that come with "everything". Fries were really good, ingredients were fresh, and the space was clean in the TenderNob spot @ Post X Jones.
author: Mitchell M.

description: Prices are reasonable. Good burger. Service is okay. They are cash only but if you order online using their website you can prepay with a credit card. I prefer to order online it's seamless and you don't have to worry about using the ATM. I will be back because they are convenient and their burgers and fries are good.
author: Joey B.

description: I ordered the mini deluxe with cheese. It was a simple order but the burger was damn good. The crisp toasted bun and juicy meat was perfectly cooked. I'll definitely be back to try the burgers with other fixings.
author: Lily W.

description: The lover introduced me to this place. He's been trying to bring me here since forever. I lost my appetite for clam chowder so we decided to go here. And oh man, they did not disappoint. Burgers were huge I didn't know where to start. Fresh ingredients. Wasn't too greasy. Of course I had to get the California style burger with avocado. Only way to go. On the side we had fried, onion rings and sweet potatoes fries. You can actually mix and match them as well. All were crisp and delicious .
author: Jassy P.

description: I don't see what the hype is all about.  Food quality is good.  Good service.  Was expecting more of a restaurant.   This more like take out.   its another tourist trap with prices that don't measure up to food.  San Francisco is famous for acclamations that don't measure up.  It says a lot about a city.
author: Abdul K.

description: I side with the other reviewers who don't agree with the #7 ranking attention this place is getting. Wonder how that stuff happens ... but in my opinion there are 7 better burgers in San Francisco alone. My medium rare burger was served rare. Said a prayer as I ate it. My friends Medium was medium rare. Little taste to the cheese patty. Maybe it was an off night. You have to say another prayer to find available seating among the 10 or so spots. Don't come with a crowd if you do decide to give this place a try. I'd rather save my prayers for something more important.
author: Robin P.

description:
LOVE.

Before I start gushing about how great Pearl's Deluxe Burgers is, I have to mention something super important.

***They only accept CASH in the restaurant.  You can easily order without added fees online and pay with a card or Apple Pay  and then pickup or dine in. ***

OK. We didn't know that, so being people who never seem to carry much cash, this was a teeny snafu. After ordering online though, we were there waiting, and they asked if we wanted it for here.  We grabbed a table and had one of the best burgers in a looong time.

The place is teeny, with about 5 tables.  Adding to the experience, the spot is super clean and staffed with friendly guys who really know their way around a great burger.  We tried the frings (awesome), a 1/4 lb cheeseburger and a Pearl's special burger with blue cheese and grilled onions.  Both were perfectly cooked, juicy, and beautifully dressed.

If you're in downtown and looking for a great burger and fries, you've gotta check out Pearl's!  Unfortunately, I think my hubby has found his new favorite spot...we'll be eating burgers for a long time every time we go out!  LOL-thankfully they have awesome looking salads too!!!

Thanks guys, we'll see you soon!

Tips:

-Accepts only cash in house, pay online if you need to use a card

-Quick, friendly service

-Street parking on Post X Jones

-On the 2 or 3 Muni line, get off at Leavenworth and walk an easy downhill half a block to the restaurant
author: Diana W.

description: Great hamburger at a reasonable price. The Cali Dreamin was very good. I also got an order of frings (fries/onion rings). While they were good, by the time I got them to my hotel they had lost a bit of their crunch. I'll be back here.
author: Michael M.

description: 3.5 star. This place has high review so we decided to check it out. Got the Kobe beef burger with cheese and bacon. Cost about $18 with small sweet potato fries came up to around $22. The meat is big but lack flavor. Service is great . Overall nothing wow. Maybe their other burgers are better. I'll definitely give them another try. 3.5 star.
author: Christy V.

description: Awesome burgers for affordable price with decent service and not much wait. I tried the Phat Bob and liked it but will try something different next time (note to self).
author: Gokhan T.

description: This are some of the best burgers in town, you can try different combos and know they are all good. The garlic fries are some of my favorites, and the shakes, let's just say if you go on your cheat day you'll make it count.
author: Mario T.

description: Seriously! This place is legit! OMG...if you need to feed the beast with ANY type of burger, it's totally worth going to the ATM for cash because, Daaaaaam! This is some seriously good food.  I'm just sad that my hangover made me have a regular cheeseburger cuz there's about 59 other types of burgers I wanted to have (damn hangover!) The fries are awesome and I hate that I was on a diet and didn't try one of their freakin awesome shakes (yeah, yeah...whatever!) Just one thing - Be prepared to share one of the 3 tables if you want to eat there but, hey! What a great chance to talk to some locals and get the straight scoop on where to go for the best whatever-you-want next.
author: Christy R.

description: A delicious burger and a friendly staff continue to be the mantra of pearls deluxe burgers. Having moved back to San Francisco after many years it was on my to do list to check this place out again.  Had their basic hamburger with cheese and sweet potato fries. The burger was cooked perfectly and presented nicely. The staff was cool. Although pricey next time I think I'm gonna try the buffalo burger. I love Buffalo and it's so much healthier for you.
author: Robert C.

description: My favorite burger in all of San Francisco. The meat is done just right -- not too thick but not thin little patties. The buns are nice and pliable and absorbent, and don't overpower the burger like a lot of fancy burgers. They melt the cheese just right on these bad boys. If I'm looking for a treat for lunch, this is my spot.
author: Jim P.

description:
CASH ONLY, but they have an ATM.

Ambience: Small burger joint. Nothing fancy from the outside, a little hard to spot. Inside, there are only a few tables so it can get crowded pretty quick.

Food: BOMB! I got the mushroom burger which was super juicy. My girlfriend got the mini deluxe with cheese, which is a 1/4 lb patty, so still a pretty good size. We also got frings, a combo of onion rings and french fries. It was nice and crunchy but got way more fries than rings.

Service: Really chill, nice people working there. You order at the counter and they bring the food to you.

Parking: We went on a Saturday night so street parking was really tough. We found a parking structure at the next street over for $4/hr. 

I would come again and recommend to others.
author: Christian E.

description: Delicious burgers every time. Great service is a constant, every staff member is friendly and makes you feel at home. The buns are fluffy, the meat is juicy, the fries are crispy, and the bacon is perfect. Only about 16 seating spaces but they turnaround fairly quickly. No TV for sports watching, etc. I'll keep coming back :)
author: Patrik B.

description: 3.5 stars. This is definitely not the best burger in SF, but I got the spicy burgers and the flavors were good.  The cooking of meat was a little off - they came out either rare or medium well, but couldn't quite cook them to medium or medium rare as requested.  It's not on my list to return to sadly. Still on the search for top 5 to round out the 4 on my list.
author: Janelle F.

description: Ok well, we tried your burgers again taking your suggestions for the deluxe burger and onion rings and we were very happy! Juicy and cooked as ordered with fresh toppings and the onion rings had a nice crunchy batter than was not thick, just crispy and flavorful. Thanks!
author: Piper W.

description:
The food was very good.

My complaint would be the worker coming up to my table and saying "we are getting busy, you have to move"

I have never reviewed any establishment before, but I felt compelled to after being rudely told to leave, while I still had food left.
author: Ashley N.

description:
Don't be an idiot and get a turkey burger, you come to Pearl's for a burgers' burger. Get American, cheddar, Swiss, it doesn't matter, this patty is a little fatty and it will blow your MIND away! 

The tenderness, the juices that ooze out with every bite, my gf gets jealous of how much I moan every time I eat a burger from here. But I'm not much of a .... nvm ... I really love food. 

Ohh, and ohh, please gets yourself an order of fries, any fries really, and onion rings! They are janky af but damn they are good. You might want to share though, it's alot!
author: Roman V.

description: Easy to pass by this small burger spot, but don't! The burgers and fries are fresh, made to order and delicious! We got the mushroom and jack cheese burger, chicken avocado burger, and frings (half fries half onion rings) - everything was amazing. Also get some of the pickles they have at the counter for free, they're really good!
author: Joe G.

description:
This place is super casual. CASH ONLY. Order your food at the counter and then find a seat at one of the elusive 4 tables.

I ordered the bula burger and split the onion rings and garlic fries with 2 others.
The bula burger was soooo good. The spicy pineapple is actually blended into the sauce and the burger is smothered in this delicious sauce. A good burger always has a well cooked patty and it didn't disappoint. The juicy, large patty paired well with the jack cheese and bacon.

The fries are quite crispy and fried to perfection. The garlic fries have a very potent garlic flavor and the onions were also fried. The onion rings have a good ratio of batter to onion. The fries are a little greasy, but not too the point where it drips verywhere. 

If I'm looking for a solid burger with fries, I'll be back.
author: Edward W.

description:
Best burger in Cali ! Spot kind of small but customer service and great food !!
The area is very busy so parking could be an issue ..
author: Joseph Z.

description: Like others, came to try because of the recent local story about how it is top 10 in the nation. There was a line out the door but it moved along pretty quickly. Parking is an issue. Place is small but they have a decent system in place to seat people as they come in. The burgers were good and the bread and ingredients were fresh but its a bit greasy. The fries and onion rings were very good. The staff was friendly and fast. Will be back to try the other items when it gets less crowded
author: Yong S.

description:
Just as advertised - awesomely made to order burgers and fries. The staff was very friendly and attentive. They welcomed me as soon as I walked in even while finishing another customer's order. 

Then they quickly took my order and made my food. The wait was short and they brought it right to my table. The staff member also made sure I had all the condiments needed. My deluxe turkey burger and sweet potato fries were piping hot and very tasty  

One thing to - the burgers are big; so big I couldn't really make a dent on my . You may want to consider a mini burger as the fries are really good. Then you can thoroughly enjoy everything
author: J W.

description: I got the Deluxe with Cheese and Bacon, fries and a vanilla shake. Over all it was pretty delicious! Only negative was I spent 20 bucks on it all, but that's a broke college student problem. And the burger was HUGE so I get the pricing. All in all this place is GREAT, definitely added to my "treat yo self" list.
author: Staja T.

description: Amazing burgers, better milkshakes. Easily one of the best burgers in town. Good variety too.
author: Robert S.

description: This place was good but not great. I came during an off-time, so perhaps that contributed. Staff was nice. I ordered the Spicy Sly with Wagyu patty upgrade, which I don't think is really worth it. One order of fries is more than enough to share with 2 (maybe even 3) people. I ended up giving my leftover fries to a homeless person. I'd come back for lunch to give it another try, though.
author: Devashis R.

description:
I came here while waiting for some friends to meet at Bill Graham.  It was actually a bookmark from years ago and I saw my chance.  I was so excited to try this place. 

I was unimpressed.  The burger was below average even with cheese and bacon.  The fries were crispy, but bland. After about $17 (cash only mind you) for a burger, fries, and soda in the ghetto, I was regretting it.
author: Richard T.

description: First time at Pearl's Deluxe Burgers today and it was an AMAZING EXPERIENCE! So let's get into the nitty gritty. Pearl's is a small establishment with limited seating. It's also a "cash only" business but, there is an ATM located conveniently inside next to the register. There are several luxury or deluxe takes on classic American burgers. Also, there are some recommended burgers as well. I had the Spicy Grilled Chicken Sandwich and Sweet Potato Fries. It was GLORIOUS!! The owner was manning the cash register, provided his favorites and brought the food to our table. The inside reminds me of classic Americana - old Pepsi and coke signage and chalk hand written colorful menu. This is a MUST TRY for anyone who likes burgers and fries
author: Rhett B.

description:
For starters, I did not know about this place, even though I've been living in SF for a few years now. I walked here from Powell station.. WORTH THE WALK! 
After a few blocks in the TL, going up hills (note, multiple hills), I ordered one of the best burgers I've had in a long time! 
Got the phat bob, a BBQ burger, w/o bacon, sub veggie patty. Cashier offered to sub another topping like avocado or mushroom since I didn't want the bacon! EPIC. 

Burger was GREAT. Big, messy, filling, delicious!!

Onion rings were slim and crispy, not a bite without the breading, fries were good, ranch was bomb..

I will definitely be coming back! 
Only things to keep in mind, minimal seating, cash only!

LASTLY BUT STILL VERY IMPORTANT, if you're visiting sf from out of town and planning to walk here from downtown area... do not go at night! Get yourself a Lyft and you'll thank me later.
author: Stephanie D.

description: Fantastic burgers and shakes! A little bit small, so don't bring a big crowd. They offer Kobe beef and bison, onion rings and sweet potato fries. The burgers were incredibly delicious, the service was excellent, and the prices were fair.
author: Jason C.

description: Great pit stop for burgers, fries and shakes! Yummmm! We loved it and ordered too much food everything was good!
author: Rachel H.

description:
Amazing burgers! This is one of my favorite burger places in San Francisco. There's pretty limited seated inside so you might have to order to go or wait a bit for one of the few tables to clear up. Service was fast and friendly.

I got the deluxe 1/2 lb burger with cheese (~$9) and my fiance got the 1/2 lb phat bob ($11) which had jack cheese, bacon, onion rings, and generous amounts of BBQ sauce. The beef patty was juicy and perfectly cooked. I'm obsessed with the frings ($6.50) here. They are so crispy and addicting especially the onion rings. Prices are very reasonable given how full you will be afterwards.

Definitely a must try in the city if you love burgers.
author: Linda X.

description: Although a little dicey, the prices can't be beat compared to the $15 per burger place down the street. Easily one of the best burgers in SF, if not the Bay Area. Super generous portions for $10 with high quality toppings. We also had the half onion rings and garlic fries which were awesome. The chocolate shake was also amazing. So glad we found this place. I even recommend a special trip...It's that good. Don't let the neighborhood or the dingy exterior fool you.
author: JoAnn Y.

description:
CASH ONLY. 
Thank god for trusty old yelp to always help while on a trip. Walking through the city, kind of turned into a mission at one point. 
It was well worth it! 
The burgers and fries here are absolutely delicious, our party of 4 ordered so much food and fries to-go. 

Seriously the fries are out of control
author: Steve S.

description:
Came by on a hungover Sunday craving something hearty to cure me. I got a mini mushroom burger and a basket of frings (fries + onion rings) for the table. The burger was great, but our shared side only had a few onion rings, which was a bit disappointing. 

The space is quite small so be prepared to do some awkward hovering for tables and/or sharing with strangers.
author: Lynn K.

description: The best burger I've ever had that wasn't cooked at a private home. I had the Bula Burger- delicious bacon, spicy pineapple and bbq sauce, two gorgeous slices of jack cheese and a smear of mayo. Also had the half fries half sweet potato fries- both were divine. Wonderful menu and very fast service.
author: Maggie R.

description: I come by on a regular basis. The burgers are on point, fries nice and crispy, but the onion rings are just OK. Fast service and nice people, I would definitely recommend if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Lu Z.

description:
Thanks to Pearl's Burgers I have a new hole in the wall joint to go to.
You know how my big thing is customer service + good food = five stars right?

Well this place brings it.

Came her with my buddy because we were craving burgers and the burgers were high quality, fresh vegetables (like lettuce, homemade pickles, and tomatoes) toasted bun and killer onion rings and okay fries.

All hand breaded but we liked the onion rings better.

What was truly a winner was the customer service. So, I'm lactose intolerant, not a serious case, but serious enough to get sick if I consume a lot of milk. The owner made sure to make the banana shake lactose free where I was fine that day and the next. He kept his word and the shake was delicious.

Two medium rare burgers. Great bacon, Great cheese. Small hole in the wall burger joint.

Support your local business and go here if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Jack R.

description: Tried the Kobe beef burger with bacon & cheese. Side of garlic fries & a chocolate peanut butter shake. Burger was medium rear cooked (asked for medium well), but it was delicious, juicy. Garlic fries were ok, not a fan of raw garlic in my fries. The shake was so rich & creamy! Service was fantastic! We recommend trying & we'd go again.
author: Marie C.

description: Not only was the food delicious, the customer service was excellent. The gentleman who took our order was very sweet! We can't wait to come back again!
author: Grace B.

description:
I was excited to try this place. The proximity to our hotel (across the street!) and the great Yelp reviews convinced my husband and myself to try their burgers. The restaurant itself is small, with very limited seating. The ordering process was easy. Cash only, but there's an ATM in the small restaurant. The server that helped us could have been a little bit friendlier--smile every now and then, girl! 

My husband ordered the Bula burger (bacon, spicy pineapple, bbq sauce, jack cheese, mayo) and I ordered the Prized Pearl (bacon, bleu cheese, grilled onion, mayo). We shared a fries/onion rings half/half and a chocolate shake.

Verdict: 

- Bula Burger: the bbq sauce overpowered the overall taste of the burger. My husband said he didn't taste the spiciness in the pineapple. Patty was cooked as described by the server (I believe medium rare, closer to pink than red?). However, the burger patty was not seasoned enough. There was an overall lack of flavor the entire burger due to the lack of seasoning. 

- Prized Pearl: I was incredibly disappointed with this burger. Now, I love grilled onions...but man, this burger was just overwhelmed by the grilled onions. To make matters worse, the onions were grilled in so much oil--which was transferred onto the burger itself. Basically, all I tasted was greasy grilled onions and not much else. There wasn't enough bleu cheese in the burger to cut the greasiness and overpowering onions. And similar to my husband's burger patty, the meat in my burger was very underseasoned and didn't taste like anything. 

- Fries/Onion rings: decent. Both items were fried to crispy yumminess. A bit greasy, but it's fried food so that's expected. 

- Chocolate shake: meh. Thick milkshake upon first sip, but eventually loses thickness way too quickly. Midway through, the shake just tasted like a somewhat thick Nesquick. 

Overall, we were underwhelmed by our experience here. I had high hopes, but they were not met. Maybe it was an off afternoon (that happens, right?). During our next visit to San Fran, we'll probably give it another shot.
author: Denise P.

description:
Pretty good burgers and freaking amazing milkshakes :)

Oreo is my favorite.

As far as burgers, get the blue cheese burger or the Hawaiian.

Will definitely eat there again!
author: James W.

description: One of the best burger places I have been to recently. It is a small place, not great for big groups. They have a few tables available if you'd like to dine in. Perfect for take out if you're staying in the city. We ordered the mini deluxe burger with cheese, Kobe beef deluxe burger with cheese and bacon and garlic fries. All three items were delicious and perfectly cooked. Next time I come I'll try their milkshakes!
author: Daisy Z.

description: Delicious burgers and fries and a killer peanut butter milkshake. Very casual and not a ton of seating but perfect place to pop into in the neighborhood if you are craving a cheeseburger. Fast and fresh it's your high end fast food nothing snobby just delicious American cheese burgers!
author: Michaela M.

description: Any time we come to the city PEARLS IS A MUST. Any of the burgers SMACK and the fries are literally to DIE for. A hidden gem tbh
author: Karina R.

description: Was very nice burger, I took bacon with cheese and was tasty, but not from the top burgers that I ate, the price to value is good
author: Lior K.

description: Damn good burgers and shakes.  If you're in the area and hungry, stop in for a bite.  You wouldn't think lettuce would be the secret ingredient to a good burger, but it works magic here.
author: Kenneth H.

description: I ordered the buffalo burger and fries. Both were extremely mediocre and the burger was quite flavorless. Maybe their other burgers are better? So many better burger options in the city. Will not be back.
author: Katya F.

description:
OH MAN OH MAN. This place has been on my bookmarks more or less since I've started Yelping and I finally got the chance to try it out after running the SF Half Marathon. Needless to say, I had a ravenous appetite and a juicy burger was just the kind of thing I needed. 

This place is small..but packed. Our group of 7 had to wait awhile to get seated but it was well worth the wait. The menu is crazy extensive. There probably was a list of 10 or so "special burgers" as well as regular burgers, vegetarian burgers, Kobe burgers, grilled cheeses, and hot dogs. In addition, there was also a large variety of sides and shakes as well. Be aware that is cash only, but I do believe there was an ATM inside. Upon suggestion of someone who's been there before, I ordered a Phat Bob and a side of garlic fries for something around ~$14-16 (I forget). Not the cheapest, but I figured I just ran 13.1 miles and I might as well treat myself. Little did I know that this thing would be massive. Like two meals worth massive. That, or I have a tiny tummy. Could be both. Anyway, the Phat Bob was seriously P H A T. It was loaded with thick cut bacon, perfectly crispy onion rings, and bomb bbq sauce. By no means were they stingy on any of the ingredients. Even the side of garlic fries was surprisingly huge. They both were so filling that I could only get myself to finish half of it. I ate the other half a few hours later and it was just as great even then.

All in all, I'm super stoked to have finally tried this. Will definitely make the 0.6 mile trek out from the Powell BART station next time in the area. Can't wait to try all the other special burgers!
author: Gabrielle S.

description: I was in SF with my kids for a concert and I happen Togo check this place out. It was a really good burger and garlic fries. They were friendly and fast service.
author: Dayna I.

description:
I ordered pick-up. Live a half block away. Order was 10 min late. Burger bun was super soggy. And it wasn't well prepared for the money I spent on it (I had add ons like bacon and egg) it was just thrown together and left to soak up moisture. 

The garlic fries were fresh tho and the portion was huge.

-2 points for quality of service vs cost. Don't do pickup. Just eat in if you can find a seat.

Super duper is the way to go if you want a legit  California style burger.
author: Gabe J.

description:
Searching for a good burger in the city and we came across this place. It looked promising until I encountered the female taking my order. I ordered two water bottles but when realizing it would be an extra $6 I asked for the free water instead. Then another of her eye rolls occurred after I asked if we could have our burger cut. Oh gee, I'm sorry I only remembered just after I paid...I'm sorry you had to walk ten feet back and ask the chef to cut my burger (I was sharing with my husband). 

Rang us up for $11 for our burger, which came after the people in front of us and about five more people after us had ordered. Burger was good but are you serious?! $11 for the burger alone and no fries and served with attitude?! 

Maybe in the future you should consider spitting in my burger or secretly telling me to go f* myself after I pay and turn around to sit down instead allowing me to be privy (to my face) to your childish eye rolls.
author: Michelle B.

description: Surprisingly good burger. Annoyingly the place is cash-only and the service sometimes isn't that great (I have, on occasion, received a burger different from the one I asked for) but the burgers are really pretty good, and they're cheap. I don't mind getting dinner here every once in a while.
author: John L.

description: Change your hours on here.  I just came in to get a milkshake it's 9:54 pm and I am told you are closed!  On yelp it's says 11 pm and apparently its 10pm and I was there before 10 and still can't get service!  It's Friday night!???
author: Davis M.

description:
Both my grandmothers are dead. Both were named Pearl. 

When I chomp into a juicy burger at Pearl's, I can smell that musty floral stench that only a grandmother can emit. 

When I shove a fistful of fries down my gullet at Pearl's, I can see both those leathery rheumatoid beasts inching toward me. 

And then BAM! They've snatched my strawberry shake out of my hands.

Whenever the Pearls felt threatened (before their violent deaths), they would release their stink as an escape mechanism. Not unlike a squid shooting ink, the Pearls were able to create thick  clouds of stink, masking their hobbled retreat. 

I can still hear their walkers scraping against the sidewalk. 

I don't always feel great after eating at Pearl's but I always find myself there. The nostalgia it offers is comforting.
author: Sethy Wethy ..

description: Probably one of the best burger places I've been to. I was craving for burgers and fries and decided to check this place out. I got the PHAT BOB which was onion rings, bacon, jack cheese, and bbq sauce. It was amazing, I asked for the meat patty to be medium rare and it was spot on! The patty was pretty juicy and went well with the soft bun. I decided to get a side of Frings (Onion rings/Fries) and it was great, hot and crispy goodness. The only downside of this place is there is not much seating since it's a small place, but the food here definitely makes up for it. I will definitely comeback in the near future!
author: Devin T.

description: No salt, no flavor, skimped on the goat cheese. I wanted to like this poor man's (HA wrong expression, I paid $20 at this, cash only might I add, it's 2017 get a Square you squares, joint) Shake Shack wannabe. Got the Prized Pearl...please SALT THE ONIONS for your future patrons. Oh, SALT THE BURGER TOO. Juicy but no flavor. Shake was bomb tho. Garlic fries were literally fries on top of a weird pile of garlic pressed oily garlic. Do not get them. Staff was kinda blah. For what it's worth I never review places, I just felt I had to as there was an injustice done tonight.
author: Cole W.

description: 2nd Bad Experience! Tried to order a burger from my neighborhood spot but got turned away AGAIN because they were closing in 15 minutes. The first time I could understand, the SECOND time I don't. I paid to have money taken out of their ATM inside only to be told that orders were to go only. I used to be a fan but not anymore. It's a shame.
author: Mike Y.

description: This is my absolute favorite burger place in the Bay Area. After our most recent trek up the steep sidewalks of Post St. I decided on the pesto burger and a side of frings (half-fries, half-onion rings). Never have been disappointed with any of their burgers, and appreciate getting to choose how well you want it cooked. The fries have that extra crunch factor that chain fast food restaurants just can't replicate. Don't forget to bring your cash with you- cash only! My only wish is that they had more seating space because during busy hours you're often nudging elbows with people.
author: Ally B.

description: Mmmm hmmm, this is a tasty burger! Very juicy, messy, and flavorful.  Props to the bun for not falling apart under the juicy pressure.  The fries are ok, but the onion rings were really good.  I'll be back.
author: Rick R.

description:
Was super yummy. Devoured our burgers. They were perfectly cooked and very filling. The fries were really crispy and seasoned perfectly. Got the peanut butter milk shake and was a really good flavor, probably my new favorite milkshake to get! 

They were really nice and got our food out to us fast too.

If we are in the area ever again in the future, will definitely come back!
author: Charity V.

description:
3 stars...
This place specializes in burgers, and they get it right!
I ordered the mushroom burger, medium. Though it came out slightly overcooked it still had plenty of grease to make it memorable.
My wife ordered the prized pearl and liked it so much she was reluctant to share. Grilled onions were a bit undercooked for me, but this is a whole mess of blue cheesey goodness!
We opted for the "frings"... the fries were great(lightly battered) but the rings were a bit flimsy... a bit more breading would help them to be more sturdy to hold the onion.
The shake machine was broken so we will go elsewhere in search of dessert..though this is a cash only joint, and I'm not sure I had enough moolah on me to cover a couple of their shakes.
Ambiance is OK Corral meets kebab shop, service was prompt, and prices are in line for the area, though slightly higher than expectation.
With so many options this joint just did not make enough of an impression to make the list, but good none-the-less.
author: Jason B.

description:
The burgers and shakes here are absolutely amazing.

My go to favorite it The Bomb Burger. It is an amazing take on a chili burger. The chili is made fresh every day and the meat that is used is the same meat they use for their burgers. It is very hearty and it sticks to your ribs.

Their chocolate peanut butter and their peanut butter banana shakes are just to die for. They are thick and add a nice touch to the burger.

I love the fact that you can order fries, onion rings, sweet potato fries or a mixture of fries (regular or sweet) and onion rings.

I am a huge lover of dill pickles and the fact that they have them out for unlimited consumption either while you wait, Tom go long with your meal or even to snag a bunch to go with your meal is amazing.

Every time I am in San Francisco this is one of my main go to spots and while some say why go to SF for a burger I say why not.
author: Greg P.

description:
Let's start off by saying we were suggested this place since we're from out of town. We had a big group with us and like most restaurants in San Francisco they are rather compact. We waited for about 10 minutes to put tables and chairs together to accommodate everyone.  We ordered in the meantime and I was excited that everyone got something different (I like to share and try to get a bite of everyone's plate) Staff was very friendly and patient with us since we had a big group, he also even made a couple recommendations. Once we all had our food everyone was satisfied and happy with their order. 

Hope you enjoy, check out my foodie page @foodgurula
author: Brenda Z.

description:
I wouldn't say anything I tried punched my mouth with the WOW factor, but Pearl's is unique as a burger joint.

Pearl's has Carl's Jr size burgers, without the fast food behind it. The menu is large with a great amount of variety. From turkey, beef, kobe beef, and buffalo for your meat options, to salads, hot dogs, fries, onion rings and shakes. 

One good thing about the place is that you can get your meat cooked anyway you want it. Medium rare or anything lower if you dare is how I would suggest your meat be cooked. The buns they use tend to get dry towards the end, so all the juice you can get helps a lot as you try and devour the large size monster.

Small spot, with only 3 tables and window seating. Cash only.
author: Jason F.

description: Hole in the wall but damn the food is bomb! Also the staff are really nice and all about costumer service! I ate the mushroom burger and for a place in San Francisco their food is cheap and really good!
author: MiamiRose S.

description: I tried just their veggie burger because I'm not a big eater. I ate the entire burger with added avocado. They have lots of options and are now accepting card according to their staff members. Staff is friendly and patient with us while I was trying to figure out what to order. They bun that I received my burger was whole wheat. I'm not sure if that's for all their burgers but that's what came with mine. I wanted to try their fries but I just couldn't order them knowing that I couldn't eat them. They bring out the food to you one you sit down. We showed up around 1/1:30 and there were a few places to sit but it is small so not much room. Parking wise, I see meters outside but the road is being constructed around it so parking is limited. There are parking garages around but prices do vary.
author: Janet B.

description: Decided to try this place after seeing the good reviews on yelp.  The burgers were very greasy and not very flavorful.  The fries were decent.  But my major issue with Pearl's are the cockroaches crawling up their wall.  In the middle of our meal we saw the biggest roach climbing up their wall.  I wish I had taken a photo of it to attach to this review.  Needless to say we lost our appetite. Just felt my need to write this review after seeing that it made TripAdvisor's list of places in SF for great burgers.  Try somewhere else instead.
author: Leen B.

description: My husband came here a few Months ago when he first came to San Fran because someone recommended it. He liked it so much that he had to come back when we were in town for a few days! He was right these are good burgers. The garlic fries are very tasty too but you have to love garlic because they pack a mean garlic punch. The burger is nice and tender and full of flavor just what you want in a burger. They only accept cash which can be a hassle even though they have an ATM right by the register we saw a couple having trouble and couldn't take money out so they had to run to their bank. Other than that these burgers are tasty. The milkshake was like any regular milkshake nothing too different or special but good.
author: Ari Y.

description: Been coming here for over 10 years. It was right across the street from my first apartment in the City. Burgers are juicy. I love their specialty burgers particularly the mushroom and bula burgers. Garlic fries are great too.
author: Richard D.

description: Craving a turkey burger for dinner and I used Yelp to help me find something close to my hotel in Union Square. The burger also had to be delicious. And I needed onion rings too. No problem. Just a 10 minute walk or so from my hotel. It was a delicious burger, I got the half fries and half onion rings, but it was closer to 3/4 fries. Onion rings were the the thin (very thin) cut. Not my preference, but the fries were awesome, crispy and delicious. There is a jar with sliced pickles near the condiments which were excellent as well. Definitely worth trying.
author: Crystal S.

description:
Small business but the quality will surprise you. They menu is quit big and they recommend you to order the meat. That's what they're well known for.
Since I had a lot of meat throughout Thanksgiving I felt like eating more healthy.

The vegetarian burger was delicious and somehow it tasted like meat.
author: Tim C.

description:
YUMMY BURGER!!!
BIG and TASTY!!
I got the King Burger and Springs (Sweet potato fries and onion rings)

Best Burger I try so far!!!
Busy.
Hard to find a parking.
author: Candice L.

description: Quick and easy. Friendly staff, great food! I had the BBQ burger and fries, highly recommend
author: Ben B.

description: Great burger! Fries were good, onion rings were great! Unbelievable shakes. Must stop for a burger in San Francisco!
author: Jared P.

description: It's a must. The pearl deluxe with onions, bacon, mushrooms cooked medium rare was the bomb. Juicy and next to nobby's in Chico, ca the best burger i have ever had. Come to The City at least 5 times a year for many many years and now i have found a gem!! The half fries and half onion rings was fresh and tasty. Will be back on the next trip to The City. The entire crew were friendly and very happy to be serving great food.
author: Gary Lee L.

description: everything sold out last friday at 20:30 after the morning news broke out that their burger ranks one of the top in the country!!! so stop by again to try to taste the regular deluxe burger and special burger. maybe we had high hopes and driving and finding a parking space in tender-nob area was not fun and we ordered the meat to be well done. overall a bit disappointed due to not feeling surprise of the food but a big size of burger for sure :) they have an app for phone so online order & store pickup is easy & fast!!
author: Emerson H.

description: Never try to miss this place! This place is a little hidden gem. It's clean and well-organized. Customer service was also good, service crew had been always ready help with your order. Had the pearl deluxe with Kobe beef and extra cheese and bacon. It was really delightful. One thing I dislike about this place, it's really hard to look for a spot to park your car.
author: Brenda L.

description: My burger was fantastic, along with the frings (fries and onion rings). It's all made to order so it's hot and delicious. The only downfall is that there's not much seating inside.
author: Sierra S.

description: The best burgers... been coming here for well over a decade and it legitimately has stayed just as good throughout the entire time... quality of ingredients, execution, just impeccable
author: Matt C.

description:
The food hear is amazing. I'm vegetarian and this is officially my new favorite burger place in San Francisco. Roam used to be my old favorite. 

The veggie patty at Roam is better than Pearl's but that's about it. The rest of the burger (buns, toppings, variety, flavor) is much better here. The selection of burgers is amazing. I loved the grilled vegetables (onions, bell peppers, and mushrooms). So overall burger is much better here.

The garlic fries and onion rings were amazing too. Probably the best I've had for many, many years. The onion rings were probably the best I've had in my life. The crispness of both were phenomenal. Other places, which may get crispness correct usually mess up on the breading (have too much) But even the breading on these fries and rings were perfect.
author: Saumya B.

description: Coming from Australia, quality of meat is of upmost importance to me, especially when it comes to hamburgers. I tried In n Out, Jack in a Box, Super Duper, 4505 so far and Pearl's definitely tops them all. The chips - (fries) is definitely a huge factor! Because.... What's a good burger without having good french fries to go with it??? Not to mention they have milkshakes! Game. Over. If calories weren't an issue I would have their fries everyday.
author: Marielle D.

description:
Mushroom burger: burger was juicy although the patty wasn't seasoned at all.

Chocolate shake: good

Garlic fries: tasty; although I would have preferred the garlic to be minced instead of chopped. At times I got large pieces of garlic in a bite.
author: Ankur V.

description: Went here earlier for lunch, all I can say is that Pearl's burger is an average good burger. The price is kinda high also. They do have a good customer service. Overall I would rate this joint 3.5, but yelp doesn't give me the option for it. I would comeback here once in a while.
author: Daniel Jayce C.

description:
After ordering online, I went to pick up my burger and fries. I was really excited to eat a delicious burger from Pearl's, but once I picked it up and cut it in half back at my office, I found PUBIC HAIR between the burger and the cheese. There is apparently a 100% health rating, but pulling the hair out of my burger makes me question that.

Going back to Pearl's to talk to the cashier, he only comped me the burger, and refused to give me the contact info for the owner. 

I work in the service industry and service like that is not helpful, nor eases my mind of what should be great service and food, but lacks in quality. Do not eat at Pearls Deluxe Burgers.
author: Kaye R.

description: Their avocado milkshake is awesome! Came in for avocado milkshake in my mind one night but it was not on the menu. Was about to walk out, feeling bumped, but I'm glad I decided to ask. Will try their burger next!
author: Cecilia B.

description: They have really good quality burgers, My favorite is Kobe Burger with jack cheese and ranch dressing and avocado
author: Ersel D.

description: Hole in the wall place, with excellent food.  People were fantastic.  So glad we stopped.
author: Jeremy S.

description: First time here and I had an amazing time! The food was amazing and the customer service was one of the best service I have experience. Very friendly staff and it was a really nice place to seat and conversate while eating there amazing burgers!
author: Ivan C.

description: The best turkey hamburger I've ever had. There are no words. They also have excellent cocktails for every taste. True, a great place.
author: Briley S.

description:
I love revisiting old places I haven't reviewed in a long time.  I can't believe after going to Pearl's two times in two months, that my next visit wouldn't be for another 4 years.  I stopped by for lunch after a movie at AMC Van Ness and had a good craving for a Mushroom Cheeseburger, so that's what I ordered on my return visit.

Deluxe Burger with Swiss cheese, mushrooms, and grilled onions w/ side of fries. -- http://bit.ly/1MUXMLh
Oh my lord!!  One thing I didn't remember was how huge these burgers were at Pearl's.  The bun is great, the onions and mushrooms were sauteed well, and the beef patty was cooked perfectly.  It definitely satisfied my mushroom burger craving!  And the fries, I definitely remember how much I loved the fries and they are still awesome!  They're double fried and have a nice seasoned crust to them.

I must've gone to Pearl's at the right time because when I arrived there it was near empty.  However, by the time I had finished my meal, there was a line out the door and a bunch of folks standing around waiting for a table to open up.  That just goes to show that even though they've been around the block for a while, Pearl's Deluxe is still a popular burger joint.  Stop by if you haven't been there yet or haven't gone back in a while like me.  They haven't lost their touch!
author: Rodney H.

description:
Pearlie Kobe Burger and Homemade Chili!

Some of the best sweet potato fries I have had!

~The Restaurant
The restaurant is tiny. Hospitality is Large! The customers were annoying. There is a hostile across the street and I think a mob of people staying there decided to come right before us. There are a few tables and some bar style seating. The place is cash only and there are large signs stating this. Despite the signs, customer after customer was making a big ordeal out of it. There is an ATM inside. I had my cash ready and just kept getting annoyed at the customers who were not ready. The group ahead of us was gobbling down the free dill pickles. The guy had to refill the container. I saw a lady even put some in a baggy.

~Food- 4 Stars
Everything here is about the same price (under $10). What costs extra is when you start customizing. I had the Kobe Burger with Homemade Chili and Avocado. It was pretty good. I think I would order it with the chili on the side next time.They also have kids size portions including a burger with cheese. Sweet Potato Fries stole the show. We ate these and even stopped by a second time to order a bag of these to go.

~Prices- 4 Stars!
Very reasonable.

~Parking-?
We walked here. It looks like parking is pretty easy on the street.

Overall, I am a fan! Thanks Pearl!
author: Nick H.

description: Obe of my best experiences trying hamburgers in SF, the blues cheese in the burger was super delicious, I will totally recommend this place to anyone
author: Ivanovish L.

description: Medium is very dry and bland, bun is a bit too healthy tasting and even bacon didn't seem to help add any moisture or flavor. On the other hand, their onion rings were overly greasy, but a bit too thin and overall a bit disgusting.
author: Kimberly H.

description: If its lunch time and i am in the city. I love going to this place for a burger.. found this place about a year ago.. the burgers are big and well worth the cost.. fries are fantastic as well.
author: Raymond V.

description:
I feel I paid a grip for this!  Yes the burgers are huge, but sometimes you just can't enjoy it in that fashion.  

+ Things to note +
That frontage photo either is of a different Pearl location, or this one moved two stores down.  I expected it in the corner, yet it wasn't there.  

+ Dining and menu board +
The place is fairly small and can get pretty packed.  As I stood in a long line, and in front of the fridge with sodas, I wasn't sure if people were stealing free drinks because it was crowded.  Or if they had actually paid for them and grabbed it after the fact.  Who knows?  But that's how packed it was.  The menu board was handy:  Burgers listed at $6.99 to $14.99, from Turkey to  Buffalo, respectively.  Sides and milkshakes also listed.

+ Service +
The girl was cute, so no issue.  She gave good recommendations too!  The manager was also cool.  He sweatily hustled and served orders, made milkshakes, helped the cashier, etc.  

++ Sides ++
We tried the Springs (1/2 sweet potato fries 1/2 onion rings, $5.99):  It was ok, but kind of flimsy.  I enjoyed a few and couldn't finish it.  They served a lot!  The onion rings were crunchy, but didn't satisfy my craving for it.  Kinda weak in my opinion.  Wish I tried the regular fries.  

++ Beefy Burgers ++
~ Pearl Deluxe with cheedar cheese ($7.99):  The bun was nice and buttery on the inside, and the patty was real beefy.  I ordered it medium rare and expected a lot of juiciness, but didn't get it.  Overall, not a bad choice.
~ Kobe Burger with jack cheese ($13.49):  This was bigger than the Pearl Deluxe!  The burger and all it's fixings were freakin' huge.  Like I previously mentioned and at first glance, "sometimes you just can't enjoy it in that fashion".  Plus big bites of a dry bun aren't fun.  The kobe patty itself was like a steak, yet leaner.  It's what I expected.  Loved the patty, medium-rare as well.  I probably wouldn't order this again.  Stick with a Pearl Deluxe.  

++ Overall impression ++   
Wasn't too impressed really.  I did enjoy the free chocolate shake I was given, since no one claimed it, so the manager gave it to me.  Bonus star for being nice, even though I saw him insert the straw tip down with his index finger, eek.  The Oreo cookie shake was yummerz too!  A soothing mix to help push that kobe beef down.  
~ Was I stuffed?  Yes!  
~ Was it worth $35?  Not in my opinion.  Sorry fellow yelpers!
~ Would I come back?  Maybe.  I give second chances sometimes.
author: Ron R.

description: I really wanted to like this place and from the previous reviews I guess I was expecting a lot better food.
