The deluxe cheeseburger was nothing to write home about and I asked them to hold  the tomato so I guess that meant that I didn't get onions either and was left with an awful looking piece of lettuce. My "garlic fries" didn't have any garlic on them whatsoever but they tasted ok. The service was fast and other than that I can't say anything great about the place.
author: Steph H.

description: Pearl's veggie patty is de-lush when you sub it in the Spicy Sly. Would be good any way... the veggie burger listed on the menu just sounds boring. Don't settle, sub! The shakes are amazing and the fries are like breaded or something and go great with ranch and free pickles wedges! They semi-recently went cash only which is a huge f'in bummer and the reason I don't go here as often as I used to.
author: Sonya D.

description: I love this place. I've become a regular over the last couple of years since I never get sick of their selection. Their fries are probably the best fries I've ever had. I'll get these random cravings for their fries and won't be able to resist picking up an order. The only bummer is they only take cash but outside of that this place is the bomb!
author: Sebastian B.

description:
What you've been missing all your life. If you ever try this place, close your eyes, choose a burger and be wowed by the magic that is their hamburgers. The place is that good! From the gooey cheese, sesame buns, to the crunchy fries- Pearl's does it right. 

The prices are very well for the city ($8-14 a hamburger, depending on the type) and is well portioned. 

If you're in the area, this is a definite must. 

Treat yoself.
author: Lucas M.

description: One of the best burgers I have ever eaten! Ordered the Prized Pearl and the grilled onions and blue cheese made it fantastic. The place is very small with limited seating but the food was great.  We were a family of four visiting from out of town and wanted something fairly simple and quick but good.  This certainly lived up to the previous reviews.  Check it out!
author: Daniel B.

description: We accidentally came across this spot on our way to somewhere else.   We were welcomed with a big smile immediately as we walked in.  We decided to order the 'Frings' fries and onion rings and the spicy sly burger.  The onion rings are so delicious I didn't even need to dip them in anything and the fries are cooked perfectly!  The burger was tasty and super juicy with quite a kick!  I highly recommend stopping in any time!
author: Tanya S.

description: They make a great burger and a great milkshake. Centrally located and friendly staff. The downside with it is the price. Things are 10% more than they should be to earn 5 stars.
author: Brian S.

description:
Delicious burgers and lot of options, I tried bula burger it was delicious!!
Good fries! Great milkshakes I had the chocolate banana and it was awesome 

l'll  definitely return
author: Maye G.

description: The burgers here were excellent. Lots of great variety and burger upgrades available.  Onion rings were tasty.  Service was excellent and friendly. This place doesn't have much room to sit and eat, lots of people were picking up to go.
author: Sheri G.

description:
I love how the brain works. In this case, we were in dire need of burgers and were just trying to find some place that had great grub, on the cheap and a place to park. 2 out of 3 ain't bad right??

I saw this spot come up in the Yelp search feed and seemed to remember it, but my brain is so broken and I've had so many burgers, I just couldn't remember if I've tried this place, although I thought I had. Was it good? Don't remember!!! 

We walk through the doors and it all came back to me. Yes, I've been!! Yes, it's pretty good. Yes, I ate the burger after a night of drinking and that probably lent itself to the goodness meter rising. No, it isn't cheap, but we found semi rock star parking for $2.25/hr. 

Burgers are giant, juicy, well seasoned and packed with flavor. 

Fries are ok, but nothing spectacular.

Shakes were icy, creamy and delicious!!

This place did the job we needed done and obviously I wouldn't choose this location as my go to pick for burgers or even add it to the top 5. It's just pretty good and pretty costly and that's all there is to it. Sometimes, a place to eat is just a place to eat. Not every place to eat can be Bix, right?
author: Hector G.

description:
I don't know why I've been so underwhelmed with the places to eat near my office lately.

This place is so-so, eh. Nothing fantastic out-of-this-world. Nothing terrible.

I thought the burger meat itself was extremely flavorless. The cheese, mayo and mushrooms did nothing to add to the burger. I think even just a sprinkle of salt and pepper would make a considerable difference. 

The french fries though.. I LOVED the fries. LOL They are probably the saving grace for my meal. 

Wasn't too thrilled with the frequency of homeless folks walking right past the open window where I was sitting. But that's obviously not the restaurants fault. Just something to consider when you choose your seat. I had to put my cell phone away in my purse because I was nervous someone would walk pass and grab it off the table/counter. 

Anyway.. the man behind the counter was very friendly so that helps make for a positive experience.
author: M E.

description:
The meat is really tasty ; the patty is very large and could be a bit thicker but even with tomatoes, lettuce and fresh onions I could still taste the meat; so all good. It's a very good burger but it doesn't have anything special to push it to a 5-star rating.
Would definitely come back if I am around
author: Faical A.

description: I have been to Pearl's many times and I have to say this is the juiciest burger I have ever had. The burger selection is pretty large, lots of inventive burgers with different toppings and even meat selection, grass fed, Kobe, bison meat. The man who owns the restaurant is super nice and very personable. I would recommend a bath after the burger though cause it really is that freaking JUICY!!!!
author: Bertamus R.

description: I came here while I was doing Christmas shopping in union square. I had read reviews about it, and it was close by. I had the deluxe burger with fries. The burger was juicy, a decent size, and overall a good burger. The fries were similar to steak fries and salted well. I would recommend this place if your near the area.
author: Giorgio G.

description: Delicious burgers that are cooked just the way you want. I ordered the Bula Burger with a large side of onion rings. The burger was very delicious, cooked medium well. With it's melting cheese upon my bite and the taste of spicy pineapple & BBQ sauce, it has become a new favorite of mine. The onion rings were a bit small but still very good. They only take cash, but do have an ATM next to register in case you are only caring your debit card. I suggest the person you are with to grab a table while you order. Very small limited seating!
author: Jazveline D.

description: Excellent filthy burgers with delicious beef and sauce. If they served alcohol and had more places to sit, this would be a destination. But now only 4 stars.
author: Penelope R.

description: Tasty and juice burgers, the best burger I had in San Francisco. Keep up the great work guys, the kobe burger was fantastic!
author: Renato C.

description:
Anywhere I travel, burgers are necessary to try.  And if they're near where I'm staying, they will be part of my meals throughout my stay.
   I have to say San Francisco has some good burgers.  The competition is fierce around Union Square but this joint takes one of the top three spots from around where I stayed.
   The place is small, and you may have to wait, but it's worth it.  The price is okay, but it's not regular fast food cheap, but no worries because the quality is there.  
   One of my favorite things is that this place solved the issue my girl and I always have, the old Regular Fries vs Sweet Potato Fries.  They have something called spries, which is a basket with a mix of both.  Thank you so much for that.  
   Let me tell you something about this battle, she usually likes sweet potato fries, but their regular fries were so damn good, she almost completely ignored the SP Fries.  
   We both loved their burgers.  We especially enjoyed the Deluxe cheese with bacon.  So good.  They have a nice variety of choices that are good to share.  Check this place out, it's worth it.
author: Carlos T.

description:
Great price (for SF), great burgers, and great fries. 

What's keeping it from being a solid 5 stars is that it's reliable, but nothing spectacular or mind-blowing in terms of atmosphere.
author: Sao B.

description:
This place is tiny and proves, without question, that good things do indeed come in little packages! I had the single messiest burger of my life (teriyaki) and it was so delicious I cared not one bit! The burger itself was perfectly cooked, the sides (we had Frings,  1/2 fries  1/2 rings) were divine and although we didn't have shakes, someone at our shared table had a Nutella milkshake...
YES! You read that right, I said a freaking milkshake with Nutella! It made me so happy to know this exists I forgot momentarily that we were only in the city because we evacuated from the fires in Santa Rosa! And I didn't even drink it! THAT is seriously powerful! Especially considering there was an earthquake shortly after we checked into our hotel, upping the 'natural disaster stress'.
I can't say enough wonderful things about Pearl's Deluxe, but I'm hoping to get back soon and give singing their praises another tasty go!
Check this place out for some seriously good eats!
author: Andrea W.

description:
Let's first off start with I am not a big beef or burger fan but this place is Awesome!
High quality beef and they cook it just they way you want. The breads for buns are fancy and top of the line. Ask for extra toasted. Very creative and juicy burger combos. Salads,sandwiches, fries and shakes...you can't forget a shake! They have seasonal shake flavors and they are all super yummy!
My friend swears by the peanut butter  and I had the Nutella which is to die for! 
Cash only
author: Amy W.

description:
Pearls Burgers is a tiny little burger joint, which happened to be just a block away from PanIQ Room, which was the final destination for the day. 

Me being the burger lover I am and being extremely hungry at this point, I decided to order the Phat Bob. A  1/2 burger cooked rare and topped with Jack cheese, bacon, onion rings, BBQ sauce and mayo. When they say rare, they actually mean RARE and not medium rare like a lot of places seem to do. The burger was massive in size and flavor. Though an excellent burger there is one thing I would change.  The amount of toppings over powered everything else just a tad. I love tasty toppings for my burger, but want the burger to be the star. That being said, the patty itself was seasoned pretty well and overall it was a pretty decent burger.

We ordered a side of frings (50/50 onion rings and fries). The fries were hot, crispy and seasoned greatly. The onion rings were home made (always a plus), plus they were cooked to perfection. I thought the onion rings could have had a little bit more seasoning on them, but in the end I was very happy with the little basket of fried joy. 

The inside is very compact, so if you're extremely claustrophobic or if you just have a problem eating next to strangers, I would suggest taking the food to go. The customer service was amazing. The guy behind the counter took my order quickly, and was very friendly. He mentioned we get free refills on our drinks, which I assumed was the case anyways but it was nice to hear him say it. He also mentioned the container of complimentary dill pickle spears on the counter which I took full advantage of. 

Good food at a good price. It's the new American dream, and Pearls delivers.
author: Jonathan R.

description: Best burger I had in SF. The burger was juicy but a bit greasy, it tastes fantastic though.
author: Ed Y.

description: This place is fucking perfect. Best burger and fries I've ever had. The milkshakes are so good I almost want to ignore that I'm Lactose Intolerant.
author: Andrea G.

description: Super fast, I always call in for pick up and it's ready within 10 minutes. I'm veg and typically get the spicy sly with a veggie burger + avocado. My bf and I share a sweet pot fry and a garlic fry (fries are so so so so so good - perfectly crispy). Oh and I get a lettuce wrap instead of a bun (to balance out the fries ;)) - love that they offer that as an option!
author: Georgia H.

description: A great feast of all combinations of burgers and fries. I ordered deluxe with cheese and a spries that is sweet potato fries and normal fries. Good place for feel good food.
author: Jesus K.

description:
I'm sure this place gets tons of great reviews on its Burgers, but can we talk about the fries for a minute?!
I am so particular about my fries--matchstick, crispy, flaky, salty, deep fried. You name it and I have a critique for how fries should be cooked. Pearls has some of the best fries hands down. There fries are just as good as their burgers if not I dare say better. That would be a very tough call to make though, so I will leave it to a more expertise person. 

Also, I might add the owner is just a great guy! You can see how passionate he is about his business and the care he puts into it for it to succeed. 
The very first time I order at Pearls he very casually told me about their new app and abilities to pay online to save me from having to use the ATM again. And kudos to him for seeing a need and meeting the demand. Placing an online is such convenience saves me from the $2.50 service fee I would have from using the ATM. 

Every time I have gone to Pearl's I am attended to right away, even if the register clerk is busy. I never wait long for food and treated as a valued customer. I love seeing business like Pearls thrive!
author: Christine T.

description: It was surprise. The place is small. The interior design is ok. The menu is standard. But I have to say that the burger is really good. I tried a classic and it was amazing. Price is good also, it's affordable. I would recommend (:
author: Rafael M.

description: Surprisingly great burgers! The storefront is plain and cramped but the results are great food. I had the mushroom with avocado and bacon burger fantastic with garlic fries.
author: Rolando B.

description: Best burgers in San Francisco! Been here several times and never disappointed. Always order the mushroom burger and garlic "frings" to share.
author: Michelle G.

description:
Great food, great little dive burger joint.

Prices were good for the area. First hamburger came out with a raw center (not medium rare as asked), but the staff quickly made a new one and refreshed my fries while I waited. 

Will be back!
author: Ryan B.

description:
Don't let the name trick you - "deluxe" in this sense doesn't mean "luxurious"! So if you're thinking of taking a classy lady all dressed up in high heels and full make up, think again. However, if you're with a classy lady who is down to get a little messy and loves a good burger, you've come to the right place.

Burgers are around $6-15 depending on size of patties, add ons, and substitutions. It can get a little pricey, but you're definitely getting what you've paid for! They have a variety of fries and onion rings. The garlic fries are bomb - a must get!

A hole in the wall that serves some BJ burgers (big juicy burgers)! The "deluxe" in Pearl's Deluxe Burgers definitely means "superior"! 

CASH ONLY! Bring those extra dollar bills otherwise you can't get that slice of cheese or upgrade to kobe beef. ;)
author: Christine S.

description:
If you require burgers, fried stuff and it to be tasty; this is your place.

If you like the option of Kobe beef this is your place.

If you have a problem with greasy stuff, get a salad...I may eat there for breakfast before I leave :)
author: Richard W.

description:
This is a neighborhood gem serving delicious burgers for a very reasonable price. What you won't find here are patties made out of high quality meat that you could find at fancier establishments. Don't expect too much even from their 'Kobe' version. Pearl's, however, really did everything right for a good old fashion burger.

The patties were perfectly bouncy and grilled to pink juicy medium well. The buns were buttery toasty, sandwiched in melty cheese and delightful sauce, all completed by fresh veggies.

Be warned, their sweet potatoes and normal fries were also highly addictive.
author: Mona W.

description: The place is great! Good food and friendly staff. The burger was delicious and made from fresh ingredients. It's a small American style burger place. Average milkshake but I give 5stars for the burger!
author: Jan B.

description:
I woke up one morning really craving a burger. Dating a vegetarian is hard sometimes, and I often get these uncontrollable urges for meat. I was really hankering for a Super Duper or an In N Out, but this Pearl's Deluxe Burger seems to be well regarded so I checked it out.

Pearl's is right on the edge of the Tendernob, with only a bit of poop and not too many crazies nearby. Parking was kind of a pain, and there was poop smeared all over the sidewalk right by my car door.  Not really what you want to see prior to getting a big juicy burger.

I ordered the Pearl Deluxe with Cheddar. It was pretty good, in a traditional All-American sort of way. The meat was obviously very fresh, and had very good beefy flavor, and was cooked medium, as per the cashier's strong suggestion. The burger was nice and juicy, and a steady trickle of fat and juice accumulated at the bottom of the plastic tray as I  munched on the burger. The burger had a generous amount of lettuce, onions, and tomatoes, and was really thick. I had to open up wide to take a  proper mouthful. As other commenters have mentioned, the burger seems under salted. I think it would be quite a bit better with more salt.

Now, the real question is how does Pearl's compare with Super Duper or In N Out? Unfortunately, while Pearl's is a very good burger, it is not as good as Super Duper or In N Out.  Although my craving for a burger has been temporarily satisfied by Pearl's, I will be heading to Super Duper and/or In N Out the next time I want a burger.
author: Allen T.

description: One of the beat burger I ever had. From the bun to the meat, everything takes amazing. Damn, I really liked that bun...
author: Olivier C.

description:
Been meaning to review this place, but this is simply the best burger place yet in California. Not only is the burger well cooked, the bun and topping are all fresh. The burger is a great size and worth the price, ranging from 7.99 to 10 depending. My favorite is the Bula Burger, which is a Hawaiian themed burger complete with a slice of pineapple.

But that's not all, their shakes are AMAZING, which you think of when going to a burger place. With many flavors from cheesecake to peanut butter and many more.

And lastly they always carry a side of pickles on the counter, I don't know whether or not if it's Dill or sliced anymore, but either way these are AMAZING.

Overall, Pearl's is a standout and one of my top 3 Recommended food stops.
author: Rev V.

description: Luckily it away from union square or this place would be packed! One of the best burgers I had! For the price of around 10 you get a good size burger!. Highly recommend this place. A must go
author: Monica M.

description:
Cash Only! ATM on site.

This is my go to burger spot. Conveniently  (dangerously) located near my apartment, I can order to go and still come home to a warm burger and crunchy fries. Owner is super friendly and accomodating, as well as the staff. I have yet to be disappointed in any of their menu items. Their garlic fries are to die for...meaty, crunchy fries with a mountain of garlic...YUM. Burgers are cooked to perfection and a plethora of milkshakes to choose from. Do your taste buds a favor and eat here!
author: Michelle C.

description: Seriously disappointing. Ordered burger well done and meat was barely cooked. Wasted my money. Fries and onion rings were good, but $10.00 plus for raw meat is unacceptable.
author: Steve M.

description: Excellent burgers! I highly recommend Pearls if you're in the mood for a burger. They offer Buffalo and Kobe as well. The garlic fries are AMAZING!
author: Black F.

description:
I tried their classic cheeseburger and I was totally impressed with its taste. It was wonderful as the reviews and stars shows.

They have lots of different style burgers and the place is small and cozy. The order came so fast and very hot.

I would definitely recommend. Absolutely better than other fancy burger places around.
author: Payam E.

description: Always love coming here when I'm in sf with my bf who is a regular during his law school years.  Prized pearl was yummy.  Omfg get the shake!  So yummy.  I got chocolate banana.  Real banana.  It was a bit too sweet for me.  But it's bc I don't have a sweet tooth but it was so good.  I didn't minded.  And fries are bomb!!!
author: Jackie N.

description:
Came here really late after the Elf musical ended. Service was great and the dude was really friendly. 

The burger is HUGE! I mean it's a big boy for sure. It was falling apart at the seams and I really struggled eating it, but it was really good and worth every penny. The fries and onion rings were really great, but waaay too greasy. Still, they were finger licking good. 

There really isn't much more to say as this place pretty much gives you what you expect. Quality burgers at a very reasonable price. Just expect some heartburn as this could have been the most unhealthiest meal I've ever had. Still, it was good!
author: Benny H.

description: I almost don't want to rank this a 5 but a perfect burger even without napkins or ketchup is something to talk about!  Wow!  Hole-ish in the wall enough to be cool but enough variation to be inventive.  Great execution with "FoodTruck cool" I would go there every night but I used take out and took my "kill" back to the room like a lion dragging a car as back to its den.  T. Fctfcccvvgvgvbyyf
author: Gary W.

description:
Fantastic burgers and fantastic fries.  The owner took my order and was incredibly friendly.  I asked for his favorite and he recommended the Bula Burger.  This was a smart decision.  The spicy pineapple bbq sauce is to die for.  The burger was cooked rare just like I asked, cheese melted perfectly.  

Definitely a spot I will return to whenever I have a craving for a burger
author: Evan P.

description:
Wife and I were starving after arriving in San Fran and wanted something that was walking distance from our hotel. The reviews for Pearl's were good and burgers sounded perfect. We passed quite a few restaurants along the way, some looking pretty darn interesting, but made it to Pearl's regardless, an unassuming little hole-in-the-wall. 

We were greeted cheerfully. At 2pm the day after Thanksgiving,  the restaurant was full but not crowded. Wife ordered a standard burger and I ordered the mushroom burger. We also got a large order of onion rings to share and a couple of sodas.  

We found seats at a shared table and our order came to our table in a decent amount of time. The onion rings were AMAZING. I usually prefer battered onion rings but these had amazing flavor and were cooked perfectly. 

Wife said, "They put mayo in it the way burgers are SUPPOSED TO BE DONE." I'm not sure what that means but she liked it. She said the tomatoes were good and fresh and the burger was juicy. 

Mine was PILED with delicious mushrooms and was so juicy and delicious. The bottom bun started getting a little soggy toward the end but it still held together. 

Speaking of the buns, they were terrific. You could totally tell they were handmade - Pearl's gets them from a bakery in Napa and they were perfect. 

Yes, you will spend more here than at most chain burger joints.  um, can I just say DUH to that? A quality, handcrafted burger is worth the extra money and shouldn't even be compared to Five Guys or In-N-Out.
author: km c.

description: The burger was very good, cooked perfectly, the reason for the 4 star instead of 5 star is the lettuce; they use a darker leaf lettuce instead of iceberg, so every time I took a bite I had to to tear through a soggy lifeless lettuce, I know the darker lettuce has more vitamins, but since I'm eating a burger I'm more interested in a great burger than whether I'm getting a tiny bit more vitamin K than I would with iceberg, but...  this burger desperately needs crispy (not soggy) lettuce. If need be have both available and let people choose, if the lettuce hadn't been so limp and soggy, (completely normal with this type of lettuce when it comes into contact with the warm meat patty.
author: Jesus C.

description: Went to a concert at the Masonic and wanted a cheap bite to eat.  Found this place nearby and what a find!! I got the Pearl Deluxe and cant stop thinking about it!!
author: Jonathan P.

description: I'm going 3.5 here. Solid first visit and tasty burger. Will definitely be back to try other items off their large menu. Special recognition for the option to upgrade to Kobe beef and buffalo. Cool spot and reasonably priced. The Kobe and buffalo options start getting a little pricey, but the "regular" beef option is fair and tastes good. Another special recognition for asking how I wanted my beef cooked (medium) and actually preparing it perfectly medium. Appreciate the attention to detail. Nicely done!
author: Jeff B.

description: So happy I fulfilled my burger craving today. Was expecting a long line but to my favor I was the only guest there. Space is nice and cozy and service was great! I had the Pearls Deluxe Bacon Cheese Burger with fries and all I could say was that it was worth the incline stroll from Embarcadero. Burger was done right with fresh condiments and the fries had a nice seasoning to it with a perfect crunch. Sat comfortable at the large open window people gazing. Let's just say I did not want my Pearls Deluxe experience to end. Got my glute incline workout and a delicious burger waiting for me at the end. (Win/Win)
author: Robert S.

description: Great burgers, garlic fries and chili cheese fries are really good. My favorite burger is the Prized Pearl! So juicy and yum. Service is great, they're fast and pay attention to details. Tried this place a few weeks ago for the first time because I was really craving a burger, and I was not disappointed at all, I came back here again today and still very satisfied
author: Karima E.

description: Incredibly nice staff. Superb service. ood is delicious! Try the chicken burger + teriyaki sauce. Then add an order of  Frings = half onion rings, half fries. Heaven!  It's tricky to find parking, but you can call in your order then swing by for pick up.
author: Heart 2 H.

description:
Of course, Pearl's is a legend. Their burgers are supreme. I do love how they have an option for mini-burgers. The big ones are too big!

They surely are famous for their burgers, but their friiiiiiieeeees tho. Fries are often an oversight. Many of my favorite burger places have mediocre fries. It's a shame. But I'd say that Pearl's has some of the best fries I've ever had.

The only bummer is that they are cash only, however they do have an ATM inside. The cash only thing has proven to be quite a hindrance on many occasions.
author: Kelsey S.

description: Had a very good experience when I had dinner at this location. Owner was very personable and we had a nice little conversation. Food was excellent comfort food and prepared very well.
author: Perry V.

description:
On a very special night with a really good date, we decided to walk around the neighborhood and check out a joint that caught our eyes. Approaching this restaurant, it was clear that we both had an appetite for burgers. Couldn't wait to see what this place had to offer!

Walking in, you'll notice a fairly small joint. Window seating and a few extra tables make up the dining area. Grab the first seat you see or you'll be standing the duration of your meal. The place has a large chalk board of a menu. You choose what  you want, order at the counter and pick it up when your name/number is called. Pretty simple. The staff was fast and friendly, nothing out of the ordinary. Be advised though, it's a cash only establishment. No cards whatsoever. 

For dinner, I decided to get a mushroom burger on the special burger menu for $8.99 and upgraded it to a kobe burger for an additional $5.99. Aside from the burger we got a small garlic fries to share for $3.99 and a mint oreo shake for $4.99. The fries were super crispy and delicious, definitely smothered with garlic. It was to the point were the garlic would create a more spicy affect because of the amount. The mint oreo shake was nice and thick, offsetting the garlic from the fries. The kobe burger was super juicy. Along with the mushrooms, this burger was dripping from my hands. Be advised, it does get a little messy. The flavors were definitely there, good burger!

If you're in the Tenderloin and really want to try a good burger joint, don't hesitate to stop at this joint. You will not be disappointed!
author: Rockne H.

description: Really tasty burgers. Reasonable prices. Friendly staff. Cash only. I chose the deluxe burger with cheese, medium cooked meet. Very delicious.
author: Marc B.

description: Exactly what I was looking for!!!  Juicy bacon and blue cheese burger.  Lots of perfectly cooked onions and lots of blue cheese
author: Isabel P.

description: As is mentioned in other reviews, small place and only a handful of tables. That's ok, I was taking it to go. Had The Bomb and the garlic fries. The Bomb served open face with onions, if you like. Since mine was to go, they put the chili on the side without me asking. Excellent! And there was more than enough chili for the burger, which is fine with me. Will order The Bomb again. The garlic fries start with their coated fries and the adds a copious amount of garlic. If you like garlic, you should be just fine. Even after lugging it all back to my hotel, the fries were still relatively crispy. While waiting for my order to be prepared, had a good view of other orders being made & delivered. Everything looked tasty. Overall, a great experience and I'll be back!
author: Mike B.

description: Was looking for bomb burger. The reviews looked promising. Place is small, think hole in the wall. Ordered 4 cheese burger and the days special. It was with avacado/bacon 1/2 lb. All the baskets were clean and there were so many fries we didn't finish. Seriously juicy delicious burger cooked med rare, in a piled high bun with fresh fixings. They made us table to sit at before we ordered.  Excellent service, tasty burgers. Oh, bring cash or there is an ATM next to the counter.
author: Skier H.

description: I had their Deluxe 1/2 lb. Burger, Frings and Chocolate Milk Shake. Oh my gosh, it hit the spot! Very good food and service. I strongly suggest getting the frings (1/2 fries, 1/2 onion rings).
author: Amber A.

description: The meat tasted of sadness. Maybe the Kobe burger is better, but I won't be going back to try it. Menu was fine if uninspired, but really the patty was just . I had the avocado Burger and ended up just eating the serviceable avocado toast on the bottom *after adding salt. I would have rather paid $13 for a honestly overpriced avocado toast than this disingenuous 'gourmet' burger.
author: Nkosi H.

description:
If you want a good quality meat burger this is the place! However the place itself is a bit crowded and small so seating would be a pain if it was busy. The customer service was great however when I asked the girl about the Kobe beef it seemed like she was reading something off the wall which I thought was pretty hilarious. 

The first thing I noticed was the big container of pickles!! I love pickles and they just have it by where they keep the condiments so basically it was all you can eat pickles. That's a huge bonus for me already!

I got the spicysly burger with Kobe beef. Love how you can tell them how you want to cook your burger! Most places don't really do that so another bonus point for Pearl's! I got my burger rare and it was deliiish. The meat itself was so juicy and tender and had lots of flavor. I definitely recommend upgrading to the Kobe because the meat was just so tender! The components on the burger really worked well too. The only thing is that this burger was super messy. Everything kept falling out and it was just too hard to eat so I ended up using a fork but still good. 

I also ordered the fries, the half regular and half onion rings. They were super crispy and tasty. The only thing is there was barely any onion rings... They probably used it all in their burger because there was barely any in our basket :( but in our burgers oh man there was a lot! 

Overall I think this place deserves to be eaten at least once. Simple burgers with great taste and pizazz!
author: Quinn V.

description: Out of town waiting for our Slayer concert and was disappointed with the Hard Rock being closed. Yelped burger joints and decided to give Pearl's a try considering it's star rating vs. total reviews. Awesome Burger with even better fries. Meat is super juicy, fries just the right amount of crunchy. Would definitely recommend. Perfect hangover cure type burger.
author: Haley C.

description: Don't let the hole in the wall look scare you away. While we were there, locals coming in and out picking up there food to go. Food was very good and I would go back for the fries alone. Staff very friendly and helpful. I will definitely go back and recommend this for those that would like a good burger!!
author: Kristina V.

description: I used to eat here all the time a couple years ago, but then I moved out of the area. I recently moved back, and was so excited to get a burger, but they just aren't what they used to be. And the fact that a burger is $10 or more?? I can get better than that at In-n-out. Even their sweet potato fries are just alright.
author: Meghan H.

description:
The burgers here aren't for the faint of heart, son, they are formidable creations.  If you're tough of both mind and body, you will be pleased.

I had Pearle's on my list for many years, finally made it a mission to check this place out.  Very glad I did, I just wish I had sooner.

I had their Phat Bobb special (burger with jack cheese, hearty thick cut bacon, BBQ sauce, mayo, and an onion ring).  It's basically a Western burger.  I got it medium-rare and it was on point, yo. I got some fries on the side but couldn't even touch them, the burger knocked me out.  So yeah, surrender your stomach, and probably an afternoon to recover too.

Manager was super friendly, nice little shop.
author: Saminda W.

description: Pearl's is one of the best burger places in San Francisco. Hands down. They have a extensive menu with a variety of different options for everyone.  There's a healthy variety of fried potato options that can be interchangeably mingled. Additionally, the milkshakes are out of this world. This place is a slice of heaven.
author: Marilyn F.

description: YUUUUM! Love their juicy burgers! My favorite are: Bula, Pesto, and Mushroom. I like how their special burgers don't have lettuce or tomatoes cause they kind of ruin burgers for me :(. Also try their chili cheese fries, sweet potato fries, and garlic fries.
author: Sui N.

description:
Amazing burgers at cheap prices!

I love this place for a few reasons:
- They give generous and legit quality meat cooked to your specifications
- It's very affordable - their burgers are $8.99 and under (unless you go for buffalo or Kobe)
- It's no frills and thus has a welcoming/accessible vibe

I'd recommend the Phat Bob (bacon, onion rings, BBQ sauce, jack cheese, and mayo) - fantastic. You should also try their frings (fries + onion rings) - they must double fry these because they are sooo crispy and satisfying.

If you want something simple, their mini deluxe with cheese and bacon really hits the spot and it's $6.49!
author: Jeffrey Z.

description:
Definitely top 3 best burgers I've ever had. The prices are very reasonable and portions are perfect. Service is always great and food comes out pretty fast. I couldn't say one bad thing about pearl's. I come here very often and have never been disappointed. The shakes are to die for and the combination of fries are all delicious as well as the pickles made in-house. 
Check out the restroom too! Super cool. Pearl's is 100% great in my book.
author: Dany R.

description:
Wow what a great burger 
Ok  I'm In SF Waiting on a bar reservation down the street. Wife and I starving. Pearl's pops up on Yelp search. Walk two blocks. Place can sit about 16 people. They were squeezing 20plus into the place awesome. 
Now the burgers. They were absolutely delicious! 
Wife had the pearl deluxe and I had the phat bob
Juicy and tasty. Had fries and onions rings both were also amazing. 

Great Lil find
author: Jd D.

description: Good burger, not great. I wouldn't classify this as the best burger place in sf but moreso average.
author: Nick J.

description:
First time visitor to Pearl's.  In town for a week and saw on YELP! this was near my hotel.  VERY tiny place - 2 4-tops, 1 2-top, and a counter which sits 2 or 3.  Got there around 6:45 on a Sunday night and snagged the 2-top, which is in the path from the kitchen and where diners wait, but, oh well!  

Ordered the Mushroom Burger with turkey.  Nice portion of meat, perfectly cooked.  Generous helping of mushrooms nicely sautéed.  Serves on a nice, soft sesame seed bun.  Excellent!  Also had the sweet potato fries.  Large portion.  A few were greasy, but not many.  Would rate the fries a 3.  

Staff was friendly and service prompt.  Even with all the hecticness, they still took time to check if everything was okay.

Burger, sweet potato fries, and fountain drink was $18.  Not too bad for SF and the meal was worth the money.
author: Chuck K.

description:
Liked: Location, dining area is clean, price is somewhat decent. 
Not so much: Quality of food wasn't the best and big portion is not a substitute for taste, accepted cash only.
PS: After a few bites, I couldn't finish my food. So I left for another place.
author: Eugene D.

description: Our hotel recommended Pearls instead of the shady hamburger joint we were gonna hit and we were glad we did! Me and my husband split a BBQ sauce, cheddar and bacon burger- seriously good business, I would say the best burger I've ever had. What's genius is they offer "Frings", basket of half and half, fries/onion rings.
author: Joe'll W.

description: Found through Yelp and so glad I did! Great place to grab a burger and really good fries!  Many burgers to choose from and they cook the burgers to your desire. The person that helped us was extremely friendly and checked on us to make sure our food was what we ordered and how we were enjoying it. Small little place but well worth the stop!  Will definitely visit again!
author: Marla W.

description: Yo this place is the best burger spot in the Bay Area. Fries and shakes on point. Burgers juicy as hell. Tried this place twice with about 1.5 years in between (only because i dont live in SF) and it is still the best.
author: Anthony T.

description:
Big and Juicy Burgers! We tried a chicken Bula Burger and spicy sly veg burgers (Most of their burgers can be substituted for chicken or vegetarian). Garlic fries and sweet potato fries were crispy and fresh. Must try, given the large variety of burgers they offer. 

PS: Limited seating and cash-only
author: Anoshak I.

description:
Total mom and pop place.  The food is simple and delicious.  A little on the somewhat pricey side, but it's worth it if you're not in town often and need a solid burger.

My only other real complaint is their garlic fries.  I appreciate the chopped garlic they use but it doesn't really coat the fries....the garlic ends up getting to the bottom so you're left with chopped garlic at the bottom of your basket.  If they drizzled a garlic oil or used minced garlic with oil, heated it, then put it with the fries, that would be amazing.  

Also BOLO for greasy burgers here.  Very greasy.  But delicious.
author: Lenny K.

description: I was in San Fran for the day and was in the mood for a burger, so I decided to check this place out. Small joint inside, but the huge burgers and sides made up for it. Had the spicey oley kobe burger with "springs" as a side. Combo of sweet potato and onion rings. Personally, the onion rings are fire. Get ready for a mess, but it's definitely worth it. Only downside is that they take cash only and a meal for one could cost up to $25. Check this place out! It's worth the hype.
author: Mohsin S.

description:
Great burgers, great fries, great everything!
I came here when I was looking for great American food on Google Maps around downtown San Francisco. Google said it would be crowded but I was lucky. Just after me a bunch of people arrived. Little off the spot, few seats. I ordered the Prized Pearl Burger (blue cheese, bacon, grilled onions) with Springs (half onion rings - best of my life -, half sweet potatoe fries). Patty was just as I wanted it (medium rare), Springs were enough for two. Best of all: free refills on Ginger Ale!
I only can recommend this place, waiting is worthwhile! Would come back anytime. Pre-orders for take away available online. Cash only!!
author: Mario G.

description:
The burger was fine (we had high expectatipns), but the fries was exceptional! Best fries I've had really!

Good thing you can decide size of the burger. I had a mini and combined with half a frings, that was more than enough for me!

Frings = half bowl of fries, half onion rings. Both truly amazing!
author: Marie L.

description: I love this place, highly recommend the turkey burger. Although I do wish they would give you a more consistent amount of sweet potato fries in your order.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Awesome Burgers very good 2nd time eating hear with family members. The burgers look good and have good photos of the burgers inside
author: Ryan M.

description: No salt, no flavor, no spices. The pictures looked great but my mushroom burger had absolutely no flavor. I didn't even think it was worth eating the 2nd bite so I gave it to my hungry boyfriend to finish. Waste of time and money here
author: Lily D.

description:
Loved this place--Yelp comes to the rescue again!

We had 2 veggie burgers--avocado and spicy. We cut them in half and shared. Also had fries and shakes. My strawberry shake was top notch!

Service was friendly. When we finished we hung out for a while and they didn't try to hurry us out.

We'll definitely be back!

Note: cash only
author: Paul W.

description: Amazing huge delicious home style burgers. The burgers that are so big the first bite I took was mostly the bottom half of the entire burger - mayo , soft fresh bread, stack of lettuce, fresh tomatoes -- second bite of the original bite was straight beef. Super juicy. Excellent service - fast and friendly.
author: H K.

description:
This review may relate a bit better if you're a local living in the Nob Hill/Tenderloin area rather than someone visiting from outside of San Francisco.

If I was to rate Pearl's a couple of years ago, I would've given it seven out of five stars. It was the most amazing thing you could have in a city full of amazing food to be had.

Fast forward to 2015, and things are not quite the same.

The clear turning point to me was around the time they decided to stop taking credit cards and become a cash only spot. Just a bizarre decision when you're located in the heart of world-technology where any old food truck carries a Square linked to an iPad or some way to accept your money. I do understand a lot of places in the city have historically been cash-only, but when you aren't one of them, why would you go backwards a step? That alienated a lot of people I know as it did to me.

The changes have also reflected on the food. It went from the juiciest, most delicious burger, to a better than average three-star burger. The patties aren't seasoned (or minimally seasoned?) and are always undercooked. Thank God the fries still manage to save the day. 

It just seems Pearl's has used its once well-deserved hype to slowly morph from a local's favorite into a tourist trap, attracting people who have heard about how great it is but were never planning on coming back again anyway - and I'm sure they enjoy their meal each time. But what they're getting is a good burger, not the absolute best burger in town they could've once had.
author: Nizar S.

description: This is one of those places that never fails to impress! Fantastic burger joint with phenomenal garlic fries, not for the faint of heart! I come here frequently, always great service and burgers that don't disappoint.
author: Leslie T.

description:
Was recommended to me by a hotel concierge at the Hotel Adagio (a few blocks down a very steep hill) and I really liked it!  It's small and maybe a tiny bit divey, but a great selection of burgers, chicken sandwiches, veggie burgers, etc.  Lots of toppings--caramelized onions, avocadoes, etc.  

CASH ONLY!
author: M H.

description:
Pearl's just has the best burgers.  That's it.  Everyone in the neighborhood knows it.

Every burger is enormous, expertly cooked, and bursting with flavor.  Many of them are slathered in custom sauces, which make them a messy beast to tackle (Bula Burger, I'm looking at you), but it's worth it.  I haven't found a bad one yet.  They also are known for their wide selection of milkshakes, which are great, but best consumed separately.  I've yet to have room for both a huge burger AND a six-ton milkshake.

The place is often packed, and for good reason.  Try to squeeze in if you can, maybe grab it to go.  I normally don't even like burgers, but this is the one place I'll go.
author: Caitlin S.

description:
Oh man....this was the best meal we had in SF during our stay. The place is cash only....so of course it had to be pretty good right? 

I ordered the Prized Pearl (Bacon, Bleu Cheese, Onion) and my bf ordered the Phat Bob (BBQ, Onion Ring, Cheese, Bacon?). Holy hamburgers....not only were the burgers pretty large, but they were juicy and so so tasty. We also ordered garlic fries and WOW. There was so much garlic it burned. But my bf likes it that way so I guess that works! 

This is a definite must try if you're in the area and want a good, fast quality meal.
author: Kristin H.

description: Amazing! We came in right when they opened, owner was super friendly and helpful. Best burger either of us has ever had. High quality ingredients. We got the award winning bula burger, and the pearls deluxe with cheese and bacon. We also tried onion rings and fries. Incredible!! If you want an amazing burger check this place out!
author: Kristi O.

description:
Oh, Pearl's...how I love thee...except when I order the onion ring / fries combo. Not sure if onion rings are more expensive food-cost-wise? You def get more $$ worth without those rings...which, to be honest, aren't the greatest. But everything else?? YES, PLEASE!!! 

Burger--does the deal; if it were a booty call, I'm storing no less than speed dial #2
Fries--OMG 
Milkshake--when decadence calls--you can order ANY FLAVOR YOUR FAT LITTLE BELLY CRAVES. or close to. no lie.

And the service here is always so sweet...tip jar ABSOLUTELY deserves to be full at all times. :)
author: Elle N M.

description: We love the Bula Burger, it is very delicious. The fries also tastes good,
author: Mega Team R.

description:
We came here 2 years ago. It was amazing then and just as good now. I don't think there is anything on the menu that will disappoint.

The staff is attentive and helpful. 

It was not as busy two years ago but today there was a line the entire time we waited for our food. (We took it to go) 

There is not a lot of seating. So you may not get a seat.
author: Andrew G.

description:
Pearl's is a great little burger joint in SF, cozy and jam-packed - people never stopped pouring through the door during our Saturday lunch, always a great sign!  6 of us stopped in for lunch before visiting the neaby PanIQ Room attraction (a great spot close to many local entertainment options if you want tasty and affordable eats) - we weren't able to score a table we could all sit at, but other than that, everything was great!

I ordered the Teriyaki Burger medium rare, and BF and I shared their frings (fries and rings combo).  For $8.99, I was served up a HUGE juicy burger, toppings pouring out and fingers never clean from all the drippy goodness!  I would say the burger was actually cooked medium but was still plenty flavorful and just stupid juicy.  Topped with teriyaki, mushrooms and jack cheese, even at a half pound it was so tasty I inhaled it.  The fries reminded me of Ore-Ida Zesties, which is a compliment trust me, and their onion rings were very flavorful and actually packed a little heat thanks, I believe, to a generous crank of black pepper in their coating.  Ranch was provided upon request, as well as extra lettuce, tomato and onion for toppings, all with no upcharge!  Another freebie were large slices of homemade pickles - I'm not a pickle person but my friends were raving about them.  Nothing wrong with a free appetizer!  

Swing by their bathroom when you visit too - you probably will need to because you'll need to wash your hands, napkins just won't handle this job!  Their bathroom was very tidy and flowery smelling, and in delightful contrast their walls were covered in epic graffiti.  This wasn't douchey people defacing property, this is an ongoing community art project.  It was quite cool!

To top off a tasty meal, the proprietors were super friendly and sociable, asking everyone how they enjoyed their meal and where they were from - neat to realize this place doesn't only survive on business from the locals, and the owner not only is aware, he is appreciative!  Definitely recommended if you're exploring SF and in need of a serious burger fix, at a very reasonable price.  Grab a stack of napkins and enjoy!
author: Terri N.

description: Nothing fresh about the burgers or fries.  Burger was suspiciously dense and machine formed.  Fries are reconstituted potato material with battering that does little to improve the machine made spud mud.  Disappointing.
author: Sue B.

description: I ordered the pearls burger with cheese and bacon and it was good. I kinda wish I tried their kobe tho but I loved the idea of spries which was a mixture of their sweet potato fries and their regular fries. Their portions are generous and me and a friend (both girls) split the burger and a order of spries and were super full after the meal. I think the only two negatives were that it's not in the best neighborhood as at one point a homeless person came into the restaurant and asked us for our fries and the other con is that this place is cash only.
author: Isabella P.

description:
Yummy, hole-in-the wall burger joint just 3 blocks from Union Square.  Good variety of burgers with lots of toppings.  I tried the veggie burger with avocado and sweet potato fries.  Both were very tasty - although should have stopped before I finished the sweet potato fries.

Tiny restaurant with seating for about 15.  Counter ordering, Cash only.
author: Dan S.

description: Banana milkshake and mini mushroom burgers keep me coming back. There is an ATM right next to the cashier, as this is a cash only establishment. Lovely staff. I enjoy the complimentary pickles while I wait. Also, my coworkers saw Seth Rogan here once.
author: Angie C.

description: Nothing extraordinary. By the way, probably money laundering - no credit cards allowed (in the day and age where you can add a $1.99 Made in China card swiper to your phone, download an app like Square, apple pay, android pay, or even a good old credit card terminal, these guys remain cash-only.
author: Daryüsch R.

description:
The night we came here I was craving a delicious burger and I could not have been happier. I got the BBQ Burger and LOVED it. My boyfriend got the Pesto Burger and was equally happy. I loved the variety of burgers and offerings, something for everyone - really for everyone! The people working were nice and helpful even though they were about to close which is always nice. Fries were the perfect amount of crunch. Im sad I didn't get the milkshake - I will for sure next time - looked delicious! 

I would say and SF Must Try!
author: Stephanie J.

description: Great location, close to our hotel, loved the Hula burger and chocolate peanut butter milkshake!
author: Rhonda H.

description: Pearl's was a great hole in the wall find.  The Burgers were very juicy and made to order.  Since the restaurant itself only had five tables or so (which adds to the ambiance of the restaurant), we sat and talked with strangers during the whole meal which to us was refreshing. I highly recommend this to anyone who is in the area.
author: Becky M.

description: Burger was pretty good. Was a little too oily. I got the BBQ Burger with Jack cheese and no bacon
author: Prince S.

description: This place is close to my apartment in SF. I have been all over the country and Pearls burgers are the best by far. This is one of my favorite burger joints and the owner/staff are among the friendliest I have experienced. My favorite burger is the Bula Burger with a strawberry cheese milkshake on the side. Only complaint is needs more seating, tho usually it works out.
author: Mary K. H.

description:
I tried Pearls on a trusted friend's recommendation. It was good but far from spectacular. On the plus side, the ingredients were fresh, the staff was friendly, and the service speedy. The milkshakes were also amazing. 

On the downside, the patties were small, fries unremarkable, and the whole "greasy spoon" vibe is a little less charming than intended.

Liked, didn't love. There are better options in the city.
author: Christopher M.

description: Walked in close to noonish and no one is inside and I was thinking sweet no wait. I check the Yelp reviews for recommendations and then asked the Asian man (cashier) what's popular and he said their cheeseburger or bacon cheeseburger. I decided on a mini cheeseburger. As for sides I couldn't decide whether I wanted garlic fries regular fries or onion rings. He said their onion rings are homemade so since I love trying homemade food I decided to try it. Food comes out and it's pretty big portions for a mini size. Burger was juicy and fresh as were the onion rings. I devoured it in less than 10 minutes. Onion rings were crunchy and has a bit of kick to it. It was a good lunch!
author: W W.

description:
Solid burgers and solid service. 

My only complaint is that our burgers weren't medium rare as requested, more so on the well done side but were still juicy anyways so wasn't a big deal.

Prices seem a little more than fair considering they are within the same range as most non chain burgers and they're generous with their portions. 

Their french fries are boomb too. Nice and crispy, not sure what's coating the outside but it adds for a nice extra crunchy texture. My boyfriend loved them (= The portions on fries are enough for two to share and then some.

Would definitely be down to come back, they have a pretty tempting list of milkshakes I'd like to try.
author: Melissa C.

description:
Had a surprisingly tough time finding an open restaurant for a very late lunch in this area of SF on a Friday afternoon. The Yelp app led me to Pearl's Deluxe Burgers. I ordered from the counter -- the deluxe bacon cheeseburger with everything.

Pros: Enjoyed the juicy burger and grease running down my forearm. Efficient and fast service. Really reasonable pricing.

Cons: The place is tiny tiny. I would hate to see what it looks like during lunch rush hours. Cash only. No beer.

All in all, a solid burger and a lot of value at Pearl's. Warmly recommend if you're looking for a quick greasy grub fix.
author: Billy B.

description: Good and THICC burgers. The onion rings looked and tasted fresh, and the French fries were awesome
author: Deion N.

description:
This is a prime example of Yelp reviews leading you the right way.  Pearl's was a great find during a day in San Fran when my husband and I just wanted a good burger.  I had the Prized Pearl and my husband had the Phat Bob.  Both were perfectly cooked, juciy, and simply amazing.  We also split a basket of Frings, a.k.a. fries and onion rings.  If you like garlic, get the garlic fries, but be prepared to taste them for the rest of the day!

Far warning, Pearl's only accepts cash, and is extremely small, but it was an amazing find and I am so happy with both the service and the food.
author: Lindsay T.

description: Huge fan of this place and highly recommend it. It's a tiny spot, but very clean and very good customer service. I walk by here on my way home from work everyday so my bf and I decided to try it. Their burgers are made to order and they have a good variety from beef patties to grilled chicken, as well as a good choice of other topics such as bacon and different kinds of cheese. I got their deluxe cheeseburger (medium rare) with cheddar cheese with fries and it was very juicy and tasty. I especially like their friessssss -- great flavor! I'll definitely be back again to try their other burgers.
author: Jenn N.

description:
So I'm giving this place four stars for the delicious burgers and service!! I'm taking a star off for price and for the establishment only to accept CASH. You would think they charge that much for the food they would have the option to pay with CC. One person could easily spend $15 or more for burger, fries and a drink. 

Anyways..the food was delicious. I had the regular cheeseburger with nothing fancy in it ( as I was limited cause of the CASH only thing) . I also had a order of the sweet potato fries and a medium drink..the burger and fries where so good!! I'm picky with each so the quality of the meat was really good and the fries where perfectly cooked. It does fill you up but you could opt for other types of burgers for more $$. I've been here a few times for lunch as it can get pretty packed since the place has a limited seating. So go earlier or later to avoid the lunch crowd. The service is really good too. The front counter was really helpful when asking questions and they bring the food to you if you happen to get a seat. They have a restroom which is a plus when your at your lunch hour..so plus for that. 

So remember, CASH only folks..try all the burgers on the menu as all of them sound so good!
author: Jaime P.

description:
Their burgers are juicy and tasty and their onion rings are fries are delicious. Great place to eat in San Francisco! The workers are also very friendly. 

The place is not that big and only seats about ten.
author: Yasy R.

description: Food came out pretty fast. We were helped by the owner who apparently had no clue he was ranked #17 out of 5000 according to trip advisor. Pretty good. For the two of us it was $23 for two burgers and fries. Good burger, for sure.
author: Ste M.

description: best burguer in town! must come! Right price for what you ask. Well located, near Union Square
author: André B.

description:
Good burger? Check
Shitty neighborhood? Check
Crackheads? Check
Bums? Check

This place is great for burger and fries and I still want to try their shakes.  The neighborhood is sketchy as hell!  My friend visited me at work and we decided to eat here, while eating, a homeless guy outside took off his pants and started wiping his ass!!!  It was one of the nastiest things I've ever seen!!!  I just wanted to tell the dude "HEY Showdogs' across the street fool!!!!"  I think my poor friend had a culture shock of how disgusting the neighborhood is, despite the good burger.
author: Katie N.

description: Hi! I came back after 4 years and this place is still holding up to my standards. Amazing food options and service. Tiny spot but people come and go so you can wait a little bit for a table. Burger size is American size! Huge with the best ingredients! I had the Swiss, again, and it just melts! And the sweet potatoes fries are so light and filling. Thanks for your service and for being one of my fave SF gems.
author: Anu C.

description: Great burgers . I had spicy sly chicken with garlic fries and Pepsi. My friend had teriyaki chicken burger and no complaints from him.
author: Natasha L.

description: I'm not a big fan of burgers but OMG my burger with mushrooms was awesome! BF had a buffalo burger and enjoyed it too. Also could not stop munching on the half and half fries and onions. So tasty!
author: Briana A.

description: This place was fine for take out. I feel like maybe their burgers would have been better if I were there, but overall I felt it was just okay. My husband ordered mushrooms extra and they gave him onions (a $1.50 surcharge). I would probably not go back because I have been to better burger place, but I will say it's better than Five Guys.
author: Heather M.

description:
Food: I ordered a Pearl's deluxe burger with cheese and bacon to go. I ate it back at my hotel room. For a burger with bacon and cheese, it tasted pretty bland. It was decent, although I would rather get a burger from Super Duper Burger instead. If you come here, don't forget to take some pickles.

Service: Cashier was friendly. You place your order at the counter, find a seat, and wait for it.

Location: Restaurant is located in a not so nice part of town. But it's fine during the daytime.
author: Emil C.

description: Great tasting burgers, meaty, fresh and juicy. There are a few meat options and sides but with that great flavor you really don't need much else. It is a small place and seats will not be guaranteed. It has a cramped seating arrangement so don't go after shopping if you bring bags along.
author: Bruce F.

description:
Pearl's is a pleasant surprise in a neighborhood with a not-so-pleasant reputation. The Tenderloin District is generally seen as a place to avoid when in SF, but if you want a burger that will make you feel alive, you need to check out Pearl's.

I was at the Westfield Mall near Market Street with a friend when we decided to look for a good and inexpensive restaurant nearby. After checking Yelp, Pearl's immediately stood out to me because their burgers looked great at an affordable price. It was a good 15 minute walk to get to Pearl's, but it was well worth it. At first, the restaurant seems rather plain. There's nothing on the outside that catches the eye, and the inside seems simple. But the aroma of the restaurant is all you need to be convinced that they serve good food. Pearls' list of specialty burgers is something to be admired. I had a hard time trying to decide on a burger, but I went with my gut and decided on the Phat Bob. This particular burger included BBQ sauce, bacon, mayo, onion rings, and jack cheese. I also ordered a chocolate milkshake on the side (not the most healthy meal ha).

The burger was unreal. In a world full of fast food, it's sometimes hard to find a burger that really stands out, but this burger did just that. The milkshake was great too. Overall, the meal exceeded my expectations. My friend ordered the veggie burger with a side of frings (half french fries, half onion rings). He really enjoyed his meal as well. The fries were good and the onion rings were average, but the burgers overshadow any other part of the Pearl's experience. I can't wait to go back to try more burgers on the menu. If you are looking for a healthy option and a nice dining experience, then Pearl's probably isn't the best option for you. But if you want a burger that will leave you satisfied, look no further.
author: Andrew L.

description: The bula burger was large and very messy. I could barely taste the beefiness of the burger. There was also too much sauce. The fries are gigantic. The garlic fries were just regular fries with bits of toasted garlic on them. The sweet potato fries were light and sweet. The ketchup tasted awful.
author: James S.

description: 5 STARS!!!! We are always looking for a real authentic burger spot that has an underwhelming ambience but killer greasy food!!! We love Pearls it totally nailed our greasy burger craving!! The buffalo burgers are incredibly! Huge portions so don't be shy, share some fries. We got the phat bob and spicy sly with garlic fries and onion rings 10/10
author: Colleen M.

description:
Pearl's Deluxe Burgers.....

Best burgers in SF?  How about one of the best burgers I've had...PERIOD!  When it comes to burgers, Pearl's does it exactly how I like it. It seems like it's these hole-in-the-wall burger joints that perfects a great tasting burger.  At Pearl's, that's exactly what you get, a great tasting burger.  I prefer my burgers as basic as it gets...meat, cheese, and just the bun. Pearl's burgers impressed me at all levels.  I had the Buffalo Burger and it was heaven.  I'm not sure if it was the juicy patty or the light bun.  Whatever it was, it was phenomenal.  My burger was huge, juicy, and wasn't greasy at all. In da' face!  My burger was deMelished. I even have 10 Yelp Friends that gave Pearl's at least 4 stars.  Well, I take that back. One of them gave Pearl's 3 stars.  Regardless, Pearl's isn't just hype.  Pearl's is one of those stops that you need to make if you're craving a good old fashion burger in SF. 

As for sides, I was torn between fries and onion rings.  So, I ended up getting their Springs (half order of onion rings, half order of fries).  I was little stuffed from my huge burger that I failed at killing my sides. But both were good.  You can't go wrong with their sides as well.  

Service was as good as it gets too.  The employees were all efficient and nice. For a hole-in-the-wall burger joint in the middle of the Tenderloin area, this place was also clean.  According to other Yelp reviews, expect lines out the door. We arrived right before the rush and didn't wait at all.  Overall, I was very satisfied with my first visit at Pearl's.  Hopefully, there's more to come.  The only reason I'm not giving Pearl's 5 stars is the size of the restaurant and the fact that they are still "cash only".
author: Mel C.

description: I have mixed feelings about Pearls.  The burger was reasonably priced but was just ok.  The meat wasn't seasoned all that great and the bun. Was straight out of the local grocery store.  I wanted to like it more but it was just ok.... better spot a couple blocks away
author: Mr G.

description: I'm a foodie and a big fan of "hole in the walls."  If you're craving a big fat juicy burger,  this is definitely one of those places.  The best of both worlds. It's a very small space with a few tables and a hallway to stand for to-go orders. The menu just makes you salivate as you read each item.  I ordered the Phat Bob with BBQ sauce on the side.  I'm not a big fan of "if it gets all over the place,  it should be in your face" Proper side dipping is adequate for my taste. I also got the Frings, which is an order of fries and onion ring.  The fries...bomb.  I took my order to go and we just waited 10 minutes. Parking in the city of course sucks,  but we'll worth it. CASH ONLY is their motto,  so leave your plastic at home.  There is however an ATM conveniently located next to the order counter.  Your host is polite and runs an efficient kitchen.  So if you're in the mood for a big burger,  this place is a must!
author: Dax P.

description: Great hamburger! I think this is the best burger place in SF. The only negative: really small place. Prices are ok.
author: Bernardo S.

description:
Pearl's is a great place to get a hearty burger. Plenty of great menu choices and extras. If you're hungry, this is a great place to go.

I had the BBQ burger and it was very tasty and a bit decadent. Lots of cheese, cooked onions, and bacon. I also had the onion rings, which were very tasty.

There's only a few tables inside, so don't expect a lot of seating. The service was fast and friendly and the food arrived quickly. Pearl's also gets top marks for health and cleanliness scores.
author: Kevin H.

description: Tasty burgers cooked to order. Choice of cheeses include American, cheddar and Swiss on a pearl's deluxe with cheese. They also have several specialty burgers on the menu. Fries are crisp and spicy. Interesting that you can get split orders of fries and onions rings. Free refills on sodas. All the fixings means lettuce, Tomato, onions, and mayo. Would definitely stop by again and maybe try one of the specialty burgers next time.
author: Karen B.

description: Wow the burger was fantastic.  Great flavour. And served in a lettuce wrap.  So I felt like I was having a healthy meal. Just visiting here and I came to Pearls 4 years ago. And this time i specifically went there to eat.
author: Peter B.

description:
Where have you been all my life? 

I think this place has the best burger I ever had. Everything was perfect. The burger, the onion rings, the coke. I salivate a little just thinking about my meal as I write this review. 

The prices are fair and you get a lot of food. I think this place may have ruined other burgers for me.

Parking is pretty difficult in this area. I must have circled around about 5 times before I finally found a spot. And there aren't a lot of seating areas inside the restaurant so you have to awkwardly wait around for someone to finish their meal before you snag their chairs.
author: E C.

description: the Phat Bobb Burger is the best thing i have EVER eaten.  look no further.  bobb ruuuuuules
author: Ampp O.

description:
Its cash only but luckily they provided a ATM
Small location and difficult to find parking 
Service was great and time was accurate.
Overall bomb burgers!
author: Diana M.

description:
I don't know. The burger was just OK. Nothing spectacular. 
We got the chili cheese fries and the pearls deluxe with cheese. The food was all just very average. 
But! There's free pickles. We liked the pickles lol.
author: Melody Y.

description: One of the best burgers in the city! You gotta try their sweet potato fries. The only catch is it's only cash...they do have an ATM I believe but still. Definitely recommend this place.
author: Suprita K.

description:
I was craving a burger for dinner and found this place on Yelp. It's located in the Tenderloin district of SF (which is not one of the safest areas).

This menu has a lot of different types of burgers, including different types of meat patties (beef, kobe, buffalo).

What I ordered:
*Bula burger (bacon, spicy pineapple, bbq sauce, Jack cheese, mayo  for $8.99) - The burger was good. For some reason, I didn't really taste the bbq sauce. And the burger was quite messy. The patty was done well and it was juicy. I didn't enjoy the burger as much as I had hoped.

*Spries (1/2 fries, 1/2 sweet potato fries for $4.99) - Very good! The fries were done very well. And it was a big portion! Definitely meant to be shared with at least one other person.

Overall, I may come back and try another burger. I think it's a bit pricey for what it's worth.
author: Lily Y.

description:
This place is legit. It's no frills, with only a few tables. Burgers are massive, delicious, and are my favorite in San Francisco. Favs include the Phat Bob and Pesto Burger. 

They only take cash.
author: Vitaliy D.

description: Great burger place if you are looking for something more than your average patty and bun food chains. The menu offers many options including the choice of meat and style in which it is cooked. I got the Pearl BBQ burger with Kobe beef that was cooked to medium. I also ordered garlic fries and a chocolate milkshake. It was delicious and a little messy but definitely a good pick for a quick bit to eat while walking the town.
author: Jamie C.

description: So Yum! I had the 'California dreamin' special and I upgraded my burger to Kobe beef (note: upgrade not available on 1/4 lb). The burger comes with onions, lettuce, tomato, special sauce, avocado, and bacon. It was deliciously messy! The fries were slightly battered but sooo good! Thumbs up for this hidden gem! Nom nom nom
author: Monica O.

description:
Best burgers in the Bay! It's a bit pricey but worth every penny. Easily the best fries I've ever had!!

Personal favorite: Pearls deluxe with bacon & cheese, jalapeños and avocado!
author: Eric A.

description:
This place is awesome I wish they had one in az! My boyfriend and I were cold and hungry and we found d pearls. I had the Prized Pearl, and he had the BBQ burger with kobe beef. We both loved out burgers!!! My  only complaint was that my burger had a bit too much blue cheese, but still soo good! We also had an order fries to split and a chocolate milkshake. The fries were great and so was the shake. The shake for us had a bit of a nostalgic feel, it tasted like a Hershey's chocolate syrup shake. 

I would definitely go back.... all the time. :)
author: Lillie B.

description:
My second time here. Ordered for takeout and they are so quick. I never waited longer than 5mins. I live up the hill from here. 
Ordered a mini deluxe burger and fries. Very good! The BEST french fries hands down.

Second time we ordered kobe burgers and Frings(1/2 onion rings and 1/2 fries), & Spries(1/2 fries, 1/2 sweet potato fries). Huge portion of both! We could have shared one. Also, great customer service!
author: Ane T.

description:
I might have to give this place another try. How does this place boast 4 stars with over 1500 reviews? I can't seem to put my finger on it. 

I thought the burger was very standard. Almost like a burger you'd get at a diner. I got the mini pearl deluxe with bacon and cheese and an order of fries.  My bottom bun was SUPER soggy. Maybe from the tomatoes? But it was only sitting on the table for a few minutes... The cashier asked if I was okay with medium, which is what i prefer but only half of my patty was medium. The other half was more on the very medium rare side. I think the only thing I truly liked was the fries but even then, they were just standard battered fries.
author: Jessica L.

description:
This is one of the best burger joints I've been to - excellent burgers, great variety, fresh sides and a VERY professional, welcoming and helpful manager/owner. 

We ordered the Spicy Sly and the Avocado Burgers, both in quarter pound (or mini) size, along with the garlic fries and sweet potato fries, and a banana chocolate shake. Highly recommend the Spicy Sly if you like spicy. I particularly liked the shake - it was thick with chunks of banana in it. 

One of the best things about this place is the owner who really sells his menu well when you enter. He gives you a quick summary of the menu offerings, recommending items and answering your Qs. The place is very small, with 4 tables total and 1 window-side bar style seating, so don't go here if you're a large party. When we came the place was full; by the time we ordered a table had opened up. But the owner joked that if one didn't open up, he would ask his friends (eating at one of the tables) to empty theirs for us :)

Other disclaimers / things to keep in mind:
- The full sized burgers are HUGE. The quarter size was a full meal so I really don't recommend getting anything larger unless you're absolutely ravenous.
- Cash only
- Usually packed and often has lines out the door. We went around 2:30pm on a weekday and it was still full but there was no line. Plan accordingly

My only suggestion for improvement to the owner would be to not have the avocado as cold as it was in the Avocado burger I ordered. Because the burger patty is so hot, refrigerator-cold avocado along with that feels strange to the mouth. Room temperate would have been much better.
author: Saba G.

description: Ordered BBQ Burger and side of sweet potato fries. Burger was over-cooked and dried out. Sweet potato fries were under-cooked and raw on inside. Guess I should have just ordered a salad...
author: carissa B.

description: After been reading some reviews I have decided going there. No regrets, pretty good burgers for burgers lovers of course, Specially that Bula Burger, and Buffalo Burger.
author: Erin J.

description: Tasty as! Both beef and veggie burgers, fries, sweet potato fries and garlic fries, all delicious! Great value, great service! Yum :-D
author: Katherine K.

description:
Holy Crap this place is delicious!  The owner is super nice and it really gives off a great vintage burger diner vibe. 

I had the deluxe bacon cheeseburger and I was just floored. I can't believe how tasty it was.  Best burger I've had in a looooong time. 

Thanks guys!  Keep making great stuff!

Oh and they have free pickles! Wooo!
author: Spencer L.

description:
I'm a burger fan. On my food pyramid, hamburgers are my number one. 

I ordered the BULA burger and my SO ordered the PHAT burger. He said his burger was really greasy and that threw him off, but my burger I thought was cooked to perfection. I think next time I'll have the BULA burger with onion rings, kinda like how the PHAT burger has onion rings in the burger.

We ordered an oreo shake to go, which was so wonderful. We also had a basket of fries, half sweet potato and half garlic. SO GOOD. Sweet potato and garlic fries were on point and so delicious. The garlic fries were especially crispy, but just on the outside.

I will definitely be back to Pearl's Deluxe Burgers. The place is small, but we went when it was not busy. The owner (I'm assuming) was really nice and accommodating. Overall, I had a great experience at Pearl's Deluxe Burgers.
author: Jordan M.

description:
Let's pretend I was super hungover and I was craving a FAT, juicy burger. Went to Pearls Burgers and devoured my burger in literally 5 mins....oh wait, I was and THAT ACTUALLY HAPPENED. 

The cash only thing is kind of a bummer but! If you're at the register and look to your left there is a little ATM to grab cash so, perfect. 

I ordered the Bula burger, medium rare, added mushrooms and veggies, garlic fries and a sprite. Seriously the best burger I have ever, ever had in my life. There was not a crum left in my plate. And I am not sorry. 

And thank you Pearls, for saving my life. ;)
author: Chelsey S.

description: Whenever I come here I always order a mini sized burger and get an order of garlic fries on the side. Garlic Fries = MUST
author: Michelle C.

description:
This place has everything you need from a burger place. 
Pretty affordable - honestly? Save yourself the money on the extra burger and split one. They are HUGE. My boyfriend and I could have easily split a Pearls Deluxe with cheese ($7.99) and he has an appetite fo sho. 
Great sides - fries, garlic fries, coleslaw, salads, etc. We ordered the Springs ($5.99) -onion rings and sweet potato fries- and the onion rings were delicious. 
Option for Kobe beef or Buffalo burgers - I appreciate the meat options. I might spring for the Kobe beef next time, especially if we share :)
Milkshakes - didn't try them but if you're looking for that it's here. 

I guess I was impressed that when I ordered the burger cooked medium, it actually came out medium. At a quick service restaurant? That's pretty unexpected.
