If they were to add beer to the mix, this would be our one and only stop in SF.
author: Andrea M.

description:
My friends and I like coming to this place. Parking around here is hard to find given its lower nob hill and there are only a number of tables here. 

The definite must get thing here are the garlic fries. They are warm, crunchy, and the flavor a just flow through your mouth. 

Their pearls burgers is also great to get. The meat is just prepared well and thus the standard burger is already great in itself.

Just be prepared to feel a bit oily afterwards. So maybe pack some fresh green tea along the side when you go.
author: Derrick C.

description:
This place is cash only but has an atm inside. 

This was my first time at Pearl's and the place is pretty small; there are maybe 5-6 tables so I'm glad it wasn't crowded when I went. 

I get skeptical about trying new burger joints because I don't like to wander once I've found a go-to spot. However I'm glad I made an exception for Pearl's. I ordered the Bula Burger and substituted Kobe beef ($5 extra) and oh my god I never thought I'd like teriyaki sauce as much in my burgers, but it was delicious. Plus with the swiss and bacon how can you go wrong. Although I did wish the spicy pineapple was more prominent.

I probably won't order the Kobe often since it totaled to about $15, but I'd definitely come back to order a regular burger with fries (which I mistakenly forgot) and to get an oreo milkshake next time!
author: Diana H.

description:
Best costumer service, hands down! I love these guys!

The burgers are juicy and enormous, not complaining :)

I recommend the fries, I don't know how they season them, but the are fried amazingly crispy :D
author: Melissa F.

description: I love this burger joint and it's my go to place. However, today I found two rocks that I bit into while eating my burger. I'm lucky that I did not chip my teeth! I have no idea how rocks this size would end up in a teriyaki burger. Completely disgusted.
author: Peggy L.

description: Great big delicious burgers for a really reasonable price! I had the Phat Bob and loved it. My wife had the teriyaki burger and loved it. We also shared an order of sweet potato fries. They could have been a little crispier, but that personal preference. They did taste good. The staff was very friendly as well.
author: Chad R.

description: Great customer service, extra clean which i very muched liked and also the food is really good its worth every penny of your money.
author: James N.

description: Happen to find this place,near our hotel. Great choice. Amazing burgers. Hamburgers were juicy and very large portions. Amazing onion rings and fries.
author: Myron B.

description: Burger was delicious as a quick meal.  We had a special with avocado lettuce and tomato. Like many places in SF, it was a little small. If you can deal with that, make this place a stop.
author: William H.

description:
At the end of the day, it was just OK. 

The burger was alright. The meat was cooked well however there was nothing special about the burger. It lacked flavor and pizzazz. The "special sauce" is just thousand island dressing, as explained by the unenthusiastic cashier (not fantastic customer service). The burger buns were also really large so the bun to meat ration was not proportionate. The fries were good, I'll give them that. Crispy and fresh. However, altogether, it didn't rank very highly on the tastiness scale. Also, from a price to value ratio perspective, if I'm going to drop 15-20 on a lunch meal, I expect to be extremely satisfied or to help a worthy/grateful restaurant. Unfortunately, it didn't do it for me. 

If you're ever in the Nob Hill area and are craving any burger, sure, venture on over. However, I wouldn't go out of my way for it.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
Stopped by here today for lunch!!! To be honest we knew this place was going to be good as there were two police officers in the queue ahead of us, so obviously a good sign!!! 
We had the pearl deluxe with cheese, the Bula Burger and a portion of frings!!! Such a lovely juicy burger and extra gherkins available at the till which was an excellent bonus!! Funky little spot with delightfully friendly staff!!
author: Ailbhe B.

description:
This place is SO good! I live around the corner and we order from them frequently-ish. The service is always fast and friendly, and they have amazing burgers which are HUGE. 

Garlic or Chili fries are definitely a must but they are also huge so bring a friend to share! And any place that has a free side of pickles is Five Stars for me!
author: Jon V.

description: Fantastic burgers and frings with garlic are so so good! A must if you're in San Francisco!
author: Jimmie S.

description:
I've heard much about Pearl's over the years & probably would have never tried it if it weren't for my outta town bestie staying at a hotel a couple blocks down the hill.  We were hungry and needed something hearty to eat before a night of bar hopping.  Yelped around and popped up Pearl's.  I got a mushroom cheeseburger ($9) and shared a small order of sweet potato fries ($3).  My friend got the Phat Bob, which had bbq sauce, bacon, mayo, onion rings, & cheese ($9).  The menu didn't have any specification on the weight of the burger, but it was huge, which later I found out was probably a 1/2lb!  They do list 1/4lb on their site though.  

The mushroom burger was cooked perfectly medium per requested & came with so many mushrooms (which I enjoyed), but a little too much mayo.  Burger was juicy & kind of messy.  The fries were cooked perfect & had the right amount of sweet & salty.  Just like the burger, they gave a lot of fries for a small.  Needless to say, though we both enjoyed our burgers we didn't finish them.  Seating is limited and the Filipino ladies behind the counter are nice though service is limited since you order at the counter.  Definetely going to come back to take my burger loving bf here!
author: Cat C.

description: One thing I enjoy while traveling is trying out new places to eat. This hit the spot in almost all my spots. Ha. I couldn't pass up the mushroom burger, and the fries were off the hook!  I could eat those everyday. The only reason I can't do 5 stars is that the burger was extremely greasy (my friends burger was too). It made the bottom bun soggy and falling apart by the time I got to the second half of the burger. Otherwise, I'd do it again.
author: Anthony M.

description: best burger in sf by far. My friend took me here because he was working on a project to find the best burger in san fran and concluded that pearls was currently leading the race. I could agree more. The flavor profiles were complex and interesting while still satisfying my craving for a traditional burger. This whole in the wall has become a destination, you cant go wrong ordering any random burger off the menu.
author: Emma J.

description:
Couldn't take another horrible burger from the hotel so I walked about a mile to pearls. Def worth the walk. Ordered the fat bob and fries. Burger came hot and juicy. Next time I may try a regular cheese burger but did not regret my choice. Sometimes the best burger are plain, sometimes they need the extras. Fat bob gets 4 stars. Plain may get a 5!  

The battered fries were perfect. Good fries are a must. 

Pearls has the basics down easily. And that was exactly what I was hoping for.
author: Ken N.

description: Every single time I go to Pearl's they nail it. They get the food out since unbelievably fast and it's consistently the best burger I've ever had. Get the bbq burger and add sautéed mushrooms holy shmoly! I'm a big fan of the springs (sweet potato fries and onion rings) but they're traditional fries are always crispy and perfection itself. I don't know what they put in their food that makes it so filling but good heavens I'm tapping out by halfway through my burger.
author: Nikki P.

description:
EVERYTHING on the menu here tastes good. You literally cannot go wrong with anything you order. They will cook the burgers to your preference which is awesome, considering most places just go with "well done" and everyone knows you've ruined it if you've cooked a burger well done. 
The spicy sly burger is my personal favorite, it's the perfect amount of "spicy" and it's the biggest, sloppiest, most amazing mess of a burger ever. The fries here are also legendary, and the shakes are huge! They give you plenty for your money here no matter what you get!
Cramped seating, but worth the wait for a table/worth ordering to take-out. Definitely choose this place over the average chain burger restaurant if you're in SF.
author: Sarah C.

description: Get the frings, share them with another person. Solid burger place, nice staff and some room to sit.
author: Dennis A.

description:
CASH ONLY. 

It's a few blocks up from Union Square and the place is tiny with just a few tables. If you're looking for something fancy, this is not it. But after a long day, I just came here for a darn good burger and that's what I got. Everything was quick and efficient. 

The only downside was when the cashier gave me all the cheese options, she couldn't tell the difference between American and Cheddar cheese. She said they're either orange/yellow/white. Like what...ok. That was unnecessarily confusing. Just give me the best dang burger you have. At least I got the burger eventually.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Burgers are Awesome !! We came here for the second time and it was So gooood!
We try the deluxe and the avocado, fabulous! 
Welcome staff
++++
author: Marie P.

description:
I honestly do not think you can go past this place for an authentic, delicious burger experience. 

It was my 2nd time in 2 days, which pushes my BPD (burger per day) ratio higher than it should be, but you know what? When it's this yum, who cares. 

Friend got a peanut butter-chocolate shake which was pretty heavenly too.
author: Red N.

description: I've had their meat burgers before and they were amazing but haven't been there since going vegetarian. Last night I tried their veggie burger and it was so so good. Not greasy or anything, just perfect!!!
author: Theodore S.

description:
I don't normally eat burgers, but was craving a yummy burger from the city after a long, and eventful day. Found this little place after browsing many burger joints via Yelp. 
My boyfriend ordered "The Bomb" burger, and loved it. It was so big even HE couldn't finish it. I ordered "Pearl's Deluxe" (w/ cheese) and as simple as it was, it was still quite a mouthful.. A delicious one at that! Both burgers ordered medium-well, and cooked to perfection. 

Heads up! They only take cash.. But fear not, there is an ATM right next to the cash register ;)
author: Brittany S.

description: Good place for a hearty burger, milkshake, onion rings and fries! Boyfriend and I come here form time to time for a splurge meal.
author: Jane Z.

description:
The burger and sweet potato fries were delicious and the service was very friendly. 
It's a super casual place. 
I definitely recommend.
author: Karen B.

description: I never come here getting a burger I don't like. The Bula Burger or the Fat Bob are classic mainstays, and the french fries are the crispiest yet fluffiest fries I've ever tasted--I sometimes come here for the fires alone! But the burgers are good, and usually the total comes out to about 16 dollars for a 1/2 burger and a large fries--not bad, considering I'd probably spend more at McDonalds or Burger King for the same amount of food.
author: Stevie D.

description:
Wonderful menu selection, fantastic quality Australian beef, super friendly service and all at a great price near Union Square!  When you are starving, hungover, and uncoordinated, this place is a life save!

It is a tiny place, so eating logistics can get tricky as you stalk someone who is nearly done so that you might get their table just as your food comes out - but that is all part of the fun...it makes the experience a little more communal, so if you can't stand ever talking to another human being, you might get overwhelmed.

I absolutely love that you can order fries/onion rings/sweet potato fires in  mixed combinations, because I can never decide between two...
author: Audra M.

description: Super bummed. Called in my cheeseburger and got a ten minute wait, perfect! Walked up the street and sat for twenty minutes while seeing two people order and get their burgers before mine. I reminded the dude behind the counter that I was still waiting for my order, and then the kitchen who FORGOT ABOUT IT began to make it at that point. 40 minutes later, I'm finally walking home with my order, and I get home to a super cold burger. $20 for a cold burger and fries. Dude. NEVER again.
author: Kelli M.

description:
Superb.

The Burger: Not too big, not too small. Best one I've had in SF.

The (Garlic) Fries: To die for. To the point where I basically ate every little crumb 'till there was nothing left. Even though my mouth was burning from the garlic. I. Just. Could. Not. Stop.

The Milkshake: The perfect way to end meal. While your tongue is still the tingling from hotness of the garlic, suck up a good amount of milkshake.

.              .                .                .

You black out for second. 

.              .                .                .

The feeling of the cold and sweet milkshake extinguishing the garlic tongue-fire ignites an explosion of joy that your conscious mind does not have the capacity to fully experience.

The sweet sugary rush leaves you in a mild euphoria and you're sure your life will never be the same.

Would go here every day if I knew I had only one month to live.
author: Malthe J.

description:
This place has really fallen off. I don't know what happened but the flavor is no longer there. The North Bay location is still great though. 

 The Prized Pearl is still good, if you come get that.
author: Justin S.

description:
Careful, if you aren't looking for this place, you'll definitely miss it. Tiny hole in the wall place that seats a little more than 10. It's got a pretty good amount of options for such a small joint: Kobe beef burgers (starts at $13), tons of chicken burgers, beef burgers, even got hot dogs. They also have regular fries, onion rings, and garlic fries (!!!!). 

They're a little pricey, though, with burgers ranging from $8.99-$14.99. I ordered a spicy sly with garlic fries and my total was nearly $12, a little steep for burgers and fries, but the guy was nice. 

Their garlic fries were freaking unbelievable!! If you're a vampire or plan on kissing someone afterwards, you should steer clear because this thing is loaded with garlic. Super crispy and retains so much flavour!! 

The burger was SO juicy. The spice wasn't as hard hitting as I thought it'd be, but it still packed a punch. The sides of my mouth are a little numb, but my tongue only suffered sweet sweet pleasuring in the form of roasted bell peppers and onions, and my goodness that melted cheese could make a grown man cry.

Overall, a really hearty and good meal! Four out of five because the price is still a little steep for me.
author: Han P.

description:
Wow! These burgers certainly live up to their reputation!! We were staying literally a stones throw away in the USA Hostel, so when I discovered just how close this place was I knew we quite simply had no choice but to try it out. It was only right, you see. 

First off, the garlic chips were quite possibly the best chips I've ever had in my life! "How exceptional can chips really be?" I hear you ask! You know, chips are chips, right? No. These were beyond chips. These were crispy shreds of garlic-lathered potato heaven. These made average chips look, well, distinctly average.

And this is saying something, because people don't come here for the chips, so you can imagine what the main attraction was like! My chilli burger was enormous and magnificent - happiness on a plate. It looked super messy and a bit gross when it arrived, I will say, but hey! It's a burger and a (deliciously) soggy bun covered in chilli so it's never going to look like a price of art, is it?

This is good, hearty, American food! Exactly what you expect it to be/ want it to be/ dream it to be.

If you are a burger lover you won't leave here disappointed! They even have a veggie option (mushroom, if I recall) so non meat eaters can join in the fun too.

An all round yummy and memorable meal!
author: Kerry G.

description: I was on a mission for a big juicy burger - and I found it! my burger was soo good - perfectly tasteful and juicy :) and they are not afraid of using the ranch and Mayo!!! The avocado burger with bacon was really good! The Bun is perfectly soft and fluffy and doesnt Fall apart!  And - when they ask you how you want your burger cooked, and it came back perfectly medium rare as i asked - you know they know their burgers! And they do! :) thank you Pearls!
author: Emma K.

description:
Coming back month after month, and apologizing to every friend I bring here. Why apologize? No burger will ever be as good as your first Pearl's Deluxe. The burgers here are always the 10 in any 1-10 comparison. They cook their meat to order (surprising this isn't standard everywhere), so if you're like me and you like your patty still moo-ing, ordering the Kobe, grilled rare is a real treat. As always, the Garlic Frings are divine and the shakes are nothing to look down on.

Love yourself.
Eat at Pearl's.
author: Charlette H.

description: I had to write this review because this place offers such a huge variety of burgers, and because they had wonderful onion rings. The burgers are enormous. As a girl, I think the mini portion would be just right. We thought the fries were perfect, and we loved that they let you have unlimited fresh pickle spears. They were so good!
author: Jen B.

description: The dude at the front was super cool and his personality was awesome. The burger was great, I can't recall foe sure but I think I paid around $12 for a bacon cheeseburger and fries. Oh yeah, the fries..  They are bomb, don't miss out on them.
author: Tim F.

description:
When ordering up their Bula Burger, it is time to get definitely messy.

The burger that is wrapped with bacon, pineapple, drenched in teriyaki sauce, melted Swiss cheese, mayo and in between two breaded patties, it was juicy and tasty all with one big bite!  

Not much of a dining spot, but a guaranteed good joint for burgers!  I like their Yam Fries and Onion Rings to go with the meal!

Time to get your hands sloppy, indeed!
author: Tiffany D.

description: I heard a lot of hype about how good Pearl's Deluxe Burgers burgers were and it did not disappoint. The excellent quality of their ingredients speak for themself. Great service, great staff, great place!
author: Jayce O.

description:
Service was quick! Definitely try the new online order app.
The smaller burger was actually very filling and the sweet potato fries were amazing!

Also had the chocolate milkshake with a banana added and I can honestly say it was the best shake I've had.
author: Briana J.

description: This is by far in my opinion the best burger place in the city! I've now been here a few times and the quality is there every time. It's reasonably priced and the meat is cooked to perfection.
author: Aaron T.

description:
I'm surprised not a lot of reviews say this, but this joint is CASH ONLY.

Next is my burger was overcooked. I wanted medium rare, but it came medium well. It's always very disappointing for me when the burgers are not cooked the way I wanted it cooked. I expected a very juicy burger, but instead mine was dry and unsatisfying.

Not many places get it right, but it shouldn't be a hit or miss for a place that prides itself on its burgers.
author: Lee T.

description: Cash only!!! But there's an ATM inside...These burgers are so delicious and kept me full the whole day! My boyfriend ordered the Kobe Beef Burger with added bacon while I ordered the Mushroom burger with an upgrade to Kobe Beef. The price of these burgers were quite expensive... $40 for two burgers and 1 shared fries? I get that it is Kobe beef but it really didn't taste significantly different or any special. The fries were half garlic fries half sweet potato fries. The garlic fries were not that garlicky but it was crispy and it went well with the regular burger. The sweet potato fries went well with the mushroom burger.
author: Celine L.

description: This place has great burgers. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who likes burgers. The only downside to this it is that it is kind of small can often be hard to find a place to sit. Also when I went the shake machine was broken and I was kind of bummed, for I was really looking forward to a good shake. This could be a one time thing and I got unlucky, or it happens often and my guess is that it is a one time thing.
author: Erick F.

description:
Located about 1/4 mile from union square, this is one of the top burger joints in town.  Service was fast and friendly.  The burger was juicy and cooked to order.  When I placed my order the owner suggested to order just one order of fries for two because their burger is so big.  He was right!  Plus that also shows honesty in that he could have made an extra 5 bucks but instead opted for a better rating experience. 



Come here if your in the area. Well worth it!!
author: John V.

description: Found this place on Yelp. Has to be one of the best burgers I've had. The garlic fries... My God!! You can smell the garlic flavor as soon as they hit the table. I visited Pearls twice during my stay. They take cash only
author: Toya H.

description:
The ladies here ruined our nice day together as a family. We hit the Carnaval parade, listented to some music, and I had two family members from far away visiting in town. I raved about Pearl's burgers and told everyone to come with me despite that it wasn't some fancy sit down.

After we got there, we placed an order, and my girlfriend (who's vegetarian) ordered a Veggie burger. She thought it was over, had already started walking away and the girl looked up to ask what kind of cheese. I answered Swiss for her. We proceeded to let the rest of the people order, and my dad paid.  We waited a while to get a seat (which is apart of the game, just expect it) and they brought onion rings and fries reasonably fast.  Later they brought burgers and had a chicken burger.  We said that we didn't order a chicken burger, and she said well look at this receipt right here.  It was weird, almost as if she thought we were lying about ordering a chicken burger for a vegetarian. She took the chicken burger and then went and started arguing with a young asian girl with bleached or lightented hair.  We proceed to eat slowly hoping her burger would come soon.  When we are all practically done with the burger, I get up to ask about it, and the young asian girl comes over and with attitude says "so what exactly happened".  I told her that we ordered a veggie burger, they brought a chicken, and we had been waiting for the new burger.  She asked "didnt she read the order to you", at that point if she had read the order it might have been to someone else, so i said I didn't remember, because I hoenstly didnt remember if she read it to me, or if she had read it to someone else. But regardless I was standing right there when she said veggie burger, and I said that because clearly she was trying to imply we would have to order another veggie burger.  I thought this was ridiculous, most importantly because they took the chicken burger, and never intended to order a new veggie burger until we asked.  At the least if they were going to rudely suggest it was our fault, then they should atleast tell us, and not leave us expecting it to be replaced with a veggie burger.  The girl relented, we sat back down, and she eventually brought the burger dropping it hastily on the table and not saying a word (clearly mad at us).  It was very uncomfortable, ruined our dinner, and ruined the vibe of everyone in the party.  All for what? Because clearly the ordering system wasnt organized enough? We did not make a mistake here on the order, so why should we be punished? And even if we had a part in it somehow, is this a way you treat a customer in a clearly innocent mistake between parties?

The burgers are good, but if you are trying to make this a special occasion, I would very much suggest passing for one of the MANY other good burgers in the city. The closest match with great customer service every time is probably Sam's which Anthony Bourdain called his top 3 burger. You could also go to Roam, or even Super Duper Burger. They will all be on par in quality, and avoid the nightmare customer service situation.
author: Jason A.

description:
Woo-hoo!  I've been dreaming of a good burger place opening in the neighborhood.  Pearl's sign is really inconspicuous and I wouldn't have even noticed it if I hadn't been at Eura (next door) the other day.  

I tried the Deluxe with bacon and cheese, and got a side of fries.  It's a truly good burger!  Make sure you're hungry before going here, as the burger is huge, and the fries portion is generous.  I'm sure that Pearl's will be really busy at lunch before long, so check it out while it's still quiet.
author: Robert W.

description: I ordered a medium deluxe burger, which I expected to be juicy because it had started to soak my sweet potato fries (which were delicious btw) with grease/juice. But when I bit into it, it was severely dry and overcooked, with only a hint of pink. It was very heavy, so if you're hungry, if anything, it'll fill you up. Do order the sweet potato fries!
author: Ke C.

description: Hole in the wall gem. Burgers were fresh, and buns were soft. The restaurants itself is in small space that's fits only about 3-4 tables. They are cash only, so make sure you're ready.
author: Erika R.

description:
I've actually been disappoint with the locations in the city.  They just don't compare to the Mill Valley Pearl's.  Same chain...but huge difference in taste.  Not sure how it worked out that way...

In any case, my burger of choice is the prized Pearl.  The blue cheese with onions on my burger is a winner everytime.  The meat just seems to be drier here.  There aren't the juicy flavors as presented at the mill valley location.  Bummer.  Also, the cleanliness is lacking here.  

I've actually stopped going to the SF locations.  I head out across the GGB to get my favorite burger of all time.  

Unfortunately, this location gets 3 stars.
author: Jen W.

description:
I just broke my Atkins diet at the Pearl, after dropping 20lbs so far this year, I probably gained 18 back in my 40min experience with the Pearl. If I was going to break carbs, well anything worth doings worth overdoing:) One double "phatbob" (double meat, cheese, bacon, onion rings, bbq sause), garlic fries and Oreo shake later. I somehow have the energy to write this review. I'm blissfully happy, and the Pearl made me that way, tonight. 

Needless to say I recommend the place. Not #1 from burgers I HAVE experienced, but #2. Who knows with the KOBE beef option, may have taken that spot. 

Enjoy people, enjoy.
author: Chris A.

description: Wow!  Truly a great burger!  Had the Pearls special and it was fantastic. Great staff, great comfort food, what more could I ask for.
author: Henry G.

description: We found this place on yelp and decided to check it out for quick bite after 10 hr drive. Burgers had flavor and were juicy. The little cheese burger is enough to fill a small person and regular bacon cheese for a man. Didn't get to try milkshakes cause machine was down:( Would come back if in the area. Cash only place. 2 burgers plus one drink about $20 bucks.
author: Bg G.

description: Always reliably good.
author: David S.

description:
I have to agree with Nizar here. I've lived in Lower Nob Hill for over 4 years. Although I haven't been down to Pearl's in awhile, I used to frequent this place and there was NOTHING like a good, fat, juicy Pearl's burger. After my visit tonight, it is clear something is distinctly different. Not only the food but the actual restaurant.

This burger was NOT the true Pearl's Deluxe burger that I came to know and love a few years ago.

The patty was not thick and juicy as it used to be made. It did not seem hand made at all, it truly seemed like a frozen patty. I ordered medium well but it was still bright pink in the middle. You know when you have a hand made burger, you can really see all the pieces of beef and spices and fat especially when the middle is pink? The middle of this was compact, and basically solid like a frozen patty cooks up.

The bun was the most generic, dry, white bun and they don't even warm it or toast it.

This must be a different owner because they now only accept cash when previously they took cards. But hey, you can pay $4-$5 extra (after fees) to withdraw cash from the atm next to the soda machine. Like, it's 2015 and people are using smart phones to pay no, cash only is not going to cut it.

The price is the same or a bit higher, yet the quality is nowhere near what it was. The place is definitely taking advantage of the original reputation this place established.

I will not be back.
author: Thomas K.

description:
These burgers are some of the best burgers I have had in my life. Cooked perfectly rare and loaded with sloppy awesomeness... I couldn't put it down after I started, because it was dripping down my arm and I didn't want to loose the perfect balance of ingredients, but I also just didn't want to let it go too far from my mouth for fear that I would never taste it again... 

The garlic fries were fucking awesome too
author: kelly b.

description:
If I gave you diamonds and PEARL'S
Would you be a happy boy or a girl?

Well Mr. Raspberry Beret,  I wouldn't say my experience made me happy.  I was disappointed actually.  

A few problems I had with this joint.  For one thing, I'm telling you right now, if Pearls was really serving 1/2 pound of Kobe beef, the burger would probably cost about $110 dollars.  I'm not willy foo foo!  And if it was Kobe, you would be calling it Wagyu.  Maybe the beef is from L.A.  
I think that's where Kobe Bryant lives.

 Then the other burger was grass-fed. Grass-fed isn't a big deal to me. The only experience I had with grass was back in senior year in high school.  That's also overrated.  Some reason it just made me stare at the chalk board...

So I decided to go with grass-fed.  I asked for it cooked medium.  So the Pearl's burger came to the table, I took a bite and noticed it was cooked well done.  No biggie.  Then I noticed the bread was stale.  That is a serious offense to me.  I was thinking about giving them Hell like they were all atheists.  But I remembered I only paid $9 bucks for the burger.  I'll live.

Maybe I got Pearl's on an off night.  Or maybe as Prince sang:

Maybe I'm just too demanding
Maybe I'm just like my Father, (too bold)
Maybe I'm just like mother, 
She's never satisfied...

This is what is sounds like, when Mike cries!
author: Michael L.

description:
If I could go to San Francisco right now... I would be so down for Pearl's. 
It's small inside and the line can be long but the service is fast and the food is fulfilling. 
I recommend a chocolate banana shake ... all their milk shakes are heavenly. 
I personally always get the mini burgers and with onion rings and that fills me up. 
The larger burgers are just as delicious, but too much for me. 

The fact they have lettuce wraps is nice for all you kids with gluten-free diets.
author: Anthony Y.

description: ...was recommended by the front desk clerk at the hotel where I was staying. It turned out to be a great little find. It was great. And, it was little. It's just a tiny little place with very limited seating. We got there just in time to beat the rush, and were able to enjoy a table with our burger. But the staff was ready close up, turning people away at 8:55, so don't be late!
author: jeff b.

description: As good as a burger gets. Juicy 1/2 lb patty cooked to order, perfectly melted cheese, fresh veggies, served on a soft, flavorful bun. Really good burger! Make sure to get extra napkins....
author: John G.

description:
This place offers comparably one of the best burgers in the city. 

I've only had this location because it's the least sketch looking and have tried the spicy sly burger, mushroom burger and the pearl's deluxe. My personal favorite is the spicy sly - it's like it sounds - a little spicy but so worth it. I get the pearl's deluxe whenever I want more of a classic burger. 

Onion rings are delicious! I highly recommend them. You also get unlimited pickles - who doesn't love them?
author: Mimi V.

description: It's been a while since I came here and the food hasn't changed it's just as good as I remember. I ordered the chili cheese fries today.... sooo good. Home made chili cheese the good stuff. If your reading this just come and eat here.
author: Dennis K.

description:
So whenever I get a burger, I usually get a Mushroom Burger.  Pearl's Mushroom Burger is pretty darn tasty.  Very generous portion.  Juicy, flavorful patty.  Ooey, gooey cheddar cheese (I opted for this instead of Jack).  Oodles of mushrooms.  The only down-side to the burger was that the bun didn't hold up well.  It started tearing apart as soon as I picked it up.

The fries are pretty delicious, too.  Do yourself a favor and ask them to make a basket of half sweet potato and regular fries.
author: Rose A.

description:
Found Pearl's on Yelp. Read several reviews and realized it was just down the street. It was a tough decision on which one to get. I chose the kobe burger with bacon and blue cheese along
with the garlic fries. The aroma emanating from the bag was turning heads all the way back to the hotel and created much discussion on the elevator ride to my room. 

The burger was everything described on yelp, tasty juicy yum yum!  And yes they are cash only.
author: Mike R.

description: Amazing food, clean setting. But there is no beer (the Yelp profile lies!), and its cash only.
author: Mandy K.

description:
Small fast foods restaurant with friendly workers/services.
The bomb burger is heavy. But really good! Two people can share this burger.
And if you love garlic fries, they have the BEST ones I've tried! Really makes your breath stinky!! =)
author: Judy Y.

description: Had the pearl deluxe with bacon and swiss and it was amazing!! Very fulfilling. Fries taste homemade and I hear the shakes are awesome. No debit so make sure and bring cash.
author: Steve D.

description:
I thought this was a large burger joint that would have an hour wait, but boy, was I wrong! It's very small and most people actually order to go to avoid the hassle of finding seats.

My bf and his cousin ordered the Phat Bob, which has bacon and bbq sauce. They added shroomies for $1.50 which is pricey but at least they gave you a ton of shrooms! I ordered the King Burger which has a hot dog and a patty. Next time, I'll just get a hot dog on it's own, half the price. I usually only finish half of my food, but I had almost eaten the entire King Burger without even knowing it! That's how good it was.

We also got the frings fries and onion rings. The fries were cooked to perfection. Probably some of the best fries I have ever eaten. They were light and crispy, seemed like they were tempura fried. I wish I had a whole batch to myself! YUM! Will definitely be back the next time I'm in SF.
author: Angelina L.

description:
Great burgers!  I went here with a group of 8 for lunch on a Friday.

A bunch of us got the spicy sly -which was delicious 

I got the Bula burger - which was good but not the best I have had. 

The fries were def the BEST I EVER HAD ! I might just come back only for fries so I don't feel too guilty :X 

I will def be back for more lunch get togethers!  

4/5 starts because I wish there was more seating

Overall great place!!
author: Reet R.

description: Decent burgers, but nothing that stands out. I enjoyed the burger, but it didn't leave me feeling like I should definitely add this place to my routine. For what you're getting, I don't think the price is worth it. I'd rather go to super duper as their burgers are better and cheaper. The service is very nice and friendly which is a plus. There's a lot of tough competition in the city for burgers, and this place is not ahead of the pack
author: Derrick W.

description:
I never really noticed this place! I live 2 blocks away and frequently walks by. After searching yelp for a good place for the bf and I to eat at for lunch I found this gem and well 4 of my yelp friends has reviewed it so it has to be good right?

A small diner joint. We ordered the 

Mushroom burger (mushroom, mayo, and swiss cheese) - Scrumptious and a good deal for the price. It wasn't too messy to eat which I liked. 

Phat Bob (BBQ sauce, bacon, mayo, onion rings, and jack cheese) - This burger was stacked tall. I didn't have a taste but my boyfriend liked it. Messy. 

Garlic fries - Nothing special. They do load it up with a surprising amount of garlic. 

The tables where bit a tiny and flimsy. One bathroom for the entire place.  We love burger bar and kept comparing our burgers to that of burger bar. It does compare but I guess Pearl's is more your typical burger. Doesn't mean we loved it any less. We will be back in the future.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Came here a few times now, this will satisfy your inner burger craving you have every so often. I've had the regular deluxe, which is great. I also just recently tried the Chicken Burger to try a healthier alternative. The cashier recommended it - it was awesome!  Especially with the pesto sauce (you have to request it, but it's free). The chicken was juicy, definitely not dry which was what I was afraid of. 

Fries - sweet potato and regular - were awesome too. I like how you can order half and half. They also have onion rings!

Milkshakes are awesome too. We found a hair in ours (gross!) but it happens. The Nutella is delicious, and strawberry is good too. I'd recommend Nutella since you can't get that flavor in many other places. 

One tip:  the buns get soggy quite fast (from all the delicious burger juice) if you continue to put down your burger when you reach for fries. My suggestion is to just hold the burger the whole time, it really works! 

Friendly staff. You gotta pay for parking though =/
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Hubby and I eat here due to reading all the great reviews on Yelp. He had the Pearl Deluxe and I had Phat Bob. Quick service, tasty burgers! My hubby ordered another burger because he liked them so much. He's nuts. I ate half. Very juicy.
author: Susann F.

description:
Visited San Francisco yesterday and was looking for something cheap but delicious. Checked out Yelp for the first time (really only ever used it for reviews of places I've already found, not to find new places) and found this little place. It was near where we were headed so we decided to check it out. Worst comes to worst we just walk a few extra blocks and then look elsewhere, right? It really doesn't stand out much from the outside and it can easily sneak up on you if you're looking for it while driving, probably even while you're walking if you're not specifically looking for it. It's a teensy place sandwiched between a few other food places that probably leave a lot less to the imagination. There are only a couple tables, two of which are cramped in near the register which I imagine can be annoying should it get busy in there. We didn't hit it at a particularly busy time (it was around noon) and we still felt a bit cramped so definitely don't expect to eat on site if it's crowded! For the small size and "homeliness" of it, it's well kept and the food isn't bad-- especially for the lower prices. It's your basic burger shop though so I wouldn't recommend visiting if you're looking for a lot of variety in your cuisine options. I ordered a mini deluxe cheeseburger (that's a 1/4 pounder if you're curious like I was; just wanted to know exactly how mini the mini really was!) with a side of regular fries and a large drink. I believe it came to around $12. Keep in mind this was just for a basic (mini) cheeseburger; prices increase as you get more "fancy" (i.e., adding more toppings besides the complimentary lettuce/tomato/onion/mayo or using different meat options). The bison burger was around $14 base price, excluding sides and drinks. The burger patty was a bit off center and slightly smaller than the bun so about 1/4-1/2 of my burger was just bread and ketchup with traces of melted cheese but the other half made up for it well enough. The cheese was super melty and the meat super greasy but if you like a bit of a mess and you don't mind some grease you should certainly enjoy these burgers. The fries are easily some of the best fries I've ever had, albeit a little bland (a bit of salt should do the trick though). Thickness wise they're in between thin and steak fries but they're extremely crispy and fully cooked internally, which is great because that's always a problem I have with other thicker crispy fries, without being grossly crunchy. The staff was also great. The cashier made sure to ask about every aspect of our order to ensure we got everything as customized as we wanted it. The trash bins were right next to our table yet the staff still finished cleaning off our table for us after we'd already started throwing things away ourselves. Personally I found this unnecessary but in a good way as the ambience seems more like a self-cleanup type of place. They kept up with keeping tables clean as customers left which is great so new customers don't have to wait for a clean table. If you don't mind smaller spaces, greasier (and quite filling) food, and a place that isn't exactly 100% up to date with their interior decorating, I would certainly recommend this place!
**** They do take cash only so be sure to keep at least a $20 on you! They also have an ATM if you prefer using that, however.
author: C. M.

description:
Yet another place you have to time right or else your in for a 20 min wait. still worth it. They use high quality beef and you can taste that it's true. My goto's have been the teriyaki burger hold the mayo (what am I Canadian?) and if your extra hungry the king burger which is pretty much their burger and hot dog having a child together. 

go for the burger. go for the fries. go for the shakes. but just go!
author: Norris T.

description:
My friend's like this place so I came to try it out. 

We were greeted as we walked in by a really friendly guy at the register. I think he mentioned his name was Charlie or something to another customer. He looked like a mix between Colin Farrel and James Franco. Really cool dude. 

We asked him about the specialty burgers and he suggested the Bula burger. The pineapple worried me because I imagined that big circle cut of pineapple in my burger and that just turned me off. But he mentioned that it's only in the sauce so that made me feel better. 

I ended up ordering the Prized Burger, the one with blue cheese while my gf ordered the Bula burger. Charlie? offered to cut it in half so that made it a lot easier for the two of us to share. We ordered a side of Frings to share as well. (Fries and onion rings how cool.)

The Bula burger was a great suggestion, I liked it a lot more than the Prized Burger. I felt the caramelized onions and the blue cheese were not in good ratio or something. Maybe it's just that the Bula tasted so much better. The Pineapple sauce was sweet and spicy in the Bula and definitely unique. 

The fries were really good too but our onion rings were a bit burnt...Sigh I really like onion rings. 

I personally think their bun is slightly softer than what I would like but that's personal preference, at least it's not five guys bun.
author: Henry C.

description:
I had the Pearl's Deluxe burger with everything on it, garlic fries and a chocolate oreo shake.
While the burgers are a bit overpriced for the quality, the fries and shakes are amazing. Their specialty burgers are definitely the way to go as the standard deluxe burger does not stand out in America's oversaturated burger landscape. 

If you're a fan of the "fries + shake" indulgence and you're looking to step up your guilty pleasure game, this is the place to go.
author: Tony M.

description:
4.5...

Enjoyed the burgers!!! Thanks to Yelp, it looks like this joint was featured on the Food Network and I BM'ed it for quick eats.

We lucked out that there was no line and that this hole in the wall was not busy. There are only about 15 seats in this place and mostly people ordered to-go. 

The guys behind the counter are super nice when taking your order. 

We got deluxe burgers with one having Swiss cheese and the other with bacon and Swiss cheese, frings and a soda for about $23. 

Everything came out fresh and piping hot! The burger was HUGE and I ate mine protein style. The bun was just too big to consume. 

It's about a 4 block walk from the heart of Union Square. Def recommend if you're in the area.
author: Maria C.

description:
[Featured:  Best Thing I Ever Ate, Burger Episode, Food Network at http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8mZ9mJNKTs8]

Tyler Florence raved, raved, and raved about Pearl's Deluxe and boldly declared Pearl's Phatburger the best burger he's ever had.

That was quite a declaration indeed.  Then I learned that Pearl's won "Best Burger" challenge at the Great American Food and Music Festival, with celebrity judges Bobby Flay and Anne Burrell (no relation to Ty Burrell of Modern Family or the World Champion Pat Burrell).

Such enormous pub was enough to catapult Pearl's to the top of my bookmark list.  I admit, I was skeptical...but I had to check it out...

I agree in part.  Pearl's burger was very good, not award winning, national TV kind of good, not the "best burger ever" type of good, but well above average.  Sorry Tyler, I'm not jumping on the "best burger" bandwagon with you, but I'll give credit where credit is due. 

Pearl's probably has the juiciest, most substantial burger I've had, though not the most flavorful.  I ordered the Spicy Sly, a burger filled with sauteed onions, peppers, spicy sauce, monterey jack cheese, and mayo.  Napkins are definitely required, and perhaps advisable to bring your own - at least half a roll of paper towels.  The problem I had was that the meat itself lacked flavor.  The sauteed peppers (granted they were delicious) overpowered the burger, so it felt more like a delicious sauteed pepper sandwich with a burger patty in a supporting role.  That's really nitpicking.  The burger was very good, though I still prefer Urbun Burger in the Mission.

Other than that, the burger was legit.  I finally found buns that could handle all the crazy fixins' these places throw into burgers these days.  Sweet potato fries were perfectly fried, crispy, and sweet.  

Now I get to my favorite part, the Nutella milkshake.  I've made no secret of my love for Nutella.  So, though I was full beyond belief, I just had to get it.  Great shake, not too creamy, not too sweet and it tasted...well, like Nutella.

Pearl's probably wont make my regular rotation.  I felt so bloated that I didn't mind the nearly one mile walk back to the office (or maybe it was three blocks that felt like a mile, ugh).

People thought this was:  Awesome (694) Handsome Reviewer (335) Terrible (1)
author: Angel S.

description:
Good quality burgers!

My friends and I came here on July 4th (Thank you for being open on the holiday!)

There's a large selection of burgers and they even have Kobe beef burgers and buffalo burgers, which I don't see very often. It adds around $6 for the Kobe beef option and brings it to around $15. Also, they ask how well cooked you like your burger and make it exactly that. Although I did not like my burger, it was just a bad pick on my part. I ordered a daily special called California Dreamin; the description emphasized bacon and avocado, but the vegetables to meat ratio was too much for me and it was really bland. My friend's Teriyaki Kobe beef burger was very good though! 
The fries and onion rings as good as well. I definitely recommend it on the side.

Apart from that, the interior is small with limited seating and I would only recommend it for groups of 2-4 people unless you plan to take it to-go. Lastly, the staff provides attentive, quick service.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Before a concert across the street my sister and I came in to have dinner before the show.

They were surprisingly not busy for being right before the concert opened and we were able to walk in and order right away.  Then we also found a comfortable seat as well.

I went with the Deluxe 1/2 lb Burger with cheese and a side of Fries.  The Burger was to be Medium but I would only describe it as extremely raw.  Bleeding all over my basket raw.  It was ridiculously hot though and I devoured it.  Forgoing any salmonella that might incure.  It didn't and I was fine.

The fries were excellent and the service was very fast.

The only down side is the combination of characters that were coming in and out.  Some harassing other patrons, some noticeably homeless or uncomfortably unstable.  Not necessarily all of those at the same time.

I saw more than my fair share of random people coming in to get cup fulls of Pickles.  So I guess I recommend staying away from the open container of Pickles at the soda counter.  God knows how many hands go through them.

Be aware of your surrounding and expect your beef to bleed.  That's all I have to say.
author: Ivy R.

description:
This small hole in the wall restaurant has absolutely amazing burgers. You can take any burger and make it into a vegetarian burger or turkey burger. I had the super sly which was very spicy.  it was absolutely juicy and delicious. I thought it was like I was having a Tommys Burger without the chili yet with all the same textures and feelings.

Their sweet potato fries were good. You couldn't get a large basket of fries for one dollar more than the small portion.
author: Steve M.

description: Never fails to deliver a great burger at a normal price with fries to die for. And so much more. Kind staff for a small place always clean.
author: Katie B.

description: I have been to heaven and it was eating their burger !   The place is tiny and most people seem to take out.   I was not prepared for that, and luckily found a corner in this place to sit and enjoy to best burger I have ever tried (and I have tried A LOT).  Forget the looks of this place, focus on the food, and I am reasonably sure for most people, it will not disappoint.
author: Joe O.

description: I have been going here for years. I love the burgers and I love the garlic fried. I would suggest the Phat Bob and the Nutella milkshake. it is sweet an delicious and will leave you with a smile when you finish that Phat Bob
author: Roel C.

description:
Begging for the Balu Burger!

Came here after a cocktail crawl in the area. Looking for something to take away sooome of the alcohol so me and the hubby could drive back home. Saw all the stars and raves on the Yelp app and had to stop by!

First off, this place is smaaaaall! There were only a handful of tiny tables. We were lucky to get a seat! But it looked like we just beat out the late night rush. Woo hoo!

I knew I wanted bacon in my burger (because everything tastes better with it!). It was between the Balu Burger and the Phat Bob. Unfortunately,  I'm not into BBQ sauce, so I skipped Bob and went Balu instead. 

The Balu has a spicy pineapple teriyaki sauce with bacon, mayo and swiss cheese. Definitely upgrade the patty to their kobe beef patty if you don't mind spending the extra money for it. Totally worth it. The patty is extra juicy, fatty and flavorful. The sauce was sweet and tangy and wasn't too spicy. I thought the mayo might have been too much, but the extra creamy texture really worked with it and it balanced out the heat. And you can't go wrong with bacon! 

Get a side of Springer, too! It's half onion rings, half sweet potato fries with a side of mayo for dipping. So. Good. Both items were fried right and the onion rings had a nice extra crisp to them. It was too bad I had to share it with the hubby. I could have eaten the whole thing myself! 

I really like the burgers here. They have interesting combos (but there are the simple combos, too) and their sides are great! I only wish there were locations in the South Bay!
author: Daisy T.

description:
If I had to choose between this place and Super Duper; I'd go with the latter hands down. However that's not to say that Pearl's are rubbish because they are not.

We were flying out at night and I had to end our trip with a burger so I went for a late lunch there. I had the Pearl's deluxe burger w/ fries, which was good. The guy who served me was quite nice. 

The place itself is nothing flashy at all. It just looks a bit like an old diner but I didn't mind it. It was close my our hotel and I have to admit that my burger was pretty good as well so can't complain.
author: Kevin S.

description:
UPDATE 7/9/15 - Added one star for owner response.
Great burgers, served fresh and juicy. Best fries in town. This time I went with a mushroom burger, all the way. My only complaint was that the bun was a little stale and the bottom completely fell apart on the first bite. I was eating with a friend, so the disintegration at the beginning of the meal was a little embarrassing. Such a mess. A delicious mess! But I wish the bread had been fresh.

I want to address the cash only portion of this business. To me, if you are a business that was started after credit cards became widely used, you should take them. So Pearl's doesn't take credit cards, but they have their own ATM that you can use for a fee. You need to get Square or something to take credit cards if you want to make more money.
author: Aaron W.

description: I tried Pearl's because I was looking for a good bison burger that I could take back to my hotel room 4 blocks away.  Unfortunately, the customer service was less than friendly and burger was dry along with the bun which was so dry I couldn't eat...the sweet potato fries were also soggy...not worth the 24 bucks....extremely disappointed.
author: Sarah R.

description: [Cash only alert!] Yes, yes, yes and more yes.  I finally found an awesome burger joint in my neighborhood!  This one's a keeper folks ;) If you're vegetarian, they offer a veggie burger OR you can ask them to substitute a veggie burger in any of their "special" burger menu items.  I did the latter, and ordered a BBQ veggie burger.  My friend and I split garlic fries and onion rings.  Everything was good, but the star of the meal for me was the burger - just a really great veggie burger.  The garlic fries were also quite solid, and the onion rings were good but I tend to prefer meaty onions with lots of batter - theirs were lighter, which some may actually prefer.  Last thing I thought was awesome was the service - the employees were clearly happy to be there and provided awesome service.  Seriously, go try this restaurant - it's fantastic.  But beware, CASH ONLY!
author: Zach S.

description:
For some reason, I've always thought Pearl's was a gourmet, sit down type of place but it's like better quality burgers in a dingy place.  Standard burgers are around $9 if you don't add a bunch of extras.

Bula Burger is one hot mess to eat.  The pineapple teriyaki sauce will drip ALL over your hands so don't even bother wiping until you're done.  Actually, don't wipe at all and just wash your hands in the bathroom.  In addition to the beef, mayo, and Swiss cheese, you get thick pieces of bacon... so many that I actually took some out to give to the hub. 

Bula burger is award winning?  I'm not so sure about that.  While it's good, it's definitely missing the balance of veggies.  It ends up being a whole lot of creamy.  I'm not a fan of the sesame seed bun; it needs to be buttered and toasted or something to add flavor and the proportion of bread to meat was a bit off so we ended up peeling away bits of it away.

I was a big fan of the fries though.  They have a little crust around them that adds to the crunchiness.  A large size is enough to share between 3-4 people.  I don't know if I'll be returning back to Pearl's.... maybe if I was really craving a dirty burger which is usually never.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Gotta say the burgers here are AWESOME!! Visited here with my girlfriend and cousin for dinner. This burger joint was extremely small for its name. I want to say around 6 or so small tables and a counter for eating. 

We were lucky enough to get a table but we actually saw a lot of customers order their food by phone, came in, paid then picked up their food and left.

My cousin and I decided to order the Phat Bob which was a good sized burger that had a patty, cheese and bacon and a sort of barbeque sauce. We also decided to add mushrooms which they really stacked on! And I mean like a pile of mushrooms on the bottom of the basket as they fell out. Very high on flavor but a little bit messy. Bun started to fall apart but no biggie with me!

My girlfriend decided to get the King Burger which had cheese, a patty, and a hotdog inside of it which surprisingly had a really good flavor to it!

We also got an order Frings which are a half order of Onion Rings and French Fries both of which were very good, loved the crunch and breading of the onion rings and some of that breading was actually cooked onto the french fries too giving those a good flavor!!

Beware though this place is a bit pricey so be ready for that but in my opinion a very good burger joint that I would most certainly come back to.

Have fun chowing down!
author: Robert H.

description:
It's nice to have a food network featured restaurant in the neighborhood.  Some of the best variety and quality of burgers / chicken sandwiches.  Has always been consistent and have never been disappointed.  

Favorites:
- Teriyaki burger
- Chicken avocado
- Deluxe 
- Deluxe plain w/ blue cheese  
- Fat Bob
- Springs
- Mint Oreo Shake
author: Michael M.

description:
Pearl's has got the real deal burgers, baby. I miss the days of living down the street from what I consider the best burger in the city. I mean, they have kobe and BUFFALO burgers in addition to traditional beef. They served sweet potato fries before every restaurant and their mom's started serving them (talk about OGs). Their french fries are thick and meaty and fried up with what I consider a great balance of crispiness and greasiness. 

Oh Pearl's, I wish we were still neighbors, especially since I now consider myself a burger person, but perhaps it's for the best; you are a dangerous thing of beauty. 

Tip: Open 'til midnight on weekends!
author: Kristine W.

description: I was in a hurry, half full, and really tired from a long walk, but the burger was sensational. I had the teriyaki burger, the bun was fresh, the beef was grilled to perfection and the sauce made all the difference!
author: Baker H.

description: I have been coming here for years the best thing is the Pearls Deluxe with cheese and if want to splurge get bacon. The chocolate milkshake cant be beat love it.
author: N A.

description:
I've been wanting to go to Pearl's since I saw them on CMT's "Best in Chow."  (Spoiler Alert: They did NOT win the best burgers in San Francisco. Oh, and there was this one judge on the show that I would like to do more than eat burgers with...) But out of the three choices, Pearl's was the one I really wanted to try.

More than two months after we watched the show, "A" surprised me by taking me to Pearl's.

But let's back up to a few minutes before we walked in the front door...

We managed to find parking a little over a block away.  In this neighborhood, you're kind of used to the streets smelling a little, well, like pee.  I stepped out of the car and it did NOT smell like pee.  It DID, however, smell like poo.  Awful, stenchiriferous poo!  Apparently, someone left a bag of gross, smeary, mushy poo IN the parking spot and we rolled right over it and got poo all over the back tire.  Blech.  

Did I say Blech?

I meant double BLECH!!!

Anyway, back to the reason of this review - we walked into Pearl's and it was packed.  There was a line to the front door and every seat was taken.  We ordered fairly quickly, but then had to stand off to the side waiting for a table to become available.  A group of three guys came in later and stood next to us waiting for a table.  A few minutes later a table opened up and you would not BELIEVE what happened.  The three guys swooped in and claimed the table.  

Umm...hello?  We were here first and were waiting for a table.

Our order came out and the guy told us that was totally our table and we should open up a can of of whoop ass, so "A", the guy with our food, and I walked over to the table and "A" kindly informed them we had been waiting for a table first.  The three guys were super apologetic and said they were from out of town and got up.  They told the woman behind the counter they would take their food to go instead.

So, cool that the guys let us have the table, but not cool that they swiped it in the first place.  Apparently that's what you do when you're not from San Francisco.  (I kid though.  I really appreciated that they let us have the table.  Thanks three guys from out of town!)

Oh, but the FOOD!  We decided to go light and split the Bula Burger, because that's the one they highlighted on "Best in Chow."  We got chicken rather than beef, so it was lighter.  Definitely tasty, but maybe because, for some reason, I like pineapples in my burgers!  We also got a side of fries.  Just the fries, not the frings, or the other half/half options they offer.  They were really good fries.  I would go back just to order the fries.  Yummy, crispity goodness!  We also ordered a chocolate peanut butter shake, but I think all we got was a peanut butter shake.  It was still delicious though.

When we were almost done eating, the owner came over to chat with us because he recognized "A" from "Best in Chow."  Yeah, if you haven't figured it out - my darling "A" was one of the judges in the burger challenge!!!!  

We also let another couple share our table with us.  Because we cool like that.

About $18 for the two of us.  Cash Only.
author: Kris L.

description:
Burger was pretty good with the option to choose how it should be cooked (medium, medium rare, etc) but there's nothing truly special about the burger which will make me want to go back.  

Although the burger is MUCH better than anything you can get at popular chains (Carls Jr, Burger King, McDonald's, etc), it's also priced accordingly and, to be quite honest, I would be happier spending $4 for a Carl's Jr burger than $8 for Pearl's.  I'm not complaining about Pearl's prices because they are reasonable and their burgers are bigger but I'm just saying that if I pay double the price, I expect double the enjoyment and Pearl's didn't meet my expectations.

And that's all I can say about that.
author: Linda H.

description:
So far, Pearl's seems to be one of the BEST burger joints in SF!! We arrived to the restaurant with a friendly welcome by Travis, the cashier. Looking at the menu, I wasn't sure what I wanted to try since all of the options seemed to sound amazing! Travis recommended me to order the Kobe Bula Burger cooked medium. It the Pearl's award-winning burger.

WOW!! I've never had kobe before, so I'm not an expert, but I definitely enjoyed the burger. The meaty Kobe beef cooked meduim, bacon, Swiss cheese, with the sweet pineapple and teriyaki sauce were great combination! I pretty much enjoyed every bite till my last. Travis, the cashier, told me to thank him if we enjoyed it, so shout out to Travis for the great recommendation!

We also ordered a side of onion rings. It wasn't that special, and a bit too oily. I'm definitely had better, but I was enjoying the burger too much to care about any side.

The only complaint I had was one of the employees working there giving us attitude when we asked for ranch sauce to-go. He was a bit sarcastic with us and gave us a bad vibe. If it wasn't for Travis being so nice, I'd take one star away for the other rude employee.

I'm coming back here to try their other burgers whenever I'm in town!
author: Kevin S.

description: My boyfriend and I were craving a burger, and happened to be on Polk St. We looked on Yelp and Pearl's popped up. With all the glowing reviews, we thought perfect. Don't get me wrong, this place is not by any means bad. It just isn't 4 stars to me. I felt the quality just wasn't there, and it was an extremely greasy burger. The portions were huge, and it was difficult to eat. I know a burger is meant to be greasy and messy, but I have definitely experienced better in San Francisco. Likely won't go out of my way for this spot.
author: Gabrielle C.

description: Got the bacon with chz. Thick and juicy patty with tons of toppings. French fries are good. It's cash only but that's ok, cash is king! It's kinda small inside so be prepared to take it to go. Next time I think I'll order the shake as I noticed most customers had a a shake of some sort I also heard their onion rings are pretty good so I would like to try them as well.
author: Scott W.

description:
Gotta love the milkshakes here! I always tell myself to try something new but I gotta have the Nutella milkshake every time. 

The Swiss and mushroom burger was delicious! They're very generous with the mushrooms, which I loveeee! :)

They deserve another star for the pickle jar. I can't just have one so I'm happy I can help myself to a few more. 

Thanks Pearls for a satisfying meal and shake!!
author: Stacy F.

description: I have been visiting San Fran for pride and my girl and I wanted to try this burger joint.Little price but it was very worth money
author: Analicia E.

description: My go to burger place in the city. The BEST burgers at a great price and friendly service. I like that they have mini burgers since the regular is a bit too much for me. My normal order is a mini deluxe (no mayo) with swiss, bacon and a side of spries (half sweet potato fries and half regular fries). They have different types of cheese which is a nice change from the typical cheddar. Oreo milkshake is also delicious! Not a ton of seating but you can call in your order ahead of time.
author: Semuteh F.

description: GREAT FIND! This might be a tiny burger place but it has HUGE flavor! We ordered The avocado burger, it was cooked just as we specified! Loved that they offered "Frings"...we never can decide between fries & onion rings and here we didn't have to choose! Quick service and friendly staff! My son ordered the Cobb salad and it was HUGE for $9.99...loaded with Egg/Chicken & Bacon...great price!
author: Jennifer G.

description:
We were looking for some cheap eats during our latest trip to San Francisco and actually came upon Pearl's by accident while looking for a friend's address on Post St and decided to give it a try. 

Glad we did!  Be warned, Pearl's is tiny or you can say cozy!  If you decide to sit and eat,  you and the person behind you will be knocking chairs the whole time!  The menu has extensive choices for burgers or you can create your own but being as I am not the adventurous type and hubby didn't want to hurt his brain thinking about it we ordered the deluxe with cheese and the frings (fries and onion rings).  The burgers were very good and juicy, not dry!  The meat was very flavorful and cooked just right and the burger was a good size.  The fries and onion rings were so good and crunchy!  Not sure what they do to the fries but they were not your typical fries, these fries you enjoy eating!

The food was fresh and hot, the place was clean and the service was friendly.  Will make a return visit to Pearl's on the next trip back to San Francisco!
author: Vikki J.

description:
I'm so glad that my boyfriend and I decided to duck into this little hole in the wall. It was absolutely DELICIOUS. 

I got the pesto burger, which was amazing in its simplicity, and a chocolate and banana smoothie which had little chunks of fresh banana in it, and they threw in a free order of french fries. Ughhh, I'm getting hungry just thinking of it. Everything we got was top notch, the staff was super friendly, and the service was great.

Highly recommended.
author: Haylee L.

description:
So many good things to day about this place so let me narrate it for you through my eyes. 

On a big trip to San Francisco as noon approaches you find yourself hungry for some food but you don't just want a fast food restourant or a run of the mill burger joint, so instinctively you go on yelp and search for burger joints. A name catches your eye "pearls deluxe burgers". You see the good rating and find yourself walking through the tenderloin for a unique and tasty burger. At first sight it appears to be a small unpopular food joint but when you walk inside you are greeted with the smell of cooking beef patties. You are then greeted by the clerk who takes your order with ease and you sit down. Although there aren't many seats the people before you leave so you sit.

After a while your burger comes (I would recommend the phat bob ) you smell the 1/4 or 1/2 pound patty and dig in. You are instantly taken through a flavorful rollercoaster on which your mind is blown by the delicious taste. 

I would really recommend this to anyone who likes good American food. A little pricey but worth it.
author: Martin K.

description:
So first off id like to say that I'm not a native Californian. I came for a visit from Washington, and I was excited for all the delicious burgers I was going to enjoy while here. Pearls was my first stop, and god it did not disappoint. 

My friend and I had ordered a bula burger and a pesto burger and it was just spectacular. From the bun to the patty and the dripping contents loaded onto it, it was a great first choice and definitely hard to top! 

My mouth waters thinking about it now that I'm back home and I can't wait to stop by again next time!
author: Helen L.

description:
When I go to San Fransisco, I don't usually gravitate towards burgers. However, I was in the Tenderloin, drunk and wanted something tasty to eat within walking distance. I relied on Yelp and it steered me to Pearl's. 

Holy cannoli...the burgers and fries here are otherworldly good. I had a bleu cheese burger and half-fry/onion ring combo and believe me, it wasn't just my empty tummy and the alcohol that made it taste so good. This is a hole in the wall, easily missed, but I can't imagine finding a better burger. I vow to come here every time I'm in the city.
author: A. C.

description: Excellent burgers and fries. Highly recommend this place as there's so many options for fries, onion rings, sweet potato fries, shakes, etc. They also ask how you want your burger cooked which is a good touch. Vegetarians can also substitute a veggie patty for any burger on the menu giving them just as many options as all the meat eaters. Not a lot of seating at maybe a dozen or so seats inside, so we saw a lot of people take their orders to-go.
author: Alex N.

description:
I walked into to this restaurant with no expectations. I was just craving for a burger and i yelped this place. I just wanted a simple burger no fancy ass burger just a yummmy delicious burger. 

The guy at the register was super awesome and welcoming. I helped connect his wifi so he gave me ice cream so thats awesome lol 

The burger it self was delicious and the fries were good too. The restaurant is well maintained and the bathroom has writings all over the wall so you can peep that while youre peeing. 

Overall I would come back because it was one of the juiciest burger Ive had in SF.
author: Amber H.

description:
Came in on a Saturday afternoon with a huge group (9-10 people) but the guy at the register was very helpful.

I ordered the mushroom burger w/ kobe beef and I thought it was good but a little dry, not the best burger I've had. But the fries/milkshakes were great!!! We ordered curler fries/regular fries/onion rings and they were all so crispy and yum.
author: Shana N.

description: I have had this place book marked for a while. Not sure how I found out about this place, maybe someone recommended it to me. Anyways we had a friend in town who always eats here when he visits so we decided to join him. I ordered a pearl deluxe mini. The bun was the highlight of the burger. The meat and filling was ok. Not super flavorful or anything. Hubby got the burger with the goat cheese. He said it was ok, a little on the salty side. My little one seemed to enjoy their sweet potato fries. Banana shake was nothing spectacular. Overall the burgers look better than they actually taste.
author: Kim l.

description: THE BEST BURGER IN SF. I love this place. It's family-run burger joint with quality ingredients assembled with love. Med rare is cooked that way and who doesn't love free pickles??? I recommend the chili cheese fries and onion ring/ French fries combo.  turkey burger is good but that classic Pearl Deluxe is my fave.
author: Nicole C.

description: Went here on a whim, the place got busy right after we walked in which we took as a very good sign! Delish, fresh, and satisfying.
author: Alyssa H.

description:
Thank you GoPago for TWO free meals at Pearls!  

Not a huge burger fan but hey, if it's free, I'm there!  I ordered the 1/4lb Phat Burger because I need bacon in my burgers.  The beef patty is yummy and cooked nicely.  You have to order lettuce additionally if you want but oh well.  Pickles are free though!  Burgers look small in comparison to everything else since portions are huge, but it'll definitely fill you up.  They have sweet potato fries, onion rings, garlic fries, and regular fries, all of which filled my fried food quota for the week.

I always come out of Pearls wreaking of grease and BBQ sauce and slightly sick of myself since I gorged on that much unhealthy food, but whatever.  I'd go again if I want to eat myself to a near-comatose state.
author: Jane N.

description: Personally one of my favorite spots for burgers, fries, and shakes! Their mini burgers are perfect for me! Their specialty burgers are incredibly delicious and full of flavors! Ingredients are always so fresh and my meat is always cooked perfectly to how I like it! I can never have enough of their fries as well! I will definitely be back soon! (:
author: Midori L.

description: Got the Kobe patty and expected at the very least a good burger.  It was perfectly cooked though the taste was mediocre.  Not worth the extra cost of the Kobe patty.  I've had Bubba Burgers with more flavor.  Onion rings were good, fries were soggy with oil.  Maybe I hit it on a bad day.
author: TJ L.

description:
Ive been here probably 20 times since last years review. The food is still amazing. I usually get the small cheese burger with cheddar cheese and everything on it, medium rare. Every time it comes out perfect. The service is also fantastic. Tonight when I went I noticed that the same guy is always manning the register. Poel (I know I butchered the spelling) Is such a nice guy, as are all the other staff. Its definitely worth a drop in if you're in the city. Its the best burger you'll ever have :)


Also, the pickles are super good.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Went in lunchtime on a Wednesday and it was pretty quiet. However, I passed by it later that night and there were around 15 people eating outside (good sign)

I would give the burger (Avocado Chicken) 5 stars but the fries 4 stars. Definitely worth a visit if you are in the area 

Great prices as well, but cash only....
author: Greg R.

description: Decent burger, a fast meal esp for one in a very casual place. Unlike most other burger places, the bread was quite decent and I enjoyed that alot. By the way, cash only!
author: Snowdrops C.

description: The ambience is a bit off-putting but he food was filling. I had the open face chili cheese burger and it was great, though it lacked seasoning. The garlic fries were basically semi raw garlic on top crispy fries...disappointing.
author: Naomi D.

description:
The burgers are amazing. We came in here one night very drunk and very loud and was rewarded with delicious burgers and really kind and patient service...def kinder than we probably deserved.

I will be back, also this is the only burger place I've been to in the Bay Area that comes even close to a good burger in LA or NY. So glad my friend introduced me. Also the banana shake here is phenomenol.
author: Cindy C.

description:
You changed, Pearls.... You changed your fries... I..I... I don't even know what to say? How could you?

Once I took 5 seconds and got over that by getting under your free pickels, I charged through my veggie burger and f. that was great. We're still homies. 

BTW so excited for your new SF location! Counting down the days until March!!
author: Emily D.

description:
I had been living 1 block away from Pearl's Deluxe burgers for about 5 years, and never really paid it any mind. It just looked like your run of the mill hole in the wall burger joint. It took someone who isn't even from this country bringing it to my attention to finally decide to step in, and holy sh!t....

umm... yeah... How blind was I??

This place is ridiculous good. Easily one of my favorite burgers ever, let alone here in San Francisco. It's pricey, but the upgrade to buffalo meat is well worth it. The little paper on the wall with buffalo fun facts had me sold, and after trying it, it's pretty much become my default.

The Bula burger is kinda what they're known for, however i prefer just the standard Pearl's Deluxe. Throw some crispy bacon on there and some american cheese. Good god...

The fries and onion rings are also delicious and crispy, so i often go for the "Frings." If you like pickles, they also have a self-serve container of pickle Spears.

My only real wish would be for the buns to be a little more sturdy. They often sort of begin to fall apart as i get to the last 1/3 of my burger. But the bun is delicious though.

Final note: GO HERE
author: Charles Michael B.

description: This place was great!  The hamburger was juicy, the onion rings were awesome and the fries were really good.  Fast service!! Very friendly!  Ended the dinner with the best milkshake ever!  Definitely recommend!
author: Lisa W.

description: Simply a 5 star burger place! Great service as well. Very friendly staff. Nice pickles on the house as well.
author: Behzad K.

description:
Meh I wasn't very impressed.. Overpriced too.

Got the prized pearl special burger (bacon, blue cheese and caramelized onions). and a regular pearl deluze w everything. 

The burgers are overpriced and not flavorful. I need a tasty meat patty on a burger and this place does not deliver that.

Juicy and a lot of fun toppings (LOVE blue cheese and Bacon on a burger) but thats about it.

Onion rings and sweet potato fries were good, nothing special.
author: Nina M.

description: This was a great little burger joint in San Francisco. Great Bula burger with fried onions and I loved that you can get onion rings and fries together.  Great Customer Service as well!
author: April C.
