description: Love, love, LOVE this place!!!  Best burgers in SF "hands-down".  Instead of 'writing' about these insanely de-lish burgers, I'll let the pic of my "Kobe & Buffalo-Jack & Swiss" infusion speak for itself...
author: D T.

description: Loved the mushroom Swiss burger and garlic fries here. I love to try these in most areas I visit and Pearl's nailed it for me on freshness and craft. Perfectly cooked and lots of flavor. The garlic fries alone were worth the wait for seating in the tiny dining space. If you love a good burger for a fair price then you won't be disappointed!! Yum!
author: Shanna V.

description: I dream of this place. I'm a Bay Area native, but only come back home maybe once a year. I always, always make a stop here. Normally my first stop after I get off the plane. Tasty, no nonsense burgers. Their garlic fries are to die for. I love the atmosphere. In a world a frilly, elitist restaurants, this place feels like a home away from home.
author: Kat H.

description:
This place did not disappoint at all. I admit, they have very limited seating (like about 4-5 tables only) and their prices might be a little high for the burgers, but you will definitely get what you paid for. There's a reason why they call it Pearl's DELUXE burgers. 

I ordered a TERIYAKI BURGER medium-well (grilled mushrooms, teriyaki sauce, mayo, and jack cheese) and a small side of SWEET POTATO FRIES. I had them cut my burger in half so I can share 1/2 with my cousin. My cousin ordered a BBQ CHICKEN BURGER (bacon, grilled onions, cheddar cheese). She also had it cut in half so she could share 1/2 with me. For her side, she chose GARLIC FRIES. We shared that as well as a side of ONION RINGS with my sister.

While waiting for our order, we lounged around standing waiting for a table for 4 to be gone since seating was so limited. Luckily, a group of 4 elderly people saw us waiting and so hurried up and finished their garlic fries (thank you, so much, but you didn't have to rush on those fries).

So I was able to taste a good amount of food and sides from Pearl's and I must say, that all the burgers and sides I tasted were phenomenal (though I did prefer my beef-patty burger to the chicken burger my cousin ordered). 

My TERIYAKI BURGER was very well made, they made sure it was medium-well, the way I wanted it. They had the right amount of sauce and the jack cheese was fully melted thoughout the burger. As for the sauteed mushrooms, they did not go cheap. There was sliced, sauteed mushrooms everywhere throughout the burger and they weren't puny either, they were pretty big. 

My cousin's BBQ CHICKEN BURGER was alright. I loved the bacon as well as the grilled onions (I would take my fork and get all the ones that fell out). The chicken was a bit dry, in my opinion, but it might be due to me eating this half of the burger after my burger so it was about 20-30 minutes old? Hehehe. I'm trying to make up excuses. 

All the sides we ordered were amazing. The SWEET POTATO FRIES weren't limp, but were well fried and sweet like they should be. The GARLIC FRIES were also very pleasing with enough garlic to accompany each fry. Also, the way they were fried made it extremely crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. Nice touch. My favorite though would be the ONION RINGS (I love, love onion rings). They were well seasoned and crispy on the outside. What I loved about them was that when you bit into them, the outside crisp wouldn't fall apart in my hands, it was very well intact (one of my pet peeves for onion rings). 

I definitely wouldn't mind visiting Pearl's Deluxe Burger again, but this time I would probably share one meal and a couple of sides since it was pretty big portions.
author: Diana N.

description:
Service is excellent.
Garlic fries are the regular fries with minced garlic on top. Onion rings and sweet potato fries are good, chocolate malt is frosty and tasty. 
Dining area is tiny with seating for a dozen people total.
BURGER is good but not the greatest.
Remember to get BURGER cooked to your desired doneness as they default to rare. Undercooked ground meat carries slight risk of food born illness, but their health rating is 100 so perhaps they grind their own BURGER meat?
I am a BURGER snob where truly the best BURGER is eaten in Dallas at Liberty Burger. No other has ever even come close.
author: D J.

description:
Bottom Line: a great line up of burgers with no misses on the menu.

This place is great.  You can get at least 4 kinds of patties here.  Plain old beef (they already use great quality meat), Kobe, Buffalo, and at least one other one (like ostrich, turkey, or veggie or something - forgot.)  On top of the kind of patty you choose, they have many varieties of toppings. 

I've had their plain old burger with lettuce, tomatoes, onions and their fancier burgers with all kinds of goodies on it.  They are all EXCELLENT burgers.  Pick what sounds good to you, and you'll be happy with it.  There aren't any real bad choices.

Some notes:
-- The Bula burger is worth the awards it gets.
-- You can tell the Kobe is juicier.  The regular beef is good too though.  Kobe may not be worth the $4 premium on a regular basis, but try it at least once.
-- Buffalo burgers rock.  They are better for you, and only a few people can tell what they're getting - they're still juicy and tastes like beef.
-- Their fries and onion rings are A-OK.
-- Their buns are perfect sesame seed buns.  Not silly kaiser rolls, or anything dumb you get at fancier burger places.
-- They actually cook your meat to the temperature you ask.  You want Medium?  It will actually be slightly pink.  I've eaten here at least 5 times, and they haven't missed yet.

If you're in the neighborhood, Pearl's is worth a look see.  Heck, if you're within a few miles, it's worth a detour.  

Pearl's was our first and last meal on our trip to San Francisco.  What does that say?
author: Anson G.

description:
Went here for a late night burger when I was staying at a hotel in Union Square and I'm glad I did! It was fairly late so there wasn't a line. It's a small place with limited seating, but I was doing take out so that really wasn't an issue for me. 

I went with the deluxe bacon and cheese burger. It was good sized, delicious and cooked just how I wanted it (medium). I read the Yelp reviews and saw so many comments about the spries- so naturally, I had to get an order. Half regular fries, half sweet potato fries. People weren't lying, these were great! The regular fries were nice and crispy. 

The staff was friendly, and there is a small container with some free for all pickles. I'm not sure if they limit you, so I only took one. It was crispy and fresh. I was too embarrassed to grab another but I'm sure it would have been fine. The food came out quick and I was on my way. Fast, easy and tasty meal.. I'd recommend it! (Also..cash only!)
author: Angela S.

description: Honestly, you have to eat to survive, so if you feel hungry this is a place you can go to. If this saved your life, no need to thank me. It's just good help people out.
author: Harold B.

description: I had the Spicy Sly Burger, Garlic Fries and Onion Rings. It is a bit of walk from Union Square but really worth it. A neighborhood business deserves a highlight. It can be a fun trip for a small group office lunch getaway with some sightseeing of the city.
author: Christie L.

description:
Came here while on vacation in SF, and really enjoyed it!  We had read great reviews on Yelp and decided to try it out since it was a short walk from where we were staying.

It's a really tiny little place.  We almost walked right by it at first.  We ended up having to share a table with another couple (they were really nice, so it was totally fine...but figured I'd mention that in case people don't like that...there's only like 4 tables in the whole place so it's likely to happen).

The food was good!  I got a "mini" burger which ended up being pretty normal size.  My husband got a regular burger which was rather large.  We shared "frings" and both the fries and onion rings were really tasty!  

I'll admit when we first walked in, I was worried the food wouldn't be good.  It's kind of a hole in the wall and it's cash only, but we left happy and very full!
author: Megan P.

description:
CASH ONLY! 

I remember the fries use to be better here, but that was a year ago.  The burger is still pretty amazing.  Definitely worth a stop.
author: Y L.

description:
Was very good but honestly i think this place was is a bit overrated. After readin the reviews and seeing it on the food network i had very high expectations. I got the bula burger and it was pretty good, a little over cooked though.


On the other hand, the onion rings were amazing! Umami in sf is my choice over this place
author: Erin J.

description:
I am truly perplexed as to what the hype is surrounding this establishment? With all the great restaurants in San Francisco, places like this should really be closed by now. Oh wait! Their Market Street location did go out of business - shocking! 

The service is quite horrible and the staff is smug and condescending. The food is decent, but WAY overpriced and the ambiance is barely a step above an inner-city cafeteria. Out of sheer convenience, I have been to Pearl's a couple of times, but last night was the very last time I will set foot through their smudged up and greasy doors. 

In the future, I will definitely be making the trek to Super Duper Burger! They are clean, friendly, take credit cards, and go out of their way to please their customers, which would be why they have so many successful locations in SF! 

Don't fall for the "hole-in-the-wall goodness" syndrome with Pearl's; you deserve a better value and service for your hard-earned money.
author: Derwood A.

description:
Best burger place in SF! 

Just go over and let your taste buds go on a joy ride.  You will know when you sink in your teeth when you take the first bite! 

Yes, I know what you are thinking...It is a bit steep for a burger.  Do not let this stop you because what they cook is magical.  

{Things you need to know}
-Quality meat.  You can try Kobe Beef for additional $4
-Over 15 flavors of shakes.  
-You can get half-and-half side munches. (Sweet potato fries, onion rings, garlic fries or regular fries)
-Bobby Flay loves this place!

{Burgers}
-Try their Bula Burger: It is sweet, savory and salty. Great combination in one meal. 
-Veggie Burger:  The gear to both vegetarians and 
-Different sizes:  Regular or Mini.  I felt that the mini was just the right portion size because you were not overwhelmingly full, but satisfied. 

There are days where I save my appetite by eating a salad for lunch and wait eagerly to eat their burger for an appetizing dinner. :) 

Happy Yelping!
author: Deborah C.

description:
I ordered the Mushroom Burger with a side of sweet-potato fries.
The burger was average...the meat was tasty and beefy. I didn't like Pearl's buns.
The sweet potato fries were good and crispy.
Tiny spot and limited-seating.
3.5 stars.
author: Derek N.

description:
I was literally starving yesterday evening and was dreaming on a delicious burger. My friend took me to Pearl's Deluxe Burgers, and that was it! Burgers were awesome, i was full by eating only one even though i was so hungry. 
Very welcoming and friendly personnel.
author: Kelly R.

description: Ewwwwww....Meat undercooked, onion rings were greasy, mangled bits dredged up from the bottom of the fryer. I was up with a stomach ache all night long. Revolting food. Wish there was an option for no stars. The only bright spot was that the roll was tasty.
author: Shelly S.

description:
First off, thanks GoPago for another free lunch! And for finding new food places for me to try. Am forever grateful!

BULA BURGER W/ KOBE BEEF
[+] the spicy pineapple teriyaki added a fun sweet, tangy, and spicy twist to the typical teriyaki burger; the spice wasn't too hot either
[+] the Kobe beef was delicious! Tender and flavorful
[+] the Swiss cheese and bacon was a nice finishing touch to really make it an enjoyable burger
[+] the bacon was mostly meat too so yay!
[-] did I mention the kobe is a $4 upgrade? Only reason I did it is to use my GoPago credits
[-] the hefty thing totaled to nearly $14! Ahhhh, it was good but not something I would come back for very often

TIP
Ask for medium rare if you actually want medium. Yuppp, it's one of those things
author: Sandy T.

description:
Dear yelper considering eating here.. 

This place is not GOOD!!!! I ordered $40 worth of burgers (pesto puke burger, and the bulu burger), garlic fries, and onion rings. ALL WERE SOGGY, COLD, OVERCOOKED, no taste. Onion rings were ...OK. Trust me, when it comes to burgers- its RARE that the whole thing will not be gone. I couldn't even eat half of it!

I never wrote a yelp review before- but after eating here- i had to write one. All the pictures of the food look hella bomb! but, actually going there sucks, and i wish i would have taken my money to in n out or some where else. How can this place have so many good reviews? 

Seriously go somewhere else before coming here! Save yourself the trouble and the disappointment. Spend your money elsewhere.
author: Sam C.

description:
These burgers and fries are so beyond boss. It's like someone is flying a rainbow colored unicorn into your mouth: you're not really sure what's happening, but whatever it is, it's amazing. 

The fries here will never make you cry, so you should get them, too.

I usually end up going here when I am in any of the following situations:

1. My tinder date for the night ditched me 15 minutes before we were meant to meet up.
2. I am too lazy to walk an additional three blocks to Jack in the Box.
3. I am drunk
4. I had a bad day at work
5. I had a good day at work
6. I need something to eat while watching Netflix.
7. I need something to eat while drinking wine and watching Netflix.
8. If I can't get a guy to sleep with me that night, but I still want to hate myself the next morning.
9. If I met an annoying vegetarian in the same day.
10. I want a burger.

Basically, I am here a lot... And you should be, too.

It ain't fancy but it's a damn good burger that will suite any mood, and you won't be disappointed.
author: Valerie H.

description:
Amazing food. The french fries are to die for! I am only giving 4/5 stars because they recently changes the burger bun types and it's such a bummer :( The buns are too big and a bit dry. Please go back to the previous buns! 

Also, the people there are super nice and basically every single thing on the menu is delicious.
author: Lindsay G.

description: Delicious burger.  Made my mouth water, has great taste.  Get it with bacon!
author: Steven H.

description: Great, classic burgers that get it all right without trying to be too fancy. The garlic fries are what you dream about.
author: Yan F.

description: Went here after reading all the great reviews. Really juicy burgers with good portions. Lots of burgers and specialty burgers which could be substituted for turkey or chicken. Their half onion rings/half French fries were perfectly crispy and delicious. The milkshakes were fresh with many flavors! A must try in San Francisco!
author: Vani T.

description:
My go-to place for a burger fix. If only it weren't so far. :(

There are so many reviews for this place, I'm sure you don't need the details. So, I'll sum it up in 5 little words: get your ass to Pearl's.


You won't be sorry.





Side note: the kobe beef burger really tastes... exactly the same as the regular.
author: Chia L.

description:
Probably the best burgers and milkshakes I've tried in my life. I got pleasantly surprised I can order even "special" burgers in smaller size and actually finish them. 

Messy, juicy and delicious.
author: Sophia S.

description:
Pearl's has become a happy tradition during my business trips to San Francisco and I made my once a year journey there today. My co-worker Johnny and I adore their peanut butter chocolate shakes and in anticipation of our upcoming visit, talk non-stop about them for weeks. Year after year I have gone home to Honolulu and told my boyfriend how amazing their milkshakes were!

My boyfriend came along with us to Pearl's for lunch and although the service is still very good at Pearl's, I must say that we were a bit disappointed this time around. The burgers are still great but my sweet potato fries were a little dry from being overcooked. The shake, which in all honesty is the real reason we walk a mile uphill to lunch on Post Street, was not right at all. It was way too thick and there wasn't enough chocolate mixed in with the peanut butter. Normally you can't get me to share my milkshake with anyone because I slurp that sucker up til my straw makes annoying noises. But after we left Pearl's I ended up throwing away a 3/4 full cup in the trash can down by Market Street. Totally sad panda! My boyfriend remarked on how he didn't think it was that great of a place and that he expected more because of all my ranting and raving. Completely humiliating...wom wom wom.

Things have changed since we visited this quirkly little burger joint and I wish they'd leave it the way it was! I'm sure we'lll return again, but for the sweet love of be-Jesus! Fix the damn milkshakes!!! (Shakes fist in air and starts sobbing)

Yelp 365 Challenge: #187/365 (The SF Tradition)
author: Emi H.

description: The buns are fresh and not so large that it's too much bread. They are really burger perfect. The burger itself was juicy and the Chilli cheese fries  with onion topping was yummy.
author: Sabrina J.

description:
This is a tight space, but worth it. The deluxe burger is fabulous. I didn't live the onion rings, but the rest of my family snarled them down pretty quick. My daughter had the chicken sandwich and liked it. 

The employees are very friendly. We loved it and recommend it.
author: Melanie N.

description: So so SO good! I'm not one to ever really crave burgers but pearls is close to work so I decided to give it a try. I had the Teri mushroom burger- amazing sauce!!!!!!! And so cheesy Mmmmmm and the onion rings- just perfect!
author: Shayana W.

description:
Being new to the neighborhood, I'm tackling the highest rated, affordable eats within walking distance of my place, and Pearl's was number two after Kare-Ken. I came at 6pm on a Friday, and luckily for me, there was no line. There were six customers seated at the 13 total seats, three of which were at a bar-style table along the front window.

My (mini) Prized Pearl ($5.99) was awesome even though I usually don't like bleu cheese. I made a happy mess of my hands while devouring it. I realized too late that the springs (sweet potato fries with onion rings, $3.99) only came in the large size, but I muscled through it anyway. And I can't say enough about the nutella premium milkshake ($4.99): it was like drinking out of a jar of nutella except someone was nice and thinned it enough so that you could drink it with a straw. Thinking about it makes me want to walk down there right now and get another one.

The verdict: I balked when I realized that I had spent almost $20 just on myself here, but when I thought back on the tastiness of what I got, I calmed again. Pearl's is also within a five minute walk from my place. Win! [Schwarzenegger voice] I'll be back. [/Schwarzenegger voice]
author: Tiff T.

description: Great，Deluxe Burger Add Bacon & Cheese very good！I like Fring，near my Clift Hotel！all my choose are Amazing than ever.
author: 乔

description:
Their selection of specialty burgers are on point! I made the fatal mistake of ordering a regular burger and attempting to select my own toppings on there, totaling up to a burger that was really close to one of the pre-made selections but costing way more than the latter.

I think the biggest gripe I have is that they are cash only, which for a restaurant that is so busy all the time in the heart of San Francisco I cannot really fathom why you would still accept cash only. However, that should not deter people away from at least giving this place a try, for some of their specials are truly amazing. I had the California Dream, and it was the most monsterously large and delicious burger I've ever had. Their milkshakes are pretty good too if you are looking for something sweet!
author: Andy H.

description: Excellent burgers, small but busy and cozy place. Fast service and fair prices. They have a huge variety of burgers. Two of us had vegan burgers, and were really satisfied. If you're in for a quick meal, fast served and tastefull burgers, this is the place.
author: Knut Olav S.

description:
I think i am addicted to their garlic fries!! So crunchy on the outside, and so garlic-y! Very well seasoned too!
Service is always cheerful and prompt!
author: Crystal R.

description:
From the outset, it looks like a random fast-food burger place in the city. Cafeteria-like seating / tables (limited as well) and a small counter to order from up front. I'm sorry Pearl for judging you before I tried you. You definitely showed me up though.

Burgers: regular size is 1/2 lb of meat, or you could order a mini for 1/4 lb of meat. You can order a regular hamburger (called a Deluxe) and add your own cheese and bacon, or you can order from the special ones (Phat Bob and Bula are the favorites).
- Meat: medium-rare is the way to go. perfectly pink interior, great flavor, tender, and juicy
- Buns: baked fresh daily (from a bakery that I don't remember the name of) and topped with a generous amount of sesame seeds. This was my least favorite part of the burger, a tinge of staleness and top bun was a bit big.

Fries: zomg. Perfectly fried. Tried both the Sweet Potato Fries as well as the regular Garlic Fries. SPF's were thick and crispy, soft interior. Garlic Fries were infused with garlic flavor, with a perfect crunch and thick enough to get a good soft potato inside. Still can't get over the minced garlic in the fries.

Shakes: 20+ flavors, and can be customized (one guy got a blueberry cheesecake with pineapple milkshake, to which we smiled and nodded.. to each their own). Didn't have enough space to try the milkshakes, but I'll definitely be back next time I'm in the city!
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Best burger I've ever had. 

What is the icing on the cake?  Staff are very friendly and happy you are there. 

You won't be disappointed.  Better than anything from my L.A.
author: Shawn R.

description: The only reason why I gave this 4 stars as they don't accept cards else awsome burgers at reasonable price!
author: Vikram S.

description:
I'll start with the cons: Limited seating, cash only, and the prices aren't fantastic. Small menu; basically burgers and fries.

Everything else was pretty on point. This place is great for a quick bite, and the food is well cooked and pretty good. High health rating, which is nice. I SERIOUSLY LOVED my burger. My boyfriend didn't like his much, but meh.

If they had more seating, I'd easily give another star. And if the prices were just a liiiittttllee more fitting, I'd give this place 5 stars. (I really, really loved my burger and onion rings.)
author: Jessica Z.

description:
Mixing up the sides is such an ingenious idea - you get the best of both when you order a portion of 'spries'!

Had the 'Avocado' with a veggie patty. Pretty messy to eat but definitely hit the spot.
author: Nil S.

description:
I'm not a burger girl but I'll add another spin class to my week to eat here.  I'm a little odd but I like my burger meat a little on the drier side in terms of how long it's been on the grill.  I like that taste meat gives off when it's been on the grill slightly past the point most people like it, when more of the lipids has dripped off.  Their buffalo burger is a loving warm textural lean red meat that doesn't feel too heavy.  Warning to the Ladies, if you can split a burger -- do so; a whole burger is just crazy big.  My husband with the hollow leg had trouble shaking down his buffalo bula burger.  
I usually get the peppery "spicy sly" buffalo burger.  I always hold the mayo because the buffalo meat is so flavorful, it doesn't need it.

Onion rings here are fresh and sweet.  We usually order the combo sweet potato and onion rings "springs".

Service here has always been friendly and kind, each and every time.
author: Liz K.

description: Best burger I've had in a longggg time! Got the mushroom burger with Swiss and it was amazing! Pricey but goooodddd!
author: Linnette C.

description: Went it for a cheeseburger and was not disappointed in the basic 1/2 lb w/bacon w/American cheese. Friendly service and not a long wait for my burger . Limited seating but was able to get a table rather quickly. Overall pretty happy and will come back again
author: Alex O.

description:
One of the best turkey burgers I've ever had! Fries, onion rings, and shakes are all good as well. 

Minus a star for one of the workers who got an attitude with me because I didn't hear my number getting called and so she told me rudely next time remember your number because I have a lot of orders. You need to be more polite lady! And why bother working there if you can't handle the pressure?!
author: Fallon P.

description:
I had the Prized Pearl (bacon, grilled onions, freshly crumbled blue cheese and mayo) was good, that's it. I had high expectations for this burger, but the burger was just satisfying and hit all the flavors in its ingredients (with some strong hints of the blue cheese towards the end). Maybe I missed the  that Food Network Chefs Bobby Flay and Anne Burrell saw in these burgers, but nonetheless it was delicious. (+3)

The burger would slip away from the bun a couple times, but eating it was manageable! Compared to the mass of a burger at Hodad's (OB, San Diego), this burger was very neat! 

BUT THE FRIES...the fries are the reason why I would be coming back! They were perfectly crispy and had a crunch when you bite into them (+1). I'll come back to try a different burger and definitely those fries!
author: Tim P.

description: If you're craving a burger on cheat day, this is the place to go. Super greasy, super cheesy, super rich food all around!
author: Juliet R.

description: Got a buffalo burger and fringos. I was initially hesitant to try out fringos because the burger seemed enough but I was clearly wrong. You can eat fringos even when you're full. That's how amazing fringos are. FYI, fringos are a mix of onion rings and french fries. French fries are insanely good. It's probably the crunchiest french fries that I've ever eaten; it just melts as soon as you put it in your mouth.
author: Kilim C.

description:
I had planned to make my order takeout, so the ambiance wasn't the reason I didn't dine there. The place is a hole in the wall (almost literally), so their abilities are limited. It's loud and cramped. But the bula burger more than made up for that. Based on that one sandwich alone, I had to rate Pearl's five stars.

The bun was good, the sauce was amazing (a combination of bbq sauce and spicy pineapple), there was plenty of jack cheese, and the patty was giant--cooked medium-rare to perfection, just as I'd ordered.

I look forward to reviewing their onion rings and milkshakes at a future meal.
author: Marcello L.

description: If I could give zero stars I would the food was nasty got my burger well done  went to pick it up and all this blood came off of it....never again
author: Katie W.

description:
Excellent little burger joint. In addition to beef, they've also got Bison burgers (and chicken too, I think), which I'm always looking for.

I had the avocado burger with buffalo, medium rare, and it was exquisite - excellent bun, super juicy burger cooked perfectly, and a generous portion of avocado. It was dripping everywhere, and I was delighted. 

On the side I had half fries and half onion rings. The onion rings were good (clearly made in house with a light batter) and the fries were even better. They had some super crunchy coating on them.

Lastly, the service was great. It wasn't busy when I arrived, and the guy behind the counter came out and got me some water while I was eating (he didn't have to, it was available to serve yourself up front) and came over with some free ice cream at the end. Very nice guy.

I'll be back.
author: Kevin S.

description:
If there's one thing Americans know better than anyone else in the world, it's a burger. We might not know where Canada is on a map (It's next to Transylvania, right?), but we know what constitutes a burger. And SF has an embarrassment of riches in the burger department. Sure, we've got the usually McD's and Burger Kings about (I miss the Wendy's on Market), but those all taste the same. Good thing we have no shortage of old-fashioned burger joints around town.

Ah, Pearl's. If there's one thing about which I'm skeptical, it's a turkey burger. I know it's supposed to be healthier, but that doesn't mean it has to be devoid of taste. Pearl's makes a mouth-watering selection of burgers and the turkey burger I had when I first wandered in (it was a helluva New Year's night) made me want to get on my knees and thank God.

It's too bad their Market St. local didn't work out, but I think of this as the only "real" Pearl's anyway. As long as this one stays put, I'll be a happy man.
author: Charles L.

description:
I came here the other night to try the Kobe beef Bula burger (won 1st place in SF Weekly's Burger Challenge in August) for $12.73 (yes, pricey!). it's a new item so the price wasn't posted on the menu yet. Good burger, but messy to eat. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pearls-deluxe-burgers-san-francisco?userid=8Ces6YdT6j7BYycnZLrSng#3PNWVeX89qUC_2tck2_nKA

The menu can be confusing, so I'll summarize the options. Most signature burgers are in the $7-9 range (without extras), the plain/ chicken/ turkey burgers and mini sizes cost less. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pearls-deluxe-burgers-san-francisco?select=lKNTHMbvi0HLRS_8Uu5FXQ#lKNTHMbvi0HLRS_8Uu5FXQ Any burger can be made with buffalo meat by adding $2.49, or with Kobe beef for $3.99 more, but those meats are not available as mini.

If you've never been here before, u should know that their burgers are 1/2 lb. and the "mini" are 1/4 lb. (equivalent to a "regular" at other places). So u can split a burger with someone or order the mini version, if you're not that hungry. The special burgers are VERY messy, like that Carl's Jr. commercial with a burger that drips all over (because of the teriyaki sauce, BBQ sauce, etc).

The sides - cole slaw, garlic fries, regular fries, onion rings, and sweet potato fries - are also available as combinations: Frings (fr+rings), Spries (fr+sweet fr) and Springs (sweet fr+rings). Most people rave about either the crinkle cut sweet potato fries http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pearls-deluxe-burgers-san-francisco?select=YL5zbyA7BjXoPywxvB_VhQ#YL5zbyA7BjXoPywxvB_VhQ or the onion rings (which are similar to the ones from Jack in the Box or Burger King). Both are good.

I LOVE the milkshakes - $3.49 for the regular flavors and $3.99 for the special flavors, with about 10 different flavors in each group. The mud pie shake (brownies and chocolate) is a new favorite.

No opinion on items I haven't tried yet: veggie burger, hot dog, chili, and the salads (garden, cobb, asian chicken).

Tips:

Check your takeout order before leaving, because mistakes can happen. One time I received 'Frings' instead of 'Springs'.

And the kitchen can be inconsistent. One night my fries were way too salty. I didn't complain that time, because the 2 cooks looked angry. Maybe they were having a bad day. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pearls-deluxe-burgers-san-francisco?select=SikRV7WAxjrPjoLM_3V3TA#SikRV7WAxjrPjoLM_3V3TA
author: Luis C.

description: Bring cash. I was lucky enough to go in when there was almost no line. Don't expect to be able to find a place to sit during normal hours (I went at 8pm on a Wednesday...) But that's OK because I was able to take it back to my room and enjoy the HUGE burger and the MASSIVE  amount of fries - potato and sweet potato. I was fearful that if I ordered the gourmet burgers my mind would explode, so I only wanted to dip my toe into the Pearls 'water'. I'm glad I did - that service, the amount of food and the quality of the food was amazing. One star deducted for not having payment flexibility. The food and service get five stars.
author: HM T.

description:
CASH ONLY!

I'm only screaming it at you because I've read other reviews and no one ever stated this. So when I walked here, I was like oh! And came back the next day. 
They do have an ATM inside, but fees..who want those?

I got the mushroom burger with garlic fries.

The burger; juicy and SO many mushrooms! It was great. Besides the fact that it was too juicy (from the shrooms) that the bun got soggy fast.

Garlic fries..eh. It was just topped with chopped garlic. I've had better, for sure.

Service was definitely great though. The guy was very nice and personable.

Pretty expensive for just a burger place.
author: Kathryn D.

description:
So good. But ooooh so bad. I need to sleep this food off. 

Thought I was in the mood for bleu cheese. So I ordered the prized pearl. It would be tasty if I loved bleu cheese that much. The bleu cheese was so overwhelming. 

I was gonna order the teriyaki burger but the sweetie did. And that was delicious. 

Good onion rings. And my favorite milkshake to have is here.
author: Glessie C.

description:
You can find a variety of Burgers in the city from your fancy schmancy Umami to your hip  but alternative Roam to a new Super Duper joint popping up almost every week it seems. If you are looking for pure dankness and high caloric in-take type of burger THIS IS THE SPOT. 

After my nasty run down Jones and Taylor I decided to reward myself. Walking from Nob Hill past Sutter you start to see bars on the windows here and there but it doesn't feel quite Tenderloin-y yet. A lot of interesting looking restaurants in the area. I knew it was near the corner of Post and Jones but it's still tough to find. The place looks like a plain jane diner. The menu looks all kinds of epic. So many options so many kinds of burgers so many fries.  At first I thought I'll just have a burger here and then cook some Brussel Sprouts at home. Then I saw the shake menu and if I'm getting a shake, I'm getting fries. 

Got the Prized Pearl, PB-Choc shake n plain fries. Sipped on the shake going back to my place. I'm a shake connoisseur of sorts and they make a top notch shake. Very creamy, just the right thickness. I peered into my to-go bag when I arrived home and the fries are those crispy type of fries, they looked bomb. Tasted bomb as well. There's a lot of em. Sharing seems like a common thing to do. Now the burger. Just pulling it out you could tell what you were getting into. Thick patty. Juices for dayz. Just a dank, messy burger. It looks like one of those burgers they use on the Carl Junior commercials that just oozes all over the place. Hey, different strokes for different folks but holy dank goodness for this burger.
author: Nicky T.

description:
It is probably the best burger place in San Francisco.  The bun was toasty, the onions, lettuce and tomatoes were fresh, and the meat was good.  It is a bit expensive for a burger and I wish they had beer, but relatively speaking I've found sandwiches here to be a bit more anyways. 

I sort of do like a thicker but not as wide patty like they have at my favorite places in New York (Paul's, Corner Bistro, Burger Joint at Le Meridien), but all in all a great spot.
author: Daniel Y.

description: Awesomeeeeeee!!.  We loved the burgers.  We ordered a side of spries.  Great idea and delicious.
author: Adriana T.

description:
This review is solely for "The Bomb" burger they have:

I have been craving Tommy's Burger (Yes, LA) lately but decided to try a new outpost here in The City. I really wanted a chili burger. Like REALLY wanted a chili burger. 

What I was expecting: fresh grilled patties topped with a walop of chili on top, cheese, a thick slice of tomato, a slice of a red onion whole, and pickles. 

What I got: the open face burger topped with their "homemade chili" with chopped onions placed inside a closable to-go container.  I seriously could not picked this up since it was so messy. I don't mind getting my fingers dirty, but this isn't 4505 BBQ Ribs. 

What it tasted: tasted like a typical grilled beef patty that was frozen topped with a can of Stagg Chili. 

This definitely crushed all my dreams and expectations. 

I had to go to Macy's right after and shop to drown my pain and sorrow.
author: Christopher V.

description: Great burgers and amazing fries. Definitely give their garlic fries a try!
author: Gustavo Y.

description:
Pearl's is not what I would think of off the bat when it comes to gourmet burgers, yet the quality of the burgers and the shakes keep me coming back.

The kobe beef is insanely delicious and is consistently good.  Why wouldn't I call them gourmet if they have a kobe beef option?   Maybe it's the look and feel of the patty and burger overall?  Maybe it's the location in the TL, but that's my point!

You don't have to be a 'gourmet' joint to serve a proper burger and Pearl's is just that!

Great burgers and great prices.  Just make sure you bring backup...i mean a friend when walking there.
author: Anthony L.

description: Did I have high expectations? Yes. We're they met? No. Am I going to keep answering my own questions? Maybe... Perhaps i'm not the burger guy I used to be, but this one was just mediocre. My relationship with the burger might be coming to a bitter end. Fries and Onion rings were very good though.
author: Jeff H.

description:
A very good burger. Would recommend.  Prices are great and the burgers and thick and juicy with fresh topings. Great milkshake as well. The staff was very friendly. 
I was expecting a sit down but be forwarded it is a order and then sit down at a few tables. "McDonald's style"
author: Brit F.

description: Best burger you can have. The ingredients are so fresh! Outstanding, friendly service. Mouthwatering and unique milkshake flavors. Stop reading, just eat here now.
author: Makenzie G.

description:
Pearl's is one of those hole in the wall places (even with the address we had to keep our eyes out to find the storefront) that is really all about the food and produces great dishes.

The bomb burger is well, the bomb.  Is it not for the faint of heart as it is essentially a giant platter with the burger smothered in delicious chili, cheddar and onions.  It is definitely not for the faint of heart, so I am glad I was particularly hungry that day.  The fries are really tasty as they have more texture than your traditional fast food fries.  They also have several side options and plenty of different types of burgers and toppings for whatever it might be that you are craving.  Friendly staff, quick service and affordable prices.  What more could you ask for?

I think the only down side is that the place is cash only, but other than that, it was fabulous!
author: Maria K.

description: JUST WOW!!!! The cheeseburger with bacon was just awesome. This place doesn't take credit cards so make sure you bring cash. I would so come back again.
author: Fabio G.

description:
Favorite burger joint in the city! The burgers are quite large, which I think should be a standard for a GOOD burger. Not to mention the best shakes to go with those fries ;) 

It can get quite packed during lunch or dinner, depending on the day. However, it's worth the wait!
author: K N.

description: Yelp says pearls closes at 11pm and the guy in the place said it close at ten and has for the last 11years.. now someone's lying, not gonna name no one but someone is wrong and I wasted my time to go there! Thanks
author: Kt S.

description:
This place is AWESOME. The food is amazing and fresh and the milkshakes are insane.

I'm vegetarian and pretty picky about veggie patties but this was pretty good. I got it on the spicy sly special burger - FANTASTIC. I got the peanut butter milkshake which was delicious! My friend got a vanilla shake, which was also really good and thick. The sweet potato fries were a little bland on their own (I'm not a huge fan of ketchup so I usually like for fries to have a lot of seasoning) but putting salt on them helped.

My only big complaint is the price, and that's why it doesn't get 5 stars from me. $19 for these three items. Don't get me wrong, it's worth it, but it's a little hard to swallow that I can't afford to go to a hole in the wall burger joint unless it's a special occasion. 

It is cash only - which is fine with me. They also have an ATM in there for anyone who forgets cash.
author: Anne S.

description: It's a little pricey, but honestly what isn't in San Francisco?, but my burger was wonderful and well worth every penny!
author: Nicole S.

description:
I can not rate this enough!!

Been traveling around the USA and I still haven't found a better burger yet. The owner is really friendly and will actually sit down and talk with you.

If you're staying at the hostel near it, this needs to be your staple food place!
author: David S.

description:
The tenderloin is a tricky place because of the people there but If,
your hungry for a burger try your fancy fixings at pearls. 

Pearl's It's classic, and never disappoints. 
Their burgers, fries and onion rings are delicious, 
I love mushroom burgers and anything where you can taste the quality of the seasoning and meat is truly good for me.

Customer service eh' I think it could've been better, 
I won't hold it agains't the place because it t'was packed.

The thing I reccomend to order is the 

- Oreo Shake - If done right as I had it!, would make you want to lick the Spoon
  and straws and the bottom of your shake glass until Nabisco comes to take you 
  away.

- Gotta love a place that has sweet potato fries!

It in general is afforable and not overpriced and your going to get full.
I dare you to eat here without getting messy...it's okay, try it for once.
I can see the ketchup all on your face right now! you Bastard!
author: Michael R.

description: Good burger but didn't blow me away. But I just got a deluxe burger so maybe I missed the boat.
author: Rob P.

description: My first visit to Pearl's - and all I can say is that eating one of their deluxe cheeseburgers was nothing short of a religious experience. Smothered with grilled mushrooms, I added bacon for the topper. Just unreal. I savored every mouthwatering bite. Any time I'm back in SF I will be sure to make a special visit here!
author: Stephen K.

description: The only other burger in SF that can rival Pearls is Roam.  Both burgers are just perfectly cooked.  I had the Kobe beef with avocado and cheese and it was magic.
author: Chelsey G.

description: Truly awesome veggie burger - but be prepared with napkins cause they're messy :D Been here twice, and will come back for sure. I can't decide whether this or Super Duper Burger makes the best veggie burger in San Francisco... hmm....
author: Marie V.

description: I was staying at a hostel across the street so I had a burger here after traveling from Monterey to SF. The burger and service was solid, but the place was tiny. I regret not getting a shake or fries, but oh well.
author: Gloria A.

description:
When it comes to burgers I am a loyal Fatburger customer but since moving to the Bay Area from Texas I have not come across any here. I decided to give this place a shot and boy was I surprised! The onion rings are to die for.
They were so good I even placed a second order while i was there.
Everything from the bun, to the lettuce, the burger, & the cheese, were fresh and flavorful! This is definitely my one stop shop for burgers when I'm in San Francisco.
The place was very clean and the customer service was excellent! Friendly staff that will answer any questions you have. I always have a crazy custom order for my burgers &  they were very friendly in accommodating me.
Will be back here again next time with my friends!
author: Chad L.

description:
Total bull crap you now only take CASH!  Your burgers are already expensive and now I have to take cash out to eat there! Just lost a few customers....stupid move!
Considering how often my friends and I have eaten there since we just live around the corner....boo
author: Mindy D.

description:
I knew I had to go visit this place after reading Mark D's review. He rates this joint as his favorite burger in San Francisco so I had to give it a shot despite the rain... 

I tried the Phat Bob (and hoped I didn't leave looking like one)... 

- The patty was cooked perfectly (medium)
- Great bacon 
- Crispy onion rings (loved it, wish we had more) 

Overall, a lovely burger at a humble, unpretentious joint. Was it better than in&out??? price-wise no but it definitely was a good burger. Great quality. Fresh ingredients. All american. Loved it. Definitely one of the better burger joints. Do stop by if you have the chance! Very friendly staff too!
author: Amanda L.

description:
I have not tried all the burgers the city has to offer, but this is my favorite. They use excellent grass feed beef, real high quality stuff; it is the life source of this burger. Good veggies, good bread. And that's just speaking on the Pearl's deluxe with cheddar, adding bacon cranks it up a notch. The Prized Pearl is a very good burger, as is the Phat Bob. Lately, I have been going with the mini w/ cheese and bacon. I feel it is a better distribution of flavors, and it allows me to enjoy all of Pearl's great fries without going into a food coma.  

Ah yes, the fries... slightly breaded, fried to perfection, as good as you will find. The frings are a solid option - half fries, half onion rings, and can be split two ways. It is a bold order on top of fries and a burger, but adding a milkshake is suggested if you really feel like doing some damage. 

PEARL'S IS THE BEST.

Also wins whole in the wall status, place is tiny.
author: Mark B.

description:
Staying in the neighborhood in an AirBnB rental and a chalkboard in the apartment had the words "Pearl Burgers ~ Prized Pearl + Garlic Fries" written on it.  Hoping it was left there as a suggestion, and not a warning, we made our way over to the restaurant.

Yelp said it took credit cards, but a sign on the door announced CASH ONLY. Luckily, we had cash, but they do have an ATM as a backup.  I don't actually have an ATM card (long story), so it wouldn't have helped me as much as correct information on Yelp would.  As soon as we set foot inside, I knew we were taking the meal to go.  It wasn't so divey that I'd refuse to eat there, but it was crowded, and I wasn't going to wait for a cramped table.  This wasn't a big deal since we were staying nearby.

Waiting in line I heard the very efficient guy manning the register take the order from the customer in front of me.  My ears perked up at the "How would you like your burger cooked?" question and the "medium rare" response.  Really? This dive hole in the wall not only cooked to doneness, but was willing to stop below medium?  Be still my bloody rare heart.  

We ordered the Prized Pearl and the Garlic Fries, because the chalk board in the apartment told us to.  We also got The Bomb (chili burger).  They asked for my name and we made our way to an empty spot to stand and wait for our food.  About 5 minutes later my daughter lamented that she'd forgotten to say "No mayonnaise."  They seemed really together and efficient so I decided to be that annoying person who goes up and asks to customize my order while it is already in progress.  They handled that without an eye roll or a hitch.

Soon a large bag was handed to me.  During the hand-off I caught the most alluring fragrance of mega-garlic wafting out of the bag.  Once we got on the street, I told my daughter "smell this" and waved the bag under her nose, our eyes met over the fumes and we double-timed it back to the apartment.

The garlic fries were great. Extremely garlicky, and crispy on the outside, soft on the inside.  They were great even after being trapped in a box for the walk back to the apartment.  I imagine they'd be even better if there'd been enough space too eat at the restaurant.  Fried food goes downhill quickly.

The Prized Pearl's bottom bun was completely soaked through and disintegrating from the juices.  This is a problem with To Go food, and I'd still rather have a juicy burger than a dry one.  Luckily there was a spare dry bun available from the chili burger because that works better with utensils anyway, so new bun to the rescue on the Prized Pearl.  It was very tasty.

Why was the chili burger bun dry?  Because they actually go ahead and package the chili separately as a side for To Go so it doesn't just all turn to mush.  Very good move on their part.  The chili burger was also good, but their housemade chili wasn't really to my taste.  It wasn't bad chili, as in overly greasy, or made with crap ingredients or anything, it just wasn't my particular preference, crossing a bit more over into the sweeter notes.  Not a big deal, definitely edible, but I probably wouldn't order it again.

We'd absolutely eat there again if staying nearby.
author: mstori ..

description: I had the Kobe Burger (rare) with Swiss cheese and a mint shake.  Amazing texture to the patty, so greasy (the way I like it) and so delicious.  Will definitely be going back.
author: Richie T.

description: Good burgers but it's nothing special...we got the bula burger, phat bob, and spicy sly with an order of garlic fries and sweet potato fries.  The bula was probably the best out of the bunch, while the spicy sly was my least favorite.  I thought the spicy sly was suppose to be a beef patty, however, what we got was a chicken patty that tasted super bland...do not order the garlic fries or sweet potato fries here, for $4 a side, it was tiny portion and didn't taste so great...not worth it...would I come again? Probably not, as there's plenty of other place that has better burgers in sf
author: Trang N.

description:
Finally tried Pearl's Deluxe Burgers in SF.  It's not very far from Union Square/Tenderloin - probably good for when you are tired from shopping or before or after a show.

Small place, maybe 7 small tables.  Order at the counter & they call out your number from your receipt.

I wasn't very hungry but still ordered a Turkey Burger $5.99 - it came on a wheat nut bun, lettuce, tomato, I asked for no onions, lite mayo, mustard, thick patty.  Pickles - FREE & help yourself near the register.  Charged it!

W. got a Mini burger (1/4 lb) $4.29 - it was well done, though she likes almost raw.

I asked for tap water.

Would like to try Veggie Burger $5.99 & a Peanut Butter milk shake $3.49 or under Special Shakes: Nutella $3.99.

One unisex bathroom in the back.

Hrs:
M-Th 11a-10p
F-Sat 11-11p
Sun 12-9p

http://www.pearlsdeluxe.com/
author: Ann L.

description:
Today was an especially cold day in San Fran.. and I needed some comfort food. I've seen this burger joint packed with people and long lines during the week, and I live a block away so decided to give it a try. Yelp says it's good so why not?

Loved the feeling of this place.. like an old diner with mom and pop behind the counter. It's teeny tiny also so added to that feeling. They have quite a large selection of burgers but I'm a sucker for blue cheese so went with the Prized Pearl and ordered side of sweet potato fries. Partner had the The Bomb burger smothered in chili. My burger was so flavorful. The bacon was thick and.. well, it's thick and it's bacon what else can I say?!? LOVE bacon! Blue cheese and caramelized onions was added bonus. The meat was cooked perfectly, and very moist. Ok, greasy! haha Fries were yummy. My partner's chili burger was gone in 5 seconds.. I think he inhaled the whole thing haha. 

I do regret not seeing on the menu garlic fries because I saw someone else ordered them and they looked sooooo good! Smothered in garlic?! Heck yeah! OK next time. Plus there are so many other specialty burgers on the menu that I would love to try. Even the buffalo meat, and Kobe beef ($4 extra). Well.. maybe after I go running for a week :)
author: Vol T.

description: Love this joint! Best veggie burger in town. Whenever I order here, I can never resist the temptation to get a shake and the deep fried french fries. Pearls is great for a quick and delicious meal.
author: Megan N.

description: Don't get me wrong, the Prized Pearl is tasty, but you can't even take a bite without a drip of grease fall on your jacket. The burguer just disintegrates, the toothpick put to hold the burguer can't hold it, the bum was soggy and it's a mess (at least for me) to eat this way. The fries were good though. Will come back in another opportunity to check whether the burguer stills the same.
author: Thompson V.

description:
I've been back to this place twice since I first wrote my review and it's consistently, solidly amazing burger amazing-ness. Every time. God, I love their Oreo shakes. LOVE LOVE LOVE THEIR OREO SHAKES.

I want a Pearl's burger right now.
author: Ashley P.

description: Walked into this quaint little spot and was immediately in love. Nice people. Nice spot. The food was more than filling and the portions are huge. The milk shake was perfection. The burgers are big so if your appetite isn't you might want to share.
author: Beth P.

description:
Pearls has the best burgers in the city hands down. I've tried almost every burger on their menu and they all deliver the goods. They use high quality grass-fed beef, which produces a noticeably more delicious hamburger.

Burgers like the Bula Burger and the Phat Bob are staples here. However, I would urge you to try their Pesto Burger. After my tenth visit here I decided to venture out from my Bula/Phat Bob safety zone and give the Pesto Burger a try. It's now my new favorite burger on their menu.

Their french fries and onion rings are also outstanding. If you come here only once and don't know if you'll be back, you should definitely ask them to give you a half order of each just so you can try both.
author: Andrew M.

description: If you want a great burger I highly recommend this restaurant. The employees are very friendly. There is limited seating so you may have to wait for a seat. I would definitely go back again.
author: Mike G.

description:
Sly Burger & Banana shake
How can you resist this place. Pearl's took the definition of "juicy" to a whole new level with the Sly Burger. They're pretty famous for their shake's, so make sure to grab one with your burger. The banana chunks are so amazing.
Service is splendid, and the cashier is probably the nicest and friendliest cashier you'll see on Post Street. *hint*
author: Sina N.

description: Came to frisco with the fam after walking the hills of marin headlands and i was starved. I came to pearls and this place is a must try super friendly super good and the kobe is so tender . My girl took down the bomb and i tried that too. Also really good. Love it here
author: Benny C.

description: Got the Kobe bleu cheeseburger with grilled onions and mayo cooked medium. It was fantastic. 5 stars.
author: Brandon H.

description:
This place is GREAT! I mean I would consider not attending a family members funeral GREAT!

The Blueberry Cheesecake shake is awesome. So is the Peach Cheesecake shake, so it the Chocolate Nutella Shake. Their shakes in general are amazing and tasty.

Their burgers are amazing and the sweet potato fries, jeez eating one is a sin, which makes me a very very bad man.

Keep up the good work, when I come back to San Francisco I am coming to eat here first.
author: Luis D.

description: The best burger spot in San Francisco! Hands down!!! Every time we visit or go hike in the city we work up an appetite just for Pearl's. I recommend the Phat Bob and add the fried egg. Also add the basket of springs (sweet potato fries & onion rings). You can also order buffalo and kobe beef for an extra charge. Visit Pearl's Deluxe Burger and you won't be disappointed!!!
author: Brian S.

description: Best burgers ever!  I do recommend!  Place is small, about 5 tables to eat on.  There were four of us and we each had a different burger.  Mine was the Teriyaki Burger which tasted excellent.  Cooked as ordered.  I hear the California burger with fresh avocados was excellent as well.  I ordered sweet potato fries, cooked a bit over done, however the burger made up for it.
author: Diane R.

description: I ordered the prized pearl burger without bacon. It was more than a hamburger. In addition to a choice beef patty, the prized pearl had bleu cheese smeared beautifully across the upper bun and caramelized onions. This burger is the burger for me.
author: Lindsay R.

description:
This is the first time I've been and I took my order to go.

I had the deluxe burger with cheese and garlic fries. The garlic fries were the best I've ever had and they used real garlic! The burger was cooked medium well and perfect.

The portion sizes were quite large...even the small portion of fries were plenty for 2!
author: Amber C.

description: I can highly recommend this place. It's a typical burger bar with a few seats and a great service. The burgers are more than delicious. A perfect meat, fresh products and really good sauces. The staff is supernice and knows how to make you happy!!!
author: Markus I.

description:
Good, but very little space inside.

The garlic fries are actually covered in fresh, big chunks of garlic.

They lose a star because, while I like crispy thick bacon, I would prefer that it not be completely blackened.
author: Jason F.

description:
Great burgers! 

I though this was a normal restaurant so when I walked in, I first wanted to walk out. It's a tiny hole-in a wall, with a few metal chairs and tables. 

However, we stayed and sat down - the best decision ever! Amazing burgers and fun atmosphere.
author: B G.

description:
Thanks Yelp! Saw the reviews and wanted a place we could take a trolley ride to - this is an absolutely wonderful dive with about 5 tables and a very, very friendly staff.

As previous reviews have said, the burgers are cooked to perfection, and are moist and delicious. My kids split a chicken burger (yummy) and the wife even topped off the evening with a large, large ice cream cone!

Will for sure be back when I'm in S.F.

NOTE: As of Jan 1st, they only take CASH (but they have an ATM machine there)
author: Matthew B.

description:
Got a Pearl's deluxe with cheese, medium without mayo, half/half sweet potato and regular fries, and a mint chocolate milkshake.  Holy cow, I inhaled all of my food so quickly it's not even funny.  The burger was juicy and delicious.  I was extremely satisfied.  I liked the sweet potato fries more than the regular fries, because they weren't as greasy and had more "meat" to them.

The milkshake is so thick that it comes with a boba straw, not a regular skinny straw.  That would be too weak.  I originally wanted Oreo but they ran out (saddest news I've ever heard), but the mint chocolate was damn good.  It's very smooth, they don't leave chunks of chocolate chips in there.

The price is pretty reasonable, and service is super fast.  Not a ton of room to sit there and eat, but this isn't fine dining anyway.
author: Jess H.

description: Can't go wrong having a regular pearl cheeseburger with frings and a Pepsi. Some of the best fries I've had in a while; they're consistently fluffy and crispy. The subtle flavors make you savor and appreciate the food. I was impressed by one of the nice workers, he was vigilant in keeping the place clean and organized: my table was immediately wiped down and a chair that belonged at the window seat was swapped out (I didn't even notice the chairs were out of place). I look forward to trying their other burgers
author: James L.

description: I may not be from San Francisco, nor have I tried a lot of burger places in SF but I can tell you this one is pretty great. Consistently fresh burgers at a relatively affordable price and great service. Can definitely recommend.
author: Hannah F.

description: Talk about great burgers!!Oh my gosh! These literally melt in your mouth.
author: Porcelain B.

description: I was here last month and gave this place a try. I got the Bula burger.....oh my gosh!!! It was amazing! The garlic fries could put to shame anything you'd find at the Gilroy Garlic Festival because I swear there was a whole head of garlic chopped up and served on top of the fries. This a little hole-in-the-wall establishment, but my meal was prepared with speed. If it isn't too busy, you can find a seat inside or take your food to go. I only regret not trying one of the milkshakes. The gentleman who took my order was friendly. This place is cash only, but there is an ATM inside.
author: Monica B.

description: Had a great hotdog! The menu was difficult to get through - a comprehensive wall menu isn't easy to read through after a few drinks. They have every option imaginable and the people who work behind the counter seem good-humored!
author: Kira G.

description:
We were in the area and stopped in for a quick bite. 

I got the pesto burger which tasted okay. The patty was juicy and cooked perfectly though! The flavors on the other hand..just wasn't going together. 

Their fries were crispy, thats a plus. 

Pickles were good. 

Overall, the place wasn't bad, burgers were cooked nicely, I just picked the wrong one. Felt a little greasy.  Don't know if I'll be back or not.
author: Annie D.

description:
Alright, this first time I set foot in Pearl's Deluxe Burgers was ~ 4 years ago before the Epik High concert at the Moscone Center (anyone go to that concert, anyone know Epik High?). Anyways, after that, I was pretty much hooked on Pearl's and often I would bring people from out of town to try the delicious burgers (ie Mr. Boyfriend, we seriously drove from the sunset area to the TL area to have a burger once because he was craving it - sadly I drove). 

I wouldn't say these are the BEST burgers out there but it's pretty darn tasty and if you are in the area definitely pop in and have yourself a burger, fries, and a shake - well, maybe share, cause you'll be full. extremely full. Or if you aren't in the area and you want to check our Pearl's I don't think you'll be disappointed because I wasn't disappoint 4 years ago when we decided to pop in for some food. 

..now I want a Pearl's burger, oh the power of just talking about food, and it's noon!
author: Mona L.

description:
Been passing by this place for the longest time, but never stopped in to try it. Burger places have been disappointing me lately. Either because their burgers are not made well or their customer service is lacking. Sometimes you can let the customer service thing slide if the food makes up for it.  But luckily at Pearl's you don't have to sacrifice either. Their food is great and their staff is friendly and polite. 

Oh yeah, I'm feeling like a happy little baby piggy right about now. Make that an incredibly adorable, happy little baby piggy with garlic and onion breath... You see, this little piggy went to Pearl's and had a pesto burger and a order of springs (1/2 order of sweet potato fries and 1/2 order of onion rings). 

Some of the best onion rings I've ever had - lightly battered, good crunch, not too salty, and a little bit peppery. The sweet potato fries were cooked well, had a nice texture though maybe not crunchy enough for some people and were unevenly salted, but otherwise very good. 

The pesto burger, cooked medium rare was pretty darn perfect. I ate almost the whole thing except for maybe a third of the bun. Most of the time when I order a burger elsewhere, I leave most of the bread behind because most other places make their burgers so dry, that having to eat all that dry bread along with the dry meat would be a real chore for me. No such worries at Pearl's. My burger meat was juicy and flavorful, topped with a generous slice of Jack cheese (no paper-thin, barely visible cheese here) and lovingly slathered with enough pesto sauce to leak out of the sides with each bite.  

You'll need at least 4-5 napkins... No use trying to look cute, prim or proper while eating this burger. Go ahead, take that big ass bite. No one else is looking at you. They're too busy getting into little piggy mode, themselves...
author: Danielle O.

description:
this place is amazing! granted, i've never tasted its delicious meat fruit while sober, but like i always say, drunk me loves it, and i trust that guy (he has good taste). 
the burgers are all super juicy, no need to get american kobe or american wagyu or whatever they call it (i'll eschew my usual "i hate the piss poor quality meat that americans call american kobe/wagyu").
obviously not as good as Hubert Keller's Burger Bar, or even Godfather's in peninsula or Flavor in HMB, but this place is as good as it gets for hole-in-the-wall prices.
author: Xander C.

description:
the worst food ever. i ordered a burger, fries and a milkshake and the bill was 34 dollars. the milkshake was 8 dollars. the dry burger was 19 dollars and the soggy fries was 7 dollars.

i could have gotten a fine dining experience with amazing food, a luxurious ambiance and great service for that amount.
author: Leslie M.

description:
Juicy, tender, yummy burger

I had the Bula Burger: special sauce, bacon, mayo, and swiss, cooked medium.  The burger was juicy and dripping, cooked to perfection.  The bacon was cut a little thick but it was buttery and not salty like other bacons.  The cheese was melty and creamy.  What made the burger so great was the sauce: it tasted like the pinapple teriyaki sauce from costco, mixed with a little bit of chili peper and garlic butter - savory and tangy with a kick of spice.  I would definetly recommend this burger to anyone

Springs: 
- Sweet Potato Fries - slightly crispy on the outside, just the way i like it
- Onion Rings - the crispiest onion rings i have ever had.  the batter was perfectly seasoned with salt and pepper

Overall a great place to come hungry and eat a huge burger!  I felt a little guilty about eating the burger when I saw that my burger juice drippings had solidified into lard on my tray, but it's all worth it!  Eat now, regret later.  A must-try place for burger lovers.
author: Tina A.

description: One of the best burgers I have ever had, cooked perfect, thick cut bacon, onion rings were awesome.
author: Adam S.

description:
It was 9pm by the time I'd gotten to my hotel, the night before a job interview. I hadn't eaten since 2pm, and despite the voice in my head (probably my common sense) that warned against eating a burger so late at night, I decided to drop in on Pearl's, ordering a phat bob with a buffalo patty, and a side of garlic fries, for a grand total of $17.

All in all, a decent burger, but not one worth eating two hours before I needed to go to bed. The flavors were fairly standard, and the bun, while better than average, was still rather disappointing. The garlic fries were a total disappointment - while indeed very garlicy, the fries were boring and dry.

To be honest, Seattle has spoiled me; we have a LOT of burger joints up here, which has raised my expectations on all aspects of the burger - yes, the bun included. But, again, Pearl's isn't bad. And it's neat that they offer kobe and buffalo patty options.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Kind of pricey, but it still stands really good in my eyes. 

Their veggie burger is big, juicy, and delicious.
The sweet potato fries are really good too. Pearl's also provides pickles you can get to add on to your burger. 

They have a number of milkshake flavors and I love the banana flavor. Thick, creamy, and fulfills my sweet tooth. Yay!
author: Rachel C.

description:
I had hoped for more after looking at the Yelp rating but I don't see anything special about this place. Burger was mushy inside, not a proper medium rare. Everything on the burger was very fresh and lettuce was crispy. 
I would venture back but it's nothing special, just another burger place. 
I'd like to try their buffalo burgers but they start at $14 and with what I had today I'm less than ecstatic to pay more for a less than great burger.
author: Chuck R.

description: Soooooooooo BOMB! Best burger place ever!!! Randomly came across it and I'm so glad I did. The customer service is amazing! Such a great place!
author: Ana-Silvia V.

description:
I came here last night with my husband after his recommendation and the recommendation of my aunt.  I was excited to try the establishment out and have a basic burger with some bacon and spries (sweet potato and regular fries). My aunt claimed these burgers were top notch and ranked them over super duper. Super super happens to make some of my favorite burgers so I had to try pearls ASAP! 
My husband ordered a burger with cheese and bacon and I got mine with just bacon both done medium and with all the fixings.  We were not at disappointed and enjoyed every last bite. The burgers were cooked with just enough pink to make me happy and they were juicy! I love juice coming out of a burger and dripping down my hands something about that just screams " I am GOOD", however mine was lacking in the juice department as compared to my husbands but that was fine.  

It is cash only and there are only a handful of tables so prepare accordingly. We did not try the shakes despite the huge variety of flavors but I guess that gives us another excuse to come back. I would hands down recommend the establishment to anyone who asks for a nice burger in the city!
author: Jacyn B.

description: I had the Pearl Deluxe burger with Bacon and American Cheese. Man it was so dope. Will be coming back here for sure.
author: Leon T.

description: Based on taste I'd give it 4 stars but when a burger is good not great and its $23 its a 3 star place to me. Fries are better than average but not memorable. I'm sure their are better burgers in San Fran at a $20 price point or burgers that are just as good for half the cost.
author: Chad S.

description: The restaurant is very small, But the burgers are amazing and the staff are very friendly. I love it. I will be back to this restaurant every time I visit Tenderloin.
author: Maher S.

description: This sh#t right here niqqa this the mona lisa of burgers  10 bucks for a fat juicy burger that I cant even fit in my mouth I had to eat it piece by piece the breads from a bakery its toasty as hell the meat doesnt taste frozen and the frings are uber crunchy it comes with fat slices of tomato and a friggin trees worth of lettuce on that mo 10/10 would bang
author: Anthony M.

description:
I dined at the Post St location last spring while in Frisco.  (I can say "Frisco."  Ironically.  I'm from New York.  Go away.)  I had a deluxe with bacon, and fries.  I then went to the Market St joint.  Same superb food.  For fast food -- and this isn't fine dining, folks -- it's as great as you'll get.

Best of all is the service.  Friendly, above and beyond.  I'm a fan, permanently.  Thank you.
author: John D.

description: Jesus Christ Yelp. It was fucking good. Did I meet the word requirement for this review yet?
author: Spencer A.

description: I went here with a friend last night, amazing burgers! They are super fast too! I had the Teriyaki burger. I don't remember what my friend had.. The burgers are huge, the shakes and fries looked really good too but I knew the burger would be enough to fill me up. Plan on going back.
author: Dario L.

description:
Best burger I've had. Better than shake shack, better than in-n-out.

I generally remove one bun from my burgers (too much bread), but the buns are so good here! Got a classic cheeseburger: everything is fresh! Bf got Kobe mushroom burger: fab! The bacon is thick, has meat.. Not cheap thin pre cooked stuff. 

Will always stop by every time I'm in the Bay Area.
author: Bee T.

description:
My Husband and I were looking for some comfort food after a long weekend of boozing and decided to give Pearls a try. Delish!

I had the Teriyaki burger and my Husband had the deluxe with bacon and cheddar. He ate the whole thing in about 4 mins and crushed a strawberry shake too! The garlic fries were crispy and tasty as well. Everything was cooked very well and the service was fast and friendly. We will be back here very soon!
author: Katy M.

description:
I've been to this place four times. And all four times, I was not impressed with their burgers. I have ordered the mini deluxe burger twice, the pearl's burger once, and the spicy sly. The spicy sly is very oily and it's not spicy (plus, it's a weird burger with some bell peppers). The bun overall is very unimpressive. The patties are on the dry side. I really wanted to like this place because it's really close to where I live. But the burgers are just really not juicy. And I really don't like their buns, which are not soft. 

The burgers are also really really overpriced. 9 dollars for a burger only is really expensive. I have to spend about 15 dollars on myself whenever I visit this place. Wish it can be cheaper or maybe have a combo with the fries. 

Burgers goes from 8.99. Mini burger is 6.99. Fries are 2.99 (small fries). The only reason I give this place 2 stars is because their fries are really good and crunchy. I would come back for the fries, but definitely not the burger. 

I also remember that the first time I visited, I said no to the drinks and a person in the back said something like "who orders burgers and fries without drinks?" It was rather unpleasant overall and I've been hesitating to go back. If not for how close it is to me, I would have never come back after the first time.
author: Erni L.

description:
DISCLAIMER: I got my burgers to-go. From the moment we picked them up, there was about a 10 minute time frame between when they were picked up and when we started eating.
___________________________________

GET: Banana Nutella Milkshake
SKIP: Burgers
___________________________________

I don't really understand the hype with these burgers. The bun gets too soggy to hold up within 10 minutes, then just kind of falls apart in your hands like mush. Yet the patty itself, juicy as it is, has a little bit of that "dehydrated meat" quality to it. It's a really strange sensation. I still finished my burger cus my appetite was INSANE during that particular phase of my pregnancy, but my husband barely finished half of his. The garlic fries were nicely flavored but just a touch on the soggy side.

The milkshakes, on the other hand... well, good enough that throughout my second trimester there was a 2-week period where we came here every other day just to pick one up.

The folks at Pearl's can also mix and match your milkshake, and I especially loved the Nutella Banana blend.
author: Asha S.

description:
It's place has fallen apart since an employee by the name of Josh recently left. The food is still pretty good, but the employees generally come across borderline brain dead. Without fail, every.time. there is SOME issue wrong with my order. Whether it be the burger meat still raw, not putting chocolate in my chocolate pb shake, forgetting to include my fries (but still charging me of course), etc.

Bottom line, I will go here if I don't want to walk far, but have to prepare myself for the impending screwup that comes with ordering from Pearls. sad.
author: S. V.

description: This review is soley on the fries. My friends and I came here and ordered some fries to go. The fries are simply delicious. The fries are thick and crispy, possibly the best fries I have ever had. Quick and good service too.
author: Larry H.

description:
As I look in the mirror, I see a love handle on my left and a love handle on my right. On the left, half of a Phat Bob: barbecue sauce, bacon, mayo, onion rings, jack cheese and a half-pound of beefness on a bun that tried ever so hard to make it through the adventure. On the right, half of a Spicy Sly: pumpkin habanero sauce, peppers, mayo, jack cheese and a half-pound of beef coma on a bun that tried to keep it together in the face of adversity. 

Sure, many say this is the best burger joint in The City. But I think of Pearl's and I picture my love handles, which I now see as a tasty, juicy alternative to a svelte figure.
author: Tim O.

description: This place is great, small little burger joint with fantastic bacon burgers. There fries are very good as well, but not so much for the onion rings but regular fries are prime. Definitely will be back next time I visit San Francisco.
author: Nick S.

description:
Great service, great burger, great milk shake choice of beef, Kobe, buffalo meat
Cash only is the only bummer but there is an atm
author: doug k.

description:
My friends, I have seen the promised land...surprisingly it's a burger joint in Lower Nob Hill. I had the deluxe bison burger with cheese, and it blew my damn mind. Hyperbole aside, it might have been the best burger I've ever had. The burger was cooked just right (medium for me), the toppings and condiments were perfect, and the bun was on point. Plus, the place has a real laid back feel to it, and the guys working the counter were real nice dudes. 

Seriously consider splurging on the bison burger over beef: it's much richer, with considerably more flavor, and it's amazingly a much healthier option. Who knew?
author: M G.

description:
This place has the best burgers!  I had a Phat Bob (bbq sauce, bacon, mayo, onion rings, and jack cheese) and some fries. It was amazing. So much so that when I find myself in Bay Area, I make sure I make my way here. 

You won't be disappointed!
author: Kim V.

description: Since you've become more popular, things are just not the same anymore. It's like... You just don't take the time to do the things you used to do. And things are just not as good. I'm sorry, but I think this is the end.
author: Jess C.

description:
Delicious. The burgers are juicy and all toppings (and bun) are fresh and high quality. The fries and onion rings are thick and crunchy - with a yummy, almost like crumb coating. The shakes are my favorite part: so thick and umptious, with quality (homemade!) icecream that you WILL appreciate. 

Burgers I've had, or taken bites of other people's: Bula (with bison), Mushroom, Phat Bob, Spicy Sly. My favorite is the Bula. The 1/2 regular, 1/2 sweet potato fries are my side choice. Have tried both the oreo and chocolate peanut butter shake, the oreo was a teeny bit better (oreo chunk texture).

Go here. Best burgers and shakes I've had in the bay!
author: Aimee B.

description:
the fries and onion rings here are amazing. likely one of the best I've had in the city...if you like the extra crispy and flavorful kind that tastes just as fresh after you've finished your burger. 

I had the pearl deluxe, which was tasty and huuuge. half was all I needed. 

upgraded kobe beef was somewhat of a disappointment...didn't taste like kobe and was very gamey. I'd suggest saving the $5.99 for milkshakes instead. 

also pricier than I would have wanted to pay for burgers and fries
author: Nattie X.

description:
I was lured here after all the Yelp reviews. Plus DH loves him a good burger and I, occasionally enjoy one, especially when it's got all the fixins.  

We ordered:
Mini Deluxe w/Cheese (Medium Well)  4.99
Mushroom Burger (Medium) $8.99 + $4 Kobe Beef
Springs $3.99
Nutella Shake $4.99
Strawberry Shake $4.39
