They mixed up our orders and my Mini Deluxe ended up being Medium and DH's Kobe Beef Burger was Medium Well. If you love Kobe beef, you know that it's no good when it's over cooked. So that put a little ding in our experience. DH was a little less than impressed because of that but overall we both liked what we got. Next time, I'd get just the Sweet Potato Fries hold the Onion Rings since they were a bit too salty for my taste. For sure, I will be trying the Bula Burger as well.  The Nutella shake will always be a staple for me since Nutella is one of my all time favorites. $5 is a bit steep for a shake, but they do this pretty well here and know it - hence charging more for a "premium" shake.

It's a bit pricey (a nearly $40 meal for two when you include tip) for burgers, fries, and shakes, but you do get what you pay for. 
Despite the owners pleasant and patient disposition and asking how we wanted our burgers cooked, hopefully next time they'll get the orders right.
author: Anna R.

description:
OoOo, late night burgers and fries. Open til 2am on Fridays and Saturdays!

The burgers here remind me of the simple, sloppy burgers that you would throw together at a backyard barbeque. But JUICIER.

The Buffalo and Kobe patty options, are impressive. Tried a buffalo burger for the first time here...loved it! Half as "sinful" a.k.a caloric as a beef patty but just as tasty and juicy (the patties are pretty small though. I think their weights are after-cooked weights). Sesame seed buns...thick and spongy, and toasted. ALSO, there are pickle halves on the counter for your unlimited taking. I approve. 

Swiss/jack/bleu/American cheese, avocado, onions, bacon, mushrooms, pineapple, and a few different sauces like pesto, bbq, spicy sauce...for toppings. By the way, the Pumpkin Habanero sauce that comes on some of the burgers is spicy like it wants revenge. I am so glad I got it on the side. I normally like spicy...but damn!

Lastly, there is something about their SWEET POTATO FRIES. So very flavorful and fried perfectly on the outside, tender inside, and not the least bit greasy or soggy. I did not expect them to be so flavorful. DARE you stop by this hole-in-the-wall, slightly exceptional burger joint and find out for yourself?
author: Jessica C.

description: I don't get it, the high ratings must be for portion sizes which are generous. But a lot of boring, ok food doesn't do it for me. We had Avocado burgers and they were mediocre, no flavor- salt and pepper helped. Same with coleslaw, no flavor. Onion rings were pretty good. Super Duper burgers are 300% better...and so are their fries.
author: Daniel K.

description: Probably the best burger in the city! Highly recommend it :)
author: Sara K.

description:
Burgers are huge. That is a plus. The meat is well done if you ask for it and they don't over cook it. Juicy and fills up the patty and then some. The chili is good but it has beans, so its not really chili but chili wit beans :)

The only real problem I found is that it doesn't seem like the meat is seasoned in any way. Nor the chili has that much salt. I actually was able to taste the flavors not overdone with salt. Problem is that seasonings do bring out the flavors in meat dishes and burger meat is no exception. I found it kind of flavorless and I don't eat that much salt. So, I would recommend for the portion and how well cooked things were but not so much for how well seasoned they were.
author: Brandon D.

description: The bacon cheeseburger might have been the best burger I've ever had.  It was so juicy and had the perfect ratio of toppings to bun and patty.  The cheese was all melty.  The chili cheese fries were a humungous portion!  The fries were still crispy and the cheese was real!  The Ice cream cone for $2.50 was a steal and was bigger than my face.  I dipped some of my fries into the vanilla and it tasted like a funnel cake.  Next time I'm gong to try it with a little oreo at the bottom.
author: Elise G.

description:
I came to Pearl's on a whim and tried the deluxe burger with cheese and springs (half sweet potato fries/half onions rings). I picked up my burger and already felt the fluffiness of the burger buns but after my first bite, I found that the burger was not very flavorful. I kept taking more bites and could see the good quality of the burger but I just couldn't find any flavor, nothing from the melted cheese or the patty. There was just an obvious lack of any seasoning on the beef patty. On the other hand, the sweet potato fries were just as delicious as reviews rave and although the onion rings were thick and sweet, the batter had fallen off of half of the rings. I did throw in their special nutella + cheesecake milkshake which had yummy nutella goodness but I really couldn't tell there was a cheesecake component in the milkshake.

I'd like to give Pearl's another shot. Maybe one of their special burgers would be a better option next time I visit but I really expected much more.
author: Maya S.

description: I've been meaning to come here for years and Pearl's didn't disappoint. I got the one with the mushrooms, bacon and bleu cheese and it was a juicy beast of a thing. Though I was still a bit hungry after since I got the smaller size of the available options but I think my cholesterol is fine with my choices.
author: Misha T.

description: You craving a fantastic burger? You gotta get to Pearl's. Incredible food but bring your cash cuz they don't take cards.
author: James H.

description: Overall, I was underwhelmed by Pearl's. The burger is good, but the fries are oily and over-fried. The place itself is small and feels like any random fast food joint. Don't mean to be picky but considering all the reviews, I don't think it holds up to the hype.
author: I G.

description:
Give me another BUFFALO BURGER please!!
Good thing, we came here just in time before the line got long and was outside the door.
First time I have ever tried Buffalo and I must say it is absolutely FANTASTIC. With a side of SPRINGS  ( half sweet potato and half onion rings) , my lunch was PERFECT! I don' think I had to eat another meal that day, except that we went to Bullitt and had Totchos!

Will definitely come back and try other burgers!
author: Claudine V.

description: I can't even order a burger anywhere else now THEY ARE THAT GOOD!!! Strawberry Nutella milkshake  YUM & the staff is always hella nice
author: Marine M.

description: How does this place have less than 5 stars? Amazing service and amazing burgers! Love the options and shakes. Will always be back thank you
author: Tara J.

description:
This place is awesome!!! Without a doubt my favorite burgers in SF. Always fresh and always delicious! And just wait until you try their french fries. They are amazing! Screw your diet and treat yourself to some Pearls Deluxe burgers! 
Also the service is great! Everyone is always very friendly and helpful.
author: Alex M.

description:
I have to update my review now that I've been there a few times. I certainly don't love the place less; nay, I love it even more. This place is absolutely fantastic. The vibe is divey, and the building is tiny, but the quality of the food and ingredients is unbeatable. The service is always quick and friendly. 

The Phat Bob is the unquestionable winner in my opinion. Thick cut bacon, a delicious spicy bbq sauce, cheese, and onion rings. It's insanely good. 

Coming in at a close second, is the Bula Burger. This has a big pineapple ring, and a sweet & spicy teriyaki sauce. Totally amazing. 

I also recommend ordering "frings", which are french fries and onion rings mixed together. 

And I would be a bad person if I didn't tell you to get the oreo shake before you leave. It will make you feel like you are about to give birth (and indeed, you might be), but it's completely worth it.
author: Sam W.

description: This burger joint is amazing! The fries are delicious and the peanut butter chocolate shake is fab!!!
author: Court S.

description: Yum! This was a great find! We decided to check out this place after finding it on Yelp. We were craving burgers, and this place definitely delivered. The selection is quite big, I had trouble deciding which burger to get. The fries and onion rings were really great. This is one of those dingy looking places that turns out to be your go-to.
author: Mary N.

description: Burgers are really good here!  The meat patty is gigantic!!! Must try if you are in SF for a decently cheap meal.
author: Phu P.

description:
I got the Phat Bob with the Kobe Beef upgrade and an order of half sweet potato fries and half regular fries.
This meal was pretty legit and worthwhile.

The burger was filling and the quality of meat is up there.
I think there was bleu cheese in my burger.
The sweet potato fries were good and the regular fries were alright.
I'd actually recommend just getting just onion rings instead.

This place gets pretty busy so don't be surprised if there's a line or no place to sit. Furthermore, the whole restaurant is narrow and you have to weave around people when it's at capacity.
I wouldn't mind coming back here but there's just too many other good places to check out.
author: Marlon T.

description:
Simply fantastic hamburgers!  Thanks, Yelpers, for your recommendations!  

I had the Pearl Deluxe & loved it.  The onion rings was superb.  The place is a bit small but it is cozy & kept clean.  The prices are more than reasonable for food of this quality.  The staff were friendly and no nonsense.  

I don't eat junk food often but this meal was worth the calories.
author: Michael L.

description: Came to pearls cuz I was craving a burger. Not just any burger but a really good one! Read a lot about Pearls so thought i'd try it. It is definitely worth the trip! I had a teriyaki mushroom burger. It was a pretty good size burger, prolly 1/2 lb (at least that's what my stomach told me) the teriyaki sauce was sweet and tangy (not too sweet). The burger was juicy and just made my mouth salivate after every bite. Had some frings (fries & onion rings) to go with it and a peanut butter shake! Heavenly! Definitely will go back for another burger maybe the Bison burger!
author: Roger P.

description: Best burger on post street. Had the spicey sly. Hit the spice mark perfectly! Loved the selection of toppings! And the pickles are delicious! Definitely worth hitting up! Cash only joint.
author: Jennifer F.

description:
I ate here yesterday with two other co-workers that recommended this place to me. I was looking forward to trying this place out because I like to enjoy a good burger. I heard they had specialty burgers that I just had to try.

We arrived right before noon and decided to eat here. At the stroke of noon a swarm of people came in for lunch but mostly for takeout. I ordered the King burger and had it cooked medium with onions. We also ordered a large size of garlic fries and I tried some of the sweet potato fries as well. If it doesn't get all over the place, it doesn't belong in your face. The burger was really big, juicy, and full of sauce (Thousand Island) when I dug into it. I like how there's a hot dog in my burger, what a great idea! I was very satisfied with burger and left very full. We walked it off heading back to the office.

Overall this place deserves 3.5 stars for the food, location, and service.
author: Tim G.

description:
In a burger mood? Do not even think about it. Go directly to Pearl's. 

Strange, but the place smelled weird upon walking in. As soon as I got used to it...not an issue. We ordered Phat burgers,the guy had jack cheese on his (Phat's are 1/2 pound..there's also a 1/4 pound) with mushrooms, medium rare. Unbelievably juicy and flavorful. Sweet potato fries were delicious. The guy had a vanilla shake because he did not realize that there are 15 shake flavors..(he would've had blueberry, had he known). Not many tables. We were lucky to snag one at dinner time on Sunday before a show at Great American Music Hall. 

Can't wait to go back...
author: Bleep S.

description: How have I not heard of this place before? This is officially my new favorite burger and shake spot in the city.
author: Justin M.

description:
What new to add to the existing 814 reviews of Pearl's?

Well ... my burger and fries were fresh-off the grill/out of the fryer hot. I mean, HOT. Four hours later I still feel that numb spot on my tongue where the burger's grease/juice shot out on my first bite.

Not that that's so bad, lol ... better hot than standing on a counter for too long.  I'll know to be a little more careful the next visit. 

Grilled-to-perfection, immensely juicy/greasy burgers -- I was hitting the napkins at least every other bite. Eclectic assortment of extras and beef for a burger 'joint' (I had the Pearl Deluxe ... blue cheese, grilled onions, and bacon. HOT bacon.) No wimpy bun here either, just enough to (almost) hold the burger ensemble together.

Frings were ok/good; onion rings more a star than the fries, the latter of which didn't have much staying power thru the course of the meal.  The service is genuinely friendly, and helpful.   But "best burger in the Bay" ... ? I'd say that's a matter of personal preference (with pardons to Tyler F.), but mine ranked up with the top contenders.

Limited seating; area parking is bad.  But if you're hankering for a burger & fries in the Union Square area, but dogged by dieter's guilt ... may I suggest skipping Mel's, Lori's, the inconsistent Burger Bar, etc. and take the ten-minute walk uphill to Pearl's Deluxe.  And call the artery-clogging goodness your just rewards for the cardio session  :)
author: John Z.

description:
SO good. I was considering giving it a 4 star because of the ambiance (little joint), but the burgers and fries are just too good to pass up a 5 star rating.

Food: Fries are warm and crispy (best I've ever had) and the burger was well-cooked, great taste and fresh ingredients. Side pickles are delicious. Btw, the mini sized burger (1/3 lb) is plenty!
Service: Young, super nice and friendly staff
Price: VERY reasonable.
Ambiance: Kinda bleh.. but it's CLEAN! Can't vouch for restroom.

Highly recommended.
author: Nora N.

description: I had the avocado burger which was ok. The onions rings on the other hand were delicious. This is a cash only business and since I never carry cash anymore was disappointing. I had to use their ATM and incur a $2 bank fee to take out money.
author: Christine M.

description:
Mmm! Pesto Burger + Garlic Fries! Yummy in my tummy! $11ish.

This little spot is a pretty happenin place to be on a Friday night. Ok, not really but there were lots of people coming in and out for their burger fix!

I really liked the pesto burger and the garlic fries were the perfect finisher. Topped with real, fresh garlic.. you just might want to be careful who you get close to after eating these. 

The fries were crispy and a tiny bit sticky due to the fresh garlic toppings. Everything came out hot off the grill or the fryer.. 

Would definitely come back again soon. Wasn't too far from my work and was delish.

Edit: My friend ordered the King Burger, not PHAT Bob. I mistakenly put that on the photo caption.
author: C C.

description:
The GREATEST Burgers of All Time. Doble recommended this place and he's right. This guy knows his food, so we go for his birthday and they are the best burger in SF, probably in the world. Well Big Mouth makes a great Hangover burger too, but really really delicious.

It's a Whole Lotta Food!
author: Rew C.

description:
I love sweet potato fries and veggie burgers. They are the only ones I get in the city mostly due to proximity and the rarity it is for me to hit up a fast food joint.  But when fast food is what I need- Pearl's it is!  The food is delicious, quick, and cheap. So now tell me who doesn't make those three words a priority when checking Yelp reviews? BAM!

Only after being stranded in the woods and not having eaten for a week, would I consider trying your oh so incredible looking milkshakes.  For now, I must resist you.
author: Ali B.

description:
I know, I'm a major burger freak.
 
I'm a hamburger with no sauce (or cheese), just the good ole onions and lettuce sorta gal. 

But I think that's the true test of a good burger. Does it stand alone? 

These were good, but if their other reviews are any indication, their true strength is in their special burgers with creative toppings. 

I dig the vibe in this place.. a little hole in the wall in a seriously sketch neighborhood. As you duck in after dodging trash covered sidewalks and yelling drunken packs of bums, you're greeted by a cozy little hum of steady happy customers. A genuinely helpful and friendly cashier greeted us... and how awesome is it that they have built in choices of half onion rings and half sweet potato fries (and every other permutation of onion rings, sweet potato and regular fries)? 

We'll definitely be back when we're in the neighborhood.. and this time I'll make a point to have a Pearl's-style burger adventure.

I'll keep ya posted.
author: Nadia H.

description:
My boyfriend ordered the mushroom burger. After the entire burger was demolished, he'd confessed to me that he'd only intended to eat half (after denying that he had received a burger and just an empty basket). Apparently, he had "blacked out" from happiness after the first bite. 

I got the mini bacon cheeseburger and the size was perfect for me. I thought that the burger was okay. Nothing outstanding flavor-wise, but everything was cooked to perfection and I liked the flavor/ aroma of the sesame bun. 

We also enjoyed our basket of onion rings/ garlic fries. I normally don't like onion rings, but these were seasoned well and crispy on the outside (same with the fries).

Service was rainbows, puppies and kitty cats. The gentleman taking our order even taped the ripped bill my boyfriend had pulled out while attempting to pay for our meal.
author: Mishell P.

description: Solid burgers at a reasonable price. Nice and juicy, with ample toppings, you will not leave Pearl's hungry. My favorite side to pair with my burger? Definitely the garlic fries. Heaped with tons of garlic, you might not want to go on a date later in the day, but your taste buds will give you the love you crave.
author: Warren W.

description:
Dare I venture up the precariously inhabited Jones Street from the comforts of my SOMA abode for a simple burger?...Dare I risk life and limb avoiding the careening cars I will inevitably confront at every intersection trudging up that hill?...Dare I risk a shorter lifespan for my arteries wolfing down the food here?...Gee, I guess so. OK, OK...of course.

Seduced by a feature story in the Chronicle's 96 Hours Thursday supplement, I saw a burger with my name on it. Pearl's does not serve the big, bulbous and hand-molded hamburger you would get at a more expensive eatery. Don't get me wrong...I love those as well. This is definitely the school of identical flat patties. The difference is that the meat is grilled so well it becomes a piece of circular, piping hot art. And it certainly tastes fresh, not at all packaged.

The $4.99 Deluxe Burger with Cheese is delish and may well be on the pantheon of In-n-Out. The fries are nice and lightly crispy, and they come in their own separate red basket so as not to mix your greases. Definitely a thoughtful gesture. And there seems to be an unspoken opportunity to refill your drinks since no one winces when you do.

I was gratefully at Pearl's when it was close to empty. Very clean and new, it's a teeny-tiny place with five little duet tables and a counter for three. That's it...and I can imagine it being as bad as an IRS office on tax day during peak meal times.

They have turkey and veggie burger alternatives, grilled chicken sandwiches and even salads. Carnivores can remain indifferent to such variety since they offer specialties like mushroom. teriyaki, pesto and a rather idiosyncratic creation -the King, a burger with a hot dog as a toppings with gobs of cheese and 1000 Island dressing. Oh my.

They are open until 2AM if you dare. As you probably know, the transitional area between Nob Hill and the Tenderloin does not provide much opportunity for easy street parking. Perhaps you can join me on the uphill climb up Jones to earn your burger. It's worth it.

FOOD - 5 stars...one juicy burger and plentiful fries well priced
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...one cute, compact place...unless it's crowded at which point it probably becomes the survival of the fattest
SERVICE - 4 stars...fast..and hey, he even comes to your table
TOTAL - 5 stars...a good burger is not that hard to find anymore
author: Ed U.

description:
San Francisco's hidden gem, unless you're at the hotel across the street or with a local you'll probably miss this one. That's regrettable. The burgers are unique, tastey, and filling.

Best fries ever, get any combination of two: fries, rings, sweet potato.

Also for the lesser portion option get the quarter pounder! I'm a fan of options :)
author: Jacqueline O.

description:
I know several people who think I am crazy for giving this 3 stars, but if they want, they can write their own review.

We went here on our first night in SF on our road trip, and while this was a spur of the moment add on to the trip after seeing it on Best Thing I Ever Ate earlier that week, I was excited.

I got the BBQ, Onion Ring Burger, my brother got the regular bacon burger, another got the Sly Burger, and another got the Chili Burger.

Verdict, everyone really liked the Sly Burger.  

For me, none of them really impressed me. They were all ok. Not too bad. The chili burger I didn't care for at all because it was a very beany chili and just wasn't appetizing.  My burger was too tangy with the sauce.  It was just a little too much. I think next time I'd just stick to the regular bacon cheeseburger.

The sweet potato fries on the other hand were actually quite delicious. How could you go wrong though? Sweet potatoes are delicious.

I want to come back here just for the sheer fact that I seem to be outnumbered in opinions, but for me, I was a bit disappointed.
author: Rubin K.

description:
Shakes n Malts: You'd be hard-pressed to find any shakes or malts in the city better than the ones served here. 

Burgers: Get 'em medium rare. They were perfectly cooked with a delicate sear that carmelized the fat and kept the interior juicy. I'd say pass on the sauce. Had a bite of my friend's Spicy Sly and I was glad I did't get a special. The sauce overpowered the BEEFINESS of the patty  I like my burgers basic. 

Fries: The best freakin' fries I've ever had. I don't know exactly how they do it, but their fries have a crunchy layer of batter of some sort enveloping the actual fry itself. They're like fries on steroids, dipped and fried in gustatory crack.
author: Colleen W.

description:
What makes a burger joint great is:
Juicy Burgers
thick bacon
fresh ingredients
SAUCES! SAUCES! and SAUCES!
crispy french fries
crispy and deliciously battered onion rings
and THICK shakes

My love for nutella shakes runs deep. I have to have my shakes really thick. I don't like drinking soupy shakes. Pearls has those big @ss straws that allow you to enjoy all of that goodness without having to wait for the shake to melt down or the fruits getting stuck in your straw. Enjoy a bomb @ss shake the way it was intended to DRINK in all of its glory.
author: augustine x.

description: The service is fantastic.  The burgers are amazing and the fries rock. Try the pesto burger and the chili cheese fries.
author: Kory-Oren E.

description:
3.5

ive been told by quite a few friends that they have some pretty good burgers, and after seeing their other location on the food network...i was convinced to try it out.

location is superrrrr tiny!  barely any seating area.

anyway, i really like their burgers.  i'd give them 4 stars if the patty wasnt so bland.  dont get me wrong, i enjoyed the burger because it was VERY JUICY.  it was just lacking flavor.  

the fries were delish!  both reg and sweet potatoes =)

i like how they have a container filled with COMPLIMENTARY whole pickles up front!
author: mong linh n.

description:
With a ton of assorted extra leftover from Thanksgiving, none of us wanted another bite or visualize any of them for a while. Matt and wife were also too lazy and tired to cook dinner. But by coincident, we had a sudden craving for a tasty burger. Sounds good after Thanksgiving, would you say?

From this tiny place with only 6 tables, Matt had the Mushroom-Burger, a small basket of fries and bottled water. The $6.95 specialty burger is custom-made towards your desired of being cooked and contained Grilled Mushroom and melted Swiss-Cheese compressed in a toasted puffed hamburger-bun. The crispy fries were indeed crispy and tasty!

Wife had the popular Deluxe-Burger with melted American-Cheese. The $5.49 cheeseburger had an 8oz custom-made patty and served with the usual condiments (mayo, lettuce, sliced tomato and onions) in a toasted bun.

We also split a $3.25 Vanilla Milkshake. They use home-made Ice Cream as the secret ingredient in preparing a thick-ass and luscious milkshake.

There are no meal-combo packages, so every item is purchased separately. Our meal totaled to nearly $20.00 and yes, since Matt is poor, Credit Cards are accepted. Like most hamburger places, you'll leave with the flamed-broiled scent on your clothing. But not this place; with the assistance of the recent cold San Francisco temperature and the powerful ventilation from this place, our clothes still smells like Tide.
author: Matt G.

description:
Still fabulous burgers and still one of my go-to stops.   Gotta knock it down a star, cause their prices are really high.  $10 bucks with tax gets you a specialty burger with no fries.

I think these guys kicked up the prices after being featured on The Best Thing I Ever Ate (Food Network).  Well deserved, but you have to remember, the internet is for two things: Complaining and Porn!

Great burgers and highly recommended.

Sylvia from Pearl's just left a comment defending the prices: I will say this... I am glad that they took the high road and raised the prices rather than sacrificing quality to save some dough.  She's right, the half pound burgers are huge and highly satisfying.
author: Rocco B.

description: The burgers here are really good, but the fries alone are reason enough to trek up Nob Hill to this low key burger place. Most people seem to get food to go so there are usually plenty of tables to sit at. The milkshakes are a treat as well.
author: Andrew W.

description: We came for the milkshakes (didn't disappoint), but would def come back for the burgers! Oh they're drool worthy. Boyfriend thought it was one of the best burgers of his life. And my vegetarian brother loved his non-meat burger choice too. I'd give it 5 stars but the dining area is meh, the burger that was supposed to come with pineapple didnt, and our milkshake was forgotten, but the guy made up for it by giving us a larger size. Definitely coming back!!
author: Kate W.

description:
I went here in my quest for the best burger in the city.  After reading about Pearl's history, I had some high expectations.  I left the place a bit disappointed.  It wasn't terrible in that if I worked near Pearl's, I would certainly frequent here for lunch.  I know Pearl's is Yelp Sponsor and all, but I just didn't find their burgers good enough to make it a destination place.  

I liked the size of their beef, but the way it was grilled wasn't impressive. Buns, which were bit too wimpy for their meat, started to crumble as I ate.  Lettuce and tomatoes were nice and fresh.  The biggest problems for me were their onion rings and French fries.  Rings contained very little onion.  Fries came stale, obviously sat there for a long time before I entered the restaurant.  I'm sure not everyone is served old fries, but I found it unacceptable.

PRICE: Average.  Burger, drink, and fries, expect to pay $10.

SEATS:  About 5 tables and 4 counter seats facing the window.

So Toro E., if Pearl's wasn't great, who has better burgers?
I am still in the middle of my search, but just to name a few:
Burger at Memphis Minnie's (http://www.yelp.com/biz/VlNE3m59v836-t3V4ZaOWQ)
In and Out (http://www.yelp.com/biz/_RysiB_bqTgCBmG8W96H4A)
Cafe Maman (http://www.yelp.com/biz/UTVDbZv-qiHU06sDkoel3g)
Couleur Cafe (http://www.yelp.com/biz/MGcr57aKUUDD0NlkhGp7Jg)
author: トモ T.

description: Very good burgers that aren't too greasy. Definitely get the Bula burger, it has pineapple in it. Good for takeout or eating in, but be weary of the limited seating.
author: Andrew H.

description: Great burger and fries. I had the Bula burger and it was a great mix of sweet and spicy. Messy like a burger should be! I was there right at closing time but the guys were still very nice and seemed to appreciate my business. Will definitely go again next time I'm in the area.
author: Brian D.

description:
Hands-down, a SOLID burger joint in SF. 

I don't get why some people are so disappointed. 
I think they come to Pearl's expecting GOURMET burgers found at GOURMET 5-star restaurants or something. 
Come on, let's be real - you're grabbing a burger in the TL - if you want a $15-20 fancy burger, go somewhere else!!! 

Pearl's was designed for the regular person - like me.  
I love burgers & I'm constantly looking for the best burger in town. 
I can't say Pearl's is the best but I'm definitely coming back when I want a quick, reasonably priced fix. 

I tried the Balu burger - spicy pineapple teriyaki sauce with bacon & swiss cheese. 
FREAKIN DELICIOUS. 
I asked them to add jalapenos & there it was - burger perfection in my hands (sweet, spicy, salty, cheesy, AND juicy).
The burger was cooked perfectly at medium. 
I also had fries to go with it & those things are so damn yummy!
Perfectly crunchy - my boyfriend is addicted. 

I also heard they have a nutella milkshake, so I'll be coming back soon to grab me one of those.
author: Sylvia N.

description:
I don't totally understand the hype over this place...

The good:
* Portion sizes
* Prices

The bad:
* Everything is tasteless.  I mean, seriously, for unhealthy food, this is as bland as it gets
* Location - it's not bad, but its not good.  Tendernob...
* Decor/cleanliness - it's not the nicest place ever but it's not a total dive
* Menu - it's confusing and it's got tons of addendums all over the place.  

So if you want a really mediocre burger that will fill you up.. I guess it's a good option
author: Yan L.

description:
Pearl's popped my cherry!  

This is the first place I have ever dined alone w/out some sort of entertainment (no book, no laptop, no magazine...jus me, and the food)!...Okay!...and the people walking by since I snagged one of the counter seats at the front window.

Regular cheeseburger w/ garlic fries and an oreo shake.  One of those downer days when I just need "artery clogging comfort food" and Pearl's did me up right!!

Service was awesome! Huge smiles, great suggestions, and table service.  The "people watching" from my seat was entertainment enough...and matched w/ the service and food...it makes me a fan!

Thanks Pearl's! I'll call you... 
;0)
author: Ninja H.

description:
Love! This! Spot!!!!!
I am absolutely a huge fan of burgers-and Pearl's does a mean burger. Went recently to grab a bite before a SKETCHFEST event and was once again blown away by deliciousness. This time I got the Prize Pearl, with blue cheese and sautéed onions, medium rare. I also split Frings with my man. He got a Deluxe burger-much more of a simple guy. 
The burgers were cooked to perfection, mine med-rare, his medium. They really heaped on the cheese and onions, and I love that they have pickles out for you to self serve. Pickles are an essential for burgers!
I found that I really like their onion rings, prob'll just stick to them next time. But the fella enjoyed the fries. 
The atmosphere is way chill, and it is counter service, but who needs fancy for a burger stop? The guys behind the counter were nice and helpful. 
Left way full and way happy!!
author: Patricia G.

description:
I ate the turkey burger with mushrooms, no cheese. Turkey burgers can be hit or miss - this one was perfect. Juicy, well seasoned, and oh man did I get plenty of mushrooms with it, which is wonderful because I am obsessed with mushrooms. Also came on a nice multigrain bun.

Overall, this place has excellent hangover food, and they literally have any kind of burger you could imagine. Their Sweet potato fries are also delicious. Oh, and I should also mention that in addition to every single kind of burger ever imaginable, they also have approximately a bagillion different kinds of milkshakes. 

Go here when you're not on a diet, or after you've had a little too much to drink the night before. Delicious, reasonably priced, friendly helpful staff. An SF institution for sure.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Two bites into my Spicy Sly and I pulled a black wavy hair out of it.  I'm still trying not to vomit.  Such a shame, because I've always enjoyed my food from Pearl's before... but this is a deal breaker.  I can't even express how sick I feel right now!  Use hairnets for Christ's sake!
author: R. B.

description:
So. I like me some burgers. This is one of those places with the sign that says "WON BEST BURGERS EVER FROM FAMOUS PERSON" so i'm like "which burger won?" and they go "oh the Bula burger with kobe beef" and then I casually glance at the prices and go uh... how about just a Bula burger. Fries. Thanks. :D

This place is right around the corner from where I was staying. Go tenderloin :P Anyways... the burgers was friggin good. The place is small with like a total of what... 8 chairs? 3 at the window and 4 tables? maybe 11 chairs? Awesome.
author: Jerm J.

description: Prized Pearl was AMAZING!!!  Garlic fries were strong and also tasty!  Staff was really nice.  I stole an onion ring from a friend...a must if you are ever in San Francisco!!
author: Kristen D.

description:
Easily makes the list of the top 5 burgers I've had ever!

After reading reviews, I had to try this place out. & since I could not decide which burger to get, I decided to go with the popular choice, so I had the bula burger. Just a note, just because this place is in the tenderloin, does NOT mean it is cheap. The burger alone was $9 and they don't have meal specials so you have to buy fries/drink separately. I got the garlic fries, small, which were $3.49, so my total came out to over $13. 

I got it to go and ended up eating it in my car because I was THAT hungry. Not a good idea. As good as the bula burger was, it is VERY messy! They pour that sauce on there and silly me I forgot to grab napkins - you can imagine the disaster. Anyway, the burger was amazing - big chunks of bacon, an enormous amount of spicy pineapple teriyaki sauce, and the burger was cooked to perfection - medium rare - just how I like it. I know the sauce says spicy, but its not spicy at all, and I didn't mind because it was full of flavor!

The garlic fries were also very good! 

I would love to come back and try their other burgers! I'm aware that there is a location on market street, however, I don't believe (based on the ratings) that it is as good as this location. Although it is located in the tenderloin, I didn't have trouble finding street parking on a Saturday evening around 4 pm. 

The place is not that big, and it had a good number of people in there. There wasn't a line at 4 pm when I went in, but I do not believe there were any open tables either. Just pick your poison - its worth making a trip to the tenderloin for me!
author: Junel S.

description: I walked here from work for lunch and got the Bula Burger. The place is small and perfect for a quick lunch. The problem was my work gives a half hour for lunch and it takes about 7 minutes to walk there, so I ended up being late by a few minutes. BUT IT WAS WORTH IT. The pineapple teriyaki sauce on the burger was amazing! The only change I would make is to add some lettuce and tomatoes to make it taste a little healthier haha. The sweet tangy sauce goes so well with the thick burger party and fluffy sesame seed bun. I will be back to try another burger soon.
author: Stephen W.

description:
Since my last review, I've found myself here on multiple occasions and have come to realize that Pearl's actually serves up a very, very solid basic burger.

I believe getting the special burgers with the extras actually detracts from the greatness that is their deluxe burger.  If you want a well-executed, affordable, incredibly satisfying basic hamburger, you've found your slice of heaven at Pearl's Deluxe.
author: Chase C.

description:
I love this place.   Currently, this is my favorite burger in San Francisco.  and I have tried quite a few.

http://tinyurl.com/4x59r5y

I also love the pace of the place.  The staff seems really into it.  and I really like the shakes and fries also.
author: Mark D.

description:
Came to Pearls after reading all the reviews here on Yelp, and I wasn't fully impressed.

It's a very, very small place. I was by myself so I only needed seating for one and couldn't get that. I ordered to go instead.

Pricier than I expected also, but for all natural beef and ingredients I can't complain. What I will complain about is how two customers in life after me received their order first! A party of 4 got their burgers before me and were in line after.
The burger didn't really stand out. The first bite was flavorful, but after that it was boring. I do admit that they cooked it exactly to my liking - medium rare. The fries on the other hand are amazing! Extremely crunchy and fried to perfection. I fell in love after first bite. I also had a chocolate milkshake that was sub par. It just wasn't thick enough.

Hopefully, I can give it another try soon.
author: Lavender H.

description:
The boyfriend and I tried the phat bob & bula burger w/ kobe, springs, & mint oreo shake last time.We felt that it was a little TOO MUCH, for example... the bacon was too thick of a cut, etc. So we decided to go with the basics this time: pesto burger & mini cheeseburger with mushrooms & springs once again. To wash it down, we had the black forest & mint oreo shake.

The burgers are HUGE. I personally am a fan of carbs, so the bun is a very important part of the burger for me. My mini cheeseburger with mushrooms felt a little on the dry side. Could it be that I had it cooked medium well? Maybe I forgot the ketchup? I don't know... I really want to understand the hype but I'm just not understanding it. I do LOVE the onion rings, but always contemplate between getting onion rings or sweet potato fries, so the boyfriend and I always end up getting the springs (half onion rings, half sweet potato fries). I feel like the sweet potato fries are softer than I would actually like. 

What we love the most here: the milkshakes! A super long list of milkshakes to choose from. We love the mint oreo. The black forest was good for the first few sips, but I ended up drinking my bf's mint oreo in the end. Think we will be coming back for milkshakes. We would love to try the other flavors.   

2 burgers, 2 shakes, 1 order of springs ~ $32 for 2 people. Kinda pricey & we left feeling like fatties.
author: Tina S.

description:
So amazing!
Everything there is awesome!

Great burgers, yummy french fries, shakes, onion rings.
It is crazy how much I can eat when I am there :) :) :)

If I got to choose to eat out at only one place, Pearl's Burgers would be the winner.
Yum!
author: Cynthia P.

description: Was looking all over for a great burger spot that had bomb milkshakes for my cheat meal, and this place definitely hit the spot! You get what you pay for. The staff is very friendly, food is fresh and the Peanut butter & chocolate milkshake was on point!!! Need to go back and try the Mudpie and Nutella flavored shakes!
author: Jocelyn M.

description: Stay cation burger! Burger tasted good, but I had major upset stomach from it. Not going to risk another crazy stomach ache so don't think I'm coming back. My burger was not well cook.
author: Happi Y.

description:
Amazing burgers! I ordered the Bula Burger, which is some kind of pineapple teriyaki sauce-glazed burger plus a few strips of bacon, with monterey jack cheese melted over. It was delicious, packed with flavor, and extremely messy. The sesame bun was toasted to perfection as well. I shared the frings with my friend and they were actually the best fries/onion rings that i've ever had...yup. Not sure how they make their fries, but they are unusually crispy. 

Service was quick and friendly. The restaurant itself was small, kind of out-of-the-way, and stark but clean. It's a simple burger joint serving amazing food at reasonable prices ($8.99 for an enormous, delicious burger plus $3-4 for frings).
author: Anna N.

description:
Peral's was just a plain burger joint to me. It is a nice quaint restaurant, but their food isn't what I had heard. The onion rings were good, but the burger was just another burger...probably will not come back if I return to California.

The mini burger was a good size, but the large burger was too much.
author: Stephanie H.

description: I tried an avocado burger. Excellent. The chocolate shake is machine-style, much like In-N-Out, and is just fine. Price is great. Only downside is that there are hardly any seats. Probably best as a to-go place.
author: Craig G.

description:
NO WAY!!!!!
I am a first time visitor to SF and was checking out food blogs and wanted to try Pearls due to the raving reviews....Wow not even close to the best burger rating scale I give it 2 or 3 stars at best. Beef was bland? Maybe it was the cooks? Dunno had to make sure I was in the right place.... definitely a head scratcher for me?  Is this the same as the one on Market Street?
author: Daron C.

description: Excellent hamburger, but the prices hurt.  I have complained about the prices at nearly every San Francisco establishment I've reviewed, so, in part, it's the location (damned little communist hipsters running around and all); still, for a burger joint, I think you should be able to order a double cheeseburger, fries, and a drink and be out no more than $10 after tax.  I don't care how good the fare is--that should be an option.
author: Patrick R.

description:
I said rare. They made it rare. I said avo. There was about a half avocado on it. 
No gross relishes or anything weird. 
I think it's a good classic burger. I have no beef with this beef.
author: Tiana G.

description: Visiting San Fran for the holiday weekend and stumbled across this fantastic burger joint. Simple food, done extraordinarily well. The burger was juicy and decadent and I am in a food coma of happiness. Highly recommend!
author: J C.

description: The burgers here are delicious the teriyaki burger is a must (if ur into that). The fries u can skip, too greasy! Haven't tried the onion rings but I here there really good! Staff was nice, got a free shake which was pretty cool! The pickles on the side, so yummy! If u are looking for a quick dinner or lunch this place is great! It is expensive for burgers but worth it!
author: Lo C.

description:
Yet another small place in San Francisco (seems to be a trend around here). There are are only 15 chairs in this place, and not a lot of seating room. It has your basic metal tables and chairs, no decoration really. Your meal can get pricey if you order it with fries and a drink cause those cost extra BUT, you most definitely get what you pay for!

I ordered the veggie burger with Swiss cheese, mushrooms, lettuce and tomato. It was served on this amazing whole wheat bun and it was a BEAST! I am so glad there was a napkin dispenser at my table because things got real messy real fast. The veggie patty had a nice flavor, and was one of the biggest patties I've ever seen. It ended up falling apart toward the end, but it was still so awesome (I was practically licking the paper). 

The wait staff is also really nice. I just ordered a burger (no fries or anything), and the cashier made sure to let me know that there were pickles and water for me to help myself to.

I really, REALLY recommend coming here and trying the veggie burger (whether you're a vegetarian or not). I'm not so sure about coming here for a date because like I said, things get really messy. But hey, if nobody minds going through almost an entire container of napkins, then go for it! (sounds like a fun date to me! ha ha) I know that I'll be back for sure with my friends in tow.
author: Larae H.

description:
This is the type of place that will make you go "oh boy oh boy oh boy" by it's cozy old-school interior, friendly service, greasy burgery smell and mouthwatering menu. 

The burgers are certainly deluxe. For one, they're huge and satisfying, especially when accompanied with golden crispy fries (7/10 on my fries meter) and multi-flavor shakes. I had the Spicy Sly burger and it came with abundant habanero sauce, just the way I like it. Onion rings and sweet potato fries for sides are also good if you're into sharing sides.

This friendly unpretentious burg joint will have you come back here again and again.

-----

Distinguishing factor: Kobe beef and buffalo burgers. Wash them down with a pina colada milkshake. How cool is that?
author: Nick A.

description:
The best hole in the wall burger ever. Actually the best burger in SF (well second to La Folie's mini burger)!

I loved the Prized Pearl Burger that was served with blue cheese and grilled onions. I got the Frings- half fries half onion rings. The onion rings are thin, crispy, peppery, and delicious.

The place is tiny and always busy. Lets put it this way, given the area I was shocked that the bathroom was graffiti free and clean. 

Long story short, next time I want a delicious heart attack on a tray I am going to Pearl's.
author: Caro S.

description:
OVER-HYPED GOURMET BURGER?
--yeah, it's a good & thick fresh-tasting burger
--but is it worth the 450 miles my son's UC Irvine classmates drive to get here?
I've had better under 15 miles in OC.
San Francisco doesn't boast many gourmet burger joints
--so maybe here it's special
--especially as an easy-to-bypass hole-in-the-wall.
MILK SHAKE
--consistently creamy & not too sweet
author: Lem C.

description:
I once again murdered the Bula Burger with Kobe meat to pieces....(murdered as in tried to finish, and ended up picking on it)
Came here on a Wedensday night, and there was a line. Luckily, the 3 seats facing the glass window were empty, so me and my girlfriends took the spot and ate our burgers with such savageness facing the passerbys and the smokers. 

The sweet potato fries were splendid just like my first trip to Pearl's. Cooked to perfection. The Bula burger was incredible as usual. Juicy kobe burger oozing in pineapple teriyaki sauce topped with crisp bacon goodness. Droool! The burgers here are pretty huge, and i tried my very best to finish my whole burger and Failed to do so...as usual....so i picked on the meat and the bacon halfway thru my burger.

The service was pretty fast considering how busy i thought they were. 
I like the fact that they have pickle wedges as one of their free condiments! 

Definitely one of the best ones i've ever tried in my LIFE!
author: Monica H.

description: Excellent hamburgers (I've had the BBQ burger and the teriyaki burger, both were awesome), fries, and milkshakes. Make sure to stop at an ATM though, they're cash only.
author: Abigail A.

description: As many before me have mentioned the food is absolutely amazing, this review is about the staff. They go above and beyond genuinely when it comes to service, not only did they make my experience at pearls but also my day! Keep up the good work
author: F T.

description:
I came in during lunch after seeing 1,000+ reviews with a high rating and asked the man who said he was the owner for their most popular recommendations. He talked about how the Bula burger was reviewed positively by Chef Bobby Flay and I decided on getting that. And a Nutella shake. What a shake! I received that first while I waited a short time for my Bula burger and that was delicious as well. The owner asked how everything was and provided some great invited conversation. 

Food was great. Service was great.
author: Emil C.

description:
The plain turkey burger had zero grease--zero. It was dry, but I actually love the no-grease because it seems like every burger joint will add unnecessary amounts of grease. I love being healthy. Therefore if you'd like a regular burger, pretty much homemade type of quality, that is hearty and will fill you up--this is the place to go. The buns were small but very puffy so they have the same mass as regular buns. And they are so cute! They are seasoned with all kinds of seeds.

 I came here expecting delicious burgers, and that I got, just not in the sense of having an out-of-this-world flavor. Because there's little grease, the flavor is only slightly bland, but that's the standard. It's a little pricey for a typical burger however I'd love to come back again and try their chicken and bison burgers. I just hate walking up the hills, so I take the 27!
author: Natalie Charlotte W.

description:
Review and rating are for a deluxe burger with bacon, mushrooms and swiss, and an order of fries.

I'm a burger fan. I like most of them. That said, I can tell the difference between a great burger, a good burger, and a bad burger. Criteria are things like meat quality, correct doneness, juiciness (also known as not putting a weight on the fucking burger), bun flavor and texture, quality of fixins, seasonings, and maybe some other factors I'm forgetting. My exact rating might not match yours, but we'll probably be within the same ballpark. If we disagree, you can rest assured that you're wrong.

You also have to take into account the price. A 4-star burger and fries at $14 dollars would be a 5-star meal at $7... and that's basically what we have here at Pearls.

I've been to Pearl's on Post three times now, so I feel like I can write balanced review. Everything is good. Meat is good, and cooked to order. Bun is tasty, although as other reviewers have mentioned, a little delicate. Toppings are generous and fresh, especially the bacon, which is great. Mushrooms are freshly sauteed to order. Oh, and lest you miss out, the pickles are self-serve on the counter, and they are frickin' awesome. The fries are... okay. Boring, honestly. Obviously frozen, and a little mushy, but they get the job done.

So if it were a $7 combo, or even $9, then this would probably be a 5-star review. I think that $14 is a little much to spend for a burger and fries, though. On top of that, the burger patties themselves aren't huge, maybe 1/3 of a pound?

I will certainly go back. Pearl's is 2 blocks from my apartment, and the food is good, just a little too expensive.
author: Dave T.

description:
Giving a little credit as almost everyone in the place seemed to be "in training" on this first visit. 

Like Nina.M I need more flavor in my burger to give the product a higher mark. The burger was good (Pearl's Deluxe; no bacon, no cheese), but nothing incredible. I don't get the impression that the flavor issues were unique to training day events. Which also included the wrong order being delivered, orders taken after mine being delivered first, incorrectly assembled and cooked order. 

I would also recommend skipping their tomatoes; pretty confident that they are hydroponic and coupling that with a bland burger doesn't help either achieve greatness. 

The onion rings were good, the place was clean, and the people friendly. Would try again.

A few recommendations for the establishment:
1. Season the burgers. If you are already do it more or switch seasonings. 
2. Don't train everyone at once. Unless you can't avoid it. 
3. If what you add to your product (aka tomato) isn't adding anything positive then it is taking away from the end result. 
4. Medium is a little more done than what you are hitting.
5. Regardless don't be too diligent with cleaning the flat-top. A well seasoned, but clean, griddle will do a lot for the flavor.
author: Clinton G.

description:
Every single time I fly out to California to visit my LDR boyfriend at Stanford, it is inevitable that I ditch him one day to go frolic with the burgers at Pearl's Deluxe Burgers. 

My first experience was with the Phat Bob. It was a great burger already, beating all of my experiences in Atlanta, but my second experience had it beat when I ordered the Bula Burger with Kobe beef and cooked medium. I took a bite and I died, mostly because every burger after this will never be as good. The bula sauce is genius; the sugary, acidic sauce cuts the richness of the burger, bacon, and cheese so delicately. The owner of the store claims that Chef Bobby Flay stole the bula sauce from him. 

A thing that earns great marks in my book is that there is a vat of free pickles. I love pickles and I cannot get enough of them, so having a free self serve area is the only thing that could've beaten the burgers. 

I plan on flying to California to see my boyfriend again. And by boyfriend, I mean the Bula Burger.
author: Anqi Y.

description:
Simply the BEST burger/sandwiches I ever ate!  

For my first visit, I ordered the Bula Burger.  The synergy of the bacon and patty drenched in the spicy & tangy hawaiian teriyaki sauce is orgasmic.  It's really hard to not eat like a pig and make a mess.

And I came back for the Pesto Chicken Sandwich.  It was drenched with fresh pesto with melted cheese.  I only wish they would give the option of having pesto as a dipping sauce.

They use the same bread as their bun, and its artisan bread delivered from god-knows-where, HEAVEN.  They have various side combination to feed your french fries/sweet potato fries/garlic fries craving.  

The only downside to this place, its a small joint - finding a table can be quite difficult [so PLEASEEEEE expand to other neighborhoods]!  Parking isnt always the easiest but Post Street is a one way, just have to circle around.

I'll definitely be coming back!
author: Steph L.

description: I finally understand the fuss. We were craving burgers and Pearls was the answer! We went mid afternoon and it was busy but not crazy. We parked in parking lot on Cosmo Place for $6/hour which was expensive but  felt a little more secure than street parking. Burgers were fresh, well prepared and very filling.
author: Dede S.

description:
Enjoyed a quick lunch on a Sunday at 12PM. Got here before the lunch rush it was packed by 12:30. Get in early. 

The place is very small might only seat 20 people at a time. There is a large menu on the wall (prices are different from on-line and what other yelpers wrote, maybe they just raised them?) Lots of different options for burgers and waaaay too many selections on shakes I would never be able to decide, lol. 

I ordered the Pearl Deluxe and substituted the regular patty for buffalo (which is an additional $4.00 charge) so it was $10.49 for a burger with onions, lettuce and tomato. A little steep but it was worth it. Food arrived about 10 minutes later to the table. The burger was cooked perfect med-well and the bun was nicely toasted and still a little soft. The meat was lean and still  juicy. I also enjoyed some hot french fries. Make sure you have the napkins ready, it's going to get messy and dirty. 

Wish they would have wheat buns and jalepenos.
author: Amber S.

description:
Finally found Pearl's - not as big or bright as I expected but well worth the visit. American (Traditional) has the greatest national dishes anywhere, ever. Pearl's Deluxe Burgers is a fine example of that tradition - make no mistake there are plenty of bad examples.
As a connoisseur I started with the basic cheese burger for value judgement witha side of garlic fries. L.U.S.H. the only way to describe it.
Medium rare burger was cooked to dripping perfect. Cheese was smooth and tasty with the right crisp bite from lettuce, tomato and onion tang. 
The garlic fries were up there too. Just make sure you're travelling alone or you both have them. Garlic was crushed an done just right - perfect quantity. 
I hope I can get back before I go to try the Phat Bob.
author: Niche U.

description: Had a great lunch here yesterday! I had one of the best, juiciest chicken sandwiches ever with the Spicy Sly (also, it was ginormous and I didn't end up eating dinner because I was still so full!). I loved that the peppers were fresh and not sautéed. My husband had the classic deluxe burger which he said was excellent and reminded him of his favorite burger place back in NJ that closed. Onion rings were awesome too. The man who was working the counter was personable and the food came so quick. Wish we were locals because we would totally frequent Pearl's!
author: Nicole ..

description:
Wicked good burgers.  You can see why they're winning awards.  I went with the Spicy Sly Buffalo Burger, made with pumpkin-habanero salsa.  It's got a kick, but it is pretty manageable if you get a delicious mint-oreo milkshake.  The group shared garlic fries, sweet potato fries, and onion rings as sides.  Everything was awesome except for the sweet potato fries, which were just OK.

Not a lot of room to sit inside, especially if you're more than 2 people.  But just get it to go and walk a few blocks to Union Square to eat outside.
author: Chad T.

description:
Bula Burger! I dream about this saucy burger.

Also, the guys that work here on Thursday nights are hilarious and so helpful! It's their mission to make this the best food you've had and will bring you yummy sauces while you eat if they think your onion rings are lonely on their own.
author: jane c.

description:
FINALLY! I've been craving a classic cheeseburger, no kale, no special patty stuffed with pork belly, no Italian blend with goat, no special Mediterranean or Korean fusion burger, just a simple delicious all American cheese burger. 

And guess what? Pearl's delivers. Good quality ground beef cooked medium, with your basic fresh ingredients on a sesame bun. Not a Hala not Brioche not Potato, just simple white sesame bun. Mmmmmmmmmm so good! Bit into the burger and you could taste the beef with a little mayo. Not overly greasy but still juicy. Of course to go classic I got American cheese. Yes the processed stuff. Oh so good. 

So the burger was 5 stars for sure.

Got the Frings and I'm not a fan of fries with a bread coating on them. Onion rings were ok so knock the place down 1 star. Might just forgo the sides and get another burger instead next time.
author: Hyung L.

description:
ALRIGHT PEARL'S!!!!!

Had a plan when I came here! Went to Moth and Dagger to check out some tat's then burgers! Well these burgers were MMMHHHHHMMMMMM GOOD!!!! Lets get to it then:

THe Good:
Well the BURGERS of course! This place has such a great variety of burger's and they have SWEET POTATOE FRIES! The seating was hard to come by since we apparently went when there was a ton of WISCONSIN folks there (they were cool and enjoyable but we knew they were all hammered lol). You could sit facing the street which I loved.

THE BAD:
Also there was such a small area to grab your freakin food OMG! I hated that area. Pricey for a burger but overall pretty cheap for going and grabbing food. Two ppl, two fries, two burgers and two sodas was about $30 give or take $5; so you be the judge.

ALL N ALL:
We enjoyed our time here on a bright Saturday afternoon. I'm always up for a good burger and fries and this place was awesome so HELL YEAH I'LL BE BACK!!! SEE YOU THERE!!!
author: marques b.

description:
This is 5-star for the segment - diner, juicy burger and delicious shakes well priced. 

I had the turkey burger - nice and juicy and my group shared the garlic fries and sweet potato. Don't miss the garlic fries if you like garlic, much better than Biersch ones. Also tried the Nutella shake and the Coconut. Both were delicious!

If you are around Union Sq definitely grab a quick burger here.
author: Lauren T.

description:
The burgers certainly look the part.  They're big, juicy, and have tons of ingredients.  The problem?  Taste.   The taste is pedestrian and boring.  There's no distinctiveness.

Another reviewer below nailed it when he said that it tastes exactly like a random diner burger.  The Emperor has no clothes, folks.

I gave Pearl's a second chance and thought that maybe if I went with the Kobe beef and added a few extras it would improve.  Maybe I had misjudged them.  Paid $18 or so, but nope - same blah flavorless beef.  Hmm.
author: J D.

description:
It's my first night in San Francisco. After a long day of walking around, discovering how not to hang out of a street car, and watching scores of cat owners flee a burning building while the fire department do a stellar job of sorting out the whole sorry affair, I was knackered (that's British for "pooped") - not to mention the jet lag and hayfever. It was time for a break. So, on the recommendation of a friend I decided to find Pearl's - I looked on the map. "What luck, it's across from my hostel!" I thankfully didn't exclaim in the breakout area of the hostel.

I closed my laptop lid, splashed some water on my increasingly tired-and-showing-it face and headed across the road for some much-needed nourishment.

I decided to keep it simple; blue cheese on a burger, with everything else on it (except mayo). The friendly lady asked "what kind of fries would you like?" and despite replying with "yes please" in my almost-passing-out state, she agreed to get me some small fries.

I waited patiently with another diner-to-be who was passing the time by playing some Farmville on his phone. "Why," I wondered, "would a grown man play Farmville at all, let alone on his phone?"

Soon my attention was diverted elsewhere though, as I noticed in horror my terrible mistake: the mistake of not properly reading the menu. Had I known that I could have ordered a burger with pesto on it, or with avocado, or perhaps a kobe beef burger instead, then I would have gone with one of those. "Alas," I mourned, "My first meal in this city I have longed to enjoy for so long is going to be mediocritised by this... this... 'DE-LUXE' burger; this standard, run-of-the-mill burger whose only notable trait is the addition is blue cheese instead of the normal, plasticy, film-thin cheese normally found in burgers."

Soon it was too late - I was to face my fate. Pearl (or whom I assumed to be Pearl) handed me my brown paper bag. I forced a smile and thanked her, thinking only of what could have been between myself and the pesto burger. I walked slowly down the street towards Union Square, replaying the scene in my mind as I ate the delicious fries that were crunchy on the outside yet moist and soft on the inside. As I savoured the delicious flavour of their seasoning I wondered if I would ever again get a chance to try the Spicy Sly or the Prized Pearl. 

Soon I reached my destination - the stage where the final act of this tragedy would be shown: Union Square. I sat on a bench; a pigeon eyed my food, and seemed to turn its beak up and fly away. A man walked by with a dog and the dog seemed to whimper at the thought of such a shameful excuse for a burger.

I reached into the paper bag, and pulled out the sturdy plastic container which held the burger with absolutely no leakage of juices or dampening, like what one would expect with some burger joints.

I placed it on my knee, prized open the lid and beheld it in all its dreadful normalcy. Although it appeared large and juicy, I knew the truth - I knew that it was merely a mockery of the wide and exciting array of burgers which were otherwise available to me.

I picked it up with two hands. My muscles almost straining from the mass, I managed to bring the sandwich to my lips, open them up, and make a small bite into the burger.

I chewed slowly, expecting the worst: mere satiation. And yet, something was not right. Not only was this burger satiating... it was satisfying, nay; it was a pleasure. It was as juicy as it looked, and the description used for the fries earlier would apply just as readily to the buns surrounding the patty.

The generosity with which Pearl offers up onions is matched only by the perfect ripeness of the tomatoes, crunchiness of the lettuce and tanginess of the blue cheese. This truly was an excellent burger. Perhaps one of the best I have ever eaten.

Pearl, you have not disappointed. This was an excellent twist in a tale which set me up to expect the minimum, and you went above and beyond the call of duty. It was exactly what I needed.

But that doesn't mean I won't be coming back for my pesto burger.
author: Daniel H.

description:
The Hamburglar's hunt for the best burger may be over...(gasp heard from the crowd)

Bookmarked this sweet spot in advance and made a point to try at the urging of our resident friend.  

Place wasn't fancy.  Basic dinning room, nothing special.  Until we got our order of juicy meaty goodness, smothered with bacon and blue cheese.  OMG!!  This was Hamburglar-nearly-soiled-himself good.  A messy burger with a bun that endured and didn't whimp out.  

Sweet potatoe fries were nice, however I enjoyed the crispy battered onion rings much better.  

"You've come a long way baby", a voice in the crowd shouts.  The Hamburgular smiled, content and satisfied with how far he has come to reach the zenith called Pearl's.  A tear is shed as he clings to the table overwhelmed and for support.  He has reached his destination.  He allows the reality to settle in.  Who knows where the next burger brilliance will emerge.  Until now, the search for the holy burger has been found.  

Hamburglar removes his mask and returns his uniformed black & white jail suit to the closet.  When and will we ever see the Hamburglar again?  

All is safe in the world as long as Pearl's keeps providing burgers of this caliber.  The adventures of Hamburglar are temporarily ceased.  May Pearl's live long ("and prosper", shouts a nerdy Trekkie).  Yes, prosper would be a good thing.  

Burger out....(burger sizzle heard from the grill).  Ahhh!
author: Kalani C.

description:
For a burger joint considered "the best thing I ever ate" by a top celebrity chef, Pearl's was a disappointment. The restaurant is small and a little dingy, but not something a great burger could overcome.

Too bad the burgers were just average. They advertise that they cook their burgers medium, but mine came out well-done (this is one of my biggest pet peeves - don't advertise it if you aren't going to deliver!).

The fries were delicious though...super crispy because of the light coating on the outside.
author: Annaliese D.

description: In town on business, this was close to my hotel and went here based on the Yelp reviews. First let me say that I like burger dive joints. This isn't quite that, but it's a small little hole in the wall with the menu up on a slightly fancy chalkboard, so close enough. They have quite a few "specialty" burgers of various kinds, which I appreciate, it's always nice to have some options. I ordered the "Prized Pearl Burger" and the "Springs" (half onion rings, half sweet potato fries). Great burgers are like great sex: a little sloppy, you make lots of weird noises and your neighbors are wondering "what the hell is going on over there?". This...was not that. It was a solid burger, cooked as ordered, big and juicy, but it lacked a certain something. Not bad, but not great, certainly not the best I've had by any means. This may be blasphemous to locals, but it wasn't any better than burgers I've had at five guys, and not nearly as good as those from shake shack (yes, a chain, I know, but still damn good). As others have noted, the onion rings are very good, and the fries were nice and crispy. Overall, the service was friendly, the sides were pretty good and I liked the selection, but the burger was just ok for me. I was tempted to give it 3 stars, but the other positives pushed me into the 4 star range. If I'm in town again I'd give it another go and try a different burger option.
author: Kent H.

description:
This place was open on New Year's Day! Hurrah, our hungry tummies were saved!

The man at the register had a slight European accent, so that was kind of cool. But the best part was that the vegetarian burger patty was THE BEST I have ever had in my entire life. The fries and the onion rings were also stellar. My friend lives around the corner from this place, and if I lived in the same building as she I'd probably be eating here at least once a week. Just. so. good. 

The staff was friendly, and they bring our your food to you, so that's convenient. The place is tiny, though, so seating is limited, especially for groups.
author: Patrice D.

description:
I had the mini (1/4lber) cheeseburger (added avocado for $1.50) and a small order of fries, and kept my tab under $10.00 for the evening...$9.07 to be exact.

Fries = nothing to talk about.  (Thanks for the warning, Yelpers.)  I snagged one of my sister's onion rings, which was quite good, and thankfully not as soggy as some Yelpers' pics...

Burger = delicious.  Good beef (Niman Ranch), nice melt-y cheese, delicious lettuce, juicy tomato.   The bun, which is something that I sometimes eat only half of...I ate the whole thing.  It was delicious and NOT marshmallow bread. :) 

Shakes = lots to choose from.  I wanted to try the Nutella shake, but I had to keep to my budget, and diet (must fit into wedding dress!)

Service = friendly enough, and quick.  Although they were PO'd that we ordered 'take out' and sat down to eat, AFTER I had mentioned to them that they forgot my avocado.  (My sis and I tend to have leftovers....which we did!)   

Prices = reasonable...for SF. 

Seating = tiny.  Y'all better bring your own chairs to sit outside, or take it elsewhere.  

We'll see what happens post-6/28 Tyler Florence show...
author: Fannie S.

description:
Unless you like things squirting in your face, don't come to Pearl's (no pun intended)! And, if you do, well...more power to you!

In all honesty, I don't know what was worse...downing KFC's Double Down last week or eating one of Pearl's Burgers. 

FOOD (all burgers cooked to medium unless specified and are served with lettuce, tomato, onion, and mayo; no ketchup and mustard):

*Prized Pearl (1/2 pound patty, sautéed onions, blue cheese crumbles, and bacon sans the mayo). I initially was going to try the Estancia Beef (grass fed cows that produce beef w/ half as much fat), but got side-tracked. :T
http://www.estanciabeef.com/benefits/health-nutrition

The Prized Pearl was DISGUSTINGLY OILY and left me wondering, were the Niman Ranch Cows fed lard?

As I picked up the burger, the bottom bun absorbed the oil like a sponge, which was a soggy mess (mind you, I ate it within 5 minutes). As I took the first, second, and third bite, hot oil squirted out of the patty and onto my hands, chest, and throat. I never knew Niman Ranch Beef could squirt--GROSS! The sautéed onions were spouting out of the toasted sesame bun and dripping with oil. After a couple of bites, I started feeling queasy, so I stopped eating it. 

Granted the beef patty was thick, juicy, and well-seasoned, but it seemed all the juice was from the oil. Even the blue cheese's pungent flavor couldn't mask the all the greasiness from the patty and onions. 

*Fries: Unseasoned steak-cut fries which were soggy. After feeling as if I ate 3 spoonfuls of Crisco (one for every bite), I couldn't even manage to eat more than several fries, so those went in the trash as well. *sigh*

PRICES: 
You can opt to get various beef patties like Estancia, Buffalo, and Kobe for extra; prices were not listed on menu. 

*Mini-burgers (1/4 pound patty)-$4.75-$6.25
*Special Burgers (1/2 pound patty w/ various fixings)-$7-$9
*Turkey or Chicken Burgers: $5-9
*Hotdogs: $4-$6
*Entrée-sized Salads: $8
*Fries/Garlic Fries/Sweet Potato Fries/Onion Rings (can also get combo of fries and sweet potato fries OR fries and onion rings): $1.99-$4
*Shakes: $4 or so, +.50 for malt

CC's accepted.

SERVICE:
The menu is posted up on the left side of the wall. You order at the front and they call out your number in about 7-10 minutes. 

AMBIANCE/DÉCOR:
No frills, small diner feel; several tables and window seating for about 10 people max. 

PARKING:
Street parking is a bit difficult since it's located in the TenderNob.

Don't get me wrong, I love burgers but NOT ones that squirt and drip oil. After all, I do want to be able to live to 30 years-old w/o having to get a triple by-pass. 

Perhaps, I ordered the wrong thing or came on an off day, so for now, I'm going to be super generous and give Pearl's 3 stars. Maybe I'll have a better experience next time with their less fattier options like Buffalo or Estancia. *Fingers Crossed*
author: Cherylynn N.

description: These burgers were the bomb!!! Even though it took awhile to get our food... who wouldn't want to wait for a HUUUGE JUICCYYY TAAASTYY SCRUMPTIOUS burger of all time!!!! Take it from a fat guy who loves to eat great food and grub at this spot!!!
author: David V.

description: I had a mini burger with bacon and cheese... it was delicious! * BEST FRIES I HAVE EVER HAD! *
author: Brianna H.

description:
I am not a huge hamburger fan... but when my friend took me to this little burger joint
I fell in love!! This cheeseburger (basic; cheese, lettuce, mayo & ketchup) was the best burger on the planet! And the french fries were amazing!! They were crunchy but still just right. I am so happy that I got to experience this place which makes me think of visiting it real soon!
author: Danielle D.

description:
Milkshakes are thick, creamy, and delicious, and come in a bunch of interesting flavors! Definitely the highlight of my meal. Sandwich-wise, I had the pesto chicken... and found it disappointing. To be fair, it'd been built up a lot as like, the best burgers ever, so the standards were high, but my pesto chicken sandwich was on the overcooked side and the flavor didn't make up for it. 

Next time, though, I'll definitely go with a beef burger - which everybody else seemed to be enjoying. Going a tad healthier's not worth the possibility that I'm passing up a delicious burger for a lame chicken sandwich.
author: Kristin M.

description: The service here is very friendly. I got the mushroom burger and that was yummy. The mini is a good size, and get with a side of sweet potato fries. I'd definitely come back!
author: Judy N.

description:
My boyfriend introduced this place to me and omg it's seriously delicious with a reasonable price!

I  came here on a Thursday and it wasn't that packed. When I walked in, my first impression was "what a small restaurant" but after observing the surroundings, I realize that it's actually a pretty chill place to just enjoy a nice burger.

I got the teriyaki chicken burger. It was SOOOO good. My mouth wouldn't stop watering. I also got the side order for sweet potato fries. The burger size was huge! I was super full after my meal.

I didn't give this place a 5 star is because the bathroom was dirty and they didn't have toilet paper OR paper towels :(
author: Anny W.

description:
If you like juicy, flavorful burgers, this is the place for you!

Wide selection of regular (+ mini) and specialty burgers including quality beef (100% grass fed, free range), buffalo, turkey, and veggie. They also have an array of grilled chicken specialty sandwiches and salads, fries (regular, sweet, chili-cheese, and garlic), onion rings, hot dogs, coleslaw, and shakes.

Sample menu: http://sanfrancisco.menupages.com/restaurants/pearls-deluxe-burgers/menu

We all enjoyed our food. I had the 'Spicy Sly' Grilled Chicken sandwich (sautéed onions, peppers spicy sauce, jack & mayo). Had a nice kick. The sesame bun was light, fluffy, and wonderful. It soaked in the sauces and juices of the chicken. Sweet potato fries were tasty, but a tad salty. I'll request no salt next time.

Clean bathroom with grease-cutting soap to wash up after. No mirror, so bring your own or ask a friend if you've concerns.
author: Cathy K.

description:
FOOD:
1.) Phat bobb = Pretty good, reaally drippy. No wrapper/dooofer, and even when I tried to make one with the paper, it soaked right through. Has everything like the smokehouse burger, bbq, bacon.. was there an onion ring in there? If there was I think the sauce made it soggy like the way the buns got soggy. I think next time I'm just getting the regular cheeseburg
2.) Regular burger with cheese = Yum Real taste of fresh meat, cooked medium.. with the perfection of cheese mmm. And I believe it had all the normal lettuce, tom, onion.


SERVICE:
Order pickup at counter. They're so popular and busy they seem a little stressed haha. Awesome that they open til 2am Fri-Sat!

ATMOSPHERE:
Touches of 50's diner look with the metal tables, ketchup mustard squeeze bottles, silver napkin dispenser.. Tiny place, only fits like 4 tables and small bar seating facing out the window. At least they have a bathroom in the back.
author: Angela L.

description:
Pearl's never disappoints. Their burgers, fries and onion rings are consistently made and delicious, I also appreciate the option for a mini. Can be a bit pricey for a burger and frings, but worth it. A solid spot to satisfy your craving. 

A special thanks to JOSH for his awesome customer service... and for the box!
author: Laxme G.

description:
I don't think I've ever had such an amazing burger at a "fast food" place. In N Out is good, Five Guys is good, but this one sits on its own throne. I got a Mushroom burger cooked medium rare and the juices from the meat was so good that I was in a burger coma. The price was decent and I even got a side of chili cheese fries. The burger was a pretty good size packed with a lot of mushrooms. This is definitely one of my favorite burger places in Cali. Next time I go I'll try the buffalo or kobe.

The only thing I can see here is that the place is very small. It'll get very busy and packed but they told us that they are opening up another store that's bigger soon. Definitely will be coming back soon..

Oh yeah, the surrounding neighborhoods is a bit sketchy.. I found out the hard way walking from the Intercontinental. Took a cab back.
author: Jacob H.

description:
When will Yelp institute half-star reviews?  Man... Pearl's is great, a solid 4.5 stars, and this is coming from a (mostly) vegetarian who never really liked burgers to begin with.  

My boyfriend freaking loves the place, and since it's a short 2.5 block walk from my apartment, he will often frequent it when he's not feeling one of my vegetarian legume-laden dinner creations.  I took a few friends from out of town here last night, and after a long day of San Francisco sightseeing, a delicious and fatty meal was just what they were craving.  I got the teriyaki veggie burger with grilled onions - it was huge and dripping with teriyaki sauce.  So, so good.  I think the most genius concept going at this restaurant is the combo sides, like the frings (fries and onion rings), springs (sweet potato fries and onion rings), and the spries (sweet potato fries and regular fries), because sometimes you just can't decide.

I'm knocking off a star for the prices, which were raised again pretty recently; $8.99 for a burger is steep, especially when it's $3.49 for a side.  I'm, however, adding half a star for their pickle bin.  I love pickles!!
author: Laura C.

description:
