This place shits on every other burger joint in the city.
If i lived in the city id gladly ear here for breakfast lunch dinner for the rest of my life. I would want to die eating a pearls deluxe bacon cheeseburger on kobe.
Pearls ftw.
Plus doode that runs the place is extremely down to earth.
author: mrvc r.

description:
Finally came back! And left satisfied!
Ordered a king i think, the one with the hot dog in the burger. It was amazing! A hotdog burger how dope is that. The patty was medium rare, tasted amazing. We ordered garlic fries as well. The fries were super salty and garlicy but i didnt mind it. The next time i come back im going to try the pesto burger, that looked amazing. Im surprised this place hasnt expanded just a little bit because there is no room in here. Its fine though because the food is more than enough to hold this place down. 
I love burgers!!
author: Andre W.

description:
The reviews are right on.  One of the best juicy burgers around.  Menu is posted on the board above you near the front entrance.  Order at the front counter and pay; given a printed number on the receipt, get a table, and listen for your number to be called

The place only seats 15 people. 5 tables of two, and 3 stools along the window.  Luckily, we arrived around 11:30 a.m. and got an empty table.  

Everything is ala carte.  Of course my girlfriend and ordered the deluxe burgers with side order of fries and a soda.  Expect to pay about $14+.  I had the 1/2 fries 1/2 onion rings, and she had 1/2 fries 1/2 sweet potato fries.  Onion rings breaded just right.  Great fries.

I had the mushroom, grilled onions, and jack cheese burger.  She had the bacon cheese burger.  Burgers cooked "medium" unless otherwise specified.  

We both bit into our burgers, and agreed they were the juiciest burgers we've tasted.  Grilled so the juices are retained.  True, the meat itself could have been tastier, but didn't take away from the essence of what it takes to make a good burger.

We amazed ourselves by eating everything.

Smaller appetites can go with the mini-me burgers.  Larger than the size of a White Castle burger, but smaller than your average burger.  Maybe 1/4 lb. versus our 1/2 lb.

Skipping dinner tonight!
author: Shirley N.

description:
In one word "meh."

Fabulous customer service, and maybe it was an off day because with 1000+ reviews I expected a fabulous burger as well. 

Sampled the Prized Pearl and my favorite part was the enormous sauteed onions. The burger was under seasoned and just not tasty. Tried a regular cheeseburger as well, and had the same verdict. I didn't appreciate the untoasted bun. Grrrr. When isolated one by one, the ingredients were quality, but it all just didn't come together.
author: Irene B.

description:
(See pic)

I was in the mood of a burger, sweet potato fries, and a milkshake. Came back for the buffalo burger with pepper jack cheese, fries and coffee milkshake.

The burger was really juicy dripping and very tasty. Fries and shake were so good and filling that a lunch like this would cover your dinner too!
author: T L.

description:
first off, skip the sweet potato fries

i was getting over the flu and had a very weird craving...burgers. so this is the place I chose. now mind you, i don't usually eat junk food, or bacon for that matter. but damn, that burger was sooooooo good, especially with the bacon and the pineapple in it..*drool*
author: Long C.

description: This place is horrible. There is nothing special at all about the burgers. They are super greasy and my burger came out undercooked and cold. I don't get how this place has such great reviews as they are highly misleading.
author: Justin G.

description:
Awesome burgers for a reasonable price. S loves their buffalo burger, as well as the Bula. I actually thought that sounded gross when I first went there with him, but it actually ended up tasting better than the burger I got.

It's a small diner-type feel - and instead of paying money for a nice restaurant, you pay for amazing food. They are usually really accommodating - often substituting lettuce wraps for buns for my paleo-eating bf.

All in all, a great burger joint.
author: Alison C.

description: Just ate here after looking up nearby burger spots. The pics looked awesome so we gave it a shot. I got a spicy sly, flings and chili while the b/f got a phat bob and a coke. Everything was really good and the burgers are huge! The chili was just ok but we still downed it. Next time I'll have to try the mint Oreo Shake. The guy at the register is super friendly and makes sure the line keeps moving fast. Not many places to sit but still worth trip :)
author: Cynthia S.

description:
One of my favorite burgers in SF! Me and my fiancé have tried all different types of burger joints in SF and this place is definitely our top choice. The food is tasty and the price is right. 

We both always get the classic cheese burger, fries and strawberry milk shake! All three are tasty! Especially the fries. I grew up working in a restaurant, eating fries weekly (which is bad) so I know what good fries are. 

There are a couple of times, where I would get the other types of burgers here, but at the end, I would always go back to the classic cheese burger. 

Anyhow, good place to get your burgers and fries.
author: S S.

description:
As my co-worker perfectly stated, "Pretty good burger, but not the best I've had." Yes, Pearl's has a wide variety of burgers including buffalo and turkey burgers, all customizable along with the usual accompaniment - fries & soda. The place has a 70's diner feel to it and staff is efficient and friendly. Burgers are a pretty good size.

- Mushroom Burger: lots of mushrooms & cheesy, the way I like it. meat was a bit bland
- Spicy Chicken Burger: spicy topped with cheesy veggies, pretty good but again the chicken meat was a bit underseasoned
- Sweet Potato Fries: good - hard to mess these up, plain fries were ok
author: Linda C.

description: I've been here twice and to be honest I haven't  been impressed. First off this is a fast food burger shop and my meal (burger, frings, small coke) was $17. I repeat $17 DOLLARS!! This better be one of the best I've ever had for that price. Not even close!  The burger was bland and my Frings were overcooked. I almost sent them back but decided to just eat as I was hungry and it was busy. The burgers are huge and the toppings are fresh but that doesn't make up for the lack of flavor. I'll give them other shot someday but for now I'll find another burger joint. Nice employees though.
author: Jay G.

description:
How the hell did I not know Pearl's was right around the corner from my apartment? Boyfriend to the rescue! He mentioned Pearl's several times and kept insisting it was near me; I didn't believe him because surely I would have stumbled upon it at some point during the two years I've lived at this apartment.

In my defense, it could be easily missed. A small hole in the wall, you could walk right by it and never give it a second glance. But now that you know you could miss it, DON'T. The burgers are great and the onion rings are even better. I'm dying to try some of their milkshakes too. It looks like they have some delicious flavor combos. 

Solid, reasonably priced burger joint. Don't even think about going to Burger Bar when Pearl's is only a few blocks away. Seriously, don't even think about it.
author: Julia N.

description:
Dont have burgers very often anymore, so when I do I want it to be amazing. The spicy sly buffalo burger did not dissapoint. Perfectly cooked, juicy and spicy......yumm. 
The pickles and the cole slaw were also top notch. I like that the beef is grass fed and finished, and that they use great clean ingredients such as non GMO oil to cook their fries. Great friendly service.
author: Elen C.

description:
Sweet potato fries. 

Not something I crave everyday, but when I do I must have satisfy this need STAT.

Once hard to find, lucky for us it seems as if more and more eateries offer these orangey fries on their menu. Pearl's version is among the best. 

A slight crinkle on the outside, yet moist on the inside eating this fry is a near sexual experience. I don't smoke, but thought about lighting up after my first time.
author: V B.

description:
I have been told I need to tell everyone that Pearl's Turkey Burgers are awesome since my friends meal was quite tasty, however that would be the only item which was.

My burger came out, complete with a liter of grease and the condiments I had asked be left off, on it.

The "ranch" dressing that came on the burger was in such a small amount I had to go ask for a little cup of it up front and still, it didn't save the burger.

The bun was cheap and the chicken was cheap and chewy. I took one bite and literally set it aside.

That's seven bucks and a half hour of my life I'd like back now please.
author: Meg T.

description:
I'll keep it short and sweet. There have been two burgers in my life that I will remember forever. The first was in New Zealand, a tasty beef/bison combo that ruined fast food burgers for me forever. The second was last week at Pearl's in the form of their deluxe with cheese. Oh, and their fries! I could live on their fries.

Hardly a city secret, there's little wonder why over 1,000 Yelpers have flocked here. The service is great, the prices are spot on, and I must have uttered, "oh my...." between bites a half dozen times. Be prepared to carry out as the small store is always packed. Love it. Will share it with all who come to visit.
author: Erin O.

description:
I still love love love love L-O-V-E this place with all my stomach. I've learned some new tips for eating at Pearl's though...so follow some simple steps to a streamlined visit to Pearl's.

1. Know what you're going to order or others ahead of you. Most times they're regulars and don't want to be rude and tell you, "are you ready yet?"

2. Know which type of  protein you're going to pick out. Is it the Estancia? The Mini? The chicken burger? What temp? Be prepared people 'cause there are lots of options here.

3. Fries? Strings? Frings? Springs? Milkshakes? There's like 20 different options so again, know what the hell you're doing. I empathize with newbies overwhelmed but be strong and firm about selections 'cause you just can't go wrong with any of them.

4. Have money ready at all times. (a $20 should suffice.) For my mini Phat Bob, order of Springs and a chocolate banana milkshake, it usually comes out to about $15 and the change which goes directly into the "Sex People Tip Jar." Who can argue with that logic really?

5. When  you receive said bundles of joy promptly delivered by the cooks usually (and I have no idea how they who ordered what but they do), I advise taking rings and possibly your watch off and secure them in a pocket. Why? The juices-that's why. You'll be so busy wiping beef juice and habanero pumpkin, bbq, or pineapple sauce off your fingers, why not save your poor jewelry some damage? I found my burger trying to make a run down my sleeve the last time and luckily my watch was already in my jacket. Whew!

6. If dining in, I suggest a counter spot if possible so you can get some sufficient people watching in and enjoy a nice breeze by the window. You can relish in the fact that you're enjoying one of San Francisco's best burgers and at the same time make others jealous when they see the joy on your face.

My latest recommendation is the Phat Bob. Organic beef with jack cheese, bbq sauce and two fat onion rings paired with a side of sweet potato fries can never do you wrong. My last visit to Pearl's took 20 minutes from counter to mouth wiping. It was that damn good. Take my recommendation and save yourself the heartache of lowering your standards to a place like Jack in the Box of Burger Joint. Eat at Pearl's and support local business. Your mind and stomach will thank you (and me.)
author: Jessica K.

description:
messiest thing evarrrrr but I DON'T CARE! It was super super delicious!

I had the Teriyaki burger with mushrooms, lots and lots of teriyaki sauce, and swiss cheese, with a side of springs (sweet potato fries and onion rings). I'm about to keel over just writing this. Everything was hot, fresh, and tasty, just how i like it!
author: Jenny C.

description:
Came here in the pouring rain and ordered a Phat Bob with a side of sweet potato fries. 

 First off, the burger was HUGE. I seriously couldn't finish the whole thing because it was really big and super greasy.  I mean, I didn't really expect anything less from a burger stuffed with bacon and onion rings, but still. Next time, I probably would go for their "mini"  size instead. Taking off a star because I thought that their top bun was too dry. 

Anyway, I left feeling really satisfied, especially with their sweet potato fries. 

Pearl's is definitely a good burger joint, and you should give it a try anytime you're getting the craving for a burger.
author: Tiffany S.

description: Good food, a bit expensive but it's worth it. Payment with cash only but there's an ATM inside ($2 fees for international cards).
author: Yoann D.

description:
Why is it so difficult to find an amazing burger place? The places you expect to be good are lackluster at best, others are slightly better than McDs, yet the prices are bistro level. 

Pearl's is approaching the level of great. I wouldn't say they're the best, but they're definitely up there on one of the better options. There's a good range of toppings, styles, and patties, as well as all sorts of fries and onion rings. There's also the milkshakes of awesome, which I've had once ever. I'd love to have one ever time I go here, but it's hard to justify a 1000+ calorie ice cream drink, especially if you're slightly lactose sensitive. Seriously, Nutella milkshake? Yum yum. I'll have to go by here some day just to get a milkshake and nothing else.

If there were a Pearl's closer to my workplace I'd go more often. This is definitely up there on good burger places in the city.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
Good food. Friendly service
Mr. MP had a vegetarian burger which he really liked and I had the garlic fries. Both excellent. We were told that gluten free burgers are also available. I wasn't in the mood for a burger that day, so I can't comment on taste.
author: M P.

description:
The best burger I've had in San Francisco.

I hate when I go to a burger place, plonk down $8 for a burger, and after eating it, thinking that I would've been happier spending $2 for a burger at In N Out.  This hasn't happened here.

The burgers are kind of expensive for the actual facilities (tiny and in the TL) but they are incredibly juicy and fairly large.  Their regular fries are a little soggy for my taste, but the sweet potato ones are on point.
author: Jenn C.

description:
Any place that serves buffalo burgers almost automatically gets five stars from me. Seriously. I love me some bison. This place serves it up, and they serve it right.

Beyond the buffalo, there's a whole assortment of meat and cheese and bread combinations that you can put together here. Turkey? Yeah. Chicken, yup. Chili burger? Got that, too. They will all blow your little taste buds away, and have you coming back for more. But really, you gotta try the bison. }:)
author: Wes T.

description:
DELICIOUS BURGERS AND BOMB ASS FRIES!!!

definitely a cool place to grab some food and go!
author: Jaime D.

description: Great quality fries and milk shake was pretty good although I would've preferred less chunky blueberries but at least it's fresh! Burgers were very well compiled, I asked for medium rare and it came out medium for my buffalo burger, next time I'll ask for rare I guess. But I digress, this place definitely cured my burger cravings.
author: Adelbert Y.

description:
Delicious burgers! If you enjoy spicy, I highly recommend the spicy sly. It has pumpkin habanero sauce, peppers, mayo, and jack cheese. It's best when consumed with their nutella milkshake. The cold, sweetness of the milkshake is perfect to counter the spiciness. 

The phat bob and the prized pearl are also good but the spicy sly is definitely my favorite. Their fries and onion rings are nothing special. If you're still hungry just get another burger! You can order them in mini sizes. :)
author: Alice J.

description:
OVERALL:4.5

FOOD: 4.5
SERVICE: 5
AMBIANCE: 4
VALUE: 4.5

I dunno how else to put this, but this place f***ing rocks my world.  Juicy burgers (organic Niman, grass-fed Estancia, or Kobe!!), regular/sweet potato fries, [malted] MILKSHAKES....Coronary irresponsibility never tasted so delicious!

Almost fried my brain deciding between the Bula (spicy pineapple teriyaki, swiss, bacon) and the Pesto (basil pesto sauce, jack, mayo & tomato), but ultimately couldn't turn down that bacon.  Threw in a Nutella milkshake & sweet potato fries for good measure (you know, it'd be such a shame to let all that artery space go to waste).  Less than 10 minute wait for 5 burgers, even got a complimentary order of fries!  Delicious, thick, creamy shake, hot crinkly-cut fries, and that burger...!!  Soft, toasted sesame bun crammed with a perfectly moist medium-rare patty drenched in tangy gooey sauce.....drrooool...wouldn't advise this for prissy types, cuz you're gonna need a wad of napkins, handiwipes, and preferably a hose down.  Leave your white silk blouse at home--go naked if that's all you got, but freakin' get your burger on already!
author: Amy K.

description:
Hrm, I don't know what all the hype is about--sooo...

+decently clean for being in the tenderloin
+about 12 different types of burgers/chicken burgers to choose from with toppings like pineapple sauce, teriyaki, bleu cheese, habeneros, etc.
+quick service

however...

-the coke i got from the fountain was flat; there was enough soda water in it; too much syrup...yuck.
-i ordered with NO MAYO, YES on the lettuce, but my order came back WITH mayo and NO lettuce (-__-);;
-the burger i ate (PRIZED PEARL: bleu cheese, bacon, grilled onions) was quite bland in flavor...it needs a kick or something
-the SPICY SLY BURGER, which i sampled from my friend, wasn't at all spicy like they advertise it to be with habaneros and such
-the burgers are almost $8 ... and they don't come with fries! i was gonna order sweet potato fries, but i already spent 10.80 on a soda and burger.   I know they are "NIMAN RANCH" beef burgers, so it adds to the cost, but my burger looked like it was going to topple over and it didn't look too gourmet despite the beef it claimed to have

overall...i'm not sure i'd come back unless i wanted a quick easy burger...cuz their special burgers are kinda sloppy.. they really didn't get my order right...and they need to test their soda once in a while to see if it's still soda-y.
author: victoria y.

description: Its was a little shocking when my order was over 20$. The food was incredible tho..huge burgers well made . good selection of sides and shakes
author: nancy w.

description:
My first experience with Pearl's was .. sub-par.  Perhaps it came down to two main mistakes: the over-hype from the BF which set my expectations through the roof, and the decision to order burgers for pick-up to devour at home (out of convenience and one part laziness, of course).  

Upon their arrival both our burgers were a bit soggy. The meat paddy was juicy, and I really enjoyed the sesame bun on top. I don't remember the exact burger I got (which speaks to how unmemorable it was) but I remember thinking the depth of flavor in the accompanying sauce needed exploring.  However, sweet potato fries are always a must for me if they're on the menu, and those did not disappoint. 

Overall, the flavors were good but nothing exquisite. Given the reviews by serious burger-ites and my bf's devotion to this place, I will give Pearl's another try, but this time, I'll make the treck for an in-house meal (their house, not mine).
author: Roxane W.

description:
On the plus side, the burgers are fairly large.

On the negative side, the taste is average to below average.  The flavor of the food is pretty bland and you have to add a lot of condiments to make up for it.  Also, if the owner is there, there's a good chance he will start trying to talk politics with you.  It was very annoying because he would not leave us alone and kept spouting really far right conservative opinions at us.  I finished my burger as quickly as possible just so I could get out of there!
author: G. T.

description: This place is amazing. My friend has a severe food allergy and the owner was incredibly friendly and made sure the cook washed his hands and wore gloves. The burger was soo good. The free pickles are fantastic. The Pearl Deluxe was delish!!! Come here for the shakes and fries too. Actually everything is great!
author: Andrea N.

description: The burgers are 5 star restaurant quality, and I love how they ask you how you want your burger cooked, I'm sure we all hate a burger that's super well done and dry, which is how a lot of burger places cook them, so it's really nice when you can have a say in how you want our burger party cooked. The regular French fires are okay, I feel like they're a little too thick which makes it not as crunchy. It's also great when you can pick the size of your burger (quarter pound or half pound). The portions are great size for the price. The sweet potato fries and the mint Oreo Shake, so good, I always want to stop by on my way home just to get one! The customer service is superb, everyone is so nice and friendly and professional, and they keep the place super clean and organized. Even the condiment table is always clean, there's never any spilled ketchup or stray napkins!
author: Rose B.

description: This review is for their nutella milkshake and sweet potato fries. It was, amaze-balls.
author: Kathleene E.

description:
You had me at frings.

For the milkshake connoisseur and the burger lover in all of us. Pearl's is a classic burger joint with a twist. You can pretty much get any kind of milkshake you would normally want. They even have a Nutella flavored milkshake! They offer frings (fries & onion rings) as well as springs (sweet potato fries & onion rings) or spries (sweet potato fries and regular fries.) I'm not a sweet potato girl myself, so I'll stick with frings. 

I like that you can get a mini burger because whenever I get a 1/2 pound burger I don't know what to do with all that meat. It's perfect Sherae size! Yum!
author: Sherae H.

description: So freaking good! My dad and I came to San Francisco for a few days and we ate here for lunch. Really great tasting gourmet burgers for 8.99$ you can also replace the meat with other types of meat or tofu. They also have a lot more to choose from besides burgers! If your looking for a good burger joint around the area this is it!
author: Anna B.

description:
Featured on Food Network = I'll be right there.

I got the Pearl's Deluxe mini burger, perfect portion size for me. Was so tasty.

I thought it couldn't get any better until I insert a sweet potato fry in my mouth. WoW.. fried perfectly so it's lightly crisp with a hint of sweetness.

Simply delicious. *thumbs up*. They need a bigger place to fit more customers!!
author: Karen P.

description: This is the best burger place in Tendernob. Bula Burger and Prized Pearl are the bomb. Not to mention their nutella milkshake is so richy and good. I eat here at least 1-2 times a week.
author: Long H.

description:
Pearl's came highly recommended and it didnt disappoint! I imagined a larger restaurant with a diner feel but this place is really just a counter and a few very limited tables. It does get busy but the line moves pretty quickly and most people do order their food to go since there isnt a lot of seats available.

I ordered the Phat Bob and my GF ordered the Mushroom burger with a order of Frings (fries & onion rings) that we split.  Both burgers were tasty and cooked perfectly. Its a big greasy burger made with fresh ingredients at a decent price, whats not to like? Typing this review is making me hungry.
author: Chong K.

description:
Whenever I'm craving a good burger and am down for a 2 day run to work off everything I just ate, I come here to Pearl's. 

The mini delux usually does it for me, but the bomb burger is my absolute favorite. The coconut milkshake is to die for. If coconut isn't your thing, all the other flavors are just as good. Everything on their menu is pretty much amazing. 

The place is a little small, and parking can be a real pain in the buttocks though. On crowded nights, order and pick up. Although eatting in is best, Pearl's beats no Pearl's.
author: Jeanette P.

description:
Pearls is definitely a locals spot.

The milkshakes are the best thing you can get from the menu. Burgers are decent. But the favorite is hands down the Oreo mint milkshake, yum! 

Service is good and they have pickle spheres on the side for your burger, love that! Pricing is ok and there isn't much seating so this is a good place to swing by and take your order to go. 

Definitely check it out!
author: Brittany S.

description: Amazing! Fast and friendly service. Big portions. Burgers are well balanced, juicy and smooth meat, just the best ingredients.
author: Radek J.

description:
Pearl's Deluxe Burgers in San Francisco is your typical hole in the wall burger joint.  It is located in the Tenderloin/Nobhill district so it's not filled with too many bums. There are a couple tables, 1 table that seats 4 and 2 tables that seat 2 people.  There's is also a counter style table by the window that seats 3 people.  

On to the food.  My boyfriend ordered the Prized Pearl with kobe beef and blue cheese and I had the Mini Deluxe Burger with American Cheese.  We shared the Frings (1/2 order Fries and 1/2 order Onion Rings) and a Nutella shake.  

BF asked for medium rare but his meat came out well done.  My burger was cooked perfectly.  I asked for medium rare and it came out nice and pink on the inside and super juicy.  The regular burgers are 1/2 lb and the mini burgers are 1/3 lb.  The mini burger was a good amount of food considering I still had to eat Frings and the shake.  Burger bun had sesame on top and was toasted perfectly so it was soft but also had a crunch. Meat and veggies were very fresh and pickles were yummy. The onion rings were prob best I've had, stayed crunchy the entire time and didn't fall apart. The nutella shake was nice and thick and they give you a boba straw to drink it so you don't have to waste too much energy sucking the life out of it.  Tasted mostly like a chocolate shake, would've liked a little more hazelnut flavor in it.  

All in all, we would come here again.  It'd be nice if they offered some In-and-Out yellow peppers but they do give you unlimited pickle spears.
author: Elaine C.

description: I think this is THE place for burgers in SF. Affordable, really good comfort food - what more can you ask for? Their burgers are effin fantastic. I like my burgers a bit charred and they did a great job. The onion rings.. Heaven!! Omg. One of the best I've had tbh. The coating was just perfect. Thanks also to the server who suggested we just order one (me and my friend originally wanted to order one each and he kindly suggested that we order just one because it was enough for two). Definitely a place to go to :)
author: Mara E.

description:
My fiance and I decided to try this place because well, we were hungry and wanted to try a new place. We used yelp to see how the reviews were and since this place had a high average, decided to try it out, and we are glad we did.

The burger was good. It wasn't like super amazing or anything but was still pretty delicious. It was a think patty which I love, but wasn't juicy, which I don't love. 

I think our favorite part was the frings. An order of half onion rings and half french fries. I absolutely loved the french fries (they were crispy and just delicious), and my fiance loved the onion rings, which I agree were delicious. I can see us making a visit some time soon just to order some frings. 

It was kinda pricy. Two burgers and an order of frings totaled about $22.
author: Lisa L.

description: Recommend by a friend who had a great experience, and I was not disappointed. The Prized Pearl was loaded with grilled onions, blue cheese, and mayo atop a half pound patty that was cooked to perfection. Side of house made garlic fries ( with real garlic ) rounded out one of the best burger joints I've ever visited.
author: Rob P.

description: Nice people. Wasn't that busy around lunch time, surprisingly, considering the amount of reviews of this place.  I went around 1130 on a weekday and there was plenty of parking. I got the mushroom burger and although it was pretty good, it didn't make my taste buds do a little dance like I expected them to.  Lots of mushrooms on my burger and it was dripping with juice. I'd put it above Islands and Fuddruckers.  I wasn't a fan of the fries, though. Came out piping hot but also a bit crispy and battered.  I would come back for the burgers but I can pass on the fries.
author: Gary L.

description:
"That is one tasty burger" I found myself saying this alot upon my visit to Pearl's in San Francisco. 

Hungry after a draining morning at the Moscone, I needed some lunch and I wanted to go off the map a bit so we didnt hit the convention crowd. 

We trekked uphill about a mile to get here and I'm glad we did. 

I had the Hawaiian Burger and it was unbelievable. This was definitely a fantastic burger although the fries were average. My compatriots in the burger pilgrimage were also very happy with their lunch.

The service was friendly and the bill was very good for the amount of food you get. These burgers are no BS, they are big. 

The next time I am in SF ill be going here again for sure!
author: Jeremy A.

description: It's sad the don't accept cards. Shakes are great. Burgers are to small for the money.  I tried the phat bob and it was to salty. I want a fan. Tasted like the BBQ sauce was too salty not sure. The meat didn't taste as fresh as I would of expected for such a high ranked place.
author: Thomas P.

description: One of the best veggie burger patties I've had. The garlic fries taste like they were fried in garlic infused oil and have loads of garlic on top.
author: Brent G.

description:
Oh-my-yummy-goodness. My favorite burger spot in the city. Their burgers are always juicy and delicious, with any assortment of add-ons you want. Their fries are also always amazingly delicious too. I'm not a big burger fan but I keep coming back again... and again... and again.

Oh, and the service is always friendly and fast :) what more could you ask for?!
author: Lucinda W.

description: This place was delicious. I ordered a 1/4 burger and it was the perfect size. My boyfriend got a 1/2 pound burger and finished it all. The fries were crispy and perfect! Freshly made too! Burger was juicy, got it well done. Not to much sitting space but the food makes up for it. Would reccomend to anyone who wants a yummy burger and a happy tummy!
author: Yesenia G.

description: Steep on price but deliver with taste! Best veggie burger in the city!
author: Josie C.

description:
I don't know what these folks do to get this flavor from their burgers but Pearl's is a winner. The buns were kind of a let down, though; they were a bit dry and cold. Still, not enough to deter me from future visits. Fries were great as well. 

My order was for take out so no input on dine in experience. I'm comin' back for more!

On a side note, apparently the economic recession has resulted in $3 oral sex offers from crackhead hookers in the surrounding area ( I politely declined). Just putting' it out there, kids. Safe travels.
author: Danny H.

description: Really really awesome burgers!  A tiny bit too greasy but you definitely won't be disappointed that's for sure.
author: Affan K.

description:
Are you looking for an adventure time burger joint with loads of interesting crack heads scampering around outside like the walking dead, crack head edition? then this would be your go to spot.

Yes it's in the tenderloin which is crack central down in SF, but they sure do have some delicious burgers. Oh they also have a mint oreo shake that will make you moan in sheer delight upon tasting it's pure magical deliciousness. 

I would def eat here again upon gracing SF with my presence another time.
author: Alex V.

description: The burgers were so flavorful and juicy!  Get the half onion rings and garlic fries basket.....so good!
author: Jennifer D.

description: My favorite burgers in San Francisco. I get the delicious Mini Phat Bob with small fries or garlic fries and I'm stuffed.
author: Kyle P.

description:
In spite of how much the opposite street corner smells of urine, this place is worth risking your shoe bottoms for a heart-stopping meal. Ok it's not that terrible for you, but it felt like it after eating 2 burgers.

The interior has a diner-like feel from the bright red and white in spite of the lack of booths, but most importantly, this place is CLEAN. The staff brings the food to you in spite of also giving you a buzzer to let you know when your food is ready. The 1/2 lb Deluxe, Kobe and Buffalo (as in buffalo meat, not buffalo sauce) burgers are served as standard burgers w/ the usual fixings, but we opted for the specialty burgers where you can choose to get a 1/4 or 1/2 lb patty.

The Spicy Sly packs a slow-rising burn, as the first few bites are no big deal but then you realize that you've got a great tingle going when you're halfway through the burger. The veggies are sauteed to appropriate done-ness, and the burger was cooked to medium as desired. The Phat Bobb was a bacon-burger like none other: this place serves fairly thick cuts of bacon and packs it in, to the point where I was completely distracted from any possibility of onion rings (no seriously, I don't remember if there were onion rings in my burger). For their garlic fries, they don't use garlic powder or flavored oil but instead put an ample amount of raw minced garlic on top of the fries, amazing! The chili cheese fries were a little disappointing as the chili seemed to consist entirely of beans (no onions, no meat, just beans), but the fries are batter-fried (a la Burger King style) so they have great texture. Additionally, you can get unlimited kosher pickle spears next to the soda machine. My only other complaint is that the bun is rather plain and flimsy and I wish it was made of heartier stuff, but then again, at the end of 1/2 lb burger x2 with 1/2 an order of chili cheese fries, your body will probably thank you for avoiding the additional carbs.

The prices here are really reasonable, and they serve a multitude of ice cream shakes (although I'm not sure if they use soft serve as there is a soft serve machine plainly visible at the register) as well as beer. I know I'll be coming back the next time I'm jonesing for a burger but too lazy to drive to Bistro SF Grill.
author: Gene C.

description: I go here for lunch as much as I can! I really like the 1/4 lb deluxe burger with regular fries and it fills you up pretty well. I still have to try the milkshakes which I've heard were super good :) I definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a good burger who's in the area!
author: Mariah T.

description:
I gave them a 2 because the service was great but the food ...not so much. I don't know if there are different cooks on different days but went in on Sunday afternoon. Got a mini bacon deluxe burger, fries and a coke. The burger was flat out BLA(H)nd, I wonder if they seasoned it at all. Bacon was half cooked and flimsy and the fries were just BOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!!!!!!! My gf enjoyed her sweet potato fries but after my meal I didn't want to even give them a try. My taste buds didn't deserve to be tortured. 

Can't believe people were double parking for this stuff?! I'm sorry but I don't get it, it's not even close to being one of the best in the city. 

With seeing a 4 star rating I had high hopes for Pearl's but I left highly disappointed:( 
I may try them out again but not before I check out other burger joints.
author: Troy R.

description: I live right across from here and damn am I lucky. Small, hole in the wall family owned type of a business but always crowed, very friendly staff and amazing burgers! I got the spicy sly burger and it was really good! Got regular fries on the side (nothing special) but the burger made up for it! Def going back for more.
author: Imran M.

description: Pearl's Deluxe Burgers is certainly aknifeandfork kind of burger joint.  I ordered the spicy sly and as many still need to discover, this place is DE-LEE-TIOUOS.  I don't eat many fries anymore but what I was seeing being ferried around by the stupendous staff, I am sure they will add to your mouthwatering delights.   Don't come with big crowds unless you want to eat outside and share with pigeons.  Do get some nicely cut dill pickles they have as a condiment.  Don't worry about starving after eating on of these monsters.  Do worry about getting a little messy.  Don't worry about it not being pristine and proper inside. Do worry how you will have some change left over for the parking meters you will need to feed and or double parking out front.
author: Tito Y.

description:
What Pearl's has going for it:
+ makes a tasty burger

What Pearl's doesn't have going for it:
- generic frozen fries that you've probably had in a school cafeteria or the like
- the place is small
- it's kind of dirty
- way overpriced, my cheese burger, fries and drink were like $14 before tip
- not organic, I gotta compare it to Super Duper who are all organic and cheaper too

If I want a cheap and tasty burger and fries I'll just go to Golden Coffee, which is next door to my apartment, and pay less than half of what Pearl's charges. If I want crazy good burger and fries then I'll go a bit farther to Super Duper Burgers, who are still less money than Pear's while also being all organic, much better tasting burgers and fries, more seating, cleaner, etc.

Not necessarily a bad burger joint, but still, I see no reason to return to Pearl's.
author: Vivian A.

description: This place is worth a try.  The staff was very friendly.  The place was clean and easy to find.  The food was great.  I had the spicy pineapple burger which had great flavor was cooke perfectly.  The sweet potato fires and onion rights were good.  I would go back.
author: Matthew B.

description:
Holy mother of burger goodness! 
Pearl's makes one mean Kobe burger. 

In fact the Kobe burger I ordered from Pearl's (which was called the Bula Burger) was voted the winner of the best burger in SF in 2008 http://www.sfweekly.com/bestof/2008/award/best-burgers-1034033/. 
One of the judges in the contest was Iron Chef Bobby Flay, so I knew their burgers would be great. 

The Kobe Bula Burger was amazing. The Kobe beef patty they used was big and juicy and was cooked to perfection (medium rare). Besides the Kobe beef patty this baby was also topped with crispy bacon, Swiss cheese, onion rings, mayo, and their delicious spicy teriyaki sauce. This burger was so juicy (not greasy) that when I picked it up and took the first bite all the juice from the Kobe patty dripped out of the patty, and down my hands and wrist. It was so tasty. 

To go along with my Bula I also got a side of their crinkle cut sweet potato fries. These fries were great. For a dipping sauce I got a side of their homemade pesto. Their pesto is pretty good but not the best I have ever had. 

To top off the meal I decided to get one of their homemade malts. OMG I truly think they have the best malts in all of SF. 
What makes them so good is that they use fresh ingredients when preparing them. I ordered a peanut butter and banana malt and when they started to make it I knew it was going to be great. They started off by pouring soft serve vanilla ice cream into a big cup, then they pulled out a fresh banana, cut it up, and threw it in with the ice cream. Then they took out a jar of PB and put 3 huge scoops into the cup. To finish it off they added some malt mix and blended all the ingredients u together. Words can't explain how good this malt was, I loved it so much. Every sip I took contained pieces of fresh bananas and PB. In fact I loved their malts so much that I went back the next night and ordered a blueberry malt made with fresh blueberries. 

Pearl's is a tad pricey. My burger, fries, and malt came to 25 dollars which is kind of expensive for a small, hole in the wall burger joint. I guess that since they use Kobe beef and nothing but the freshest ingredients that I really can't complain. This is one of those places that you truly get what you pay for.
author: Craig R.

description:
By 10pm, they ran out of the shakes -1 star. 

I'm still a fan b/c:

- I LOVE CRISPY DEEP FRIED FRENCH FRIES and their fries are all that I love about fries plus not too skinny not too thick. 

- Crispy chicken burger so tasty and filling enough.

- Blue cheese burger even better! 

All the burgers that I saw that I didn't try, are really big with the average price of $7. YUM!
author: Ss S.

description: When my wife and I visit San Francisco (several times a year), we stay in our timeshare one block from Union Square.  We are not really "tourists," because we used to live in the East Bay (about 40 years ago), so we know SF fairly well.  There are many places to eat around Union Square, but we don't eat "fancy;" we always look for some local "hole in the wall" to try it out, and we found a great one yesterday.  Pearl's Deluxe Burgers is a "fast food" kind of burger place, you order over the counter, find a table to sit down, or take out.  We ordered a Pearl's Deluxe ($8), a mini Pearl's ($5), and a large fries ($5, really large!), a bottled drink, and the bill was $22!  It was so much food, we were struggling to finish them (didn't want to waste any of these tasty foods!)  The burgers were some of the best we have ever had, or maybe the best!  The fries were also excellent, and the service was top-notched!  The Asian man (I assume he is "Pearl," the owner?) who took our order came by a couple of times to make sure everything was OK with our meal; who does that in a "fast food" joint.  McDonald's?  We shall definitely return, and soon!
author: Akihiko Y.

description:
To quote the lady next door to my hotel room, "Yes!!  Yes!!  Yes!!   Oooohhh!!!"  That kind of orgasmic wonderlust is usually only reserved for hotel rendez-vous's and whatever else my naughty neighbors are experiencing.  Because I eat cupcakes instead of work out, my "Yes!! etc." moments are found at places like Pearl's.

Yes!!

Spicy Sly Chicken sandwich with grilled peppers, onions, cheese and spicy sauce.

Yes!!

Hand-cut garlic fries filled to the brim and served in a large, red, plastic platter.

Yes!!

Super thick, homemade (extra) peanut butter and chocolate milkshake served with an extra wide straw, so as to not suffer any of that sucksuckwheeze business.

Oooohhh!!!

All for, about, $16 despite with the high SF tax and food mark up.  It's super filling, (relatively) cheap and unquestionably San Francisco-y.

Seriously, there are some thin-@ss walls here...
author: Johnny T.

description:
I've been going here for 8 years and I've never been disappointed. Great burgers, great shakes, great onion rings and great staff. 

I could go on about my deep and abiding love for Pearl's, but the reviews seem to already back me up. Instead, a brief aside...

They used to serve buffalo meat for just a few bucks more. As of 4 or 5 years ago, it jumped up to $8 for buffalo instead of beef. That's a big ask and it's not backed up by the price you see for ground buffalo at other locations. I understand buffalo hit a supply crisis a while back, and maybe that's not over, but I can't believe buffalo meat today is twice the cost of high quality beef. I hope they revisit this. 

Buffalo or not, this place will give you an outstanding burger than can stand toe-to-toe with the best in the business. Five stars.
author: Phil D.

description: Had a hard time finding the location, their sign is faded so you have to get closer and make sure you're in the right place. Inside the location is clean, the staff is friendly and helpful. They only accept cash, but have an Atm available right next to the cashier for your convenience. Their menu is pretty good and has a lot of options. The veggie burger with cheese and mushrooms was delicious, it was really big I wasn't able to finish it.
author: Natali Q.

description: Amazing burgers. Juicy! Messy! Yummm. The owner is super friendly. Excellent service.
author: Heather S.

description:
Man, the diet just keeps failing. I hadn't planned on a big dinner, but when some friends mentioned going to a favorite burger joint of theirs, how could I possibly ever say no?

So I went for the Spicy Sly burger. Packed with grilled peppers and onions, as well as a habanero sauce, you'd better be ready for some serious heat if you're going to take down this bad boy.

It turns out the habanero sauce on this burger is vinegar based, which intensifies the heat of the habanero. The vinegar was perhaps a bit of a turnoff simply because I wasn't expecting it, and there may have been a bit much, but it's hard to complain when you've got grilled peppers and onions everywhere, right?

Shared some frings with a friend - they were good. Tried my friend's Oreo shake. Delicious.

I imagine this place gets super busy, but we lucked out and were able to seat 7 people as soon as we ordered. I'd totally go back, but probably go for something a bit mellower next time.
author: Conrad B.

description:
A few reviews have referred to Pearl's as a "hole in the wall." I have to set the record straight. The restaurant is small, and the furniture is inexpensive, BUT it's clean and cheerful and full of natural light, even at 6:30 in the evening. Also? "service with a smile" doesn't begin to cover it. The service is friendly, laid back, and welcoming. Love it.

But best of all, of course is the FOOD!!! Veggie burger? Check. Buns: Awesome. Garlic fries--no pissy powdered garlic here. There had to be an *entire head* of freshly chopped garlic on those bad boys. And...and...and...two words: NUTELLA SHAKE.

Their Zagat rating is well deserved. I am one happy (and well-fed) tourist.
author: Jessica G.

description:
On the last night of a recent vacation to SFO, I went to this place mainly due to the overwhelmingly positive reviews and the fact that we were looking for a quick bite.  From the moment that we stepped in the door, it seemed like things were going to go well.  Our order taker took the order quickly and efficiently.  After our order was placed, I decided to take a look at a copy of a the most recent health department findings.  These findings included mouse droppings in a storage area, etc.  I immediately began to reassess our choice of venues.  I tried to put this out of mind and thought that maybe this was a "one-off"  situation.  While we were waiting for our order to come up, another order taker, who I assume may have been a manager, began barking at the customers who had previously ordered food.  Our food order came up and we took this verbal abuse of a sign to get out...and fast.

Once we arrived back at our hotel, we unpacked what we had ordered:   2 deluxe burgers w/ cheese, a large order of fries and an order of onion rings.  With that said, the highlight of the meal was the fries.  The burger was tasteless (no salt, pepper or other herbs) and more than likely was from a box of Sam's precut patties.  The onion rings were burnt and tasted like they had been fried in old oil.  Somehow the fries were cooked properly in the midst of the rest of this culinary chaos.  My bf ended up throwing out at least 1/3 of his burger.  I was thoroughly unimpressed and I have no idea what all the glowing reviews are for.  This visit was the culmination of 5 days of lackluster food in SFO and this was by far the worst.  Where I'm from, burgers may not be super fancy but, they taste good at the very least.

http://www.yelp.com/biz/lankford-grocery-and-market-houston#query:lankfords
author: Mark M.

description:
TATANKA!!!

I have slayed my first buffalo. I love how they have the buffalo nutrition facts posted up on the wall. I usually hate bloody, juicy burgers, but this one didn't bother me because it was so damn yummy! That has got to be the tastiest burger that I've ever had in my life! I just wish that they used better bread for the buns.

And OMFG the mandarin orange shake is so yummy! It tastes like a creamsicle with actual chunks of mandarin oranges in it. Ohhhhh, I need to fly back to SF stat just for Pearl's.

P.S. I wasn't really impressed with the garlic fries or the sweet potato fries, but they aren't bad either.
author: Lauren H.

description:
My friend and I searched on Yelp! for a suggestion for lunch in the city. Pearl's was highly recommend and now I see why.
The burgers were juicy and cooked perfectly. The battered fries and onion rings were heavenly (order them together as "Frings"). 
My only reason for not giving this tiny restaurant a 5 star rating is the parking. It can be a nightmare!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Pearl's is sort of that rite of passage for people moving to the city - whether you're some art student living in one of the many dorms in proximity to it, a transplant with a few friends that just found out about this place (and Cancun/El Farolito), or now, tourists that saw this place on the Travel Channel or something. 

It's been crazy. But instead of cracking under the pressure, they've staffed up and really took their game to the next level. They've consistently serve up a solid burger. Gone are the days of the soggy, thick, lazy fries they used to have. Now they're light, battered, and stellar. The shakes are shakes, plain, simple and fat-making. The crowds can be something to contend with on some days, but on others, it might randomly be dead. Go fig. Still a damn good burger.
author: Roy M.

description:
EXCELLENT! And Delicious!

This was our first lunch stop on our trip of San Fran. The place was not crowded and was very clean.  And the staff was very pleasant and helpful. Oh and all their beef is 100% Grass Fed.

I ordered the Deluxe with Cheese and my hubby the Spicy Sly Chicken Sandwich. And we got an order of "Springs"....the greatest thing ever....1/2 Onion Rings, 1/2 Sweet Potato Fries. Everything was delicious!

It was the best meal i had in San fran and can't wait to have it again.

Definitely Recommend.
author: Rachael B.

description:
Pearl's is very around the cornier of my office, a very convenient place to grab a burger.
I order a mini cheese burger and the size it was perfect for me, about the taste it was ok nothing outstanding.
In general I will recommend this place, it is convenient and prices are ok.
author: Inna M.

description: Burgers are great! Everybody that works at Pearls is very friendly and they work pretty effect!! CASH only. They have an ATM. Get a milkshake while your at it!
author: Cristi B.

description: My husband Loved the buffalo burger and I loved the veggie burger. The fries were the best because they were crispy (almost tempura like).
author: C S.

description: Best garlic fries I've ever had. Nutella shake was delicious too.
author: Rond Allen D.

description:
I feel like such a fat bastard after eating here, but it was so delicious that I really don't care all together that much. In fact I care so little that I'd be willing to feel that way over and over again if it meant I could shove this beast of a burger down my gullet. The Phatburger is just amazing. I thought I had consumed some good burgers in my day, but this one is really up there. Great meat cooked perfectly on a yummy seeded bun and a bin of pickles you can eat at will? Yes! 

The downside of this location is the lack of seating, but if you manage to snag a table its a great experience. I would seriously eat this thing standing up outside in the Tenderloin as a dog pissed on my leg, but you've got to get the rings too. The onion rings are so crisp they shatter in your hand and they give you ranch or blue cheese dipping sauce. Fried fatty onions dipped in more fat. What a concept? How bad can that be? So bad its brilliant. 

P.S. - Tyler Florence I love you!
author: Stacy T.

description: Ok, the burgers were great. The fries were great. But holy cow, the shakes were AMAZING. I had a nutella and banana shake and let me tell you, that's the closest thing to heaven on earth I've ever experienced. Owner is super nice and down to earth, too. Highly recommend!
author: Sara S.

description: Wanted to try something new, so my boyfriend and î decided to go here while we were in town visiting! The food was amazing!!!!! The best burger I've had in a really long time!! It was delicious!! I would definitely go back!!
author: Margaret Y.

description: Fast, delicious, and inexpensive. Best place for a casual/quick bite with friends.
author: Rachel W.

description: The Nutella shakes are still amazing but everything else?  It took a tumble and the BBQ sauce on my burger made me sick the rest of the night.  We went through a lot to get it to so it was doubly disappointing.
author: A. S.

description: Spectacular burger, the guy in the cashier was the nicest person I ever met in a fast food place :) will def be back when I'm craving some burgers! :)
author: Sara C.

description:
I am not a big burger fanatic like most people but i am very fond of Tyler Florence. (c'mon ladies, you gotta admit he's cute.) So I watched "The best burger I ever had" on Food network the other day and memorized Pearl's Deluxe Burgers and found out it was not far from Berkeley. Since I was on a road trip in North Cal, I stopped by the lovely Mill Valley for lunch.

Here is how I break it down - 

Environment: It really is a small place. There are probably 6 tables. Unluckily, most people eat pretty fast so I was able to find a small table. Pearl's is clean but a little dark. Restaurant is unisex and pretty clean as well. (3-star)

Staff: They are pretty friendly and speedy. I noticed they ran out of pickles and asked them if I could have some. The cashier said they would put some more out and within seconds, the bucket was full again. (4-star)

Food: I ordered Pearl's Phat burger (medium rare) with cheese and bacon and a small side of fries. My food arrived within a few minutes and boy! it was PHAT! It was so big it could not fit in my mouth! And the patty was so juicy! It was dripping! Their fries was crispy, fresh, and, hot! Now I understood why Pearl's had been so many people's favorite! Half way through the burger and I was already full but it was so so good so I kept eating till the last bite! I can't wait to go back again! (4-star)

Price: Fair. 

OVERALL:  3.8 stars

* Besides the famous Phat burger, their award winning Hula burger looks good too!
author: Amiel C.

description: I'm going to go ahead and agree with the masses that Pearl's delivers the best burger in the city. I live up the street, there is no better place for an instantly and flawlessly prepared burger than here. Love it!
author: Drew P.

description: Was looking for a nice burger and came across this place! Absolutely amazing burger, delicious fries and milkshake and a nice coleslaw to complete my meal. Can only recommend it! Oh and the people there are super nice too :)
author: Katharina Z.

description:
The good: the onion rings and sweet potato fries
The bad: The burger is fairly average, and really greasy
The ugly: I had heartburn for 6 hours!

This was one of those times that Yelp failed me. You get large, greasy burgers, but they're not really that good.  Too much bread and an average patty made this a boring experience. Though the onion rings and sweet potato fries were both great.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Order: The Winning Burger (Bula Burger w/ onion rings and kobe beef) with Frings and a Cola
Cost: $19.20
Burger Layout: Sesame seed bun, Swiss cheese, Spicy teriyaki sauce, Swiss cheese covered onion rings, 1/2 lb Kobe beef patty (medium), Mayo, Spicy teriyaki sauce, bun
Fries: Half onion rings - Half fries

Walked right past the place when it was the destination and didn't even notice. Walked back and went in the place. Maybe 6 tables and a bar with 3 seats that faces the streets. Stared at the menu for a long time before deciding on what to get and finally decided to go with the "Winning Burger" that had apparently won at an event with celebrity judges including Bobby Flay. 

The burger was a mess. I stared at it for a good minute before squeezing and attacking. The drip was immediate - mayo / teriyaki sauce coated the bottom of the basket. Amazing flavor though, so much coming from the sauce, but you still got crunch from the onion rings, the smooth cheese flavor, and the oh so tender kobe beef. The bacon provided a nice salty crunchy kick as well. The burger really was truly phenomenal, even if it was a sloppy beast.

The frings were only half necessary. I ate some onion rings and had no room for the fries... which were terribly inferior to their oniony counterparts anyways. I had also tried some sweet potato fries which were amazing. If I went again then I would go for the springs (Sweet potato fries and onion rings)

The main thing to watch out for here is the price. The meal I have described above was just under $20. I would say it's worth it to try once, but it's enough to detract from the perfect rating. 

4/5
author: Nick W.

description: I'm not sure if they've gone downhill since opening, or whether I was initially overexcited by having a legit burger place around the corner. Either way, I'm just not feeling Pearl's these days. The regular burger is lackluster and thinner than I prefer. We always order ahead, but it's pretty clear that they don't start cooking until we get there and pay. And they took my beloved Black Forest shake off the menu! These days we'll almost always walk the extra blocks to Slider's on Polk, which has really upped its game.
author: Lauren C.

description: I came in here at a friend's suggestion. This tiny hole-in-the-wall makes some tasty burgers. There are so many choices. I opted for a mini which was plenty for me to eat. Add sweet potato fries and you're set. The prices are reasonable and the place is tiny so don't bring more than a few people with you or you will have a hard time finding a table. It's a bit tucked away in the TL but totally worth seeking out.
author: Amy J.

description:
Hella good! the bula burger was perfectly sized, great tangy pineapple flavor, and soooo juicy! f*ck i want another one. It's yummy.

takes about 10mins for food to come out but dang worth the wait. Small inside, only room for about 10 people to sit. But dang its hella good.

I'm in San Jose, Pearl's is in San Francisco. I might drive over there to get some cuz its hella good

wait, its hella good!
author: Nathan P.

description: This place was heavenly. Me and my friend are from SoCal and we wanted some good burgers. And this place didn't fail us! With their awesome staff and amazing burger, this place was truly a pearl to is! Next time we go to SF we are for sure coming back here!
author: RJ T.

description:
I've lived a block away from Pearls for over 2 years, but hadn't gone until yesterday. I was sooooo excited for a good burger. The coleslaw and sweet potato fries were good, but I was really disappointed with the burger. 

My burger was so juicy...but not in a good way. There was so much bright red juice that the bun turned pink and soggy, and my hands and sweet potatoes were drenched. Juicy is good, but I didn't order an au jus. Also, the burger was packed really loosely together, so there were little holes throughout the meat and it actually seemed really light and didn't have any flavor in the meat itself.

I dunno, I'll probably give it another chance just in case I got a bad burger, but I wasn't impressed.
author: Monika M.

description:
Very big and very good burgers, and the shakes were awesome too.
I wish there was more seating because it can get pretty busy.
author: Amanda M.

description:
This is probably not the best burger I've had in my life, but probably is the best burger I've had in California.  I've had the bbq with onion ring burger, the mushroom burger, and the one with spicy pumpkin sauce and they were all great, although the mushroom burger was my favorite because the topping didn't overpower the delicious flavor of the meat. The fries, onion rings, and sweet potato fries are all great. I would say the fries are my favorite of the three. Breaded deliciously.

You'll pay about 9 bucks for a half pound burger or 6 for a quarter pounder (Turkey or Beef). They also have Bison and Kobe burgers for an added charge of 4 bucks, but I haven't tried those.
author: G S.

description: One word: YUM. Delicious burgers, incredible milkshakes, and a Spock memorial on the counter...definitely one of my favorite places to eat. The burgers are so juicy and well seasoned, the pickles are crisp and slightly spicy, and the milkshakes are amazing.
author: Meagan S.

description:
This is where the burger bun meets the road.  I love this place.  I pride myself on knowing what a tasty burger is and this place gets an honorable mention.  Pearl's is not one those gourmet, use expensive Gouda cheese, toast my burger bun over an open fire with glitter and gold type joint.  They stay humble to it's ingredients and give enough tender loving care to their food to make you want to slap yo mamma for attempting to say, 'I can make this at home'.  OK, maybe not the last part, but it's worth checking out.  

I had the 1/2 lb Phat Bob burger cooked medium rare with bacon, jack cheese, BBQ sauce and onion rings with a side order of sweet potato fries.  Yeah, It's a man's meal or for any female that knows how to get down.  Put this meal in front of me and don't even attempt to put your hands anywhere near the table.  They may be bitten off....yeah that includes you, Beyonce.
author: James M.

description: First time eating here and really enjoyed it. I had the "Prized Pearl" and an order of Spries. The burger had nice big grilled onions and just the right amount of blue cheese. It was juicy and had good flavor. I would say it is the best burger I have had, but it was really good. The patty could have been better, otherwise definitely a good burger. I would definitely come back.
author: Michael F.

description:
A couple of tips re: Pearl's:
1. if you want to sit down inside, be prepared to wait for a table because there are only a few inside.
2. If you don't want your burger to be bloody and rare, err on the side of telling them to overcook it (at least that's what it seems like from my one experience).
3. If you're fine with the basics and you have a small appetite, the mini burger will definitely suffice.

The burgers here are tasty, the fries are yums and the milkshakes are super tasty.

I also really liked the people who worked here. They seemed to really care about the customers, whether it was bringing the food to the table, finding a take out box in case you wanted one, etc.
author: Rachel R.

description: Great burger joint! We ordered the Bomb and a burger that had onion rings and bacon! Everything's better with bacon . Oh don't forget the garlic fries.  This place doesn't disappoint .
author: DAWN W.

description:
I thought it'd be appropriate to write up Pearl's Deluxe Burgers as my first review.  After all, I have Yelp and Stephanie K. to thank for first discovering Pearl's for me. 

A couple years back, my friends asked me where I wanted to celebrate my 23rd birthday.  Having just seen and been visually tormented-and-delighted-at-the-same-time by the How I Met Your Mother episode "Best Burger in New York," I couldn't resist requesting a similar search right here in our beloved little City by the Bay.  

Even with my hyper-inflated birthday expectations, it somehow did not disappoint.  (That's saying something, too, seeing as how I suffer from chronic "birthday deflation-itis."  Happens regularly, once a year or so.)

I've been back maybe a dozen times since, and it always hits the spot.  Except for maybe, in all honesty, one time: when the level of juiciness destroyed my bun.  However, I just can't bring myself to complain that much about a burger being too juicy.  (I really can't...this doesn't count.)

And sorry Beatrice T., but I've come here a bunch of times with groups of 5 or 6 people at prime dinner hours, and never had a problem with seating.  The place is small, for sure, but a lot of customers go the takeout route.  Those who do stay and eat are usually pretty good about moving on when done with their food (when there's obviously other people in need of seats).  Probably not the best place to hang out for a 2-hour meal anyway, unless you just really like no-frills/no-booths diner ambiance.  It's not perfect, but the turnover system has worked well enough in my experience.

Can't ask for much more from a burger joint.  The shakes are delicious, and are made with fresh ingredients for each flavor (fresh strawberries = awesome).  And gotta love all those different flavors to choose from.  The fries come out hot and crispy, and the burgers juicy and flavorful.  Extra cool points for offering kobe beef and buffalo burgers.  I mean, cool for meat-eaters.  Sorry to my vegan and veggie friends...all 3 of you.

Dear Pearl's, although Mr. Bartley's in Cambridge (http://www.yelp.com/biz/mr-bartleys-burger-cottage-cambridge) has since inexplicably stolen my heart/arteries from you, I'll be a customer as long as you keep up the good work.
author: Emmanuel H.

description:
Pearl's is one of my top five burger joints in the city.
It is quite possibly the best burger in the city--and the whole bay.  Simply said, they get all the basics for a burger right:

1)  the bun.  must be fresh, toasted, warm.  This is probably equivalent in importance to the actual meat itself because the bun touches your mouth first and is the first texture you feel as you bite down into the burger and chew it.  Pearl's gets it right, toasted, soft, chewy, with sesame seeds on top.  Don't get me started about how often this is screwed up in all the new "gourmet" burgers in SF.

2)  the meat.  A good blend of lean meat and fat, cooked to order.  Since Pearl's actually cook it to order most the time, I go with their Bison meat which is leaner and has more flavor than the american kobe which is fatter.  The specialty burgers all have a full 1/2 lb patty which is glorious and very satisfying.

3)  the cheese.  melted and hot on top.  hard to screw this one up.  decent selection of cheese.  I know they have swiss, cheddar, blue, and of course american.

4) veggie condiments.  cold, fresh.  again, most places don't screw this one up.

The Bula burger is awesome:  swiss cheese melted on a huge burger cooked to order with their homemade spicy pineapple BBQ sauce and a perfectly toasted and fresh bun.   Honestly it's really hard for me NOT to order this here.

 The King burger (with a hot dog on top) was good too, but it didn't quite work because the hot dog just slipped right out of the bun when you bit down.  might work better if it was somehow made into a patty or chopped/sliced up.

I should add:  their fries are lightly battered so they are kinda like giant tater tots.  both the regular and sweet potato fries are seriously good.  They may even be double fried because they resemble belgian fries in a way.  And the onion rings are really good too.

Pearl's is conveniently located 1 diagonal block from my favorite watering hole, Rye.  so yeah... I go fairly often.  :)
author: Fong L.

description:
WORDS CANNOT EXPLAIN HOW MUCH I LOVE THIS PLACE.

Pesto kobe beef burger, sweet potato fries, and a mint chocolate milk shake... salivating.

I know the prices are pretty high up there, but it is worth it. This place is a must-go when you come visit San Francisco!
author: Sara D.

description:
Really good burgers, had both the pearl deluxe with cheese and the bbq burger, they are quite messy and massive, but overall delicious!  Service was good too, guys were friendly.

Downfalls: cash only, location/parking is tricky, space is limited, and a bit on the pricey side for a hole-in-the-wall burger.
author: Grover W.

description: Really good burger options as well as great fries and onion rings. Highly recommend.
author: Bill D.

description:
Very good burgers!

This location is on a busy street, so I'm not so sure about parking since my boyfriend and I parked in a garage about 3-4 blocks down and walked to Pearl's. Immediately we were greeted by the cashier who noticed my jade bracelet and made small talk about it. After looking at the menu for a good five minutes, I tried the mini Deluxe burger while my boyfriend got the Phat Bob. For the people who can't decide on fries or sweet potato fries, Pearl's has the option of getting both: Spries!

It took about 5-10 minutes for our orders to arrive. Typically at these pay and sit down kind of joints, you have to pick up your food when your number is called. The workers actually brought us our side of piping hot spries and delicious burgers to our table. Good service! While I was eating, I noticed that the workers also bus the tables right after a person is finished eating which is a plus! 

The burgers are freaking delish man! Just the right size (cashier mentioned that the mini burgers are 8oz and deluxe are 12oz) and the fries are amazing! Possibly the best fries from a burger joint that I've ever had. I don't know if they're breaded or not, but they're so good!

Overall, I'd highly recommend!
author: Joyce E.

description:
Delicious in a divey, unassuming, just-plain-good-food kind of way. I got the spicy sly which is covered in tangy habanero sauce, grilled peppers and onions. It was amazing and I ended my meal looking like I had slaughtered something with all the sauce on my hands. The patty was really juicy! Only complaint is that the buns are kind of soft and started to fall apart, but all in all I'm a big fan.

The portions are big here. I can eat a lot, but I'll probably have to go for the mini when I come again.
author: Lisa W.

description:
So I've been living near this burger joint for almost a year and never knew about it until a friend told me about it! I've past by this place so many times and never even glanced in. This place is real low key and cutty, doesn't even look like a burger spot on the outside. 

Anyhow, I've had the Spicy Sly and the Mushroom Burger and they are both so filling and delicious. Talk about gourmet burger without the gourmet price. And of course the sweet potato fries are an added bonus.
author: Tam T.

description:
Awesome prices with great quality food.

To keep it short and simple, the burgers are made with great ingredients.  Burgers are totally juicy (however, my friend's medium was med-rare/rare....no bueno). I was very happy with mine.

If I wasn't so satisfy with my burger, I would take off a star due to the small seating area.  There was two girls hogging FOUR extra chairs...her friends finally came after 20 mins; we were basically half way finish with our meal. Park is hard if you are driving to this location.
author: Eddie C.

description:
As we continue the search for the best burger in San Francisco, we stumbled upon Pearl's Delux Burgers last Saturday night. I have no idea how we missed this unassuming establishment for so long. It isn't as fancy as a Sliders or as trendy hip as Umami Burger in the Marina, but it's damn well tastier. 

We hit up the Pearl's in downtown San Francisco on Post and Jones. There are two other locations, one in SOMA and another in Alameda. Pearl's has an assortment of standard burgers as well as some out-of the-ordinary choices like the Bomb Burger, an open faced burger smothered in chili, shredded cheese, and diced onions. I chose the mini-burger (1/4 lb.) as opposed to my husband who chose the Delux (Standard) 1/2lb burger. The burger was absolutely melt in your mouth delicious. Pearl's doesn't offer a "topping bar" like Sliders, because the burgers speak for themselves. No need to dress them up. Two points for Pearls also in that they had a bucket of serve yourself pickles on the counter. (Yum) Pearl's also offers fancy burgers like Kobe beef and buffalo meat for almost double the price. 

I'd say my second favorite thing about Pearl's besides the delicious burger is that the Post location is right down the street from 2 international hostels. I couldn't figure out if I was in a hostel common room or an actual restaurant in San Francisco. I loved it! Listening to all the hipster travelers brought me back to my good old traveling days. I would probably walk the extra few blocks from our house past Sliders to hit up Pearl's just for the entertaining conversation.
author: Alice S.

description:
This burger joint is definitely a place to try out for yourself if you're ever near the Downtown area. They've got a great selection of mouth-watering burgers and a huge selection of milkshakes (which I unfortunately didn't get around to trying on my first visit)! I tried the Bula Burger and it was awesome! The burger was delicious and juicy! The burger and a side of frings was so filling, especially since the regular sandwich is a half pounder. The sweet teriyaki pineapple sauce that the beef patty is lathered with definitely tastes as good as everyone raves about and added a nice tangy kick to the burger! Their fries and onion rings were also fantastic - extra crispy and crunchy!

This place is definitely a neat little spot that isn't too hard to spot when you're walking along Post St. I'd definitely recommend it burger lovers all around! My burger and fring combo came out to be about $14, which is a bit pricey, but the portion size will keep you satisfied (even if your wallet isn't) for a while.
author: Cheston W.

description:
Definitely very good but didn't wow me.  The burger is excellent, juicy but not fatty.  Can cheeseburgers be healthy?  Not so much, probably, so this would have to be considered relatively healthy.  Please note that I'd eaten the lean specialty-meat burger on a previous visit and it wasn't as good as the regular-meat burger. 

I'm not a fan of their fries, which are battered.  I typically let the burger juices and cheese drop on my fries, though otherwise I wouldn't have finished them.  

Love the collection of shakes.  The mudpie was very satisfying, with little lumps of chocolate, while my pumpkin was underwhelming.  Plenty more to choose from, though, on my next visit.
author: Mike H.

description:
We all know how being under the influence can extrapolate the deliciousness of food, but luckily we had another friend who could make an uninfluenced assessment of our meal for the night. Parking is tough here, so just a forewarning. 

Heard about this from Eko A. and the roomie Lui B. Good burger joints are easy to find. it's great ones that you really gotta keep a look out for. This place meets the criteria for a bomb ass burger joint. shyeeeeah.

First off, I was in amazement of their sick ass menu. Not too often do I find a place that will have a combo of fries and rings, or sweet potato fries and rings, and other possible combos. The onion rings were redonk. Perfect crispiness, and the onion doesnt come sliding out after you take a bite. grrreat. The bula burger I ordered. Flavor inception success. I picked up the burger and got ready to dive in like greg louganis, but then a poop load of the spicy pineapple teriyaki shat all over my basket. Totally fine, just as long as I know the sauce is there. First bite was bliss. Bacon on top of that awesome sauce, stacked on top of a juicy ass niman ranch patty provided awesomeness. The bread often gets overlooked, but this one was sooooo awesome. A nice little crisp to it on the outer rim and soft tenderness on the inside. 

I'm rambling. I'll write an update with more burgers that I'm about to try from this place. 

P.S. I'll be sure to upgrade my patty to KOBE for 4 bucks more next time. FOR SHOW
author: Alvin P.

description:
After a busy day of errands I treated myself with a fat burger lunch. My boy TJ had recommended Pearl's to me before and I was close enough that I figured 'why not?' 

Wow I have been missing out. I love hand cut garlic fries. It takes me back to a hole in the wall place when I was a kid. Add to that this massive double cheeseburger. It was fresh and delicious! To top it off I went milkshake. It was a debatable choice because with that much food I was already pushing it. I managed to break out my big boy pants and take it all down - barely. Seriously I am still happy and full six hours later. Awesome bun, pickles, cheese, and everything. I think I might be drooling a little from the recap. That has to be a good sign!

Service was decent but it was pretty crowded. I liked the location as it was a classic little burger shop without a lot of frills. Eat, belch happily, and head out the door happy.
author: Nick B.

description:
The buns are too big and it fell apart.

I LOVE burgers and I am on a continuous hunt to find the burger joints that I will never go to again.......... and to find the ones that I love.

I ordered a basic cheese burger because that's how a good burger place should be judged- by how the standard burger tastes and I think that Pearl's other burger combos are probably better than their basic cheese burger.

Overall the burger wasn't very good but not really bad either.  However, the bun was terrible because it turned into a crumbled mess and totally fell apart.  I had to use a knife and fork to finish it!   The bun is also huge and has a mealy texture.  

Hot dogs, hoagies, steak sandwiches, sandwiches, and especially burgers MUST BE SERVED WITH REALLY GOOD BREAD, ROLLS, BUNS ETC...  Bad bread will RUIN any good burger, cheesesteak etc...
and Pearl's HUGE buns ruined what may have been a tasty burger.

Also, burgers to my liking have the perfect amount of tomatoes, onions, lettuce and cheese.  I have never been a big fan of Nations- "can I get some beef to go with my salad please!" burger.  BUT, Nations has great buns, dense and almost chewy, but not huge and overwhelming. Also, Pearl's put so many raw red onions on it that it dominated the overall flavor.  
 
I MAY go back to see if my crumbled bun experience was a fluke- but, overall................

THEIR BUNS ARE TOO BIG
author: Edmond S.

description:
Delicious, juicy burgers! I'm usually full at the end of my cheeseburger, so fries aren't really needed. However, it is the Nutella milkshakes that really make the meal memorable.
The service is always extremely friendly and the place is always clean. 
Stop by for a quick lunch if you're ever nearby!
author: Cara G.

description:
Ok so its a little in the ghetto.

The burgers are quite good, despite the trip through ghetto.

First off, this place is tiny, not recommended for bigger parties.  Mostly can seat from 2-4 people max with around 20 maximum.

Extra pluses for vegetarian options, you can basically make any burger with a veggie patty.

I got the pesto veggie burger.  Was freaking amazing.  Had it with the sweet potato fries.  Didn't think the fries were that outstanding from what I've had before, but the burger was awesome.

They also have an option of chicken patty, buffalo and kobe beef.
