So a large arrange of choices with the patties and the speciality burgers look especially tasty.

Would highly recommend if you are not too scared to walk through the neighborhood :P
author: Kameron K.

description:
I took my husband here for his birthday on request.  It was our first time, and he is a burger connoisseur.  We got the Phat Bob burger and the Prized Pearl.  Both were cooked exactly to order, and they were both delicious!  I loved that you had the option of getting a "mini" burger (1/4 lb instead of 1/2 lb) for cheaper.  It was a perfect portion for me.

We also got the "Springs", which is half onion rings and half sweet potato fries.  Both were delicious as well.

Staff is very friendly, and service is quick.  The only downside is the place is very small (probably not ideal for a large group), and it would've been cool to have an actual menu to look at, like the one they have on their website - it's easier to read.  The bathroom could also use some love, too.
author: Cortney M.

description: I love Pearls. I'm so glad they moved into my neighborhood. Definitely my favorite burger around. The patties are so juicy, delicious and huge. The shakes are bomb too. If you are looking for a good burger, look no further.
author: Nick N.

description: This review is only for the Buffalo burger. It was very average and I wouldnt be tempted to order it again. I think the only way to go here is to get a regular specialty burger. I thought the bun killed the burger taste.
author: Nate S.

description:
Asked for a medium, got medium rare (closer to rare), the bread was rather stale, the whole burger was on the cold side. Ended up throwing away half of it. 

I'd go back and demand a refund if the place was any closer.
author: Gleb P.

description:
One of my pet peeves is to look for great burger options and Pearl's doesn't disappoint.
Their burger are excellent and it's very obvious why so many folks love them.

They have an interesting selection of burgers and I picked the Spicy Sly Buffalo Burger
(with pumpkin-habanero salsa). It does have a nice kick to it but not overwhelming at all.
A good remedy for folks not used to heat is to order one of Pearl's milkshakes.
Pearl's also offers a variety of different fries (garlic, sweet, spicy). I went easy on the fries but could have eaten more. They are great, nice crisp and well seasoned.

It is a very small place so don't bank on being able to eat inside . but you can always have your burger to go and eat it in the (rental) car or stroll down to Union Square and eat it while people watching.

Overall a great place and one of the top choices for burgers in San Francisco.
author: Jan Mark H.

description: Nice burger joint and a lot of different options! I ordered the Bula burger and the sauce was a little too much for me but that is my personal taste :) Would like to come back again and try the Deluxe. Cash only but they have an ATM located in store.
author: Denise C.

description:
I go here because it is close to home, and it's pretty good.

I usually get a bacon-cheeseburger, which is tasty.

TIP: When you order anything with chili, the chili comes in a cup and it's a good portion. You can have a chili-burger and chili fries by only ordering one thing with chili and save some cash.
author: Joshua C.

description: Tiny little place, almost missed it! Strolled in 15 minutes from closing and was surprised to see two people still eating. The guy behind the counter was super friendly. I had a cheeseburger with bacon and fries. The fries were pretty dang awesome and the burger was pretty good too. Was sad I hadn't discovered this place sooner during my trip!
author: Patti C.

description:
As a person who loves me a good ol' fashioned, juicy, messy, artery-clogging burger, I thought the world might end when I found out that gluten was the culprit making me sick all of these years. Whaat?? No more bun with my burger? Now I have to eat it with a knife and fork? Or even worse, have people assume that I'm on a "low-carb" diet? Bluh. Far too complicated and way too boring.

So when I heard we were going to Pearl's for dinner, I was understandably little tepid. No need to fear, my friends. This place is like a quintessential backyard barbecue complete with burgers grilled to medium-rare perfection by your best friend's dad. And the bun issue? Turns out it's not. As soon as I uttered the words 'gluten allergy', they offered me a lettuce wrap and quickly warned against the fries (flour drenched, apparently). And that was just the pre-burger goodness.

Grilled to sublime pink-centred perfection, this greasy mammoth had me grabbing a napkin between every bite. Bacon, blue cheese, barbecue sauce - brilliant. Add some avocado and mushrooms and I'm the happiest girl in the whole wide world.

And what's that? A Nutella milkshake? Ohdearlawdsaveme.
author: Robin M.

description:
After reading that this place had the "Best Burger in the Bay" I had to try it. The combinations are nuts. I was salivating just reading the menu. I decided to order the Phat Bob with a side of garlic fries and a shake. 

The burger: Very savory and the combination of ingredients made for a good meal. But I'm not sure it's worth the $10. It's about 3/4 the size of a Red Robin Burger and doesn't really have any flare. I still think Five Guys makes a better burger. I'd say it was worth $5 at best. 

The fries: Very well cooked, not greasy at all. But good luck getting garlic salt on the fry. The garlic salt comes in clumps and doesn't really stick to the fries. So either you dip your fry in sauce and hope to catch some salt, or you stick a spoon full of the stuff  in your mouth and risk 72hr garlic breath.

The shake: This is one of the few places I've been to that makes everything with real ice cream and malt. The oreo cookie shake is a must.

Overall, I liked the place. I'd go back again and try a different combination. But if you take someone to this spot, expect to pay about $30 for a couple of burgers and extras.
author: Jorge H.

description:
This review can be summarized in 3 words: I Love Pearl... 
Honestly, there is not enough exclamations points in the world to express how much I love this place!!! 

My regular order is the the baby Bula Burguer with springs (sweet potato fries  and onion rings). The bula, simply put is heaven in a bun.
It is essentially, Pearl's twist on the Hawaiian burguer! it comes with thick cut bacon, swiss cheese and a pineapple teriyaki sauce. I've got to admit, I'm sucker  for everything Hawaiianish, pineapply, or bacony. Hell, I even love Hawaiian pizza and yes, I don't care to admit it. But this burger is something extraordinary, actually it was named best burger in the Bay Area by Bobby Flay! 
The onion rings are a bit disappointing. They are cut to thick so they get soggy in the middle, the batter is tasty tho. I don't know  if this is a new thing with the fries or what, but the last time I ordered Frings (french fries and onion rings) the fries came battered just like the onion rings, those were the best fries that I've ever had, super crunchy in the outside and soft in the middle 

Asides that, Ive tried the Phat Bob, which is pretty good, but nothing like my bula. The chilli burguer was really good too. They even have a low carb meal that is a lettuce wrap instead of a bun. The one that I had was kind of dry, so just go with the bun and go to the gym  longer.
Their milk shakes are amazing, I got the peanut butter chocolate, it tasted just like Reese's Pieces! 

This place never disappoints !
author: Angela R.

description: My crave for burger comes from the movie Pulp Fiction. And this restaurant made my dream come true. The milkshake is soooooo good and it's 5 dollars--just like what the movie shows. ^ ^
author: Nancy Y.

description: Best burger place ever! They BBQ burger with Avocado is mouth watering. Great service great food! Highly recommended
author: Oscar R.

description:
OMG! That was one heck of a messy burger, and a shake that was thick enough to be called a shake, but not so thick that it hurt my lungs just trying to suction it up through the straw.

So many different burgers, so little stomach room! Good thing there are "mini burgers" to remedy that at least a wee bit. If you're headed here on a date, please oh please don't get the pesto burger. Especially if it's one of your first dates. That thing was ridiculously delicious and ridiculously messy. I had pesto running down my fingers the whole length of that burger. It's nothing a few napkins couldn't cure, however, and it was washed down like nobody's business with my nutella milkshake.

Burgers and shakes don't get much better than those at Pearls, folks. No siree, especially when you see the look of satisfaction on the face of one of the staff as he asks you how your meal was and you can't help but gush about it. That in turn made it even better.
author: Wendy P.

description: Pearl's burgers are top notch, period! The best burger I have had in a really long time!! Try their BBQ burger... AMAZING!
author: Joel V.

description:
O.M.G: Spicy Sly: pumpkin habanero sauce, peppers, mayo, jack cheese and a half-pound of beef. If you missed it the first time, let me repeat: PUMPKIN HABANERO SAUCE!!!! 

Next time I'm going to get it without the peppers. For some reason, after reading "habanero sauce" I was expecting jalapenos or some other spicy pepper and the red and green sauteed bells showed up on the bun did nothing for the burger as far as I'm concerned. 

The sweet potato fries were also killer. Thin and deliciously crispy. My friend ordered the chili cheese fries, which I'm usually not crazy about and they were pretty legit as well, I kept going back. 

Do not pass this place by if you're in the area. You'll totally regret it.
author: Julianna T.

description: I forgot where I was referred to this place at, but I'm glad I took their advice. This place is a bit of a whole in the wall, and small, with limited seating, but the food is on point. I got a huge burger with all the fix-ins, and a tray of onion rings and sweet potato fries, Springs, as they call them, for a great price. It seriously hit the spot after about ten hours walking around the city.
author: Melvin D.

description:
How do I love thee - let me count the shakes.... 

After a thankful long walk to find Pearl's, we arrived. 

Naive Canadian girl (that's me): What is a mini burger? 
Cool Dude behind the counter: It's a quarter pounder flattened. So it's about this [insert fingers spread wide] big. 
Naive Canadian girl: I guess I'll have that (and thinks, I don't want to know how big the regular burger is then)

Loaded up with a mini cheese burger, "springs" aka sweet potato fries + peppery onion rings, I set to work on eating my burger by employing an old technique that keeps your burger and filling ratio at an all time right level, upside down. 

Am I in love with their fresh burger toppings, the melty cheese in flavours gouda, blue, or cheddar and the onion rings? You better believe it!

And ever lucky me, my co-eaters were both draining peanut butter chocolate milk shakes that they generously shared with me -- creating just the "right size" shake for my lil booty... and then we walked all the way back to the office, bringing all the boyz to the yard with us!
author: Crystal H.

description: I found this place thanks to yelp! It was SO good. The service was great!!
author: Patty A.

description:
I definitely love that place! Burgers are excellent, the meat is juicy and tasty, the bun is perfect. They've some extra burgers, I taste the bulla burger which is very good and huge ! I also recommend the fries which are crispy and very different than the usual one !
Eating in Pearl's it surely meant to be in a food coma at the end of the meal !
author: Valentine F.

description:
I humbly apologize to the 1025 reviews that come before me, but Pearl's did not live up to the hype.  

Maybe I ordered the wrong item? I had the Phat Bob: bbq sauce, bacon, onion rings, jack cheese. If the Phat Bob were a person in real life, he'd be a fat ass mess named Bob with his ass crack showing and who cannot get his sh*t together for the life of him. The burger was a dripping, greasy mess and I had to wipe my hands in between in each bite. The sauce overwhelmed the burger and made the bun and onions soggy. The meat was lackluster and underseasoned. I did not finish my burger and that's rare for me. 

I love sweet potato fries and was not very impressed with them. I thought the regular shoestring french fries were better. The vanilla milkshake was really sweet.

I may return to Pearl's and try a regular burger without all the crazy fixings. That may persuade me to update my review. Otherwise, Super Duper is where I will be going for my ideal burger fix.
author: Monelle A.

description:
If you're craving a burger (even if you aren't)... you need to come to Pearl's on Post Street. The burgers are big, juicy, and full of flavor. They have some very creative concoctions at Pearl's and I have to also say that they have the best milk/malt shakes I've ever tried! 

The location is very small and during lunch time they get REALLY busy, but you can reduce your wait time by calling your order in ahead of time. I thought I should make a recommendation- but everything is so good.. honestly! You can't go wrong with whatever you order.

Although they have other locations, this one is the best in my opinion!
author: Marisa D.

description:
I found Pearl's on Yelp because I had a serious and undeniable milkshake craving. Pearl's Nutella milkshake slapped my craving in the face. 

The sweet potato fries here are also good. I've personally had better veggie burgers elsewhere, but I like all the toppings, pickles and sauces they provide. That somewhat makes up for the somewhat mediocre patty. 

I will definitely be back here for more milkshakes.
author: Shreya O.

description:
I had been to Pearl's a couple years ago before I lived in the city and I remember it being amazing, so naturally I needed to go back once I moved to the city. 

I am sad to report that it was not as amazing as I remember it being. I ended up ordering a slider, I wanted a bison slider but apparently that is not possible they can only use beef for the sliders. So that was a little disappointing, but I went for the slider because I was not hungry enough for a big burger. The burger was ok, I asked for it to be cooked medium well, it was medium. It was topped with cheese, onions, tomatoes, lettuce, and mayo. 

I also ordered a side of onion rings, I got my order to go so by the time I had walked two blocks to my friends house they were soggy and unappetizing. 

Overall a pretty disappointing experience. I do intend to go back and get the turkey burger (that is what I had the first time I went there and what I liked so much about Pearl's) and I will make sure to eat there so I do not run the risk of my side getting cold.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Simple, tasty burgers. Options for both classic patty, lettuce, tomato, and onion fare as well as specialty burgers with onion rings, barbecue sauce, and the like, as well as two different sizes. They also ask you how done you want your patty, which is nice of them. Lots of milkshake flavors, a friend of mine got a coconut one and enjoyed it for what that's worth. 

Kind of pricey unfortunately. Milkshakes are on the cheaper side, ~$4 if I recall, but burgers can run from ~$6-$8 depending on the size and kind you want, no fries included. Not a terribly large venue either - had to push two tables together to seat 4, and the ambiance is decidedly hole in the wall - not unclean though. Single, unisex bathroom - clean other from the incredible amount of graffiti. 

Would be a solid 4 if the burgers were cheaper.
author: Ian S.

description:
Best burger joint EVER. 

Make sure you get the onion rings, fries and a milkshake cause they are all just as great as the burger. Price is great and really friendly service. I will definitely be back for more!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I swear I ate more than a ethiopian family of four.  I finished the Prized Pearl and felt an odd combination of  anxiety, pain, and pride.  

Louis CK once said "I dont eat until im full, i eat until i hate myself."  I have never hated myself more than after Pearls.
author: Paran Y.

description: Was amped to try this place and was severely let down. A $10 tasteless greasy and overall mediocre burger. The bun was the best part of the meal. The fries were uninspiring too. The free pickles were good but I CAN NOT recommend this place. Super Duper is way better and cheaper.
author: Ari K.

description:
I've noticed that my satisfaction with a 'burger and fries' type meal is directly proportional to the amount of napkins I leave wadded up on the table. After eating a Prized Pearl and onion rings at Pearl's, the napkin carnage was formidable. This is probably the best I've ever had. That title was, until today, probably held by the Rogue Ale House, which offered me a Kobe beef burger that seemed to have it all. Well, it didn't have enough -- and I didn't even opt for the Kobe beef option at Pearl's.

There is not a single thing that I would change about the Prized Pearl ... well maybe the fact that it left me too full to try the sweet potato fries, one of their milk shakes or any of the other amazing-looking/sounding burgers on the menu.
author: Art Q.

description: I have to say this place has one of the best burger i ever had, the price is too low for the meat quality, the first bite got me hooked to this place, it is fresh, and the grill taste of the meat is just heavenly good, the juice from the burger is like the prime-rib juice from a 5 star steak house, they also have mini potions, and KOBE BEEF !!
author: Philip H.

description: Had the pearl's burger with cheese and bacon and the chili cheese fries. We came here after having drinks at Jaspers and it was ok. It's a small little burger joint and we took up half the tables with 9 people. I would go back if I was in the area but wouldn't make a special trip to this place.
author: Minh H.

description:
Not only is this place open super late at night, but their buns make me enjoy sesame seed buns again.  Halleujah! Usually sesame seed buns have an overly sesame-ish taste, but these buns were perfectly toasted and textured.  

I ordered the teriyaki burger and it was juicy and mega messy (just the way I like).  The only thing I thought was out of place was the cheese.  Would totally eat there again when everything else is closed.  Yum it up
author: Lisa X.

description: We go here during DreamForce and the burgers are worth the hike. Best bacon western buyer I have ever had. Not fancy but ridiculously good. Awesome onion rings. One of the best burgers ever.
author: Larry W.

description:
First the good.  The sweet potato fries is really good.  Great even.  Sweet, crunchy, and soft all at the same time.  I've had better onion rings.  They were too crunchy hard and the not enough onions for me.  

I had the spicy sly and my man had the bula special.  We both requested side of the tomato, onion, and lettuce to add some fresh crunchy to the wet messy mix.  My burger was good, but I wasn't blown away at all.  The meat was grilled perfect, the peppers and onions were delish, but something was just off.  After several sloppy bites, I realized it's the buns.  Too big, too dry...a little stale and flavorless.  Damn...almost perfect.  The man enjoyed his bula special, but didn't care for the buns either.  Eh...Can't have everything I guess...or can't I?  I'll have to remember to bring my own buns =P

It's a very cute burger joint, albeit teeny tiny...but the service was quick and sweet.  

I think I'll try one of their mini burgers next time!
author: Je C.

description:
4.5 stars because it was small and if there is more than two of you going then it will be a struggle but boy oh boy was the food AH-MAZ-ING!!!!!!!!!!!!!

i don't even know where to really begin. The menu was single, they had basic burgers but then other options and more extensive burgers. I did the basic cheese burger with bacon, med rare, and fringe, fries and onion rings. The burger was so juicy and fell apart and made it a mess. it was AWESOME!!!!!!! 

I would def come back here and i highly suggest going! Just be prepared for it being tough to find a spot and you def wont want it to go, well depends on how you want it cooked, but the bun will just get soggy.
author: Hillary C.

description: This place is the spot if you're looking for a hamburger spot!!  Loved their Strawberry Milkshake! Oh, and is Cash Only!!!
author: Mayra S.

description: Good burgers of a different flare. I had the pesto burger which was really good. Milkshakes are delicious. The frings were good but nothing outstanding. The service was friendly. Super Duper burger is on par with this place if you're looking for a typical burger. The difference for me is the wait time. Had no issues ordering take out from Pearls, have had to stand in line for super duper for 20 min.
author: Erin W.

description: Very courteous.   We went on a Friday @ noon and didn't have to wait in line.  Very fast service, and good food.  We took ours to go, as seating for 5 is sparce in the downtown area.  Burgers, fries, onion rings and shakes!  Great choices,  and they make and weigh their own burgers.  Very tasty.  Highly recommend,  and will definitely go back.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Dont go here if you're trying to sit down and relax. The place is tiny and there is almost always no where to sit. 

Go here if you want a really satisfying and delicious hamburger. They have a mini burger that is less expensive and just the right amount, their regular burgers are pretty big so I usually opt for the mini, cause I need room for their fries and tasty shakes!
author: Dalilah A.

description:
Been here a few times now and it's a cool spot. Be prepared to spend money, especially if you want buffalo (+$4) or a tasty shake, but it's almost totally worth it.

The joint is tiny, with less than half a dozen tables and no waiting area, and to top it all of the line for the register is in between the eating area and the soda machine....turns out this is a problem EVERY time you go there.

Fortunately the food is top notch, with nice big burgers, excellent toppings and sooo many milk shake flavors. Of particular note is that you can get your sides (french fries, sweet potato fries, onion rings) half of one, half of another....good stuff.

I do have to say when you go there and drop nearly $20 it doesn't feel so good, cuz after all you're getting a burger, fries, and a shake and while it's on the opposite end of the spectrum you could get the same thing for $5 if you really wanted to somewhere else......is Pearl's FOUR times better? probably not.

That said I stop by here occasionally...but really I'd rather take the same money over to Bullshead and have their buffalo burgers. Mostly though it depends on where I'm at and whether I'm craving the best burger (Bullshead) or the best fries / shake (Pearls).
author: Josh S.

description: After finishing a nice happy hour, my friends and I stopped at Pearl's for the burger that we'd all heard about.  Truth is, it's a great burger, but does not portray any stand-out qualities.  Furthermore, one of the kitchen staff got angry at my friends as we were standing near the entry between the kitchen and dining area.  While the restaurant was packed, there was no other place to stand.  He angrily asked my friends to leave, immediately offering to refund them if they just exited the restaurant.  If Pearl's had more respect for their patrons we would return, but after this experience we will simply find another burger joint.
author: Daniel G.

description: burger was great. owner is professional and nice. hugeee portion so go hungry. a bit overpriced
author: Maggie A.

description:
Drool! It's a good thing this place is in a rather tough to park area and therefore requires effort getting to because otherwise I'd be getting FAT eating there more often. The burgers, the shakes, the fries...oh my!

I have tried the Bula, Phat Bob and the Prized Pearl or good, good, and AWESOME. Even though I have my burgers well done, the patties aren't dry. Each was juicy and full of that charbroiled flavor some of us burgervores love so much. I've also tried the Minto Oreo, Peanut Butter Chocolate, and Nutella shakes. Each of them thick and delicious. They give you fat straws to ease consumption. This place is the real thing!

Like I said parking is pretty tough, and the place itself is rather small able to accomodate around 10-12 people, maybe. The guys are always really nice. Anytime I'm even remotely in the area I know I'll be thinking about eating here.
author: Jose U.

description:
This place is delicious but I can't imagine eating here more than once every few months. The food is so heavy and they give you so much. Don't get me wrong, it is one of the best burgers I have ever eaten, and the fries are just as good. 

I had the Phat Bob, which is a burger, cheese, onion rings, BBQ sauce and mayo and it was perfect. They give you all the pickles you want, and ranch dressing for fries. The people working there are very nice as well. Very good place to eat.

The restaurant itself is very small so if you go there while its busy, be prepared to wait a while.
author: Matthew B.

description:
Pretty solid burger. Was turned on by all the positive reviews but turned off at what I got for the price. Friendly dudes working there... frings were bomb. Not much more to say. Still on the hunt for a kickass burger in the city.

Will visit again since it's so close to me and I get Dat Burger Itch so often.
author: Omid F.

description: Great place I loved the burgers and fries def will return! I went alone but next time im going to.have to take some friends it was great
author: Beto G.

description:
I love Pearl's and it's quite a bit of a walk for me to get there, otherwise I'd be there more often. However, I can see many reasons why people wouldn't be as fond of it as me...(see last paragraph)

Now if you're looking for a greasy and flavorful fatty burger and not at all worried about watching what you eat for that meal this is for you. The meat is cooked to whatever is your hearts content and on first bite the grease starts to dribble everywhere and the bread soaks in seconds. My favorites are the teriyaki sauce burger and the blue cheese and bacon one. Milkshakes are good but definitely more on the sweet and creamy side that was more popular in the 90s.

It is however a bit pricey for a hole in the wall feeling place. Bare minimum atmosphere, Tenderloin, and cramped if anyone is waiting for a togo order. You lose nothing in trying IF you know what you're coming in for. This is definitely not a 'clean' California style burger so know that coming in. Big filling burgers to eat on an indulging day with a milkshake, that's what they do.
author: Sam H.

description:
OMG! I'm not a burger person but I had the Spicy Sly Burger with Kobe beef patty and it was a delish! I kid you not! I wish my stomach was bigger so I can have more of it.

Oh, this is a small place and very casual. Limited seating. Tough parking (hey, you're in The City). Service is cool.
author: Kaycie Y.

description: The best hamburger and fries I have ate in SF !
author: Cécile D.

description:
Mini Deluxe- Don't  the name fool you. What Pearl's calls a mini is really a regular sized burger. I think this is the best burger I've had in the Bay Area. Better than Five Guys and better than In-n-Out

Sweet potato fries- awesome

Malt- My friend ordered this and let me taste it. It tasted like the inside of a whopper. It was like a cold and creamy whopper gut. Soooo good. I need to have another one of these before I die.

This place is small and gets very full. It's not the best place to have a going away party with 11 people (the reason we were there). 

It was a nice send-off for our friend that was leaving the Bay Area for New York.
author: Daisy S.

description: Excellent San Francisco burger place. High quality, wide selection and excellent customer service are just a few things that make this place great. Fries and rings are especially good. Only drawback is limited seating. Highly recommend.
author: John H.

description:
I visited Pearls for the very first time on July 16th (a Friday). Folks, I've already gone back on the 23rd and 30th. The burgers at Pearl's are SOFA KING GOOD that I plan go back for a fourth Friday in a row. I might have to make this a weekly thing. 

Their Pearl's Deluxe with Bacon is simple yet bursting with flavor, absolutely juicy, and super tasty. I've got my eye on a few of their Special Burgers too, the Spicy Sly and The Bomb were calling out to me during my last visit. They've also got a couple of killer sides such as garlic fries and onion rings which were quite delicious, I've yet to try their sweet potato fries. 

The staff is super friendly and they definitely have legions of loyal followers. You know a place is #1 (best of the best top gun style) when they're open until 2am on Fridays and Saturdays. 

PS - They also have a wide assortment of milkshakes (Nutella FTMFW). 

PEARL'S = 5+ STARS
author: Mar M.

description: My wife and I eat Pearl's almost every weekend (maybe more sometimes...).  It's amazing we're not fat. Place is awesome.  The burgers are so good.  They have Buffalo and Kobe beef burgers, which are great, but just a straight burger there is my favorite.  Shakes are solid too. Staff also great.  Cash only is a downside, but that slight inconvenience should not stand in anyone's way.
author: Kyle M.

description:
Popped in here on the way home last night, since we were passing, looking for a cheap, quick bite. Ended up being far better than I bargained for.

The menu is broad but simple - enough choice to keep me coming back, but not so much I worry about quality. Service was fast and friendly, as you'd expect.

The food, for the price, was very good. The burger, while a little wetter than I like, was cooked as ordered and pretty tasty. Well dressed, and hit the spot. The surprise highlight for me though? The fries! Very crispy outside, and not really salty. Had a weirdly pleasant donutty flavour going on. Not sure if that was intentional (or if I was just imagining it) but they went down a treat.

I will certainly be back to try the kobe and buffalo burgers as soon as I can.
author: Leigh H.

description:
Consistency + Deliciousness + GREAT service = Another solid 5 stars from me

I came here again today with a troupe of people, ready for some burger love.  It was, again, awesome and delicious, but this time, I need to comment on two nice things they did for us, which really made me appreciate them:

1.  The place is tiny, and the tables are set up for groups of two or so.  When we walked in as a group of 8, one of the guys working there immediately started rearranging all the tables and chairs to accommodate us.  That was super nice of them. 

2.  I ordered a mini deluxe with cheese and upgraded it to Kobe beef for an extra $3.99.   After I ordered, paid, and sat down to wait, the cook came out and said that the cashier made a mistake because they could only do Kobe beef upgrades for the regular half-pound burgers.  So, I told them I'd just pay the extra $1.50 to upgrade to a regular burger.  The cook, however, was like, "It's okay, we'll just upgrade it, no worries!"  That was SUPER nice of them!  Thank you, Pearl's!

So, yes.  Now, in addition to the great burgers, I am a big fan of the service and the nice-ness of the staff.  

THANK YOU!  5 stars this time + the 5 stars from last time = 10 solid stars!
author: Vivian C.

description: Traveling from Philly and the quality of the burger it's unreal....... I loved it #mustEatBurger
author: Zo H.

description:
Okay... where should I start.

We walked here from our hotel that we were staying at, and going in it seemed like a nice burger joint, kind of in the cut. So I'm looking at the menu and everything looks great. And then I noticed a sign saying that I could make my burger with Kobe Beef.

What other choice did I have? If you're presented with the chance to go kobe, you have to go kobe (talking about beef here, not basketball, even though it's also true.)

So I ended up getting the Phat Bob burger with Kobe Beef, and an order of Garlic Fries, and for my drink I ordered......no not a just a bland lowly soda, no, I ordered the holy grail of beverages, a Nutella Shake. 

It was amazing, the burger was huge and juicy, the fries were super garlicky and the nutella shake was a gift from the heavens.

A little pricey, but worth it.

We proceeded to rolling down the hills of San Fran back to the hotel.
author: Joseph H.

description: A bit overhyped but pretty tasty burgers.    We tried two different burgers based in large part from the Yelp reviews.  In our opinion, the food was good, but either we picked the wrong burgers or they are good, but not great.  My Pearl pick with blue cheese, bacon, and grilled onions was good, cooked to my liking (medium) but a bit on the greasy side and the onions were too large and overpowering.   Wife had the Bulga and the spicy pineapple wasn't too spicy.  Service was friendly and thoughtful.   Cash only is a bit of a drag.  Bacon in the burgers was really pretty good. If I was in the area again and wanted a burger, I wouldn't hesitate to try Pearls again, but compared to Super duper and In and Out, I would be hard pressed to opt for Pearls.
author: Bad News S.

description:
Pretty hungry tonight
Everything looked like an easy bite 
Ate the Pearl Deluxe
Right at seven bucks
Lost in the 1/2lb burger... that's right!

Came here tonight and had no clue what to order. I didn't realize how BIG the deluxe burger was (1/2lb of meat)? O_O I couldn't even finish half of the burger! Next time I will surely get the Mini Deluxe (1/4lb). Have you heard of a blueberry milkshake?? I hadn't until tonight!! It was $3.49 of YUM!!! :)

They also have sweet potato fries, cobb salads, special burgers and hot dogs!! Yummy!
author: CeCe C.

description:
I got a tip while at a study group about delicious banana smoothies at a nearby burger joint with really good burgers. So I'm hungry for dinner, it's after 9pm and I walk over to find Pearl's Deluxe Burgers. Forget the banana smoothie - it's really a shake. I order the most bad ass burger I can spot on the menu:

Phat Bob burger: bacon, onion rings, BBQ sauce, mayo

Oh yeah, the patty is so thick and meaty! This burger is huge! It's a meatgasm. And that's without the usual fixings like tomato and lettuce. Stuffed, I ponder how a shake would be a great sweet (and equally fatty) treat to refresh the palate. A shake chaser after a heavy burger!

There's also a Pearl's on Market which has mini sized burgers. Somehow I didn't see that on the menu at Post.
author: Mary W.

description:
My bf and I love burgers and are always on the hunt to try a new place. We found this one through yelp and decided to give it a try. My first thought entering the restaurant is that it was super small. There are only a handful of tables and chairs. 

We ordered the deluxe and the mini, both prepared medium with all the fixings along with a large onion rings. The burgers were really tasty, the meat was a little on the medium rare side. I guess you should specify if you don't like the sight of blood in your meat. Onion rings were also delicious. You can get pickles from the counter to eat with your burger. 

Overall, the workers were very friendly and the food was quite tasty. Will definitely come back again to try some of their specialty burgers.
author: Tran N.

description:
The best burger in San Francisco, hands down.  
Damn good fries, damn good shakes, free pickles, lots of meat options for the burgers including vegetarian options.  
Need I say more?
author: Steve F.

description:
extremely limited seating. if you see an empty table, grab it first, then order!

the mini burger is plenty to eat. i ordered a mini cheeseburger.

Service is friendly and quick. I dont remember there being a mirror in the bathroom.
author: Kailey O.

description: Great burger joint. Cash only. I had the pesto burger and my husband had their special burger of the day and onion rings. Both were great.
author: Christi G.

description:
After a week of dealing with San Francisco's obsession with 'leafy greens!', 'mixed greens!', and 'random grass we filled most of your lunch plate with leaving almost no room for the good parts that will make you fat!', I had had just about enough with this California bullshit. So, without any consideration of the consequences, my lunch buddy and I took to Yelp to find a burger joint.

A short, accidental walk through a less than desirable neighbourhood later, and we're in business in this tiny burger joint already packed with people who appreciate a good calorie fuel-up. And what next? Well damn...hours have passed and I still feel about six months pregnant. I mowed through a veggie burger the size of my face, topped with so much Swiss cheese that it looked like an extra layer of bun. And I did so with no regrets.

Then, I turned to the frings - a basket of very peppery onion rings and just-okay fries that distracted me for just long enough to convince myself that a peanut butter milkshake could definitely fit in my stomach without pushing me over the edge. Spoiler alert: I was wrong. But happy.

Staff are friendly enough to make you feel like you totally deserve your binge, lulling you into a false sense of confidence right up until you leave, reentering the streets of San Francisco five pounds heavier.

Would I do it all again? You bet my newly fat ass, I would.
author: Ben B.

description: The BBQ burger is on fire meaning it's good really good. Also the sweet potato fries is a must. The burgers are big so you have to take big bite don't be shy to indulge in public.
author: JJ B.

description:
on my last day of vacation in SF, my friends and i wanted a good place to send us off with. we jumped on yelp and found this place, had good reviews and wasnt too far from our hotel. we walked over to it, on a sunday just to find out it didnt open til noon. it was only 11:40 at the time so that was actually not a problem. we waited until it opened and waited til at least one person walked in before us until we went over. 

at first glance, the place is quite small. very limited seating and the menu was not too large. but at a second glance at the menu, although not the largest, the variety was definitely making up for it. some very interesting burgers up on the wall that i could only wish i'd be able to go back and try. i ended up with just the regular deluxe ( i believe it was the deluxe.. the normal one with bacon and cheese.) the burger was great, nice and juice. just like a burger should be. it seemed like they put double cheese which is ALWAYS AWESOME. i'll never complain with that. and i actually really enjoyed the bread that they used. the fries were pretty damn good also.

while we were sitting, we overheard a lady who ordered the Nutella shake, and she literally said 'this is absolutely delicious', and although i didnt order it myself, id probably agree also. i mean, really, its Nutella.

this place is easily a 5 star place, the ONLY reason why im giving it 4 is because the seating selection is very, very limited. maybe 10-12 people could have a place to sit. and with the fact that within the first half an hour of being there while eating, the place had already developed a line of at least 10 people WAITING for food. 

overall, great place. i highly suggest it if you're looking for a great burger.
author: Kyle G.

description:
This is a long over due review I should have made, but I have been putting off signing up for yelp.

After reading all the great reviews of this place back in July, I decided to come here with a few friends to check it out. One friend and I ordered a beef pattie burger, with another ordering a chicken pattie variety. When we ate our beef pattie burgers it tasted rather.. plain. There was something definitely wrong with the texture of the pattie and my other beef ordering friend agreed. The chicken pattie however was tasty according to that friend.

I guess me and my beef associate gotten a bad batch of patties or something, and I sure hope so because this place seems to have an oddly high about of good reviews.

Prices are overall higher than what I expected. Definitely over priced for what I had. For burgers that start at around 7 dollars, I half expected to at least get a side of fries with it, but those are separate.
author: Alan C.

description:
Come to Bula! Good god this is an amazing burger - we live a few blocks away from this place and we have to seriously control the amount of times we crave this weekly.  It is such a delicious burger! Ive also had the kobe one and its such a treat!

If you are looking for an amazing, well priced burger in SF this is the place to go! Get the bula, trust me its amazing! Also try a shake they are soo gooood!!

Only negative - the walk home, which is completely uphill. woof.
author: Donna H.

description:
Are you the type of man who likes nice dim lights and "ambience" to go with your meal?  Maybe arugula and fennel on your burger tickles your fancy?

Put down your Cosmopolitan and come with me.  Pearl's delivers your burger the way it should be, thick and greasy.  The huge patty will not only crumble in that dainty mouth of yours, but will also release enough meat  juice to impregnate you.  Try not to blush.

"But where are the cute chic decorations and modern decor?" you ask.  They're sitting alongside the Maxi-pads on isle 5.  You'll find only functional old school metal tables and chairs crammed into enough space so you don't knock elbows with the other patrons here.  You're here to eat the burger son, not lollygag in an Ikea showroom.  The menu looks like some Frankenstein wallboard, there are options just hanging off of random papers.  You'll need to make some executive decisions here, there are more options here than the nail salon you've been frequenting.  All of hamburger's friends are here, from fries and onion rings to various milkshakes.

A regular burger isn't good enough for you?  You want some toppings on there, you special flower you?  You can try some of their specialty burgers, with fancy things like pineapples, bleu cheese and whatnot.  Go ahead, I won't look.

Once you're done eating, your face and hands will look understandably disheveled. After all, you've just consumed an animal with your bare hands.  Although your feeble OCD mind may be completely in ruins, you owe it to the Y chromosome in yourself to proudly just lick whatever entrails are left on your hands and brush the rest off with some tree bark.  Or soft napkins if thats what your delicate skin prefers.
author: David B.

description: ...juicy burgers, great fries and rings....tiny space but great friendly service more than makes up for the squeeze...got there for a late lunch, early dinner and found enough room for three of us...the small napkins were ridiculously inept...bibs would be more like it...if you eat there or take out you should sit and eat these burgers cause its definitely not "food on the run" fare...next time in S. F. well be back for sure...aloha...
author: Kahai D.

description:
Yet another disappointing experience at Pearl's.  Next time I'll be smart and just go to Bullshead.  Let me compare my most recent experience at each restaurant:

Bullshead: I got a half pound buffalo burger and a side of fries for $11.25.  It was the sauteed fresh garlic burger, which has sauteed cloves of garlic on top that are subtle and delicious.  The burger was cooked perfectly, and I left happy.  This is how every visit is to Bullshead.

Pearl's: I got a half pound buffalo burger for $11.99 (more expensive) and then had to pay $2.99 for some fries.  I asked if they could put garlic on, and they said yes.  They put about two tablespoons of diced raw garlic on, which was overwhelmingly powerful and made the bun garlicky and soggy.  Disgusting.  And the bacon was way too fatty and chewy.  They also included a random bag of extra toppings, which was also a bit soggy.  Why?

I need to learn my lesson and never go back.  If you see me write another review here, hit me.
author: Mike G.

description:
Pearl's has been my best friend's favorite burger joint in SF for years (and mine too). What we love the most, however, is their milkshakes. Imagine my chagrin when we were informed last Saturday that the blueberry milkshake was unavailable. We were going to call the Main Street one and check there but ultimately decided against it. No loss there because we just discovered that that location shut down! Anyway, being blueberry milkshake-deprived almost drove me to tears. At least my friend got her Nutella milkshake. Are blueberries out of season or has the flavor been removed from the menu completely? How many other of their flavors have been cut?! The last time I checked, there were a MULTITUDE of milkshake options. Do they only offer vanilla, chocolate, strawberry and Nutella now? Am I making an unreasonable fuss over a milkshake? Perhaps! But I can't even check out the menu because their website is "under construction" and unavailable! Pearl's, what is happening to you?! All I wanted was a thick, creamy blueberry milkshake to wash down my Phat Bob...

Anyway, it's a really small place so like 90% of San Francisco be prepared to 1) not find parking (My friends once circled the block while one person ran inside to order and get the food) and 2) not have anywhere to sit. The Main Street location was a lot bigger, but alas, it's gone now. Time to let it go. I'm not quite ready to lose my blueberry milkshake, though. Seriously, is it coming back anytime soon? I've never tasted anything like it anywhere in the world and until I find a substitute it will haunt my dreams. You might as well just call it liquid crack in a paper cup.
author: Elle T.

description:
Smoosh and I were craving hamburgers after a night of watching Kitchen Nightmares and it just so happened we were headed in the direction of lunch today. Lunch lead us to Pearl's Deluxe Burgers, which held nice reviews from all of you. So, we figured "sure why not?" and headed in for something delicious. 

I ordered the mini-deluxe with everything and Smoosh got the deluxe without onions. We also got a small side of sweet potato fries. Who doesn't love sweet potatoes and fries? So naturally sweet potato fries caught our interest. The place was pretty small but it got packed quickly. We were lucky when we got in lest we be standing in a line that nearly touched the door.

Our food came quickly. The burgers were good and not greasy. It would have sucked if they were because our trek back to Smoosh's place would have killed us. Mine was cooked how I liked it, well done thank you very much. Smoosh liked his. It was a good burger, not the best, but pretty good. I was disappointed in the sweet potato fries. I felt there needed to be far more seasoning than there was on there. It had the perfect amount of salty goodness but a little bit of kick would have made it kick-ass.

Overall, an ok place. If I were in the area again I'd pop by to try something else but I won't go out of my way for it.
author: squishy b.

description:
So, this lunch started out as a quest for fried chicken - I had a craving, what can I say!?!?! After walking 6 blocks and arriving at Louisiana Fried Chicken I quickly turned around and went next door to Pearl's.
Fried Chicken place = EMPTY
Pearl's = PACKED - I knew where to go - damn the fired chicken craving, I'm going for a burger!!
Quickly get to the register and I order the Spicy Sly with homemade onion rings. No drink for me.
Took a seat at the window, watched the people for a few minutes and BAM! my food was ready. I got up to grab it and it was inbound in the hands of a cute little gal with a big smile on her face. I traded the buzzer for the food and once I sat back down I looked over the fare. Looked super fresh, super homemade, super good - so, I dove in with gusto...
Onion Rings - truly the best I've ever had in SF, or the Bay Area for that matter. Crispy, REAL, not greasy - just perfect.
Burger - cooked perfectly, loaded with bell peppers, onions, and a darn zingy sauce that gave it just the right edge. Jack cheese rounded out the flavors and textures and before I knew it the burger was dying a slow death in my gullet. Onion rings too.

Will I be back? HELL YES!!!
author: jim m.

description:
Get the Spicy Sly burger.  It is pretty hot, but that's how I like it.

One of the best burgers I've had. Enough said.
author: Mark F.

description:
This 5 star review is based more on my BF's experience.  We were on vacation in SF and my burger fanatic friend said we absolutely had to come here.  There's only a couple of tables and luckily we got there right before this big group.  I ordered the Prized Pearl (w/ blue cheese) and my bf ordered the Spicy Sly (habanero sauce)..both with medium rare Kobe meat.

My BF thought it was the best he's every had!!  Several reasons:  Kobe meat was super juicy but not messy; not messy because the bun was perfect for soaking up the juices; habanero sauce had a kick and wasn't too spicy; and the list goes on.

I'm not a huge fan of burgers so I guess I don't appreciate the little things.  I did like their fries (both regular and SP) and onion rings.
author: Angela C.

description:
Is there anything else to say about Pearl's other than "NOM! NOM! NOM!" ?

The burgers are amazing--i usually ask for mine Medium Well since they standardly  serve theirs as Medium. 

The salads are really fresh and delicious too--I know I know salad at a burger joint, but it's not iceburg lettuce with processed chicken. They use fresh mixed greens, lots of veggies with a grilled breast of chicken. 

It's very small (like every place in the Tendernob) so it's best to grab a seat if you can, if not, to go works too. 

Happy Burger Noming!
author: Desiree P.

description:
UPDATE ON THE SWEET POTATO FRIES & SERVICE.

SWEET POTATO FRIES
Definitely not as good as Taylors! The sweet potato fries here at Pearl's are crinkle cut fries. They were fried perfectly and taste awesome with ketchup BUT they are on the bland and dry side. Usually, sweet potato fries have more of a taste to it than just being bland like normal fries. I'm used to sweeter sweet potato fries like the ones they serve at Taylors. They're not called SWEET potato fries for no reason! Plus, Taylors serves them on the softer side so you can definitely taste the sweetness of the potato without having it covered up by the crispy fried outside and oil. The only reason I dip my sweet potato fries in ketchup is either because 1) it has no taste or 2) they are too dry. Might I add, I dipped each sweet potato fry from Pearl's in ketchup.

SERVICE
My apologies for walking in here 5 minutes before closing and expecting friendly service. The workers were already putting up chairs and preparing to clean up. I should have known they were going to be on the edgy side.

STRIKE #1
My friend: Can I use the bathroom?
Server: No. It's closed because I already cleaned it. 
(Um...really? No bathroom privileges for PAYING customers?)

STRIKE #2
Server: What can I get for you?
Me: An order of the sweet potato fries, please!
Server: Ok. Anything else.
Me: Nope. Oh and to-go too, thanks.
Server: Everything at this hour is to-go. 
Me: Uh..ok.
Server: DOES ANYONE ELSE WANT ANYTHING. LAST CALL. HELLO? ANYTHING? 
(We all stared at him like he was nutso and proceeded to shake our heads...)

Can I say RUDE?? In this economy, where people are penny pinching like crazy, any business should be GLAD to have customers come in even at the last minute. If you close at 2am, you should close at 2am, not 1:55am. I was mildly turned off by this and the more and more I think about it, the more and more I want to rule out coming to Pearl's ever again. I rather spend my money elsewhere at a business that actually appreciates my money. One more strike and you're out, Pearl's. 

The workers here at Pearl's definitely need an attitude make over.
author: Heidi C.

description:
Goddamn these burgers are delicious.

I literally have to control myself from eating here three times a day. Personal recommendation: the Bula Burger. It's got bacon, a pineapple teriyaki sauce, and swiss cheese. Wash that down with an order of 1/2 sweet potato fries, 1/2 garlic fries, and you'll be in heaven.

I haven't tried their milkshakes yet, and that is the main reason why this review is missing a star. With just a burger, fries, and a drink -- you're looking at a bill of around $18. So although everything here is unbelievably good, I can't help but feel like its a bit overpriced. Bummer

TL;DR -- Fucking amazing burger and fries, but a bit on the pricey side.
author: Gabriel S.

description:
I don't think I've ever eaten a burger so fast in my life. It was a good, juicy flavorful burger, but it wasn't the best I've had. Still not too bad for the price. The patty was thick, juicy, drippy and the burger was just falling apart, so I had no choice but eat it as fast as possible. 

OM NOM. 

Oh, I thought the fries were teh suck though. I think they just weren't freshly made.. And you have to order it separately.. no thanks.

I'm definitely coming back to try all their special burgers. They sound amazing.. but pricey.
author: Donna H.

description: Delicious burgers, free pickles and fantastic price! Pearl's was the first place we went to in San Fran and didn't we pick a winner! My partner said "that was the most perfect dinner ever." Will be back!
author: Lauren O.

description:
4.5 stars

LOVE this place.  Perfect burger, just the way I like it.  Buffalo w/grilled onion and cheddar.  Small side of the best crispy onion rings, noticed something spicy in the batter today, bonus.  The burgers are always cooked to order and juicy.  Better make sure you've got a pile of napkins, you're gonna need em!

YUM!
author: Kim A.

description: Yes Sylvia I did order my burger as a lettuce wrap. I got a bacon avacado burger with sweet potatoe fries. My wife got the same thing but hers had cheddar on it. Very good and will be stopping in again!!
author: Nick Z.

description: I don't understand the draw to this place? The meat is dry, probably because it's a frozen patty, way under seasoned and over cooked. I've eaten here three times to give it a chance. It's still the same, every time. The fries are also frozen. Just plain lazy. Two stars for being consistent.
author: Jake E.

description: Amazing! Got the Bula burger and springs and they were delicious. The spicy pineapple gave the burger a unique twist. Huge portion so come hungry. Highly recommend it!
author: Zack O.

description: Best Burger! This is truly a joint! You'd miss it if you didn't know the jewels to be discovered within! I will fly to San Francisco to get another!
author: Lisa W.

description:
Oh man I love Pearl's meaty MAN-BURGERS! These burgers are so huge the patties are the biggest in the BAY.. 

I ordered the Bula burger(Award winning pineapple teriyaki sauce with bacon,mayo, swiss cheese  and a basket of half fries half onion rings. I like the onion rings! They are seasoned very well and have a nice kick of pepper and spices to them. The staff were very happy and friendly and the food was brought to our table within 5 mins or so. I will be back again to try the Peanut Butter Milkshake after I run a marathon one day. Biggest Baddest Burgers so far I give it Da Big CheeeSe Award. 2 Cheddah' Cheese Thumbs up
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Solid burgers. 

They say it's important to make a good first impression. Pearl's did just that with their Prized Pearl and onion rings. 

Bacon, mayo, sauteed onions and blue cheese is a winning combo and to top it off, I had to get a side of BBQ sauce. The medium rare burger patty was cooked to perfection and each bite was an explosion of heaven-esque flavors. Burger was juicy and every bite was just as good as the first.

If there is one negative thing, the burgers are on the smaller side. I did only order the 1/4, but it could have been a little bigger. Either that or the burger was so good I just craved more.
author: Chris Y.

description:
Had the Spicy Sly. Bomb.

GF had the Mushroom Burger. A little dry but BOMB.

Best pickles on EARF.

Just Friggin amazing, would eat again in a heartbeat.
author: Joshua G.

description: Maybe I should have gotten something besides a basic cheeseburger, but after hopping a bus and walking a few blocks to get to this place I wasn't in love. It was definitely good, but I've had better burgers. What I like about the place is it's forreal a hole in the wall with enough seats for maybe 10-15 people at a time. The wall has a full menu of specialty burgers and a wall of their best burger awards. It's also a bit out of the fray to be so close to union square and the rest of the financial district. If I get a chance to go back I will definitely get a cooler burger and the sweet potato fries. Those dang fries were AWESOME!
author: Channa P.

description:
5 stars for what this place is:  a hole in the wall joint in a not so great neighborhood serving quality burgers.  It is tops!  But if f you are looking for a nice sit down restaurant to impress your lady or guy, think twice.  Unless you know she's into dives (like me!) better save this for the going steady stage. The burgers are done by someone who clearly knows how to cook hundreds of these babies a day- juicy and delicious!   But the Oreo cookie milkshake put this place over the top.  Just like we used to make in the blender after an afternoon at the beach.  A perfect combo with your burger.  

Still dreaming about Pearl's weeks after going here.  I will brave the tenderloin and come back soon  I promise.
author: Julie I.

description:
Have you ever thought, "F it, I'm just gonna be fat" ? Yeah, Pearl's makes this thought scroll through my head. 

I think about this place all the time. If you like mushrooms, get the mushroom burger already!!!! They use like, an entire fields worth of mushrooms on your burger. The cheese oozes out like an angry volcano. It is a dreamy mushroom burger.

Ok, everyone else on here has raved about the Phat Bob burger, but I need to put my own two cents in. This burger makes me shrug my shoulders at the thought of having a triple bypass heart surgery. This burger is topped with big crispy onion rings, thick slabs of bacon and warm, drippy BBQ sauce. The burger is pink in the middle which makes my lady lips quiver. I am an average sized chick but I can take this burger to the face. Yeah, LM usually has to roll me home like the girl in the Willy Wonka movie, but dude, it's so worth it. I usually have BBQ sauce all crusted up and stuck in my lip rings after devouring this thing. It's pretty sexy.

Oh, and get the frings! What a deal! Half fries, half yummy ass onion rings for a good price. Woooooooooooooo. Yeah, I'm that excited about it. Ok, one more thing (this is important to me), they have fountain soda here. There's just something about the soda from tap, like extra carbon or something, that is so so extra good. 

In case you are wondering why I didn't do 5 stars, I guess it's because the inside it just average. It's clean, simple and kind of small. Nothing to get excited about. But the burgers man, get excited. Get real, real excited.
author: Liz M.

description:
The staff here is extraordinarily friendly!  

I recommend the mushroom burger with jack cheese...
I don't recommend the Bula burger, it's just too sweet...

BTW, there are ONLY 4 tables in this establishment.
author: Cora L.

description:
The Phat Bob burger was really good. It was a good size (not humongous but pretty big) and left me feeling good. The bacon wasn't crispy though. The sweet potato fries are a must. You could just look at them and tell that they're not greased out. Crispier would be nicer though. $7.97 for a burger is a bit much, but a burger at McDonald's can cost almost $5 and not even be half as good, right? Overall, a good deal and definitely worth going out of your way for.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description: Juicy burgers. My bf thinks it's the best in the City. Highly recommend their shakes and fries too. My strawberry shake was superb- incredibly delicious with great consistency (not too thick). Fries were crispy and not too greasy. Meal starts to add up though. My bf and I ended up spending just below $40 for the both of us.
author: Sophia B.

description:
I was pretty hungry after shopping in downtown, so I endured a bit of a walk from Powell to get here.  But it was definitely worth it.

We got there shortly after it opened and I ordered the Bula Burger with garlic fries and a Blueberry Cheesecake milkshake.  The burger was pretty darn good, and I thoroughly enjoyed the shake that went along with it.  I'm usually fond of spicy food, but this burger wasn't all too spicy unfortunately.  Still though, I'd love to come back and try their other stuff.  I love it!
author: Ren L.

description: Burger was cooked perfectly and was very filling. Homemade onion rings were phenomenal with great seasoning. I definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting a high quality burger without the need of a nice restataunt atmosphere. Only problem is cash only.
author: Yoshito K.

description:
PEARLS! 

oh my god. this place was SOOOOOOOOOOOOOO good!! I'm up visiting from LA and I do a blog here called BURGERGASM, and i have to say, i definitely experienced one at Pearl's.

I went with the Phat Bob and honestly, this thing was not only delicious, but was as a big as a house. Loaded with BBQ sauce, Bacon, Onion Rings, and Cheese, this thing hit every taste bud and blew my mind.

I barely got through half of it, but man this place slays.

Everyone was very nice, and super helpful, I would suggest this place to anyone looking for a mean burger from an excellent small spot!
author: Carlos C.

description:
Ordered and savored a mini deluxe burger which isn't that mini, only slightly smaller than a regular burger.  It was juicy, cooked well done.  The line was long, which made me hungrier, which made the burger taste that much better.

Considering the amount of people, I got my burger rather quickly, probably because it was a simple order.  Lots of small tables, but they sure do fill up!  Most of my party had to stand and eat.
author: Kim Chi P.

description: Had the 'phat bob' and it blew my mind. The best BBQ sauce I've ever had on a burger. The Oreo shake was incredible. Their fries had some extra love on them maybe in the form of panko, I couldn't tell. This is a burger lovers must.
author: Z B.

description: I frequent Pearl's about once a month; this place is fantastic. The Bula Burger is insanely addictive, and their fries can't be beat!
author: Beau M.

description:
This place was terrible! First of all, it was cash only, which is super inconvenient. The bathroom was dirty and the staff was rude. 

Now for the food: boyfriend and I tried the bula burger and the phat bob. Both were so disappointing! The only good thing about this place is that you can tell the beef was good quality. The phat bob was smothered in very strong barbecue sauce, to a point where it was inedible. The bula burger was just bad. We split sweet potato fries and onion rings. Both were bland and I've had much better before. Everything about this place (the food and interior) was droopy and sad. This place was just so disappointing, it made me hate burgers for a little while. Do yourself a favor, find a better burger place.
author: Dar E.

description: It is a normal burger place although it could've been cleaner it wasn't nasty, I really liked the open windows in the front which allowed the nice day in. The burger I got was big and juicy and I loved every second of it! Definitely try the Nutella Milkshake!! it was to die for!!!
author: Zachary B.

description: True Kobe beef burger that is unmatched anywhere. This place is the local spot for great food. I can't think of a better place to go eat a messy burger.
author: Jason G.

description:
Small joint on POST with HUGE burgs.
My burger was dripping with cheese & was amazing.
PHAT BOB ALL DAY!
author: Horacio V.

description: Great Burger joint!! Food was awesome, friendly service. We had the "Spicy Sly", "BBQ Chicken" "reg Cheeseburger" and the burger of the week "Steakhouse Burger"...excellent all the way around!
author: Evan F.

description: Great burger. I had the 1/2-lb Prized Pearl which had bacon, sauteed onions and blue cheese. It was one of the juiciest burgers I've ever had. The garlic fries were good.
author: Russel J.

description:
Went here a few minutes before they closed and ordered the Phat Bob Burger. It was really good and reasonably priced. However, it wasn't so much the food that impressed me more than the stellar service.
Not only were the staff extremely friendly and welcoming (especially given the fact that I came in minutes before closing), but they offered me a free large fries! I'll definitely be coming back soon.
author: Johnny C.

description:
Deliciously fresh and juicy. 
I love burgers and this one was a great find. 
Took my mom and my husband, they both loved it. 

The key word here is love. 

That should say it all. 

Everything from the burger to the buns to the fries are all fresh and mouth watering. 

Haven't tried the milkshake, so will go back for that. 

Can't go wrong here. It's the best a burger can get. 

Just don't expect easy parking, clean bathrooms or plentiful seating. It's about the grub.
author: Jo M.

description:
Man, I could've sworn I'd already posted a review for this!

Anyway, hands down one of the best burgers I've had in the city BUT keep in mind that I'd just been at The Cellar on 80's night dancing my tush away. And yes, dancing for me includes drinking.

So yeah, I had this burger at 2 am. I had their Spicy Sly which has onions, peppers, spicy sauce, and I believe pepperjack cheese. I know the only reason why I got it is because I love me anything spicy. Good news was the burger did not disappoint. It was spicy, but as usual it could've been spicier.

I keep wanting to bring my boyfriend here, but really we're never in the city or if we are we aren't nearby this joint.
author: Vanessa F.

description: Ordered the mushroom burger with buffalo.  There wasn't enough cheese and it tasted like paper.  Ended up throwing it away and going to get some katsu-curry instead.  Maybe I shouldn't have ordered the buffalo medium.  Maybe I should have ordered the steak sandwich, it actually looked pretty good.
author: Byron W.

description:
Spicy Sly and a Strawberry Shake gives Pearl's Deluxe Burger a 4 Star, more like 4.5.  The combo cost me $13, and it was worth every penny of it.  There was absolutely no one in line when we arrived giving me ample time to decide what to grub on.  

Even though Pearl's is not a customizable burger joint like the Counter, Pearl's takes it any day.
author: John O.

description:
I was hoping Pearl's to be the shiny iridescent jewel of the Nob Hill neighborhood from the many glowing reviews, but it fell a little short of my expectations. From my experiences the burgers looked a lot more appetizing than they actually were. Always slightly charred on the outside, and regardless of how I request my burger to be cooked (medium), my burgers have always been overcooked. It's great that they serve Niman Ranch beef, Kobe beef and buffalo (I've tried it all from here), but from my experiences the burgers have really lacked that distinct beefy flavor and juiciness we meat eaters enjoy and love. Decent burgers overall but they also serve very good sweet potato fries that I always order as a side.

I'll be back pretty often though as Pearl's is the best option in the area for a burger that I've had thus far. With a good variety of specialty burgers and sandwiches there's definitely more for me to try from here.
author: Erich D.

description:
Came here with some friends -- 8 of us to be exact.  Walked in the door and, dude, didn't realize the place was so freakin' tiny.  Luckily, by the time we placed our order some tables by the window cleared up.  So we crammed ourselves in the small corner with some friends left standing eating off of the little entrance divider.  

The menu was really interesting -- a good amount of choices with buffalo patties to boot.  I got the mushroom burger with the spries (sweet potato + regular fries combo) and it was all pretty average.  Maybe I got the wrong burger, but I wish the mushrooms or the patty had a little more seasoning.  Same with the fries.  And I guess you could consider the patty to be juicy...but I just saw it as really greasy.  And it was kind of disgusting as the bun had sopped up most of the grease by the time I had took a bite out of it.  

My friends got the spicy sly burgers and they seemed to enjoy them.  I also tried the onion rings and I felt that they too were just alright.  Don't get me wrong, I do enjoy a good burger but the food here is nothing to write home about.  I'm not exactly tempted to go back but I'm willing to give it another shot considering all the rave reviews.  I'd probably try their award-winning burger (the bula?) which I had missed on the menu the first time around.  Hopefully the damage to my heart will be worth it.
author: Jen N.

description: Kobe beef was super tender and that sauce with the Bula burger complimented it so well. Their fries were super fresh and thick too. I was so lucky that my hostel was right across the street from this place. Just a bit pricy but then again its kobe beef and San Francisco.
author: Bibiano L.

description:
thanks yelp app!   I searched for burgers near me and I found heaven on earth! haha. But seriously I loved it.  My friend and I bought Classic burgers with cheese and bacon and a large order of garlic fries and onion rings and a couple of shakes. 

-The burgers were made to order.
-I asked for my onions grilled (no extra cost) yummm
-The fries were cooked perfectly and the garlic sooo fresh.
-The onion rings where good but probably not the best I've ever had... we did eat them all tho!
-My shake was amazing, not too thick, just right. I ordered a strawberry cheesecake shake. I think they actually put some cream cheese in it.  Yeah, it was pretty amazing.

The atmosphere was nothing special, but it really didn't need to be. it was clean enough, they recycle, free ice water, nice staff, good burgers. 

I give 5 stars. My belly is still full, 3 hours later. :)
author: Mateo C.

description: Too much hipe for this joint. I thought it was going to be one of those great hole on the wall, but I got disappointed. The burger has nothing to write back home. I order the pesto burger and it was OK.
author: Nick G.

description:
It's a good place for a burger.  They're big enough to share especially if you're going to get an order of frings (fries and onion rings) or chili cheese fries.  I had the Phat Bob and it was pretty good.  It tasted like a backyard burger with bacon, cheese, and BBQ sauce.  

Seating is limited so keep that in mind if you're with a big group of people.
author: Nina L.

description:
Ive been meaning to review this place for over a year now, and Im not sure why I haven't got around to complete the review, but this place is awesome! 

They're not serving up your bougie burgers on brioche with a fried egg, and pommes frites. These burgers are down home goodness. When you bite into them, the juice runs down your arm, and it's great. They have a huge menu, with something for everyone, and the shakes are thick, not watery like most places.  

You should know that this place is pretty small, and not good for groups. Also, parking is a bit of a pain in this area, but definitely worth it when you arrive. I think Ill go get a burger now. Peace.
author: David M.

description:
Popped by here to pick up a quick lunch to go the other day and was amazed to roll up on a miracle parking space right out front.  Upon entering, was surprised that it looked so different from what I have pictured.  Not sure why, but was expecting it to look a little fancier.

Checked my to go order quickly before driving off (a must anywhere nowadays) and actually spent more time looking for a place to park and eat than I did getting my food.  Upon opening the two cartons, was impressed with the size and appearance of my half-pound burger.  Nice!!!!  Is what I said when I first took it out of the container and held it up.  Looked so impressive that I wondered if people walking by would notice it like they did when I had that cheesesteak from Jake's.  Or like the time in my car when I had a big falafel wrap from Oasis (the best in SF!) and some guy walking by said, "WOW, look at that burrito!"  Would it perhaps incite a little burger envy?

Anyway, the bacon was a little underdone and there were stringy portions of fat that I had to tear off, but overall, I really liked my burger.  It was really good.  Wasn't a religious experience, but hey, this was just their base burger with cheese and bacon.  Next time, I will try the grass-fed or most likely their Kobe beef version.  The Bula looks real good.

Also ordered 'Frings' (half fries/half onion rings) in which the 'rings' were a tangled battered mess, but actually tasted pretty good.  Wish there had been more of them though...less fries would have been okay as that was a generous portion.

In the end, I couldn't believe I finished it all and was really, really full.  Loved their free self-serve pickles too.  Will definitely be back.
author: Roy N.

description:
Fantastic Burger place that a friend of mine recommended for a long time and we finally went there.

I got pretty much my dream burger:
- Half an Avacado
- Jack Cheese
- Ranch dressing
- Upgraded to Kobe beef

Unbelievably good. I paid $15 for this burger but it was damn well worth it. I also got onion rings which were very homemade like and very good as well.

Hole in the wall looking place but incredible burgers and a friendly, humble staff.
author: Nick E.

description: So good we ate here twice during our visit to SF.  Regular burgers are fine, but they also offer a wide variety including buffalo. No frills, diner-like atmosphere.
author: Joe S.

description: Just landed in San Francisco and starving. Once my husband and I checked into our hotel (the Warwick at Geary and Taylor) we wanted something close and fast. Searched Yelp for places to eat in the area and ended up at Pearls--just up the hill to Post and over a couple blocks). Their burgers are delicious. Fresh buns made fresh daily by a local bakery and produce so fresh you would swear they had a garden out back. We both tried Pearls Deluxe burger  (first thing on the menu) the FIRST time we went (because we went twice in five days).  We added bacon and cheddar cheese. Fries were hot and crispy. Second time we went we left off the bacon but had the "frings" Half french fries half onion rings-- wished we'd gotten just the rings this time as they were perfect-- crunchy and delicious and the coating didn't fall off with the first bite. For two burgers one large order of fries and two drinks we spent around $29 and change and didn't feel the least ripped off. Big burgers, generous portion of fries (and rings) and two drinks -- not bad for SF. The guys behind the counter were very friendly. The only problem is there are only three tables and some seating by the window. This is s must-try place if you're in the Union Square area.
author: Nancy H.

description:
Well, I'm not sure my review is going to add much since there are a thousand others but I will say this....

PRIZED BURGER AND GARLIC FRIES!!!

YUM! YUM! and MORE YUM!

i love SF.
author: Bahar M.

description: I ain't afraid to say it but this place is the only place that satisfies my Aunt Flo. The burgers are pure juicey goodness and the fries are addictive. I live closest to the Post St location, and the staff is lovely. I work next to the Market and 6th Pearl's and sometimes go with co-workers (I think our visuals coordinator is addicted.). I think Pearl's is the best burger in the Bay. So whether you're  a local or visitor and want a burger, don't waste time go to SF's Prized Pearl!!!
author: Anita O.

description:
All I can say is yum.  And go there and be prepared to waddle out.

Sweet potato fries are great---I got the spries basket (fries and sweet potato fries) which was amazing because I'm a huge fan of both.

My mouth is watering just thinking about it.
author: Jessica R.

description:
My BF and I had lunch here on a saturday afternoon. It's a small location, very limited seating not good for groups to sit down. but 2-3 people group should be ok! We enjoyed our entire meal! Only draw back was how pricey it was for a burger joint. This place is the type you order up front and then sit down without a server after order/paying.

Food:
1) Turkey burger w/mushrooms and pepper jack cheese. The Turkey patty was very juicy :)! And the bun was tasty too. I've had dry turkey burgers with no flavor but this was juicy and flavorful!

2) Fries: The fries were really yummy! They arent thin fries like mcdonalds but kinda like burger kinds new cut fries. The flavor was unique and had a nice crisp factor.

3) Banana Chocolate Shake: O M G, DELICOUS!!! They put fresh bananas in this shake, it was reallllly yummy!

Service:
They staff is really friendly and helpful reccomending what is popular and what they like :). 

Total Tab of all of the above with tax (no tip included) for 2 people: $30. Very pricy for burger, fries, and shake if you ask me. But I also only ate 1/2 of my burger b/c it was very big.
author: Parita P.

description: Holy heaven nutella milkshake!! Incredibly amazing :)  We ordered Pesto burger, avocado cheeseburger & spries (half sweet potato fries and regular fries) I should have ordered a mini burger because these burgers are huge!  I can't wait to come back here again.
author: Sophia T.

description:
Bula burger and the teriyaki is the best way to go. Fries are light and crispy almost similar to Curly fries texture but not dense. 

But if you're going to try these burgers be sure to bring a bib and tons of wet-naps because there's only one bathroom stall with no paper towel besides a hand dryer that didn't seem to work. 

But pretty good burgers! You're also to upgrade your beef to Kobe or buffalo, you just have to add an extra $4 on top of the burger price.
author: Linh D.

description:
Im happy I finally got to try out Pearls Deluxe! It was really good. I had the Bula Burger. Really tasty. It was cooked just ask I asked for it.

The only downside about this restaurant is that its REALLY expensive. $8.99 for the burger. $3.49 for the side of fries. Which were also good. I didnt even want to get a drink cause Ill be paying $15 for a burger meal. 

Love the place, a bit pricey but Ill be back.
author: Daniel S.

description:
I have eaten here on two occasions, and both times, i would've given it 4 stars.  the food is good, as are the shakes.  however.... last week we entered and stood in line to order.  as the customers ahead of us moved, the cashier informed us that they were closed...   "yes, we're closed... we close at 10"
**looks at phone - its 9:58
