being one who works at a restaurant that is often busy (particularly at closing time), i'm aware that it sucks to have last-minute customers.  however, when your closing time is 10p and not late, like say, 1a, my sympathy isn't as strong - you're still leaving work at a reasonable time tonight.  the way i see it (and i would say its logical):
-if you are in line at the time of closing, the customer gets served.  
-if the lights are on and the door is unlocked, the customer gets served.  
-if you close before your posted hours, you lose my future business because all you're saying to me is that you don't care about the customer.   
i don't think i'm being overly demanding or unreasonable - if your door is unlocked and it's still within your hours of operation, you should serve the customers.  

the whole experience left a bad taste in my mouth.  pun intended.
author: Carl V.

description: The best burgers and fries around the tendernob. Pearl's is a block from my apartment I have been here several times, and they never disappoint. Large burgers and very good garlic fries, have yet to try the milkshakes but they look amazing! The Phat bob with BBQ sauce and onion rings is hands down the best. A lot of options, especially for those who are trying to eat on the healthier side.
author: Mel S.

description:
delicious hamburgers...just delicious...there are days where I dream about Pearls and I'll wonder when will be able to come back again.

I had a burger with bacon and it was juicy good...juices just dripping down as I bit into that burger..*droooool*

and the sweet potato fries..goodness gracious...cut in that amazing way and though fried they are not oily or greasy..are they even fried? who cares..all i care about is that fact that it tastes so good..

good job Pearls!
author: phillip w.

description:
Hamburgers.  I'm always writing about fucking hamburgers.  Wait, that sounds more interesting than it actually is.  Move that "fucking" two words left.

Time to fire my M-Ray(M=Metaphor.  TM, Bitches!) handgun at this review.  Pearl's Deluxe Burger is transformed into an olde school warehouse rave Circa Bay Area 2001.  My appetite is now a 19 year-old Candy Raver going to SF City College and living with her mom (a QA engineer in Mountain View).

So, it was, like pretty OK.  The headliner started out pretty awesome but I don't know if it was the cheap pill I took in the bathroom but, maybe half way through I kind of stopped feeling it.  I was kinda overhyped for this party ya know?  
(burger looked/smelled good, fairly average in flavor/quality/size)

The venue was "meh", it was in that crappy warehouse like kind of near Oakland Chinatown under the freeway.  So, way sketchy.  Jackie's car wasn't even very flier'ed up so you know that's ghetto.  Not a lot of room, no place to puddle or chill.  and hot!  The lineup list was crazy, couldn't tell who was on when or in what room or anything.
(in the Tenderloin, tiny spot with a somewhat confusing menu)

Felt more like a $10 party than a $20 one, if I'd paid $10 to get in I would have felt happier about the whole night.  
(I either wanted it to be a little cheaper, bigger or tastier to justify the medium high cost)

Still, it was pretty cool.  I met this crazy straight edge kid.  Ya, the one with the stuffed animal pants.  He totally chilled with me for hella days.
(I don't think this has anything to do with Pearl's unless it relates to the fact that my wife went with me and  I dig her)

I'd go to another party there, I guess.  Except Jackie probably wouldn't drive cus the neighborhood's too janky.
author: Milk N.

description:
Gooood lord! Ok my favorite burger spot to this day has been Jack's Prime in San Mateo a little $$$ but worth it. I was shopping around the SF Union Square area today and was craving a burger and found this spot with many reviews here on Yelp and decided to check it out. It was quite a walk from the Union Square area but definitely worth it! I was a little skeptical about it with a few people hangin' out in front of the place and being such a small place. But hey, never judge a book by its cover! Every time I try a new burger spot I always get something traditional like a cheeseburger and any special upgrades they got, in this case, medium rare kobe beef! 

Damn! Even though the bun was ok the burger as a whole was off the hook with playa' prices! I mean for under $15 you can get a kobe beef burger with some garlic fries?! 

The fries is another story! I read they dipped it in flour? It does add a nice touch. If you're not worried about having your breath hummin' with garlic the rest of the day then you gotta try the garlic fries.

Next time I'm shopping out in the city, I'ma be like our governor Arnold Schwarzenegger, "I'll be back!", at this place lol
author: Paul Andre D.

description:
Best burger I've had in the city hands down.

The Phat Bob might be the best "western" burger (bacon, onion rings, bbq sauce) I've ever had anywhere.

Both the fries and sweet potato fries are great - the onion rings are only okay.

The portions are huge, as someone who leaves restaurants hungry quite often - even I was very full.
author: Nathan J.

description:
Food 5/5
atmosphere: 3/5
service: just cashier and person who bring you your order, very nice people

I've always wanted to try this place after my friend told me about it. I have to say that the burgers are big and the meat is very good. I think what sets this place apart from other more expensive burger places is that it has high quality meat. The special burgers are $9. I got the Pearl burger with onions and blue cheese which was wonderful. I came for dinner and the place is small so the best time to come is 5:30pm there will definitely be 2 tables still free. But at 6pm, there are no tables and a long line.

I also shared a garlic fries with my friend. They were definitely good...Not that I got to try very many. My pudgy dumb friend ate almost all the fries while I was finishing my burger. He finished his burger way before I did. Later he even started using the fork to shove fries into his mouth. After I finish my burger, he is like "here, finish your fries" and there are only 5 left. 

I'll definitely be back again.
author: Cecile S.

description: I love their Cobb Salad and the Kobe burger. Not my favorite burger in town but I wouldn't say no, also great shakes.
author: Justin H.

description:
My boyfriend and I were visiting a friend for the weekend in the city.  We were starving from our drive from LA and used Yelp to find something delicious and close to our parked car.  The reviews sounded great, so Pearl's it was.

I got the chicken pesto burger which was definitely delicious!  The piece of chicken was huge and I only ate about 2/3rds of it.  We also got an order of chili cheese fries.  Those were not anything special.  In fact, for $6.99 the fries were soggy and seemed small for an order of fries.

The place was empty when the couple that was already there left.  The cashier was very attentive and seemed to love his job.

Oh and the pickles (free BTW) were sooooo good!
author: Karla R.

description:
So, my man and I took a stroll up to Pearl's the day after a night of heavy imbibing. I have found that a greasy cheeseburger with a coke is part of the recovery process and Pearl's provided the perfect Rx.
 
Walking in, the place smells like a Chinese carry-out but looks like your standard diner. We checked out the menu on the wall and after much consideration I went with...
the deluxe burger with cheese. Not fancy, I know, but when I want to test the true greatness of a burger, I find it best to keep it simple. And Pearl's did not disappoint. It was greasy without being revolting, I asked for a medium burger and that's what I got and the toppings were fresh. My only complaint is that the bun, while tasty, ceased to resemble a bun after a few bites. The whole thing just fell to crap. Don't think that deterred me, though. I gladly finished it. 

My hubby got the Prized Pearl and absolutely loved it. He gave me a bite of it and I must say it was worthy of its title. The caramelized onions and bleu cheese are so good, it's dirty. Dirty!

We got the Frings to share, which I recommend. Yeah, the onion rings were a little on the soggy side once we got back to our room but I can hardly blame Pearl's for that. After all, they poked little holes in each of our containers so that the steam had an escape route. Brilliant, Pearl's! 

My only lament was their inability to make shakes on the day we were there. That Nutella shake sounded beyond fantastic. 
Oh, and also their location. I am in Cincinnati. Pearl's is in San Francisco. I just don't see how we can make this work, Pearl's. But I'll be sure to check you out the next time we're in town.
author: Amanda S.

description:
It isn't five stars because it isn't the best burger I've ever tasted.  That being said, I have nothing but good things to say about this place.

Neighborhood is a tad seedy, but if you let that get in the way of amazing food, you're doing it wrong. 

Customer service was excellent.  When I ordered my buffalo burger (see below), the woman behind the counter was knowledgable and kind enough to point out the difference in cooking and what that would mean for my medium-rare order.  I adjusted accordingly. 

They offer a wide variety of burgers and chicken sandwiches, with fixings such as pesto, chili, onions (a variety of ways), pesto, a good array of cheeses, etc.  They also offer kobe beef and buffalo.  They especially recommend the buffalo, but to be honest, I didn't really taste a difference good or bad.  It tasted like good beef, but nothing worth the extra $4.00.

They have fries, sweet potato fries, and onion rings, and they also cater to combination orders.  A half order of onion rings and fries is called frings.  They also have spries and springs.  

They also do a wide variety of shakes, and they're good, made the old fashioned way with the mixing rod, real ice cream, and whole milk.  The mint oreo is awesome, but I always stick with chocolate. 

The quality of the burger was well above average.  The beef was seasoned and cooked very well and tasted great.  Cheese was thoroughly melted, but not liquified or allowed to brown/burn on the grill.  Bun was good, soft, and just slightly chewy.  Lettuce was fresh.  Good mayo.  

The place is a tad on the spendy side, around $12-15 per person for a burger, fries, and a drink, but it's also a pretty damn big burger and the food quality is a cut above.  Whole-heartedly recommended.
author: Jace P.

description:
I'm not sure what all the hype is about this place. The burgers aren't anywhere near awesome. They seem like frozen patties.. Granted I haven't had the kobe burger, but still, if that's the only great burger they have, they need to come off the top 10 list for SF. Their fries aren't anything special either. This place is ok if you are in the hood, but don't go out of your way.

*The owner sent me a nice message asking what I had ordered (the bacon cheeseburger, several times) and offered to serve me a meal, on them to give it another shot. I appreciate that.
author: jen w.

description:
This is it folks... I think I am done.  This place serves the BEST burgers I have ever had in San Francisco!

The burgers are so delicious it made me bite my tongue and my cheeks like I was some handicapped shark.  My chomping was so fast and intense that I could not control or limit my jaw.  It was like a "limit break" that lashed out an omni-bite on the burger.

Let me describe my experience like this:

Episode 1: THE GREEN BURGER
LIKE WATCHING HEAVEN ON ICE!... LIVE! The burger juices are so vividly unique and tasty it is as fine like a choir of angels figure skating on the ice doing open axels with trumpets flaring.  The pesto sauce I had on my burger was drowned with cheesey cheese of jack nature.  So much pesto was in the burger that the rest of the day I had hints and remnants of my delicious burger floating in my mind.

Episode II: THE DEEPTHROAT SHAKE
The tapioca straw for the milkshakes is just genius!  I used to suck my straw at jack in the box until my gums started bleeding before even breathing in the taste of their shake.  Here I had an experience of pleasure in deep throating mint oreo flavored goodness on the first sip!

Episode C: SULTRY ONION RINGS
Although I did not have the pleasure of ordering this.. my friend ordered one for the table.  Onion ring make me orz orz orz like worshipping a false idol.  The slight spice and decadant crunch of each bite left me divorcing my old Buckhorn Grill string rings, separating from Best-o-Burger's Ring-Os, and kicking out my old Burger King Onion Rings out of the house!

Epilogue: FIVE STARS NO DOUBT
Hands down... if you love burgers and live in San Francisco... this place is a must!  Just note that parking is not easy breezy, and getting a table may be hard at times as well.  But in the end FIVE STARS *****

UPDATE: 10/26/09 Revisit
I went back and did myself right by ordering the Kobe Beef Bula Burger!!!  I messed up however by forgetting to say MEDIUM-RARE!!!!  Even though my burger came out more cooked then I would like it was SUPER delicious... and I could only imagine how much better it could have been.  I just wanted to make it known that if you don't mention how you want your beef done... it will come out medium @_@.  Happy Eatings!
author: Benny S.

description: Seeing as that Pearls is a few businesses down from my apartment, I thought I'd give it a whirl. I was happy with it :) Nothing fancy but excellent service, yummy burgers and super down for the pickles on the side. I only put three stars simply because it satisfies a burger craving (for sure) with fresh, jammed pack ingredients but it wasn't anything out of the ordinary. Perhaps that's my own fault for just ordering the classic pearl deluxe! I'll have to try another, more wild burger next time. Stay tuned!
author: Amy C.

description:
Burgers here are AWESOME!  

Tried the Teriyaki mushroom burger with french fries and onion rings and was impressed.  Mine was piled high with thick sliced fresh sauteed shrooms.  They aren't cheap but it's cool that they offer Kobe beef if you care less about price and even more about flavor.  Fries and onion ring portions are plentiful and crisp.  
 
There were 5 of us and everybody all agreed their food was excellent.

The dining area is about the size of Cool Hand Lukes' tin shed detention box but if you really want to get your burger grub on, look no further!
author: Mark T.

description:
Thank you food network for such a good recommendation!! 

Definitely a good quick bite in San Fran while on the go. We split the prized pearl, since it was recommended on the food network. It had bacon, sauteed onions, crumbled bleu cheese, and mayo. The combination of all the ingredients was delicious! The burger was cooked a perfect medium and was juicy! We also got an order of sweet potato fries which were a great compliment to the burger!

Small, hidden place but definitely worth the trip. ;)
author: Leanne D.

description:
Insane burger craving math problem:

1 scrumptious cheesburger cooked just the way I like it
+
1 order of heavenly sweet potato fries
+
1 mango jarritos
+ 
1 thoroughly satisfying burp (albeit ladylike)
=

1 satiated female who loves her meat
author: Pam S.

description:
The best burger I've ever had....
The team there was very welcoming, explaining the specificities of each burger.
The burgers were simply fantastic !! and so the garlic french fries, and the onion rings  !
author: Pierre E.

description: Great local burgers. Quick service, good value for money!! We had the original Pearl-burger and it was really tasty.
author: Sune D.

description: Excellent burger but make sure you bring your big boy appetite!  Burgers are 1/2 pond and side of fries is large enough to feed a small country.
author: Clayton A.

description:
4.5
One of the best burgers ive eaten

Small little place with about 25 seats. You pay upfront and then they bring out your order. The specialty burgers were 8.99 while the basic 1/2 lb burger is 6.49. Cheese is 50 cents and bacon is +$1. They also have a mini burger option. Any variety of fries are 4.99 each.

I got the regular with bacon and I have to say it was quite juicy as with every bite, little bits of juice and grease dripped out. 

I also tried the springs (sweet potatoe fries + onion rings) and I have to say they were above average. Its big enough to share with another person. The onion rings were battered just enough while the yam fries were cooked correctly.

Overall I would have to say its the best place to get a burger in San Francisco although my friend says the one at the cheese cake factory is better. I will be the judge of that.
author: Robert Y.

description:
I'm so glad I started going here!

I used to go somewhere closer, but I feel that the quality here is so much better. I'm really a fan of the Spicy Sly. I like that it's actually spicy, and I suspect that it's made with a sauce made with pumpkin seeds. I also like that you can taste things other than "heat." It's a VERY wet burger, so get a stack of napkins. This is my favorite so far: the Bula Burger and Prize Pearl didn't really do it for me.

Oh and don't be an asshole and reserve a table. There are only 13 seats in this restaurant and you should yield tables to people in line before you. The turn around is pretty quick, so you won't be waiting long. Also, don't be an asshole and linger, once again because this place is so small. Don't even think of coming here with a large group!
author: Diana O.

description: Saw good reviews on Yelp so I walked over after checking in to my hotel. I ordered the mushroom burger, fries and a shake. The burger was great and pretty large--I easily could have gone without the fries or shake and still have been satisfied. The fries were really awesome, crispy but not thin like many other crispy fries tend to be. Enjoyed the shake as well, especially since it wasn't too thick like some places' shakes. I'd eat here again in a heartbeat!
author: Mike L.

description:
I didn't realize the Deluxe Burgers at Pearl's were half pounders until I finished my burger and it settled into my stomach.  Along with an order of small fries which is fairly large and a large soda (I was really, really thirsty when I walked in.) I found myself in a serious food coma.

Even though it is posted on the menu board I failed to see that Pearl's burgers are cooked medium unless otherwise requested.  So I accepted my burger medium for a change.  I had ordered a Deluxe with bacon and no cheese or onions.  The burger patty was very good with good beef flavor, but the bacon wasn't cooked as crispy as I would have liked; in fact the fatty portion of the bacon was still quite chewy.  Between the grease from the burger and the bacon, the moisture from the lettuce and tomato and a thin film of mayonnaise the bottom bun disintegrated in a greasy, drippy mess.  

The long, meaty fries were fried up golden crispy.  One thing did catch my eye on the menu, which stated that an all-natural Beef Patty could be substituted for an additional charge.  Does that mean there was something unnatural about my burger?

For such a tiny restaurant the menu is pretty extensive.  Quarter pound options as well as buffalo, turkey or vegetable burgers, chicken sandwiches, hot dogs and salads are also available.  I'm pretty certain I'll return as their Spicy Sly Chicken sandwich sounded quite good.  They have lots of milkshake options too, but I was out of Lactaid tablets at the time.  Next time ... milkshakes!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
Kobe burger huh?  ok, bf got me on the kobe burger.

ordered the mushroom kobe burger, and the bacon with blue cheese kobe burger, i must say if that's really kobe, then kobe's just not all that.

for a gourmet burger, it was pretty darn tasty.  beef was cooked to my liking, pretty thick patty, slightly less juicy that I thought it would be, but it was still pretty good.  i think the condiments from these "special burgers" made it a little too overwhelming to my liking.  Next time, I'll just get a regular deluxe with buffalo upgrade perhaps?  Regardless their little flaws, the burgers were pretty darn awesome.

Shakes are awesome.  We got the chocolate banana shake and a blueberry shake.  Both are fantastic!

Springs were crispy, sweet, and salty.  Loves the onion rings, and loves the sweet potato fries.  mm. mmm. mmm.

Will definitely return to check out the buffalo deluxe, the kobe, however, was just not too impressive.
author: Gigi T.

description: Love this place I order the Buffalo burger  & my husband order the chicken, we both  like it special the chicken usually I don't like it but this one oh my god I love it for  sure we'll back.
author: Bebe C.

description:
This is a dangerous place to have just a mere hundred feet or two away from my apartment.  DAAANNNGGEERROOUUUSSSS I tell you!

I find myself coming up with excuses to eat here more and more frequently.

Whats that?  It's Tuesday?!  Well I gotta go to Pearl's!

Whats that now?  It's raining?!?  Well I should go to Pearl's.

WHAT'S THAT YOU SAY??  THE GIANTS WON?!?!?!  Well now I'm definitely going to Pearl's!

My burger of choice comes with blue cheese crumbles, mushrooms, bacon, and lettuce - hold all that other bells and whistles - I like my burgers like i like my whiskey, DRY.

LOVE their garlic fries, infinite noms.

Mint Oreo Shake is fantabulous.  Tiffany Y. is right, shakes are straight up to die for.

So now my reviews done, guess I should go to Pearl's?

FUCK YES!
author: Chelsea C.

description:
Ordered up a veggie burger with pepperjack cheese,
and man it was goooood. This veggie burger taste a
bit different than the one I had in hodads. But i still like
it very much :) it was juicy and the fresh veggies that
came with it made it great, along with some AZ SWEET TEA
and finally got to try some sweet potato fries was different,
yet I like the whole sweet/salty vibe, GOOD STUFF! I believe it 
cost me less than $11 if not $10 bucks? I split the fries tho with 
my friends. anyways, good burger joint! thanks yelp!
author: Shirley G.

description:
KOBE BEEF MYASS.
There is no beef from city of Kobe, Japan to U.S., period.
FXXX The Bullshit !

Oh yeah, I forgot, It's Kobi,  Kulby or Cubee, I should say.
It is so irritating to hear that people sayin', " Can I get the Cubee beef?"
It hurts in my ear every time I hear that sound.
Kobe  Bryan?
I have NEVER heard of anyone on TV pronounce correctly the name if his father really mentioned that city of Kobe, Japan.
FXXX!

Real "KOBE" sounds like "Koh-Beh".

So, 
I don't understand why you need to pay more for the Jiveass muzaFxxxin' pseudo Kobee-beef bullshit burger.
At all.
The Kobee beef burger is such a rip off.
It's pretty much same as the regular kind.
You gotto be an asshole getting the shit. So Yes, I was the asshole because I ate the bullshit Kobee beef hamburger for crying out loud!

B.U.L.L.S.H.I.T.

It was NOT better than the regular phat-burger.

The Regular Angus Cheese Burger was good and decent price.
The burger was juicy w/ pretty good buns.
Fries were ok too.

We went there only because we saw the place on TV.
I wasn't really expecting anything because I was skeptical about ANYTHING that Tyler F and Bobby F's say. 
I was just hoping it's better than In & Out Burger.
And it was better than that, a lot better.
author: Nobu K.

description:
This is where I go for an ever so hardy and delectable burger!  My favorite is the Spicy Sly burger.  Every time I come in, I try to order something new...sometimes I do BUT, most of the time, it's the spicy sly for me.  I just can't help it.  Seriously, I don't know what's in that sauce but it's addicting.  You know this place is good because it's always packed inside with people dining in, ordering, or waiting for order pick ups.  

I love the service as well.  Last time I got to chat it up with the owner and he was just so kind and easy going.  Everyone there is always welcoming :) 

Best burger in the City!
author: Lynnie T.

description:
Got there just before closing. Had to do a take out. 20 min to get home and by then the burger and fries were a soggy mess.
It was only a 2 star meal but giving it 3 stars because it looked like it would have been great if I could have eaten it there.
author: Don D.

description:
I had the deluxe burger with swiss cheese, lettuce, bacon and a side of onion rings!!
FANTASTIC!!!
A great juicy burger...
author: Robert O.

description:
I am a bit of a burger snob. I've had hundreds, nay, thousands of them. 

This is among the very best, ever.

You can't go wrong, but if you want the best of the best, go for the BULA!!!

The fries and rings are good, but not on par with the burgers, I may save the space next time and get two burgers!!

Stop reading this and go there NOW...

Why are you still here, RUN!
author: Jeremy M.

description:
Every once in a while you may perhaps find a pearl in say an oyster, but once in a lifetime you'll find a Pearl's in the TL!

Wow that "King Burger" is phenomena!!.  1K Island dressing, American and Cheddar with all beef frank split in half on an 1/4 pound burger.  Sounds like a weird combo but it tastes so friggin delish.  It's a knife and fork type of burger but I just cut it half and stuff it in my face.  If you love grilled onions like I do, there is no extra charge for those and they'll give a generous amount of them if you request it.  

Their fresh made to order onion rings have cayenne pepper in their batter for a nice little flavorful kick and and came out very tasty.

The menu here looks the same as the location as the one in Milf Valley except here I have the aroma of tapioca on the sidewalk as I'm leaving having eaten one of the best burgers of recent memory.
author: David C.

description:
This tiny place in the TenderNob is easy to pass by without a second thought.  There are only 6 or so tables, and a few stool seats.

The burgers are big and juicy, with lots of options.  Me, being the so called "Bacon King", had a bacon and swiss burger with garlic fries.  There are "special burgers" too, that add mushrooms, and other things.  I stick with the basics.  The regular burgers are 1/3 pound, I think, while the Deluxe weigh in at 1/2 pound.  It was cooked as ordered, a good Medium Rare.  They are pretty messy, but napkins are at your table, so feel free to get your hands greasy.  A "natural patty" can be had, but it looks like only for the "special burgers" for about $1.25 more.

The garlic fries were very good, but a little over salted.  I would prefer to add my own salt.  The drinks are self serve, which is a plus, because you never know how much you can drink.  Shakes are available, but I did not order one.  That is the only way I eat ice cream ... and it's a rare occasion when I do.

Check it out, but don't plan on finding a place to park.  Cheap ... my meal cost about $11.00.  Not bad when you consider some places across town charge that much just for the fries.  OH ... you want a burger with that too?  Another $20 please ...  You won't regret stopping by Pearl's, for all you burger fanatics!

Second visit!  Tonight, I had the Prized Pearl, natual beef.  This one has blue cheese, sauteed onions, and bacon.  I think I've found my all time favorite burger.  The creaminess of the cheese went so well with the beef.  Try it!
author: Michael M.

description:
Always in search of the perfect bacon cheese burger a friend recommended that I try Pearl's. After reading a bunch of great reviews, it was GO TIME!!! 

After mulling over the menu for a few minutes. I asked them if I could just get a bacon burger with cheese please... I also noticed they had onion rings and asked the owner if they were any good. He said he didn't like onion rings, but he likes these ones. I mean what else is he going to say - right?! So I said as long as they were not battered then let's do this...

So when I got my burger I was a little confused. So being a natural beef place the burger kinda looked as if a pre-made patty. The cheese was a little bit too melted and so it was like a yellow coating on a pre-made patty. Everything else looked in place, except I must add that the bun they used was a whole lot of bread for a burger bun. more bun than burger, which leads me to say - Where's the BEEF!!! So then I was kicking myself not ordering the Kobe burger, cuz maybe that would be a whole different experience.

On to the onion rings... not fully battered, but still battered w/ a few mixed in crumbs... ugh... or maybe not quite breaded but a whole lot of holes going on in the breading... I just don't know... I would call it giant shoe string onion rings... yeah that's it... giant shoe string onion rings that can't decide if they are or not bread or battered...

For all the rave... and a Tyler Florence two thumbs up... Hmmm... 

I might try it again if I got nothing better to do...
author: Minh V.

description:
I love this place!  I saw it on tv (one of those food channels) and I was excited to be in SF so I can check out this burger place.  

I went with the kobe burger with some blu cheese on top.  I was really happy.  They really know how to do burgers.  It was good and juicy with lots of flavor.  I really do think that this is one of the best burgers you can get.
author: Rob Y.

description: If you want cheap, HUGE, and delicious burgers this is your place! I wouldn't say this is the best burger i've ever had, but it was big, juicy and very yummy. I ordered the deluxe cheeseburger medium and it was definitely medium rare, (bloody juice soaked throughout my bun...more than i'm use to),  I think that's what put me off a little bit. On the bright side, I'm a total food network junkie and glad that i've been to a place that they've featured.  Anyway, I will be back for sure :)
author: Nancy P.

description:
Good enough for me to stop by after class every few weeks, but some things bother me too much for more than a 3-star.

The major one is inconsistency. Burgers are way undercooked half the time. Sometimes the bacon is perfect, a lot of times it's nearly raw. It made me stop getting things with bacon on them altogether. From what I've heard they're pretty good about taking care of mistakes, but since I always get my food to go I only discover it once I'm home.

The other is price. The ingredients are better quality than average, but this still ain't gourmet. You can end up paying close to $20 for a fast food meal here.

That said, most of the menu is delicious. Be prepared to salt your burgers a bit, but the fries, sweet potato fries, and onion rings are perfect. Avoid the chicken though, completely tasteless.
author: Dani A. C.

description: Great little spot. The owner was nice and service was quick. We all got burgers (paleo style) and sweet potato fries. Fantastic. I would definately hit this spot up again and suggest it to a friend.
author: Stacey R.

description:
Husband took me here after our ultrasound ;) since we were close by..he had the Prized Pearl and I had the Pesto Chicken.

My husband said overall it was good, lots of blue cheese however it was really really messy. 

The pesto chicken was just ok for me, I didn't really like how they cut the breast in half (assuming to make cooking time shorter); that left the chicken very dry. 

Would come back to try something else probably only if we were in the area.
author: Michelle Y.

description:
What can I say that hasn't already been said about this place?  It has amazing burgers and I have never been disappointed.

My go-to meal, Bula burger with a peanut butter milkshake.  Sooo good.
author: Cullen R.

description:
Had the Bula Burger with a Strawberry Shake last night.  Even though their burgers are $8.99 and you can upgrade to a Buffalo or Kobe Beef Burger for $4.00, I think it's totally worth it.

Best burger I've had in my life.  This place shitted on In-N-Out, Gott's, Five Guys, Nation's, etc.
author: Chris T.

description: This place is amazing! Definitely worth the title of having some of the worlds best burgers.
author: Geir N.

description:
Ok, I know I probably can't add any more to the long list of positive reviews, but.....

This place is so good that I am a vegetarian and go there specifically for the veggie burger. These people respect their burgers enough to even make the veggie burger a delight to eat. Get it with a small or large order of appropriately greasy fries, and you'll feel just as satisfied as a carnivore.

Also, don't let the hole in the wall atmosphere fool you -- you're getting good quality food here.
author: Lynn F.

description: This place was super tasty. I was craving a burger and this totally hit the spot. Burgers, fries, and milkshakes...hot damn! And one of the guys working there was hilarious. Very friendly employees all around.
author: Chrissy B.

description: My friend and I came here for a late dinner around 9:30pm. We weren't even that hungry but everything on the menu sounded good! We shared the Prized Burger (bacon, cheese, sprinkled with bleu cheese, mayo), small fries & a nutella milkshake. Omg, the nutella milkshake was bomb! I love nutella and I haven't seen it done anywhere else. The burger was also delicious! I was very satisfied. I'm definitely coming back here and next time I want to try their famous Bula burger!
author: Christine C.

description:
If you've read any of my previous reviews you know I'm a bit picky about my burgers! All I ask is that it's better than I can make at home and trust me I'm not destined for the food network or anything! I've had a lot of disappointing burgers in the bay area but Pearls exceeded my expectations! Seriously good food! 

I tried the Phat Bob ($8) which is covered in a light but tangy BBQ sauce, bacon, a giant onion ring and oh soo yummy melted cheese. I loved it! Actually it was so big that I made two meals out of it. Truth be told Pearls isn't bad heated up the next day either! 

I also splurged and got an order of Spries (fries & sweet potato fries mixed). The also offer Springes (sweet potato fries & onion rings). Frankly, I appreciate a place that doesn't make you choose! A full order is a bit pricey ($4.95) but then you realize that it's clearly enough to share. The fries were crispy but the sweet potato was a little undercooked for my taste!

However, the toughest decision is clearly the milkshake ($3.49-$3.99). So many choices I actually said to the guy at the counter "Oh no you have too many flavors I can't decide!" He said "no we don't." And you can't argue with that because serious is there such a thing as too many milkshakes? Seriously what was I thinking? I stand corrected! However, if you are indecisive blueberry was very good. However they have at least 30+ choices including chocolate mint, nutella, coffee & mandarin orange.

I'll be back for sure but maybe not until I've given up on those New Years resolutions!
author: Marissa P.

description: Great burgers and garlic fries! Stopped by early on a Saturday evening and had a short wait. Food was delicious and very friendly service. Seating: 4 window seats, 2 tables of 4 and 1 table for 2. The usual lettuce wrap burger was our gluten free option.
author: Beth K.

description: Pearl Deluxe Burger 4 stars.French Fries 4 stars.Didn't care too much for the sweet potato.My friend had the garlic fries and he said that they just threw garlic on there.There was no buttery garlic sauce.He didn't like them
author: Mrs. H.

description: The Swiss burger with avocado is great. HOWEVER THESE BURGERS ARE GRASS FINISHED NOT 100% grass fed. That's a deal breaker for me. They taste great but remember you're eating a sick animal when the cow is on the standard gmo corn diet. Even if the farm attempts to clean it up with the grass finishing maneuver. If you don't care about all that, try this place as it is delicious.
author: Chris C.

description:
DAMN!!!! I haven't had a piece of meat this amazing in my mouth since... (lets not get too carried away)

Having been in America for about my whole life, I have been to many burger places and i usually order an avocado burger or a mushroom burger. I felt a little bold that day and I tried to deviate from my normal choice of burgers to try something exotic. I saw a half ripped 8 x10" paper on the wall of the Bulu Burger ($8), it was just meat on top of meat (my kind of burger). It was also a prize winning burger from the San Francisco Examiner, that sold it for me. 

The burger had bacon, swiss, mayo & spicy pineapple teriyaki sauce and kobe beef (im a warriors fan, so i had to eat kobe for lunch). As you can see from the stuff listed in the burger, there was no lettuce, tomatoes and onions. I cant speak for you but i hate the extra lettuce, tomatoes and crap veggies on the burger that some places put in there, that dilutes the taste of the burger. Pearl Deluxe Burgers cuts out the foreplay and goes straight to the love making in your mouth!

The burger was a little pricey but it was well worth it. 

Peace, Love and Sadface
author: Garrett L.

description:
My oh my this is indeed the best burger in town(Or at least around San Francisco). Never be fooled by the sketchy exterior and interior design of the place for once you tried the burger here.....you have tasted little bits of heaven. 

1. My favorite despite everyone says is the kobe burger. The rich meat texture and the herbs makes it a delicacy. Its really good! Seriously this is the best one i've had in San Francisco. A must try burger if you are in the area!

2. I also like the Bula Burger. Its really good. I've never had a burger with pineapple but this place makes it really good. The sauce is sweet with the spicy after taste. They do deserve a winning award for this place. 

Even though this is my favorite, definitely try other burgers too! I am in my utmost confident that you will be satisfied!
author: Cavin T.

description: I've eaten here occasionally over the years and everything's always been good... but last night we ordered 'frings' again which is a combo of fries and onion rings, and I have to say they knocked it out of the park! It may have been the best order of fries I have ever eaten.  The burger was good too, very slightly overcooked (it was more 'well done' than the medium as I ordered) but still delicious. Yeah, I want those fries and onion rings again right now.  Whatever your're doing now don't change a thing!
author: Jasmin P.

description: I dont often indulge in a burger but pearls mini burger was awesome in quality taste and price
author: Michael S.

description: Yelp you did not let me down was craving a burger and this was a perfect find. The burgers were big and so flavorful. This place is cash only so bring some cash.
author: Karla R.

description:
Uber tasty.
Friendly employees
Big burgers, grilled sesame buns
High quality ingredients
Many options to decide from for the toppings and patty
My favorite so far is the buffalo burger


Plus, when I was there the health inspector had just finished his inspection and gave Pearl's a 100 on their card (a point up from their previous inspection at 99).  Go Pearl's!
author: Karen W.

description: Great burgers - especially the Kobe Burger.  Definitely among the best burger joints in SF.
author: Brian L.

description: A diamond in the rough. No, literally, it's in the Tenderloin but don't let that deter you. Solid, tasty burgers in a very casual atmosphere. Onion rings, garlic fries, and regular fries were all very good. I've had the mini deluxe, mushroom burger, and regular deluxe and they were all superb. The milkshakes do not disappoint either. A little pricey but totally worth it. Probably some of the best burgers I have had in the city. It's my go-to for burger cravings.
author: Salma R.

description:
Kept on forgetting to put the word out for this place! Been there a few times with a friend who recommended this place. Burgers are outrageous, delicious and totally filling. It was late night and we wanted something that was in burger form and tastie! We wondered around Union Square and it dawn on us that we needed a Pearl's fix. 

Place is small but worth the wait!!!! You can sit and munch on pickles as your burger is being staged to perfection.

Like they say, you can't just eat one. Go back and try out the menu
author: Ken E.

description:
I didn't really have any specific expectations when I decided to try this place out, except that it was "good." So I walk in, and I thought it was a little smaller than I expected. It certainly didn't look like anything special. The menu was on the side, written on an erasable white board. But I was starving to death, so whatever, I quickly ordered my food.

Service was fast, friendly, and I was asked if I was okay with all the toppings, if I wanted any side or a drink, what kinda cheese I want, and how I wanted my burger cooked... which was awesome. When I'm starving, all I can focus on is getting the food and eating it, so I tend to forget mentioning how I want my food.

I bite into my burger... first reaction? UH-FREAKING-MAAAAAZING. The burger was /perfection/! Not too salted that I'm chugging down my drink, but just enough to taste the goodness that is beef. The rest of the burger toppings were fresh and crisp! YUM! I downed that burger so fast, that I finished before my friend even went through half of her mini-sized burger. Yaa, it was that good.

One of the best burger places I've been so far. I will definitely be coming back here again sometime!

[ Overall ]
- Pearl's Deluxe w/ Cheese $6.99
- Small Soda $1.99
- All regular burgers come with onions, tomato, lettuce, mayo unless otherwise specified
- Fast, friendly service
- BOMB food, /this/ is what I call a burger
author: Judy Z.

description:
This was the best Burger I have had in San Francisco other than Joe's cable car. I had Kobe beef Burger which is $4.00 extra but more than worth it. Bread was fresh, cheese was Excellent and I will be a regular. Its a small joint, not a restaurant,  but it is worth it even if u have to wait for a table to Hope
 They are friendly and courteous which is rare these days. I have not had their regular beef Burger, but my roommate (boyfriend/significant other) has and said it was equally as good, but its worth the extra four bucks to upgrade.  I can't think of anything negative to report, other than it is small, but if u really want a quality Burger (beef, and Buffalo or chicken) then go eat at Pearls.
author: Jeff V.

description:
The Bula Burger is exquisite. The spicy pineapple teriyaki sauce is the headliner, separating it from its peers of other specialty burgers. The sauce has a perfect blend of spice & sweetness. The thick layer of bacon accentuates the greatness of the Bula. It's messy, juicy, and cooked to perfection. 

I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a quick bite to eat, especially if you're a burger lover. Whereas some burger joints underwhelm on providing "deluxe" burgers, this joint truly earns it's title. The place is small, so it may be tough to find a spot during prime lunch and dinner hours, but you can always get it to go. Also, it's now cash only, so come prepared.
author: Reid T.

description:
Who keeps saying they want to be vegetarian again?

Oh yeah, me.

Well, I'm still trying. But when cutie-pie and super-prego Honolulu community manager Emi H mentioned that she was really craving burgers, fries, and a shake - now, how could I resist?

And all I hafta say is: OMG! All that hype is true. Pearl's doesn't look like much from the exterior, and I was potentially frightened off by the lack of seating when we arrived, but luckily window seats opened up while we were placing our (massive) orders. Don't go here expecting veggie burgers, my friends, although if you've somehow lost your mind feel free to order a salad or a chicken burger. You just have to indulge in every possible sin, including a juicy burger with all the toppings, fried things, and thick shakes. I sampled the bacon cheese burger, sweet potato fries and a chocolate peanut butter shake. And by sampled, I mean sampled, because this was way too much food for me. A little advice: order a mini (1/4 burger) and split a fry with your friends and it will be plenty, I swear. Take the shake to go and try to stuff it in your mini fridge for a midnight snack. 

Make sure you know what you're ordering before you get to the counter - size, toppings and type. I made the newb error of changing my order midway through, and they had to re-ring me in. They did it with a smile, but I swear I spotted people rolling their eyes in line behind me.

I'm sure someday soon I'll be able to resist the lure of the burger. Thank goodness I don't live in San Fran, or I'd be a carnivore for life.
author: Laura L.

description: Amazing family business great service the owner was at the front taking orders and talking about his menu to us you don't see that much anymore. The homemade onion rings are so good I am a critical onion ring person and these are in my top 2 ever eaten they were sooo good burger was great juicy fresh produce real lettuce fresh tomatoes and the best milkshakes. Don't miss it when your in SF
author: Events i.

description: Some of SF's best burgers are here.  They are huge and send your mouth on a epic quest. Plus the Orion Rings and Sweet fries are some of the best around. A little pricey and a small dinning spot make it a little crazy when its super packed, but you'll be glad once you eat your food. Once its all over, you'll want to eat it again.
author: Michael T.

description: Great spot for a burger and fries.  We have been here a few times and can get very busy!!!  Make sure you bring cash. No credit cards.  The sweet potato fries are tasty.  Make sure you tip...only sexy people tip.....
author: Joe M.

description:
Amaaaaazing! Man, so my friend and I were craving a burger BAD after a previous night of fun, so a quick Yelp searched led us to Pearls. This place has it's hole in the wall charm coupled with some of the best burgers I have had in a looong time. The cashier was super excited and courteous, and the workers were all in hyper drive, spinning out orders left and right! 

I got a Bula Burger (pineapple teriyaki sauce, bacon, mayo, grilled onions and swiss cheese) with sweet potato fries. Perrrrfect! Definitely a great choice, I'm tempted to just stick with it even though I want to try it all! Definitely a good place, make a point to check it out when feeling a burger!
author: Teresa C.

description: Definitely a type of hole in the wall spot that you just might miss if you're not looking for it.  I was and I stepped in for their turkey burger, which was absolutely fantastic in flavor, and a basket of their sweet potato french fries coupled with onion rings.  I ate it all and left very satisfied!  HIghly recommend this place!
author: Jamarcus T.

description:
When I want burger I know where to go to get really nice, juicy, bursting with flavor buffalo patty, oh yea, that is so good!
Seating is really limited, so I wouldn't recommend to go there during lunch hour.
author: Anelya S.

description:
Terrible! If you order food online/or using GoPago app, be warned: DO NOT WALKOUT OF THE DOOR WITHOUT CHECKING YOUR FOOD.

I've ordered the following food items: Large french fries, Deluxe burger and diet coke through GoPago and they message me back in about 10min stating that my order is ready to pick up. I went there to pick up my food and I didn't check the food. I just left the place with my order. It was around 7 something pm, I was heading to Marina Theatre to catch the 8PM Batman Dark Knight Rises screening, everything was fine... I got my movie ticket and went inside the theater, got a seat and opened my bag of food... thats when the nightmare started!!!!
They gave me the small size of french fries, and my deluxe burger came WITHOUT the hamburger buns! HOW CAN YOU FORGET THE BUNS?! It's insane!!! This has never happened to me and I'm 99.9% sure that this doesn't happen very often, I guess I should have gone to McDonalds, I'm pretty sure they will add buns to my burger and I'm 100% sure they will know the differences between the LARGE fries and the SMALL fries. 
I was really upset, so I tweeted to GoPago and they told me to send message to Pear's which I did... I didn't get any messages back from them though, nothing at all. Not even after the movie was done.

I sat through the entire movie hungry and upset....  I couldn't eat the hamburger patty, I didn't bring a fork with me., didn't think I would be needing a fork... WTF! 

I took some pictures of it inside the movie theater: pic.twitter.com/WQ0PJB5y as you can see, there's only the lettuce and the hamburger patty! Small fries when I asked for Large: pic.twitter.com/3ZBcwtJF. The pictures is dark because I was inside the movie theater and the movie was about to start in 10-20min or so.... 
Took this thing home cause I couldn't eat it there: pic.twitter.com/9FEpeLMT look at it... again, HOW CAN SOMEONE FORGET TO ADD BUNS? it's freaking insane!!!!!!!!!! 

I highly suggest going to McDs, In-N-Out, or elsewhere for burgers. I mean, if you want a mediocre burger that comes with buns. The only thing that came perfect in my order was the can of diet coke... 

NEVER AGAIN! I paid $12.46 for a small size french fries, a burger that didn't come with hamburger buns and a diet coke.
author: Dan T.

description:
AAWWWWW i feel so loved. So I came back to Pearl's after 8 very long months because I had to show some old friends where to find the BEST BURGERS EVER! and the (I guess I could say manager?) remembered me!! Also he thanked me for my yelp review which shows me that they really pay attention to what customers really think about the business.

So this time around I ordered the teriyaki burger. It was DEEElicious with perfectly cooked meat (always remember to order medium rare), melted cheese, soft bun, and gooey teriyaki sauce.

My friend really enjoyed her Bula Burger and the other loved the prized pearll We also got a large onion rings which is still in my opinion the best onion rings i ever tasted. 

Portions here are perfect. Not too big, not too small.

I was also lucky enough to try the new nutella shake and CAN I SAY FRIGGIN GENIUS!! they have a ton of different shake combinations that you can't find anywhere else. the nutella is def a must try.

i heard that they are opening up a new location in alameda that is supposed to be bigger. I wish they could expand the restaurant in SF so more people are able to sit down and enjoy their meals.

Def come out and try to best burgers in SF!
author: Em F.

description:
Really? when I thought comcast customer service was the only talking back company I was proved wrong.
Today at about 8:46pm I phoned to order when who ever was working tonight at that hour didn't know the order I have been ordering for two years now. I nicely asked her if I can talk to someone I can understand because after trying few minutes for her to understand my order it was just too tough for her. She started raising her voice and started go at it and all of the sudden she takes a deep breath and says sorry. I remember seeing a post about customers service. Well it still sucks really bad. They need to start acting like a private resturant trying to make that extra honest dollar.
author: Daniel R.

description:
I paid almost $20 for a burger, fries and a coke served on a plastic tray in a plastic basket.  The food was OK, definitely not the best burger I have had.  This place is not in the same league  In and Out. You would be better off going to In and Out.
The meat was OK, the bread was awful. It fell apart  as soon as I picked up the burger. The sauce  they put on it was a little bland.  If I go back, I might try one of the non specialty burgers.
Why is this place so pricey?  It is small, it is in the Tenderloin and it has no parking.
author: Bob b.

description:
The burgers were pretty awesome I must say, although I can't quite give it 5 stars as will be mentioned below.  I had the Bula Burger and some of my friend's Phat Bob Burger:

1.   Bula Burger- I was expecting more from the spicy pineapple teriyaki sauce that comes with the burger.  I liked the sauce, but I wish I could have tasted more of the pineapple because that was the only thing that seemed to be lacking in the flavoring.  The burger as a whole was pretty good though, the patty was thick and soft, and the gooey cheese was great.

2.   Phat Bob Burger- It reminded me of a Western Bacon Cheeseburger from Carl's Jr., but better.  The patty was supposed to be cooked medium, but it was quite pink in the middle, but I didn't mind because I like medium-rare meat.  The burger overall was decent.

Note: I didn't like the way they prepared the bacon in either of the burgers.  For burgers, I like the bacon to be crispy and they can break into pieces/fracture off easily.  Instead, the bacon was not cooked as long, so it was still a little tough, which is not really my style.

Overall, the burgers themselves were pretty good.  The decor and the space available in the restaurant were kind of turn offs because it was kind of cramped, dirty, and uncomfortable.  So in addition to that plus the bacon, there is the -1 star.  But overall, Pearl's was still good and I would definitely recommend it.
author: Lawrence E.

description: Stopped by on a whim after my kids basketball games & were starving. My family manages an apartment around the corner & have driven by dozens of times. Omg super yummy!!! Why didn't I try this before?? I had a turkey burger (yes, not such an exciting choice) BUT it was so delicious!! Kids got mini which weren't so mini. Got frings which were half fries half onion rings (yum) & hubby got pearl burger with blue cheese and bacon. The workers were super friendly & even gave us all samples of ice cream... I am still dreaming of dipping those fries in vinegar...
author: stephany m.

description:
I had a crappy day.  Correction - crappy week.  Being the emotional eater that I am (don't hate), I needed some beef and Pearl's came to the rescue.  Sure enough, Pearl's made the happy meter go up again.

They don't call it DELUXE for nothin!  They now offer minis for specialty burgers.  It was the perfect size to go along with the frings and garlic fries.

We ordered a mini Phat Bob and a Bula Burger.  Man oh man, it hit the spot!  The secret to these burgers is definitely the sauce!   The Bula was smothered in pineapple teriyaki...makes my mouth water just typing about it!  The beef was excellent, niman ranch organic - the good stuff.  And the bacon...mmm bacon!  Thick and juicy!  

Now that I've used enough !!s, I'll end this by saying Pearl's is an excellent burger place.  I'll be going back fo sho!!!  Heck, one more...!
author: Stella K.

description:
This is probably now one of my top burger places to go to in San Francisco. This place doesn't hold back on calories and makes sure their customers become full and happy.

I went here and honestly knew very little of it, but once I got inside this place.... I fell for it right away. I liked their menu. They had a great amount of unique burgers and drinks. I felt like this was a great spot for anyone wanting a burger. You will most likely be able to fit any of your needs due to their variety of burgers.

I am def. coming back just so I can try their other foods. 

FYI I got the Bomb Burger and that was delicious. Def. get that if you love chilli in your burgers. Possibly ask to hold on the onions because it does give a little weird taste, but besides that it was really good.
author: Sonlay V.

description:
There are two kinds of burgers. 

The fancy ones that you pay 15 dollars for that come with a cheese that you have to visit a special shop to procure served on a bread you often cannot pronounce with a variety of toppings with fancy words attached, like caramelized or applewood or shaved or aioli. These are fine burgers, sourced from healthy and happy cows, I am sure. They are even delicious if you are in the mood for something fancy. 

Then there are the burgers that remind you what a burger is meant to be. The ones that are just a little too unhealthy, a little too large to finish, a little too inexpensive and a little too good to be true for being a bunch of basic, though good quality, ingredients. These are the greasy spoon burgers. They are the burgers like the ones you get at Pearls, and Pearls does them soooo right. 

That is all.
author: Drue C.

description:
These burgers give me a hard on.

Whatever, don't look at me like that.

Next time I want to try all of the milkshakes. All of them.
author: jared c.

description:
My visiting teenage niece & I were finishing off a whirlwind week of activities when she said, "Know what I want to do before I leave? Get the *best* burger and fries in town! And I want the BIGGEST, BADDEST one!"

Found Pearl's on Yelp and it was puuuurrrfect in every way! It's obvious this place doesn't really need another review, but there are a couple of minor things some people might find helpful: 

* You can either go totally junk with your burger or really lean it up. If you like red meat, but like to go leaner, buffalo is typically lower in fat and is usually grass fed. They also have turkey and veggie burgers. 

*Want bacon and cheese, BBQ sauce and deep fried onion rings on your burger? Get the Phat Bob.  

* If you are going gluten-free, they will wrap any of the burgers in lettuce, which is my favorite way, but the bun looked like a good quality bun. 

* Expect to spend about $15 on a burger and fries. Totally worth it. I've had comparably priced burgers at fairly nice places (Zuni, Town Hall) that were not as good. 

I can't believe the kid ate a whole 1/2 lb. burger and frings (onion rings and fries) with no problem. Her response when I asked her to rate her Phat Bob on a scale of 1-10 out of all the burgers she's had? 

"11!" 

I look forward to going back...once in a while...No seriously...only on special occasions. ;)
author: N B.

description: Very crispy fries, had the Pearl's deluxe with cheddar and bacon....., Nutella shake looked very enticing
author: Sascha A.

description:
Pearl's has a lot of potential, especially if you order correctly. Someone's obviously put a lot of thought into the menu, where you'll find gourmet-ish upgrades like buffalo burgers and natural beef (for an extra $1.25-$1.50) and seasonal fresh-fruit shakes, alongside frat-boy gutbombs like a hamburger that comes with a hot dog on top!

The place is clean and crisp, without feeling sterile. Service at the counter was on the ball, and the prices seemed in line with similar joints: We paid a bit more than $20 for the two of us. You could see the fresh fruit for shakes in pourable containers in a little fridge near the register, and everyone backstage looked like they knew what the hell they were doing. They even offered frings, so I didn't have to choose between two equally appealing options... sa-weet.

Unfortunately, I was so distracted by the surprise fries-with-rings option that I didn't specify what kind of cheese I wanted on my Pearl's Deluxe, so I got some particularly nasty American technicolor-orange stuff. The theoretical 1/2-pound patty was flat, obviously machine-made, and tasted downright industrial. It came with a decent, but obviously store-bought bun, plus nice leafy lettuce, cardboardy tomato, and sliced onions. The meat was cooked to medium --- as they said it would be by default --- but tasted manky enough that I don't think I'd dare order it again.

My husband wisely opted for the natural-beef upgrade on his mushroom-bacon burger; his Jack cheese tasted a little less processed than the American, the 'shrooms were good (although they paled in comparison to those at Joe's Cable Car), and the patty looked like it had been formed by human hands. Unfortunately, they'd cooked the living daylights out of it. Medium? Nononono... this poor patty was scorched to fare-thee-well-done. Still, it remained reasonably juicy and definitely worthy of another try.

How 'bout those sides? Both fries and rings were from a bag, but actually tasted like someone had bothered to find the best premade versions they could get, rather than the cheap, sugar-coated nasties you find most places. Similarly, a vanilla malt --- although made with soft-serve ice cream --- was actually creamy and malty, without the gloppy texture you ususally find with extruded dairy.

Would I go back? Probably, yeah. But I'll stick with the natural beef, make sure to specify real cheese, and ask for my burger to be cooked medium-rare.
author: anita c.

description: Great hamburgers and low prices.  No parking and very small but a must do for burger fans.
author: David B.

description:
Probably not the healthiest of burgers but then again who wants to be healthy eating a burger.

I had the Bula Burger and my wife had the Pearl Burger. Both were oh-so-delicious.

The patty was juicy and the buns were unique. The unique burger toppings and patty offerings (Kobe Beef, Buffalo, etc.) make it a fun experience. Beats any  6 dollar burger and who wants to pay 20 bucks for a gourmet burger? Not me! If you're like me visit this place. 

For the light eaters try the sweet potato fries :)
author: Miichiko S.

description:
Sorry Barney's, Pearl's now has my favorite burger. This little hole in the wall shop has 5 tables at most. You order at the counter, find a seat (hopefully), and within minutes they deliver your burger to your table. It's a small, intimate place with a really old-school diner feel. The staff is super nice and quick. Most of all the burgers are EXCELLENT.

I had the Bula Burger - the burger that won best burger in SF. They will be featured on CBS's Eye on the Bay on Monday. They offer this burger in regular beef, kobe, and buffalo. May have more. Their garlic fries option is tasty too. The Bula Burger toppings were excellent and the balance of cheese to bread to burger ratio is perfect. I really think the bacon was cooked perfectly, though it could have used a little more.

Try it, NOW. But I would stay away at night if you don't like the Tenderloin at night.
author: George D.

description:
BULA BURGER, BIG AMT OF GARLIC FRIES, & PINEAPPLE SHAKE (with bitz of pineapple) = HELLA BOMMMMMB!!! 

Long lines but thatz what u expect frm a hole in the wall burger joint!!!! Not enough tables but again who cares!! This place is that GOOD!!! They also Buffalo burgers, Ostrich, & i think Bison also which i will try next time!!! 

I'd MOS DEF be back again when i go back to the City!!!
author: Bryan D.

description:
The burgers here are really good. You should go. There's not a lot of seating. Maybe you'll get a table, maybe not. You can always take your burger to go. 

The customer service here is really fantastic and the reason I'm sticking with my 4 star review instead of dropping it down to 1 star after our order was messed up. Here's what happened: 

We waited a long time (20 minutes) for our burgers and when it became apparent that everyone else had received their food, and the kitchen staff didn't seem to be making anything else my husband went to check on our burgers. After being assured "they were making it," he sat back down and we were a little skeptical... soon after, someone came over to let us know what happened (the order was rung up as a call-in instead of dine-in) and offered to bring us a shake while we waited for our burgers. After our burgers came out, another person came over to make sure they were okay. Then when our fries and onion rings came out, the first guy gave us a refund on the price of the burgers. The staff really made a great effort to fix what went wrong which is unfortunately rare. 

To the staff at Pearl's - THANK YOU for caring enough to not only fix our problem, but actually explain what happened, and taking pride in your business. You've definitely kept our business.
author: Emily C.

description:
Place is super small. Like 5-6 tables of 2 small.

For a gourmet burger spot, the place is decent good. I ordered the Kobe Beef Mushroom burger 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/TRBP1G1l8vZkjgfqdx96Cw?select=Mppi1L4WapQ49dd7jWmo9g

and my compatriot Chiko ordered the Avocado Burger. 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/TRBP1G1l8vZkjgfqdx96Cw?select=g4n5iYkPuH4ZrTl3-EXbPQ

I ordered mine rare, it came served medium at best. Meat was good, but honestly I've had better tasting Kobe. Considering we spent over $35  for 2 deluxe Kobe burger sweet potato fries, two sodas and a Peanut Butter Milkshake.. Honestly, it was a tad on the pricey side. Had the burger tasted incredible, maybe i wouldn't be crying, but in all reality I can go to Cafe Mason and get a tad less burger for 1/4 of the price.

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/TRBP1G1l8vZkjgfqdx96Cw?select=ur2bkg_JtgHDyhsuM40cYw

So on goes my eternal quest to find the best Cheeseburger in the Bay Area.
author: Paul V.

description:
Came here 15 min prior to close on a Friday night, err Saturday morning. Dude at the register says everything is to-go. So the group proceded to sit down and eat the food at the table. I don't know whats up with that, but I appreciate not having to eat my food outside.

Anyways, the king burger was awesomeness....who would of thought a hamburger + hot dog could be so awesome?!?! Thanks for the heart attack. I'll be back.
author: James T.

description: Very good burgers, and they have coke with real sugar. Highly recommended. They don't have many tables so it might be hard to fit a larger group, but you can always do take away.
author: Magnus W.

description: Super small restaurant. Definitely no fritz or frills. Some of the menu on the wall is handwritten. You don't expect much and BAM! the burger flavor explosion hits you. Great burger for the price.  Small menu and it's definitely all about the traditional burger here highlighting the quality of the meat. I'm upset I didn't try the buffalo burger or kobe burger. Definitely next time!
author: Catherine C.

description:
When I lived in Nob Hill, this was always my spot for an amazing burger. Living in the Inner Richmond, I still come to Pearls for an amazing burger. I've had too many of the burgers on the menu to remember, but rest assured... they are ALL good! Spend the $14 or so on the Food Network kobe beef winner, it's worth it. I love that they have half sized options on most of the items on the menu. Kind of a bummer that fries are sold separately, but all in all the place is so good I won't hold that against them. 

This isn't the place for ambience as it's pretty small with about 7-10 metal tables, it's where you go if you're looking for flavor. What more can I say? Just go!
author: Monica M.

description: Get buffalo meat! It's so lean and delicious. The pesto burger is unique and tasty. Also, get the half fries, half onion rings basket. They call it "frings." The Oreo milkshake is a requirement to get-so thick and chunky!
author: Christina W.

description:
The chicken burger and fries were great! 

The guy taking my order was super nice and talked to me about Norway and having been there :) 

I had trouble finding it - standing across the street, only because it was smaller than expected :) hehe

Would definitely recommend this if you crave a good burger!
author: Henriette F.

description: Came here after a couple drinks looking for dinner with friends that was not Asian food (almost every restaurant in that area is Chinese or Indian/Pakistani or Thai and we just did not feel like that flavor). I only got the sweet potato fries but they were top notch. My friends all got burgers and LOVED them. We were also being kind of annoying and loud after having had a couple drinks in us but they remained friendly to us which sometimes/usually doesn't happen in such a scenario.
author: Alexandra W.

description:
Been meaning to try this for a while! I was enticed by the thought of juicy burgers and crispy sweet potato fries....... and the fact that they have the word DELUXE in their name.

I ordered the Pearls Deluxe Burger with American cheese, while my sister got the Phat Bob. In addition, we wanted the strawberry milkshake and spries (half sweet potato, half french fries order)! The total ended up being around ~$25, which is not bad. The cashier was being really informative and kept repeating everything I ordered, even when I wasn't done, just to be sure. I thought that was funny because we kept talking over each other by accident.

The deluxe burger (no mayo) was really juicy! The juices were seriously dripping down the side of my hands and it spread all over my face. Other than the fact that the beef was nicely cooked, it tasted like an average burger. The Phat Bob, though....... mmmm. I could taste the heart attack. Sadly, these specials didn't come with lettuce and tomato, so the Phat Bob was just a meat+bun kind of thing. Nevertheless, it was delicious.

Another thing that I liked was the spries. This order gets its own paragraph. It was so crispy and I could not stop eating them! It was the highlight of my meal... I knew the sweet potato fries were going to be delicious, but the regular fries were surprisingly tasty.  I saved half of them to eat later, and they were still crunchy!
author: Karen L.

description:
Hot damn, Gina.  I can't give it the full 5 stars yet as I haven't exactly had a burger there yet, but the Spicy Sly chicken sandwich was one mean chicken sammie! The Spicy Sly (both the burger and the chicken sando) comes with sauteed onions, peppers, spicy sauce, jack & mayo.  It's so creamy, satisfying, and spicy for those who like the heat. 

Located in the lovely Tendernob area, Pearl's is a hidden gem that I'm so glad I recently discovered so I can frequent it as much I'd like for a burger in the next 4 months before I move.  The guy working the register was in a crappy mood though when we were questioning him the difference in size between a mini and a regular burger.  

The menu is huge and will definitely have something, even for the pickiest eater.  The toppings and sauces are creative are amazing, ranging from blue cheese crumbles to grilled onions, to your typical ranch and not-so-typical bacon teriyaki sauce!

The shake menu is also impressive...Unfortunately, I was too full from my sandwich and a half order of the sweet potato fries (also amazing) to try a shake, but they have ever flavor imaginable, even peanut butter, which is what I intend to order next time!
author: Jenny W.

description:
I had a deluxe burger with cheese and Springs. The burger was decent. It was pretty big, which is great, but there was nothing incredibly special about it. Also, I asked for it to be cooked medium and it came back rare. Their onion rings are bad, but the sweet potato fries are solid. All-in-all, it was okay. I was a bit disappointed, though, considering how much I spent ($14.00!).

UPDATE: I went back to give the place another chance. This time I was given the wrong order. Didn't realize it until I got home. Again, everything was really average. It's a decent place, but I can't justify spending so much for an average burger and average fries.
author: Paul O.

description:
WHAT!? No review for Pearls? WTF.

Honestly one of the best burgers I've ever had. I alway leave feeling so full! The buffalo burgers are outstanding. The onion rings and sweet potato fries- PLEASE + THANKS! Their shakes are delish. 

And are now open Sundays! What whaaat.

Staff always nice and asks how I am. 

I won't lie. I'm still not used to moving from clean, yuppie SoMA to the TL. And I don't think I'll ever get used to or learn to live with the smell of piss every morning when I step outside of my door. But knowing that I'm just seconds away from Pearls can make that all go away for a good 30 minutes or so. I'll deal ;)
author: Amanda S.

description:
Burgers don't get better then this.  Its two handful of fresh ingredients, big taste. Customer service is good, seating is a bit tight.

Its everything you look for in a diamond in the rough restaurant .
author: joshua z.

description:
I don't normally crave burgers nor am I a huge burger fan, but this place was really freakin good!!!

I came here after the Giants' parade and ordered the Bula burger, which was one of their many specialty burgers with bacon and some special sweet and tangy teriyaki sauce.  Maybe I was too hungry, or maybe the burger was just that good, but DAMN that bacon was freaking perfect:  it was crunchy AND chewy to the perfect level!  The patty was nice and juicy, and the buns were in this perfect little dome shape that didn't collapse when you held the burger together and didn't sog up from the intense amount of juice and sauce.

The whole thing was a mess to eat, but it was definitely a very VERY enjoyable mess to devour.  

The only downside was the garlic fries.... but that's not the point because the burger's tastiness completely masked that.
author: Jenn L.

description: This place has great burgers. This aside, I don't want to sound greedy, but where are my fries? It costs extra to get any of that shit. The burgers clock in at around 12$, which to me is steep, but everything in the bay...kind of pricy. The burger was great and messy, and I don't know if it's what I ordered or not, but I liked it all the same. So, let's just say that this has been the best burger I've had in the bay area.
author: Clinton J.

description:
These burgers are the best in the downtown S.F. area. You can take that as a criticism, or as a "Thank you, Pearl's, for clogging my arteries and making me feel happy for it." 

The buffalo burgers here are generous, juicy, and full of flavor. The beef patties also are exceptionally good. Their hot dogs, fries, and onion rings are flavorful and satisfying. If you like milkshakes, they let you customize yours -- I like coconut.

I eat here about twice a week. I know, I know -- I'll cut down before I get a heart attack.

The staff is super friendly to both the regulars and the frequent travelers and tourists that shuffle in and stare at the menu with glazed expressions.
author: Joshua Z.

description:
Went through hell of a lot of trouble with parking to eat here. Ended up paying 10 bucks at the local garage. This place is tiny, good thing we were warned by these reviews. We ordered the Pearl's burger and the Spicy Sly. I actually enjoyed the latter much more than the former as the bleu cheese was all I could really taste. It made the burger dry and not so amazing.

That Spicy Sly is something else. It does have a notable kick and that's coming from a guy who has Sriracha running through his veins. A bit oily I must admit but the combination of juicy patty and peppers are a party in the mouth. Be sure to wash it down with the Nutella Shake. Good thing the straw is big, bad thing is I'm lactose but I can't seem to stop sipping on it. Will try a different burger next time.
author: Joe L.

description:
Got the mushroom special burger.  It was awesome.  Greasy, but I guess that's what makes it special.

Place is kinda small to be eating there so I took mine to go.

Couldn't do this everyday, but not bad for once in a while.  Cheap and good.  Definitely try at least once!
author: Ken L.

description: The tast was good, but be careful! I had a piece of paper still stuck to cheese my burgers.
author: Tomoco I.

description:
After craving a burger, fries, and milkshake for about a week, Pearl's seemed like the most perfect place to fulfill that craving; I was disappointed, to say the least.

I was however impressed with the size of the burger, the beef patty was thick and went past the edges of the bun. Pearl's cooks their patty's medium (unless otherwise specified) and personally, I loved my beef cooked medium, but, I next time I would ask for it to be cooked medium-well because the medium part of the patty had a weird taste to it that made me gag a bit. I also thought that the patty wasn't seasoned well, it tasted bland and I had to turn to the salt shaker to excite my taste buds.

I ordered the Avocado burger and replaced ranch for pesto. Upon biting the burger, my taste buds didn't go crazy; my eyes didn't bulge and I didn't let out an exaggerated "Mmm!!!" (which is a clear sign that whatever I was eating was mediocre). If you do love avocados, this is your burger because they are not stingy at all with it; they give you about half of an avocado! 

We ordered Spries (Sweet Potato fries and French fries) and they were delicious, the portion was satisfying as well.

We also had an Oreo shake which was absolutely delicious! It didn't have that thick consistency to it like I expected. I was also disappointed because it came in a regular soda cup and didn't have that extra refill tin cup.

All in all, we payed $28.00 for two burgers, a side of Spries, and an Oreo Shake (which I think is a bit pricey).

Although my burger didn't WOW me, I'll definitely be back to try out the other options.
author: Juliette R.

description:
It's not quite the the Tender Crisp Bacon Cheddar Ranch (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XUyzLvuhbps), where there's tumbleweeds of bacon and cheddar paves the streets, but a night ending at Pearl's does have its fantasy elements. 

There's a burger for every kind of person here, but the common quality is quality beef and fresh ingredients. Take the Prized Pearl, which luxuriates (in a blue collar way) in toppings that include sautéed  onions, crumbled bleu cheese, and tasty mayo. Order some life-shortening onion rings on the side, for full effect.

So yeah, now, when my belly starts a-rumblin' and I'm Jonesin' for a treat (like after a Hootie reunion show, where I'm the opening act), I close my eyes for a big surprise, and we're at Pearl's.
author: Nish N.

description:
If you are a street wear head, and The Hundreds - Post is one of your go to places when visiting the Bay then Pearl's is not too far up ahead - or before depending on which direction you are coming from. Place is small - 10-12 MAYBE 15 people tops!

But back to the point. The burgers are GOOD! Deluxe? Yea! The menu on these babies are amazing. I didn't know which burger to get! SO I just opt for the 1st burger on the menu, The Phat Bob - which happens to be their most famous burger...so I was told. Anyways, inside it has your typical beef patty, bacon, melted cheese, onion rings, and topped with BBQ sauce. Sounds like Carl's Jr. Western Bacon Cheeseburger, but Phat Bob makes this chain classic look super wimpy. Its seriously that good. No, good is an understatement. It was so good, that I mistaken my tongue for the burger! I chomped on it so bad that it left a nasty purple bruise.

Other creations include The Bomb Burger - which is your basic chili cheeseburger, but overloaded so that it is served to you open faced. Knife & fork required.

Sides are your typical fries, sweet potato fries, and onion rings. Or you can combo it up with clever word likes Spries (Sweet potato fries/fries), Springs (Sweet potato fries/onion rings), and Frings (fries/onion rings). They even have buffalo - but I'll come back for that another day.

If you are hungry and don't know what to get, I advise to go with a friend or eating buddy - so you can order a variety and share (^_^)!
author: Angela A.

description: While visiting SF, my husband and I went to lunch at Pearl Burger with his SF office coworkers. It was a good burger but lunch for the two of us came to over $35. 2 burgers, 2 fries and 2 fountain sodas should never come close to $40, especially not at a fast foodish type place.
author: Brianne Y.

description:
