Discovered this gem today and also discovered that I know the owners!

They just won SF Weekly's Burger Challenge with celebrity guest judge Bobby Flay. I love how the owner is passionate about good food and good service.  All the elements of a good burger are here.

1. Bun - moist soft and delicious! It all starts with the bun
2. Meat - Niman's ranch says it all. No hormones, organic grass fed beef.
3. Bacon- thick cut bacon with plenty of meat. Not the shriveled excuse you find in a Denny's burger.

The shakes and sweet potato fries are amazing as well. Couldn't be happier. The food, service, and people at this restaurant are all A+
author: Joe O.

description: Great food and great service! Everyone was so friendly for a order at the counter type restaurant. The fries were cooked fresh and the burgers were cooked perfectly.
author: Conrad G.

description:
Burgers here at Pearl's are delicious, but if you add to many extra sides, the burger can get a little sloppy. I added avocado, bacon, and mushrooms to mine, and after a couple of bites, my burger collapsed into a frenzied mess. Key take-away: Don't get too fancy with the additions, just enjoy the burger.

Another piece of advice: DO NOT upgrade to "Kobe" beef. It is NOT actual Kobe beef. It is Wagyu beef from LA, which is NOT the same! The upgrade is hardly noticeable (I've tried both and could hardly tell the difference.)

Bone Ape Tit!
author: Kenneth N.

description:
I woke up one afternoon after a quasi-crazy night of clubbing in SF craving a nice hamburger, so my friends and I yelped what SF could offer our alcohol-coated stomachs.  We stumbled upon Pearls and decided to give it a try.

The joint was deceptively small -- it could probably hold at most fifteen to twenty people -- but like any place worth eating at in lovely San Francisco, this book begged to be read before I judged it.  I'm a sucker for bleu cheese on anything, so I opted to get the Prized Pearl.  I also like to live life dangerously, so I threw down the extra $4 for the buffalo patty, which by the way was pretty delicioso if I may say so myself.  

Said burger could have used a little bit more bleu cheese, but nonetheless, it was everything I expected from a niche burger place -- fatty, fresh, and flippin' bueno.  The shakes were bombtastic too.  I took one sip of the Nutella shake my homie bought, and man that sent my taste buds into a tizzy.  

Highly recommended if you're in the area.
author: Jerome S.

description:
While it's no longer the first choice at most establishments I frequent these days, I had to sample the San Francisco take on that great American staple: the cheeseburger. Pearl's did not disappoint.

I had the Spicy Sly...the pumpkin cuts the Habanero kick really nicely and of course the burger was cooked perfectly, nice and juicy. Prices were very reasonable for what you get and the ambiance is exactly what I expect from a nice little burger joint.

It's been 2 years since I went here and still rank it right up at the top of the heap in terms of burger joints I've been to across the country (side note: it was much better than the popular Kuma's Corner here in Chicago). If that doesn't warrant 5 stars I don't know what does.
author: Philip R.

description: With so many burger joints in the city, Pearl's is a solid choice, just nothing too unique or interesting as far as the combos go. Likewise I was not a big fan of the patty itself, it's missing some moistness... On a positive note the shakes are tasty.
author: Misha Z.

description:
My husband LOVES burgers. It's probably on the top list of things he thinks about when he wakes up in the morning. So when he told me about  this place and we were nearby, we decided to stop in and give it a whirl.

I did not find anything special about their burgers or fries. It was messy, the bun was too thick, and the flavor just wasn't there. Their fries were too thick. I like to shove a lot in my mouth at once and doing that with their fries just made me want to gag. 

Also, the place doesn't have much seating and it gets crowded. You basically have to stalk your table like prey and eye the people eating their burgers to make them eat faster so you'll have a place to sit.

For the price and quality, I'd rather go to In-and-out where I know I'll get an awesome burger that really hits the spot.
author: Lang T.

description:
After a night of drinking, I wanted something greasy, Pearls it is!

I order a mushroom chedda deluxe burger with spries (regular and sweet potato fries) AND onions rings (it has less batter, more onion). Hubby got a deluxe burger with chedda and bacon.

The burger was greasy! Every time i took a bite, grease spilled out from under onto my basket. I didn't want my burger to get soggy so when I was eating my fries, I would place it on the table on top of napkins. (Hubby's burger was messy b/c he opt to eat like a man...) I really didn't care for the sweet potato fries, seemed like they were frozen for too long but the regular fries were nicely done.

Bonus!! They have pickle spears out for freezy! I love me some pickles.
2 burgers, onion rings, spries, and 2 drinks = $25
author: Anna S.

description:
The place is clean!!! 
After trying this place. I cant eat a burger else where like a mc donalds. I personally like there chicken terriaki sandwhich with mushrooms and cheese. Super messy but it's delicious. I only like there sweet potatoe fries and there onion rings. There peanut butter shake is addictive....lol (excuse the mis-spelled words)
author: Chante C.

description:
Bula Burger & Sweet potato fries & a coke & nothing left behind.. No leftovers.. I ate everything! haha

Hands down one of my favorite burger joints in San Francisco!

I will definitely come back to try the Phat Bob & the other great things people are talking about..
author: Matt M.

description:
Nothing special. Was looking forward to a durty burger while in town and the Ms was at her AHA meeting. I was expecting a flashback to fatburger from my youth.  All I have is my disappointment and an empty bag now. 

Ordered a Deluxe (cooked medium) with american cheese, bacon, and everything else.  Side order of onion rings. 

It was decent but forgettable. The patty was over cooked and not especially tasty. Bacon, cheese, and tomato were great. Onion rings were good. Ho-hum all around though. 

I expect more for the price and reviews. Perhaps it was an off day or I ordered the wrong thing.
author: Sean C.

description: Great burgers and fries. Just be sure you utilize the self serve pickles and ketchup.
author: Daniel R.

description:
This unpretentious place has amazing burgers with fresh flavorful ingredients and crispy fries.  Highly recommended.

PS:  On the door this place is listed as one of Michael Mina's favorite  places in the city.
author: mr. D.

description:
Friday night on Nob Hill - My wife and I had just had some drinks with a friend and we were famished.  A perfect opportunity for our first visit to Pearls!  

I had heard about this place before but never knew exactly where it was.  The restaurant occupies a small storefront on Post Street, a few blocks up from Union Square.  When you walk in, there's not much to the space, just a few tables squeezed into the front of the room, and the kitchen and counter towards the back.  A big sign on the wall lists off the couple dozen sumptuous burgers that they make.

I saw the chicken teryaki sandwich and immediately had a craving for something teryaki flavored.  But I really wanted a hamburger, not chicken.  That's when I saw the teryaki burger - perfect!  It was absolutely delicious.  The fries were great too.

These guys are open conveniently late, so I'm sure we'll be back here again!
author: Tim N.

description:
Seriously overrated. Whoever gives this 5 stars doesn't know a good burger.

A decent burger if you're in the neighborhood and urgently need beef, but otherwise:
- Poor bun choice (it's bland and they don't toast it, so it becomes soggy). - Flavorless, Safeway-style tomatoes. 
- If you request grilled onions, they are barely grilled and sliced cross-ways.
- 10+ minute wait is fine, but it's not really worth the wait.
author: Joe J.

description:
The best mis-order of my life! 

Great basic dux cheeseburger. When trying a new place I always order a basic cheeseburger. Don't forget a couple pickles to add to your burger located between the tip jar and the to-go ketchup.  Always good to see a shop encouraging medium cooked beef - so much better taste and texture and says much about quality of the beef. 

Now for my misorder, before dropping by, I saw a YouTube video about Pearls shakes and spotlighted the peanut butter and chocolate shake. I quickly ordered a pb shake sans chocolate and after several minutes and someone starting my shake I refrained by revising my order. 

As I took my first sip, I quickly realized my misorder led to greatness. Wow that's good, that's amazing. Definitely, recommend the pb shake!
author: Henry M.

description:
Pearl's is so good you gotta be a regular. 

This is the kind of juicy burger food that Beyonce's thighs are massaged in. 

Listen up ladies...Pearl's is gonna give you a new curve.

Pearl's ass is fat and she wants you to know how it feels. She's gonna steal your man and have him calling her baby while you're mmm, mmm pigging out. And let her have him. You're getting fed!
author: Nathanerin L.

description: Boy, how the mighty have fallen. The last couple of times I'd been I thought maybe it had slipped a little, but this time was the last time I'll come. The buns are now flimsy little things that quickly become sodden and were likened to those found at McDonalds. My medium burger came out overly rare and the juiciness was more of a greasiness. The grilled onions were sadly undercooked, too, leaving them with an unpleasant bite. And, the fries were cold. Oh well.
author: Lisa K.

description: Very good hamburgers in a very tiny space. The buns are the best because they hold the burger together for the whole meal. Fresh condiments, hot sweet potato fries &  onion rings, and a coke. Perfect lunch. Very pleasant service. Enjoyed eating at the window bar and watching all the people on the street.
author: Delaine Z.

description:
On our way to dinner Friday night, my wife and I walked by this place that was "PACKED" with people. People lining the hallway, a line snaking out the front door and at least 20 people outside gnoshing on hamburgers!

What is this place? We didn't have time stop and dilly dally, so I made a mental note to check it out later next week.

Today was the day, and I can say, the hamburgers at Taylor's Refresher have just been dethroned. And that's a BIG CLAIM because I'm a huge fan of Taylor's. I still like Taylor's, but Pearl's has stolen my heart.

Not only are the hamburgers BETTER (if that were possible) but they also have MORE VARIETY of milkshakes. Unbelievable, but true!

I went to lunch around 1:30 pm to avoid a crush, but there was still a line and of the 15 seats inside, only one was available. I am so glad it was because by the time I had finished consumming this decadent hamburger, my face needed a complete washing. Yeah baby ... it's that good!

I ordered a simple Pearl's hamburger with American cheese. No fries, no onion rings. Just a pure unadulterated hamburger. 

They also offer Buffalo and Kobe Beef for an extra $4 upgrade.

While gnoshing on this fabulous burger, my eyes were drawn to a picture of a Bula Burger with Kobe Beef and onion rings that apparently won some kind of acclaimed contest of world-wide fame. I overheard one diner explain to his friend, that the Bula Burger is "mind-bending."

I think I'll try the Kobe beef next time. Compared to a 13 oz Rib-Eye Kobe at Harris Ranch for $170 or their version of the Kobe Hamburger for $100, I think I'll try Pearl's. At under $20, it's definitely the Deal of the Century!

The only downside is that Pearl's needs to invest in more quality absorbent napkins. I used at least twenty during my one burger binge.
author: David C.

description:
The Bula Burger with buffalo meat and an order of springs, I think (a basket of onion rings and sweet potato fries).

This is one of the best... oh hell, it's the best burger I've had in a while.

The raves are well-deserved! Yum!
author: Chung N.

description:
I have only had the milkshakes here (always the mint cookies) and they are delicious!  Milkshakes are $5 per cup--which isn't too bad compared to other milkshakes I have had.  I do have to say I was a little disappointed on my most recent trip; I heard the person who was making my shake say they were low on the Oreo cookies, and sure enough, my milkshake had very little Oreo cookies in it.  I'll give them the benefit of the doubt this time, as for the most part, they have been generous with the cookies.  I'm coming back for their seasonal pumpkin shake and will have to try the burgers one day, which looked really good.

There is a crowd during lunch hour, so avoid the lunch rush.
author: Felicia S.

description: The man behind the counter was really helpful with what to order portion wise for my boyfriend and I. I had the chicken pesto sandwich (no mayo) which was so filling especially after a big work out. For girls on a normal day I would have only been able to eat half of it. My boyfriend got the phat bob burger which he thought was really good. I had a small order of sweet potato fries and I definitely didn't finish the whole order. My boyfriend got regular fries and he felt they were cooked perfectly with a nice crunch.
author: Raquel G.

description:
When you have a big greasy burger craving, Pearl's is the place to go. The milkshakes are awesome too. Try a mint chocolate milkshake... ugh, so good! 

I know what I'm having for lunch!
author: Danielle D.

description:
PEARL'S!!! YOU ARE THE BEST IN ALLLLLLLLL THE WEST!!!!

So... you know how you hear those stories of those guys in Japan falling in love with pillows and marrying them? That's sort of how I feel about the burgers at Pearl's. Although I don't know how our marriage would work out in the end... If I got married to a Pearl's Burger I'd probably end up eating my spouse on our honeymoon and end up in jail for murder... So maybe I'll just not do that.

Random anecdote aside, Pearl's is the place to be if you really like good meat. You can choose from 4 different types of beef to have in your burger, all at varying prices. The basic beef is Nieman Ranch, then they have Estancia (which is from Uruguay, free-range, grass-fed, etc etc etc), then there is Buffalo (which actually has less calories, fat and cholesterol than chicken), and the highest grade is, of course, kobe beef. I honestly am perfectly happy with the "basic" Nieman Ranch, but knock yourself out if you feel like it.

They have awesome fries, sweet potato fries and onion rings, and you can get different combos if you like (ie. frings, springs,spries). Make sure to load up on ranch for your dipping pleasure as well.

While seating is limited and the ambiance is not the most amazing, it doesn't even matter! The food more than makes up for the fluorescent lighting!!!

My personal favorite order: Pearl's Deluxe Burger with bacon and bleu cheese, with a side of frings (fries & onion rings) and a diet coke (you know, because I'm OBVIOUSLY on a diet).

And yes, I do eat here once a week. I am engaging in an ongoing courtship with Pearl's Deluxe Burgers.
author: Felicity M.

description:
The burgers were phenomenal! But I'm not really sure what people are raving about when they talk about these fries! Some friends and I came here on a busy Friday night and we ordered burgers for each of us and spries (sweet potato fries and regular fries), frings (onion rings and regular fries), and garlic fries, just to sample them all. To our surprise! They were all soggy! Sad to say, the much raved about sweet potato fries were horrible, they tasted like mashed sweet potatoes because of the lackluster texture. Now on to the burgers

Oh lalala! The burgers! So I ordered the Prized Pearl - a enormous burger with bacon, carmelized onions, and blue cheese! MHMMMMM! Is all I could say for at least 10 minutes! I loved how the strong taste of the blue cheese went with the natural flavor of the burger. It was AMAZING! 

Conclusion:
- Burgers are phenomenal! Especially Prized Pearl
- Fries, Onion RIngs, and Sweet Potato Fries didn't even come close to what good, so soggy, definitely take a raincheck on these, all of these!
author: Kevin L.

description:
it's been a few years since i've been to the by area and i definitely miss this place! not necessarily for the burgers but for the shakes! i simply have not found a shake as good as the ones i have had at this burger joint! 

will finally be going back next year and hopefully the shakes are still up to the standards i remember ;)
author: Alannah E.

description:
Best no-bs burger in town.

Want a burger?  Go here.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Oren F.

description: One of the best burgers around with fresh ingredients and full of flavor.  And I didn't have to ask for mine to be cooked medium.  There really isn't much as far as ambiance, but we will definitely be back.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
Huuuge burgers! 

The burger was pretty good, even if it was a little difficult to eat. The meat was really juicy and I loved the huge buns that could stand up to such a meaty burger. But the bacon was way undercooked to the point where it was almost inedible for me. 

I thought the fries were decent, but a little greasy. And I loved how you could take as many pickles as you want. I ate three! 

If I lived in the area, I would definitely come here to get my burger fix and I might come back to try some of the more adventurous burgers. But I just didn't think it was worth the hype, and definitely a little more expensive than it was worth.

Also, the bathroom was disgusting, almost made me hack up the burger I just ate. :(
author: Hannah S.

description:
I actually went out of my way to go to this place because I heard the burgers were fantastic. Luckily, I chose a day (or time) where there weren't many people since I could tell the place wouldn't hold more than 12 people.

I ordered a mini burger (I wasn't too hungry) and a side of chili fries while my friend ordered a different burger (sorry, don't remember the name). The burger was so good and so juicy. The patty was big and it was very filling. And the fries. My gosh. The fries were excellent with the chunky chili, thick fries, and meaty goodness.

They are also very friendly. They laughed while my friend and I argued over what to do with the onions in the chili fries and were nice enough to ask the suggestion "do you want the onions on the side?" to which my friend cautiously asked "could we get them...grilled?" and she said of course. 

Unfortunately I didn't get the chance to try a shake. I panicked when I saw people behind me and didn't have time to choose a flavor (they have a ton of options to choose from). But if I'm ever in the area, I'll definitely go back again and make up for my milkshake-less experience.
author: Susan J.

description:
Take your favorite greasy spoon burger from back east, add a west coast twist (avocados, buffalo meat0, and jack the price by 3 bucks and you have Pearls. 

It is hands down one of the best burgers in the city, which explains the price points.  BUt in a city that has a severe dirth of decent greasy spoons its not hard to see why.  I would saw its worth the money, especially considering the serving size.   But probably  not worth a wait of more than 20 minutes if there is a line.

Great burger, just don't get your hopes up because some local bay aryan fooled you into thinking it is the best burger ever made (AKA Zacharys Pizza level hypery)
author: Spanky M.

description:
There are two primary sizes of burgers; 1/4 and 1/2 pound.  I thought the 1/2 pound burger sounded to large and the only option was the 1/4---perhaps the optimum size would be 1/3.

The quality of beef and burger was cooked exactly the way I wanted it.  I did feel great by having the smaller 1/4 pound burger--it is much smaller than you might think. 

I also got the frings (French fries and onion rings) fewer onion rings than I would have imagined; nice and thirsty fries.  I enjoyed my experience and look forward to trying the larger burger next visit.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description:
I love this place... but something has happened... first they changed the fries to some "Burger King Baby Batter" and they are no longer the fat fries dashed with the perfect amount of salt we all came to love. Now the burgers have started to change... I can't really pinpoint it, but something is different. 

I think it's too much messing around with a good thing... A great thing! Don't lose it completely...! At least bring the fries back!
author: M M.

description:
I thought In-and-Out was the best burger place. Yesterday, after my first bite of Pearl's cheese burgers, I changed my mind.

When I got here, I saw that there were only about 6 tables, luckily, there was no line (the line began right after we ordered!). Even though it was a a tiny bit pricy, it was definitely worth every penny! 

We ordered an order of garlic fries, cheese burger (cut in half), and a chocolate milkshake.I was really hungry, so I was kind of grumpy when it took about 5 minutes for our food to be ready.

I think that was the freshest, tastiest cheeseburger I've EVER ATE. The garlic fries tasted very different than any garlic fries I've ate before. I guessed Pearl's served organic fresh stuff, that might explain the taste difference.

The milkshake was super yummy as well! 

My boyfriend and I were still hungry, so we bought a mushroom burger. Man, I was SO FULL! The only thing I didn't like about the mushroom burger was the cheese, it tasted great, but it felt like there was more on one side than the other. I would eat a very cheesy part, then when I got to the other side, there was pretty much no cheese. 

Even though this place is really out my way, this will be my first place to go if I'm craving burgers :)
author: Sophia G.

description:
Definitely a hole-in-the-wall, local type place. I was expecting a little more from Pearl's, especially because I ordered the buffalo meat, which costed me an additional $4 on top of the $9 burger. 

I ordered the Pesto Burger, which was good.... except that it turned my burger into a huge, sloppy mess. I'm down to get messy, but seriously, this was difficult to eat. As for the size, they are monster burgers. Also, you get free unlimited pickles too. Sweet!

If I ever come back here, I'd definitely skip the upgrade for the buffalo meat, as I wouldn't be able to justify spending that extra $4. Although the meat did taste a little leaner, if no one had told me I was eating buffalo, I wouldn't have known.
author: Patrick P.

description:
Heard about this place from a friend who lives in the neighborhood, but also previously saw Tyler Florence's rave review on "Best Burger I Ever Ate" on the Food Network.

The burgers were definitely worth these recommendations. Huge, juicy, perfectly cooked as we ordered them (Medium Rare), and piled high with deliciousness. We had the Prized Pearl (bacon, blue cheese, grilled onions) and the Phat Bob (onion rings, bbq sauce, bacon) with a side of onion rings and sweet potato fries.

Here's where I dock one star: The onion rings were soggy to the max. Not very appetizing at all. The sweet potato fries weren't crispy, but this is usually normal for sweet potato fries anywhere. Maybe this is being too picky by docking one star for the onion rings, but I loves my onion rings. :(

We also had the mint oreo shake, and chocolate banana shake.. DELICIOUS! The chocolate banana shake was not just banana flavoring, but bits of chopped banana inside. Yum. They also have a NUTELLA shake that I'd love to try next time.

Yup, there definitely will be a next time.
author: Tay R.

description: Had dinner and lunch here since my last review.  Have nothing but good things to say about this place.  The chili burger is messy but yummy.  The mushroom burger is the favorite of our family.  Three out of four of us ordered them recently.  Chocolate shake is also good.  We'll be back soon.
author: Lewis C.

description: So we found this place on TA and took the cable car all the way down from Fisherman's Wharf to get here.  Boy were we glad we made that decision!!  This place is a total hole-in-the-wall but absolutely amazing!!  Wide variety (and interesting) selection of hamburgers.  Made to order, and thank you for cooking mine medium rare, not many places will do that.  My hamburger was perfect, it was so good I had to order another one to go and eat it later.  My wife loved hers too, and her milkshake (pumpkin) was excellent!  The owner was super nice and spent a few minutes talking to us.  If you are in San Francisco you have to check this place out, I promise it will not disappoint!!
author: David S.

description:
My favorite burger join in SF!!

Words can't explain how good their burger is, especially with their awesome sweet potatoe fries. 

They open til 2am on Fri/Sats, perfect late night munchie after a movie/bar/hang out/whatever.....

Staff is always friendly and location is convenient to Union square/Nob Hill.
author: Maggie C.

description:
Grease-tastice! Just the way I like it! I got the Mini Deluxe bacon cheeseburger. It was messy but yummers! My only complaint was that I wish the bacon was crispier. It will make you want to eat salads for the rest of the week.

The place is kinda small and the service is lovely. You order and pay for your food at the counter and they bring it to you, which is nice. We sat at the window and enjoyed people watching.

Thanks to Yelp, a Los Angeles-native like myself, knew to come straight here for a good burger.
author: Laurice F.

description: I was craving a good burger for days. I finally got a chance to eat here, but it was pretty disappointing. I think Umami is lightyears ahead of this place.
author: Becca I.

description:
Pearl's is a cute little burger joint in San Francisco.  By little, unfortunately, I do mean tiny.  There are hardly any seats, so when it gets packed, you're getting it to go.  Of course, I have no shame in telling you that I will stare someone down, until they're finished, just to be able to sit and enjoy a veggie burger with a Nutella shake.
Nutella shake.  Pure genius, if there ever has been.  As a matter of fact, as I am writing this review, I am wondering how I can get to Pearl's today.
So, if you are a fan of burger, fries and a shake, try Pearl's because they do it the best!
author: Hannah B.

description:
Now about my favorite burger joint in the city. This is to distinguish it from fancy restaurants that serve burgers, which can be uber-delicious as well (you know I'm talking about you Mission Beach Cafe and Namu). Pearl's is a joint though. You choose your meat (unless I'm mistaken the choices are beef, kobe beef, buffalo, turkey), you choose your size and whatever else. I've always gotten the Spicy Sly. You can get fries, sweet potato fries or onion rings or any combination of the three. They also have a multitude of great shake flavors. The beef burgers are JUICY and delicious and onion rings are my favorite side.

It is tastefully located in the Tendernob right next to a massage parlor in case you need to take care of other appetites as well.
author: Sam P.

description:
Underwhelmed. 

Pearl's is clearly setting itself up to be a chain of burger joints, and there's nothing wrong with that, but there's nothing here that made think they have the uniqueness or wow factor to really make it as an "authentic" style chain. The big problem is that here's nothing personal or local about the place to make me want to champion it.

I had a bacon cheeseburger, and like others have noted, the bun was not stellar. I think the problem is that the ingredients here are highly processed, so the bun is lacking flavor or texture (it will fall apart and be a big mess). The meat is molded into a form (at least mine seemed to be) and seems to inevitably dry out. Mine was so dry I had to keep adding mustard and ketchup. They probably need to hit these burgers with some kind of special sauce or Worcestershire or something to keep them moist if they are always this dry. The fries are fake with lots of artificial seasoning, etc. I did enjoy the onion rings, but again they are clearly not made fresh but dumped from freezer to fryer and made who knows where. Again, all that is fine if you're on a budget and on the go, but the decor and environment and details of the joint don't really inspire you to buy into the place like an In & Out Burger or similar chain grabs you. It's just another reiteration of a fake diner, and let's be honest: who really cares about diners anymore except baby boomers? They need some pizazz or a clever gimmick if they're going to really make it, IMHO. If your focus isn't quality ingredients made for the community (see Burgerville in the Pacific Northwest), you're going to need something novel to stand out as a budding chain. 

However... bonus points for having a big container of decent-quality pickles that you can take at your leisure. I did. A lot.
author: Casey C.

description:
Freakin YUM!  Yo, I love me some red meat, and even better: ground red meat between bread (aka burgers)!  Burgers are awesome here!  Sandra wanted burgers, and we decided to try someplace new.  We ended up at Pearls, and dayam, were we happy.  

I got something with bacon, onion rings, cheese, and bbq sauce.  Whatamess.  There's so much bacon that it falls out, and still leaves a ton of bacon in the burger!  If it didn't have onion rings in the burger, I'd have put them there.  Some genius thought of me when they designed this, and I'm a happy camper.

I also got the strawberry banana milkshake.  I figured it'd be strawberry ice cream, milk, and a banana blended together into a creamy milkshake... NOPE!  Even better!  It was a strawberry milkshake with chopped chunks of banana whipped into the shake and served with a phat boba straw!  DUDE!  It's like a banana boba strawberry shake!  How can that not be awesome!?    

Sandra got the avocado burger.  There was like... 3/4 of an avocado in there!  They definitely aren't afraid of skimping on the contents of your burger.  It's pretty awesome.  

We shared a small order of onion rings.  This was probably our only mistake.  We should've gotten a large!  They were seasoned to where you really don't even need mustard or ketchup on them!  

Basically, they NAILED IT!
author: ROB L.

description: I am literally in love with this place. Them burgers be bangin boyeeeeee awooh!
author: Kevin D.

description: This place is awesome when you're drunk, sober, and just plain hungry. Burgers are a little greasy. Still packed with awesome flavor.  Staff is super sweet. Milkshakes are better than the average fast food milkshake. The guy at the front seems stoned and a little spacey BUT super sweet and funny. They accidentally put onions on my burger and he told me to put it on his hand and he'd take it away. A little weird but nice in gesture. My boyfriend and I love this place and go at least once a month.
author: Kiara W.

description: This could have been a five star exeperience if it hadn't been for the girl at the cash register. She was not at all interrested in serving us and missed an item in our order and then acted all rude when we asked for it. Besides that, good food! A lot of food!
author: Agnes N.

description:
To be honest, if I were just walking around the area, I don't think I'd bother to notice Pearl's or even stop by to eat here. It's such a quaint little burger joint that you'd think their burgers are no different from Wendy's. But after running the Embarcadero with a friend and burning tons of calories, I suddenly started craving a nice juicy burger which led my friend to suggest we eat at Pearl's.

I truthfully felt skeptical when I first entered. There was nothing fancy about the place let alone their menu (appearance wise, but selection wise, I was impressed.) I decided to keep it simple and get the Mini Pearl Cheeseburger with a side of frings. I actually liked the idea of "frings" (fries + onion rings) because usually when you go to a burger joint, you have to order those two sides separately thus having to pay more, but with the frings, you can get a nice distribution of both without having to throw down double! As for the burger, it was pretty juicy and delicious, but next time I plan on trying one of their specialty burgers with Kobe beef.

The best part to my meal at Pearl's was how I got a free Chocolate Cherry shake! Somehow the lady in the back took down an extra order for that and had no one to give it to, but somehow she chose lucky ol' me amidst the crowd. Thanks lady, I'd like to think she's Pearl just so I can say, Pearl, thank you, you're amazing and so are you burgers, frings and free chocolate cherry shakes.
author: Ally C.

description:
Michael Mina and I have SO MUCH in common. For example, we both enjoy eating at Pearl's! BFF, right? 

I got a mini bacon and cheddar cheese with a side of spries (regular and SPF) and a Perrier. 

1/4 lb. burger was POIFECT in taste, texture, and size.
author: Jacquee P.

description:
There is only one thing that we service dogs like better than shrimp, and that is hamburgers! The name of this place should be "burgers are us". 

As the others have already said, order any burger, they are all very good, but the buffalo burger is very good, and you can rationalize it by saying that is healthy!  What a deal!

Good milk shakes, fountain drinks and fries as well during our visit in February 2011.
author: Finnegan M.

description: I hate to do this.  However, the last couple of burgers I had here sucks, big time.  I ordered the Buffalo burger and it must have been the hide they put in because it was EXTREMELY tough.  I hope it was a temporary thing they are going through, however this was the second time it happened.  They better shape up or else I need to find another go to burger place.
author: Jim J.

description:
Really? This is all it takes for people to rave about a burger? 

I had the standard cheeseburger. It was ok--I mean the meat tasted fresh but the bun fell apart before I was half way through. And I know it is a gimmick but c'mon, some secret sauce would help, even if that secret sauce is just mayo, hot sauce, and ketchup. 

I did love the fries. They were extra crispy and fried. Ambience was ok--limited seating but it was fine on the Saturday afternoon that I went. Parking sucks, as always. But saying parking sucks in SF is as painstakingly obvious as saying water is wet or that Mitt Romney is out of touch. 

So Mr/Mrs Pearl, I doubt I will return. Sorry. But a burger should be more than just "meh."
author: George J.

description:
This is the best burger that I have found in San Francisco!! I doubt I will ever find a better one and this doesn't bother me cause Pearl's is that good! The meat is juicy and delicious. You can tell it is high quality. This is great because it means that I can feel comfortable ordering my burger medium-rare the way that I like it. The bun is unique and super tasty, a fresh bakery-style roll. Bonus- it isn't just bakery-style, it is from a bakery, so a sign proudly indicates (I can't remember what bakery). The BACON that they use is above par. It is lean, but it's presence is still downright imposing! Honestly, I don't think I've ever seen bacon exactly like it. They must get some certain cut and cook it a certain way. 

The only downside might be limited seating. Both times I have been there were at what I would think of as 'off', no rush hours, yet both times my husband and I narrowly got a table. I'm pretty sure a table might be a near impossible feat if one were to come during lunch (i.e. 11:30am-1:30pm). Then again, Ive never been there at that time so I s'pose I don't know.
author: Melissa S.

description: The sly burger is hands down my favorite burger! If you like chiles and/or spicy food, TRY THIS. The flavors have always been consistent and the meat is really juicy. I've also ordered garlic fries a couple times. If you're a garlic lover, they're a must have. They load them with minced garlic. One thing though, they tend to be on the salty side. They might not make them salty anymore but ask in case ;) Nutella shake is bomb too.
author: Natasha S.

description:
Friendly staff. Tasty burger. Got the mini deluxe w/ cheese. Liked the sesame buns. Just enough for me. Get the frings (mix fries/o-rings)! I'll have to try the shakes next time. i saw under the reviews a suggestion to try the "nutella" shake but didn't see it on the menu board.

Street parking could be a problem.
author: Carolyn J.

description:
Fresh burgers made with high quality beef... or bison if you want. They might look like any patty that you've seen, but they're juicy and bursting with flavor. Probably the best burger I've ever had. Oh, and their I love their SPRIES (sweet potato fries mix with French fries).

They have specialty burgers and normal burgers, but all are made with the same quality ingredients. Definitely try it when you're in SF.
author: Katheryn H.

description:
I rarely crave a shake.  I did tonight and the first place that came to mind was Pearl's.  While hubby was willing to drive, I was hoping we can find something closer and was thinking McDonald will do...but the drive continued and we ended up at Pearl's :)

After studying the menu, I was deciding between the mint oreo and the chocolate banana and chocolate banana won.  Yummy and the banana chunks are one of the favorite part of the shake.
author: Gloria H.

description:
Great specialty burgers/turkey burgers/chicken. Springs (sweet potatoe fries & onion rings) are the BEST!

This place is my late night savior (though also really good when sober).
author: Nick T.

description:
I've been here twice and was seriously disappointed each time :(

I had the turkey burger and the veggie patty. Both patties tasted like they had been in the freezer and quickly microwaved to thaw. I had the fries and thought they were too greasy and nothing to rave about.
author: Kamalpreet K.

description:
Finally got to try this place! I got the Phat Bob burger and I have to say that is a good burger. The meat was of good quality and when I asked that it be cooked medium rare, it came out medium rare. 

Have tons of napkins ready though because one bite of the burger and it's yummy goodness will be dripping down the side of hands. 

I can't wait to go back and try the other burgers.

Bottomless pickles! They get a star just for that alone!
author: Genie S.

description:
I ordered the mushroom burger before I read the sign that said, " the winning burger the Bula burger with Kobe beef and onion rings." At first glance, I couldn't believe how soft their buns looked (no pun intended). You know how you see a Big-Mac on TV and it looks so voluminous and juicy, but in real life it's flat and grey? Well, their bread, and the burger as a whole, was really as good as it looked. 
 The garlic fries immediately opened my sinuses since the chucks of garlic were barely cooked. 

In terms of taste, this place gets 5 stars.
How you feel afterwards, a 2. 

The meal sat like a brick in my belly. We were driving to a friend's wedding in Pleasanton when I frantically called the hotel we were staying in and asked if they had a gym. There was no way I could eat  again in 5 hours after that meal without working out!
author: Aghavni W.

description:
Really good burgers. Quality meat. It's a heavy burger so be prepared. I tried the mushroom burger and the spicy sly. Each ~ $8. They also have kobe beef and buffalo upgrades for $4 more, something I am very interested in trying. 

I enjoyed the mushroom burger, but the spicy sly was too spicy. If you enjoy spicy food, this is definitely the burger for you. It is coated with a habanero pepper sauce which gives it intense flavors. 

They have a huge selection of shakes, including unique flavors like Nutella. Very good, not too sweet, tastes just like Nutella :)  Plus, they use low fat milk. 

If I ever want a burger in SF, I would come here.
author: Joyce L.

description:
Regular size is 1/2 pound, mini is quarter pound. I was tempted to go for kobe beef but it's $4 extra. Maybe next time. They also have buffalo meat substitute as well for $4 extra, with signage of how it's supposed to be a lot better than cow meat. 

I had the Bula which has some sort of spicy tangy pineapple sauce. It was delish. Sweet potato fries were fresh and steaming hot when they came out. Milkshake just divine.

I sure wish the place had more seating. If it's crowded and you're patient, there will be a seat opening up at least every ten to fifteen minutes. 

Parking's a pain too. 

Just one of those really small places that everyone goes to because the quality and price can't be beat.
author: David N.

description:
Kobe Burger it is..yum..

This place is good i must say it is a HUGE burger and cheap. A must have. This burger is fast to get and way better then fast food.
author: Andreane R.

description: I read the reviews on Yelp and ALL the good things written by others are spot on... I had the most yummy Prize burger (blue cheese, bacon, caramelized onions) with a 1/2 order of the best sweet potato 1/2 garlic fries for lunch today. Everything was perfect and I am still full... I highly recommend this burger joint...
author: Kris K.

description:
Everything that nice little man says in the video is pretty much true!

Not big on burgers, and when I am in the mood I'll just go to the nearest In n Out. I'm not big on beef in general, actually. But for whatever reason, we were craving a burger and looked on Yelp- since this place had over 900 reviews, it didn't matter what people said, we just decided to go. 

When he says they use Niman Ranch beef -- well, you can really taste it. It's super lean, and just tastes...FRESH! No grease or anything dripping from it-- I guess that's what "organic" tastes like. 

They have Kobe beef, Buffalo meat, chicken and even veggie burgers. Although-- I don't know why'd you come here if you were a vegetarian. 

The little man is right, it is very clean inside--very small, but very clean. The staff is really nice, just like he said. I ordered a specialty burger not knowing it didn't come w/ produce, and when I asked for it after my burger already came out-- there was no hesitation. The worker came back out in 2 minutes w/ a basket full of lettuce, onions and tomatoes. 

Anyway-- I guess I'm just confirming that everything that man says in the video is true! This place is the spot to go to for a DELICIOUS FRESH burger accompanied by a friendly staff!! Yum!

I guess the only one negative thing I'd say, and it's not really any fault of anyones... is that the place is small. When I came it wasn't too packed, but I could imagine coming when the place is crowded-- probably would take a while and be cramped inside. But hey, that's what "hole in the wall" places are all about. It would be absolutely worth the wait anyhow!
author: Mindy Y.

description: Great milkshakes! Try the oreo chocolate and you will be impressed!
author: Ron B.

description:
For the past few years, I have been on a bit of a quest to find the best burger around.  I don't order anything fancy, not even cheese.  Just a regular burger, with the usual toppings.  Most of the places I have been to in SF that are reputed to be "the best" rarely live up to the hype, but Pearl's is an exception.  
Easily the best burger in the city (aside from the $20 burgers you might find in fancy restaurants).  It really is just a perfectly executed burger from bun to bun.  Great ingredients, cooked and seasoned just right, and the price is right.  
Please Pearl's, don't ever go away.  I wouldn't make it without you.

Other good things:
-Frings (Onion rings and fries together)
-Nutella Shake
-Very good garlic fries
author: Dan L.

description:
I'll have the clogged artery with a side of heart attack, please. 

Pearls will send you to an early grave, but fuck it, the world's gonna in 2012 anyway, right? 

I forgot what it was called, but I had the burger with bleu cheese crumbles, bacon, and Swiss cheese. Pretty damn good! They use meat from grass fed cows and you can really taste a difference. A side of garlic fries and an ambulance on speed dial and you're good-to-go. 

The place is pretty small, only a couple of tables. Service is quick and friendly, though.
author: Andrew A.

description: I ordered the deluxe burger expecting to have one of the best burgers I've ever had because of all the great reviews here on yelp, but I couldn't have been more disappointed.  The burger was bland, messy and difficult to eat.  I thought the fries would be ok, but they're just your typical burger joint fries.
author: Joe N.

description: Mini-burger just the right size n delish
author: paul m.

description: Good as it gets for burger shops IMHO. Quality ingredients, excellent and friendly service. Recommend the half and half Garlic fires/onion rings combo order (garlic fries are lightly battered and piled with enough garlic to ward off the most agressive vampires). Tried Bula burger, sauce is nicely spiced. and Phat Bob, great combo of sauce, cheese and bacon, and the teriaki mushroom which has piles of mushroom and a nice sauce that is not too sweet. Also as others have mentioned, the endless pickles are quite nice, sour dills. Pearl's Burgers are Big at 1/2 pound so order minis if you trying to keep your girlish figure (cause you gonna want to try some of the fired side goodies as well). Didn't have room in my weekly calorie budget for a shake but they looked great.
author: Mitch J.

description: Best milkshake I've ever had in my life, hands down.
author: Nina C.

description: Really great burgers, except for that bun!  Definite 5 star rating if not for the crumbly bun that gets so soggy and broken down, it's borderline nasty.  I got the Phat Bob and it was delicious!  Make sure to ask for all the toppings like lettuce, onions, and/or tomatoes because it doesn't come with otherwise.  My advice would be to pick it up and never put it down.  Took me all but a few minutes to finish a 1/2lb Phat Bob.  It was a combination of it being yummy and racing against the bun completely soaking and falling apart.  One of my friends ordered the garlic fries and they're the best I've had in a while.  I really cant get past how terrible the bun is... and it keeps me from wanting to go back =/
author: Christopher L.

description:
Jaaaysus. Looks like this place doesn't need any more praise on yelp, but it deserves it. I had the Bula Burger and sweet potato fries. The burger was massive and the toppings went perfectly together.

I got mine to go and ate it in Union Square, but while I was waiting I noticed a customer tell the staff his burger was undercooked. They literally gave him the next burger off the grill and threw in a milkshake of his choice. good on ya
author: O'Brien J.

description:
First things first - get the sweet yam fries!! To die for. 

I had the teriyaki chicken burger when I checked out the place with some friends a few weeks back, and maybe the teriyaki just isn't up to par with the others, but it was really just a basic what-you'd-expect burger. Well, except for the bun, which was veryyy good (sweet and fluffy). The teriyaki sauce on the chicken breast seemed very run-of-the-mill.

The restaurant itself is pretty small and it was a tight squeeze on a Friday night at around 7:30-8ish. There were a TON of people waiting in line to order, and every table was filled when we got there. We managed to find two tables to squeeze together for our group.

I would definitely come back though, and will try another burger. I will update this review if my taste buds judge my next burger as deserving of more stars.
author: Amy D.

description:
I joined Yelp just to review this restaurant. We initially found it by searching for the highest rated burger place in the city. We read the reviews and were convinced. 

All reviews were basically excellent, except one or two that complained the pesto burger was bland with little pesto. I decided to go out on a limb a order the pesto anyway, and I was pleasantly surprised, then a little mad. Who would dare to defame this delicious, juicy, pesto-heavy cheeseburger? Offended, I decided to sign up. 

Anyway, it was probably the best burger I've had in the city, or in life. The meat was great -- I ordered mine medium-rare. The burger was large. And they have so many creative burger choices. They also serve buffalo meat, kobe beef, turkey burger and vegetarian burger. Pearl's also has a wide variety of milkshakes and malts with so many flavors! The only problem I had was the sides. It's great that they have fries, garlic fries, sweet potato fries and onion rings. You can order half and half baskets called "frings" and such. But, eh, they're okay. 

Stop by if your hankering for a good burger, and you might be able to snag 1 of the 3 small tables they got in there.
author: Diana N.

description: Not cheap at all but the burger was really good. Had the garlic fries too and those were no punishment either! I plan on going back for sure
author: Josh V.

description: A bit over hyped. Dry burger patty, dry bun but a friendly staff and descent shakes. The fries are not half bad.
author: Jeramiah W.

description:
Jam-packed everytime! But here in San Francisco, that means the food is good and well worth the wait! 

Bacon cheese burger, order of fries and ANY of their shakes makes for the perfect Friday night dinner date. 

The burgers are always moist and juicy. They have that classic flat top taste and perfectly melted cheese cascading down the side that makes your water just by looking at them. I crave these monstrous things regularly! mmm!

Fries are fries, nothing too special about them. Compliments your burger well.

But the shakes are what really make me happy here. All of them taste homemade with big hunks of fruit, real peanut butter swirl, and even crunched up oreo bits! They have wide straws to make sure you get every last bit of deliciousness out of that cup. LOVE THEM!
author: Lauren R.

description:
One of the highlights of our San Francisco eating experience, and their ratings and reviews back it up. This place comes across as a very no-frills (think old school menu boards styrofoam to go containers and laminated 8.5x11 signs), hole-in-the-wall burger place, but the food is fantastic! I had a buffalo burger + avocado and one of their fresh-made malts (my partner got the Stella burger and the cheesecake shake, also very good.) They offer sweet potato fries, onion rings and regular fries, as well as combination baskets (sweet potato + onion rings = springs) if you don't mind styrofoam, they seem to have a pretty popular to go pick-up, too.  

Go here! (You won't be sorry.)
author: Aurora H.

description: Small, completely un-fancy place that serves amazing burgers! I'd have walked right by Pearl's without a second look, but thankfully the hotel clerk recommended it as his go-to burger place (in a neighborhood with lots of pricier, fancier options). The bison burger, smothered in onions & peppers, was memorably tasty, juicy, and huge, and the  fresh, crisp cole slaw made a perfect side. Pearl's stands out for me --head and shoulders above Five Guys and Smashburger (both good, but Pearl's is a wow).
author: Gus H.

description: Good burger, cook to the right temp but it just didn't have the pop that I wanted. The fries were different kinda like the offspring of a French fry and a tater tot. So all in all 3.5 stars. Be sure to grab a milkshake they are very good.
author: Greg B.

description:
It's good, but definitely over-rated.  Fries were overcooked in dirty oil so that they turned brown.  Sweet potato fries lacked the rich flavor I'm use to.

Tiny place without enough seating so that our party kept being rushed out even though 3 out of 4 of us were already seated and had placed our order.  It's not our fault other patrons were not smart enough to claim a table before ordering their food.  I waited my turn and will not give up my seat just because your food came out first.  (At the same time, I do appreciate their staff trying to look out for customers, but they clearly need a better system)

While the burgers and fries were not impressive, I must say their chicken was!  I've never had such a tender and juicy chicken burger.  Most places overcook the meat so that it's borderline dry and bland but Pearl's definitely does it right.  And if you must stick with beef, order medium-rare.. it's a crazy big difference from medium, so much better.
author: Beatrice T.

description: If you like greasy, under-seasoned burgers, then this is your place. I had to throw mine away after only a few bites. It was literally dripping grease and fat. A total waste of $9. I only gave them the second star for having canned sodas. In n Out or Dick's (if you're in Seattle) are far more preferable.
author: Julie K.

description: Delicious burgers! Special burgers are huge, so I am happy that they offer a mini option. My favorite is mushroom with teriyaki cheese! Call ahead for to go orders, the lines get quite long here..
author: Patricia L.

description:
Great burger.  

Do you need to know anything else?  I mean, you want a great burger, you go to Pearl's.   

You don't eat red meat?  Turkey burger.  

You don't eat meat at all?  Veggie burger.  

Watching your fat?  Buffalo burger.  

Feeing fancy?  Kobe burger.

That is all.
author: Liz S.

description: Taste like this place called "five guys" but worse. And I don't even like five guys
author: James V.

description: I ordered a buffalo burger, fries and a shake. The burger itself wasn't bad, although the thicker bun wasn't much to my liking. Fries were okay but unmemorable. Shake was real ice cream but a bit watery. Seemed pricey. Overall, would eat here again but not rush back. Would rate 3.5 stars instead of 4 if I could.
author: Brendan M.

description:
I love to sink my teeth into a hot, juicy piece of meat.  It fills my heart with warm fuzzies and makes me smile. 

The menu is simple yet carries plenty of selections for any craving you may be having. They serve Niman Ranch Beef for their main burgers but offer Kobe Beef for added fee. 

Side note: Remember when Niman was all the rage for beef?!!? Now it's Kobe? What will folks use next? A5 Wagyu? Damn, hope not. That is some expensive carnage....

The burgers were amazingly tender. Dripping with juice NOT fat and loaded with fresh veggies. The onion rings were seasoned with just the right amount of spice and had a yummy crunchiness. 

I dig it.
author: Jay H.

description:
HOLY MOTHER OF CHEEEEEEESEBURGERS! The spicy sly is amazing!!! I don't think I have ever had a tastier burger than spicy sly cheeseburger that I split with my sister the other day! 

So there always is a story to a place that wins my tummy. Ah yes....because of Pride weekend and all the  cars that jam packed the main street, it took us sooo long to get to this place.  My sister and I went to get pedicures in the Glen Park area.  I told her that my friend told me about this burger spot and that we had to try it and on top of that I added that I had yelped it and said that they were going to be on the food channel soooooo it was a must to try!  

So just before leaving Glen Park I called in an order of large sweet potato fries and a spicy sly burger.  He said it will be ready in 8 minutes!  Great, so I head down to the city from Glen Park not even thinking that there was going to be traffic...why? LOL I have no clue.  So I get off of Civic Center and headed towards 12th St. to get on Van Ness, *bam* 50 feet in 10 minutes.  I had to get out of there...turn around go down 7th street to get to the Tenderloin that way and once I get to Howard....blocked off!  I thought to myself, wow this must be a sign that I should just turn around and go home. Ha yah right, I was determined and restrategized....hopped back onto 101N and exited Octavia and traveled parallel to Van Ness hit a right on Post and tada!!! Victory in 45 minutes.  

My sister had called Pearls to let them know we were stuck in traffic and they were A-Ok with it.  We were thinking, 'oh great our burger and fries is gonna be cold!'  I put my hazards on and sent my sister on in to get it.  We were sooo hungry that we just pulled into a spot on Jones to chow down.  To our surprise the burger was still hot, sweet potato fries were freshly fried!  I was definitely satisfied and that phone call made all the difference.  The food: All I can say is WOOOOOOW! You have got to try to to experience this amazing-ness of a burger!  If you love spicy things, this is the cheeseburger for you! Man...I am hungry!!! My mouth is watering as I am ending this review! Soooooo stop reading this and hurry up and go get one!!!
author: Mary-Anne C.

description:
Went for a quick bite with many great expectations.
To me, the burgers were just OK, nothing new. I was expecting something way better, especially since I watched the Food Network's Best Thing I Ever Ate-burger episode. The fries were very good.
I guess you should try it yourself...
author: Veronica M.

description:
Finally tried out Pearls the other day. Wife and Kids all got burgers and absolutely loved them. Creative selections and very, very tasty. They still like the counter in San Jose better but definitely want to go back to Pearls. I tried the california chicken breast sandwich and it was good too with a ton of avocado slices...mmmmmm. And of course I got to taste the different burgers from around the table so bonus for me :-)  

If you want to try some very fresh, grass feed natural beef from cows that are free to roam then you'll want to check out Pearls...you won't be disappointed
author: Robb L.

description: Good burgers. Service could use some improvement though. Maybe when you serve someone a massive  cheeseburger with bacon, grilled onions, and mayo to go, you could put a napkin in the bag?
author: Alex C.

description:
Garlic fries was good

Burgers are tasteless
Just wasting space in my stomach
I'd rather have mcdonalds cheeseburger
author: Cindy L.

description: Sorry, Pearls, but you've gone downhill a bit.  I don't know what happened.  The first time I had a burger there, it was decent - probably 3.5 stars, but really pricey.  The second time I had a burger, it was probably a 3 star burger - again extremely pricey.  So finally I decided to go for it - I ordered the most fancy kobe beef burger and splurged.  The burger was plain - felt like it had ZERO seasoning and the frings were saturated and also unseasoned.  I'm sorry but if I'm going to spend $20 on a burger and frings, then I'm going to burger bar or perhaps a fancy restaurant.  Add some seasoning and fix your burgers because at this point, I won't be back.  It's unfortunate as well since I only live a few blocks away.  :(
author: Noneya B.

description:
I was intrigued by the claim that Pearl's was the best burger in SF, so a couple girlfriends and I stopped by while we were passing through.
Two of us shared Pearl's Deluxe with bacon and cheese (yes, basically everything we could get on a burger). Essentially a mini burger = 1/2 of Pearl's Deluxe but slightly more expensive, so we decided to be economical and just split a regular burger, and they even cut it in half for us (I had to chuckle when there were clearly finger marks smushed into the bun). Juiciest burger I've had yet. Everything was tip-top. My only complaint is that the place is a little small, so not the best place to eat-in if you have more than 3 people. 
Delicious though!
author: Jen T.

description:
Got the Bula burger with a side of sweet potato fries and upgraded to Kobe beef.

The taste of the burger itself was good.

BUT!!! It wasn't juicy from the patty itself!! It was not dripping in beef fat/juiciness, but rather from the sauce. Even if it isn't Kobe beef, if it was a good patty it should be dripping with deliciousness. Kobe beef should make it even more so. Also, DO NOT upgrade to Kobe beef, several articles recently came out that explain the American Kobe beef scam:

http://www.forbes.com/sites/larryolmsted/2012/04/12/foods-biggest-scam-the-great-kobe-beef-lie

The sweet potato fries were awesome though. My friend got the regular fries which were also really good.
author: Victoria L.

description:
Probably what a Big Kahuna burger tastes like.

All I can say is get blue cheese on the burger and some sweet potato fries on the side.  It's better than the crack they sell outside.

Also, it's all good to BYOB when I went a month ago.
author: Joey S.

description: This place used to rock. Now- it borderline sucks. The guy at the register was rude and commented on the large quantity of food I ordered for myself. If I gave any fucks, I might be offended. The fries were underdone and the burger lacked the pizazz it used to posses. Not sure what's going on. Maybe living in New York has turned me into a snob. Or maybe this place just lost a few key employees. Big fat bummer.
author: Jessica K.

description:
The BF and I loooooove these burgers.  Give me the mini deluxe w/ pepper jack, and the BF "phat bob" (onion ring, bacon, barbeque sauce cheddar) +  frings and we are set for the night...and morning. This last time we went, we ate in silence, completely engrossed in our highly anticipated meal, and savoring each bite!  Yes, I savor these burgers. I always leave completely stuffed and satisfied.  I've never been disappointed and actually look forward to returning. 

Damn you Food Network...Hopefully (crosses fingers) it wont be impossible to eat hear post FN exposure.
author: Lesliegh H.

description:
Was in San Francisco for some R&R and needed something quick after getting off the plane.  I noticed on Yelp that Pearl's was nearby and remember their spot on "The Best Thing I Ever Ate" on the Food Network, so I gave them a try. I actually went there twice, once after checking into the hotel and the other was late night when all the other restaurants were packed.

The place is pretty small, probably about 6-8 tables and a bench that seats 3.  Very clean place and the staff is pretty friendly. My first visit, I got the buffalo burger with american cheese and small garlic fries.  Unlike some establishments like Islands, you can request medium rare.  I chose medium this time.   The burger was pretty big.  The patty was nice and firm (didn't fall apart when you bit into it).   It was also very juicy so you will need alot of napkins.   The bun was great too.  Some place neglect the bun but I feel it can make or break the burger.  It had a unique rounder shape but it was nice and spongy.  I bet they get them custome-baked for their place.   The garlic fries were good too.  I'm glad the garlic is cook (fried I believe) because some places use raw garlic which can be too strong.

On my second visit, I did the Kobe burger (medium-rare).  Was great too.

I hope they open one up in San Diego.  Great burgers.
author: Denver M.

description:
I'm still stuffed from the huge cheeseburger I had last night! Mmmm...so delicious! 

This is a great place to stuff your face...maybe not the best place to impress your date though...unless he or she is attracted to meat drippings all over your face!

I really enjoyed my burger w/ American cheese. It was HUGE! The bun is really good too, fresh and covered w/ sesame seeds. I couldn't even finish the whole burger...I was a bit disappointed in myself.

We also got the nutella milkshake which was delicious! As well as the sweet potato fries. 

Can't wait to hit this joint up again soon...I definitely won't eat anything for at least 4 hours beforehand!
author: Mabel L.

description:
no pretense, no frills, no bells & whistles....and I haven't even ordered yet.  I enjoy the straight forward, take-me-as-I-am feel of Pearl...Thank you for that!

I got the mushroom burger (add the bacon...because i'm a sucka for bacon, and the avocado...because i'm love em).  Get em with a side of fries & sweet potato fries.

Drippin with cheesy greasy, mushroomy goodness...my craving can't contain itself!!!  

All I could say is:  Don't talk to me, i'm eating!  :)

Next time, I have to try the shakes (with them big ol boba straws--GENIUS!!! why didn't I think of that for thick ass milk shakes!?!)  

I'd go back for seconds...and thirds...and maybe even fourths....

P.S. Oh, and I hear...PEARL is to be featured on Food Network's "The Best Thing I Ever Ate" June 28, 2010! Fun!
author: Jac T.

description:
I'm happy with the "innovations" like the Estancia beef, but I have to say that overall the entire burger experience leaves a bit to be desired, notably & egregiously in the soggy bun department!

I usually get take-out and even though I now have the buns packaged "on the side", so they don't get _as_ soggy, the experience of getting home & opening drenched-by-patty, wilted lettuce and soggy cheese, definitely subdues my enthusiasm about Pearls. 

Its now a 3-star joint for me and max 4 if you eat the burger in house hot off the grill.
author: I. O.

description:
The burgers at Pearl's are definitely deluxe and delicious. I'm always impressed that I can actually fit one of these enormous burgers into my mouth. Their chocolate shakes are also tasty and they come with super wide straws for easier shake sipping.

The dining area is a bit small but I've never been to Pearl's without a place to sit. I love that this place is open so late. 2am on Fridays and Saturdays! Those hours are perfect for a night owl like myself.

Overall Pearl's is a fantastic place to grab a burger. A great menu complimented by great prices makes Pear'ls Deluxe Burgers a fantastic place to grab a meal.
author: Charles M.

description:
Kindly allow me to wax poetic. (I must stop short of sonnet form, but really only barely and that's due to technical inability.) Pearl's, you are the dream, attained. You shine happily in the darkness, a diamond set in chrome. To know you is to know an isotope of perfection, rare and elusive but, once there, forever at your side even if only in memory.

I, a child of the land which idolizes the unhealthiest of sandwiches, the land which worships the German transplant that is the burger by taking it to new heights of innovation and glorious excess...I have eaten many specimens of this food both foul and excellent. I have eaten ones for a dollar, and for twenty. It is not my favorite nourishment by any stretch of the imagination, but as a culinary archetype I believe it to be one of the finer points in life. Especially when taken together with accoutrements such as fries, onion rings, and shakes. Great happiness lies within these things.

And so, preconceived notions of what characterizes a burger done well firmly in hand, I finally made the brief trip and ordered a bula (regular beef) with a basket of springs. The universe at this moment rends itself in two and here I am, in some place unknowable and beautiful. The patty is succulent and flavorful. The bacon is crisp and aromatic. The sauce a festival of tang and spice with terriyaki umame. I ask, what is the definition of luck? And perhaps somewhere in the dictionary it says, "Living four blocks down the street, however briefly, from Pearl's Deluxe Burgers."

I'm spent just thinking about all this, reliving the springs (perfect combination of sweet potato fries and onion rings) and the exquisite mess of a half-pound honest-to-goodness-great bacon cheeseburger with sauce. Their chicken...also incredible, of course. The staff...yeah, super nice and quick too.

You can spend $15 easily if you splurge on trimmings and upgrade on your meat. If you like burgers, you will consider the cost to be trivially worth it. You will be fatter, but happier.

Please come here, and try it for yourself.
author: Peter B.

description:
Spicy Sly. I love you. 

I love spicy food. I love onions. I love Spicy Sly
Hands down the best special burger I've ever had. If you thinking of dropping by this place (and literally dropping by because you can't really drive here. parking sucks) then try this burger. Awesome, full, savory flavor. A messy burger too. Expect sauce on your face and hands.

Note: This isn't your usual McDonalds "spicy." This is REAL spicy and the burger has a bit of a bite to it. Talked to the gentlemen at the cash register and he stated it was made with habanero peppers. 

Had a few bites of my friends Pearl Deluxe burger and it also a pretty good burger. Still, however, choose Spicy Sly. 

I paid a total of $20.00 flat. For a Spicy Sly burger, Pearl Deluxe w/ cheese and small sweet potato fries. No drinks.
author: Alexis R.

description: My friends and I stumbled upon this place while walking around San Francisco this past weekend and hands down, it was one of the best burger places that i've been to. Definitely coming back here again!
author: Donna I.

description:
THANK YOU PEARL's for letting us overtake your restaurant!  (and sorry about the mess we left...)

Saturday night, about 20 of us crowded into Pearl - get this - with a styrofoam case of cold beers to celebrate the birth of a lovely friend named Amy.  And hey, the birthday girl wanted to have cheeseburgers for her special day, and she was definitely going to have it her way!

These guys were SO fantastically, incredibly accomodating to our loud, obnoxious party, and even handed Amy a $20 gift certificate when I thought they for sure would have booted us as soon as we started poppin' those beers open... (seeing as how they don't have a liquor license, and we basically broke the law that night.)

The burgers were scrumptous - I ordered a 1/4 lb cheeseburger (no onions, thanks).  Loaded on the ketchup and mustard and had my way with it.  Split the sweet potato fries (which are crinkle cut!) and tried some french fries as well.  Fries were yummy, crisp on the outside, soft on the inside.  Pretty solid.  Though, I will note that they overcooked the meat a tad - I asked for "medium" and it pretty much came well-done.  Nonetheless, it was a juicy, flavorful, satisfying cheeseburger, which I scarfed down.

I overlooked the Kobe beef option, which apparently you can request for about $4 more.  Perhaps next time.  The rest of the party seemed to really enjoy their burgers, so - thumbs up all around.

Of course - what's a party without some cake?! And a "princess cake" at that.  Yes - we brought our own cake. plates. knives. candles that sparkled and relit themselves when blown out.  Of course, we shared a slice with the man who worked there as a thank you gesture (and apology).  

Man, I'm giving this place 4 stars for the food ...and 5 stars for not kicking us out that night...
author: Christine Y.

description: BEST BURGER... E-V-E-R!!! You can taste the quality of the ingredients. The onion drips with juice and glazed with grease. The meat tender and succulent. The cheeses add the punch and cuts the fattiness. And the add-ons galore... bacon, mushrooms, avocado, bleu cheese crumbles, mmmmmm.... just thinking about it makes my mouth water! The buns are toasted and the options of fried "vegeies" (potato, sweet potato, onions)... they just need to add mushrooms and zucchinis and I'll never had to order a salad again!
author: Stephen Y.

description:
There are only two things wrong with this place:

1. They don't serve beer.
2. They need more seating.

Other than that, go in and get yourself a tasty burger and milkshake, possibly the best in SF.
author: Eliot R.

description:
The "Prized Pearl" (blue cheese, bacon, onion) burger I had here was SO good, I'm willing to overlook the following:

1)  Overpriced ($14.86 for a burger, coke and fries)
2)  Grumpypants employees (short-tempered and annoyed)
3)  Long wait, long lines
4)  Never a place to sit (play it safe and order To Go)

I'm even willing to overlook the fact that my order was "misplaced" for 15 minutes, and rather than apologize and give me a fresh burger, the woman was rude and threw my lukewarm burger in a bag like it was MY fault she messed up.
author: Ted T.

description:
The burgers here are ok. They aren't exceptional, but definitely good. For a burger that costs close to $10, I sort of expected more. I ordered the Phat Bobb(?) which is basically a western cheeseburger from carl's jr., but bigger. The portion was good, but the taste of the burger just didn't wow me. 

Since the burger wasn't amazing, I was expecting the sweet fries to taste amazing since I've had amazing sweet fries at so many other places. However, the sweet fries here were unamazing. In fact, I would say they were not very good at all. 

If you're out in the tenderloin, then this may be a good place to swing by, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here though. 3 stars.
author: Jeff C.

description: I have been hearing about this place for a long time from a friend - the best burger in San Francisco, I finally tried today and it was AWESOME! it's a bit expensive for a burger($8), but the quality is good, certainly worth it.
author: Shan L.

description:
Pearl's is definitely one of the better burger joints in the City but they don't quite have that extra which puts them over the top.  I am glad that they use grass-fed beef and beef from Niman Ranch.  If you don't like red meat, turkey is an option; don't like meat altogether, there's a veggie; they also grill the expensive kobe burger.  They did win the Best of Hamburger award last year with their Bula Burger though I haven't tried, and the milkshakes are the best in the City.  The sweet potato fries really sucked, not crispy and still a bit raw in the middle.

This is a solid 4 star place where my kobe beef burger was good, but the sweet potato fries suck and the shakes are good.  But maybe it's the high price, about $20, when you have your burger, fries, and drink that's turning me off.

bathrooms are clean
clean & good service
parking is terrible, metered
author: John D.

description:
Good burger, great sides. I just got a Pearl's Deluxe burger the first time I went (not the Uruguay, bison meat, or the  kobe beef burgers), but it was good. Juicy and flavorful. Onion rings were perfect. Have been back and tried the fancier burgers (both the Uruguay beef and the buffalo). They were tasty, but not really worth the upgrade fee.

I also got a coffee milkshake. Now, I had high hopes that it might be a little bit like a coffee frappe back home, but they were dashed. It was way too strong and tasted artificial. I mean, it was still tasty, but I prefer the vanilla.
author: James B.

description: First , i m not really a  Burger fan. however, that is a such great place to have Lunch! I ordered Pearl deluxe , really juicy meat ! i am sure i will come back again!!!
author: ZHUOmei w.

description: The owner emailed me after my review apologizing for the Spicy Sly.  How gracious! I will def give this place another try!
author: Kristina P.

description:
Mmmm burgers~

I really liked this place :D I came here for lunch with my boyfriend for our one year anniversary XD I know how much he loves burgers, and I couldn't just ignore all these raving yelp reviews!!

I got the spicy sly burger, and he got the pesto. I ordered a side of fries, and he got  the onion rings. He said his burger was really good, and I thought mine was really good too. They really don't skimp out on anything- these burgers are HUGE. HUGE and DELICIOUS. I loved it :D

4 stars because they messed up our order and mixed it with someone else, and I couldn't tell if the guy serving us was being nice or was just passive aggressive XD

Yay for yummy burgers!! Definitely going back :)
author: Jade R.

description: Love that they have huge mini burgers and will add grilled onions on request at no extra cost.  Great fries; want to try the sweet potato fries too.  The owner Young is very pleasant too.  A great find for a great burger.
author: Rita F.

description:
The prized pearl is AMAZING!! Blue cheese, thick big slabs of bacon, onions makes one big fat tasty burger! 

One of the best tasting burgers i have had sinced i moved out to california from chicago!!!
author: Yuri G.

description:
Always on the search for the city's best burger, we finally hit this place on our list. Overall, solid experience, though not our favorite burger in the city. The fries on the otherhand... mmmm some of the best I've had!

I got the pesto jack burger, my husband just got a regular cheeseburger. I'm not a huge fan of the sesame seed buns, but didn't take away from it. Food came out reasonably fast. I think we both enjoyed our burgers enough, but not sure it would have us coming back when we do have a burger craving. Still a great place, and those fries are awesome!!
author: Lauren M.

description:
Splurged and got me a Kobe beef half-pounder.  Didn't think I would finish it, but I DID.  It was mighty good!  Love all their meat choices: Niman Ranch, Organic, Kobe.  Previously Burger Joint was my fave place for a burger, but now I believe I've found my new #1.

Want an incredible burger?  Just come here.  Enough said.

PS -- I've got to have the sweet potato fries next time!
author: J K.

description: Sooo freaking good!  Best fries I have ever had, anywhere.  I rarely eat burgers, but when I do, Pearl's is the place.  Especially the buffalo burger.  I give four instead of five stars because of the prices...but really, it is worth it.  The service is always great.  I might recommend take out though if you go during lunch rush because it gets crowded.
author: Sarah S.

description: This place was AMAZING!!! I was in town for the day and my friend and I went here to grab a bite and boy was I not disappointed!!! Their Bula Burger was DELICIOUS. As soon as I bit into the the burger it just fell apart inside my mouth. The meat was juicy and flavorful. The burger itself was just a whole new experience. The fries as well were great. Very crispy yet at the same time very fluffy on the inside. I would definitely recommend this place to people who love burgers, fries, and even shakes!
author: Jorge S.

description:
A friend of mine took me here one day after work and I loved it, here.  Very small but the atmosphere is really cool, the people behind the counter are cool and the burgers here are real, real good.  Mine was real messy and juicy.  I can't remember the exact name but it was the fairly common combination of onion rings, bacon, bbq and cheese.  What's even better is the crazy flavors they have for Milkshakes that sadly you don't find at too many establishments.  After I devoured my burger, I ordered a peanut-butter and chocolate shake for the road.  I could barely drive straight this thing was so good.  Eyes kept rolling into the back of my head.  God that shake was something good....

Be warned, parking is a BITCH, and it's in the Tenderloin.  However, if you're a real San Franciscan like me, that won't really stop you now, will it?  Not like we're not used to those scenarios or anything....

Edit: 11/21/10

I went back again and now I remember the name of the burger.. THE FAT BOB!!!  That burger is soooo frakking GOOD!
author: Sean V.

description:
Pearl's has got some seriously awesome burgers. The way the cheese melts to the bun is absolutely perfect and the bun itself is exactly what I look for in a burger. In the two times that I've been here, I've ordered the Bula Burger and the Pesto Burger.
