Although an insane mess, the Bula Burger is definitely one of the best burgers I've had in SF -- one of these days I'm going to get that with the Kobe beef because I'm sure the meat would be a lot more juicy & tender. The Pesto Burger, on the other hand, was pretty bland -- I really wish there was more pesto in there and maybe some roasted garlic would've made it great. 

Love the sweet potato fries. Krinkle cut, soft sweet potato fries. Awesome.

I give this place 4 stars because the burgers are definitely some of the best in SF, but only if you order the right ones. Is it better than In-N-Out (the standard upon which I measure all burgers)? Hmm... I think that's up for debate. I'll go with In-N-Out by a slight margin, due solely to the price.
author: Roy C.

description: I tried the 1/2 lb mushroom burger. It was, like most gourmet burgers, quite large. Somehow, I did not realize they offered 1/4lb burgers, or else I would have selected that instead. It was quite tasty, but if I go again, I'll probably try the sly chicken burger, my friend said it was "soooo gooood"
author: Caroline S.

description:
Pearl's! So tasty. One thing I'm definitely gonna miss when I move next week. 
Mini-Bula Burger with an order of frings (french fries and onion rings) is the perfect size of a meal and incredibly delicious.
Maybe it's just me but I can't eat a regular sized burger. It's 1/2 lb! That's a whole lotta meat ;)
Anyway.. it's super tasty. the staff are nice too! Always get it to go though.
author: Emily R.

description:
I never in my life thought I would write a poor review about pearls, but here it is...
I somewhat consider myself a cheeseburger aficionado... I travel all over and I like to try the best burgers around whenever I get the chance. Here in San Francisco... Pearls was that burger. I would get the pearls deluxe with bacon as often as I flossed my teeth which is daily. It was always an amazing treat. I like my burger to taste like a burger so I ordered it medium rare always, and it WAS always spot on. 
About 6 months ago I went and ordered my medium rare pearls deluxe, and as I took a bite I noticed it was definitely medium cooked. "Oh well" I thought to myself... "We all make mistakes". I went again a few weeks later and BAM same thing. This time it could have almost been considered medium well which made me wildly unhappy. This happened about 4 or 5 more times with the same result. What happened to my beloved Pearls??? Then they went ahead and changed their weekend closing time from 2am to 10pm which really put my in a tail spin one night...
Tonight I decided to give them another try... "Listen I love your burgers, but lately Iv'e been ordering medium rare burgers and they come out medium. So I'm going to ask you to cook it rare, but please I don't want a raw burger... I just want a lot of pink like medium rare" I said to the cash register dude. For half a second he acted like he understood, and went on with his work. About 30 seconds later my burger was ready. "That can't be good" I thought, but I thought the burger gods would be on my side. Right when I took a bite i knew it... RAW BURGER! It looked like it was on the grill for less time than a piece of sushi. It truly was not edible, even by my standards. Then I decided after 6 months of this... They have earned a horrible review. 
There has definitively been a change in management and it seems the current staff has totally let quality control go out the window. Now I sit here with a parasite in my stomach writing a bad yelp review with my last moments on this earth.
Goodbye Pearls... GOODBYE CRUEL WORLD!
author: Joseph J.

description:
I love burgers and I love Pearl's. This is not a coincidence. 
I also love that you can get a side of "Frings" (fries and onion rings) because in the past, choosing between the two was like choosing which child of mine I favored more.
author: Jenn Z.

description:
I was in a burger mood one day long ago. I had an intense craving and it was satisfied.

Pearl's has a TON of choices--anything you could possibly want to put on a burger, and more.

And lest we forget the bombastic sweet potato fries.

Pearl's delivers and it's worth the money. Go here.
author: Inga B.

description:
Great stuff. 

The counter on its best day is still better  but Pearles is  far more consistent and will never disappoint. 

Go for the buffalo burger. Kobe beef burger is wayyyy overrated 

I'd recommend getting your burgers done  medium rare.
author: Praveen P.

description: Great Burger. I ordered a bacon cheeseburger and it was great.  Nice size burger with a generous amount of bacon. I ordered the burger with a side of fries/onion rings....I would go back to try one of the specialty burgers. I would say the only downside to this place is the small location.
author: Omar A.

description:
My friends from Taipei dragged me here. I thought what do they know about a good burger but alas they proved me wrong.  When I first entered they had a stick on thing that listed google check ins or favorited by people like Michael Mina and Hubert Keller--odd since he now has his own burger place.  
So I thought If THEY like this place it has to be somewhat noteworthy.  I got a gigantic burger--really you can share I think the portions are huge.  If you are in the TL, need to get your burger on and don't want to pay Burger Bar prices then head on down to Pearl's.   I would say go on off hours since its gonna get busier with their Food Network appearance.
author: Sarah C.

description:
I was looking for a good hamburger place that was close to the financial district. So I came to YELP and I found a great place with good food and great prices. So far i have tried 3 of their burgers and every single one is good. There is not a lot of room to sit in here but other than that their food is great and their prices are excellent.

Spicy Sly is the best burger so far that i have tasted from this place and they use 100% Free Range Grass Fed Beef, which taste delicious!!!

I can't wait to go back!!!
author: Mario I.

description:
The burgers and shakes here are out of this world! Foods ordered:
- mint oreo shake - best shake ever. huge chunks of oreos. yummers.
- mud pie shake - good, but not as flavorful as mint oreo. chunks of brownies!
- sweet potato fries - personally, too sweet potatoey for me. I like the more fried thin fries better.
- onion rings - nicely battered, hit the spot.
- bula burger - ohhhh messy messy hamburger that you want to sop up with the bun. Nicely fried bacon inside, went well with the pineapple sauce. Not as spicy as i imagined it would be. Delicious, massive. Impressive.
- phat bob - oozing with bbq sauce, looked delicious.
- the king - hot dog within a burger? genius!!!! and delicious.

I'd totally come back here again if I lived close in the city. The only reason its 4/5 stars is the price. Its quite pricey for a hole-in-the-wall hamburger..
author: Carol L.

description: Best burgers ever. Priced at what they're worth, 10 bucks depending, but the owner and staff are amazing. Food is to die for.  My life is better because Pearls exists!
author: Sierra P.

description:
Best burger I've had in a LONG time. (At least it was 2 years ago, when I went there all the time.)

I discovered this place while I was living/working for a month in SF, and I can't tell you how happy I was that it was only 2 blocks away from my apartment! It's one of a handful of restaurants that convinced me that awesome food actually COULD be found in the non-NYC part of the US! 

I recommend the bison burger. Awesome. I enjoyed their shakes, too. And both the sweet potato fries and the onion rings were good. 

Highly recommended, all around.
author: Amber A.

description:
Say oohlala to the bola!

You can always get a mushroom, pesto, and avocado chicken at any other burger joint so why would you want to get it here? GET THE BOLA. I especially loved the bacon--definitely not from an average porker. And that sauce was incredible. I was expecting some teriyaki, hawaiian taste but now I'm a little embarrassed I would make such a ridiculous assumption. The cashier never asked how I wanted my meat done so trust them that they'll make your burger how it should be eaten. No need to get onion rings or fries; the burger does you enough justice. I got the mini, and I was very content though not super full. Any burger joint where I can walk out happily without feeling like my skinny jeans are going to pop is a winner.
author: Hana J.

description:
First off, I love this place. I always try to stop by when I'm in the SF area. These are one of the few burgers I get medium rare and am not worried about getting sick. Their burgers are still as juicy and delicious as I remember. You can't really beat the combination they have with their beef and buns. Their buns don't fall apart as you're eating your burger, so that's great. The only knock I have against this place right now is that it seems that their burgers are getting smaller. I used to be barely to finish a burger and now I can finish a burger and half a basket of fries.

Once again, small and cramped and hard to eat with a large party. Good things the patrons here are usually nice and just eat their burgers and take off instead of milling about.

Their bathrooms are surprisingly clean.
author: Paul V.

description: Great tasty spot, I love bleu cheese and the burger did not disappoint, I recommend anyone to visit next time your in SF watching the Niner game!
author: Walter J.

description:
I met a sweet couple on the Super Shuttle last Monday.  They were getting dropped off a couple of blocks from my apartment and we somehow got on the topic of local restaurants.  They recommended a "great burger place" and told me where it was, but could not recall the name.  

I did my research and found out that it was Pearl's.  A few days after I met them, I was walking home from downtown and decided to look for it.  I found it and who should be in Pearl's??  It was my new friends from the Super Shuttle.  They were just telling the owner about me too!

I had the mini deluxe w/ cheddar and sweet potato fries.  The burger was perfectly juicy and not greasy.  The fries were slightly undercooked, but still tasty.  At long last, I have found my neighborhood burger place!!!

UPDATE!  I came back to Pearl's the next day and had a 5 star, 8 napkin bleu cheeseburger.  I think it's the best I've ever had!  Next time I come, I have to bring my lactose pills so I can try a milkshake!!! :)
author: S. Y.

description:
I was on a date with this Indian guy and we walked by this place on the way to my house and he literally freaked out and told me this is the BEST burger place in the city. Of course, it was closed at this time, it was 11pm, so I promised him I would try it soon. Since it's 2 blocks from my house, I told my bestie that we needed to try it out and I heard the best reviews.

So last night we went to Pearl's after work and there was a little but of a line. It's pretty crowded there and the reason is because it's the yummiest! I am super picky about my burgers and brag to my friends I make the best burgers at home, but Pearl's is top of the line amazing. I wish they had a bigger, more comfortable sitting area, the ambience is zero, but you are literally going to town on out-of-sight burgers and killer fries...who needs to look at pretty wall paper or shiny chandeliers...right?

This place is pretty inexpensive for the quality of food you get, so that rocks as well. Huge thumbs up from me for sure.
author: Tina C.

description: Burgermeister used to be my favorite burger spot. It has since been bumped down by Pearl's. I love the buffalo (though it's on the pricey side), but you can't go wrong with the good old beef. Not only are the burgers stellar, but the fries are amazing! I usually get the frings, which as you might guess is a mix of fries and onion rings. In short, if you're craving a burger this will definitely satisfy you.
author: Killa B.

description:
Yes, thank you Yelp app! Looking for the best burger in San Francisco when visiting on vacation could not have been easier. 

Pearls does burgers how I like them. Simple with quality ingredients, not too huge where it's a pain to eat, and they will do rare!

I've only had the classic or deluxe burger with cheese. Top notch. We shared spries (half and half of sweet potato fries and regular fries) which were perfectly crunchy and tasty. Oreo shake was awesome as well. 

Other than that, the place is a little small but we were lucky enough to find a couple of seats. The employees were very nice. As far as location, the hood was a bit seedy, yes, but we went during lunchtime and were surprised it wasn't as bad as some on here had us thinking it would be.

I'll definitely visit again next time I'm in San Francisco. I want to try that Bula Burger!
author: Eric B.

description: We always get the mini deluxe burger since their portions are huge! Probably one of my favorite fries from any burger joint...perfect amount of crisp. I haven't tried their milkshake yet but they look delicious.
author: LG M.

description:
Thank you burger gods! I have found my go-to place for burgers in SF! 

Went there on a Saturday afternoon at 1:30 and there was still a line! I ordered the mini bacon cheese burger and its was everything I dreamed of. Juicy burger cooked to medium, gooey cheese, crunchy bacon, fresh tomato slice, crisp lettuce, and light mayo on a toasted sesame seed bun. Every bite was perfect. I hate burgers where the patty is too small or too big and the cheese, bread, veggie ratio is off. Not at Pearl's! Dlish! The mini burger was the size of a normal burger so it was perfect for me...can't imagine trying to eat a regular one by myself! 

Unfortunately, I didnt try their famous shakes but now I'll have another reason to go back! One nutella shake please!
author: erica w.

description:
Ok, I have to recommend the Bula burger here.  Don't get anything else till you try this one.  Thick slabs of bacon drenched w/ swiss and special sauce over a pineapple slice.  Trust me, it's good!  

My only grip, the prices have gone up on the buffalo option($4) which is ridiculous!  Get the Kobe upgrade for that amount instead.

The fries here are not worth getting, instead get the onion rings or sweet potato fries.  Rings are texture battered with seasoning...good stuff!

BTW, service is much better at the Mill Valley joint.
author: MTBer I.

description:
Pearl's is how a burger, or many burgers (my level of consumption is quite up there), should be. 

Man. Pearl's is what it's like to be very satisfied with what you've just wildly devoured, and wanting more despite the extreme protrusion coming out from your midsection. Pearl's also causes that inevitable phlegm-cough-laughter that occurs after consuming a burger, some sweet potata fries, and an oreo malt. 

Also, their chili dog and chili fries are some more of my arterial vices. 

Thumbs up!
author: Stef Y.

description: Awesome fresh exotic burgers but even more exciting are the fresh, unique shakes. We stayed at the Beresford hotel right across the street but did not find them until our last day after a referral to eat there  from blazing saddles where we rented our bikes.
author: Jihn S.

description:
My first visit to this wonderful city had me hunting for a great burger. I was staying in Union Square and wanted something within walking distance. Pearl's on Post st. was just a few blocks away from the hotel. Thanks to yelp I found out about this amazing place. Its size is small and it was hard to find a seat sometimes but the food more than made up for it.

WOW. I was in SF for three days and ate here three times. It was that good. First time I went I had the Prized Pearl which was mouthwatering. It had blue cheese, onions, bacon, and mayo. It was to die for. Perfect tenderness in the patty, grilled to perfection (medium rare) and tons of flavor. I also ordered the sweet potato fries which were excellent. They appeared to be fresh cut and were salted perfectly.

On my second visit I had the phat bobb with a peanut butter chocolate shake. The burger was, again, outrageously good. Yet the shake was even better (if possible) tons of flavor and perfect thickness. It was a party in my mouth!

Third time around prized pearl again and a nutella shake, the shake was great yet again. I wish this place was located in my hometown but I guess its a good thing that it is 2000 miles away so I don't eat here daily and gain twenty pounds!

Spectacular, definitely the best burger I have ever had.
author: G K.

description: I like the burger here, fresh and big portion but sometimes they make it plain taste. It always crowded though. Still a good spot in the city for fast food.
author: Suabot J.

description: In this city, it's not hard to find a good burger. A burger that makes your life better, at least for a short period of time is usually a stone's throw away. I love this. However, Pearl's just may be the best of the bunch. Their bison burger gets more delicious after every bite, and never loses its integrity. It's VERY close, but there's a good argument for Pearl's being the best burger in the city. Go eat one now. Go.
author: Marc M.

description:
I have to be honest here, and this is coming from a guy that used to love this place a couple of year back: This place has gone waaaaay downhill in the last year or two! 

After having them screw up my order a couple of times in a row (recently I got the Deluxe Burger with bacon and they gave me it carb style, wraped in lettuce for no good reason!) I finally gave them one more chance. I work at a Hotel down the street and the collective opinion of everybody here is that they realy don't feel good about paying so much money for such a lackluster Burger and fries. Add a shake, and you might as well pay the same amount of $ for a a really good Italian dish at "Fino" a couple of blocks away! 

So I gave them one more shot and the burger was bland and pretty dry. I came to the conclusion that they REALLY ARE OVERPRICED, AND OVERRATED AT THAT!

It's a shame, they used to be pretty damn good. Maybe they are under new owners or the expansion to other locations have stretched them too thin. 

People will catch on to this place being a rip off eventually. SF people are smart, and if something stayes average for long enough (at these prices) they will abandon it.
author: Joshua P.

description:
I had lunch at PEARLS today and tried the PHAT BOB & order of FRINGS and free ice water 

the service was pretty fast around 10 minutes and the PHAT BOB BURGER was cooked medium rare, the bacon went well on the burger and was also cooked perfectly, the order of FRINGS was not very impressive, the rings looked smaller than I expected? the onion rings were pretty small?

the meal was very filling, I even skipped breakfast to make sure I would be hungry enough to handle the Phat Bob burger and I almost couldnt finish it. 

I liked the fast friendly service! and the variety , I would say this is one of the better hamburger joints in San Francisco. They are also a very clean restaurant and the rest room is kept clean. I would definitely go back to try their other burgers.
author: Mr Bolo B.

description:
Everything about this place is great. We found this to be the best burger joint so far. It is always part of our itinerary for our visitors.

3 1/2 STARS for the restaurant:  it is really clean, once a table clears, they clean it right away for new comers, BUT, it's really small, expect a line

4 1/2 STARS for the food: it is REALLY good, they use free range meat!!! 

try everything, all the burgers are delicious!!!
author: Cnn F.

description:
I have yet to have a burger here that can fail me.  the sweet potato fries are worth splitting unless you're super duper hungry.

but make no mistake, get a shake!  those are some damn good shakes.
author: Jason J.

description:
I like a milkshake with my burger. Always. And although its hard to believe I even feel this way, I must admit that their chocolate is a little too sweet. It was the perfect thickness, cold despite us getting take out, but yeah, it was a little bit too much. Sugar-flavored ice cream. Save yourself a few dollars. 

Their burgers, however, are awesome. Done medium-rare, the burger is perfectly pink (ALMOST red), and the bun is hearty without being too bulky. I had one with bleu cheese and bacon (thick, thick bacon), and it was awesome. 

I would suggest asking them to keep the fries in for another minute or two, unless you like soggy fries. It was a bit upsetting.

It's great if you're in the area and need a burger fix.
author: Lindsay J.

description: This burger joint was not all that.  I should try the award winning burger next time, but their regular cheeseburger should still taste better than what I had to warrant their four stars.  Probably the most disappointing of all hyped SF burger joints.
author: Erika C.

description: Very good but not quite 4 stars. Don't get the garlic fries to go, they'll steam up and won't be be crispy. "Kobe" beef patty didn't impress, save $4 bucks.
author: Brooke B.

description: Thanks to my fellow Yelpers to leading me to Pearl's on a business trip.  This is exactly why I love Yelp - no way anybody at my hotel would have sent me to Pearl's, but I am so glad that I went.  Great burger, great fries, great shake.  The atmosphere is about a 2 on 10-point scale, but who the hell cares?  Pearl's is about getting your eat on.
author: Tom P.

description:
I live right across from this place, lol. 
Delicious burgers for sure! 
Frequent customer :)
author: Belle Y.

description: The family and I are in San Francisco for a couple of days and have been trying different restaurants, since my father is more of a burger and fries kind of guy we compromised and settled on Pearls over a fast food chain. I had the Pearl, hubby had a bacon cheeseburger, my mother had a chicken mushroom burger and my dad (the burger guy) had a hot dog...yeah, I know :/  we all enjoyed our choices as well as the regular and sweet potato fries and the onion rings. Everything was cooked to our liking and definitely hit the spot. But as much as we enjoyed our food we loved the service better, the gentleman working at roughly 3:30 pm was top notch, he was helpful from the moment we walked in, when my 3 year old decided to have a mini melt down he stepped in and tried to help without ever looking irritated. When he found out we were visiting San Francisco celebrating my son's first birthday he brought him and my daughter some ice cream. We have been in town a couple of days and have been eating out quite a bit and have noticed that service in many restaurants is so rushed and cold, the service we got at Pearls was a breathe of fresh air. I strongly recommend Pearls for their delicious burgers and awesome service, we will definitely eat here again when we visit San Francisco in the future.
author: Monika O.

description:
Perfect. This place is simply perfect. 

The burgers are as good as they get: juicy, delicious, and packed with flavour. They have a variety of burgers, including a kobe beef and buffalo meat upgrade. I never tried the buffalo, but the kobe beef was very impressive.

What I love is that they have mini-burgers if you aren't up for a huge burger! They still fill you up, and they give you the experience of Pearl's Burger.
However, if you are at Pearl's, you HAVE to try one of their specialty burgers. I've had the Phat Bob, and I love it! I mean, who wouldn't love a burger with onion rings inside? 
The garlic fries can be a bit overwhelming, so remember to bring mints if you plan on ordering them!

Though there might be quite a wait, depending on when you go, it's worth it! It's a small place, but no worries. Union Square is a few blocks away, you can always take our order to go and sit outside if the weather permits. (:
author: Bianca W.

description:
I went here yesterday for lunch, I was a lil hesitant due to my food allergy issues but I broke down and said screw it.
It was worth it, and I was fine (which says a lot actually).

They use Estancia Grass Fed Ecuadorian beef for their regular burgers, but for a scant amount of money more you can have either Buffalo or Kobe beef.

So if you're looking for some pretty tasty burgers, this would be a good spot to check out.
author: Tom S.

description: Mediocre food, hole I'm a wall place. Not sure how clean the Kitchen is, because the sitting area didn't look attractive to me.  I would give it five stars for the customer service. Very friendly and helpful staff. The burgers were good, but I would not return for the food again.
author: Anya P.

description:
I got the avocado chicken sandwich which pretty good along with the sides of sweet potato fries. I've heard a lot good things about Phat Bob and the burgers, so I'll try that next time I come here. The only reason I knock it one star down is the lack of seating and the lack of room around the place. 

Overall this place is pretty good.
author: Patrick T.

description:
Disclaimer: This review was posted after eating at Pearls, the disclaimer portion is I had nothing to eat (not even breakfast) and this was my first meal of the day at 1:30 PM so I was starvin like Marvin. 

If diamonds are a girls best friends, Pearls is mine. I liked to keep it simple as this is how I judge a good burger. Plain ol' cheeseburger with a side of fries and a fiji water (probably the only healthy of my meal)

The burger was made medium rare with american cheese and it was made to perfection! Cooked just as I wanted and boy was it juicy. The burger was soo good I took the fries and dipped them in the juice that was falling out. If I had any juice left over I would have asked for a cup to take it home to freebase. I devoured the burger ate all the fries which were good but not great. I credit it to the freshness, but what do I know. 

Anyways go to this place for $11 (remember the Fiji water) it was a great deal and left me full with a smile on my face. I plan to try the Buffalo Burger they had on the menu when I take the Wifey here, but definitely will repeat!!!
author: Ayub M.

description:
So I went for lunch this afternoon with some friends from work.  I had the Sly Spicy Burger (upgraded to buffalo meat) with sweet potatoe fries.  Awesome burger and the fries were surprisingly "light", not greasy like I expected.

Be warned, that at lunch time, there is a line.  This place is really small, so seating is limited, but it is worth the wait and if you work/live close, it would be good for takeout, but if it will take a while to eat your burger, I would not recommend.  These burgers are so juicy, you would end up with a soggy mess.

Anway, highly recommend.  It looks like the will also be on "Eye On The Bay" on Monday, Sept 13 ('10).
author: Khim Y.

description:
Moist, juicy, heart-clogging goodness. 

The only drawback is how oily it is and how drenched the buns become in this monsterous oozy goodness that they call "Spicy Sly" with mounds of spicy red and green peppers, onions, and a pumpkin habanero mayo spread on the buns. If you don't think about the 700 calories, easy, you won't have a problem devouring this burger. Let me tell you, it's pretty damn good. So good that for those moments I was savoring each bite, I forgot about the downpour outside (remember Tuesday October 13th where it was POURING so hard it was scary driving anywhere). Yes, that good.

Price wise, a little bit on the pricey side at about 8 bucks a burger. We also had the spries, half fries and half sweet potato fries. I would pass on the sweet potato next time and try their onion rings instead.

The next time I'm craving a burger in the area and I don't want to cook, Pearl's is the way to go!
author: Ling H.

description: Great place for a nice unique tasting burger. They have a pretty good selection. Most of them are delicious. First try their deluxe burger, then try something else from their menu. Ask for grilled onions. Their onion rings are pretty awesome as well.
author: Darin Bom N.

description:
Hands down, best burger and fries I've ever had. I can totally see why Tyler Florence raved about this place! I ordered the Bula Burger and Sweet Potato Fries.
Pearl's definitely set the standards high for burgers. I can't wait until I come back!
author: S. C.

description:
pretty far from where we live, but since we were heading to the ball park, we stopped by here for some food to go. 

found a 15 min parking spot on the same block, not busy inside, pretty small. 

ordered
phat bob- bf liked his, it was really big
mushroom burger- HUGE lotsa mushrooms, but since it was to-go the cheese was kinda hardening 
and a side of sweet potato fries- which were good but since we left it alone and covered it, it got soggy

not as oily as i was imagining, just a bit. really filling and i wanna try a shake next time!
author: Christine M.

description:
I love their selection of healthy, organic red meat...you can even order buffalo meat!  Milk shakes are really good as well.  
The reason I knocked it one star is because the burgers weren't as juicy as I wish them to be.  Ask for medium rare!
author: Jacquelyn M.

description:
I was visiting San Fran and stopped at Pearl's for a burger. I have nothing bad to say about my experience except  - what was I thinking when I ordered the mini burger!  Not that the mini burger is exceptionally small, I just should of ordered the normal one to get the full experience, and I forgot to upgrade to the Estancia Beef, I was hoping they would ask me once I was at the counter.

Overall I enjoyed my burger.  It's your typical burger shack kind of burger and it was good.  I would like to go back and try the other options and get the sweet potato fries that I keep hearing about.
author: Michelle B.

description:
I had the Bula Burger with Buffalo meat... it was really juicy!
I asked for sweet potato fries but I got the regular fries... realizing the mistake, they gave me a free order of sweet potato fries.

Clean joint, good burgers, I'm def going back!
author: Christian P.

description:
My favourite burger joint in San Francisco, they are open late so if you have a midnight craving on a weekend this is where you want to go...

Service is really good and very friendly, the place is quite small but its kept really clean all the time. You'll always get your food fast, fresh and delicious. 

They have a good selection of great quality meats, amazing signature burger creations, chilli fries are fantastic, and last but not least their milkshakes are heavenly. 

Prices are really moderate for the excellent quality you are getting, definitely worth checking out!
author: Javier B.

description:
I could go on and on about how wonderful the food and shakes are here but i'll spare you the details...IT'S FANTASTICALLY DELICOUS so trust me on this one and try it!!!! Especially the Bula Burger....hmmmm..the only possible problem is not eating it EVERY DAY!!! :) 

The staff are fab also and if you go there reguarly enough they take the time out to learn your name and ask you how your wkends was etc..small place but you never have to wait long for a seat as everyones quick to gobble the yummy food down! 

I asked how come they hadn't expanded to many many other restaurants by now and the answer was a good one 'the owner doesn't want to sell out, he cares about the customers and quality not quantity is always the 1st consideration'. Excellent. In a world where everyones selling out to make a buck this is pretty impressive and obviously working!! These guys have been on every food network channel you can think of in recent times and I wish them every luck. 

This is thee best burger joint inthe city I challage you to find better for the value especially!! 

Great location only 3 blocks from Union Square.

This delux fast food joint has the Midus Touch!
author: kelly a.

description:
The best casual burger I've had in the city (so far).

Very creative flavors and combinations.
Great flavored milkshakes.

A bit of a gut bomb, but in a good way.  It was my own fault.  Yum.

It's a small dining room with a limited number of tables.  You may have to wait if you come at peak times, and I wouldn't expect to get a table quickly with more than 4 in your party.
author: Eric H.

description: Delicious burgers and great shakes! This location is also a great place to people watch.
author: Karen D.

description:
DANG!  Why didn't anyone tell me about this place before tonight? 

My only complaint is that I ordered the "Frings" (1/2 fries, 1/2 onion rings) when I should have ordered a full order of  fries and a full order of onion rings. Yeah, they were that good. 

The hamburger was epic. I am speechless. 

I topped the meal off with a fountain drink. But I kicked myself every time a milkshake order was called out for pick-up "Nutella Mikshake! Blueberry Milkshake! Strawberry Milkshake!"

Please, let's go back soon.
author: Joel G.

description: This place is seriously great. Good burgers at a reasonable price and located in SF!? Definitely recommend, any burger here will have you wanting more.
author: Manny S.

description:
I am always in search for a great burger joint and this place is probably up there with one of the better burgers in San Francisco. I have bookmarked this place for months and I finally got to try it. I was impressed with the size of the burger and the buns that they used. Meaning the width of the patty was bigger than the buns. I hate burger joints where their buns overwhelm the patty. I ordered the deluxe mushroom burger and onion rings. The key to a great burger is to melt the cheese correctly and obviously to cook the burger right. You know how some places just place a slice of cheese on the patty and they don't leave it on the grill long enough on the grill to let it melt? Well.........you won't have that problem here. It was melted correctly. 

The burger was cooked perfectly. It was juicy, the buns were toasted, the mushrooms and cheese were a great compliment. Added some tobasco, ketchup, mustard, and black pepper and this was close to heaven. The onion rings however wasn't that good. The batter wasn't fluffy. It fell apart and it just looked like it needed help. 

It's tough to find parking here but they do open til 2 am on Fridays and Saturdays. If you are craving a burger late at night on the weekends, then this might be a great spot to check out. I really can't compare this to In and Out burger, Burger King, or McDonald's. It's like comparing apples to oranges. This is more like a Bella Burger, a lower end Barney Burger, or a Buffalo Burger.
author: jason g.

description:
5 stars for the Kobe burger, done medium rare...juicy, meaty, mushroomy, delicious. 
-1 for the soggy bun...although I don't even eat the bun most of the time, it would be so much better if served on a nice ciabbata roll or a toasted roll that didn't fall apart.
-1 for soggy fries...I never order fries myself, but usually steal a couple from my boy...the fries were mealy. 
+1 for the Kobe and Buffalo option.
author: Nilu r.

description:
Today was one of those crazy horrible days where I wanted to hurl myself off the Golden Gate Bridge.  By the time 7PM rolled around and I was leaving work, I still hadn't eaten a bite of food all day long.  So on my walk back up to Nob Hill, I took a different route home, and as I rounded the corner of Post Street, my burger senses started tingling.  Yes, I smelled that beautiful beefy grill aroma and followed it until I arrived at Pearl's.

To get a good sampling of what Pearl's had to offer, I decided on a mini deluxe burger and an order of springs (sweet potato crinkle fries and onion rings).  My thought after the first bite of the burger?  OH HECK YES!  Their meat is extremely juicy--not greasy--and cooked consistently all the way through.  The bun was also really soft and fluffy which I liked, because nothing is worse than eating a burger sandwiched between two bricks.

The sweet potato fries were out of this world amazing, and I think I might go get them again tomorrow for lunch.  When you get them, don't even think of disgracing them with ketchup or vinegar.  They can stand on their own don't need to be insulted like that :)  The onion rings were also great, but nothing could compare to those sweet potato fries.

While I was eating, I also observed a first-time Pearl's eater having an explosion of foodgasms from the buffalo burger.  I thought someone was going to have to mop that poor guy off the floor before he could finish it.   He was honestly ready to combust from food-induced pleasure.  Apparently that buffalo is some good stuff.

Other random things I like about Pearl's:  The employees are super friendly.  They conveniently put all of their condiments up on the counter, and they have lots of dill pickle spears in a tub, so you can take a few as you please to go with your food.  The little dine-in area is nice and breezy when the front window is open (great for warm afternoons).  And last but not least, the burger I order here is $4.29 while the one I like at Taylor's is $8.  My bank account is smiling down on me for this.

Just a warning, don't bother going on Sundays- you'll just be greeted with a big disappointing CLOSED sign.
author: Christy L.

description:
Our visit to Pearl's Deluxe Burgers was a last minute choice assisted by yelp users.  On our way to a Comedy Club we decided to yelp a burger joint around the area due to a craving.  So we yelped , we went, we ate, and we wrote reviews.

Who cares about the setting -- so let's just talk about the food.  I ordered the mini plain cheeseburger and spries (fries and sweet potato fries), writing about it already makes me salivate.  The burger was tasty and fresh.  The fries, sweet potato fries, and the onion rings were so delicious and were not greasy at all.  Whatever they're doing - they're doing it right!!   I HAVE TO VISIT AGAIN!

Hopefully the management is reading this bc I have some recommendations to make it better. 1 - other than combos of 2 item deep fried yummies, how about a three item.  I wouldn't know what you would name it - how about sp-ri-ons?  2 - please teach some hygiene into your female workers.  She blew her nose w/o washing afterwards.  That's just nasty.  Just give her the boot.
author: romeo b.

description: Been dying to come to this spot, ever since others at one of my favorite pubs recommended this place as having one of the best burgers/fries in the city. 3 of us went there for a late lunch on tuesday, Sept 16th, and were greeted by the staff and owner. We were surprised at how small the place was, and that it didn't off that much seating. Since it was after the "Lunch Hour Rush" we were able to get a large table shortly after ordering. 2 of us had just a regular cheese burger and the other had a veggie burger and we split a large order of fries. We can honestly say it was by far one of the tastiest (and juiciest) burgers I've had in aeons and the fries were to die for. I asked the owner how he was able to get his fries to be so crunchy, and he said he uses a special "proprietary" type of oil, which keeps them crispy and not limber for a while after they cool. What amazed me was that he and all the staff kept asking us how everything was and always checked on us, even though it wasn't the kind of thing that we expected. What made our experience even more special, was that the owner (forgot his name) asked all the patrons if we'd like to have a complimentary cup of coffee, as he was going to get rid of the coffee and didn't want to "waste" it. I thought that was genuinely kind and thoughtful. You just don't find that kind of service and caring anymore. I give this place a 10 rating hands-down!
author: Timothy L.

description:
This place is far better than other fast burger joints.

I had a cheese burger with cheddar. The bun, cheese, etc... were all good quality. They will cook the meat to your liking and I was impressed that medium actually means medium here. So few places get that one right. 

I think the meat that they use could be a little better. It was absolutely tasty but it was also a little gristly.

The guy at the counter recommended that I get the onion rings since "they make them fresh in the store". Well I did and they indeed were delicious. 

I think next time I might get a milkshake. I saw on the menu that they have a peanut butter one and that is my favorite milkshake flavor... Hey! its good, trust me.
author: Eric G.

description: I have to give this place a 5 star. The best fries I have ever had in my life. Bobby Flay was definitely right rating it one of the top burger joints in the US. The Bacon Cheeseburger Deluxe is so delicious and fresh knocking competitors out of the park. It is not in the best area so I don't recommend going at night unless your a Tenderloin Native or straight fearless. I would give the burger a 4/5 stars and the fries I would give 5/5 stars. If your in the downtown area and looking for a very tasty burger, I would highly recommend coming to Pearl's Deluxe Burgers. You will not regret it!
author: Diego A.

description: I cannot describe how content I am. Thick patty as big as the bun, cooked perfectly medium rare, unf! Spicy Sly is good if you're craving a burger with a kick. Be sure to get the sweet potato and garlic fries half & half and free pickles.
author: Lauretta L.

description: Way overrated. Not sure if it was the burger I got but the burger wasn't all that. Decent but not worth 5 stars. However, plus points on the sides. They let you mix sweet potato fries with reg fries or onion rings. And their onion rings are prob the best I've ever had. Oh and there isn't much on the parking front or room to eat there.
author: Natalie L.

description: Omg very good fresh and clean, for the burger cravers.
author: Miki E.

description:
Marshall Eriksen's words are much better than mine:

"Just a Burger? Just a burger....It's so much more than "just a burger." I mean, that first bite--oh, what heaven that first bite is. The bun, like a sesame freckled breast of an angel, resting gently on the ketchup and mustard below, flavors mingling in a seductive pas de deux. And then, a pickle! The most playful little pickle! Then a slice of tomato, a leaf of lettuce and a...a patty of ground beef so exquisite, swirling in your mouth, breaking apart, and combining again in a fugue of sweets and savor so delightful. This is no mere sandwich of grilled meat and toasted bread....This is God, speaking to us through food."

Still want to try the buffalo and kobe patties.  They sound delicious.
author: Jason K.

description: Aside from a lack of seats, and aggressive pan-handlers, I can't complain! The burgers were big and juicy, with a variety of specialty topping combos (try the Bula), the fries were crispy and the sweet potato fries were some of the tastiest I've ever had at a burger joint. One of the best burger spots in the city!
author: Quinn S.

description:
yum! 
juicy, fresh, tasty.
the burger i got was packed with goodies and it pretty much all came apart after my first couple of bites, but much worth the mess and the bajillion napkins we went through.
author: Sunni B.

description:
Perhaps my taste is different than local San Franciscans, because I do not taste what they taste.  This place was recommended by a friends friend and i was not the least bit impressed.

California chicken avocado burger: bland, bland, bland.  My bf likes to tease me saying I like bland food, so if something is too bland for me there is definitely no taste.  They weren't too stingy with their avocado which is a plus, but it does not make up for the lack of taste.  I only ate half.  

Prized pearl: this burger consists of a beef patty, bacon,  grilled onions and blue cheese.  The menu said all burgers came with lettuce and tomato, but there was no lettuce or tomato and we did not specify we didn't want it.  This burger was sooo greasy it was disgusting.  You can literally see a pool of grease forming underneath your burger.

Garlic fries: soggy and salty!  The basket was still full when we tossed it.

Total cost for the meal was about $25.  A revolting meal for $25?  I think not!
author: Constance J.

description: I've only ever had a burger to go and for that one burger I opted for the Spicy Sly, Turkey. Delicious! The Spicy Sly has pumpkin Habanero sauce with peppers, mayo, and Jack cheese but as mentioned I got turkey, and generally speaking, not a lot of places do turkey justice. This burger though? Fantastic, a great blend of flavours and a nice level of spiciness to it (though not overly spicy). The pumpkin Habanero is well pronounced so you're in for a treat if you opt for this one.
author: Shauna S.

description:
Went back and got the strawberry cheesecake shake and regular fries. Much better meal. Very delicious shake, never had that flavor before. The fries are tastier without the garlic, stuffy and crispy at the same time.

Service was top notch, as always.
author: Mack D.

description: Good, but nothing overly special.  The fries are good, but not unique, I've had the exact ones at other restaurants, so they are ordered from somewhere else.
author: A L.

description:
My absolute fav for years!  A delightful, clean place with consistently outstanding food.  I've enjoyed visiting there for years.  My last was last night and I had a Pearl's Deluxe and it was brilliant.  Cooked medium, juicy and hot, with crispy bacon and creamy melted jack cheese.  Fries are always excellent and make an excellent meal on their own.  Everyone who works there are most friendly, efficient and very good at what they do.  I noted last night that they had deservedly won another "Best Of" award and I'm very proud of them!

'Love ya, Pearl's!
author: Samantha M.

description: Good burger, not so good fries...very casual and fast.
author: Caio P.

description: Revising my previous 3 star review. I think Pearl's has great quality burgers, with original sauces and toppings. And it is pretty darn consistent. My one nagging issue with this place is that the burger patties themselves are rather bland. I feel like they don't use very much, if any, seasoning on their meats. Other than that, one of the best burgers you can find in central San Francisco. Decent prices too, for what you get. I haven't tried the milkshakes but I am mightily tempted to do so. Their fries are good, if you like the whole battered frie thing. I live near here so I will keep coming by for sure.
author: Bass T.

description:
So far, the best burger joint in my neighborhood! Extra star for having buffalo burgers. It's a bit on the pricey side if you are like me and want a buffalo burger with mushrooms, cheese, and bacon on it. It's SO worth it though,and the chocolate malt is to die for. They use those giant bubble tea straws so you don't have to use so much force to drink them. 

I'll revise this after I've tried the other burger joint in the hood, but I suspect it will be to just reinforce this review!
author: Darren M.

description:
Having Pearl's a mere two blocks down the hill from my place is a thing of beauty.  Still my favorite burger joint in SF (although Jenny's on 9th Avenue recently asserted itself as a strong contender).  I'm sometimes amazed that any of the nearby restaurants manage to stay in business, I had been meaning to try the excellent Indonesian place (Borobudur) next door for the longest time but didn't make it 'til very recently because every time I get near that corner I find it nearly impossible to resist the magnetic pull of Pearl's.

One minor caveat, some of these burgers are MESSY!  (particularly the "Prized Pearl").  I personally see this as a good thing but those who are a bit more fussy please take note.

Get there around 11 or 11:30 if you want to avoid the massive lunch rush in the very tiny dining room.  Apparently Pearl's is going to be featured on The Food Network's "Best Thing I Ever Ate" tomorrow, very nice to see these guys get some very well-deserved national recognition.

Long Live Pearl's!
author: Mike J.

description:
Went here on a friends recommendation, and was it GOOD! One of the best burgers I have had since coming to Nor-Cal.

Seating is very difficult from 11:30-12:30 because of the popularity.

Customer service was AWESOME! They make you feel like a regular, even when its your first visit.

If you are in the area, and craving a well crafted burger, DO NOT pass this gem of a joint by, and stop in. You will definitely be rewarded with fabulous food, and service.
author: Aaron B.

description:
Went there for lunch, was trying to be healthy, so I ordered the Buffalo Burger.  To my surprise, it was juicy, actually cooked medium (I always ask for medium and almost all burger places will overcook regardless of my preference), and very flavorful.
The only thing is that the store looks like it hasn't been upgraded in a while and the fixtures are definitely a bit old looking, but whatever, its in the tenderloin, it would be more wierd if it was a gentrified yuppy place with dark polished wooden furniture.
solid burger.  if i ever have someone to share them with, i'll also order the sweet potato fries.
author: Yin L.

description: I had a dream about sinking my teeth into this joint's large juicy burgers with the meat grilled medium and pink inside with their perfectly toasted sesame bun, and warm melted cheese. It was pure bliss, until I woke up with my stomach growling and nothing in my mouth but air. Unfortunately, I'm not in the Bay Area now and to satisfy my Pearl's craving went to a grill that appeared pretty happening, only to be served a burnt tasteless slab of meat with american cheese and a stale bun. For all of you living near Pearl's, don't forget how good you have it, because this is the best burger joint in the city, and outside of it, not many others can compare as well. I can't wait to return and sink my teeth into a real Pearl's burger instead of one concocted by my subconscious.
author: Chris W.

description: A nutella shake?! really?! This place should get 5 stars just for that. The awesome combination of cow, pig and bread that I devoured was also tasty, but not the best in burgerdom so I'm simply going to give this place 3 stars. Definitely a solid hang out with decent food, better shakes and great service. It's a small hole in the wall so unless you go during off peak hours it'll be tough for you to sit and enjoy all of the goodness you experience.
author: Marc P.

description: Boom! The burgers were above average, and the shakes were out of this world!  I love this place...
author: Chris G.

description:
Pretty decent hamburgers-- the meat, especially is top notch.  Very messy, very oily and greasy, but with a coke and fries, it's pretty much the perfect comfort food.  The buns, however, are a bit on the light and flaky side, and they quickly absorb all the grease from the hamburger and become slightly soggy, but if you like that kind of thing, it's all good (I personally don't).

The only other qualm I have about this place, and, not to sound like a high falutin douchebag, is that the clientele consists primarily (over 65%) of D&D enthusiasts.
author: Peter L.

description: Totally Amazing! Service was fantastic, price is good. I will definitely be back :)
author: Celica E.

description:
4.25. Best burgers I've ever had.  Cousins and I sampled each others' burgers, it was ALL good.  I ordered the Veggie burger with spicy pepper jack cheese, mushrooms, and jalapenos.  Cousins had pesto burger and Balu burger with mushroom.  It was all good man and the Balu burger...goddamn (drools).  Nice big burgers, 7-9 bucks but worth it.  I had frings and sweet potato fries.  We had it to go because we wanted to eat at Union Square so by the time we got there  the fries were a bit soggy but they were still good!  I recommend eating the fried stuff fresh.  The place is really small... probably only seats 15 people.  Who cares about seating, it's about the food.  What I really liked was the all you can grab pickles.  Most places will serve you one sliced pickle with a burger but here it's self served. MMM I grabbed three for myself haha =D EAT HERE!

I want to come back and try every burger on their menu.  I'm looking to order the Spicy Sly Chicken burger next mmm.  Places like this makes me wish I lived in SF.

Oh yeah, don't be a jerkoff and bring 8 off your prick friends and take up half of the seats in the joint. GTFO
author: Ronnie N.

description:
I've made a huge mistake.

I was looking for a small-bite to eat, and I got recommended to go here from Public Barber Salon. They either know me really well (that I eat alot) or wanted me to succumb to the food coma of the century. FUUGGGGGGGGG.

+++STRAIGHT TO THE POINT

The regular size burger is a 1/2 lb. The "mini" is a 1/4lb. GOSH.

You can choose from Niman Ranch beef, chicken, buffalo, or Kobe beef (extra for the buffalo/Kobe). Sounds like a deal to me. I went for the Buffalo for kicks. And for the lulz that a buffalo has an unusually large head: http://www.wildnatureimages.com/A%20to%20C3000/BUFFALO-1..jpg

What's this? I didn't see the small print saying that the Buffalo burger only comes in 1/2 lb size. DAMNITTTTTTT.

Anyway, the burger probably was the best burger I've had in a while. It's size and weight is like an effing thorough-bred horse ramming you in the stomache so don't go here looking for a casual meal. It's gonna make you not want to eat dinner.
author: Charles L.

description:
I love this place! I live about four blocks away. I also live five blocks away from my gym. 

I don't always make it to the gym.
author: Jaynel G.

description: One of the best burgers I've ever had in my life. I paid around 6 bucks for a burger that blew away the $23 wagyu beef burger I had at Monettes in Hawaii!
author: Kelly F.

description: Pearl's epitomizes everything that is good and holy in the old fashioned burger world. Greasy, comforting meaty goodness...but made with love and organic produce and grass-fed beef. Tons of options as well as the choice to upgrade to Kobe or Buffalo--Pearl's is easily a must-try for any burger fan. My usual order: Pearl's Deluxe w/ cheddar & bacon w/ garlic fries and a chocolate shake. Their shakes could use a little work, but their garlic fries have tons of freshly minced garlic chunks. On a date and worried about breath? The sweet potato fries are awesome. Inexpensive but definitely an other worldly experience. Good, honest burgers just the way they used to make them back in the day.
author: Frances L.

description:
I like a burger to be plump, juicy and burst in my mouth with flavors from all of the components of the bun and between the bun.  So after reading the 4 and 5 star reviews I was ecstatic to walk into Pearl's.

They cook burgers "medium" unless you ask otherwise.  I said I wanted mine medium RARE, leaning closer to rare than to medium.  The vapid dude at the counter grunted and entered something into the computer.

What I got was medium WELL. The patty is flat and flavorless.  Salt is NOT a flavor!   Their burgers all look impressive when they come out, largely because they pile on a lot of "stuff," and the bun itself is chubby (but tasteless and doughy, a step above buns from Safeway)

The bacon on mine was generous, but it was barely cooked, and the the pieces which were cooked were sort of half cooked/half not cooked.  That gets a loud EWWWW out of me.

The grilled onions taste like they were cooked yesterday.

The batter of onion rings was a big yawn with no flavor.  Absolutely not calorie worthy.

Call me crazy but I thought they'd make their own ketchup or offer something really good.  I thought they'd have good mustard.  What's on the table is a mystery - both are in opaque squeeze bottles with no brand name.  The mustard is likely Frenches (they do not offer anything better) and the ketchup is probably el cheapo from Costco, laden with high fructose corn syrup and other horrible things.    

The fries are not house cut/made, they are the usual frozen things you expect from a place which does not use grass fed meat.

Which brings me to their meat.  Snarky McSnark at the counter got into a snit when I said that Estancia from Uruguay is hardly "sustainable" since the stuff comes up the George W Bush Memorial Super Highway from South America . . . Snark Boy pointed to a poster on the wall and told me to read the Estancia propaganda.   Puh-leeze, he must encounter a lot of gullible and stupid people, which I am not. I was all set to enlighten the unenlightened with resources for purchasing California grown grass fed meat, but I realized I was trying to talk to someone who's drunk some bad Kool Aid which dissolved any desire for facts and common sense.

Niman Ranch is barely acceptable to people like myself (and I hope you too) and I've had faaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaar better Niman Ranch burgers at Tower Burger than the thing I was served today at Pearl's.  When Tower Burger does a better job you know your in trouble!

I end with a question - how can something dripping from greasy oil be bone dry?  Ask Pearl, if there really is a Pearl.
author: Cinnamon Z.

description:
Came home late from work tonight and stopped at Pearl's for my favorite meal there - a chicken teryaki burger and a half order of onion rings. The onion rings here are SUBLIME. Best ever. I would have been satisfied with just those but had to make work of my main course. I will never tire of their delicious, phat teryaki chicken burger. Just the right amount of everything and sooo soulful. 

While I was waiting for my order I watched a guy who had two hot dogs with kraut in front of him doing the crossword and singing to himself. Ah, sweet life.
author: Roxmarie M.

description: I would have rated this higher if I didn't know Super Duper existed, but I do and thus the law of relativity takes effect.  Not that these are bad burgers by any stretch of the imagination, just sorta okay.
author: Norman S.

description:
Damn, this place serves a good burger. We needed food before a night of celebrating and this place fit the bill -- yummy looking menu, good reviews, and fairly priced.

I got the Prized Pearl, small fries, and a drink. The burger was perfectly cooked and the patty wasn't skimpy-sized at all. The blue cheese tasted fresh and the grilled onions were perfectly cooked. Fries were a plentiful portion but were no better or no worse than anyplace else I've been to. The service was pretty quick considering the burgers are freshly made. My total was $12 and in the realm of tasty SF eating, that's pretty frickin cheap. 

People aren't joking when they say this place is small -- there was maybe room for 20 people max to sit down. The 8 of us wisely chose to take our food back to the hotel. 

I'm trying to think if I've ever had a better burger but nothing is coming to mind. I think Pearl will have to be a tie with St. Johns in Sunnyvale for the best burgers I've had. My entire group agreed that their burgers were awesomely tasty so I'm gonna have to chalk this one up as a win in my book.
author: Farhad M.

description:
So, I happen to be walking home last night,and I finally stop by this place.  I was starving after a crazy day of flying to Boston and back.

And, I walk by this place more often than not and hear of the fab food this place cooks up.

Well....from the moment I walk in, the gentleman in the red cap behind the counter welcomes me in as if I were a regular: good sign!

Anyway, all that really can be said here is that the Pearl's Deluxe Neiman Ranch Cheeseburger with a side of regular fries was THE BOMB!

OH MY GOD!, to be blunt, it was the most mind blowing food orgasm E V E R!...Believe me, I will be back, and I am forever in love with this place...

question-is the gentleman in the cap the owner?  anyway, his customer service skills are TOPS!

i heart them both.

Patrick :-)
author: Patrick I.

description:
I went for an early dinner, aound 4:30, so it was quiet and only two other patrons were there when I came in. I sat at the little table. There were two tables for 4, and a few stools at the counter at the window. 
Good burger, good value. Burger sizes are half pound or quarter pound (mini). I had a mini cheeseburger and fries. Not amazing, but good. The texture of the fries are fantastic, but they don't come seasoned. I was so enchanted by the crispy, deep fried, lightly breaded (I think...) texture when they were hot, that I didn't notice there was no flavor until they cooled off. 
My favorite thing about this place is the container of pickles on the counter. I love pickles with a fat juicy burger, which mine wasn't. I took two at the end when I realized I wasn't quite as full as I thought I would be. 
They bring the burgers and fries, but everything else, including seasoning, is completely up to you. I think I saw a little mustard on one bun. I could have had a bigger, juicier, tastier burger for less at a couple of diner type places nearby for the same price. To be fair, I believe Pearl's has better quality of meat. 
Service was ok, very simple and casual.
author: A L.

description:
I love burgers and I was very excited to try this place, although it didn't wow me. Still a good burger though, and reasonably priced.

I still prefer the KK Cafe. Have yet to try Zuni (not that those are in the same league).
author: Mark A.

description:
I'm not sure if I even ate at the same place as the rest of the reviewers. My experience was TERRIBLE! I was in San Francisco visiting from Texas. The place we'd stayed at recommended coming here for a quick burger and told us all these wonderful things. Being from Texas if there is one thing we are an authority on it's beef! Well, don't go here.

 The place is very, very small and cramped. And we could have looked past that, but there were dirty tables, trash all over the floor, and clutter everywhere we looked making the place seem even SMALLER, and that much more gross. We only had about an hour before everything started closing so we decided to stay. Big Mistake.

 I got a double Cheese burger with onion rings and my boy friend got the Pearl Burger, with garlic fries. Well they charge you extra for the sides.. my bill for a burger, onion rings and water? $22 his? $15 When the food came, my plate had about 5 little homemade onion rings.. not what you'd expect from a dive bar, that just charged you extra for them. The burger might as well have just been a slab of Crisco on a bun. Neither of us got past the first three bites before they went in the trash. The "garlic fries" were half cooked fries with raw garlic sprinkled on top! Gross! Ever hear of garlic salt pearl burger?!... You've been warned!
author: A A.

description:
2.5 stars

I'm a burger fanatic.  
There are a few things in life that you will NEVER see me turn down - and a good cheeseburger is one of them.

I mean, come on.  Cheeseburgers are not just filling, but it's "comfort food" to me.  I'm not a snob about what kind of burger I have - - everything from my specific "special" burger from Mickey D's (quarter pounder w/ cheese with no ketchup, no pickles, no mustard, only onions) or one of life's greatest inventions: the double double from In N Out.... all the way to a $20 burger from Epic.... I love 'em all!  Some burgers I do not like come from Burger King and Carl's Jr. but even then, I'm not unhappy eating one of them - - I just miss Wendy's is all.

Now, I should explain that this was a take-out order.  So, it did have to survive on its own for about 6 minutes prior to my taking it out of its misery.  

I specifically requested no ketchup... and no pickles.  
I do not believe in ketchup.  You put ketchup on anything and all you taste is ketchup.  There aren't many things in life I hate - - but ketchup is definitely at the top of that short list.  Whenever I see someone dunk their otherwise delicious food in ketchup - - I make a mental note to never trust that person's food recommendations.  Seriously!

I order my burger w/ the option of cheddar cheese.

The first bite was pretty good.  It had a nice big bun that was soft - - a big patty and a healthy dose of onions, tomatoes, and I spotted a piece of lettuce that was totally wilted but hey, like I said, it was takeout order.  This is forgivable!

Based on these reviews, I expected to be wowed, but it just never happened!  Looking at the burger, I expected wonderful things to happen to me for the next 4.1 minutes.  

What I did NOT like and don't consider directly related to the 6 minute wait was that either the cook forgot to use salt, or he feels about salt the way I do about ketchup.  I worship salt, so this was the first ding.  The beef was dead already, but he killed it completely by cooking it without salt.... and that cow died in vain.  No flavor.  
I have certain expectations of cheese.  I love cheese.  I like it melted on a burger - it makes a plain burger fabulous -  but I don't like it when cheese melts into OIL.... it should melt in a gooey fashion but maintain a consistency and color that is reminiscent of "CHEESE".  This cheese melted into a semi-clear oily covering on the beef - - and left nothing to taste.  Combine this with the lack of salt, and basically, I tasted nothing but tomatoes, bun, and wilted lettuce.

Due to it being so big, and not very flavorful, I started to take the thing apart and ripped off the buns, took off the cheese, took out the melted lettuce and then decided only to eat the meat.  Taking one bite into the meat, I noted that the texture of the beef was not what I'd expect of real ground beef.  That's not to say it was fake beef, but it was definitely a pre-made patty that one buys in bulk - - just a different texture than what I'd expect from a freshly made burger from a restaurant.
With no salt or pepper.

The entire burger was also incredibly oily and watery.  Now I love fat and oil more than most, but don't I simply don't need it, mixed with water from a frozen patty, dripping from my fresh burger in a continuous stream. 

I was just under-impressed on the whole.  
What was even worse, though, was the onion rings.  These onion rings were SO bad that they made Burger King look like a 3-star Michelin restaurant.

That said - -  this place makes some fresh and BEAUTIFUL fries.  I like my fries big, a bit crispy on the outside, and  completely SOFT on the inside.  Pearl's made it exactly that way - - it was lovely, and the texture was perfect  - - - but as expected, it could have used some.... 

SALT!!!!!

I MIGHT try a buffalo burger one day and order it w/ extra salt or something.  Surely, there must be something all these Yelpers are raving about, but I just don't see it right now.  

I really, really wanted to like this burger, but it just didn't happen.
author: Grace K.

description: I very realy seek out a burger.  But having my parents in town, (dad is a burger kinda guy) I needed to find a good spot for everyone.  All i can say is DAMN GOOD BURGER!!!!!!
author: Rob S.

description:
700 + people raved about this place.  If you live around the corner its a decent burger place.  If you want to go because you had a "cheeseburger in paradise" dream and craving for burgers , I would say keep looking.

Parking is NIGHTMARE!  Burger was good, but a Little too greasy for me.  Maybe I should have upgraded my meat choice to kobie or the grass feed burger. My meat seemed like a preformed patty.  It was cooked right and no complaints flavor wise.  I had the famous bula burger and though it was good  but nothing  great enough for us to seek this place out again.  

 All was good but nothing to write home about.  We will keep searching out the perfect buger place and when we do I will let you guys know.
author: matteo b.

description: Really good burgers. The Kobe beef is the best way to go. Not too pricey either
author: Star W.

description:
Excellent burgers! I love the Phat Bobb, which happens to be their award winner. Totally makes sense, as it has bacon, onion rings, and BBQ sauce. mmmm

I highly recommend ordering the fries well done. Any time I forget, they are a bit smushy, which I hate. Regular or sweet potato, both are excellent when hot and crispy. 

I always call ahead, as I work across the street, so I've never eaten in the store. It severely lacks ambiance, but hey, it's burgers and fries.
author: Brooke B.

description:
I stopped in to try one of these amazing burgers I have heard so much about and wasn't as thrilled as I thought I would be. It was a fine burger. But it wasn't anything special. 

I tried the Bula Burger because I thought that he Spicy Pineapple Teriyaki Sauce would be something new and exciting. It really was kind of bland. I'm not saying it wasn't good. It was a quality burger, just not real exciting.
author: Mike S.

description:
I've officially sinned.  I was on a juice fast and just broke it by coming here today.  Was it worth it?  SURE WAS!!!!  

Pearl's is my comfort food.  10 steps away from my apartment, burgers cooked to my liking, greasy, dripping, and wonderful.  If you're a little girl like me, the big burgers might be a bit much (I can only eat half and the other half is wasted because I don't like leftover burgers).  I order the mini burgers which is still bigger than an In N Out burger.  The sweet potato fries here are crinkle cut sprinkled with Garlic Salt.  No need for extra salt or ketchup, I just eat them whole.  They're a little dry for my taste, but I guess sweet potatoes don't hold a lot of oil.  When I eat fries I expect my fingers to shine.  

The pumpkin shake is DELICIOUS.  OMG, PERFECTION.  1000 calories of pure heaven.  After I have one, I usually like to sit on my couch and watch 4 hours of tv.  I'm only 110 lbs and I walk everwhere, so Pearl's and I have a great relationship.
author: Nezza F.

description:
Would you believe me if I told you they scored a 100 on their last inspection?  If you don't believe me, see the proof for yourself underneath the menu.  I believe it.  It had to be one of the cleanest, most sterile burger joints I've ever been to!

I was SO wanting to like this burger after reading all the reviews.  With a few other friends in tow, we ordered the Prized Pearl, the Spicy Sly and the Phat Bobb.

So here's the critique.  Though we ordered the burgers cooked medium, they were cooked a little too long to medium well, which created a pretty dry burger.  We liked the taste of the beef, but it was a pretty dense patty with little flavoring.  A little bit of salt, pepper & perhaps chopped onions would have gone a long way.  We liked the sesame bun, but it was also a little dry.  I prefer a Kaiser roll or a Challah roll myself.  However, we had to agree it was a good size and the condiments were excellent.

The Spicy Sly with sauteed onions, peppers, spicy sauce, jack & mayo was just spicy enough without being overpoweringly so.  It definitely had a kick, but it didn't kill your tastebuds so you couldn't enjoy the other elements of the burger.

The Phat Bobb with bacon, onion rings, bbq sauce, jack & mayo was tasty too.  The bacon was nicely crisped, the onion ring kept it's shape well and gave a satisfying crunch when bit into, and we liked that the bbq was more savory than sweet (i.e. more Cattlemen's than KC Masterpiece).

The Prized Pearl with bacon, sauteed onions, crumbled bleu cheese & mayo was good too.  Bacon makes everything better, right?  The only complaint about this one was that the bleu cheese wasn't salty enough.  I've found pre-crumbled bleu cheese tends to be less flavorful, so the ones that pack more of a pungent whallop (what this burger really needed) are the ones sold in wedges.

All in all, a decent burger but not quite the one I envisioned it to be.
author: Janet L.

description: Deluxe w/ cheese. Loved it! Glad I didn't get something too over powered by extras.
author: Kasey T.

description: Went to Pearls with my cousin in the summer that highly recommended it to me.  I thought the burger was great, had the cheeseburger, but the fries were amazing.  The next time I'm in town, definitely heading back.
author: Camilo M.

description:
ZOMG.  This is the best burger I've ever had complimented by the best onion rings I've ever had.  

My fiance and I were craving  burgers when he suggested we try Pearls.  The place is very small so we got our order to go which took about 15 minutes to get.  We quickly walked up nob hill, hurrying home to taste the meal while still hot and fresh.  When we arrived at the apartment, we were pleasantly surprised to find that the folks at Pearls had strategically cut a hole in the top of my onion ring to go container to keep them from going soggy on the walk home - awesome!  The rings were composed of delicately sweet, soft yet slightly crunchy onions, and PERFECT, delicate, peppery, crisp batter.  My burger was The Ranch Burger with Buffalo meat - ranch dressing, cheese, avocado, tomato, a perfectly cooked medium 1/4 pound bison patty, on a not-too-hard-not-too-soft poppy seed bun.  The burger was more delectable than I had hoped but was very VERY messy - I believed we used the phrase, "Hamburger Massacre" to describe the remains.  

This is definitely not a place to go on a date if you don't want to be perceived as a sloppy mess but a great place to go alone, with friends, long time significant others or a first date that has already taken a nose dive.

Pearl's rocks.
author: Lindsay P.

description:
This tiny shop has the best non-fancy burgers in the city!

3 types of beef. American Kobe beef for gourmet taste buds. And turkey, chicken and veggie burgers for those who don't eat beef.

Add a milkshake (choose from more than 2 dozen flavors).
Add your pick of crinkle fries, sweet potato fries, onion rings, or any combination of them.

Devour food while still hot. I'm a happy camper!
author: George M.

description: First, let me say that we found this place under the category, "burgers and beer". We walked 15 minutes based on the category and the reviews. Alas, they don't serve beer. After I got over the disappointment of not being able to have a beer with my burger, I ordered the Kobe bleu cheese burger. Juicy enough to fall apart in my hands, it was tasty. Not over the top, but tasty.
author: Bob A.

description:
Ditto other reviews--delicious burgers and shakes!

Crinkled cut sweet potato fries lend to thicker fries rather than the "traditional" crispy sweet potato fries.

Be sure to read the fliers posted to the right of the menu board for their specials before ordering your shake.

Hubbie's tips: (1) your hands will glisten with meat juice; (2) don't put the drippy (delicious) burger down--it'll be nearly impossible to pick the soppin' burger back up; (3) once you start, don't stop--you'll realize how full you are, and won't be able to finish. 

3rd tip--easy enough unless you're eating the King, a burger "crowned" with a hot dog (delicious!).
author: Nisee D.

description:
I love your Phat Bob (bbq sauce, onion rings)and your frings(fries and onion rings). I just wish you were open on Sundays too! 

I've gotten many a craving for a burger, walked over, and then sadly realized once again, you're CLOSED SUNDAYS!

It breaks my heart.
author: Kathy K.

description:
The burgers are delicious (the meat was a bit big for me but that's cuz I'm  a  woos).  I just had a regular cheeseburger, nothing fancy shmancy.  And the ingredients were great, the meat was fresh, the cheese was melted, and it was just delicious.  The staff was so friendly and attentive.  The place is tiny so be prepared to vulture over someone's table (1 of like only 5 tiny tables inside this place) for a place to sit.  The fries were flawless.  The garlic fries, on the other hand were really garlicky.  This is coming from a garlic fan.  It's a lot of garlic.  I went to sleep that night and woke up in the middle of the night feeling like Id chewed on 3 garlic cloves, but didn't swallow them.. just left them in my mouth to marinate.  That's how stinky I was.  And yeah, I'm a newlywed.  Not sexy.
Oh, I also must add... don't place much faith in the side sauces.  The ranch and thousand island are just... idk... not good.  Stick w/ketchup.
OH, and eat some pickles.  They're on the counter, and they're so good!! It'll give you something to do until the food's there.
author: Rox G.

description:
Mutha have mercy on me!!  I can't say these burgers are good or even great.  Those meager words don't do them justice.  These burgers are phenomenal!!  One of biggest, juiciest  and tastiest burgers I've had in a very long time.  This is drip-down your arm, all over your mouth and face delicious.  I had the king burger and I sure felt like one when I saw it.  Who thinks about topping their fat decadent cheeseburger with bacon AND a grilled hot dog?!  Better question is, why haven't I ever thought about doing that?!  

This is definitely the place to satisfy that late-night (or anytime really) craving.  Prices are fair.  It's not the cheapest burger out there, but you're seriously getting a lot of food for your buck.  This place is no secret either.  Lines form VERY quickly but they move 'em pretty quick.  There's limited seating so get your table right away.  Don't even look around.  There's nothing good to look at anyway.  

Now excuse me as I find a way to unclog my arteries.
author: Jim D.

description: Awesome burgers. And don't forget an order of Springs!
author: Wendy F.

description: This is hamburger heaven.  I order a Pearl Deluxe, cooked rare, sweet potato fries, and one of their unique shakes.  I LOVE Pearl's!!!
author: Katherine F.

description:
I am definitely a fan of this place.  When the other reviewers said hole in the wall, they weren't kidding.  Both burgers we had were amazingly juicy and delicious.  I was surprised they were able to cook a 1/2 burger so perfectly.  I usually struggle finishing a 1/3 lb burger, but this one was so good, it all went down without a hitch.

I will definitely try their Bobby Flay winning burger next time.  The sweet potato fries were amazing -- they would be PERFECT if they had less salt (seems like they over salt their fries and my SPF's got caught up in the mix).  

The salty fries and the limited seating were the only reason the establishment didn't get 5 stars -- but the burger was absolutely a 5. 

I will return to this joint again in the future, and try the leaner buffalo and get whoever I'm with to get the Kobe so I can try that too. :)  The shake machine was broken when I went (woe is me!!!)

Great place overall, and best yet, only three blocks away from Union Square!
author: Dee D.

description: I had the spicy sly burger, onion rings, and nutella and cheesecake shake. Burger was cooked perfect, and fun as its not often one gets a spicy burger--the grilled red and green peppers and onions went well with the spicy (chipotles-style?) sauce. Onion rings were great--tasted fresh, and would almost swear they were sweet onions. Shake--imagine a massive slob of nutella on top of a cheesecake, and throw it in a blender--sugar karma--a nice uber sweet desert after the spicy burger. As many free pickles as you want-nice bonus. About $19 out the door for a full course meal, and worth it. Only downside, sign said the shake was $4.99 and they actually charged $5.99 (stating the sign was wrong). Okay. Awesome burger and otherwise good folks. Limited seating.
author: Richard H.

description:
Pearl's Burgers vs my wedding dress

pearls is winning...

Why did I have to discover pearls right after I got engaged!?! I am getting married in about a year and a half.
