I, like every bride want to get in shape before my wedding.  cycle cycle cycle. crunches crunches crunches. I have spent hours making up work out routines!  I bought I yoga mat and exercise ball!  Every thing was great...

And then I met pearl's.  A-M-A-Z-I-N-G! I crave it!  Only 1 block from my apartment! I might have to move otherwise I will gain weight living so close!  Can you have wedding dresses let out!?!
author: Olivera J.

description:
I'm a burger guy, I truly appreciate a good burger. These burgers were greasy, flavorless, and sloppy. The fries were old and soggy. 

On the upside, the staff was nice and friendly.
author: Zak C.

description:
I'm sorry but this time I have to give you two stars. Since I live a few blocks away, I eat here often. Usually it is great but the last three times me and my dining partner have been disappointed. 
We always order the same thing, I have the Bacon Burger and he has the Teriyaki Burger. I'm not sure why but the last visits, our burgers have been over cooked. That is 6 burgers in the last 3 visits. That is a lot of money for a mediocre meal. NOw the onion rings were delicious as always.
I let the previous 2 visits be as bad days for the cooks, but this time I need to speak.
We got our well done burgers and decided to just eat them, again, however the Cashier came out and asked us how was our food. I replied, our burgers are over cooked, again, and his response was " that happens sometimes, and I'll let  (insert some lady's name here) know and walked away. That was how they take care of compliments? Nothing like dry well meat. YUK
WOW, that took care of our problem. 
We are thinking of finding another burger house for our burger fix. Maybe somewhere in Russian Hill.
author: Geoff F.

description:
It's not bad living in the "Tendernob" area. 

I have "Katana-ya" for their slurpy ramen goodness, "Coco Bang" for some soothing soup or fire-hot chicken that'll make a person's ears sprout flames, "Shalimar" for their greasy oh so delicious curries and tender tandoori, and "Osha Thai" for some decent late-night stir-fried noodles as long as I don't use the bathroom because chances are someone puked in there already.

But what about when I'm craving SOME MEAT ON BREAD?!?!?! *insert random pseudo-caveman sounds here* I'M TALKING A NICE BIG HUNK OF MEAT TO JUST DIG INTO AND WOLF DOWN LIKE THERE AIN'T NO TOMORROW ??

... oh and by the way did I say I'm on a budget? (no steak) And I don't really eat beef or pork? S.O.L.? Nope...

That's when I go to Pearl's for their Buffalo Burgers (if YOU'RE tame and want moo-meat it's cheaper). Lean and still a bit pricey at ~ $7.25 for the base burger but oh so satisfying. The place offers various combos that include toppings from avocado, blue cheese, ranch, to a habenaro-pumpkin sauce thing. They lightly toast the inside of the buns but it still gets squashed in the eating process. Fresh chunks of lettuce. Thick slice of tomato. I always end up with a case of "oh-I've-only-got-two-bites-left-to-go-stomach-hurts-but-must-finish-because-oh-so-good".

And then the next day I find myself wanting more. 

Their sweet potato fries aren't bad either.
author: ChiYan T.

description:
My new favorite place to get a burger!!!!  

Mini swiss cheese burger with bacon
Phat Bob burger
Sweet potato fries
Onion rings
Pumpkin milkshake.  

AMAZING!  

If you haven't tried this place, you're missing out big time on one of the juiciest burgers evah.
author: Jennifer H.

description: This place is awesome yet tiny. Order ur burger medium and it will come pink in the middle which is perfect. The fries are battered- crispy and delicious! Highly reccommend!!
author: A K.

description:
Who am I kidding, Pearl's deserves 5 stars.  Since the original review, I have tried the regular and buffalo burgers as well as a shake.

The buffalo burger is pretty good, but I definitely prefer the flavor of beef.  The regular burger was just fine, and way less greasy than the kobe, but still the kobe is awesome and worth the extra $4 if you are really hungry. 

If you get a kobe, as soon as you get it tilt it upright so that it's not resting on the bun.  That way all the grease drips out of the burger instead of being soaked up by the bun.

The vanilla shake I got was excellent; the right proportions of good ingredients.
author: Joseph N.

description:
Okay, this review is going to be my warm-up for the 8-10 page paper I must start and finish tonight after doing THREE GODDAMN PAINTINGS. In fact, I have to write 8-10 pages *about* my stupid paintings. Which reminds me: "I don't need sex because Berkeley fucks me every day."

So yeah, Berkeley is fucking me allllll night long...until I finish my paper and go off to goddamn jury duty. Please no one call me on the hotline tonight. Please. Can you tell I'm stressed?

So, now I stop using Pearl's as a venting space and start actually reviewing the restaurant. On a Saturday night, we drove around forever trying to find street parking somewhere remotely walkable from Pearl's, but FAILED. Had to pay for parking.

"Well then, Pearl's had better be pretty freakin' amazing," we said to each other. Turned out to be a tiny hole-in-the-wall joint. They had special burgers, normal burgers, frings (fries, onion rings), springs (sweet potato fries, onion rings), spries, I think (fries, sweet potato fries), as well as various flavored milkshakes...including pumpkin and blueberry.

I settled on the Teriyaki Burger (mushroom, jack cheese, patty, teriyaki sauce) and Y got a Phat Bob, another special burger. Both of us upgraded ($1.50) to Buffalo meat, which is supposed to be leaner and healthier, with more protein. "Aren't Buffalo extinct?" asked Y. No, my dear, they are not. Maybe you're thinking of wooly mammoths?

We ordered springs, but they heard wrong and gave us frings. I nicely asked to exchange them for springs and they nicely obliged. Total came to around $20. Not cheap for fast food.

Our food came and hey, it really wasn't that great. Good, but definitely not worth the parking or the money. Y described buffalo meat as tasting somewhere between beef and liver, which kinda disgusted me because I don't like liver.

I probably ordered the wrong thing. There was too much teriyaki sauce in my burger (very overpowering), plus I missed lettuce and tomatoes! Then again, I have had a good swiss mushroom cheeseburger without those additions. I'll give them one thing though. Their burgers are very adorable. They come in big poofy buns...and yes I was really full afterwards. 

Mine: http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/5o_hMMj3MWuxA7r9xbGVgw/l
His: http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/UuzhrQnGj82RX4NrSOwzig/l

The sweet potato fries (http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/-xMdOZv_XEeONeYMkn7-MA/l) tasted kind of like tempura but not as good. A bit limp, and we ended up taking them home. Would not order again. Onion rings were good though...

All-in-all, Pearl's didn't really hit the spot for me. It was okay, but what I really need is for someone to take me to In-and-Out (Yann, if you're reading this...). And I wish that I finished my beer at Periscope Cellars because it's gonna be a rough night.
author: K W.

description:
Burgers and fries. It's what I would consider as some of the best hangover cures in all of San Fran. And what is better than having a place right across the street that serves them 6 times a week.  It's all been said before, so instead of giving the blah blah blah review about how it's great that they serve Buffalo, organic, and kobe meat in their burgers and how it doesn't matter what you ask for the outside of your burger always looks like it's been singed, I'll just tell you about the do's and don'ts of Pearl's.

DO:
-Always ask for medium rare. It doesn't really actually matter was you ask for (see above) but this will guarantee that you burger isn't too overdone.
-Always ask for your fries well done or crispy. Since I usually get take away and Pearl's has a tendency to wait until you get there until they start making your fries (because who wants soggy fries,) sometimes they under cook them. Asking for well done or crispy fries will make sure that your fries are as good as they can be when entering your mouth.
-Always get malt in your Milkshakes... even though that could just be a general overall rule when it comes shakes.
-Always Tip! they do enough to keep that place friendly and clean that they really do deserve that extra buck.
-Never get the Peanut Butter Shake unless you like eating peanut butter directly from the jar.
-Always sit near the window if you can. Best seats in the place.

Now food wise this place would only get 3 or 3.5 stars. Don't get me wrong, the burgers, fries, dogs and shakes are good, but they aren't epic, blast a load in my pants good. What really pushes Pearl's to that 4 star burger place is the service. They are probably the nicest people in the world and they always go out of their way to make sure everything is better than great when I walk in (and I walk in a lot)... and this might seem a bit sappy, but I truly feel like my burger is always made with a little love. And that's something that everyone wants a little of (that and bacon. Seriously, their bacon is diesel.)
author: Zane C.

description:
Absolutely fabulous burger.  I was certain that this place would be great when the cashier asked me how I wanted my burger done; and surely, I wasn't disappointed.

Definitely try their kobe/buffalo patties when you are there.
author: Bill T.

description:
I've been here a few times before and have always been more than satisfied.  Last night i had a new experience though, the buffalo burger!  It tasted just like a lean Dank Burger, and i have never felt so good after eating such a big burger in my life.  No stomach ache??? Fuck Yea!!!  I will always get the buffalo burgers when i come back, and i will be back!!

"Not to be a total dick or anything, but my rack of lamb is way too fucking salty!"
-Bob Ross at Gary Danko Restaurant, 1999
author: John B R.

description: Yummy veggie patties! They let you make any of the specialty burgers vegetarian which is awesome. Maybe they'll  step it up and get some tofurky sausages..til then I will make due with what they have. Staff was friendly, and laid back. Best to go to this place on your own time, unless you have an hour lunch break you'll find yourself rushing back to work (like me). A little pricey but a good experience. Minus one star for average garlic/sweet potato fries and the cash only policy.
author: Liz P.

description:
Sorry to bust that Yelp bubble.  Pearl's doesn't live up to the accolades, awards, and praises.

Unlike graphic tees, Paris Hilton television shows, and green house gasses; the world DOES need another good hamburger joint.  Hearing so much good things about this place made me giddy.

Pearl's is quite small.  Seating serves about 15 but 10 is likely more comfortable.  Half of the space is taken up by the kitchen.  Although their signage is nice the interior is quite humble and stripped down.  Their bathroom is surprisingly clean with only one graffiti tag.

I ordered a "Prize Pearl" hamburger and a side of fries.  End total was about $10.  I was lucky enough to grab a table in this busy nest.  If you spot an empty table -- grab it.  The people in line won't realize until it's too late.

Typical ketchup and mustard squeezers and napkin boxes are stationed at each of the tables.  They also have additional vinegar, halved pickles, and water in the front.

My hamburger and fries were individually served in red plastic trays layered with deli paper.  The burger was absolutely dripping with juice and grease.  The juice I like, the grease not so much.  This is a burger after all so I wasn't kidding myself.  "Prize Pearl" comes with mushrooms, grilled onions, sprinkled blue cheese, bacon, and beef patty in between two sesame seed buns.  The guy didn't ask me how I wanted my meat so I assumed that this was one of those places that didn't do it; I then heard others ask for custom meat preparation (~doh!).

The burger was okay.  If this came out of some roadside diner I wouldn't be so surprised.  I guess my expectations were too high.  Although the Prize Pearl sounded good in text, it didn't meld well in execution.

Just way too many ingredients used in the wrong way.  It needed more cheese, the bacon needed to be sliced into bite sized pieces, the mushrooms and onions were all over the place.  The bread was also a problem for me.  At first glance I was glad they used higher quality bread, but this feeling didn't last long.  The bread doesn't elevate the burger to the next level like it should.

Fries are a let down.  They taste like the freezer bag kind.  They were so thick and feel stale I needed to use a lot of ketchup.  On the bright side, they give enough to feed two people.

As I ate I read the menu on the wall.  I wished I had ordered something different.  They even have buffalo meat for $1.50 more.  Still, the food I had tells me I wouldn't be satisfied with anything.

___

An average burger joint constantly filled with fans.  Great to visit after a mosh pitting concert or epic battle with a time traveling robot.
author: Michael H.

description:
So, my friends and I decide to go to San Francisco randomly one day and we really didn't know what the plan was, but we knew we were hungry. I told my friend to look up anything good in the area we were in, and we found this place. 

This place is actually kind of small but its not that hard to wait for someone to leave so you can have a burger. Its not really good to bring all of your friends to. When i saw the prices i thought, they were pretty decent. Then out comes your food and you know you got more then you payed for.

I got the plain cheese burger with cheddar. It was such a juicy and delicious burger. You could also get buffalo meat and kobe beef for an additional charge. The fries are just ook though. All in all, id go back just for the burgers.
author: Andrew D.

description: Pearl's Deluxe is like my favorite song on my iPhone, I keep hitting repeat.
author: Timothy L.

description:
This place was recommended by the hotel, fantastic! The burgers were grilled to order with many options.  Ate there twice, both time loved it. The oreo milkshake was also a very nice way to end the meal.  

My personal favorite part was the cashier taking the time to engage conversation with a Frisco noob and tell me what was up and down
author: joshua s.

description: Great burger place in the heart of SF! Ordered the mini-burger with fries & potato fries..mmmmm.
author: Jenny G.

description:
This is one my favorite places to eat in San Francisco when I want a burger. They have buffalo, turkey, chicken, and veggie so everyone can eat here. You can get fries, sweet potato fries, onion rings and mixtures of any of those. The lady also says they make a mean Nutella Shake. 

I always get the Turkey burger and its a big size, the produce tastes fresh and they add jalapenos to it if you ask. The fries taste amazing, and when you are finished you feel full, and not like you got robbed for your money. 

Here is the bad point of Pearls. There is hardly any seating. Since this place is popular, if you don't want to sit on the sidewalk outside you basically have to stand there and watch people eat so you can snag the table before someone else does.
author: Josh G.

description: Great spot for a late night burger.  Selection is great and the staff is very nice.  Huge portions and the sweet potato fries will have you licking you fingers.
author: Matt J.

description: I've had my eye on Pearl's for a while.   Then when they were mentioned in the Eater SF poll about best classic burger (which I believe they won) I knew I really had to schedule some time to go.  Even though they're opening just a couple of blocks from work, I couldn't wait.  So hubby and I (I knew I would not be able to tackle these burgers myself) went for lunch.  I was kinda expecting it to be one of those dives, like Reds Java House, but instead I found a clean welcoming little burger joint.  I intended so show some restraint but my resolve was quickly weakened after reading the menu.  We ended up getting a burger each, springs and a milkshake.  Reading that now I'm not sure what we were thinking.  It was a lot of food.  The prized pearl burger was super tasty, juicy, etc, etc.  Everything you would expect from a classic burger.  I think next time I need to get the mini burger (1/4 lb) instead.  Or give up on the springs.  Okay, there's no way I'm giving up the springs.  The sweet potato fries were really good.  As was the milkshake, though I could probably sacrifice the milkshake if I had to.  I do not recommend ordering as much as we did if you want to avoid falling into a food stupor in the afternoon.  Was it worth it?  Yes.
author: Jean K.

description:
Great selection. Organic Beef and Organic Chicken. Niman Ranch and a Kobe Beef. 

Service with a smile and fast. 

Yummy, yummy bugers. The sweet potato fries tasted like they were just cut before fying - they were very fresh. 

Folks were coming in a jeans and T's as well as shiny out fits. 

A great SF place to go for a real burger craze.
author: Fresh E.

description: Oh my. I love this place! Awesome burgers. They're ample, juicy, and full of flavor. What more could you want?! I've also had the sweet potato fries. A lot of people go ga-ga over them, but the batch I had was just okay. The shakes are pretty yummy too! Beware, it's a small place so take it to go, fight off strangers for a seat, or go during off hours.
author: Joanne R.

description: I've only came here once, but man was that burger big and juicy! I  ordered the pesto chicken, a side of garlic fries, and a NUTELLA STRAWBERRY CHEESECAKE MILKSHAKE!!!. Yes, it does sound like a heart attack! but boy was it good!! Burger was great, gave me a lot of pesto on it and the chicken was cooked just right!  Should try this place at least once! You won't regret it!
author: Bruce L.

description:
My husband saw pictures for this place earlier this week, and declared that we would eat here this weekend.  Good thing did it for lunch, because it's been three hours and I'm still full!

I had the Pearl bacon cheese burger and my husband had the deluxe (with grilled onions and bleu cheese).  The burgers were good.  Thick strips of bacon, good helping of cheddar cheese...  Hubby loved his burger too, though it was hella messy.

Our only gripe is about our orders of fries and onion rings.  Our own fault for not noticing that they had a fries/onion rings combo.  That's fine.  But what we didn't like is that they had small and large orders of both - and without asking, we were charged for large orders.  Again, yes, we didn't notice there were two sizes - but you don't assume and charge for the more expensive one.  I can understand not mentioning the combo, but really, they should have asked if we wanted small or large orders of our sides.

On the whole, the burgers were good.  Greasy good, but it's not the best burger in town.  I wouldn't NOT eat there again, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.  It's a burger.
author: Denise M.

description: So I've been hearing good things about this place. Workplace decided to order lunch from here for pick up one time and so I decided order with them. Ordered a mushroom burger (I've ordered this burger from other burger joints in the past) and this is the best so far. I could probably eat 2 if I wanted to and the burger isn't really that small.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
The burgers were excellent and they only use top beef (Niman ranch is the standard I think). My husband started a burger blog (http://sanfranciscoburgerblog.tumblr.com/) in SF and this is the place to go for good burgers. 

 Ambiance was standard and very small but the food was great. I recommend upgrading your burger for a buck or going all out for the Kobe beef burger... but regardless, its all good. A little pricey for a burger IMO but that's what you pay for quality I guess. 

Also not spectacular on the fries but they do have a combination of regular fries and onion rings (onion rings are really good)
author: Leila H.

description:
While walking up to this place a well-mannered man informed me that it was a great day to be alive because there was "great women and great dope" on the streets of the city.  Upon leaving Pearl's I was hoping to bump into him again so I could add to that list "great burgers".

I thoroughly enjoyed my burger(cheddar w/ bacon) and springs (1/2 order sweet potato fries, 1/2 order onion rings).  The burger was juicy, flavorful, and oh so satisfying.  The bacon added a nice touch with a great smoky flavor.

They seemed to have some great 'deluxe' burgers that I can't wait to try on my next of many, many visits to this quintessential burger joint.
author: Justin B.

description:
I ordered a Kobe beef burger tonight.  It tasted gamey and was not juicy at all.  They cook their burgers medium unless you specify otherwise.  It was cooked perfectly, but I was not impressed with the quality.  In fact, it had a crumbly texture.  

The sesame bun was okay.  It was thick (which I usually love) but not as soft and fresh as I like.  I ordered a fresh banana shake, and it had some fresh banana and a lot of syrup.  I hate artificial banana flavor!  The one saving grace was the fries.  They were nice and thick just like I like them.  

My husband and I got a burger each, shared an order of fries, I had a shake and he had a soda.  The bill came to $47.   Total rip off.   If you want a magnificent burger at a great price, go to Nations!  The best burger in the bay area.
author: Freya Z.

description:
Went here yesterday for my first taste of Pearl's with a gang of like-minded burger fans, and we all walked away happy. In fact, there's a big update about it here:

http://sanfranciscoburgerblog.tumblr.com/

But regardless, loved it and would recommend it to anybody who loves a mouthfull of savory, delicious beefiness.
author: Drew H.

description:
While nursing my drink at a bar one evening, I struck up a conversation with a cute hapa guy -- really, you shouldn't be surprised, that's what I do, talk to people, I'm actually quite friendly once you get past my poker face and aura of homicidal bitchiness. But I'm getting carried away, also something I do, so let's refocus. 

Anyway as it turns out the guy was from Hawai'i too. Now, you'd think a shared background in colonialism, miscegenation, and land rape would foster a stronger sense of brotherhood, but to my astonishment the dude was something of a prick because smack in the middle of our conversation he let the following non sequitur rip:

Dude: well, I'm not gonna sleep with you.

Followed by:

Me: excuse me?
Dude: you have a nice body, but if you've got an ugly mug it ain't gonna work.

...

OHHHHH.
                     HEEELLLLZ.
                                                NO.
                                                          HE.
                                                                  DIDN'T.
                                                                                  JUST.
                                                                                               GO.
                                                                                                        THERE.

Seriously? SERIOUSLY?!? Did this guy have a motherfucking death wish? WHAT THE FUCK?!? I mean, I can't even fucking REMEMBER the last time someone said straight up to MY FACE that I was UGLY! And for the record I didn't even WANT to sleep with this asshole, okay that's a total lie but whatever this is my review and if you spurn me in person I'll deny any exchange of conversation or bodily fluids, not to mention that everyone knows dealing the "Ugly" card to someone gives them the right to play the "Bitch" one.

BUT here's the thing. I'm learning. I'm maturing. See, instead of torching his car with Bacardi 151 and my purple lighter or stomping on his head with my stacked heel boots or attacking him with a rubber hose or otherwise acting out and directing my anger towards others like a sullen child I have taken ALL the vituperation crashing over my head like cresting waves in a warm ocean of hatred and internalized it LIKE A PROPER ADULT. And until that glorious moment when I rise from the ashes like the Phoenix and the pent up frustration and self-hatred explodes in a display of mature, adult irrationality like buying red Corvettes or accessorizing needlessly or paying for hookers or droping $50K for plastic surgery, I will settle for the quiet comforts of overeating -- in this case, Pearl's delectable burgers and shakes which were my balm and salvation after leaving the bar in a huff.

Whether it's the Phat Bobb and its smoky, thick-cut bacon atop two onion rings and a meaty patty wrapped in jack and slathered with barbecue sauce and mayo, or the King, who is a cheesy despot of ground beef to which you will gladly submit since he's crowned with a hot dog (yes, a burger with a fucking HOT DOG ON TOP OF IT), Pearl and her friendly, professional crew KNOW THEIR MEAT. Toss in one of their lactatious (yes, I made that word up, fuck off, this is my review) shakes and crisp sweet potato fries and BOOM! you don't need ass for the evening.

I give Pearl props for providing patties for the vegetarians and other health-conscious folks in the form of veggie burgers and buffalo burgers, thought to be honest I've never tried either 'cause if I'm gonna eat a burger I WANT A BURGER THAT WILL CLOG ALL MY ARTERIES ON SIGHT, the very idea of a patty low in fat is anathema to me (et tu McLean?!?).

And listen up bitches, here's the deal-closer: it's open until 2 AM on Fri/Sat which, combined with its proximity to many downtown/TL watering holes, makes Pearl's a great leveler of social distinctions. 'Cause it doesn't matter if you're a man or a woman; it doesn't matter if you're gay or straight; it doesn't matter if you're stumbling up to Post Street from a douchey venue (Redwood Room, Ambassador), a scenester venue (Rye, Bourbon&Branch), or a divey venue (Whiskey Thieves), the fact is you're STUMBLING and I think -- regardless of our differences -- we can all agree that the best way to prevent a hangover and cap off another luckless, sexless night is to eat a delicious burger. You fucking loser.
author: d s.

description:
There's enough reviews but I have to rave about this place!

Milkshakes PLEASE!
+ Coffee, not the overly sweet wussy stuff, it tastes like there's a kick!
+ Pina colada, great blend, refreshing

Nothing too extraordinarily special, just a really good messy burger. I've been here years ago and it was even better... though it still has ruined me on other burger places ;)
author: Angel L.

description: Been here twice, and both times I've been surprised at how good and juicy their burgers are.
author: Christian A. S.

description: Everything you've heard about Pearl's peanut butter shakes is true -- go get one right now!!!
author: Stephannie N.

description:
three words - Sweet potato fries. 

We were nearby at Ace's celebrating a friends birthday. Needed something to munch on and looked on the yelp app for near by places. Ended up here because sweet potato fries were calling my stomach.

This place is like a small diner. Menu on the wall so you can browser while you wait in line. 

I got a small order of sweet potato fries and demolished it all by myself (meaning they were pretty small). They were not crinkle-cut like all the photos posted- sad panda. The slices were thinner than regular/garlic fries yet packed enough of the sweet potato goodness. Yum

Service is friendly, but SLOW. Drinks come out promptly, but food takes a while. It took us a good 25+ min and all we had were various fries and 1 burger. Orders did come out in order of ordering, but does that mean they prepare one at a time?

5 * for the fries, -1 * for the SLOW SERVICE.
author: Christina C.

description:
All I can say is--food orgasm.  This place is a gem.  The patties are nice and thick, juicy, and greasy--in a good way.  Bacon is perfectly cooked--crispy, salty (but not too salty) and has the greatest consistency and crunch.  Blue cheese is oh so wonderful.  Strawberry milkshakes have the perfect consistency and little bits of fleshy strawberry in them.  I take a public speaking class, and I did my impromptu speech about how much I love this place.  Enough said.

P.S.  The people here are so sweet.  I hear it's not as good if you go in the day time, though, but if you're a night owl, you're in the right place.  Watch out for the vanilla milkshakes though.  They're pretty bland.
author: Natasha L.

description: quick, fast, greasy, and graffiti covered bathrooms are always the sign of a true SF local dive
author: rae m.

description:
These are the best burgers I've had in San Francisco...

I've had fancy burgers that cost upwards of 20 dollars and used purported "Kobe beef," mixed with truffles, and spiced with exotic herbs I can't even pronounce. This place thumps them all back to the stone age.

Forget about those fancy burgers. If you want a great burger that's huge, great french fries, with a quick diner joint atmosphere, visit Pearl's. 

Any burger you get here has the same great patty, just with different toppings. There is a liquor store 3 fronts up so if you need to drink with your burger, make sure to stop by while they make your food (and hide it in a bag because SFPD loves this place, too). 

I visited Pearl's after watching Sideways. I came to this restaurant with a small bottle of red wine to go with my burger. It was one of the best experiences I've ever had... Burger + red wine = heaven.

The fact that ketchup was out of a red plastic squeeze bottle and the tenderloin people walking outside only adds to the greatness of the experience.
author: Jason C.

description: Went here on the advise of Tyler Florence, as he claims it's one of the "Best Things he's Ever Eaten". I was unimpressed. The burger was just fine, but a bit sloppy and not particularly special. Maybe it's just my expectations that needed adjusting.
author: Erin W.

description:
YEESSSSSSSSSSS!!

pearl's in sf is just as good as pearl's in marin!

we had the sweet potato fries today and they were also a success!  sweet, potatoey, and crispy.

tip:  if you come in the evening, park one block down after jones street on the right hand side, at the white curb that is only restricted during business hours.
author: Josie M.

description:
And now, a word from a former liberal arts major.

In-And-Outrage Burger has "animal style," "communist style" and, especially, "Fundie Christian nut-job style."  Thus, I present my review.

Japanese style:

Pearl Burger: wow
Gorgeous, giant, meaty, thick,
Juice runs down my arm.

Shakespearean style:

To dine at Pearl's, delightful.  A feast
for mind, and soul, your spirit swoons.  Perhaps
a glimpse to heaven's own gate.  Of meat.

Irish style:

I once had some fries at Pearl,
along with milk that's been whirled,
I said with a grin,
as I wiped off my chin,
it's better than making love to a girl.

American style:

i had a burger at pearl
        my mind soared to a place
               not unlike,but different than,any
         i had ever experienced before.  the meat
was as a thousand exploding novi in my
        mouth, a death that brings a life
               renewed.  i sat, sated, still,
a bourgeoisie baboon.
author: Ben P.

description: I love their buffalo burgers. Can't tell it's buffalo meat at all! At least with the special burgers. I love all the special burgers I've tried. Kinda make me thirsty though. But otherwise, super juicy and flavorful, and of course, filling! their bun is good and greasy. their garlic fries are also super garlicky and flavorful, but don't get them if you can't stand raw garlic and don't like to smell it on your fingers for days. their onion rings and oreo milkshake are also phenomenal. sweet potato fries not bad. they make the oreo milkshake when you order so the oreos are nice and crunchy still when you drink it! one of my top choices for burgers overall.
author: Verna L.

description: SHiiit!!!!  I have tried four of there  many burgers and EVERY ONE has been delicious. What more can I say besides a very clean environment which is always a plus they have a very good fries and shake to boot. But don't take my word for it go and enjoy for yourself. Then you can experience the joy of Pearls
author: Merrell D.

description:
I should really hold my tongue and not rave about finding the best burger in the world.  Inevitably, the next day, I'd find a burger just as good or even better burger.  I am embarrassed after screaming my praises, I found one that was equally good.

Yesterday, I had the best burger at Big Mouth.  Today, Big Mouth has to share the title with Pearl's Deluxe Burgers.  The place was quite a bit more sunnier than the divey Big Mouth's.  Silver chairs and pristine tables trump the wooden rickety chairs and table.

Still, it was the burger that meant everything.  I loved Big Mouth, but I also truly loved Pearl's too.  It was a ten napkin burger.  I could have done a commercial for the burger that would put Carl's Juniors to shame.

Big Mouth does have the natural beef without charging extra going for it.  Peal's charges $1.50 more for the natural beef.

I had the Deluxe Burger with Swiss Cheese and Mushrooms (Medium Rare) $6.49

My husband had the Deluxe Burger with American Cheese (Medium) $5.49

We split an order of fries (Large) $2.25

It cost $15.44 for the both of us.  

I asked my husband if he'd like to come here again, and he said yes, if we're in the neighborhood.  When asked which burger was better, he said both Big Mouth and Pearl's was about the same.  They were both EQUALLY good.

Oh well... I guess I'm a fickle kind of girl.  If I'm not with the burger I love, I love the burger I'm with.

Pearl's serves beef burgers, all-natural beef burgers, chicken sandwiches, turkey burgers, hot dogs, salads, and so on...

All the burgers are served with mayo, lettuce, tomato, and onions.

Deluxe Burgers (1/2 lb)
Deluxe $4.99
Deluxe w/ cheese $5.49
Deluxe w/ bacon $5.99
Deluxe w/ bacon & cheese $6.49

Special Burgers $6.95
Mushroom (Grilled mushroom, jack & mayo)
Teriyaki (Mushrooms, teriyaki sauce & mayo) 
Pesto (Basil pesto sauce, jack, mayo & tomato)
The Spicy Sly (Sauteed onions, peppers, spicy sauce, jack)
Phat Bobb (Bacon, onion rings, BBQ sauce, jack & mayo)
Prized Pearl (Bacon, sauteed onions, crumbled bleu cheese & mayo)
The Bomb (Open-faced burger smothered in homemade chili, cheddar & onions)
The Bula Burger (Bacon, Swiss, mayo & spicy pineapple teriyaki sauce)
The King (1/4 lb burger crowned with a hot dog, cheddar & American cheese & thousand island dressing)

Substitute all natural beef patty on any Special Burger for $1.50 more.
Substitute buffalo patty on any Special Burger for $1.50 more.

Chicken
Grilled chicken sandwich $5.50
Teriyaki $6.95
Pesto $6.95
The Spicy Sly $6.95
BBQ $6.95

Turkey burger $4.99

Veggie burgers
Veggie $4.99
w/ cheese $5.49
w/ mushroom & cheese $6.49

Hot dogs
All beef forty niner dogs $3.49

Salads and sides
Garden salad $3.95
Asian chicken salad $7.95
Cobb salad $7.95
Home made chili $3.95
Chili cheese fries $4.50
Fries $2.25
Garlic fries $3.25
Frings $3.25
Onion rings $3.25
Sweet potato fries $3.25

Sodas $1.65
Milkshakes $3.25
Special shakes $3.75
Malts add $.25
Freezes $3.25

The fries are better at Big Mouth's, and at Big Mouth's, the shakes are made with Mitchell's ice cream.

Anyway, like I said about Big Mouth's, no more even thinking about 
Joe's Cable Car Restaurant
Starvin Marvin's (I know why they're starving)
Gunter's
The Bashful Bull
The Burger Joint
Nation's
Beep's
Whiz Burgers
Clown Alley
In -n- Out
Fudruckers
Sliders
Barney's
Mel's
author: Priscilla L.

description:
I really wanted to love you, Pearl's.  

The bf and I both wanted a burger and since you are rated number one...it had to be you.  We walked all the way the heck over to your 'hood from lower pac heights.  I showed my commitment to your famous burgers.  We entered to friendly greetings from the employees and decided to take a minute or two to look at the menu.  

And that was when we both saw it...BUGS and lots of 'em.  

They were crawling all over the table under the menu on the wall.  After walking that far, we were starving but this did cause some hesitation.  Still, we ordered and my burger, the mushroom & jack cheeseburger was EXCELLENT.  It was right up there with one of the best burgers I've ever had.  That's why I have to give you four stars even considering the bug situation.  

I want to come back to you but the infestation makes me a little nervous.  Perhaps you could get some bug spray and hose this joint down?  

You are just too damn good to let this be a dealbreaker.
author: Rosie F.

description:
My friend and I quite literally made the "Harold and Kumar go to White Castle" pilgrimage to find this place. It was a rainy and cold Saturday. We had spent the entire day food shopping and I was too exhausted to cook, so my hubbie suggested Pearls. I immediately said yes and we made the trek to Pearls. Now mind you, we don't live that far from Pearls, but it seemed as if that day everything and everybody were trying to stop us from eating Pearls' amazingly tasty burgers. We FINALLY got to the place around 6pm after being out since 11am. We were not disappointed. Sure you have to pay almost $8 per burger and sides and drinks are not included, but it is worth it. (Plus they offer combo meals, but I prefer to order a personalized burger.) 
I had the Phat Bob. I generally tend to think that most burger are average, but this burger was amazing! it comes with heaping portions of BBQ sauce, bacon, mayo, jack cheese and ONION RINGS! The rings were perfectly crisp even after the 15 minute ride home. My friend ordered the King Burger, (1/4 lb patty with a hot dog thousand island, and American cheese, surprisingly good.) We also ordered a side of the Spries. A perfect side of sweet potato fried and french fries, but we could barely eat them because we were so full! A great snack for a Sunday afternoon. 
You can order to go and I would definitely recommend this place. they pack your burger in a sturdy carrying case for to-go orders and the staff is very friendly. Two thumbs up!
author: Antoinette C.

description:
greedy little monster that i am, i got sweet potato fries, onion rings, and garlic fries. all really tasty, though not my perfect fry (shoestring, that is). However--there is some batter business on the fries which were delightful, the garlic was pleasantly strong, and the onion rings were crunchy and one of the best.

the burger itself; i got a phat bob. it does not come with onions, tomatoes, lettuce--though it does come with a massive patty that threatened my heart (in an arrhythmia sort of way, mostly). too big for me to eat in one meal. 

it does reheat well--and adding in the regular burger toppings -- with the onion ring, bacon, cheese, and bbq sauce, i was in burger heaven.

not the very very best burger, but delightful and joy-inducing.
author: Jade L.

description:
Pearl Burger: wow
Gorgeous, giant, meaty, thick,
Juice runs down my arm.
author: Wakako U.

description:
First visit and I like this small place. Good burgers and plenty of good burger topping combos available. 

Don't expect much in customer service, the place is too small and I'd be uptight if I worked there. Not alot of seating, so, if you go, be prepared to wait for seating or take your order to go.
author: Sf S.

description: Even though this is so close to my house, I had never been before. Glad I finally did! Great , huge burgers. Bun was nice and soft. Onion rings, Yum!
author: lisa v.

description:
I was craving a burger and it was decision time - should I go with an old standby* or try some place new? I was feeling a bit sassy and decided to check out Pearl's Deluxe...that decision was made easier by the fact that it's 6 blocks from my house.

There's a lot to like about Pearl's - the food is inexpensive, burgers are made with top quality beef and the staff was extremely friendly. I went with a bacon cheeseburger and a small side of fries. My burger was tasty but cooked a bit too much for my liking - only after I took my first bite did I notice that the menu board said all burgers cooked medium unless requested otherwise so I guess that was my bad. The burger did pack a lot of flavor as well as at least five pounds on my girlish figure. 

Next time I'll request my burger medium rare and go with the infamous sweet potato fries. Hell, if my bulging belly is any indication I might even go with the mini burger instead of the regular. At least my walk home was uphill!

*for the record, my Top 5 burgers can be found at Slow Club, Street, Balboa Cafe, Zuni and Bar Johnny
author: phil h.

description:
How I love the sweet potato fries here! their burgers are simply amazing...their bun is not the normal "soak up the grease" kinda bun. I had the mushroom burger and the prized pearl burger...um, of course not at once! I might be a greedy eater...but even I have my limit...well, my tummy has! If I could...I would just eat and eat. =) 

overall...I would come back here! Especially since my friend only lives a block away!
author: V N.

description:
Their sweet potato fries are crinkle cut now.

I'm not sure how I feel about that.
author: Marsha Z.

description: I ordered a medium rare bacon cheese burger and it was so juicy I had to use 20 napkins to soak up the love. My burger was medium well, which got me a little tweaked. I have no problem saying it was a very good burger and I'll be back for more.
author: Tom A.

description: Is it possible to eat a million calories? The answer is yes! This place has killer burgers and fries.  The nutella shake put it over the top and the staff is nice too. Totally coming back to this place. A local, no frills, chill place with great food.
author: Michael S.

description:
What does one eat on a rainy Friday night after ingesting large quantities of red wine?  Burgers, of course!  

The very tiny space that is Pearl's Burgers served us delicious burgers and fries (sweet potato fries even!) that exactly hit the spot.  Not too expensive, large portions and fountain sodas - exactly what a neighborhoody burger joint should be.  And, to top it off, clean restrooms!
author: Suzanne B.

description: This is an excellent burger joint.  Tiny little shop.  Delicious burger.  Add a little salt and pepper on the deluxe and deluxe with cheese.  The shakes are worth it too!
author: Jim L.

description: My g/f and I went to Pearl's Burgers for lunch yesterday and this place was da Bomb.  I had a Phat Bob (no cheese for me) and my g/f had a Prized Pearl.  Both burgers were just enough, not too much.  One of my tests is always, "does the burger work without cheese".  Yes.  We also had an order of half fries and half onion rings.  I think these onion rings were the best I've ever had.  The fries are also lightly battered and taste sooo good.  I think this place might be a "cop hangout" but only for those in the know; regardless, cops or no cops I would definitely go here again and/or recommend this place to a friend.
author: Zofeone D.

description:
New year's day 2010 my husband was craving a burger...all day...so after wondering around in the rain all day we decided to yelp it...so glad we did. Pearl's was as amazing as the reviews said. Not a fancy place at all...but well worth it! I think they have the most incredible onion rings I have ever had in my life...wow! I had a the spicy sly chicken sandwich...and be ready...it's spicy...but yum! Smothered with bell peppers and onions and some kind of delicious secret spicy sauce...
My hubby had the Bula burger (Kobe beef with pineapple teriyaki...their award winning burger)...he was in heaven! 

After we were both stuffed and insanely satisfied! Love this place! Service was great! Food was A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!
author: Danielle H.

description: AaaaaaaaaammmmmaZZZing. I'm all about antibiotic-free beef formed into fab delish patties, perfectly ripe tomato slices, fresh green lettuce (the ONLY place that is actually kind enough to leave out that terrible white part of the leaf), soft fluffy bread, and just mmm mmmmmm mmmm mmmmmmm!!!! I'm a huge fan of the mini burger (1/4 lb). However, I haven't had much luck with their fries... they were a little undercooked. Also, the burger cooked at medium was too bloody for me ( and I'm a gal that likes her ribeye medium rare), so the second time around I got it medium well and it was purrrrrfect-- hawt and just un poco pinko-desu.
author: Natasha P.

description:
HOLY SHIT.

This is the best burger I've ever had.  And I've eaten three burgers a day for the past 98980185 years.  I'm pretty much a burger expert - I got my fucking ph'd in burgers.

The Phat Bob was pretty hot and tempting as the name implies.  I'm going to need a triple bypass after eating it.  And it's totally worth it.

Basically with this place now on my radar I'm well on my way to morbid obesity.
author: Evan L.

description:
My wife and I were recently in SF, suffering from jet lag (we live on the east coast) we wanted to just grab something quick to eat on our way back to the hotel after a day of being a tourist.  She said she wanted a burger, so I yelp'ed for the best burger place neat my hotel, Pearl's was the answer.

So walked over, and holy cow, the minute I walked in the door I started drooling, the smell was glorious.  I had a great burger, the phat bob.  Nicely cooked, huge patty, very, very tasty.  I also got a peanut-butter chocolate milkshake which was fantastic. 

My wife had changed her mind after seeing how big the burgers were, and got the grilled cheese.  Big mistake.  It's cheese on a hamburger bun.  Not good, at all.  But she had burger envy after getting that, and seeing mine, and got a burger of her own, which she said was great.

I would definitely recommend, and will be going back before leaving SF.  Just avoid the grilled cheese.
author: Michael G.

description: Ordering and receiving my food was snappy. The food was pretty good though I only had the buffalo burger. The shakes looks tempting but I saved that for another time. Seating is a bit tight here. Found out that you could save seats by calling in ahead of time.
author: Louis T.

description:
Shatangi was treated to a Deluxe Phat Bobb (shut up chewie!!) by j o (shut up chewie!!). A very tasty burger!! The thick-cut bacon and crunch of the onion rings made for a textural delight. It had just the right amount of cheese as well. The frings, I could have done without. The fries were the standard cheap restaurant variety and the onion rings although tasty on the burger, were a flop on their own. I'll try the sweet potato fries next time. I would be remiss to not comment on the excellent service we received. The staff was very friendly and efficient. They made us feel very welcome to be there.

Shatangi told you...
author: Njon W.

description: One of the best burger places in town!!!  Amazing burgers, shakes and onion rings.  The price is right on target you will get full belly without denting your wallet to bad.  My fav is the bacon and blue cheese burger it will not disappoint!!
author: Ben S.

description:
Pearl, how I love you.

This place is so close to my house I can justify going whenever the craving strikes.  The burgers are delicious and even though I don't like onions, the onion rings are tasty.  It's fairly affordable, friendly and warm.   Mmm... strawberry shake...

I, uh, gotta go.  I have to do...something.
author: Pirate M.

description:
Really, really, really good burgers.  If I'm in the mood for meat, this place makes me smile.  Still not better than Shake Shack in NY but it sure is better than In n Out. 

Garlic fries and shakes are pretty lip smackin' as well.
author: Virginia L.

description:
My sweet potato fries were a bit dry and overcooked but my turkey burger was thick juicy awesomeness. I must admit that I ducked in here after a session of acupuncture. Just that tempting. . . .
*le sigh*
author: Kia B.

description: Great burger for the price.  When you're in the mood for a big, juicy cheeseburger, you can't go wrong here.  If you leave hungry, you did something terribly wrong.
author: Melanie B.

description: i enjoy a good burger from time to time. pearl's is the spot. the deluxe burgers are too big for me to finish, but the mini deluxe is perfect. and i love that you can order their specialty burgers in a smaller size too. it's a really small spot, but if you wait around, there should be a table open by the time your food is done. either way, its a tasty little burger joint.
author: Xochi S.

description: This little gem is delicious but getting there can be a bit sketchy. The food is a bit over priced but the burgers, spries and nutella milkshake is scrumptious. I have been there many times, and have always had a strange experience around the restaurant. I have witnessed fights almost happen and a lot of yelling both in an outside of the store. There are a lot of sketchy people inside and outside of the restaurant but the food is yummy, but not the best burger ever.
author: Gretchen S.

description:
OMG, Pearl's is seriously amazing.  The day after my birthday I was really craving something greasy and delicious.  I wanted a hearty burger, not something from Burger King or McDonalds, something with some personality.   Pearls was my savior that day.  I went burger crazy ordering Garlic Fries, a Cookies & Cream shake, and the Phat Bobb burger.  Everything was amazing and surprisingly reasonable.  I really overdid it though, the burgers are huge, as are the shakes and servings of fries.  

My Phat Bobb burger was perfectly medium rare, tender and juicy.  I kinda felt like I was in one of those Carl's Jr. commercials, with all the huge burger dripping down...get this burger!  The bacon is crisp and flavorful and the BBQ sauce and onion rings are amazing.  The Garlic Fries were tasty, not as good as the ones from Gordon Biersch, but definitely loaded with chopped garlic and delicious with some dipping ketchup.  The Shakes are huge, so watch...try the specialty flavors.

Pearl's is so good.  You might have to wait a bit for your order, but rest assured it will be worth it.
author: Katherine C.

description:
Is it cool that I start my review Awwww Sheeeeeed! 

I love a good burger and a good Turkey burger and I'll sneak in a beef burger once in a while.  I've been to a few burger spot in my time but Pearl's is by far the best! Now that make Joe's Cable Car like a distant 2nd or 3rd when I finally make my burger list. 

Oh my goodness and the chili cheese fries are way better than the ones at Nation's and I think its the chili that makes the difference. Well it could be that they cook the fries longer as well. I was glad to try another sample but then I would had to buy a basket . 

I'm not to sure what was so about this Turkey Burger but it touched my soul. No really it touched my SOUL. I was at piece with the Universe and my taste buds for about 30 minutes and those damn fries just made the experience complete.  

For someone that wants to lose wieght Pearls can be very addicting and I think I'm going through withdrawal pain right now and need a fix!
author: Karim R.

description: Ooh baby, that was a good burger. I got something with blue cheese (bleu? I never know...) and bacon and oh man, that bacon was real and the blue cheese (bleu?) was messy. I would like another one right now. There are huge chunks of garlic on the garlic fries. My husband got the buffalo burger, which was good, although I wish buffalo had a bit more of a distinct taste just so you feel like you're getting your $15 worth :) My burger was $9, I think. Overall, with his $15 buffalo burger, my burger, two drinks, and a large order of garlic fries, we spent $34, which was more than we imagined, but I didn't regret it. I definitely want to go back and try more of their burgers. We went for dinner at about 6:30 on a Monday and even though the place is tiny (about five tables) we got a spot to sit. I suppose Mondays probably aren't super busy, but they had a fairly steady stream of people coming in and out.
author: Erin A.

description:
I went back again and tried a buffalo burger with swiss, bacon, tomato, lettuce, and avocado. It was a very nice size, had a good appearance, and tasted pretty good too (although the bacon was a little bit fatty in that kind of parts-of-it-get-chewy-and-stretchy-so-you-can't-bite-through-it way).

I still wouldn't call it a landmark destination or anything, but I'm certainly willing to improve my rating of the place.
author: James L.

description:
Let me begin by saying that this place is a lifesaver on weekends. A hot juicy burger at 1 in the morning is something you can only rejoice to. A great place for friends to get together and eat hot, juicy, and succulent patties. As prudent as I usually am about food choices on the menu, EVERYTHING is good on the menu- from the oddly Delicious shakes to the garlicky familar taste of the fries- But seriously folks, a great place. 

         Price wise, a little pricey burgers, but quality simply makes you forget about the money you spent on a fattening, yet heart-warming piece of meat. Shakes are awesome, fries are great, and the burgers tended to give me homicidal thoughts when someone said that pearl's "sucked." 


Food 5/5
Price 4/5
Atmosphere 4.5/5


P.S  not in the best of neighborhoods , so if you are gona go latenight dining , go in groups or with a friend :D

P.S.S UNLIMITED PICKLES.
author: Jimmy K.

description: Good food. Had mini Tuscan, fries and Oreo Shake. All good with fast, friendly service. It's not cheap. Almost $15 for those 3 items. Worth a visit.
author: Will W.

description:
This place is awesome.  Never heard of it until my friends took me there.  The food there is absolutely delicious.  I wish it wasn't so because I must've consumed almost 2500 calories.

I ordered the mushroom burger, an order of Spries, and a mint oreo milkshake.  Mushroom burger was kind of sloppy but that's what you get with mushrooms.  Very flavorful and the portion was huge.  Spries, sweet potato fries and regular fries.  The sweet potato's fries were delicious but their regular fries were just regular.  Next time I'll get the Springs, sweet potato fries and onion rings.  The mint oreo milkshake was, OMG, awesome.  Way too good.  They have mini versions and I should've gotten that.  But for some reason I was afraid that the mini would be too small.  But at 1/4 lb the mini isn't so mini.  The regular is 1/2 lb.

The pricing was good.  I can definitely see myself coming here again and I will.  

I gave it 4 stars because the place is kind of small and if it were a busy day there would be no way to get a table.  But other than that they're great.

I heard they were taping a special for the food network the following day at the Shoreline.  I bet once that episode airs this place is going to blow up.
author: Benjamin H.

description: Tonight my first time there as I just moved in down the street.   All I can say is "sweet"!!!!!   My new favorite place! -Michael on Post
author: Michael I.

description:
Small compared to the one in Mill Valley and doesn't feel as homey.  Didn't seem to have quite the same shake variety as well.  

BURGER - Was a little worried about the bacon after some reviews, but it was excellent, as was the Phat Bob Mini I had.  Tasty!

ATMO - stale

FINE
I'll probably save my Pearl outings for my Marin trips.
author: Dan M.

description: I've been planning on eating here since before I moved to the neighborhood, yet somehow almost two months passed before I managed to make it in. Obviously I'm a person of refined tastes when a burgers and hot dogs are high on my list of to dos. So tonight was my first time in. I ordered a burger and fries too because I remember hearing good things on yelp, and they were pretty solid. A little too much salt for my tastes.  This burger was awesome and so far best I've had in the neighborhood. I will definitely return to purchase their wares in the future.
author: Patrick B.

description:
A carnivore's paradise. These burgers are the bomb, find your comfort in the food! Great grilled juicy ground beef patties with all the fixin's to your liking (not pre-frozen hockey pucks).  It's hard to leave unsatisfied. Large variety of burgers to choose from.  Cute classic 50's era diner setting, friendly neighborly staff. Parking in the area is brutal, but take a bus in and walk from Union Square, you'll be glad you did.  Comfort food packaged with a comfortable pricing you'll definitely want to come back!

And yes you can arrange fries to go with that shake!

UPDATE: 5/21/07
just a lilttle FYI If you make the trek out here on a Sunday
I was craving a meat fix on a lovely afternoon only to be disappointed to see this place CLOSED SUNDAYS :(
author: B H.

description:
Wowsers.  Now that was probably the best turkey burger I've ordered in the city thus far.  The sweet potato fries were awesome goodness  and cooked perfectly.  The chocolate banana shake was just the right thickness and masterfully blended.

Do not order the onion rings or regular fries - go with the sweet potato fries.  Or if you feel the need to try them, order a half and half basket.  The portion sizes are pretty substantial, so only add a shake to your meal if you're REALLY hungry, and also, the basket of fries can definitely be split between two people.   Prices were reasonable, staff was friendly and helpful, and although the place is small, the diner-like details are cool.  Let's just say it's a good thing I don't live in the neighborhood, cause I'd be here at least once every week.  Except on Sunday -- but only because they're closed on Sundays.

They also serve buffalo meat here for an additional $1.50.  I'm not a huge fan of buffalo, but I was tempted to try it here after reading the fact sheet on the wall.  Supposedly, buffalo has less cholesterol, calories, and fat than the same serving of beef, fish, or chicken.  Also buffalo/bison are the only mammals known not to develop cancer.  Other buffalo facts listed on their wall:
    
1.   Bison does NOT taste wild like game meats. It DOES taste like the finest quality beef that you remember from your childhood.
    
2.   Bison is the only red meat that is non-allergenic.
    
3.   Bison was the main diet of the Plains Indians who:

      a. never had cancer
      b. never had heart disease or heart attacks
      c. lived to be 85 or 90 years old AND, scientists speculate, would  
          have  lived to be 125 with adequate dental care.
    
4.   Eating 5oz of bison, 3-4 times per week can help most people reduce LDL cholesterol 40 to 45% over a 6-month period.
    
5.   Bison has 40% more protein than beef so you can eat 1/3 less volume and still come away satisfied.

http://www.americangourmet.net/healthy-buffalo.html
author: LaSha G.

description:
Seriously delicious burgers, seriously good fries and shakes.  Seriously so full right now that I am seriously considering throwing up.  

Noticed too late that they offer mini versions of their seriously delicious burgers.  Next time I will go that route ... seriously.
author: Katrina V.

description:
After the person I was with told me he was craving a burger I knew just the place to take him - Pearl's Deluxe Burgers.  It was a quick walk down post, through the TL, but well worth it.  I ordered the Phat Bob and he ordered the one under it with Blue cheese or something.  Both were DELICIOUS.  Almost perfect.  In my book the bacon wasn't crispy enough so make sure you ask them to cook it how you like it.  Onion rings were delicious.

I am a straw connoisseur and the straws they have for their shakes are amazing.  Nice big thick ones.

Minus 1 star for their super soggy sweet potato fries which was something I looked forward to for the entire walk over there.

Otherwise - definitely one of the best burgers in the city!  Oh, and they now have mini versions (which I will be getting next time) if the regular size is too big.
author: Gemma S.

description: BEST BURGER ON EARTH! and its right here in SF! holllaaa! The staff is super friendly and helpful! I dont remember exactly what I ordered but it was the shit for sure! and apparently Bobby Flay ate here! pretty cool! Huge burger too, for a fairly cheap price! their garlic fries are pretty darn tasty too!
author: Alina R.

description:
OK so I've been back to Pearl's twice now and have to update my review.  Both of the last two times have been perfect.  While I could go for a thicker patty, I'll save that for elsewhere.  Here the burgers are tasty, well cooked (in the sense that they cook it the right temperature and understand medium rare).  Also the onion rings are still not all cooked well but they are nicely spiced and some of the better rings I've had in the city.

So with all that they get a shiny updated five stars - thanks Pearl's!
author: Gene X.

description: Similar to hairstylists, I'm hesitant to switch burger places. Pearl's Deluxe Burgers are simply phenomenal -- the best SF has to offer in this department. When friends visit town, I take them here and many have said they're the best burgers they've ever tasted. Get ready for big, filling, and juicy goodness.
author: Damian E.

description: Some of the best burgers and fries around. This place doesn't skimp on the key ingredients like cheese, mayo, and avocado. When you're craving a big ole messy bite of fast food indulgence, this is your place.
author: Ryan L.

description: This place is phenomenal! The service was excellent and the food was even better! I will definitely be returning over and over again:)
author: Galina H.

description:
Pearl's is a gem hidden in the tenderloin/nob hill neighborhood. The two or three times I've eaten here, my friend & I were lucky enough to grab the "window seat" so we could people watch while munching on their bomb ass burgers! Last night, we found parking one block away and saw a real live pimp and his hoe! And, when we were almost done with our meal, a bum came up to the open window and asked if we wanted to buy a ring! No thanks, man, just let me get back to my good eats. 

Last night's meal was right under $40 bucks for: 
-avocado chicken burger (moist, fresh tasting) 
- buffalo deluxe burger (my friend LOVED it) 
- springs (a mix of sweet potato fries & onion rings. Pearl's is the only place with this awesome combo.) 
- banana shake (kind of tasteless, wish I'd gone for a chocolate shake instead) 
- blueberry shake (that one was tasty) 

Pearl's has limited seating, even if you come in later at night. This place is always busy, but mostly people get their burgers to-go. 

I wonder what characters I will encounter on my next trip to Pearl's...
author: Fancypants X.

description:
I got the mini-burger with cheddar cheese and avocado (for an extra dollar).  SO GOOD!  Don't be fooled - mini is still 1/4 lb. patty and it is the perfect size as to not make you feel like death after eating.  Avocados were very fresh and kept slipping out of my burger but definitely worth it.

Spries on the other hand, were lacking in the sweet potato part (though the few sweet potato fries were quite delicious).  The ratio was quite horrendous.
author: Lydia W.

description: This place was amazing! A huge burger with all sorts of fun toppings (A HOT DOG ON A HAMBURGER PEOPLE) and the most delicious of milkshakes :) I would happily go back if I ever found my way back to San Francisco.
author: Jessica S.

description:
burger of classic to neo-contemporary construction....serving up standard mayo, lettuce, tomatoe & onion filler....while providing "special" offerings of spicy sly, bula & bomb (plus).....likes of grilled to order burger, turkey, chicken o' veggie.....pearl's showing effort to please...finding saucy wet spicy sly a bit difficult to handle by sesame seed buns alone....destruction~! and aid of fork and knife....

disappointment in fries and onion rings the only negative....thin faint onion ring batter excellent...but thin string slivers of onion cuts...and fries..well..just fries.....thinking "fring" a waste..

well..well..well..milkshakes...the "special" a must...banana~!...consistency, texture, flavor 'n' all....best tasted to date.....burger and shake.....and pearl's won't disappoint.....
author: Hen A.

description:
Their mini-burgers are awesome! I'm not sure if they changed their patties or what not, but when we ordered burgers from Pearl's this week it wasnt as "greasy" as it used to be- i guess that's a good thing but their onion rings were super greasy, yet very delicious.

I tried their turkey burger for the first time and it was a bit dry...i think i'll stick to their regular burgers from now on :)
author: M W.

description: This is one great burger place. The burgers are juicy and flavourful. The fries are crisp and coated with a very light batter. I'm not a big fan of dressed burgers but the few that I tried were so good that they could change my mind.
author: Alfred L.

description:
Have I died and gone to burger heaven. I am writing this as my belly comprehends what I have just took in. I had the Phat Bob (bacon, jack cheese, onion ring, and BBQ sauce burger), onion rings, chili cheese fries, Oreo mint shake, and garlic fries. I AM SO FULL and IT WAS SOOOO DAMN GOOD! I also took a Prized Pearl burger (bacon, sauteed onions, and crumbled bleu cheese) to go and I bet it will be just as good. I LOVE YOU PEARL! I will be wearing your burgers on my thighs!

UPDATE 1/29/07 : -2 stars to my burger the other night. My burger was more than a tad oily (more like dipped in oil and then handed to me) and was just plain awful! The only thing I can tell that was different were the cooks. The first few times I went in there was an older white guy on the grill and the burgers were great. We go in the other night and it's a latin man. So maybe it's the cook, but he is awful! Where's my white cook at? What days are you in so I know when to come?!
author: Christina B.

description:
AMAZING BURGERS.

My friend told me about this place and we finally just go to going. Sat down and shared two burgers - a regular cheese & the Phat Bob.
BBQ sauce deliciousness & a burger made right!

The meat tasted amazing. The burgers hit the spot perfectly and the sweet potato fries were a God-send. 

I can go on and on, but you must go try it for yourself.
In fact, I think I'm going again tomorrow.

FRIGGIN' DELICIOUS.
author: Sloane W.

description:
SO TASTY! Drippy, buffaloey, tasty, lip smackingly and finger lickingly good. And tasty shakes, too!

Sadly, not enough seats there to enjoy mah meal! 

I took a foodie friend I was trying to hit on there. He quite enjoyed himself. :)
author: Chris Y.

description:
I just put in a review for In-N-Out -- OK burgers, not great. Pearls, on the other hand -- that's where great burgers are found.

The standard burgers are great on their own, and Pearl's offers a bunch of special burger topping combos (recommendations: pesto, spicy sly, but really, just get what sounds good). They also serve buffalo (err, bison)... so, so, so tasty -- they'll cook it to order, and it's lower in calories and cholesterol than beef -- heck, it's almost nutritious!

Be sure to get some fries with your burger. If you like garlic, get the garlic fries. And they serve milkshakes here in a bunch of crazy flavors (Black Forest, did I read that right?!?). I hear they're delicious, but I haven't been able to justify it. I mean, I just finished a huge burger and a large side of fries. But one day.

Problem: they're closed on Sundays. And what a bummer sometimes -- let's say you've been watching football all afternoon, enjoying some beers, and now you've got a hunger within. A delicious burger would be so awesome right about now -- but wait! Dammit! oh god why!?!

alas.
author: Chris M.

description:
Pearl's probably has the best pre-frozen patty burger that I've ever had.  Unfortunately it's still a pre-frozen patty and as such Pearl's will be subject to the standard three star limit.  I should knock them down another star for not living up to my expectations for a "deluxe" burger joint  but their peanut butter chocolate milkshake saved them in that regard.  

For those of you raving about the sweet potato fries... give it a rest. They're just the same frozen OreIda fries that you can get at Safeway.

Also, the dining room was crowded and cramped with college students who wouldn't have known the difference between a good burger and a dog shit sandwhich.  Not that the burgers tasted like dogshit... I'm just saying.
author: dan d.

description:
The burgers are awesome and delicious. More importantly, they are CONSISTENTLY awesome and delicious. Alaways gonna rule when you go to Pearl's.

I usually get the turkey burger with avocado and cheddar. Lots of avocado on there, probably half of the damn thing finds its way to my burger. The turkey's always good, never dry. Frings are always the accompaniment, and they're real onion rings, not some frozen Sysco bullshit.

If I had to complain, I'd say that a full slice of red onion is a bit too much for a burger. But I always take off the oinion anyway, no matter how much or how little, and any place that errs on the side of giving you too much food is awesome on principle. 

This is all that needs said, really. Perfect burgers, whenever however, and what else could you need to know?
author: That Was A Good Drum Break ..

description: This is LITERALLY my first yelp review, created the account and everything just to espouse how AWESOME this joint is. Hearty and damn tasty burgers with multiple combos that feature a mix of regular fries, sweet potato, and onion rings. I happened to meet the owner on my way out and told her I'm making this my regular lunch spot. You should do the same.
author: Troy J.

description:
Was heading back home hungry and decided that I wanted a burger.  None other than Pearl's was open and close to where I was at the time.

I got the staple: Chedder Cheeseburger with Bacon cooked medium rare with Garlic Fries.  I was surprised to find the burger was actually cooked perfectly.  The burger was awesome!  

Now onto the Kobe beef burger with onion rings...
author: John M.

description: Holy mother of all greasy DELICIOUS burgers. They put a friggin hot dog on my hamburger! Huh? Delightful.
author: Brian G.

description: If you want a good burger in SF, this place will give it to you.  Burgers are excellent.  Sweet potato fries are also excellent, you have to eat those.  There are other good burger places but this one always satisfies!
author: Eileen L.

description: So After several trips to Pearls and trying several different burgers I am ready for a review. First the burgers, the special burgers are great especially the Phat BOB, Awesome! But if you get just a regular pearl deluxe you can tell there is not a lot of flavor in the meat, which makes the burgers just ordinary and not memorable. The fries, there regular fries aren't good not crispy enough and undercooked it seems, the sweet potato fried were great and the Onion Rings are AWESOME! Their milkshakes are delicious and go well with anything you get here. So in all unless your going to add Buffalo Meat or Kobe meat(for a nominal fee) the burgers really aren't anything special.
author: Sean C.

description:
Oh, a soft wind blows across the road as I head into Pearl's at the ungodly early hour of 4pm with two friends. One of our party was seriously jonesing for a Chocolate shake from Pearl's (they give you the bubble tea diameter straws) and the other two of us, had eaten 3 hours before but were pulled in by the mythical status of Pearl's burgers (which, incidentally, aren't so mythical on Sunday when they are closed).

So we arrived and there was a couple other people in the joint. They had their 100 health inspection front and center (and no bugs clearly visible) so we saddled on over to to the counter and proceeded to stuff our faces in the most gluttonous of Augustus Gloop manners. My "impaired" friend nearly fell into the 6 inch diameter straw of his tasty chocolate milk shake. His onion rings were notable, while the fries where just aight.

But you don't care about that, you wanna know about the burger.
Overall, 7.5/10 on THE burger list ranking.
Burger: Cooked medium rare Meyer beef. Nice size, but a little more greasy than I prefer.
Bun: White Bun, but had nice firmness and held up against a big burger.
Toppings: I ordered Cheddar and Grilled Onions. Which were both fine, although the cheddar didn't have the bite that I was looking for. Still, good. The burger also came with mayo, lettuce, and tomato ALREADY on it. I didn't know this, and generally would prefer to have none of those things on my burger. They put it on the bottom of the burger, so you don't know about it, until you pick the meaty goodness up.  
Sides: The onion rings were good, very mealy. The fries were alright, but it must be noted that they were the only things that remained uneaten on the table when we finished.

Final Analysis: This is the best "Diner" burger that I have had in town. I would watch out to make sure they don't put any toppings on that you specifically don't want, but they do a good job.  And, at $6.50, it is a very reasonable burger, especially compared to what you get at Burgermeister and Polkers.
author: Matt C.

description:
Oh my GAWD! Get the sweet potatoe fries! I ordered the onion rings for my burger and my girlfriend got the sweet potato fries. Her order came out first and curious, I have the fries a bite and I said "Fuck yea, I love these fries" out loud. *Allegedly*
My order came out next and guess what I got instead of onion rings....Sweet Potato Fries.
As the server brought out my order he realized I wanted onion rings not fried, but I said "Its okay my friend, I like the sweet potato fries better." And that was how I averted a meltdown.
author: Harry B.

description:
EXCELLENT BURGERS. I was thoroughly suprised at how well the burger was cooked. Just right, medium rare! The sweet potato fries were delish as well! I didn't notice the Kobe beef option in time to get it in my order but I will for sure. 
I've always heard my friends telling me I should go here.. Now I know why. This place's burgers are seriously worth the 20 minutes you need extra to find parking around the neighborhood on a weeknight. Even though I had grease drippings all over me and the table I felt fully accomplished for some reason.
Great burgers!! I will def become an addict of Pearl's!!
author: Eric A.

description:
best garlic fries ever ! hamburgers are good , but kobe beef hamburgers are fantastic add in one of their custom milkshakes and it's like one of the old dinner hamburger joints with attitude . it's pricey but worth it 24.00 for everything  , but worth it . 
it was  delicious
author: Steve M.

description: Late night and you got the munchies? Stop here and get a shake and cheese fries. We had the peanut butter chocolate shake at may have been one of the best things I have ever eaten/drank in SF. We ordered garlic fries with cheese, blue cheese and that was also heavenly (but oh so naughty). All this talk makes me write to find a close location and go for a drive! Pearl's, here I come.
author: stacie s.

description:
I'll be honest, the prices are a little more than what I'd like to spend on a burger and fries - but they are so good and filling it's totally worth it! 

The milkshakes are amazing. I recommend the mint!!!
author: Rachel C.

description:
FYI- you can order a Mini of any of the regular beef burgers, and this small girl with a giant's appetite needs to mini any burger here.  My man eats 3-5 burgers a week and this is one of his top sf picks.  Since it's in our neighborhood we eat here regularly.  You can upgrade to kobe beef or buffalo and that is a delicious decision as well, but I'd only go for the buffalo if you like your meat on the rarer side, because above MR on that lean of beef is a bit dry).  Other delicious decisions include the malt and milshakes.  Sweet potato fries are delish. Regular fries ok.  

Downsides: The garlic fries are like a handful of crushed garlic thrown in a clump with the fries.  The atmosphere is not comfortable.
author: Dina A.

description: Go! Enough said. One of my all time favorite burger places. Still working myself through the menu. I know it's small, but the service is quick and the food is awesome.
author: Robert S.

description:
I wanted to like the milkshake, really I did. You all said such wonderful things about them and I like milkshakes. A lot. Unfortunately, I was disappointed. I ordered a chocolate shake, like I do at any new milkshake joint. Yes, it was thick. Yes, they give you a big straw with which to suck up said thick shake. However, it had that off-putting sweetness that I associate with soft-serve or cheap ice cream. Sad pants. Oh well, it's not like there aren't other places out there. 

P.S. Perhaps another flavor would have been better (I've been told that the Oreo is good), but I base all of my milkshake reviews on plain old chocolate, so that's the way it's going to be.

Milkshake scale: Some of the boys to the yard. (http://www.yelp.com/list_details?list_id=quuUwlD01pr7A2ilWll59g)
author: Katie I.

description:
It's not exactly a Zuni burger, but it is pretty good.  It's extra good if you have a hangover and need some serious grease.  Or if you are a "fancy toppings" kind of burger person; they have loads of choices as to how you can have your burger made.  

The milk shakes are really good, especially the chocolate.
author: Amme P.

description:
Do you have a mad craving for a burger?  One that is perfectly cooked, made from fresh ingredients, disgustingly messy and delicious?  Stop searching Yelp, turn off your computer, grab a light jacket (one that you don't mind getting grease dribbles on) but leave your calorie-counting self at home, and head directly to Pearl's Deluxe.  

The place is most definitely nothing fancy.  It's a burger joint, and it looks and smells like it.  The menu is substantial with about a dozen specialty burgers (and options to get either a buffalo or an organic beef patty), all of which looked great.  Then there are, of course, fries (sweet potato and standard Idaho spud) and milkshakes.  

I kept it simple on the burger and got the most basic option: beef patty, lettuce, onion, tomato on a sesame seed bun.  Then, I added the sweet potato fries and a blueberry milkshake.  Pure gluttony, baby.  The friendly man behind the counter took my order and in about 5 minutes I was a happy carnivore.  I'd recommend sharing the fries, but keep the milkshake to yourself; it's incredible.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Eric S.

description:
Decent burgers, and I am parital to their onion rings.   The fries lack a lot, somehow.  The main problem is that they are overpriced, for how good they are.   Burger and rings runs about $11.  You can get the basic burger for ~7, a bit less, and skip the fries.

The special burgers are messy, and the buns are too weak to handle them.  Basically they just start to fall apart, squirt out the back, etc.  Feels like shoddy construction =)  Eat it fast, without putting it down!

The one in mill valley is supposed to be legendary, according to the old timers who recommended it, and I went there first.  The two are just the same for me.
