Decent burgers, nothing super special, but a good place. Will go back with friends but wouldn't be a destination.
author: Andrew W.

description: Each time, I just keep asking myself, Why?  The regular burger is not that tasty. Meh says it all.
author: Melissa G.

description:
After reading all the positive reviews, i had to give this place a try. 

I just don't get it. The food was not that good. Ordered a cheeseburger and the sweet potato fries.  The burger was overcooked and dry. The fries were over cooked and hard.  

I should have listened to the person who said In-N-Out is much better. I truly agree with that statement.
author: Dilly M.

description: Doesn't look like much from the outside, was recommended by the hotel. They have awesome burgers, the greasy, messy kind like they should be! Great fries, great prices, great service! Will definitely return next time im in San Francisco!
author: Michael K.

description: Im giving this a 3 today for 2  reasons.  1. Right here on the front of their page it says for the month of april mention you saw them on yelp and receive a small french fry or small soda Free! AND THEY WOULDNT HONOR IT! Saying it was a mistake?? Even after the couple who walked in behind me said they just saw it on yelp and  SHOWED THEM ON THEIR IPHONE and  they still didnt honor it  WTF! 2. 3/4 through my MED-WELL Deluxe with Bacon it became a VERY RARE DELUXE WITH BACON I ask again WTF? Dam shame  because it started out as DAM GOOD BURGER!
author: Damone G.

description: Definitely one of my all time favorite joints for burgers. They are BIG, JUICY, and so delicious. I also like that you can get a smaller portion too because trust me their burgers are HUGE.
author: Annie L.

description:
As an out-of-towner with no clue where to eat within walking distance of my hotel, I jumped on Yelp to assist in my dinner decision. =)

We only had to go 2 blocks to get to Pearl's and at 8:30pm it was packed. The seating area is definitely small, but it doesn't take long for people to finish eating and give you a seat. I assume most people live close enough to pick up to-go orders.

I ordered a mini deluxe burger (1/4 pound) with cheddar cheese -- it was delicious! Along with my small order of sweet potato fries = YUM! My husband ordered a deluxe burger (1/2 pound) with cheddar with a side order of frings (1/2  french fries & 1/2 onion rings). He was definitely full after his large meal but really enjoyed it. 

We grabbed shakes to go. I got a pineapple shake -- very yummy! And my husband got his usual, an oreo shake -- he really liked it. =)

Though we opted not to, for $1 more you can upgrade your burger to Free Range Grass Fed Beef.
author: Shastina O.

description: Pretty good the third time I went in as the food was well prepared and cooked just how I liked it.
author: D B.

description:
Wow, that was one awesome Kobe Burger! It was so fresh and yummy!!! Best I think I ever had it. I definitely will come back here and have another one and try other stuff here!
That burger was so memorable! Enough said!!!!
author: Leon C.

description:
Being a burger lover, I had to try this place out after hearing so much about it...setting was a basic hole in the wall, which is typical/ fitting for any burger joint...
Fries were great, i love how they were more fried than your typical french fries... for the burger I got the Phat Bob, which was basically a western bacon cheeseburger (BBQ sauce and onion rings)...burger was good but nothing really stood out above the burger place...I guess maybe I was expecting more from what I've heard... I'll definitely go back next time I'm in the area, as I really want to try the Kobe beef burger...
author: Joe K.

description:
After moving to the San Francisco area a month ago, I was struggling to find a decent burger place. Last Saturday, after going to Pearl's, my search ended. This place has the best burgers I've had in the area.

It's small (like, 5 couples could eat there at a time) and unique, making it a cool place to people new to the city. Plus it's not expensive and close to some great bars. 

You gotta try it, otherwise you're missing out.
author: Kevin S.

description:
1.5 blocks from my house.
Sweet potato french fries.
Peanut butter milkshakes.
Really nice staff.
Good burgers.
Sweet potato french fries.

ya know?
author: Kimberly K.

description:
I found out that there was a late night burger joint near my apartment and put it on my must do list.  I went on friday night 5 minutes before they close at 2 am.  The manager, Jim, was super friendly and not at all annoyed that we were there so late.  

Then I noticed the sign on the wall proclaiming the use of grass-fed beef.  I have a soft spot for pasture raised meats, and Jim was more than happy to explain all the dietary habits of the animals we were about to consume.

Then I got home and sank my dentures into what may possibly be the best bbq bacon cheeseburger of my life.  The burger had flavor.  The bacon was thick and smoky.  The sesame seed bun was of substance, quality, and very fresh.  

Well done, Pearl's.  I sense the beginning of a long and beautiful relationship.
author: Shane G.

description: Definitely the best semi-fast food burger in the city. This place destroys Super Duper. Anything here is good, and don't be shy with the mini-burger combo. With fries it actually turns out to be enough food.
author: Alfredo A.

description:
Badass burgers at a good price.  What else could you want?  One of my go to spots for anytime I'm craving one of the meanest chili burgers I've had outside of Tommy's in Los Angeles.  

The only way this place could be better would be if they sold beer to wash down my cheese burger.
author: Hungry D.

description:
You choose... 

in Yelpish:

"Ok, like... let me just begin by starting off by saying this... umm... you know when you are all like... hungry and you just want a good burger and stuff. You know... like... the kind of burger that like... looks like a burger, and tastes like a burger. RIGHT! I know... So, I decided to eat. Like... I always believe you should eat when you are like... hungry. So, like... I walk in and was like... WOW... REALLY? I mean they didn't even like... know I was there. Like... dissed... or something... WHATEVER! I mean, grow up... like... learn effin manners or something. I mean, there were like... 10... to 45 people in there. I am like... a customer... HELLO! So, at this point, I was like... all hungry... I probably could have eaten like... a cat or something. Anyways... I walk up to the counter and I ask the woman behind the counter, POLITELY I might add, for like... ummm... yeah, like... "can I get a burger?". Not hard, right? You would think. Wrong! And she was all..."and how would you liked that cooked?" And I was like... a burger. And that's when she then got all weird on me for like... no reason... I mean... like... or

in English:

"One of the best burgers in San Francisco and beyond."
author: Terry S.

description: I've only had the veggie burger here, which is pretty good, but Amanda says that the meat burgers here are phenomenal.  The milkshakes are pretty good, lots of selection there which i appreciate.
author: Phil J.

description:
This place was a great small shop, with plenty of heart.  I went here on the recommendation of fellow yelpers, and was looking for something special, different, and hearty.  

First of all, the service was terrific and friendly.  The staff is attentive to detail, cleaning and totally enjoying working there.  We got in around 12:10, just before the rush of people coming in to make their orders.  I ordered the mushroom burger with a side of fries.  

The food was definitely tasty, and the bun looked fresh and perky, which is a very good sign.  I wasn't a big fan of their regular fries, nor was I happy with the price(a little steep for what i expected to be a quick bite to eat).  But overall, I still recommend this place cuz its definitely different from more of the mainstream joints.
author: Evan T.

description:
HECKA GOOD BURGER (ALMOST AS GOOD AS THE ONE IN MILL VALLEY). the primary reasons the one in mill valley is better is #1 its more OG #2 its not full of art school retards.

the other other place in san francisco that has the YOURE A MOTHER F**KIN RETARD burger seal of approval is joes cable car in the excelsior.
author: christopher a.

description:
I'm a big fan of Pearl's. 

The buffalo burgers are actually more lean than the chicken sandwich, but have the taste and presence of a real burger. Order the bacon and you won't be sorry. It's like strips of crispy hamsteak crashing a meat orgy. 

The fries, sweet or regular, are crispy and tasty without being greasy.

One warning: the shake guy was a little jumpy with the peanut butter in the PB/chocolate shake.  

It's a bit expensive for burgers, but worth it.
author: Wes P.

description:
Pros: Location, Variety, Price, Time, Customer Service, Side items.

The location is clutch as its near a number of spots downtown (Nob Hill, FiDi, Union Sq., etc.). There are a number of fixin's and styles offered for you to munch on. The cost is pretty fair considering SF price gouging. These guys appreciate their patrons, there are gift certs to Sports Basement on site (where the manager works part-time) and they'll always try to give you what you want, so you come back again. They offer a good amount of tasty sides, from fries & rings together in perfect harmony to sweet potatoe strings. Its all good in the neighborhood at Pearls.

Cons: Size of the patties.

My one knock, and this goes for a lot of places, is that their patties tend to be kinda thin. I don't mind it some much at most places, this includes Pearls, however its my opinion that the really great burger joints handmake their patties thicker. That thickness lends to you having a tastier, juicier burger, not to mention often times those places will combine different cuts of meat in their patties. I can hardly hold that against Pearls though, as their patties are still of decent size and quality.
author: Charles L.

description:
Best burger I have had in SF (maybe anywhere?)

Located close to the heart of the tenderloin, this little gem serves up a burger that rival those coming out of some 5 star restaurants I have been to. With options such as buffalo meat and kobe beef, you can immediately tell this isn't just a divey diner.

It can be a little challenging to find parking, and space in the joint is limited, but its worth it. 

Recommendations:
ITS ALL GOOD
- My gf had the burger that Bobby Flay thought was the best in SF (The Bula Burger with Kobe). I had a taste - it was pretty damn good. 
- I had the Phat Bobb burger with Kobe, and loved all of it. Personally, I liked it better than Bobby Flay's favorite burger.
- My buddy had a chicken sandwich and swears we have to go back just to have that again.
- We shared an order of sweet potato fries and onion rings. I am split over which i liked better, so you really can't go wrong here.
- Finally, to just make sure I end up a diabetic, I ordered an Oreo shake on my way out. It was done before I reached my car!
author: Rondeep C.

description: I live super close to this place. It's both a blessing and a curse. AM-A-ZING burgers, i tell all my friends about this place.
author: Krystle A.

description:
Yuck!

I ordered a Pearl's deluxe burger.  It states on the menu that every burger will come medium unless otherwise specified.  To me, medium = pink, not bloody.

When I got my burger, it was a freaking Texas Chainsaw Massacre on a bun!  The bun was soaked in blood, there was blood all over the basket, and it was dripping blood all over my hands.

I also feel that they must have cooked a frozen patty, because the burger was not hot at all.

Hell to the no!
author: Burrito M.

description:
Pearls is a good burger joint at best. I had high expectations heading there because of the reviews on yelp but unfortunately it did not live up to expectations. 
 I ordered the phat bob burger, 1 mini cheese burger and an order of springs (1/2 sweet potato fries 1/2 onion rings). That cost me $20 bucks. Once the food came I dug right in. The mini burger was exactly that a very tiny burger that I could have ordered from burger king $1 menu. The springs were not worth the $4 dollars I paid. The sweet potato fries were excellent but the few onion rings that came with it were all smashed, pretty much onion strings. The phat bob burger was good until I got to the center where I started to notice some pink in the burger. It's not like it was raw it just wasn't cooked all the way through, probably because of the size of the patty. 
The place is very small and a lil grimy because of the amount or tables that are shared throughout the day. As soon as some one cleared their table others were already sitting down. No employee was even wiping the tables down. Oh and the one trash can in the place was overflowing with trash. 
Overall the spot was good (3 stars) but I'm definitely in no rush to go back but I would eat there again. The burger selection was fairly large with some unique combination's. I definitely recommend the sweet potato fries tho.
author: Adam M.

description:
I noticed the sign on the way to work one morning...my heart skipped a beat.  Could it be?  Could Pearl's, formerly exclusive to a Mill Valley location, be coming to my neighborhood?  Are my burger prayers being answered?  Will I finally get a chance to try the King (topped with a hot dog) Burger? Should I start buying clothes a size up?  

Yes.
author: L W.

description:
Damn. I Love Beef. I Love Burgers. 

I was at the laundromat a few weeks ago. Someone left an issue of 96 hours on the table. A picture of a burger and the headline BARGAIN BITES, led me to page 10. But when I got there page 10 was gone! Some other hamburglar stole it. 

But bless the demise of the printed newspaper business, the article was available online and I marked Pearls as a place to hit up.

I really wanted to love this place too, but damn, love indeed isain't easy.

For some reason I thought Pearls was more of a diner spot, but it really is more like a take out place with a few tables. They have a good and clear menu with a good amount of items, but the prices are a tad bit more than the bargain I was looking for. 

I got the Phat Bobb: medium rare with onion rings, bacon and cheese on a sesame bun. Garlic fries. Fountain drink.

Food took awhile to get here, and while it looked good upon first glance, after a few bites, I just didn't feel like eating anymore. There were no other toppings on the Phat Bobb, no lettuce, no onions, no tomatoes etc etc....it was just one burger away from dying with an artery clog. I know.

The meat was overcooked, not red at all, and lacks flavor. It was also kind of hard. Bacon was of the crumpled kind. Onion rings played no part in the taste. I just had a burger from Mel's last night that was better than this. I ate maybe 3/5s of it and stopped. 

Garlic fries were of the thick kind. All the garlic was trapped in the bottom of the tray and I think skinny fries work better at garlic fries. Meh.

My bf got the Pearl's Deluxe and his wasn't so hot either, also overcooked. He ordered the Frings tho, onions & fries, which I thought was a great idea for those who can't pick.

For the price, I'd rather go to Burger Joint, which is in the same category...but nicer decoration. I would want to try Pearls for a 2nd time, but since it's kind of out of the way, I probably won't.
author: Faffy L.

description:
Nothing cures the hunger pangs than a nice juicy burger with not one, but TWO sides of fries (garlic and sweet potato - much bigger fan of the latter).  The tasty burgers made the feeling of my own blood coagulating worthwhile (don't you just love that word?  I do.)

I like that the place is pretty low key, and for the blue cheese and bacon fans (who isn't, really?) the Prized Pearl sandiwhich is pretty darn good.

One star off for my burger being a little too well (I ordered medium) and my friend's for a little too NOT well (she ordered medium too) ... but our other friends found theirs juuust right.

Sorry, couldn't resist.  

Even so, it was still a tasty experience.  Next time I'm ordering the thick and creamy milkshakes too!
author: Shay F.

description: This is an update.  Maybe my previous review made a difference, or maybe I was just unlucky my first time?? I've eaten here twice since and the burgers are amazingly medium rare and tasty now--which is fine since their meat is house-ground grass fed meat. Really great burgers both times, about as good as a burger can get.
author: Anthony B.

description: excellent food and fantastic speed when making and delivering the food. burgers are slightly on the dry side but the fries are amazing!!
author: Bella C.

description:
Update 9/27

Well, I have had to increase the stars to 5, simply because the burgers are consistantly good. I also just tried the grilled cheese sandwhich, the hot dog and the fries for the first time. Damn Good!

Welcome to my neighborhood, you are a welcome addition, although the extra time I will have to spend at the gym will be difficult. 
Pearl's just opened in my hood and is a modern version of an old diner, but with top quality meats and ingredients. 
Deluxe Burgers (1/2 pound), Mini Pearl burger (1/4 pound), Turkey Burgers, Veggie Burgers, Hot Dogs, Salads...beef it up a bit with an all natural patty, or a Buffalo patty.
I had the Bula Burger (bacon, swiss, mayo, spicy pineapple teriyaki sauce) minus the bacon and it was really juicy and messy, the way a burger should be and frings (french fries and onion rings) with a rootbeer float.
Yummy. I have a feeling I will be spending quite a bit of time here.
author: Jason D.

description:
The only reason I cant give Pearl's 5 stars is that I always end up spending like 14 bucks for my dinner that is supposed to be cheap. That said, everything they make is delicious, and they offer buffalo burgers, which are a little easier on my belly than plain old beef (though their plain old beef is now some kind of natural organic thing too, so i guess that's good). The burgers are well-portioned, with lots of delicious condiments, especially the "Spicy Sly" which lives up to its name and then some. Also, the will sell you half fries, half onion rings, half sweet potato fries (any two of those) so if you're sharing with a friend, you can have variety. 

All that's great, but there is really only one reason that I love Pearl's and will never say a single bad word about them:

Unlimited Top-Quality Pickles.

the pickles are in a little rectangular container next to the ice water and they're self serve, and even if you fill up two little take-out bags wiht pickles and also eat some while you're standing there waiting for your food, they will not give you a dirty look, they will just refill the pickle container. Dream come true.
author: Julia G.

description:
ended up here for an early dinner last night, since our original plans fell through.  Got a jack cheeseburger with the frings (fry and onion ring combo)
and the bf had the phat bob. Both were pretty good but have to remember to ask for my burger medium well next time, since my bun got pretty soggy by the end. Space is pretty small (5 small tables and a window counter) so it's not great for large groups. Got a peanut butter and chocolate milkshake after-so damn good, like drinking a peanut butter cup.
author: Marie W.

description: LOVE Pearl's Burgers... the food is always great quality and the staff is efficient and always friendly.  Best to order on the phone and pick up... but do sometimes expect a line...  Don't forget to try the pickles.
author: Daniel P.

description:
Woo-hoo!  I've been dreaming of a good burger place opening in the neighborhood.  Pearl's sign is really inconspicuous and I wouldn't have even noticed it if I hadn't been at Eura (next door) the other day.  

I tried the Deluxe with bacon and cheese, and got a side of fries.  It's a truly good burger!  Make sure you're hungry before going here, as the burger is huge, and the fries portion is generous.  I'm sure that Pearl's will be really busy at lunch before long, so check it out while it's still quiet.

There are plenty of interesting looking speciality burgers I'm looking forward to trying.  And you can also get buffalo burgers or "natural beef" burgers (as opposed to the unnatural beef in their regular burgers???).
author: J S.

description:
Deeeliiiiccciiiouuuussss!!!! *wipe drool from chin*

Oh man! Yelp has definitely come thru this time! :) My roomie and I were craving burgers and so I thought I'd check out Yelp and find out what was SF's best burger. Since we just moved to the city, we are out and about looking for all those awesome hole-in-the-wall eateries that SF has to offer. Well, we definitely found one today! :)

I had a specialty buffalo burger with grilled onions, bacon and blue cheese on it. Cookie (my roomie) had a regular deluxe burger. Since we heard so much about the sweet potatoe fries, we had to try them and onion rings as well. Holy moly! Everything was delicious. The onion rings were fried to perfection, crispy, not oily and awesome in flavor. My burger was done to a perfect MedRare.

The decor,...such a cute quaint little diner style. 5 or so tables which were all taken up when we got there but cleared as soon as we were ready to sit. There was a constant buzz of people eating around us.

The cashier was friendly and very helpful. Pearl's is definitely on my hot list of burger joints in the city! I will definitely be back soon! 

5 Yummerz Stars from me!!!
author: Ann T.

description:
Wow, how have I lived with a block or two of this place for over a year, and never stopped in before?!

Being an avid meat-eater engaged to a Vegetarian, I have to satisfy the carnivore in me when I get the chance.  About once a month, I get foaming at the mouth craving which can only be satisfied by a huge, meaty, grease-dripping burger.

Up until last night, I'd either have to walk down to the Mall for an overpriced, skimpy thing, or settle for the flavored cardboard that fast food joints pass off.   But no more!

Pearl's is amazing, the Spicy-Sly is one of the best burger's I've ever had, second only to my own creations which usually take far too much time to pull together.  Sauteed peppers and onions, melted cheese, nice honking 1/2 pound of tasty, juicy meat on a fluffy bun, with a nice hint of spice.  It was messy and Delicious.  About as much as you'd expect to pay for a gourmet burger, but at least they give you a real patty, and not a strip of meat.

Onion Rings were also amazing, somewhere between those generic ones you normally see that are 80% fried batter with a strip of onion, and those thin ones that are all onion, with a little batter.  Perfect middle ground.

Can't wait to sample some more of the menu, I didn't see the Sweet Potato French Fries till after wards.

The amazing thing to me is as fantastically juicy as everything was, an most certainly my Heart had to work a little harder today, it didn't give me that nasty, grease-covered feeling I sometimes get after indulging in a burger.  No nasty oil on the roof of my mouth, or feeling like I need to take a shower afterwards.  Everything was fresh, and juicy, without feeling like it was dripping in oil.

I'll definitely be back.
author: Tyler D.

description: Only NOPA has better burgers in SF. You have to go with the Kobe here, or at least the grass-fed. Fries and rings were good, and the shakes are great. You won't be disappointed!
author: Adam Z.

description: This place...OMG! The best burgers you will ever taste!!! My husband and I use to drive from Sac just to eat here. He came home on his leave and all her wanted was Pearls! You will not be disappointed. Its a very small place I think they should expand because they obviously are very popular. But its a hole in the wall, they have a sit down area but not too many. After you have a Burger from Pearls, you will always find yourself comparing all burger meals to this place. BTW.. prices are awesome!
author: Maria B.

description:
Went there with a friend from the area. 
It's your standard hole-in-the-wall burger joint that serves good food. 
The burgers were juicy and cooked to the correct temp. The sweet potato fries were delicious. My friend's Chocolate-Banana shake was said to of been delicious. 

Very good spot to grab a quick lunch,
author: Koli H.

description:
I'm always on the look out for a good burger joint. The boy is obsessed with them and could probably eat them every day...forever.  So when a friend who recently moved to Berkeley, and misses her food connection in the city, suggested this place- we headed right over!

It is near downtown/Union Square area so it is convenient if you want to do some shopping (I suggest shopping first as you won't fit into anything in your size afterwards). So parking is atrocious- walk or public transit this one.

The burgers were good- I just had a plain one but there were plenty of weird options for people who want greasy juice AND some odd combination of fruit running down your chin.  You could also put together some pretty funky milkshakes. I went with my favorite, vanilla, but my friend said the peanut butter/chocolate was her favorite.  That'll be for next time I visit, because I will definitely be going back.

The fries were thick and there were a large amount, the burger was very tasty and obviously full of grease and fat (= perfect!), and the milkshake was delicious and huge! It lasted me through the meal and all the way down to Union Square. Enjoy!
author: Jess K.

description:
4.75 stars.

Deducting a quarter star for the meat coma that ensues mere moments after scarfin' down a Pearl's Deluxe Burger, Sweeeeeeeet Potato Fries and a chocolate shake.  oooof.

Pearl's has ruined me on other greasy spoon burger joints in the city.  None can compare to their fresh ingredients, friendly staff and (though a bit overpriced) extensive menu board.
author: Pete S.

description:
This place truly does have impressive burgers. It is a bit of a stretch to call it Union Square, but I don't feel it is the Tenderloin either or even Lower Nob Hill. I will let you decide, as I am not a city planner.

As to the food, it is delicious. I had a chicken burger, with bacon, blue cheese, and onions, with a a side of french fries. I basically ate the french fries there because they were so good. In fact, when I got to my friends place up the Hill, I ate the burger as if I hadn't had anything to eat all day. I think it was a combination of the great flavor and walking up Nob Hill.

The place is cute and you could eat there, but I feel it is more of a to-go place if you live in the area.
author: Christopher W.

description: Great staff. The food was ready in a flash, tastes really good - I can recommend the garlic fries! The bula burger was also good although a little heavy on the sauce.
author: Adi V.

description:
I am only an occasional meat-eater these days.  But when I do get that hankering, I head to Pearl's and order the buffalo burger with cheddar cheese, cooked medium.  

The burgers are consistently delicious.   The fixings are fresh too (no colorless tomatoes or yellow lettuce here).  You can even split a burger, and still feel full.  And the garlic fries are piled high with garlic. But be careful if you have an important meeting afterwards.  There's a whole lottta garlic on those bad boys.  

The folks in there are friendly, and you'll get your grub quickly.  Pearl's is close enough to Union Square to make it a perfect location for lunch before or after shopping.  This is yet another place that I found out about through word of mouth.  It definitely lives up to its reputation.  There are veggie burgers for folks who don't eat meat.  Although I don't usually care for a brew before dark, you can bring your own beer with ya to down with that burger too.
author: Jessica R.

description: I highly recommend this place if you are in need of a burger-fix. Very tasty and best NUTELLA SHAKE EVER.
author: Dee M.

description:
Probably the best burger place I've ever been to.  It opened up across the street only a month before I moved out of the neighborhood.  For that brief  period in my life I was able to enjoy this heavenly meal at a reasonable price at a whim.  Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner... didn't matter to me.  (though I've lost some weight now that I don't live there anymore...)

And to boot the owner is a real cool guy, greeting everyone as if they were old friends.  Can't think of a better place to enjoy a burger.  A+
author: Jesse F.

description:
I think that Pearl's and Carl's Jr. should swap slogans b/c "If it doesn't get all over the place, it doesn't belong in your face" fits my (first-time) experience at Pearl's perfectly.

I ordered the Super Sly Burger, which was a 1/2 lb. burger, toppled with sauteed onions & peppers, jack cheese and their chili sauce.  I also tried the sweet potato fries.  In short, despite being REALLY messy (i.e. I needed a fork to scoop up all of the "goodies" on my plate), my burger was great.  It was huge; the meat was twice as big as the bun (a critique of mine), which made it a little hard to handle.  It was nice n' spicy with plenty of flavor all around, though.  Almost too flavorful, really!  However, I ordered it med-rare, and got if med-well :(  The fries were great, too!

The staff was really cool and friendly, though.  You can tell that this place is a hot spot, if only because it's apparent that the staff know how good they are- it shows- and I can appreciate that!

Def check this place out, and I'll def be back.
author: M S.

description:
Great food! Late hours! Great Staff! Huge Selection of burgers and fries! but why only 4 stars? i'd have to say the price and the confined space. it's a small space which can be intimate and nice, but usually you just feel crammed in. take the food to go you say? ok, but by the time you get home your food is a ball of moist grease. best tasting moist grease but still not what you payed all that money for. but anyways back to the positives the burgers are amazing and having different types of fries and fry hybrids is great all in all the price is usually always worth it. haven't had a bad experience yet other than the day i took my food home. just go make the decision for your self if you like burgers(beef, buffalo, or vegitarian) check this place out. also they have shakes. actually all this talk about the good food has my mouth watering i think i'm going to go there right now. :)

"mmm that is a tasty burger" - jules(samuel l. jackson) pulp fiction

"That's a pretty fucking good milkshake. I don't know if it's worth five dollars but it's pretty fucking good." -Vince Vega(john travolta) ......pulp fiction.
author: Steve S.

description: Burger was really yummy, as were the sweet potato fries. It's a hole in the wall (seriously, it's tiny). But those are usually the places that have the best food.  I'd go back, and you should visit. =)
author: Frances A.

description: Bula burger was amazing, didn't really get to try the kobe beef but I will next time. Shakes are on point, I had a nutella banana, and tried the nutella strawberry. Come on, who else has nutella milkshakes?! Pretty pricey, but well worth the money.
author: Andy L.

description: The burgers here are so good.  It's flavorful and juicy. It's my favorite burger joint in the city so far. Sweet potato fries, burger, and a shake. Can't go wrong with that combo.  Food coma fun.
author: Dawnie N.

description:
Came here after reading all the great reviews. I went half/half on the burgers with a friend so we could have a variety. We ordered The Bomb and Prized Pearl with a side of the frings. Both burgers were far from juicy. I didn't see any drippings from the burger. The Bomb is what you would expect of a burger with chili, cheddar, and onions. Nothing to wow about there. The Prized Pearl I had high expectations for since I love bacon and I love bleu cheese. Sorry to say, but the burger is not prized at all. The bacon was so fatty and tasted a little undercooked. I couldn't even even taste any bleu cheese. The only thing I can say for the frings .... Skimp! After about four reaches into the basket and it's all gone.

Maybe I'll need to come back and try a buffalo or kobe beef burger.
author: Eric L.

description: delicious, affordable and quick. Their milkshakes are also extremely tasty.
author: Connie M.

description:
Mmmmm, mmmmmm, GOOD!
Bula Burger and Onion rings.  
It was all good. Oink, oink... wish I had saved room for a shake!
author: Jeff M.

description:
Yum. Burger was good, but I requested medium well and got well done. Minor difference.  I had the spicey sly burger. The peppers, cheese, and sauce were great.

I wanted to get a milkshake but will have to wait until next time.
author: Sharmet S.

description:
Whether  its mid day food craving , or late night cruise after a drunken night at the club, Pearls is the place to make your pit stop. Great selection...My favorite is the Turkey burger! um hum! lmao...man thinking about it so much, that im about to take a trip down there and pick one up now.....lol..

And the deluxe shakes are awesome!

-Mack
author: Mckenzy G.

description:
I ate here because Eura Cafe was closed (which incidentally I found because Canteen was full).

I do eat a lot of burgers but I haven't tried any that I would brag to friends about. The bad ones, however, will get highly publicized by me. Pearl's falls into the good category. A good, non-intrusive burger just like it should be. I also like the fact they offer organic beef as an option without being pretentious about it.
author: Shawn T.

description:
UPDATE - Not only good burgers, the servers here may be some of the nicest I have ever come across.

Damn fine burger!  Also home to some delicious lower guilt burgers.  They have buffalo burgers - which i have had in many other incarnations and always thought they sat like a dry brick in the gut, but these are juicy and delicious and just taste like premium beef (and have less calories and saturated fat than skinless chicken breast).  
They also have an option for a small fee of getting your regular burger with organic hormone free beef.  

I have yet to try the King Burger, but i can tell you the idea that they have it and that I have a hard time even picturing it ( a hamburger "crowned with a hot dog") makes me even more excited to go there every time.

Lastly if you like pickles, they have a thing of pickle spears - take as many as you like - or if you are like me and you like lots, take as many as you can grab without them noticing how much of a pickle pig you are.
author: Greg M.

description:
First of all kudos to Yelp, not sure how we functioned before we met!

Second, we wanted burgers on a Friday night and I typed "burgers" in the search box and vwhala Pearls appears with some great ratings!!

My review is a bit schitzo, so beware: 

We went.  It was yum.  I had the turkey burger w blue cheese, uber yummie.  Would I go back, well I am not sure.  I wasn't that impressed.  The burgers seemed very cookie cutter, not round and juicy but flat and boring.  A very welcoming and friendly staff, which is hard to find!  So it's hard to rate.
author: Tamz O.

description:
I tried 2 more burgers on the menu over the past two weeks and I was in artery-clogged heaven. Burgers are flavorful, juicy & cooked the way they were ordered. 

The onion rings were nicely seasoned. They're regular slices of onions...neither the fatties nor the shoestring variety. I'm not so much a fan of the garlic fries, but the regular fries & the sweet potato are quite tasty. And the milkshake's still as good as ever!
author: Jane K.

description:
These are the kind of burgers you need two hands for...and a lot of napkins. Their specialty burgers are amazing blends of different sauces and toppings which combine into a kind of foodtopia in your mouth. My favorite is the buffalo-meat patty with melted bleu cheese, bacon, grilled onions, and mayo. Yes, they've got buffalo meat options (healthier, tastier, less fatty) along with turkey and chicken. 

This place knows that a good burger goes beyond a well-cooked patty. The selection of toppings is as complete as any gourmet burger joint (want avocado or mushroom? You got it). They've even got sweet-potato fries (with enough garlic to kill a vampire) and, of course, milk shakes. They include salad and vegetarian options for the less carnivorous amongst us. 

It's a small place - diner style in decor. Not too expensive, but the specialty burgers cost about $8 with tax. Worth the price, for sure. 

Best burgers I've had in San Francisco!
author: Matt T.

description:
I've tried the regular cheeseburger and I thought it was nothing special. The Kobe beef upgrade is definitely worth the upgrade in my opinion though. It's just a lot more juicy and tastes way better! 

I had the peach milkshake and that gets a thumbs up also.
author: Charles K.

description:
I think the majority of the population would agree that bacon is awesome. It is salty and fatty - two of the primary factors that have led to American obesity I am sure. Bacon = rad .... most of the time. 

I ordered a turkey burger at Pearl's and added bacon because bacon makes everything better. When I got my burger I could hardly find the patty because there was bacon everywhere. I know this sounds like a dream scenario, but I learned that there can be too much of a good thing. I would estimate that there were about 6 pieces of thick cut bacon on my burger and it really was too much. I could almost feel myself getting meat sweats as I was taking my second bite. As I continued to eat I was overwhelmed with a sense that I was about to enter some kind of bacon coma. I left Pearl's with nitrates coming out of my pores.
author: Dana H.

description: Pretty tasty burgers and large portions! Messy like a mofo though so don't bring your bougie girlfriend here unless she's down to earth or a hood rat! I had the spicy sly, fries, and onion rings! Onion rings were banging! Fries were regular, nothin special. I will definitely come here again if I'm in the mood for grease!
author: Daniel N.

description:
For the price, this is probably the best burger in town.  

I had a buffalo meat burger, which was extremely tasty and filling, yet I didn't feel sick after.  I also ordered a large side of sweet potato fries, and couldn't even finish the entire thing.  My buddy had the onion rings, but they weren't anything special.

Overall, this place is great and I definitely want to come again and try some more of their specialty burgers.
author: E-dough R.

description: The burgers are great (I'm a fan of the mushroom) and there's a really impressive selection of food here. 4 stars because my first time there the sweet potato fries I got were super soggy. The second time the garlic fries were perfect, and I didn't mind the garlic breath I still had the next morning!
author: Irene M.

description:
I'd heard a lot of good things about this place, so my expectation was high.  

The burgers are okay I guess... the kind that are huge, messy, and dripping with grease.  Normally I'd say this is a good thing, but there was just too much to choose from.  They have like 3 different kinds of meat for the burger, and then the usual choices of combinations and condiments.  

It's an extremely filling meal, and a pricey one, so just get ready.  

I think they're closed on Mondays, or Sundays.  Anyway, call first.
author: Adam C.

description:
moving is hard work. i'm not talking about the stress of moving or the annoyance of packing and unpacking; i'm talking about the actual, physical work of moving an entire apartment's worth of acquired junk down two floors in a cramped elevator and across town to a new apartment. and then doing it again, the very next day, this time, with STAIRS. yes, this past weekend my new roommates and i went through two days of hell that culminated in us three stooges and two saints named Martin W. and Allison K. moving my entire apartment down two horrific flights of stairs, into a u-haul and two cars, and from the east bay to san francisco. 

i can't even express the gratitude i feel towards those two, nor the hunger that we worked up doing all that moving. and while on that second day, our hunger was sated with pizza and beer, on day one of moving, i was introduced to my very first san francisco infatuation - the yummy, greasy, burgery goodness also known as pearl's deluxe burgers. while i can definitely down a full-sizer, pearl's mini burgers are perfect in my opinion, since they allow you to switch it up with the delectable onion rings and garlic fries. i haven't yet experienced the milkshakes i've heard so much about, but you can bet your last chip that i'll be back for more. pearl's was the remedy for my hunger, and a more than warm welcome to san francisco.
author: Kris G.

description: What can I say?~The grass fed burgers are delicious. Also, the buffalo burgers are excellant. The fries are perfect and the milk shakes do not have all the crap and junk you find in other places. Everything on the menu is great!!! The staff are very nice ! Great customer service.
author: Jennie M.

description:
Disappointing. 

I had the standard beef deluxe burger w/ grilled onions and cheddar.

"Medium" resulted in a dry, flat, flavorless hockey puck of a burger, which was very sad considering the presentation was awesome. It looked like it was going to best the best burger I'd ever had.  It wasn't. In-N-Out makes a better burger.

Word to Pearl: Learn to cook meat and start adding pickles to help bump up the flavor.
author: Dana S.

description:
I LOVE burgers.. So after hearing about this place, I decided to try while I was staying in SF.  We went around 4pm on a Saturday and it wasn't busy at all.  The place is TINY! Maybe 3 tables and a bar seating area, us 4 took up half the place already.  Anyway...

I had the cheeseburger with garlic fries and wow were those fries SUPER garlic-y (which i love).  The burger was so juicy and I did add bacon to it.. The bacon itself was so thick and DAMN GOOD but something about the burger was DELICIOUS.

My boyfriend and friends all had the award winning Bula Burger.  After, my boyfriend was SO FULL but managed to get ANOTHER BURGER - this time the Buffalo Burger. The meat is a bit more rough but the burger was sill WONDERFUL.  

I crave this place now that I'm back in Los Angeles and it makes me SO SAD that there's nothing like this place around here... :(
author: Kathy C.

description: Went a second time and this time, just ordered the regular deluxe (1/2 pound) with cheddar, lettuce, tomato, and onions.  And a cup of water.  Cost was $6.72.  I'm telling you, it was divine.  I was starving and scarfed it so fast that I was sort of embarrassed that other people might have noticed.  Just the burger made me quite full for the rest of the day.  No way I could have eaten fries.   Their fries are good, but if you don't want to feel overstuffed, I suggest going big on the beef and skip the fries for maximum enjoyment.
author: Marc S.

description:
My boyfriend recommended this place. I got a mini burger and it was delicious. The beef was good and it was cooked very well. 

I like how it's a small place and the people there were nice.
author: Cat D.

description:
Very good establishment. My wife and I got a hamburger that I ate and then we split onion rings and garlic fries. She was nuts about the onion rings. I would say they were a 9 on a 10 scale. The garlic fries were just right for anyone who hasn't had them before or has a weak stomach like myself. Unlike the garlic fries at Gordon Biersch, you didn't see garlic everywhere. Just a scant amount. However, the fries all had a garlic taste which was very good.

We were just going to have those two but when we crossed Jones on Post, I smelled the meat cooking. A mini hamburger was ordered and I must say it was quite good.

One last thumbs up: they give you biodegradable containers. We walked three blocks back to the hotel on a cold San Francisco evening. When we got back the room, the food was piping hot. Eco-friendly and effective!!!
author: Tom M.

description:
If You Can't Score Crack in the 'Loin, There's Always Pearl's Deluxe


Pearl's Deluxe Burgers
708 Post Street
San Francisco, Ca 94109
(415) 409-6120
http://www.yelp.com/biz/pearls-deluxe-burgers-san-francisco

Date: 12/9/10
Price: $6.29 (incl.cheese.) "Spries" (1/2 regular, 1/2 sweet potato fries) ran an additional $2.95

Dave Chappelle once remarked (live at the Fillmore) that there ain't nothin' tender about the Tenderloin. Well played, Mr. Chappelle. Yet clearly, you have not had the burger at Pearl's? For the burger at Pearl's is juicy, pink, delicious, and yes, TENDER. So you see sir, the Tenderloin is about more than just "smoking crack in front of Starbucks," the Tenderloin is about...well, it's about...(cough)...I dunno but we had a really good burger there.

The burger at Pearl's has been heralded by Tyler Florence and other fancy-panted celebrity chefs as one of the premier burgers in San Francisco. Pearl's is not a fancy restaurant (and I'd be hesitant to recommend an aspiring restaurateur to establish a ritzy place in the 'Loin) but you could easily find their burger in any upscale establishment. The 1/2 lb burger had a fancy weight, size and look and was quite good. We were somewhat disappointed to find out that Pearl's was not serving any of their top-notch meat - Niman Ranch, Kobe, or Buffalo - that we had seen highlighted in a publicity reel, but the FavCo Ranch substitute proved to be a worthy opponent. Our burgers were cooked perfectly-reddish pink throughout with a thin layer of brown encompassing the patty, which for some reason kept reminding me of an inside-out red M&M. The texture and consistency of the patty were great, although I thought the burger could have used a bit of seasoning to bring out more of that beefy flavor. The accouterments seemed fresh and the bun was proportional and springy. Note: Pearl's does not have a liquor license. Like bacon-chocolate, this sounds like a bad thing, but is not! Unable to purchase a beer at Pearl's, we purchased the 22 oz. beverage of our choice at a nearby corner store (Charlie would say "bodega" because he's east coasty like that)  and brown-bagged it into Pearl's. We came to find out that Pearl's wasn't BYOB either - uh oh - but the nice lady behind the counter (strongly) suggested that we pour our beers (quickly and discreetly) into large paper soda cups she provided. Win-win! Right?


Size: 1/2 pound (their mini burgers are 1/4 pound)
Ranch: New Zealand's FavCo Ranch...although because the internets couldn't find their website for me, my doubts as to whether this "FavCo Ranch" actually exists will remain very high.
Meat: Cow
Accouterments: Arrives pre-assembled with lettuce, tomato, mayo and enough red onions to render your breath absolutely repulsive. Added cheddar cheese.

Beer with burger: Ballast Point Big Eye IPA (from corner store)

Beer availability: None. This place is as dry as a nun's gusset! I'm Rick James, bitch!

Ambiance: And so we break our streak of uppity yuppity/bougie places, with Pearl's. Pearl's is a small burger joint, with a handful of two-tops and a street-facing counter that seats maybe four. It is brightly lit inside (although not easily spotted from the street) and very clean. The staff is friendly, efficient and informative. For most folks, it's the kind of place where you wouldn't imagine spending more than half an hour of your time. In fact, many of the patrons took their burger to go, but we are not most patrons! We beat out three generations of customers in staying past our welcome! Take that Bob "What About Bob?" Wiley!

Burger rating: .5 above the mean
author: Charlie R.

description: Excellent burgers with the option to upgrade to Kobe or Buffalo.  My favorites are the Phat Bob, and the Bula add rings.  Their shakes are great.  May I suggest a Nutella shake for you?  French fries and onion rings are both what they should be - go ahead and get a frings, half of each.  Well worth the trip!
author: Danny M.

description:
Non-red meat eaters shouldn't be allowed to review burger places, but I'm going to anyways. This is a nice little place. My grilled chicken pesto sandwich was juicy and fresh, although it got a little soggy in the take-out container. Sweet potato fries ($3) are a treat, but next time I'll ask to hold off on the salt.

Very friendly and chatty owner at the register. He explained to me that they use a healthier and lighter rice oil in their cooking, but there was no noticeable difference in taste. Will definitely be back to try the turkey burger. Walked by this past Sunday, and they were closed. But bonus points for late Friday and Saturday night hours! And GREAT shakes.
author: Dave K.

description: Ordered a mini-deluxe burger, sweet potato fries and a milkshake.  Best burger I have ever eaten.  Just perfect.  Fries were nice and sweet.  Excellent meal.
author: Dave H.

description: If I could curl up inside of one their burgers or shakes or garlic fries forever- I would.  They have veggie burgers (which is awesome because this place really is a hole in the wall) that you can have prepared just like any of their regular burgers and they are SO DANG GOOD.  But it gets better.  They have some of the most amazing garlic fries that I have ever had the pleasure of eating and they come in a big ole basket for sharing.  AND on top of that they have a NUTELLA shake.  I'm pretty sure I don't have to go into any detail on why that is awesome.  You could easily walk by this place and miss it if you were chit chatting with the person you were walking with but .. don't. Because you're missing out.  Make this part of your regular eating habits.  In moderation of course.
author: Kat L.

description:
JULES
                       Good for you.  Looks like me and
                       Vincent caught you at breakfast,
                       sorry 'bout that.  What'cha eatin'?

                                  BRETT
                       Hamburgers.

                                  JULES
                       Hamburgers.  The cornerstone of any
                       nutritious breakfast.  What kinda
                       hamburgers?

                                  BRETT
                       Cheeseburgers.

                                  JULES
                       No, I mean where did you get'em?
                       MacDonald's, Wendy's, Jack-in-the-
                       Box, where?
     
If Brett was in SF, he would've gone to Pearl's.
Deets: Made to order with all the fixins. This place is no frills and that's the way I like it. The place is clean, the food is fresh, and the fries are hot and crispy. Let's talk money: cost is a few bucks more than your usual fast food jam, but you won't feel like ass afterwards and will have plenty of money left over to buy your wife a foot massage.
author: Gabe b.

description: If you want a heart attack then this is definitely the place to go. The burgers here are delicious! However, it comes with a price, you will probably eat more than 1500 calories in one sitting. They do, however, have some healthy burgers in their menu for the health and fit people,
author: Marlon M.

description: burgers are to die for! always good, everyone must try the nutella milkshake! the best creation ever.
author: Amy R.

description: Massive, dirty, delicious burgers. AND they have NUTELLA SHAKES (not fantastic but it's one of the few places with nutella shakes).
author: Abi R.

description:
Summary: Fabulous burger; Pearl's really deserves a 4.5, with 1/2 a star deducted for the mediocre fries (would've been a full star deduction had it not been for the options of sweet potato fries and more importantly, "frings" -- a combo of onion rings and fries for the indecisive.)

Venue: Clean and a bit divey with about 7 two-person Formica tables and a few counter stools. It's the type of place where you order and pick up your food at the counter. Very similar setup to Blue 9 Burger in the EV in NYC.

Service: Less than 5-minute wait time, but then again, we were the only ones there.

Menu selection: Surprisingly diverse for a burger joint. Deluxe burgers, mini burgers, buffalo burgers, chicken burgers, turkey burgers, organic burgers, etc.

Burgers: Five stars. Large but manageable, juicy but not greasy, perfectly grilled. Bacon was nice and thick (think applewood smoked bacon). Ask for grilled onions, which came in big rings rather than the stringy, mushy kind you get at other places.

Fries: Not worth the calories.
author: Veronica S.

description:
I got a veggie burger with grilled mushrooms, onions, and cheese, and an order of fries.  It was unexceptional.  Granted, the fries weren't greasy, but they also weren't that tasty.  The burger itself could have been crisper, but that's not my objection.  It simply didn't have much flavor.  The cheese (Swiss, in this case) was the best part.  The veggie patty itself?  Eh.

I love a good veggie burger.  I have yet to find one.  The best, so far, has been Barney's tofuburgers (Wildwood brand, I believe), which I would rate as a 3.5.  Barney's gardenburgers, however, are not as good as Pearl's.

Friendly folk; prompt service; kudos for being open late (2a on Fridays and Saturdays); convenient location.  As far as the veggie burger is concerned, however, it could have been better.

Would I return?  Unlikely.
author: SalsaBoy S.

description:
After watching the "Best Burger in NYC" episode of HIMYM a couple weeks back, I'd been jonesing for a good, nay, spectacular all beef patty on a sesame seed bun.  But where to start?  Well, as far as I'm concerned, Yelp is the Alpha and the Omega and it led me straight to this place.  And let me tell you, they hit the nail right on the head.

The place is TINY.  We went on a Tuesday night around 9:00 and it was packed.  I could only imagine what kind of insane crowd you get on a weekend night.  The guy working the counter was a really nice guy.  Not just "I'm only smiling because I'm paid to, but I'd be just as happy spitting in your food", but he just seemed genuinely happy, which always puts me in a good mood.  I had to place an order for myself, and then another order to go for my buddy, and he told me that he'd put on the to go order 15 minutes after making mine so that it would be nice and hot when we left.  Nice!

And then we finally got our food.  In the immortal words of Jules from Pulp Fiction, "this is a tasty burger!"  Although, instead of washing down my tasty burger with a Sprite, I opted for the strawberry shake and a side of Srings (sweet potato fries and onion rings).  Both were extremely solid.  I went with the Phat Bob and my bro with the Mushroom burger.  Both were heart-stoppingly delicious.  I know that I'm going to have to hit the gym doubly hard tomorrow, but this meal was most definitely worth it!
author: Norm U.

description: Great burgers, fries, shakes. Fast Friendly service. If you have found any better burger than this in SF, let me know - Pearl's is at the top of my list so far.
author: James P.

description: Really great burgers!! The phat bob and the mushroom burger are my favorites...and the nutella milk shake is a must.
author: Nicolas P.

description:
This place makes me wish that I never had any other hamburger. The sweet potato french fries are to DIE for. You looking for something beyond your usual beef? Ask for buffalo. It's amazing. They also serve veggie burgers and grilled chicken burgers.

This is the best burger place I've been to in San Francisco. It's the closest thing to a Stamp's Burger since I've moved from Mississippi (which I might add, you really should try if you're going down south).
author: Frances L.

description: Checked it out after seeing it on the Food Network. The burgers were delicious but the place is definitely a hole in the wall. Trash on the floors and dirty tables kind of took away from the experience for me, good thing the burgers were worth it. I'd take the Counter over Pearl's any day but if you are looking for a good burger and are in the neighborhood, its worth checking out.
author: Kari G.

description:
Though I live right around the corner from Pearl's, I found it on Yelp.  I never walk down Post between Jones and Leavenworth because I live on Sutter between those two streets - I always end up walking up and down either Jones or Leavenworth.  I was happily surprised to find out that Pearl's was just a stone's throw away (litereally).  

I have a weakness for burgers with blue cheese and Pearl's does not disappoint (and the bacon and sauteed onions are a nice touch).  The buffalo burger is also delicious (especially when I'm looking for something a little less greasy).  The onion rings are good but not as good as the sweet potato fries.   I love that you can choose the type of meat you want.  I love that they have a 1/4 mini burger (now if only they offered a meat choice for the mini).   I love that you can mix your fries or mix fries and onion rings.  

It isn't the best hamburger I've ever had but it is close.   I sort of wish it wasn't so close to home - my burger consumption has definitely gone up in the past couple of months.
author: Julie P.

description:
After writing my review, I gave it a 2nd try since I was in the area and hungry.  Meh, same deal.  I went for the one with bacon & bleu cheese.  I love bleu cheese, a lot, but whatever they use is some cheap extra sour stuff that was just not good.  And their bacon is a bit suspect, I've never had bacon with the kind of texture theirs has.  It was almost spongy :/

Had the fries though, which were bomb.  I may go back just to snack on some fries if I'm in the area.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
Definitely not a cheap burger place. Good yes, cheap no. I would have given it 5 stars but it was a bit pricey for a casual burger joint.  

The biggest hurdle at this place is the options. A lot of variety with all the fix-ins. So I decided to go with the most basic option. Buffalo burger with cheese. And it was great! Really really good. The sweet potato fries were killer and I loved the fresh pickles at the cash register. If you decide on the bison make sure to order it medium. 
Will I be going back? Hell yeah! And next time I will try one of the more elaborate burgers.
author: Roger H.

description:
Good stuff, especially during a recession!  Went here on a date Saturday night.  My date's burger was dripping, and my vegetarian burger was very delicious actually.  The sweet potato fries were yummy.  The menu was very accommodating i.e. you can order half sweet potato fries and half french fries.  For the value, I give it 5 stars - it's less expensive than Burger Meister for pretty much the same quality (Niman Ranch), same great customer service, I see why this is the go-to place for young professionals and trendy folks alike.  

Would come again!
author: Jenna V.

description:
Nobody has reviewed the veggie burger, so I will.  It was nice and hearty with good flavor.  Better than the frozen veggie burgers in the green boxes.  I really couldn't tell what was in it, and will only venture to guess there were some slivers of carrot.  All in all, good texture with good taste without trying to hard to be a real hamburger.

The fries were good, but not orgasmic.
author: Guy S.

description: i gotta thank fellow yelpers for this one! i came across this place on yelp and thought i would give it a try. LOVED THIS PLACE. i don't remember exactly which one but i ordered mini burger with fries and oreo shake, and i still couldn't' finish it! This place def deserves fives stars.
author: DaYe K.

description: great burgers and great service. the garlic springs are delicious.
author: J.K. B.

description:
If you like hamburgers (or chicken or turkey) and you haven't eaten here, you might have something wrong with you. seriously. Eat At Pearl's.  

and have one of their milkshakes, there is just something about drinking a milkshake out of a boba straw that makes it all worth it.
author: Stephie K.

description:
Sometimes you just need a no-non-sense burger.  You know the one.  Bun, meat, grilled (or not) onions, lettuce, tomato and mayo.  Simple and beautiful in all its All American glory.  This is what you will find at Pearl's.  5 stars for the simplicity and and hitting the burger-nail on the head.

For those who complain about the price .. the meat is good and think about where this place is located.  Almost downtown so consider rent in your review before you slam the $$.

Had the mini-classic today ($3.99), 1/4 pounder, and that's enough meat for me.  Small side of fries ($1.75) and soda ($1.25).  Under $8 all in for lunch.  Service was fantastic.  Counter person (poor thing) has to clean up when no one is ordering and actually delivers food to your table if you eat-in.  Way better than Sliders and I know the meat is better here.  

Meat is cooked as you like it and I like it.  Fries are nice and hot, perfectly salted, not over salted.  

Minor complaint is that I can't get the all-natural meat ($1.50 extra) with the mini burger so the only time I get it is when I have a friend to split one with me.
author: Beautiful B.

description:
Pearl's Deluxe Burgers.  A name well fitting since their burgers are pretty much the most deluxe burgers I've ever tasted.  I don't know who Pearl is but she sure makes great burgers.  I tried the Prized Pearl with bacon, bleu cheese, and grilled onions in it.  It wasn't a huge burger by comparison to another burger joint but it really filled me up.  The garlic fries use real garlic and onions so they do give a slightly spicy taste.  The burger really hit the spot and they have a lot of great burger ideas.  I have never tried bleu cheese on a burger before but now it's almost a necessity on all my burgers.

The place is kind of small and is located right off downtown.  There is always a seat open though and the wait isn't too long.  The jar of pickles next to the water seem to be fresh as well.  They're crunchy and have just the right amount of sweetness with the brine.
author: Bobby Y.

description:
This is the best goddamn burger you'll ever eat. period.

Also home of the best onion rings in the universe.

If you eat here and disagree that it's the best, you can go f@*k yourself 'cause you're wrong.

Rice bran oil french fries, sweet potato fries, and onion rings. Homemade chili. Real thick fruit shakes. Buffalo or turkey burgers on request. Whole wheat buns. Insanely good. ....Did I mention how good this place was?
author: Joe T.

description:
On my first time there, I heard a fella tell the staff "that was the best burger I've ever had; I will be back" as he walked out, and I was pretty sure I had come to the right place. When I got my food, my suspicions were confirmed: the burger was huge and juicy, and the fries were crispy on the outside but soft on the inside -- perfect.

The service was excellent. Before I got my food, I got up to move my scooter as it was making it hard for someone to park, but in the process, I knocked over an innocent lady's table, spilling her drink, sending ketchup and her burger flying. I immediately offered to pay for her food, and the kind staff offered to give her a new meal and a dessert (she refused both offers). Then they cleaned up the huge mess I made with a smile, and even came over to ask me how my burger was after I was served. The staff really goes the extra mile.

Go here, tip well, and enjoy the excellent food.
author: L D.

description: For the money, this is the best burger in sf. Good service and plenty of options, what else could you ask for in a burger joint?
author: nick d.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend and ordered the following:

Buffalo Pesto Burger
Spicy Sly Chicken Burger
Small Garlic Fries

I had never had a buffalo burger before, and didn't really know what to expect, but seeing that it was lower in fat and higher in protein than beef sounded good to me.  I ordered the burger medium, which was a mistake (the meat came out medium-well), because the lower fat content rendered the meat really dry and chewy.  Not what I look for in a burger.  The pesto sauce was decent.  If I were to eat here again, I would order the buffalo rare to medium-rare.

My boyfriend had the Spicy Sly, and I think they should add Messy to the title.  The sauce was extra drippy, but not extra tasty.  It didn't fit my taste, so I didn't take more than one bite of it.  My boyfriend said he was whatevers about the burger.

The garlic fries were super garlicy.  Tons of raw garlic all over.  I would have preferred that they sautee the garlic a bit, or more if they do, but the menu stated garlic, and that's what you get.

Total: $21
author: Lisa F.

description:
I was in town from Chicago to attend MacWorld at the Moscone Center.  I checked Yelp and found that Pearl's had a good reputation
First, the food:  very good.  I had a mini burger (1/4 pounder) with fries.  I should have ordered the normal size burger, 1/4 too small, but tasty.   Bun tasted whole grain.  I asked for raw onion and they gave me a full slice of red onion.  Fries were crispy and had a good favor.  Limited table service 

Now for the neighborhood:  I did not do my research about walking to Pearl's.  I wound up walking thru the Tenderloin neighborhood.  It's reputation (check Wikipedia)  is well deserved.   Check your route before walking to Pearl's
author: AJ B.

description:
i could have sworn that i wrote a review on this a couple of years ago. guess not. 

so pearls is a good spot. i never ate here i always ordered to go. their burgers are pretty big and tasty. the milkshakes are good. i enjoyed their sweet potato fries. but besides that its a good spot but i dunno. nothing really special. sliders and nations are better i think .
author: Ashley H.

description:
Check out this place! Deeliicouus and inexpensive burgers. BBB...better than Barney's Burgers and half the price. Ordered a regular and buffalo burger, french fries, and a coke. 17 bucks.  Can't really beat that.

Update 05.30.07
They've got 99 points on the inspection, didn't quite make a 100 because the faucet was dripping (according to the waitress).
author: Bogee B.

description:
Last night on my way home I decided to come in and don't regret it! I got the pesto burger, sweet potato fries and black forest milkshake. OMG, can't wait to try the other flavours of their milkshake. The blackforest shake reminds me of eating the real baked version. 
The patty was HUGE! yes, you definitely need two hands to eat these things. The service was awesome too! friendly and quick!
author: Diane M.

description:
I seriously would give this place four stars, but I was hammered so I feel it couldn't be as good as I recall.

I went to the speakeasy B&B after work and ended up leaving with a sizeable bill and a stumbling problem.  Boy, was I glad this place was a block away.  I had the turkey burger and frings and it was unbelievable. . . I think this meal saved me as I slowly tried to put my arm through my work shirt and shuffled to the office this morning.

I'll go back sober as an endangered panda bear and see if I need to add back that star.  I think I'm still drunk.
author: E L.

description: Mini phat bob + nutella shake. tooooo good :)
author: Madison K.

description: The burgers here are phenomenal. They are generously sized, perfectly cooked, and taste amazing. A burger shouldnt be lean, and these ones definitely are not. They are not out of the price range for a burger of this size or awesomeness. They have a lot of different varieties, but I honestly do not care for BBQ sauce all over my burger. The fries are crispy and they give healthy portions and its awesome how you can get a combo order of fries for those days you just cant decide on what you want. They have a pretty extensive menu on shakes and the fact that they are geniuses for serving them with large "boba style" straws so that youre not just sucking away with no milkshake getting to you, is a plus. This place isnt all that big and parking isnt too great so a to-go order might be the way to go.
author: James T.

description:
Five reasons for five stars:

1. Delicious.
2. Plenty of options between beef, turkey, chicken and veggie
3. Cheap, $4.99 for my turkey burger.
4. Friendly service, totally up for making mine minus the oil
5. Did I mention delicious?
author: Jason B.

description: Great burger place. We ordered the bula burger with kobe beef and onion rings (it costs extra). They were also nice enough to cut the burger in half for us. The burger and onion rings were greasy, but oh-so-good and worth it. The only thing that I can complain about is that it had a little too much sauce. It was dripping everywhere but it was delicious! I will go back there again.
author: anita y.

description: Thank you again yelp for not letting me down when I'm craving something specific!  Friends and I were looking for good burgers and came across this place through Yelp.  It did not disappoint!   Best onion rings I've ever had.  My burger (I can't remember which one I ordered but it had blue cheese and grilled onions) was awesome and dripping with juicy/greasy goodness.  I didn't even need to put any condiments on it.  It's a little hole in the wall and there isn't much seating but definitely worth the wait.
author: Katie V.

description:
so i needed a late-night burger this past saturday. it happens, okay? ;P my friend and i were about to go to darla's, which is down the street from my apartment, but since we were heading out late and they close at 10, we hopped on the N to check out pearl's downtown.

i ordered the phat burger with cheese and a small side of onion rings, my friend ordered the teriyaki burger. let it be known that i am a cheeseburger fiend, to the max. i tore into my burger as soon as they delivered it to our table (nice!). but although it was flavorful, there was something missing that i couldn't put my finger on. i got a bite of my friend's teriyaki burger and was shocked. 

"why is yours so much juicier than mine??" hers was literally dripping with cheese and juice, while mine was significantly dryer. "and your patty is bigger!!" i then thought i hit on it, that they had forgotten the cheese. so i looked on my receipt and saw that they had given me.....A VEGGIE BURGER!!! 

now, it must have been a pretty good veggie burger for a carnivore like me to have eaten half without being grossed out or immediately disappointed, but it made so much sense why my burger was not delivering like it ought to have. since i was already halfway through, i just finished it then went to the cashier. i told him what had happened and that i enjoyed the veggie, but wanted to buy a real cheeseburger to take home. 

he said it was on the house (so nice!!!), but i insisted on paying, since i'd eaten my whole veggie burger and it was good. he relented, but insisted on giving me 50% off, so it was like $3.50. sooooo sweet of him, and i will definitely be back again!! :D
author: Katie M.

description:
Oh gosh, the burgers here are delicious! The fries are great too. I also always order the chocolate shake, so goooood. Grabbing that burger and seeing the juices drip from both sides, delicious yummy tasting sinning!

I really can't wait to go back here. :)
author: Henry P.

description: its right across the street from my place sooooo... I'm a fan. Pretty much everything is solid and HUGE. The buns they use aren't my favorite, but otherwise one of my regular food spots.
author: Matthew S.

description:
Reluctant 4 stars. 
Fries...delicious
Malt...delicious and thick
Deluxe Burger with Cheddar Cheese...good quality meat, good cheese, tasty bun, red onion, green lettuce (soggy, they should use romaine), big tomato. I personally think the burger would have tasted better with a little salt. It had none. 
Service...great, nice people, clean store-100% score for health inspection.
Bottom Line (and this is just my personal taste): The burgers are tastier at...Best'O Bugers, In N' Out, Flames, Bun Heaven, Pickles, Pete's Tavern, Brick House. Next time I'll ask them to season the burger a little.
author: Johnny O.

description: Good burgers for the price. Pretty greasy and not very flavorful burger patties though. I love the diner feel inside and it's clean which is a big plus. Not very much seating if you have a group of 3 or more.
author: Jessica M.

description: I had some friends from out of town visit and despite the small area...we fit our party of 8 in comfortably.  I was expecting my socks to be blown off, but they were.  Turkey burgers are usually ho-hum, but this one was cooked perfectly--succulent.  My hubbs had the special and my friends all had something different.  Not one negative comment...from the cleanliness, to the great customer service to the grub'n burgers, Garlic fries and shakes.  We were very, very happy.  Hubs said this is a definite come back must!  I agree...the banana chocolate shake was YUUUUM!
author: elizabeth c.

description:
Kick-Ass veggie burger, fries brought back nostalgic memories of a burger joint back in chitown (circa age three). what kinda place does that to the memories?  fries are just supposed to be these limpy pieces of potato heart-attack sticks, but damn!

the only reason this place doesnt get a 5 is that the veggie burger from lettus is a bit better, JIMO. non the less, go and get your carnivorousness on!
author: Ishmael V.

description:
Really I'm a fan. Man my Spicy Sly Burger was GOOOOOD! The meat had so much flavor. Loved the grilled red and green peppers and the grilled onions. And the mayo and pumpkin chili sauce - wow! 

I tried my friend's Phat Burger - bacon, and some other stuff I can't remember. All I know was that it wasn't as good as mine.

The "Spries" (half sweet potato / half regular fries) were yum. The sweet potato fries were crinkly, crisp on the outside - the way I like 'em...

I can't wait to go back to try their other special burgers. They have chicken varieties too. And tons of milk shakes. I can see why people love this place!
author: Cindy W.

description:
phat burgers!  A pretty small joint but they crank out some good burgers.  I gave the Prized Pearl (buffalo version) a try and was very satisfied.  The burger was thick and juicy.  For me burgers go into specific category with a few other foods.  Burgers are either good or better.  This was definitely a better.  Why no 5 stars you say?  Well its kinda outta the way and very very small.  Also, no real decor for a cool burger joint.  The inside is plain white, thats all.  They even got 100 on their inspection score, theres something wrong about that.  Grease should be flying!  anyways,  I'll come back if i'm ever in the area!

oh yeah, their stawberrry banana shake was pretty delish too
author: Steven H.

description: Besides getting yelled at for bringing in beers (Our fault; it's dry but we heard it was BYOB), we had a great time. The burgers are big and juicy, and the sweet potato fries and onion rings are excellent (skip the regular fries).
author: David S.

description: I can't believe It took me so long to try this place! It was SO good! I had the spicy sly with a turkey patty. The turkey was not dry at all. It was juicy and just all around delicious. I also had the nutella milk shake. Pretty amazing stuff. I had ordered two milkshakes, one for me and one for a colleague. They accidently charged me for three but I didn't notice. The manager/owner caught it while he was ringing me up and reimbursed me immediately. I appreciated the honesty. I will be back for sure!
author: Elizabeth T.

description: It was tasty!  We had some super garlicky french fries.  They were awesome.
author: Terri W.

description:
UNLIMITED PICKLES FOR THE WIN!

On a real note, delicious burgers and a meal worthy chili fries to boot.
Tip-request for grilled onions comes at no extra charge.
author: Doogie H.

description: Pretty great "artisanal" burgers. I had a big old monster with jack cheese and an onion ring inside, and a delicious milk shake. I'll probably add another star if I ever go there again.
author: Nick W.

description:
We had a Mushroom burger (kobe) and Bula burger (kobe) with two milk shakes. 

We ordered both burgers be medium rare and they came out medium and warm (not hot). The taste was good though they were both very messy. But that's part of eating a burger, though they seem drippier than most. 

The Bula burger included bacon which were a bit chewy. You can tell it was pre-made many hours ago. The Kobe meat was tasty but I wished was hot and not warm.

Milk shakes were good and thick. 

Seating was okay. They had their windows and door open so it was a bit cold during our SF evening dinner.
author: Em J.

description:
Delicious milkshakes + Open until 2am on weekends = Worst (and by worst I obviously mean best) combination ever. 

Pearl's makes it far too easy to make bad decisions and for that reason, we have a love/ hate relationship. The last time my boyfriend and I went to get our milkshake fix the guy behind the counter asked "which flavors?" before we even got the chance to say "two milkshakes, please."  This made me laugh but then I wondered...has my weekend Oreo milkshake addiction gotten out of hand? But then I realized, he hasn't memorized our flavors of choice yet, so we're still in the clear. The day he starts preparing one Oreo and one Peanut Butter milkshake when he sees us walk in will be the day I reevaluate my levels of milkshake consumption. Until then...mmmm milkshakes :) 


By the way, the burgers are great too (the Prized Pearl...yessss). I would get a milkshake AND a burger each Saturday night but that would be a little too much for my arteries to handle...
author: Amanda R.

description:
Pearl's makes really solid burgers. Very solid. But's not in the upper echelon of burgers that you get at places like Zuni or Nopa. For the price however, it's pretty unbeatable. I had the bacon and bleu cheese burger and wow...I actually felt my artery seize up. Perfect!

The sides are also a great selection, if not particularly delicious. I didn't find anything special about their sweet potato fries, garlic fries, or onion, but I appreciate that they had them. My friends say the milkshakes rock, so I'll go with their judgment on that.

Also, it's always a good thing that they are open late for cheap.  Pearl's is really good, but it's not great and it's not epic.
author: Tolga E.

description: Nothing special. Once Umami burger opens up, this place will fall under the radar. Buffalo burger was...standard. Couldn't tell the difference. I compare it to Nations. The diff types of burgers was fun to read, but not my steeze.
author: Tiffany L.

description: You in the mood for an extremely good handburger? Try eating one of these without breaking into uncontrollable orgasmic spasms. You'll fail for two reasons: 1. Because it's impossible due to how delicious they are 2. Because you fail at everything. You soiled what should have been the best years of my life, and for that I give you one withered star out of 5. Pearl's Deluxe Handburgers on the other hand, will receive 5 out of 5 golden, shiny stars and a kiss on the lips. Ground beef lips. *spasms*
author: Morgan C.
