description: Blue cheese bacon onion burger, buffalo burger, regular burger, sweet potato fries satisfy.  The garlic fries have staying power . . . in your mouth.
author: Natasha S.

description:
Chris Farley said it best in Tommy Boy:

"That....Was...Awwweeessome!"
author: Amanda P.

description:
So after deciding to drunk on an empty stomach and getting sloshed after drinking half the amount of liquor that it usually takes me to get drunk -- I needed to eat. I didn't know what would be open at about 1:00am to satisfy my hunger and Karleen suggested Pearls.

what a great choice!  They are open on Fridays and Saturdays until 2am which is sooo cool!   I got a mini burger which isn't so mini. It was the perfect size and it was juicy and delicious and the price is totally reasonable. The guy at the counter (forgive me for forgetting his name) was so so nice.  I jsut got a regular cheeseburger but this place offers so many different kinds that I wanna try them all!

The fries are freshly made and scrumptious and perfect with a whole bottle of ketchup. As people always ask me, "would you like some fries with your ketchup?" --- The fries were a delightful condiment to my ketchup.

I think I'll go there again soon. Very soon.  Like maybe by the end of the week.
author: Anne M.

description:
If you love delicious things. Get the Bula Burger. You will NOT be disappointed. 
This place is awesome.
author: Kevan M.

description: This place is friggen awesome. Pearls Deluxe burger is a basic, standard burger, but it is delicious. I usually get just the burger to go. The staff is friendly, and pushes your food out emensly quick without it being overcooked or wrong. My only problem is the place is tiny, and you do not have that much room to move around. The place is kinda off the beaten path, but you will get some tourist inside. Pearls at dinner time can get pack with people ordering, and waiting. The places stays open late on the weekends.
author: Nathan M.

description:
I've never had a bad burger here, although one time when I did a takeout order they forgot my sweet potato fries.  That aside though, this is always a solid choice.  It can get a little pricey for "fast food", especially if you are getting a specialty burger, but it is well worth the price.

Great food, nice staff, decent price.
author: Matt N.

description:
I love this place and I love the fact that it's right by where I live.    

There's not much space here but everything else about this place makes up for its lack of size.  The cashiers are super nice and friendly and the burgers are probably the best in the city.

I usually get the Pearl's mini, which is your typical burger, and plenty enough for me.  On my more indulgent days, I've had the deluxe pearl's burger (also your typical burger, but bigger than the mini), the Bula Burger, and the Phat Bob.  I recommend all of those, but be careful, they get really messy.

Other stuff I've tried:

-Chocolate shake:  Decent
-Fries:  Occasionally I get them a little soggy, other times they are perfect
-Frings:  Fries and onion rings; I noticed they tend to skimp on the onion rings, so if that's what you're really going for, just order onion rings
-Garlic fries:  Love it!!  Super garlic-y.  Like the kind that makes your stomach ache, in a good way (but maybe not so much if you're with a date).
author: Michelle N.

description:
Wow, what a find.  If you like/love burgers, you have to give this place a try.  

I got the deluxe burger with bacon and cheese.  This might sound weird, but the bacon was actual bacon, not the crispy flavored flakes that other places try to pass off as bacon.  The cheese was perfectly melted, and the meat was juicy and delicious.  

We split a fries/onion rings side, and gobbled everything up in a flash.  Definitely worth the money, and the trip.
author: Matt P.

description:
What can I say, I didn't think that a burger could bring me closer to God -- and all for under $10.00!  I stopped by this joint after a late nite movie at the Lumiere.  We didn't have a chance to have dinner before the show, so by the time we got out, I was ravenous.  I had the teriyaki burger and it was juicy, delicious and completely hit the spot.  We ordered the frings and they were equally yummy and crispy!

The next time you have a burger craving...check out Pearl's, I promise you won't be disappointed.
author: Pilar P.

description:
I want to give this place four stars real bad because the burgers are awesome, but the fries are always hit or miss which can be frustrating when you want a good burger AND fries. Some days they're good Some days they're just limp... and that's when they're just the worst.

Hey Pearl's.... Please do something about those fries!!!!!!
author: Davin A.

description: The sercvice is really good...friendly staff. However, their burger is kinda overrated IMHO. It is a good burger but not like the top 10 I've ever had. Very busy place... I'll probably have to line up sometimes
author: Omar E.

description:
I know Pearl's is #1 on many people's "Best Burger in SF" lists, but it's never been able to supplant Gott's Roadside (formerly Taylor's) in my burger-loving heart.  That said, I still find myself craving a Pearl's Deluxe burger on a fairly regular basis.

Even though I love me some ground beef, I know it's better to sometimes opt for a "healthier" option.  Pearl's comes in handy because, as good as their beef burgers are, their buffalo burgers really aren't much of a drop-off in taste and juiciness.  When I want to get my burger fix but don't want to consume the requisite calories/fat/cholesterol to do so, I know a Pearl's buffalo burger is a perfect compromise.

While the burger is the star of the show, you can always count on equally tasty fries and milkshakes.
author: Patrick H.

description: I ordered a veggie burger with cheese and mushrooms, and somehow the clerk took it as mushroom burger sub veggie patty and charged $2 more! What's the difference? I'm not one to complain but it was a silly charge. My fries were ok, not bad not great. The coffee shake was delicious. I wish they put more pizazz into the veggie burger as they do with the other menu items.
author: James P.

description:
I would actually do 3 and 1/2.  Nice people, clean place, clear menu, nice choices.  They asked me how I wanted my burger cooked? Major points!
The burger was good, not great.  I certainly wouldn't put it on par with the Slow Club burger or even the Red Onion Burger in the East Bay.  It's a solid place to have a burger at lunch, especially given it's location.  I will definitely be back.  I do however think that some of these reviews are a bit hyperbolic in their assessments.  But hey, that's what Yelp is about right? People are able to express their opinions.  
I would suggest using better hamburger buns as a start.  Also the Onion rings have pepper in them, which doesn't excite me.  An acquired taste.
author: Ron T.

description:
I thought this place would be a lot better based on the reviews..I was very excited to try some bison, but in the end I ended up missing the good old hormone injected beef haha...

Me and a friend ordered -

--Pearl deluxe with cheese and upgraded to the buffalo meat... Surpringsly bison meat taste really beefy and it was good. However, I found it kinda dry and I missed the juicy fatty flavor or beef, but that's just me. I loved the burger bun... It seemed fresh like not the ones that come in packages...
-- shroom burger with the upgrade to estancia beef... Again I could tell the difference in taste.. Lets just say it's really strong....
--- onion rings, garlic fries and a drink- noting special

I was a bit surprised when everything came out to be $30... I thought it would ve cheaper but I guess with all the upgrades it really adds up.
author: krystina ann r.

description:
The burgers are huge, beefy, and greasy... just the way I like them. The chili cheese fries are goopy and cheesey and sloppy... Also highly recommended. And the shakes are very thick and tasty. I've gone here with my boyfriend a number of times, and I always love it.

But it's not all meat juices and oozing cheese. I recall getting a chicken pesto thing that was mighty tasty when I was not in a cheeseburgery mood.

If you think burgers should be meaty and juicy, and not something you eat to get in the best shape of your life, I believe Pearl's is definitely the way to go!
author: Trish B.

description: The burgers are AMAZING! I went with my sister and best friend, we all got different burgers and split them. Also had the sweet potato fries (yum!) and onion rings (another yum!). We all walked away STUFFED and completely satisfied.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I feel lucky to live as close as I do to Pearl's. 

The burgers are incredible (I especially like the Phat Bob which is what I order most often knowing full well the cardiological ramifications), but let's talk about an oft-overlooked detail: the bun.

Best hamburger bun I've ever had that isn't some sort of fancy ass ciabatta, hands down. It's kind of like a french roll with sesame seeds, but still shaped like a burger bun. It's never too hard  or difficult to bite through like some french bread can be, but strong enough that the structural integrity isn't compromised by the greasiness/sauciness of the burger. I really cannot say enough about these fabulous buns.

The breading on the onion rings isn't my favorite, it's almost like the breading you'd find on some fried chicken. Too floury or something.

They have both beef and buffalo burgers and good milkshakes in a ton of flavors. Everyone who works there is friendly and if you order for take-out they wait until you come to pick it up to cook your fries so that they're fresh and hot when you take them away. A nice touch. Also, an inspection score of "100" from the Dept. of Public Health. Bonus.

Maybe my favorite hamburger place this side of Bill's on Clement.
author: Trav W.

description:
This is as good as it gets for burger joints.  Pearl's is in the highest leauge for burger quality.  The burgers must weigh at least half a pound each.  They are PACKED with whatever you like.  

They have loads of options and combinations for you to pick from.  Unless you have a huge mouth, you are going to have to cut up the burger or esle to just falls apart ont he way up to your mouth....which is a good thing.  When you ask for avacado (for $1 extra) they really pile it on.  It's awesome.  Same with other things you want extra on it for $1.  

There isn't much room inside to sit, so it's great that they have take out.  They give you a lot of fries too.  The fries my friends and I got were a little too soggy for my taste, but they were still good.  They have onion rings, french fries, and some other fries options as well.  They've got soda and other drinks like Snapple, Rockstar, etc.  

It's a bit spendy, but the dangerous thing is, the burgers are worth every penny.  In fact for how much quality the burgers are, they could get away with having them cost a bit more.  Expect to spend $9-$13 on a combo.  It's worth it.  Go here, now!
author: Mason P.

description: i first was introduced to this place because my friends wanted great burgers and came here  Its in a ghettoer part of town but the burgers kick butt! its so juicey and they have different size burgers if u are feeling really hungry or not so much.  The sweet potato fries are a must.  this place is soooooo good, leaving u wanting more!
author: kini m.

description: We took our "Pearl's Deluxe" w/ cheddar cheese, no onions and garlic fries on the side to Union Square and people watched on a busy Saturday afternoon. Strangely, grass fed beef burgers don't taste like the ordinary burger. Perhaps Pearl's Burgers are what burgers should actually taste like. Almost like living in black and white and suddenly waking up to see color.
author: Pax, Formerly Known As Rufus D.

description:
Was lead to pearls burger via yelp and was not let down ! I ordered " the winning " Bula burger which came with Swiss cheese, bacon, mayo (can do w/o) and huge piece of burger smothered in the award winning spicy teriyaki sauce (also added mushrooms) and this definitely hit the spot ! No wonder why Bobby Flay and Anne Burrell voted this burger a winner..

Bf ordered the "Phat Bob" included bacon, onion rings, Swiss, and smothered in BBQ sauce. We also got sides of garlic fries and onion rings which were pretty good as well ! Left super full, satisfied and with leftovers for later so we decided this isn't the last time we'll be here ! Took away one star because the place is so tiny and burgers this good need a bigger spot so more people can see what the hype is all about !
author: Ry And Tiff B.

description: Stopped in for dinner with wife and kids. It was very crowded with not much seating. I ordered the phat burger. It was really good. The bun was fresh too. Wife ordered the one with bleu cheese, bacon and grilled onions. She loved it. Kids ordered regular cheese burgers. They are so NOT adventurous but they inhaled them. Fries and onion rings were great too. Everything was really good except for the lack of seating. Go get one!
author: M L.

description:
a hole in the wall place with quality fast-food.

since everyone in line before us ordered milkshakes, well, guess what, we also had to get the milkshakes, thick and sweet, their newest flavor is nutella

burgers cooked just as you like. i was impressed with the bread used for the buns, fresh and high quality.

we will be back again for more

the biggest drawback was the size of the place because you may not be able to get a place to sit down but found out this was actually larger than many of the dining places in the area
author: s l.

description: It's really good. One to many onions on my burger and my medium was more like medium rare, but its not to bad. Really close to where I'm at so I will probably eat there again.
author: Zac B.

description:
I feel like the regular hamburgers are just ok and the prices have become quite steep for a burger joint. I like to get the special burgers rather than getting a normal one. The teriyaki burger and teriyaki chicken sandwich are quite good and I don't mind paying their prices for those.

Last time I went, I got the garlic fries. There was so much garlic I nearly died in garlicy ecstasy.
author: Stephen C.

description: I'm only giving Pearle's 3 stars because I got the hamburger to go and I think it would have been much better if I stayed there.  Nice place though with a good selection of burgers and chicken.  I had a strawberry shake as well with an extra wide straw to get all of the strawberry pieces through it.  The shake was the best part of the meal for me but I will definitely head back and give it another try.
author: Blake B.

description: one of the best burgers I've had in my life. Spicy sly burger packed a kick. Totally didn't expect it. Must return SOON :]
author: Peter P.

description: Teriyaki  kobe burger with bacon and springs. BEST BURGER OF LIFE
author: Ksenya R.

description: I had the bula burger since they won a burger contest with it, and it did not disappoint. The sauce was nice and tangy, and really complimented the burger. I was with 2 other people and they loved their burgers as well. One was even full, and continued to finish her burger because it was that good.
author: Jen K.

description:
It's worth it every penny when you spent in this rest.

Best garlic fries compare with other place, Pearl's use the real garlic and for sweet potato fries (no regret for those who like sweet) and the last but not least is their REAL onion ring (they don't sell from the frozen) but the fresh one, and you can combine to be springs (sweet potato fries and onion ring) or 1/2 onion ring w/garlic fries, or regular fries with sweet potato fries (what a great idea)

Two thumps up for all special burger even the regular one still the best, give a shot for their cole slaw and their salad (asian) and for dessert their milkshake cool bean (my fav is pumpkinto bad its based on season) and all from the fresh fruit.

As far as i know there is no rest who concern bout health for their customer beside Pearl's reason they use "special" oil to do cook even for fries (check on the side of the fountain drink machine) i forgot the brand.

you don't believe give it a shot my suggest !!
author: christine s.

description: Not as good as the reviews here would lead you to believe.  I've been here twice and both times my gut was busted.  Kept burping up that greasy thing for hours after.
author: Michael R.

description: If you're in San Francisco, you can't miss this place!  Best burger I have ever had!  I got their burger that they used to compete in a SF burger contest and won!  I got it with Kobe beef.  Something I'll never forget!
author: Craig B.

description:
Super good!

If it's your first time, get the Bula Burger w/ sweet potato fries. And if your really into it-get a milkshake while your at it.
author: Steven K.

description:
The organic beef burgers here are decent, but I was disappointed by their turkey burgers. They were a bit drier than I was used to--NYC delis totally spoiled me! 

The prices are okay, but don't include fries. So once you add that and a drink--it might be more than you generally want to pay for a burger. And I always do takeout because the little eating area is tiny and well lacking in atmosphere.
author: Jamila C.

description:
Pearl's is a great place to get a burger. They can get a little expensive with all the extra's they offer, but fairly reasonable considering the quality. Big thick burgers, old school milk shakes, and lets not forget the sweet potato fries! Definitely try the Bula Burger, a spicy teriyaki burger with pineapple, and swiss cheese. 

Pros:
Great burgers, great shakes, friendly staff. 

Cons:
Small place, you'll almost never get a seat during rush hours. Burgers are a little over priced, but the quality is worth it.
author: John H.

description: Best burger I have have ever had bar none. The location is very small but that adds to the experiance. Can't wait to try the Alameda locations.
author: John K.

description:
2.5 stars, but granting them 3 since they were really nice folks serving up the burgers inside. I tried the Prized Pearl burger, which has bacon, sauteed onions, crumbled blue cheese, and mayo for $6.95. I also had the half order of sweet potato fries and a small soda. Whole bill came to $12-something.

The burger was a little dry and flavorless (just the meat). I liked the melty blue cheese and grilled onions, but with the bland patty and bland bun, it just didn't work for me. And it's big! You will not leave hungry.

The sweet potato fries were delicious. Thin, crispy outside/soft inside, nicely salted. 

Nice little place, but I won't be visiting it again.
author: Erin O.

description:
The Tenderloin has a lot to offer if you're looking to score crack, catch an airborne disease, observe the homeless or catch an hourly rate at some broken down cesspool of a motel.  Unfortunately, I cannot add grabbing a hamburger to that list.

My wife and I tried Pearl's on a whim since there was so much chatter about it.  While good I cannot give it the gold medal, more like Honorable Mention.  There is no doubt some serious competition when it comes to burgers in San Francisco.  Of it's competitors that beat this out, I'd have to argue the main difference between this place and those is the beef patty was molded before thrown on the grill.

I don't claim to know the practices of Pearl's but looking at the patty it looked previously frozen rather than molded from fresh ground beef.  The patty at Pearl's was perfectly circular leading me to believe it wasn't molded by hand before making it's way directly to the fate of a hot grill.  

The taste of the burger while subjective was just okay.  Nothing really stood out for me.  The fries were crispy and hot and the milkshake was delicious.  The price was a bit lower than some of the better competitors around the city but to pay for parking evened the score.  

Bullshead still tops the leader board out here in SF.
author: Bill P.

description:
I am rarely at a loss for words when writing a review but this about sums it up:

They have burgers and they are REALLY REALLY good.

Wish I had an option to replace the lettuce with sprouts though!
author: Cindy P.

description: If there was a competition for the best burgers on the planet, Pearl's would definitely be a hard contestant to beat!!!!
author: Yasmine F.

description: "Great hole-in-the-wall" status. Shakes are like a dream come true. Burgers follow suit in that same dream.
author: Nate M.

description: Really, this was over-hyped. I got a mushroom burger and it was decent but nothing special. I also got a peanut butter milkshake which was more impressive than the burger which would be okay except the burgers are what people seem to be crazy for at this place. Basically, if you're in the area already and feel like having a burger, by all means, but don't go out of your way to try this place out.
author: Josh M.

description:
3.5 stars would be perfect for this place...but alas, there are only whole star options.  So 3 is going to have to do -- perhaps on my next visit we'll up to 4.

Actually -- based on the burger along, definitely 4 stars.  But adding in the fries pulls it down to 3 stars.  Reason -- fries were undercooked, blech!

Reasons to go: 
- Fast and easy
- Burger meat is good, and even has hints of red in it -- rare for fast food joint
- Fountain soda was top-notch on my visit
author: John R.

description:
Not bad. I liked having the option of organic beef or buffalo if I so wanted (we went for the organic beef). Their sweet potato fries were rather delicious (once again, not the best I have ever had --- and their ranch came in little packets). The shake was pretty good (banana chocolate) though the banana was a bit over-ripe for my taste. Overall --- not terrible..but not so great either. They have extended their hours for the weekend so if you have hit the bars and need a burger --- go for it..otherwise..I would save myself for something better. 

They have a Mill Valley location which is supposed to be better..if I go again..that will be the one I will try.
author: Natalie G.

description:
3 stars for the food, and +0.5 for the above-average service.

This might be un-American, but every time I tried any of their deluxe burgers, I'm distracted by how messy/greasy/about-to-fall-apart my burger is to notice much of the taste. The burgers go far beyond the "This is a juicy burger" threshold and into "It's just sloppy." It doesn't taste bad, really -- I especially like their sauteed onions -- but I'd like to settle for smaller, more manageable burgers.

Their side orders, while somewhat creative (frings, a plate with half onion rings and half fries), aren't too good, either. They use thick-cut fries that taste soggy, and there's nothing worse than using soggy fries for chili cheese fries.
author: Ryo M.

description:
Read about it. Had even wrote down a day in my planner to go because I was so excited, but only to realize it was closed on Sundays, but lucky for me, it was Indigenous People's Day the next day, so off I go on my burger frenzy. I am weird indeed. 

New favorite burger joint. Friendly staff, awesome food...what more can a girl ask for? Based on a fellow yelpers review, we had the mushroom burger and the King Burger (I think)...a burger with a sliced up hot dog. Added in sweet potato fries and a strawberry shake.

Result: we were both disgustingly full and had a doggy bag of sweet potato fries and all for about $30. Can't beat that.  Woo hoo!
author: Dolores L.

description:
This is how burgers should be.  No frills, just quality meat on a sesame seed bun.

Party of 2.

Highlights:
Pesto Buffalo Burger, Sweet Potato Fries, Onion Rings, To Go orders

Deltas:
The King, the neighborhood.

Overall:
This place makes burgers with simple, fresh toppings with your choice of meat.  I had one of their burgers two days ago, and I'm still savoring.  Patties are cooked to perfection and the topping ingredients are made fresh (like their pesto).  The sweet potato fries and onion rings are a perfect side to accompany these surprisingly filling burgers.  Free complimentary pickles!  It's in the TL, what do you expect?
author: Michael L.

description:
Okay so I saw a few people say their food was soggy and that's why they didn't like Pearls. 
I've been coming here for over a year and this place has never done me wrong. Always one of the best hamburgers I've ever had. I've had them all, but my personal favorite is the Avocado Burger. Its not on the menu but its the chicken substitute a hamburger. Deliciousness at its best. The shakes are outstanding and the fries are crispy and NEVER soggy! The buffalo meat is always a must do. So between price, taste, and convenience 4 our of 5 stars.
author: Chris S.

description: Yup... just as I suspected.  That nutella shake is the best milkshake I've ever had.
author: Jannea T.

description: Great prices, excellent meat quality. I love the teriyaki burger w/out mayo. It's tasty and messy, just the way I like it.  Plus it's Tyler Florence's favorite burger. If it's good enough for him, it's good enough for me.
author: Brian H.

description: Went here based on reviews from Yelp.  First thing I noticed was a delicious smell inside, which is always a good sign.  Ordered a mushroom burger with buffalo meat, which I found tasted no different from beef.  Overall, the burger was very good.  The bun was superb, as it was very soft and tasty.  The burger itself was very good, although it did not rewrite burger history as we know it.  Had an Oreo shake which was very very good, but then again, it is just a shake.  Ice cream, milk...I mean what is there to screw up?  Had garlic fries as well, which were just regular french fries, but covered in actual real pieces of chopped garlic which was a nice touch.  They definitely had a strong garlic flavor as well.  Overall, very good, although pricey.  For two buffalo burgers ($4 more per burger for buffalo), 2 shakes and 2 small orders of fries, it was $42.
author: A. L.

description: the best burger ever!!!  it was my first time here and i was told the buffalo burger was good so i got it. YUM!! i had it to go and it was still so good. next time i got to make it there earlier so i can experience the real thing with the sweet potato fries.
author: Mai-Tam N.

description:
This place is THE BEST for good ol' greasy, bad-for-you diner food.  We tried The King, the Prized Pearl, the Mushroom Burger, veggie burger (for the one odd-ball health fanatic in the group) onion rings, garlic fries, sweet potato fries and a vanilla shake.  They were all incredibly yummy.  The only drawback is the limited seating.  

The only bad thing is that we are now hooked.  Better start buying those larger sized clothes at all the after-Christmas sales.
author: Jo Anne G.

description: Yum!!!! I got the burger with bacon and blue cheese with sweet potato fries... wow! I will definitely go back to try something new the next time I'm in SF.
author: Geena B.

description: The place is a little hard to find at first but once you find this little gem of San Francisco you'll be so glad you did.  Tiny place inside but definitely workable.  Nicest friendly staff and super quick service.  The burgers are pretty damn big and pretty damn amazing!  I have had both the beef and buffalo and both are delicious, messy and juicy...so damn good.  I hear their sweet potato fries are unreal, i dont eat SP fries, but their onion rings are fantastic.  If you live in the area or just passing through definitely make this place one of your stops!
author: James E.

description: What a cool place. What an awesome burger. I haven't had that many burgers in SF but this is definitely the best one. And possibly in my top 10 ever. Yum. Thanks Pearl!
author: Stefano F.

description: Hands down the best hamburgers in SF and man have I been looking. The Bula burger they have is on point a tangy teriyaki sauce with small bits of pineapple is awesome especially when it oozes out and you can dip those oh so good spries. Oh and the bacon compliments that juicy hamburger patty. And the bun actually stays together unlike those other burger spots whose buns just deteriorate upon initial bite. All in all a great constructed sandwich.
author: Luigi B.

description: Although the burgers are really, really good I usually order an Asian Chicken salad when I go here. I dig the apples, walnuts, grilled chicken and the teriyaki-style sauce. Sometimes they're a little heavy with the sauce, but 9 times out of 10 things are spot on. Recently tried the Cobb salad and that was just as enjoyable -- looks like I have some tough decisions ahead of me.
author: Claudia P.

description: Just a flawless burger. Juicy, runny, perfectly seasoned and cooked. Loses points only for the fries, which are good but ordinary. Nothing wrong with the Pearl's Deluxe with bacon and cheese, though.
author: Dave S.

description:
Very small dine-in area, in a neighborhood that has never been voted to be among the most pleasant neighborhoods in the city. Painful flourescent lighting, Spartan little tables, hard impersonal linoleum. Side orders don't come with the order - that means no fries, no drinks with that burger. The two women who took orders and made the food were nice enough. They took orders with a smile and walked your food over to your table promptly enough. This place takes cash and plastic, and you can call in for takeout. I see enough locals walking in here, which is a good sign. 

Oh, and great feature: the choice of having your burger in full size (1/2lb.) or mini (1/4lb.).

If we're talking just about taste, the burgers are good. But the burgers are badly built. More bread than meat. Also, when you bite down on one side, all the toppings come squirting and squishing out the other side, and you don't really get any in your mouth. Very irritating, especially when you're trying to finish. 

I don't know if I'd come back. If so, it would be to give the other burgers a try - they have as many creations as some ice cream stores have flavors. The Prized Pearl with the blue cheese and grilled onions tasted off, and I was biologically punished for it later. But most likely I'll be at Grubsteak instead, seeing what all the talk is about.
author: Clar L.

description:
The most important thing to remember about Pearl Burger is that they are closed on Sunday! I once made the trek here with and out of town friend, only to find these wonderful establishment is closed on Sunday.

The milkshakes are pretty good, I recommend trying the chocolate one.

I usually get an organic burger, either with mushrooms or with cheese. The patty is cooked medium by default, so you'll get a little bit of pink. The fries are usually crisp to a little squishy, but delicious.

There are spear pickles at the counter that you can help yourself to. I didn't realize this until I saw someone raiding the pickle jar while I was waiting for my order.

Service is good, burgers are one of the few in the city I always enjoy, and the cashiers are usually friendly or stoned.

The 27 will take you near here, otherwise, aim for the metered parking.

Edit: Pearl Burger now puts organic beef in all their burgers by default. I've been here many times since my first review, and the quality and service with a smile is still there.
author: Mark B.

description:
This place could be dangerous... since it's located just a block from my apartment!   The menu looks fabulous and it took me a long time to decide from all the burger selections, but the food is just OK.

I loved the fact that they offer Springs (1/2 fries and 1/2 onion rings) but those Springs had sprung~  they really had no flavor, at all.  I opted for the banana/chocolate shake which was pretty good, but I could not get over the 'burger experience'.   I ordered the smaller burger, but even though it was not the full 1/2 pound patty, it still was not cooked enough.  It is posted that all hamburgers are cooked to be medium, but this burger was quite red in the middle.  I had taken it to go, so I was not able to ask for a new burger, thus  I simply ate around the edges where it simply light pink.  

The place is clean and the people are friendly, but the food just doesn't cut it.
author: Karen W.

description:
Pearl's burgers ranks up there with my favorite bistro burgers (Chez Maman, Bistro Aix, Absinthe, The Richmond, etc.) but without the pretension. You can order the burger any way you want--I went simple and had a cheddar & avocado mini burger. My bf had the grilled onion and blue cheese special--yum!

Super extra bonus points because they have an all you can eat fresh pickle jar. What would push Pearl's over the top is if they served wine. For some reason, I love a good burger with some good wine. Our simple solution was to go to the liquor store around the corner and just brown bag a bottle. Problem solved!
author: L N.

description:
The sides at Pearl's Deluxe Burgers were delicious, especially the sweet potato fries. For two people, I would recommend someone ordering the half French fries/half sweet potato fries basket, and the other person ordering the half onion rings/half sweet potato fries basket. 

As for my burger, I ordered the Spicy Sly Burger.  The chili and toppings on the burger were very good but the burger itself was lacking seasoning, and the bun wasn't anything special. If only there was an In-N-Out Burger next  to Pearl's Deluxe Burgers.   The toppings would have been delicious on a flavorful In-N-Out burger served on a toasted bun.
author: Josh K.

description:
I usually only go to Post street to grab some Indonesian food around the corner, but one day while on my way to the Indonesian restaurant I found parking on the street. I dived right in the spot, and it just happened to be in front of Pearl's Deluxe Burgers... I honestly didn't even know it existed, but judging by the line, and that I was greeted on the street by the owner, I decided to try it. I stood in line like everyone else, and studied the menu.  I was surprised to see that they had Buffalo Burgers. The only other place I had that was in Vegas, and it cost me an arm and a leg.  I decided on getting a Buffalo Bacon Swiss cheese burger, with some garlic fries, and a vanilla shake.  I was also surprised because it was so clean, everyone was always cleaning the tables, the floors, the counter tops, washing, etc... you would think that the smell of cleaning supplies would over power the smell of the restaurant, but it didn't. I found that my mouth was starting to water while waiting for my burger, all the smells, and watching the other customers eat their food was to much to handle.  I wanted my burger asap so I can see if it tasted as good as it smelt and looked. 

Well as the 5 stars indicated above shows, the burger was amazing.  The taste of the buffalo was not gamy as I had expected, but very neutral and tasty.  Then the bacon was amazingly crispy, and the garlic fries were not to overpowering with garlic.  Washing the food down with the shake was also another bonus, it wasn't to heavy at all, and I didn't have to suck on the straw so hard that I felt like I was going to pass out.  I couldn't believe that everything I had touched and ordered was made to perfection.  Usually, the fries are soggy, and the meat is over cooked, or the vegetables are not fresh, but everything on my plate including the shake was exceptional.  Then I couldn't help but notice that the cashier / owner was very communicative with the customers.  Joking around, laughing, and making adequate small talk.  I hate it when owners, waiters, or cashiers, tend to jaber on and on, while you are trying to savor the food you have in front of you.  Anyways, I walked out of the store thinking that it may have been because I was so hungry that the food was so good, so I came back again with my wife and friends hoping to have a negative feedback. I was wrong, everyone loved it, they had the same opinions I did about the restaurant, burgers, owner, shakes, etc.  

A definite 5 stars for Pearl's and thank you for bringing the restaurant to Post street. I have gone back about 9 times now and have become a regular.  I definitely recommend the restaurant to anyone in the Bay Area, the drive will be worth it. 

Steven W
author: Steven W.

description: This is really the best burger you can get for your money in the city. The burgers I've had here have been juicy hot and delicious. Really not much more is needed.
author: Clifford C.

description:
I'm not in SF often anymore, but if I'm craving a burger there I'm generally going after In 'N' Out. My schedule didn't allow for a visit there this time but I did have the opportunity to get to Pearl's. It was great!

A little restaurant, Pearl's offers counter service and a few tables. The menu is bigger than one would expect - there were a lot of burger options, including buffalo (nice!) but I went for the mini deluxe with cheddar, fries, and a chocolate shake. It was hard to pass up the Nutella Shake (!) (!!)

Burgers are cooked to medium by default, so I went with that. The burger was really enjoyable. It was juicy and flavorful. I also appreciated the bun: instead of a generic, sad sesame seed bun, this was a more substantial, heartier one. Good stuff. Oh, and they use Niman Ranch beef - that's another plus in my book!

The fries were addictive, and the shake was excellent and real (thankfully) - none of this "not a real milkshake" junk. 

Pricing is about what I expect downtown; the whole meal was about $12.

All told, though, I'm really glad I tried Pearl's and would definitely go back for another tasty burger!
author: Paul M.

description:
Once I got into Yelp, I started only eating at places I find on Yelp. It really helps to have an iPhone because you can search places near your current location. It's the best way to go when visiting another city.

I found great reviews of Pearl's on this site so I decided to try it out. Holy crap was it amazing!! That is definitely one of the best burgers I've ever tried. I got beef, but you can pay extra for buffalo as well. My selection was the Phat Boy Burger, which is like a western burger. My side was sweet potato fries. I was very excited to see they had these! I try them any chance I get and these were tops.

Besides having amazing burgers and sweet potato fries, they have a huge milkshake selection. Even though it was February, they still offered pumpkin shakes. I'm a big fan of seasonal pumpkin and this did not let me down.

Oh, and they are open pretty late!
author: scott b.

description: This is by far the best burger I've had in a long time.  In fact, I can't remember the last time I had such a great burger.  This is the place to go if you are craving a burger.  Its not cheap but not expensive.  I spent $40 for two people.  We had two kobe deluxe beef burgers with onion ring, cheese, and bacon.  Had a small side of sweet potato fries and a side of regular french fries.  Fries are cooked in trans fat free rice bran oil.  Also, had a mint oreo shake and soda.  The mint oreo shake was so f***in' good.
author: Brad F.

description: We're staying at Hotel Serrano and looking for a dinner spot  I injured my knee today and am having a hard time walking. Found Pearl's on Yelp. Close by with takeout. Called to order. And I was asked how I was doing- sweet & sincere. I already love this place!  My husband went to pick up, ready in 10 minutes. The hamburgers were amazing!  He forgot the ketchup, but this mushroom burger was delicious on its own. Choc shake was good & brilliantly served with a super wide straw!  Onion rings & sweet potato fries were good, but would have been better if eaten before being shut in a box to take home.  Truly the best burger ever!
author: Lisa G.

description: Came here back in June when I was visiting some friends up in the Bay area. Prized Pearl was money! Even better when they cooked it to medium! Blue cheese, bacon, mayo and onions are definitely a great combo. Garlic fries here are some of the best I've ever had anywhere. My only complaint would be the patty wasn't seasoned quite enough, but the mustard they provide at the tables added some nice tang and seasoning. Will definitely be hitting this place up again when I return to the bay.
author: Lucas Y.

description: Came in the other night for another burger. We waited a while and what ended up happening is another customer accidentally took our order and we had to wait a little longer for ours to be made again. One of the employees apologized and refunded our money. These guys are great!
author: Wes K.

description: A bit pricey but well well well worth it! I got the teriyaki burger with onion rings instead of grilled mushrooms, which the guys behind the counter had no problem doing for me. Bit into one of the greatest burgers of my life tonight. I'll be going there quite often.
author: Spencer M.

description: Yes... Just, yes.
author: Peter F.

description: Best burgers and milkshakes EVER!  I'm a huge snob when it comes to burgers and this one wins, hands down.  Fairly new (last five years or so I believe).  My favorite burger joint in S.F. was on 16th St near the Mission.  It closed down some years ago to my severe disappointment.  But a couple years later, I discovered Pearl's and never turned back.  They serve bison meat and you can really customize your toppings, which are very tasty, by the way!  And they have a long long list of milkshake flavors you can get (I recommend blueberry).  The diameter of the straw they give you is the size of a nickel.  It's awesome!  Great counter service.  Very small diner, but highly recommend!
author: Paul S.

description:
I'm a picky eater and don't like a whole lot of burgers, but oh man do I like Pearl's!  

I used to always get the mini with cheese (american or cheddar), which is awesome,  but now that I've tried the Kobe beef burger, I don't think I can go back.  

Now, I usually go with my bf and we get a Kobe burger with cheese and bacon with an order of fries and share it, and get a milkshake each ( I get mint chocolate or mint oreo, yum! and the bf gets strawberry, which he says is deelish as well), and that's the perfect amount of food for both of us.

The service is always great.  One of the cashier girls even remembers us and has them cut the burger in half so we can share without us even having to ask, so sweet!

My only complaint, which doesn't even deserve the deduction of a star, imo, is that the place is really small.  I wish they could expand so we could take a huge group in there!
author: Stephanie W.

description: Pearl's has become our go to burger place.  Lucky for us it is right up the street and when you call in an order the food is ready within 10 minutes for pick up.  It doesn't get any better than a regular Pearl deluxe with cheddar for me.  The meat is so juicy and always cooked the right way.  The fries are pretty good but not nearly as special as the burger experience.  The chili cheese fries were definitely a miss...could use some work.  But overall....a pearls deluxe with cheese, side of fries and a delicious banana chocolate shake makes me a very happy girl.
author: Kalin K.

description: WOOOOOOOOHOOOOOOO!!  Kobe Burgers!  Simply put, Happiness on a Bun.  I've now eaten my way through the entire menu, and am a better person for the experience.  Every bite is not just satisfying, but just as intense as the first.  THE BEST DAMN BURGER HANDS DOWN!  This place should be on everyone's bucket list.  The employees make the experience that much more enjoyable.  Friendly and delightful.  Thanks Pearl's for helping me experience true mouth orgasm.
author: Michael M.

description: Probably the best burger place in SF - their awards seem to confirm this. Wide range of delicious burgers: especially good kobe beef and buffalo options.
author: Josiah M.

description: food is so good omgggg the only problem is that its too much money
author: Jeremiah M.

description: this is a way delayed review...nonetheless, this place gets mad kudos...the burger was juicy and with the self service pickles, this camper was extra satisified! Topped it all off with the peanut butter/chocolate shake...divinity in a cup...haul ass and get yourself some!
author: Season F.

description: i wanted to eat here every day on my vacation...amazing burgers and love love love the garlic fries!! super speedy service too!
author: Angela S.

description:
This is a fantastic burger place.  A hole in the wall, no frills, but super yummy.  I rank it above Burgermeister and Burger Joint.  It's different than Big Mouth or Whiz Burger, so it's not better or worse.

Chili is great, organic burger is fantastic, delicious onion rings.  And fresh banana milkshakes?  Yum!

Go here now.
author: Lita F.

description:
I don't eat burgers often, but it's so nice to have a place in the neighborhood to pop into on the way home from the bar (I have them on speed dial on my cell phone, so it will be hot and in a to-go bag by the time I arrive). 

I love that they have choices other than the usual beef-- veggie burgers, Buffalo burgers and gourmet (I think it's hormone free or organic or something- basicly a happier cow).

The sweet potato fries are awesome too.
author: Lisa R.

description:
I guess one could opt for a chicken sandwich--all of which sound and look good--but as the name says, Pearl's is about burgers. And that's about it (except for fries, shakes, etc.).

Not quite as greasy as a diner, but also not necessarily a gourmet experience either, Pearl's is a very friendly and clean but no-nonsense burger joint.

The prices are phenomenal, considering it's only a couple of bucks more for a burger that what you'd spend at a fast food joint.

As far as being in the Tenderloin: Don't sweat it. It's definitely more "Lower Nob Hill" than the TL.
author: Derek R.

description:
So I was watching the episode of Quantum Leap where Sam leaps into the body of a 1961 greaser teenager, and in one scene eats a hamburger, fries and a shake.  Cravings followed.

I went to Pearl's and ordered the Bula Burger, Oreo Shake, and Sweet Potato Fries.  I was stuffed after half the shake, but nibbled my way throughout the day on the rest. 

The shake was delish, and was served with a really wide straw so the Oreo pieces didn't get caught at the bottom (genius!).  The Bula Burger was regrettably missing the pineapple slice, which seemed to be the experience of someone else.  So, don't get all excited about the pineapple, it might not happen!  The fries were almost excellent.  The service was so happy and smiley, which is exactly how I feel it should be when I'm about ready to eat thirty billion calories.  My only complaint was the bun - too big and flaky.  

As if it is possible, Quantum Leap is even better because it brought me back into the burger scene, which Fast Food Nation took me out of a little less than a year ago.  I am glad that I chose my reinduction to take place at Pearl's.  I will be going there again for sure.
author: Nicole A.

description:
Super Delicious burger for only $6!  Great quality, friendly help and pronto service!  
I finally understand why I moved to the Tenderloin...
author: Matt V.

description:
- Fries = awesome (they are crisp and generously given).

 - Mushroom Burger = awesomer (they really pile on the mushrooms with the burger...can't go wrong with that).

 - Oreo Shake = awesomest (tastes like melted Cookies and Cream ice cream...sooooo good).

If you plan on eating in, there's not a lot of table space.  Then again, if you consider where this place is, it might not be a bad idea to just take it to go and eat it at Union Square.

The price is a bit more than your normal burger place, but it's well worth it.  The only drawback for me is that it's so far away from work, but I wouldn't mind walking all the way up to Pearl's from SOMA every once in a while.  It's that good.
author: Marlon E.

description:
Had the Mushroom Burger with sauteed oninons last night.
Well, actually I had the Mushroom Burger.
Mama conveniently stole the one with the sauteed onions.
We both loved each other's burgers.
Ordered the Springs and was disappointed. Sweet potato fries and onion rings are my absolute favorite burger sides.  The sweet potato fries were dry and the onion rings were dry and mangled.
Also ordered the garlic fries. Couldn't be happier with these, even if it is 8am and I still taste garlic. 
Worth going back to try the other burgers.
We'll just stay away from the Springs next time.
author: Barry A.

description:
It's uber dangerous that this place is so close to my apartment. I'm going to be a million pounds, just watch. I give it a couple months tops.

Pearl's makes my heart stop, in the best way possible. The sweet potato fries are the definition of amazing (even though in the two months I've been going to Pearl's they have changed from crinkle cut to shoestring...maybe they like to switch up the cuts? No matter, i liked them both) They always leave my burger slightly pink and very juicy. The shakes are way good and they will mix you custom flavors (try peanut butter, chocolate, banana!), but you should share one because having a whole one made me feel huge (They come with boba straws though! Awesome!) I'm going to have to start getting the mini burgers for fear of my expanding waistline. They make their specialty burgers in mini version though! Cool!

Also, even though this place is the size of a postage stamp, I haven't yet had to wait for a table. AND they're always super nice. SHUT UP!

Pearl's, you make me feel like a fatty. Stop being so damn good, ok? Thanks.
author: Tara O.

description:
BEST burger in the city. 

Do you watch HIMYM? Do you remember the episode where Marshal describes the best burger ever, and how he couldn't eat burgers the same way after that best burger because it was just THAT good? Yes- I've found that spot in SF- Pearl's Burgers. 

Phat Bob? Good.
Bula? Gooood.
Spicy Sly? OMG Gooo-oooo-ood. 

I mean- I am a fry girl. I looove me some fries (they're my favorite food) but this is the one place I don't dare order fries. I'd rather fill up on their burgers and wouldn't replace a single bite with a fry- they are just that good. 

The meat is oh so tender and juicy. The flavors are incredible. Nicely done, Pearl's, nicely done.
author: katie n.

description: Better than your average burger joint. The ingredients tasted fresh and my burger was perfectly cooked. I wouldn't have minded a little more seasoning. Great burger for the price!
author: m t.

description: We visited SF in October and happened across Pearl's in our wanderings.  It was very much worth the walk from the main "touristy" drag.  The burgers are just absolutely amazing no matter which burger you order and the fries/onion rings are outstanding.  The seating area is quite small but very much worth the cramped space.  The guys working the counter were very friendly and quick on the delivery!
author: Will H.

description: I have been to Pearl's 4 times and it gets better each time I go, Hands down the best burgers I have ever had. In case you were raised on fast food, it's even better than In-N-Out. This is one of those "must go" places.
author: Sean H.

description: I got the house burger but wasn't really satisfied. The patty was probably a 3/5 in terms of taste and the bacon I got with it was fatty and not cooked all of the way. Staff was polite but my review is based off of the food. First time in San Francisco and we hiked about a mile uphill to get there.
author: Brandon m.

description:
I LOVE Pearl's. The first thing I had in California was an In n Out burger, and it was fine, it just wasn't was I was expecting. It had no real fat, that fatty meatiness that coats you mouth just wasn't there.
This place is easily the BEST, whenever we get out of town visitors, we take them here!
My boyfriend has tried their award-winning Bula burger with Wagyu beef, and I guess if you have a sweet tooth, it is AWESOME.
I, however, prefer spicier food, so I tried their Spicy Sly. It was my first Pearl's burger. I heard from somewhere once that "You know it's good if you have to wipe your mouth after every bite", and this thing is so messily delicious. It dripped all over me, but I didn't even care. You can have the sauce on the side as well but if you enjoy Sriracha or Tabasco like I do, you will want it as the cook does it. Besides, I am a firm believer in just trusting the cook/chef.
For a few weeks, we would go there and try something different once in a while, until I tried the Prized Pearl. I am drooling as I think about it. Like, right now..... *drool*
THEN I asked for some spicy sly sauce, and it was, I kid you not, the BEST burger I have had in my life, fast food, gourmet, homemade, NOTHING can compare to that thick, juicy beef patty with Blue cheese, and... here it comes... BACONNNNNN!!!!!!! I have had bacon burgers, and I think what sets this apart is the quality of the beef and the bun.
It's about $7-8 for a burger, you can change it up to buffalo or wagyu if you like, they also have a wide selection of chicken burgers but I like to live beefy. 
Sides are so-so but I was never a big fan of fries anyway so I can't judge those. Onion rings are similar to the frozen ones we have at a pool place, which are fine, but there are better places to get those. Here, it's about the burger.
It is just so pure and honest, the place is sooo tiny but the people are great, they'll do your burger however you like it (med, med-rare).
I am now sorely disappointed that Yelp rates Hubert Keller's Burger Bar lower, I'm a big fan of his, but sorry Hubert, Pearl's is TOO good.
author: Lydia R.

description: If you love burgers, you'll love Pearls. Classic little whole in the wall burger joint, offering quality meat and some meeean garlic fries. Check it out, the staff is cool and the burgers are big and affordable......you can't go wrong.
author: Courtney C.

description:
got the spicy sly and sweet potato fries... 

the sweet potato fries were fried too long... but eh... im here for the burgers

the spicy sly was very good... the sauce was spicy...  the toppings were tasty... the meat was juicy... it shouldve been sooooo delcious but for some reason when it took my first bite i was a bit underwhelmed... 

BUT dont be dissuaded!  i am definitely going to go back because i did like the burger a lot and im going to assume that i was underwhelmed because of my super high expectations... and this place definitely TOPS the average burger joint... :) 

oooo and i didnt get the chance to order a shake but the shake menu... amazing.
author: Alannah N.

description: Nutella fucking milkshake. BOOM enough said. Ok not really because their food is awesome too, the burgers, and especially the sweet potato fries. But again, nutella milkshake, so worth the calories!!! I'm drooling right now..I better go get one stat.
author: Julie P.

description: I'm not sure where they get their beef from but it's like their burgers are on crack. So juicy and full of flavor, its like In n Out but bigger and better! I had the regular deluxe burger with cheese and it was one of the best burgers i've ever had. they've won numerous awards around the city and i can see why. top 3 on my list for best burgers!
author: Patrick M.

description:
This place? Where can I start?

My first time here, I was iffy about it. I mean, it's in the tenderloin and at the time, I wasn't craving a burger and wanted to go to the thai place across the street. I think picking this place over thai was the best decision I've ever made in my life. I got The Bomb burger and omggggg. The chili was perfect. The meat was cooked just right. The Nutella shake..................

The Nutella shake deserves its own paragraph. As if Nutella isn't delicious on its own, they just had to make a milkshake. I can't speak for any of the other shakes because the Nutella shake is just too good to not get so I haven't tried the others. In my opinion, it tastes exactly like a chocolate hazel Pirouette and thinking about it, makes me salivate.

Moving on. I used to HATE sweet potato fries and when my friends got some, I decided to give them a try. ANOTHER great decision I've made in my life. The fries were fried just right and not too salty. Just perfect! The day after my first time here, I seriously started to get withdrawals. I missed my burger so much and every burger I've had after that day just did NOT compare. In-n-out even started to taste bad and I LOVE(D) In-n-out. I went again last weekend and got the BBQ chicken burger and that thing was HUGE. I needed a stack of napkins because of the burger. It was delicious, but not as good as The Bomb. I want to come back and try the Kobe burger that everyone is talking about. I swear thinking about this place kills me. It's just too good! The service is great. The staff is really friendly!

The only thing that disappointed me was the time changes. One night, I tried going here with my boyfriend and a couple friends (we were super excited to eat Pearl's). We got there around 12am only to find out that they changed their weekend closing time from 2am to 11pm ): But that won't change my love for Pearl's!
author: Camille T.

description:
Best Burger Downtown, 
Try Bacon-Swiss with Frings, or 
Buffalo to Go.
author: Brian J.

description: Fresh and delicious!  The onion rings were awesome!
author: Lynette R.

description:
Small hole in the wall.

BIG amazing food.

Frequented by locals, you know its good. Michael Mina is also a fan so who could argue? The offerings include turkey burgers and buffalo in conjunction with the standard beef. Be adventurous and try all of the exciting exotic toppings! It is a well kept SF secret that I feel like sharing with the world!
author: jon d.

description: After turning vegan back in June I tried going back to this favorite spot of mine to ask if the veggie burgers were vegan or had any kind of dairy in it. No one at the place seemed to be able to answer my question and kind of seemed like they didn't know what I was talking about. So after that I just chalked this place up as another spot I couldn't eat at. Oh well.
author: Patrick D.

description: Best burgers ever! I love how they have so many different choices in meats and burgers! The milkshakes are amazing too. I used to live across the street from pearls and ate there every week! the prices are affordable for San Francisco. Now that I don't live across the street from pearls, i definitely have pearls withdrawals!
author: Victoria G.

description: While visiting San Fran I had a hankerin' for a delicious burger. A quick Yelp search lead me to Pearl's where I quickly and efficiently devouered a Mushroom Burger and sweet potato fries that I shared with my boyfriend. This was the first burger I had eaten in roughly 8 years and I feel great about it. Quick service, quality beef, and perfect fries. So glad that this was my first burger back after the long hiatus!
author: Sonya S.

description: awesome burger get the kobe beef for sure!kinda small though as far as seating goes.
author: Anthony G.

description: Believe the hype.  The burgers are that good.
author: MakeUp M.

description: the meat on that burger itself is delicious and it would have been 4 stars if it wasn't for that bun , i think its too doughy and didn;t seem fresh enough , i still prefer super duper, but will give pearl's another try for sure ...
author: NAEL K.

description:
If you ever find me out on the sidewalk crying because my dolly got taken away by a big dog, just scoop me up and take me over for a Mini-Deluxe with cheese, Strawberry shake, and split some Garlic Fries with me, and all will be right.

The people that work here are super nice. The service is fast, considering you have to go from raw to amazing flame kissed magic, and the seating is, while not spacious, very comfortable and great for sopping up some intoxication after a night of drinking or chatting on a warm Friday after getting off of work early. The best is when they open the front window and you can feel the air outside while you eat with your friends.

Plus, they have a self serve pickle container (always a plus) that puts Quizno's to shame. But don't fret, there's tongs, so people from all walks of life aren't just reaching in five finger style.
author: Justin L.

description:
Unbelieavably good burgers just a ways up Nob Hill.  The place looks a little sketchy from the outside, but it's clean and smells amazing on the inside.  The burgers take fantastic and are cooked to order - this place is not nearly as "fast food" as it looks.  Someone before me ordered garlic fries and they smelled incredible; I'll have to try them next time.  Oh, and allyoucaneatserveyourself pickle spears - le swoon! 

The only reason I give it four stars instead of five is that their regular fries are slightly lacking, which is unfortunate.

Nonetheless, I already see what's going to happen.  I'm going to "justify" getting like 5 burgers a day by walking up Nob Hill to retrieve 'em.
author: Frankie D.

description:
Yum! I've been going to Sliders near here for my burger fix during my lunch break. But I had read a good review of Pearl's and decided that I'd walk the extra few blocks to give it a try...

And was it worth it! These burgers are easily better than those to be found over at Sliders, my first try I got the spicy burger, that has grilled onions, some sorta habenero sauce, and peppers...it wasn't as spicy as I might have hoped, but still so good that I know that is officially my cheeseburger spot for lunch....

Highly Recommended!
author: Matthew S.

description:
Just went to Pearl's after reading these reviews and I must agree ... yummmmy!

Got a spicy sly, and it's true that the burger is a little sloppy.  But totally worth it.
author: R J.

description:
Yummy! Went here last night. I got the mini with jack cheese banana shake and garlic fries.... Divine.
BF had the the BBQ w onion and thick bacon was a happy camper.
I def recommend and we will be back real soon.. Left happy and full only $23 buck lighter. Nice.
Only four stars because the milk shake was a bit thinner then I would like and the cashier taking my order was friendly enough but not super product knowledgeable.
author: Latriece L.

description:
I haven't had the pleasure of trying one of Pearls burgers (believe it or not, I didn't have the craving for a burger!) but if their fresh banana milkshakes are indication of how fiiiiiiine the burgers are then I'm giving it 5 stars! (I know I gave 4 but I"ve got to try the burger first - hello? Once I get the desire I'll be there with my 5 star, ummmhmmm!

Thanks Tillzie!
author: Darlene D.

description:
So we called this night "Babes and Burgers" and it was a real deal, roll up the sleeves, mean and serious research night with the homegirl 'food-in-the-city committee'.  As per a stellar yelp review, neighborhood savory hearsay, and the agreement we'd go 'mom &pop' vs. 'gourmet'- Pearl's Deluxe Burgers was the mark for this reconnaissance mission on this warm San Francisco night. 

The venue was straight to point. No frills, no pretentiousness . This is a business that boasts 'we sell damn good burgers here' nothing more nothing less. That was noted from the get-go and the joint was conducive for our no- mercy burger examination that was to follow. 

We wanted to a good variety to sample. Four girls, 3 burgers to share in attack:  Pearl's Deluxe w/ Blue Cheese (for the classic), Phat Bob w/ Buffalo Meat (for the girth), and the Pesto Burger (for kicks). 
Of course we had to see what the Spries (sweet potato fries) was about, which we got laced with crunchy sweet onion rings. 

The notes:  An obvious respect (if not worship) of the meat as the big boss in the bun; grilled perfectly medium/ medium rare. Whether it was the blue cheese, pesto, or bbq sauce in each of these burgers cases- the condiments were careful not to mask taste but accentuate; the bun buttery and light in a happy soft embrace of the beef. And every bit was bite-able and fat with taste. The attention to detail was exciting- props to the architecture of each.  There was surprisingly nothing but a harmony of yums and oohs that came from our table. 

Quotes: 
"Despite the medley of flavors in a single burger, my taste buds and olfactory system were surprisingly not overwhelmed." 

"I don't usually like blue cheese, but the combination of blue cheese, red onions lettuce and sauce made it fantastic!"

"pesto burger a surprise and the buffalo meat very tasty with just enough spices."

Conclusion: Based on the varied elements of our sample tonigh, we agreed the burger to build next time would be a Pearl's Deluxe/ buffalo meat/blue cheese/ and bacon. No joke. That'll be the winner. That, and the spries (couldn't take one bite without the 'that's good' nod). And lastly, the staff. Justin (who reigns there Tues, Wed, Thurs) exemplified down home service, pride of his product and the intergenerational family history behind building a great neighborhood feel good burger...all of these, made the experience addictive and hearty for sure.
author: irie o.

description:
Oh sweet delishousness! Thank you oh lord for helping me find the best burgers in San Fran!

1.) They have a 100% health inspection rating, clean=good
2.) They have "Mini" burgers! I am a petite gal so when I find things that are " my size" I squeal with delight! Meat was perfectly cooked and the veggies were all fresh. 
3.) They have my all time favorite side...sweet potato fries! The thought of those delicious  fries makes me crave MORE!!

Next time I want to try the shakes!

I enjoyed my meal at the steps of union square with gigantic Beckham  in his skivies for my view. Thank you to whoever decided to put that glorious piece of man on a huge poster.
author: Amy A.

description:
Best burger in the world, hands down. I love this place.I've been living in Seattle for a year, but fly back about once a month. Pearl's is usually my first stop; it's essentially the only red meat I eat in a given month anymore.

Now that I'm moving home to San Francisco next week I don't know how I'll be able to stay away. 

The owner is great, and I hear he's expecting!

Two years ago they had an option between "regular" meat and organic, now it's all organic or buffalo and insane.
author: Michael H.

description:
This place is great! The menu is impressive with Niman ranch beef, Kobe beef, buffalo, and chicken options (also veggie burgers and dogs). I got Pearl's Prize Burger and my date got the much heralded Bula Burger we loved them both. The sweet potato fries were nice and crispy (crinkle cut) not soggy like I've run into most of the time. The peanut butter milkshake was blissful.


 I feel like the specialty burgers are reasonably priced and they even offer mini versions of all the burgers.


 A good place to take a date or just grab a lunch.
author: ceaseless

description:
I love Pearl's. I get the deluxe Pearl burger with buffalo and swiss more often than I should but hey, what's a little extra junk in the trunk? Regular fries are just so-so, but great onion rings. I'm usually lactarded, but for some reason I can drink their shakes. Maybe because they use the full-fat milk? Honestly, I thought I'd never drink milkshakes again, so I'm not asking too many questions. 

German Chocolate shake is unique and delicious. Oreo and coconut are also great. Oh, and Asian Chicken salad is a little pricey at $8, but it's fresh and delicious with lots of candied walnuts, grilled chicken breast, apple slices, and avocado.

Please note, prices in actual restaurant are not the same as online or their take out menu. Burgers are now about $1.50 more than they used to be. I asked and they don't plan to update menus or online with new prices anytime soon.
author: Jemima P.

description: Smack dab in the middle of San Fran you can find a burger joint that pretty much belongs in the black&white part of the movie Pleasantville, except for the fact that it's about the size and floorplan of a what is expected for a burger joint smach dab in the middle of SF.  The guy behind the counter was a legit burger guy.  He seemed so nice and helpful, he would have to have been casted as the milk man.  In a world where a 4/5 burger is getting harder and harder to find, this place gets it done and they do it in all sorts of different ways.  Go there.
author: chris b.

description: Their burgers are Great!! Moist and phat! I love the onion rings they have a lil spice to them. You can kick it up a bit with the Kobe or buffalo but I think they are good enough not to.
author: Pat C.

description: Best burger ever!! Great garlic fries. Fair prices. Can't get any better
author: Carolina T.

description: kind of irritated with this place, ordered a chili cheese burger and they forgot the most important part....the CHILI!!! WTF...and the burger itself was mediocre at best ...the onion rings were too peppery...wont be going back.
author: Melissa S.

description:
Biggest douchebag ever working here.

The guy messed up my phoned-in order, so I returned to ask for my money back.
I simply explained that I didn't have time to wait fifteen minutes for a new burger. I even told him that if there were a problem giving me a refund, he could even give me store credit, and I would just come back the next day.

He blew up at me, telling me it's entirely my fault for ordering the wrong thing, and that he shouldn't be obliged to return my money. He raised his voice and just made it awkward for everyone in the dining room.

I explained to him again that I only told him that I wanted a certain sauce on my burger when we spoke on the phone, and that HE told me to order it as a specific burger by name. It was a burger that came with a bunch of fix-ins that I can't eat.
He then tells me he would only give my money back if I admit that it was entirely my fault, all while people eating in the dining room grew more and more uncomfortable by the second. 

Again I reminded him that he gave me a burger that I couldn't eat because he didn't tell me what was in it, but alas, he wasn't hearing it. 
The expression on his face seemed like he was some contractor and I was trying to not pay him for a $50,000 roofing job, not an $8 burger.
I even tried to acquiesce and say it's both our fault, and a simple communication error. Again he shouts that it's entirely my fault, and that his restaurant's going to lose an entire $8 dollars plus tax because I had the audacity to call a burger joint and order without having a menu in hand. A burger joint, geez...

I kinda chuckled to myself, trying to keep my cool, amazed that none of his co-workers or supervisors were even fazed by his behavior, or even tried to calm him down, also thinking of restaurant and service jobs I've had in high school and college where this type of behavior would warrant at least a write-up. He saw my chuckle, and then shouted from behind the register "Oh, so you're just gonna laugh at me, when this whole thing is entirely your mistake?!"

I just stopped talking and waited for a refund, it was pointless.
I got my refund and he gave me a menu, and said "Here, make sure you learn to read this before you decide to call again"
I threw it in the trash, never to go back.

This tool needs to be in the back flipping burgers, not interacting with customers, I'll never go back as long as they employ meatheads with chips on their shoulders.
author: Chuck D.

description: This place is great i know there known for there hamburgers but the chili dog with chili on the side is great! my personal fav. i highly recommend you come and try this place.
author: stephen c.

description: Careful, this place is addictive!  Best burger I've found in the city.  My favorites are the pesto burger and the turkey burger with avocado.  The half order of fries is PLENTY, even for two, and the milkshakes are delicious.  The black forest shake is a chocolate shake with wild cherries - unbeatable!  The staff is always very friendly and the place is small, simple and clean.  They offer lots of different choices of meat for the burger, but the price goes up with each one, so I usually stick with the basics.  They also have mini burgers, but they're served on normal buns so it's a lot of bread with your burger.  I generally have some left over with the normal size though - it's generous!  You can call ahead for take-out, but orders don't take long if you just go in.  Enjoy!
author: Anna I.

description: Worth the walk through the tendernob. Split the mushroom and phat bob burger (bbq, onion rings, bacon) with hubs and they were both giant, juicy burgers. I wasn't dazzled but it was real tasty. I'd def go back to sample their whole line of milkshakes - just $3.50 for a sizable glass of thick deliciousness.
author: Elise B.

description:
well well. tyflo did not disappoint. heard he came here for a best thing i ever ate segment. 

i ordered a bacon cheese deluxe, medium. mom ordered mushroom burger, well. sister, the mini with cheese, plus fries for the table.

the burger is huge, the beef tastes beefy and well cooked. i ordered medium and i got a medium burger. only complaints i have are that my medium burger dripped juice everywhere - but that just means they cooked it to my liking. and that the place is sorta small. you feel like when you bite messily into your burger, everyone else can and is looking at you be a piggie. it didn't help that i was sitting next to and facing the line.

fast and great service. will definitely come here again, though i will try the uruguay beef next time - see what that's like. they also offer turkey burgers, kobe beef, and buffalo. their patties are already niman ranch, so thumbs up! :D

fries were steak cut, and crispy - freshly fried and super hot as well.  oh! the burgers came out like that too! my mom commented that this is the first time she ate a burger and it stayed warm throughout the entire meal. 

they also have a HUGE assortment of shakes. will also try sometime. :) prices were decent for the burgers we got. never have to go to cheesecake factory or chain restaurant for a burger again!
author: Melissa C.

description:
certainly, the ingestion of junk food as a means of self-medication is indicative of either:
a)  pearl's having way too many reviews, and this is my feeble attempt to post something different
b)  my genuine emotions and seemingly perpetual encounters w/misfortune

perhaps both are true.  and perhaps one is truer than the other.

a great burger is my solution for all woes, both trivial and severe.
        i have a cold = i eat a burger
        i'm heartbroken = i eat a burger

my whole being swirls and crumples and shatters w/ease prior to entering pearl's.  i wish and hope and curse and am equally grateful for the cavernous kaleidoscope that i peer through, time and again, whose faded colors and distorted shapes sporadically become animated.

a pearl's burger (plus a strawberry banana shake) will dispel all self-inflicted gloom and doom and general inadequacies.  particularly, the prized pearl (topped w/bacon, sauteed onions, crumbled bleu cheese and mayo) will momentarily cure all emotional pangs, whose combination of flavors will strategically create a wondrous mirage of happiness in the near future.  in this instance, my slow eating pace is advantageous...  

the strawberry shake alone induces a sudden (albeit ephemeral) shock of optimism and rainbows and puppies.  

not such a bad form of treatment (for an admitted worthy illness) when weighing the options.

sigh.  
i need a burger.
author: Ting A.

description:
After ranting about how good Burger Barn was, a friend of mine told me to try Pearl's.  Their Kobe Burger is amazing!  It was slightly over-cooked, as I ordered medium rare, so I told the cook, and he was kind enough to not only re-do my order, but to let me keep the original!  

All of their meat is organic, grass-fed beef.  Pretty great to see a service that cares doing well.  

Dodgy neighborhood, but great burger!
author: Mark K.

description:
I was absolutely impressed by this place. It was love at first bite! I had the Mini Prized Pearl which was super tasty. The bacon was fried to perfecton, high quality blue cheese well accented by the steaming hot grilled onions on a perfectly cooked burger!! I have a pretty small appetite, but I love food so I was very happy to see that you can get any of the "special" burgers Mini size! 

My boyfriend had the Spicy Sly and was definitely a HUGE fan of the habanero sauce that his burger was lathered in. He said it wasn't quite big enough for him so he might have to get 2 minis next time. The sweet potato fries were good, but not very sweet, and the onion rings where perfect! Not over battered or over cooked!! Oh and I loved that you can get a combo (2 half orders of either fries/sweet potato fries/onion rings). Customer friendly!!
author: Henriette P.

description: BEST BURGERS IN THE CITY. Oh my. If I could eat here everyday, you know, without the looming fear of certain cardiac arrest, I absolutely would.  The prices are great, the staff is friendly and quick, the selection is extraordinary (blue cheese on a burger? yes please).  This place is always buzzing. The only criticism I have is not directed at the staff or restaurant, but for the other people who choose to eat there when I eat there...stop savoring and move, bitch! You're sitting in my spot! haha
author: Marilyn R.

description: thank goodness for burger joints that accommodates us veggie lovers. my carnivorous friends were happy, and so was i. they have jalapeno's! yesss.
author: Ramandeep K.

description:
psst, you don't have to wait till tuesday and get to toronado by 1pm for the best burger in the city.  at pearls you don't have to wait 45 minutes, your clothes don't smell like a backyard grill all day, you can have sweet potato fries with your meal, the pickles are better and they don't charge you $1.50 for it.  

and did i mention you can have it everyday?!
author: Nikki F.

description: The best hand crafted burger you will find. Excellent ingredients
author: Dennis H.

description: With hundreds of reviews, what can I add?  But I'm too excited not to add my two cents' worth, as I just got back from one of the best burgers lI've had in the city ... a Phatt Bobb, perfectly cooked burger on a great roll that actually held up to the bacon, onion rings, bbq sauce (tangy!  sloppy!) and mayo - really crispy onion rings and fries - free soda refills.  Not greasy at all - buffalo burger awaits my next visit.  Wish there were more seats; I'd eat here every week.  Joe's Cable Car finally has a worthy competitor!
author: Brian B.

description: I was expecting much but it didn't deliver. Ordered the burger medium but it was burnt to a crisp. The sweet potato fries and chilling were pretty good and the servings are large I much prefer acme burgers on divisadero.
author: Avinash S.

description: I went To pearl's deluxe burgers today around one-ish on monday, june 4 2007, and the burgers were in my opinion pretty descent. The service was with out a doubt great! I had ordered the " Prized Pearl" burger, which was ordered medium rare and my burger was actually medium. The taste of the burger was pretty good big chunks of bacon and I can really taste the blue cheese but overall quality I thought it was ok.
