I had also ordered some sweet potato fries which was alright but I thought the onion rings were better which I had also ordered. Overall this restaurant gave great service and got the food faster than I had thought. I would definitely recommend this place if your'e out looking for a place that sells a pretty descent burger in a short amount of time.
author: Daryl A.

description:
Pearl's is just too close to my apartment for me to lose weight. Whenever I go, I get take out, since the inside is somewhat small and cold. Plus I don't need my neighbor's to see how I eat... 

I almost always just get a cheddar cheeseburger, and it's amazing. If you ask for it medium it's actually medium, still red in the middle, unlike every other burger place that either gives it to you still mooing, or cooks it until you don't even know what animal it came from. I haven't tried the specialty burgers, since everytime my friend's get one they just end up a complete mess. I am a firm believer that a hamburger should never be eaten with a fork.

The turkey burgers are okay, but too thick and have a sausage patty taste as opposed to a burger taste. My friend enjoys the veggie burger, but that's only because he's been a vegetarian for so long he can't appreciate the wonderfulness that is a well made cheeseburger.  The sweet potato fries and onion rings are also worth the calories. 

Complete fabulousness..
author: Sara G.

description:
Ok. After several months of eating here with increasing frequency, it's only right that I bump my rating to five stars. This place serves the best burger that I've ever had. Yum.

Now, in my last review, I mentioned the milkshakes. They are disappointing. Which is fine - otherwise, I'd be having far more milkshakes than I should. This raises the question, incidentally: how many milkshakes should one have? I don't have an answer to this vexing problem yet.

So the only real problem (and it's a PROBLEM) is that they aren't open on Sunday. This is highly disappointing. Not like the milkshake thing. When I get a hankering for a burger, I want one and I want one now. And I can no longer go anywhere else (why settle for second-best?), so I'm stuck with an unsatisfied craving.
author: Josh O.

description:
Best burgers in town. 

The spicy sly burger with buffalo done medium rare is killer.
author: Peter C.

description:
I found out about Pearl while traveling from the airport to downtown SF at 9:30 in the evening. Having just landed from a long flight, I was starving to death (I avoid food on planes at all costs), and I needed something quick and good. Naturally, I opened my Yelp app on my phone and searched for places near my hotel. "Burgers", 1300+ reviews and 4 stars were more than enough to convince me. I asked my cab driver to drop me off right by it.
From outside, Pearl looks very unassuming. Had I not known about the Yelp reviews, I would have never went it. It is a true hole-in-the-wall. It is very small inside, and under normal circumstances, I would have questioned the hygiene as well, but who cares about hygiene at 9:45 PM, and you haven't had any proper food for 5-6 hours? I ordered the buffalo burger (medium) which was an additional 4 bucks on top of the regular burger. I took a seat at one of the small tables and started waiting patiently. My burger arrived in about 6-7 minutes. It was sized perfectly: not too small, but not too big either to the point that I couldn't handle it comfortably. The patty looked juicy, which surprised me because buffalo burgers tend to dry out pretty fast due to its low fat content (It is actually leaner than chicken). It was topped of with the standards: lettuce, tomato, onion. I opted for mustard instead of mayo. It was absolutely delicious. Probably the best burger I have had the entire 2012.
I probably had the most basic burger on the menu. Their menu is full of burgers with fancy topics or you can create your own. I am pretty sure they all taste good. The guys at Pearl definitely have the basics right, which is the most crucial to building a good burger! I will definitely be back.
author: Mustafa K.

description:
this will give barneys a run for their money.

a-mazing. so glad that they are close to me (but that's a bad thing for my waist line). fries were perfection and the chocolate milkshake left me wanting to lick the inside of the cup. oh yes. i'll be back.

(service was great, too! and i loved the dill spears ... mm pickles... )
author: laura f.

description:
AMAZING I CAN'T GET ENOUGH... oh btw HAHA I live a block away!!! Well ya'all can laugh at me when i have a heart attack but until then HAHA. But seriously this place has won numerous awards all over town for having the best burgers around. 
     I recommend the Spicy Sly burger over anything else on the menu. If your a normal vapid american who can't stand heat, then this burger is NOT for you. It's got onions and peppers pan fried in a tabasco sauce over marinated beef (or buffalo if you prefer) with a chipotle mayo sauce that will have your mouth watering at it's glory. 
     This is no sissy of a burger. Come prepared to wharf down something that will challenge your traditional methods of burger-eating. It'll slide and fall apart, and if you find this a glorious challenge... well then my friend, Pearls is the only place in SF for you! ENJOY ^_^
author: Joshua L.

description: I tried the spicy sly the first time I was here and it was a really good tasting burger.  It was moist and flavorful, and for $7.99, not too bad of a price for the size of the burger.  The only downside is that you have to order the fries/onion rings on the side.  On the plus side, you can get those sides mixed and matched, i.e. sweet potato fries w/onion rings = springs.  On my second visit, I got the bula burger in a mini size for approximately $6.00.  Turns out, that was the perfect portion for me, so probably only mini sizes from pearl's from now on. Either way, I'll definitely be back to try out the other burgers. (Oh, and I liked how the onion rings were super crispy!)
author: ML N.

description: I wish I could give this place a half star.  It is really that bad.  The burgers are sooooo greasy I knew it was going to haunt me later.  Do people mistake greasy for juicy?  Anyways, the burgers are pedestrian, expensive and $4 for a milkshake?  Come on people we can do better than this place.  I didn't  think I would ever say, " I should have gone to McDonalds."  One more thing I should mention, the bald guy who works there is a real douchebag.  I know your life probably didn't turn out like you wanted or imagined but you don't need to take it out on the people buying your horrible burgers.
author: phil k.

description:
I came here with a truck load of friends based on the great yelp reviews, but we all left scratching our heads.

Burger was pretty good, but had an overwhelming amount of grease. French fries / onion rings were nothing special.

Give me in-n-out instead.
author: Brian S.

description:
To borrow a phrase from one of my fellow yelpers, NOM NOM NOM!!!! This burger joint served quite possibly the most delicious burger I've ever had. 

After yelping the area around me for a bite to eat while in San Francisco Pearl's came up and encouraged by the great reviews and the announcement that Pearl's was being feature on the Food Network (which I must say, is VERY well deserved), I made the quick walk over with my sister and a friend. We actually walked right past it at first but the smell of frying onions and sweet and spicy teriyaki sauce turned us right back around. We walked in and true to other reviews, the place is small. There isn't a lot of seating but there is a pretty good rotation of customers and people are considerate about getting up when they are finished with their meal so other patrons can sit. 
After staring at the menu board for a solid 5 minutes (so many delicious choices, how do I choose?!) I decided on the pesto burger and a coconut milkshake. My sister and I did a quick conference and decided to order different burgers (me, pesto, her, the bula) and cut them in half so we could each try each others. We also ordered sweet potato fries and onion rings. After a short wait, our food was brought to our table and Oh. My. God. My pesto burger was cooked to medium perfection and was covered with an amazing basil pesto sauce, jack, mayo and tomato. My taste buds screamed with longing every second I wasn't taking a bite. After (quickly) finishing my half of the pesto burger I moved on to the bula burger (cooked medium and smothered in bacon, Swiss, mayo and spicy pineapple teriyaki sauce)...and wtf?! How is this possibly better than the pesto?! I literally didn't talk for a solid 8-10 minutes while savoring each precious bite (but did realize why each table has a well-stocked napkin dispenser. Helpful tip of the day: pull some out napkins ahead of time so you don't waste seconds while eating). 

And now on to the sides...a lot of places I've been to have either great sides or great main dishes. Not this place. The onion rings were cooked to battered perfection and the sweet potato fries were a little crisp on the outside and soft in the middle without being to mushy. The coconut milkshake I had was probably the best milkshake I've ever had. I know coconut is usually a yes or no kind of thing for people but this was a perfect blend of sweet coconut without being too overwhelming. My friend (who doesn't like coconut) gave it a try and was instantly hooked (and then rejected over and over again throughout the meal when he kept asking for another sip. Sorry buddy, get your own!) 

I am not at all surprised that this establishment is being featured on the Food Network and I am eagerly anticipating my own return on my next visit to San Fran. If you are in the area, do not miss this spot!!!
author: Amy C.

description: I LOVE these burgers! I usual get a mini burger, it's the perfect size (to me) and I won't slip into food coma like I would with their (regular) gigantic burgers. They also have an awesome selection of Milkshakes, and they are AMAZING!
author: sherrie A.

description:
This place seems like it should be a gem.  It's fairly cheap, the burgers are huge, they offer a variety of toppings, even offering a buffalo meat option, and yet I was very underwhelmed.

I ordered my burger medium rare and it was sooo bloody which I didn't appreciate.  I topped it with mushroom and cheese, and yet it was still completely tasteless.  And they use those flimsy buns that get soaked and break apart easy.  

Also, way too tiny to sit in.   Don't go with more than one person, there won't be enough room for more than two burgers or two people at a table.

It's worth it if you just want some quick take out that will fill you up, but don't expect quality.  The fries were good however, earning the place an extra star.
author: kristen v.

description: This place is insane.  It will be one of the best burgers you'll ever eat.  Great fries and onion rings, and every different type of shake you can think of.  Buffalo and turkey burger substitutions is a plus.  A very hole in the wall type place, but if you're in the area, its a must.
author: Josh H.

description: Great!! Service was REALLY fast and really friendly! Food was amazing! Yummy milk shake with a really big straw... Mmmmm sweet potato fries!!! Couldn't be happier.
author: Dayna E.

description: bula burger-delicious! The fries were unlike any ive ever tasted.  i would have been just fine w the mini..The portions are huge!  $25 for two bulas,  fries, and drinks!
author: Kaytee E.

description: Hands down one of my best burger joint experiences. The service was super friendly. The menu was pretty extensive and provided a lot of variety. I got the bula burger, a nutella milkshake and an order of frines (regular and sweet potato fry combo). Great place if your looking to pig out on quality burgers. This place shits on fast food burger places.
author: Ken F.

description: I just can't get over how good this place was so I have to add to my original review.  I came with a group so we ended up getting everything to go because seats are limited.  I got the chicken pesto sandwich ($8.95) and the garbage disposal got the phat bob (also $8.95)  My sister got the veggie sandwich and my dad ordered a normal burger.  We all shared orders of garlic fries and sweet potato fries.  Wow- the fries were good!  I also got the peanut butter shake ($3.50).  It always makes me so happy when places serve peanut butter shakes because it truly is like mixing crack and ice cream together.  I also saw that they have a specialty Nutella shake.  FREAKING NUTELLA!  That must be like mixing heroin and ice cream together- I'll be back to tackle that on another day.
author: Cersei T.

description:
Late Lunch Review.

Bear with me as I'm currently food comaing after returning from my trek from civic center to the far corner of TL to this tiny hole in the wall burger joint.  It's like any other hole in the wall.  It's small with about seating for 10 people and is opened pretty much throughout the day.  The service is pretty quick and they are super nice.  Average price is $7 a burger, but for the value, its pretty good.  However, even with the specialty burgers, nothing super excited me.  I had the following:

-Prized Pearl w/ Mushrooms (+$1) - it was huge, and i mean huge.  Well worth the money, but the burger patty was sort of lacking flavor.  the grilled mushroom and onions were just over over saturated with oil and by the time i got the burger, the bottom bread peice was soaked in oil and I could start seeing through the paper.  The bule cheese was a neat new thing on a burger for me, but aside from being stuffed, I don't see myself making that trek back to this place for a burger.
-Springs - sweet potato fries and onion rings were mediocre.  Onion rings fell apart and the onion wasn't fully cooked.  The sweet potato fries weren't fully cooked either as they were not fully soft in the middle.  I guess its best to get thinner cuts.  
-Mint Oreo Shake - Probably my favorite item on the menu which was easily finished.  I split this with a friend and to our surprise, one order easily fills 2/3 of 2 cups.  Excellenttt.

Sorry Pearl, but maybe if I were to party in the Union Sq sometime, I'll keep in mind that this is around here.
author: Vincent K.

description: Juicy big boy!!! MMM I shared a Pearl's standard cheeseburger (grilled onions) with a side of spries (mix of sweet potato and regular fries) with my bf. Great idea on the mixed baskets because if someone has a taste for a different side you don't have to order separate ones or one gluttonous mofo can get the best of both worlds! The burger was perfectly cooked (I ordered medium rare and that's what I got :). My one tiny complaint is that the grilled onions needed a lil more flavor so I sprinkled some salt on those bitches and all was well after that. When I return I want to try one of the specialty bugers.
author: Niki P.

description: Great Cheap Burgers. Especially for downtown
author: Ken R.

description:
Ate here for the first time last week after unsuccesfully nursing an all day hangover.  What I needed was a classic greasy American cheeseburger to fix what was ailing me.  

I was skeptical at first upon entering the place, but after getting the the grease soaked bag home and sinking my teeth into the organic beef burger I was truly impressed.  The meat was not overdone, the cheese was perfectly melted with a crisp wedge of iceberg, tomato and onion.  Also noteworthy was the "frings" option.  I now feel cheated that every other restaurant in the nation does not offer you the choice of having onion rings and fries together.  I know Bistro Burger offers it up but I am not a fan of their burgers. 

 My girlfriend ordered the non-organic mini deluxe burger and was not as impressed.  It appears that upgrading to "all natural" beef is the route to take.  I am looking forward to heading back to Pearls in need of a hangover elixir, as my first visit certainly did the job.  Oh yeah, they also have all-u-can eat free pickle spears.  A definite bonus.
author: Brett W.

description:
Shatangi said to go, so I went.

I don't know about other people, but I firmy believe that the messier the burger the better.

I gotta tell you... that was one messy burger! 

I had the "Spicy Sly Burger" it was poetry in a burger. The grilled oniions and peppers where just right, cooked enough for carmelization but not overly cooked so that they still had firmness. 

The onionrings and fries need a little work, the fries are your basic "stealth" fries (not bad but the burger deserves fresh cut, REALLY!) same with the onionrings.

The staff was really welcoming and attentive (especially for a burger-joint) the shop it's self was very clean and stocked, and I love that they have the extra large ketchup squeeze bottles at the tables (because the fries needed them)

All in all, a great place.

thomj
author: j o.

description:
The only burger joint in SF worthy of my 5 stars.  And if I could add another one on the sole basis that they open til 2am on the weekends, then I proudly would.

The place is clean, the shakes are amazing, and the burgers are just about perfect.
author: Ranch S.

description:
I eat at Pearl's at least once a week, usually twice. I'm one of those fortunate jerks that doesn't get fat from eating nothing but fatty foods, so naturally I take advantage of it by ordering a Deluxe Bacon Cheeseburger on Buffalo meat with Frings (fries and onion rings) at least once a week. 

Plus they don't lie when they take your order over the phone and say it will be ready in 5-10 minutes. The staff expects to see me at least once over the weekends, so they're always friendly and prompt. They take card, they do mini-versions of their burgers when you're feeling cheap or not-as-hungry, have a whole refrigerator worth of beverages, and best of all, open until 2am on Friday and Saturday nights. 

Don't feel guilty when you have those cravings for burgers and fries. Give in and go to Pearl's.
author: Stu C.

description:
My friends and I meet for a regular "burger hunt" every month or so, and in our estimation this place is a solid contender.   I'd put it in our top 5.  The meat was super juicy and cooked just right (medium rare), which in my book is an essential component of a good burger.  I also had the garlic fries, which were good, but not as good as the mind blowing garlic fries at Taylor's.

And thanks to you Yelper's, cause otherwise I might never have found this place.
author: Chris T.

description:
I really enjoyed the burgers here. I got the 1/2 pounder and it was just absolutely wonderful. Juices were flowing out after my first bite. The meat was cooked the way I liked it --medium rare. The main reason I came here was because they had sweet potatoe french fries. I love sweet potatoes and for it to be deep fried was just as tasty (but not so good for you health wise. Bummers.) 

They have killer milkshakes here. I hate it when people screw up a milk shake with too much milk or whatever they do. Here, they had the right balance of milk and ice cream. 

Prices are reasonable. Burgers around $6 bucks and up. Fries $3. Shakes $3. They have fountain and bottle drinks as well. 

Dude, go try this place.
author: Van D.

description:
I'm in town for a conference. I was too busy networking (okay, and drinking champagne) to eat dinner. 11 p.m. rolled around, I was starving, and my supposed luxury hotel doesn't serve anything but chicken wraps for late-night room service. But I'll save that for another review.

After a quick session on Yelp, I headed a few blocks to Pearl's. Even that late, the place was full. The guy at the counter was polite and looked me in the eye as he took my order. I'm pretty sure no fast-food personnel has met my gaze since, like, 1997. 

I ordered my meal to go. Back at the hotel, I sat down to a deluxe with cheddar, a small order of garlic fries, and a vanilla shake. What? I hadn't eaten since noon. 

Wow. The meat was flavorful, the cheese perfectly melted, the veggies crisp, the tiny amount of mayo just right. And it's hard to argue with garlic fries--potatoes and garlic together in one hot chewy mess? Yeah. I'm happy.

The shake was just okay, and more than $13 for a burger in a cardboard box is a bit much. Still, I'd go back. Now, if you'll excuse me, I'm going to finish my fries.
author: Wendy F.

description: Limp fries. Ordered SPfries, but got french fries instead. Surprise! Need to look inside the box before take it to go. Should have told me when you ran out of SP. It's not as good as before. The ketchup is High-fructose corn syrup (HFCS) if you know what I mean.  Not worth the price/hype. Go to johnny rockets (all local NimanRanch pastured beef). You've to pay $10 burger here and it's imported beef. See ya!
author: Rey d.

description: It's quite astounding how amazing these burgers are, I would say that they are easily the best in the city. Plus it doesn't hurt that the employees are really nice as well!
author: Christopher H.

description: Came here based on reviews and I'm glad we did. It was right after we checked into our hotel and we were hungry. The burgers were nice and big. The burgers tasted good but the beef seemed somewhat bland and my bun was a little cold. On the other hand, the fries were superb. The burgers are a little more expensive but it definitely filled the three of us up. I would come back and try it again.
author: Kevin K.

description: The burgers here are pretty darn good. The king burger (cheeseburger with a grilled hot dog and thousand island dressing) will hold you over for hours. I'm not impressed with the onion rings, they are breaded vs. the traditional battered ones. Friendly staff and they are open hella late on the weekends.
author: Marco M.

description: Unbelievably phat burgers! The best burger in town? I haven't found anything better (yet). At this location, they have Kobe or you can substitute a Buffalo patty for $1.50 more. I love that you can mix and match the sweet potato fries, the onion rings, and regular fries. My favorite burgers are the Phat Bobb, Bula, or the Pesto Burger. They run a tight ship in this joint, reminds me of tiny joints in NYC. It's well worth the wait for them to fix up your burger just right! Of course, you're gonna spend over $10 and closer to $12-13 with the fries/drink, but isn't that the going rate for any "cheaper" meal in Nob Hill these days?
author: Greg M.

description:
Wow! Pearl's you are officially my favorite burger place in the city.  The restaurant is tiny, fitting about 15 people comfortably in the front. 

Burgers are $4-8 and there are plenty of choices to choose from. Fries are like McDonald's fries but slightly thicker. Pretty good. 

I also love that you can choose onion rings, frings or french fries. Pearls hasn't forgotten you milkshake lovers out there. I counted about 8 different kinds. 

AND to top it off, my burger was cooked perfectly!! I asked for medium and I actually got medium. (How often does that happen?) It was juicy and delicious.

Of course, I will have to compare this to another popular burger place that is Taylors/Gotts. Definitely better. Pearl's does not need to use any fancy sauce to cover up for the taste of the burger. Pearl's is also slightly cheaper than Taylors.

I had a burger, small fries and a drink for around $11. Not too pricey.
author: Mei F.

description: The Spicy Sly was one of the best burgers I have ever eaten.
author: Michael L.

description:
I loove this place.
The burgers are the best I've had so far. The service is friendly.
I would definitely come back when I'm in the area.

Kudos to you Pearl's Deluxe Burgers!
author: Charlotte C.

description: My wife and I just had an absolutely delicious burger. Deluxe with cheese and the lot for me and the mini deluxe with cheese for the misses. Will not disappoint a must for a quick v.tasty and cheap meal.
author: Sean G.

description:
Probably the best burger I've had since moving to SF.  Well made burger with fancy toppings.  Messy and delicious!

As an added bonus they have sweet potato fries and their onion rings are excellent.
author: Allen K.

description: Amazing burgers.  You can't go wrong with any of their specialty burgers.  Their 1 pound Kobe or Buffallo beef burgers are to die for!  The nutella shake is equally to die for.  The management is top notch and the service is always friendly.
author: Terence G.

description: The burgers are as on point as you can expect from any little burger joint. I go at least once a month and have yet to find a reason to stop. I love burgers and theirs are really consistent with taste and drippy goodness.
author: Joseph K.

description:
I was really jazzed to check this place out, as I'd heard a lot about it. Suffice it to say I was completely underwhelmed. My Deluxe Burger was served on a bun that disintegrated midway through the burger and the fries were limp.  I hate limp fries! Burger, fries and a small coke were over 10 bucks. I'm not really sure what the hype is with this place- maybe if you get one of their specialty burgers it's a bit better. 

I think that a good burger MUST start with a good bun- and this wasn't that. Oh, and did I mention...THE FRIES WERE LIMP!!!!
author: Tim S.

description: Excellent burgers had the prized pearl with bleu cheese and bacon gf had pesto burger the burger was cooked perfectly medium (just how I like it) mine was good but the pesto was super pesto-e delicious the onion rings were encrusted with herbs unlike any onion rings I have ever had and the sweet potato fries had a nice crunch with Just enough sweetness to compliment the burger best burgers in the bay for sure and I would definately be baq  to try the nutella shake and phat bob
author: Alex C.

description: Had the 1/2 pound kobe beef burger with grilled onions. This was the most juciest burger i ever had. I also love the spring, sweet potato fries with onion rings, enough for two people to share. Will give only 4 stars because i need to try out the milk shakes and the chilli cheese fries next , cant wait.
author: Mykia F.

description: I never thought out of all places my favorite burger would be in San Francisco. Jalapeno burger, super garlicky fries...yes please! Delicious
author: Katie H.

description: Good but not great. The french fries need some serious work. For the price you should getmore /better. The milkshakes are the best part!
author: Sherri R.

description: Oh man...my boyfriend brought me here for lunch today, and it was all very good. My boyfriend loves this place, so he was excited to take me here, and I'm glad he did! The milkshake we had was AMAZING, especially because it had chunks of banana in it. Both of our burgers were delicious, and I cannot wait to come back and try more of their special burgers and delicious milkshakes!
author: Lisa B.

description: Do you know why I love Yelp?  Because I find great places to eat like Pearl's when I feel like a burger and I don't want to walk very far in the rain from my apartment for fast food.  This place is definitely delish.  They make burgers to your liking, and they do a great job at it too.  Why go anywhere else for a great burger but this place?  Meat is from Neiman Ranch which means there aren't any hormones added to their beef, and now they have buffalo burgers which are even healthier and jucier than regular burgers.  I used to have to go to Fuddruckers to get such a burger.  Now...I can just walk half a block up.  Be aware though, they're closed on Sundays.  I learned it the hard way yesterday.
author: Jin B.

description:
Pearls I really hope you read this review and fix things. I LOVE your burgers, LOVE your 49er's dog and your spicy sly whoooo on point... amazing. Here the thing I work down the street and eat here often and recently I'm starting to have a sad face when I order the chilly cheese fries :( first of all the price went up hmm... but that's not a big deal the problem there its been at least 5 times that I haven't had any cheese and the bear minimum of onions c'mon thats the best part. The chilly is also lacking its watered down like no meat and this is really bumming out because I always add spicy sly to my chilly so now it extra watered down makes me sad.
Overall I still will give you guys a 5 star rating because it would not be fair to bad mouth MY FAVORITE hamburger joint in the city. If you haven't been here yet its one of sf gems the spicy sly burger, turkey burger, ohhh god i'm getting hungry again, I'm eating chilly cheese fries as I type, EAT HERE...

But pearls I'm telling you my co-workers and I are talking you got to shape up though to up the price on your chilly cheese fries and for them to get worst its not a good look. one day its on point and one day short c'mon stay consistent 

P.S
I'm not bad mouthing perals get it straight I FUCKING LOVE PEARLS... I"m just a little sad right now cause I don't like to complain and i'm eating cheese-less chilly cheese fries

D.Hood
author: dorian h.

description: I will never be a skinny person because of Pearl's. I will never be able to say no to any burger from Pearl's. I will never cut out dairy from my diet because of your milkshakes. I will never have to rob a bank to afford a meal from Pearl's. I will always leave Pearl's satisfied.
author: Mary L.

description: Great neighborhood burger joint.  If I'm craving a solid burger, I head to Pearl's.  And they have mini burgers, which aren't that "mini" but small enough to satisfy me.  Shake selection is great too!
author: Janice Y.

description:
LOVE, LOVE, LOVE the Pearl Burger!!!!!  I kinda want to eat a cheeseburger every day now.  

I used to only order the cheeseburger, but then switched over to the turkey burger and have remained faithful ever since.  Both are excellent!  I've never been disappointed with the food.  And they make a kick-ass peanut butter milk shake!

The only reason I'm giving 4 stars is the wait time...I usually call my orders in and am told every time "5-10 minutes."  Yet when I show up  5-10 minutes later, I end up waiting another 5-15 minutes.  Please just tell me when it will really be ready and I'll show up then.

Other than that, this place rocks!
author: Michelle M.

description:
Big juicy burgers (some might say sloppy) on melt in your mouth buns with a side of Frings, all for less than a Jackson.
What more could one want after a good movie. Not only that, we found a parking place right in front.
Yum.
author: Marcus R.

description: the burger is sooooo AWESOME! and the garlic fries is perfect! yum yum yum!
author: Susan H.

description:
dug it.

good burgers.  fast delivery.  courteous counter staff.
wide variety on menu.  good serving sizes.

would recommend and would definitely go back. 

(try the mini burgers for a smaller portion and a cheaper menu option.  they don't downsize the taste!)
author: Lily B.

description: Luv this little gem of a burger joint. Theres not much going on, its super small but the is an awesome burger menu & the owners are super friendly & the prices are reasonable. Oh and the burgers are so freakin' DELICIOUS the fries are good too. This is our go-to place for burgers in our neighborhood - this ranks in my top 5 of burger joints in SF for sure. I def recommend this place.
author: Kimberly R.

description: The Bula Burger with Kobe beef is incredable.Shakes Too, any special burger is great...next time im going for the pesto burger if i can resist "the Bula",but whenever iM in Frisco Pearl's hits the spot.
author: Mark C.

description:
friend: "don't forget the napkins, it's gonna be messy."

me: "sure, but I'm not a sloppy eater."

OH EM GEE! 
The phat bobb was great! It was tasty and messy, with just the right amount of BBQ sauce. This is my new burger place, period.
author: Miguel S.

description:
you wouldn't know it from the exterior, but thanks to yelp reviews i now know about the veggie options at this place.  you can get any "special burger" with a veggie patty.  examples are pesto, teriyaki, etc.  and many come with grilled mushrooms, nice!  the "burger" size is very generous.  fries are good.  and i love that you can get split orders of fries / sweet potato fries / onion rings!

vegetarians who love fast food (ahem) should know about this place.  assuming you're into the veggie patty thing.  they also have grilled cheese.

guy at the counter was so friendly.  a rare find in sf.

and i haven't tried them yet, but this place has a huge selection of milkshake flavors!  impressive for such a small joint.
author: Karen O.

description: Iv'e heard great news about this place, so I was excited to try it. There is nothing like a good cheeseburger. Pearl's did not let me down, their food tasted fresh and somewhat healthy for a burger place. The cheeseburger  was served on a wheat bun with organic beef. After eating it, I did not feel overly stuffed like I would from a normal cheeseburger. I am excited that this place is only a couple blocks down because it is so delicious!
author: Sadie L.

description:
Hello flavor!

This place is amazing. Simple food, with big flavors. Whether you want a traditional burger, or the buffalo/kobe versions, or my favorite the BLACK FOREST milkshake...this  place is amazing and reliably delicious.
author: Brian S.

description: Ate here for the first time a few weeks ago and it was great! It's a small place but the food is great. They also have a wide variety of milkshakes which were delicious!!!! Can't wait to have another milkshake!!
author: Danielle W.

description: I came here once because of all the glowing reviews, but I did not find this Burger place much better than average. Pearl's does offer a large variety of different types of burgers, but I am more of a plain Cheeseburger with lettuce and tomato fan, so given the choice, I would choose "Slider's Diner" over Pearl's.
author: Scott S.

description: "Phat Bob" was hellacious... tasty and huge. Coconut Shake was not really coconutty but who cares it was still yummy as hell. Garlic fries ... new twist on an old favorite for me.... and I don't usually like when people mess with stuff that works but these were decent. Service was super speedy and very friendly and genuine... definatley felt welcomed. The price was reasonable comparitavley to the rest of the area... and I wiill be back. Awesome all around.
author: John C.

description: Pearl's has some delicious burgers. My favorite burger at the place is the Spicy Sly burger.  If you don't mind spicy food, I highly recommend it. It isn't too spicy anyway. The staff is nice and they are a good example of a good burger joint.
author: Yuan T.

description: Loved everything I had, even down to the giant straw for my shake. Has become a mandatory visit whenever I come to San Francisco.
author: John O.

description: I have been celebrating with the rest of the Giants fans for the past few days and really didn't feel like cooking tonight, and I blew being vegetarian earlier with the hot dogs at work after the parade. What better to end the night with than a burger? So, I Googled and Yelped my way to this cute diner I never noticed before. I had the deluxe burger w/ cheddar and hubby had the deluxe w/ cheddar and bacon. We shared onion rings and sweet potato fries and a chocolate shake. It was everything I wanted it to be, a juicy, perfectly cooked burger on a bun that could handle the toppings. The onion rings were decent and the fries were sweet and not oversalted. I am now full and happy and going to sneak into the freezer and finish off the shake while hubby is asleep. My only issue with this place is that I am now going to be tempted to make a detour on my way home tomorrow again. :D
author: Kate C.

description: My husband and I shared the mushroom burger that comes loaded with cheese and the deluxe with cheese and bacon.  Both were delish.  They both hit the spot.  We also had the frings (half fries, half onion rings).  The fries and onion rings were both okay but tasted even better saturated in ranch.  The chocolate shake was also good.  They have a variety of burgers to chose from, such as the pesto burger or the king which is topped off with a grilled hot dog and thousand island dressing, too rich for me.  All in all it's a great casual place to go for hearty burgers.
author: Maybelline A.

description: Buffalo, beef or chicken, the meat is juicy and the combination of ingredients is absolutely delicious. Fries are not my favorite, but on the plus side, they have sweet potato fries!
author: Jay K.

description: Yeah this place has won awards for their burgers.  The reason is they are EXCELLENT.  Extremely juicy burgers, but unlike other "juicy" burgers, these don't leave you with that heavy-gut bomb feeling.
author: p w.

description:
One of the best burgers in town. Never been disapointed, nice crew, great meat (buffalo burger !!).

The place is quite tiny thought so be prepared for a take away OR for a little wait
author: laurent c.

description: Hands down one of the best burgers I've ever had.  The patty is thick, juicy, and prepared just right every time.  Not much more to say than that.  Enjoy.
author: Idin K.

description:
Thank you Pearl for clogging my arteries and making me feel happy for it. 

The buffalo burgers here are ginourmous, juicy, and full of yummy flavor. If you love milkshakes, try their coconut milkshake. It's so good, I eat here about twice a week. I know, I know, I  promise I'll cut down before I get a heart attack.

The staff is super friendly and even friendlier when you're a regular.

The only disappointment is the bun. It tastes and feels like a store-bought sesame bun. I'd gladly pay a dollar more for a home-baked bun. Also, please bring back the old-style sweet potato fries. The krinkle cut ones are nasty and flavorless.
author: Chanpory R.

description: The second best burgers I've ever had. Literally the only negative thing I can say about this place is it's almost impossible to get one of the limited seats. The fries are also to die for.
author: Mike L.

description:
they have some of the best greasy juicy burgers.
but man i just purchased their grilled chicken burger to try something new and it was a horrible mistake. i couldnt even finish it i dont know what they did but it was tasteless and the worst texture ever. 
other than that i love this place.
author: mackenzie e.

description: Introducing my new Best Burger in San Francisco. Wow. Fresh, tasty and prodigious. Next time I'm gonna upgrade to bison, just for fun. Don't bother with the regular fries. The sweet potato fries are the way to go. By the way, we found this place on the recommendation of the bartender at the most excellent Minx bar, just around the corner. He even phoned in our order and told us to bring them back and eat at the bar, which we did. An incredibly delicious Pear's burger, washed down with beverages from Minx? That's a tasty burger, Brad.
author: Jim M.

description: I actually don't like eating meat that much because it's so filling (i know, i'm weird)... but when I DO crave a cheeseburger, I go to Pearl's!  My husband and I go to Pearl's a lot and I usually get the sweet potato fries (the best I've ever had!) and a banana shake (great shakes too!).  My husband has had every burger on their menu and has no complaints.  We love you, Pearl's!
author: Crystal K.

description: I came here in search of the perfect burger and I found a decent burger, with an okay malt. The onion rings were great and so was the service, but the malt, burger and fries. Eh. I could take them or leave them.
author: Dee I.

description: Really great burger... I'm not a burger person. But tried spicy sly chicken one and added some mushroom with it. Umm... Yum! Super satisfied. My friend got a Turkey one, smells good too... They have a new one called Kobe... beef inside... sounds good. I think next time, I'll try that. Then, maybe the Buffalo or Turkey one... Oh, man, I hope I'd better watch out my body fat after these delicious burgers... BTW, they have very nice serves as well. Very patient about I doubt like 3 times what I really want. (Come on, normally I'm not like this, but I'm NOT a burger person!) Anyway, great tiny place with the surprising good burger.
author: Flora F.

description: Sweet heavens, I feel like a fool for never having heard of Pearl's before this past Friday! Shamed as a native san franciscan by visiting canadians. It started on a boat like most stories. The beginning tummy rumbles began soon after the sun set and the cold air set in. Of course, we started to talk about food just to make ourselves more hungry. Pearl's was an immediate suggestion by the canadians, claiming it to be better than Burgermeister. Now my interest was peaked. Then the rumbles became growls as more time passed while we unkowingly sailed past our dock, followed by hours of being lost in the bay. Pearl's became a shiny beacon, a reward for finding our dock, something to look forward to, something to satisfy the tired sailor. And it was! A simple cheeseburger was pure love. It melted in my mouth. I wanted to cry I was so content. So I concede to Pearl's greatness.
author: Faye P.

description: Small little place with only a few tables but the Phat Bob burger and the garlic fries are amazing!
author: Jeff R.

description: DEEEEEEEEEEEEEELICIOUSNESSSSSSSSSS! OMG their burger w/ bacon and cheese happy dance with every bite!!! onions rings .. hellllo lovers! sweet potato fries yummmmmm, hotdog mmm mmmmmmm goood! i cant take it anymore what's not to like! they are so nice!!!!!! and their food rocks! and the face they are open late. I LOVE YOU PEARLS!
author: Nina R.

description: Best burger I've ever had in my life! I forget what its called but it won a contest, so just go in there and order the one that won the contest, no questions asked, you will be amazed!
author: Allegra W.

description: I consider Pearl's to have the best burgers in the bay area. Delicious meat, and great toppings. I've never tried the kobe beef because the standard ones taste so good. Can't go wrong with a Phat bob, Spicy Sly, or Prized Pearl. My only warning is eating one does get messy, and sometimes their sweet potato fries are too soft/soggy.
author: Dave S.

description:
Went there on Thursday 7/29/10 with my best friend who recommended this place for long time. So we arrive at 1130-12ish noon time, place was half pack. I don't know what is good so my friend order the usual. 2 pearl burger medium rare with sweet potato fries and 2 orange soda in a can with foil cover with was cool keep ur drink clean before u open it.
First bite I taste the juice from the burger and all the favors. They cook it right on the spot wasn't over cook or undercooked. It just was what I wanted a nice burger that didn't broke my tooth like Carl's Jr in San Bruno that scare me away from eating burger for months. Yes the burger is greasy from all the lovely juice but who care it is a burger and yes it is small place but most good place is small and hard to find. Don't come here if you in a rush and want alot of space and some fancy seating with a large group. If u want to be eating health and all that go eat a salad. The sweet potato fries fill me up it is sweet and cook just right. I going to try all their other burgers next time.
I would love to come to this place for lunch when I drive by whenever I can. Btw goto hell Carl's Jr ur burger cost me hundreds in dental and all the other bad fast food goto hell
author: Amano T.

description:
damn near perfection! recommended by my roomate. she's marvelous for it. 

sooo my friends and i get together one day a year to act like  angry jealous women who can't stand other women looking better than them. we're not generally like this at all (i swear) but on this one day we choose to because it's fun to act completely irrational sometimes. what day is this? the day/night of the Victoria's Secret Fashion Show. we sit around and watch the gorgeous (and some not so gorgeous) models strut around in their skimpy outfits in jealousy and we judge them. when they're too skinny or not of utmost beauty, we rag on them and happily enjoy junk food. and when they are beyond gorgeous we say "pass the ice cream."

so prior to the viewing my friend and i decided to start the good eats early. we head to pearl's and get crazy specialty burgers. she gets one with bacon, cheese, onions and bbq sauce. i get one with bacon, onions and blue cheese. sweet potato fries and onion rings to share, and a mint oreo shake and a pumpkin shake to share. SO GOOD. no complaints. all delicious. greasy like it should be. 

the place is really small but clean and inviting enough. it's run by some Asian folks who i never realized would be able to concoct such mean burgers.  it was the best way to start on our we'll-eat-ourselves-until-we-feel-better-about-other-women-looking-so-gorgeous-junk-food!
author: Regina C.

description:
The best effing burger in the city. Will customize anything to you're liking. (so get light sauce Chase, you whinger)

The food is always fresh and fries hot as blazes. 

If there was any down side it'd have to be the small dinning area. But, with that said I've eaten my burger sitting on the curb and it's so good it doesn't matter. 

Once again, BEST IN  THE CITY!
author: j f.

description: Best burger in the city, and best veggie burger too! Young treated me like family when I was with my old office and worked across the street. He still greets me by name even if I now only stop in once a month, rather than twice a week.
author: Michael H.

description:
I grew up in Texas and was used to there always being a great, greasy burger joint right down the street, wherever you were, but I hadn't found anything like those places of my youth out here in Cali until I discovered Pearl's. Really, though, it's so much more than a greasy spoon. 

The difference is the variety of burger toppings and even different kinds of meat offered. Also, the chicken sandwiches are legit, too. To top it all off, there are like 20 different flavors of shakes and you can mix and match the flavors if you want. My favorites are Nutella, Mud Pie, and Pina Colada. Oh, and I forgot to mention the onion rings are awesome, too.
author: Colin S.

description:
3.5 Stars

My cousin saw this place on the food network and wanted to give it a try. I looked it up on yelp and it got a lot of great reviews so I wanted to try it as well. A group of us took the trek up to the city with the hope of finding the best burger we ever ate. Unfortunately, not everyone felt that way about this place. The place was tiny with a line out the door. I ordered the prized pearl and it was OK. I like the hamburger meat itself but overall I wasn't that impressed. Most people in my group weren't all that impressed either. Probably not worth the trip to the city and there's no parking except for the few spots on the street.
author: Phillip M.

description: I do not really need to say much, their burgers are delicious, their fries are to die for, they have awesome and really good milkshake combo's. And that's basically it, you will want to visit this place again and again!!!
author: Luis O.

description: Delicious! I think Pearl's Deluxe Burger with Cheese is the best. But, Avo Chicken Burger is sometimes good.
author: Shinji K.

description: I have been here twice- and am impressed!  Their interesting and gourmet takes on the American burger will definitely bring you back to explore the menu.
author: Annabell S.

description:
Voted in San Francisco's Best of 2007- for Best Burgers - I thought that this would make a perfect destination for a post Union Square shopping escapade!

My friend and I trekked uphill towards  Post Street by the Tenderloin border- the restaurant was sandwiched between a french cafe and grocery store-so don't blink or you'll miss it!  

Once inside- the clean, steel lined cubicle had but a few tables with the best seats being the stool bars overlooking the busy street outside.  The huge chalk board menu made up for the sparse decor- but what they lacked here, they made up for the burger menu offering!  I thought to myself- its other namesake could have been, "HOUSE OF THE $6.95 BURGERS!"  All the burgers were priced at 6.95- that's one yelp STAR!  Moving right along the menu- they had FRINGS- people- I rest my case- half onion rings and half fries- this saves me extra bucks because this is the best of both worlds on one plate - hmmm maybe that was too far-fetched- but I just love these sides and end up ordering each one with my burgers at other restaurants! That's an additional Burger Star- ooooh I mean YELP star!  (Can you tell I'm getting excited about this place???) Sooo moving right along- the next order was for milkshakes- my friend had the Oreo milkshake- but I opted for my all time favorite strawberry flavor- if theirs had chunky pieces of strawberries in there- why-- I think I might just give them two stars!!! Once the milkshake tasting was at hand- I decided to give it my u;timate test:- THE 'let the straw stand for 20 secs test'...Wait and see if the straw starts to lean towards the side...if it doesn't, my friend you have just found the best milkshake in town!  I stopped counting after 25 seconds- cuz I just had to have a strawful right there and then!  I had to gather so much suction cuz those strawberry pieces were HUGE!!!  WOW- I think I just  found my favorite place- creamy and thick just like Blue Bell ice cream back in Texas!
Everything else was great- burgers were hot,  moist and juicy- fries were crisp , onion rings were fresh and crunchy but most of all- the service was prompt and courteous.

PS- I'm having the Oreo milkshake next time- and you can just roll down the hill when you exit.

UPDATE: 4/30

They are now the BEST $7.95 Burgers in town!
author: Arissa C.

description: Try the PHAT BOBB (burger with onion rings, bacon, BBQ sauce, & jack) and the SWEET POTATO FRIES. You won't be sorry!
author: Nicole F.

description: Best Burger I've had in San Francisco. and the sweet potato fries are simply stunning as well! not to mention, they even let you mix it up! i.e. half fries half onion rings, or half reg. fries, half sweet potato. I love variety!
author: Jevir G.

description:
so apparently three other yelpers were at pearl's same night I was....we should have to wear signs or something so we can have higher inter-rater reliability :)

i had mini spicy sly, pb-choc shake and i split some sweet potato garlic fries with my female dinner companion. ya i was the girl in the black north face with the blonde hair, using 8 napkins and still making a mess :) 

it was yummy- the mini size was perfect for me. the medium burger was definitively medium. the flavors were great- made me completely unkissable! tender, juicy beef, grilled peppers and onions, jack cheese on a softer than-a-cloud bun. the shake was also really good, like eating a reese's pb cup...however why the boba straw? if its for drinkability then a +...otherwise its just kind of an awkard size straw. the sweet potato fries were good, pretty avg and the garlic fries were pretty tasty too.

all in all great experience-minus creepy/flirty bums outside and minus the mess! i will have to workout extra hard the rest of the week! thanks pearls!
author: Jess V.

description:
when i am in need of a tasty, juicy burger (which is often), i go to pearl's deluxe.  i have been so heartily pleased that this place moved into my neighborhood, because it can be hard to find a damn good burger, and pearl's serves up a damn good burger.

what, you may ask, distinguishes pearl's burgers as "damn good?"  a list should illuminate the subject:

tasty beef, very perfectly cooked medium - meaning, tender, with a few interspersed spots of pink.
a delicately (as delicate as you can get on a grill, at least) toasted bun.
fresh tomato & lettuce - the lettuce is actually green, and CRISP.
grilled onions upon request.

and besides the elements of the pearl's burger itself, the establishment provides many burger amenities, as well:

free-range/organic beef option.
tasty buffalo meat option.
two burger sizes - "mini" and "deluxe."
sweet potato fries.
a huge variety of milkshake flavors.

and last, but not least, IT'S FREAKIN' CHEAP - i got seriously full tonight on a mini-deluxe cheeseburger for $3.99.  AND it's OPEN LATE.  until 2am on the weekends.

the only reason i don't give pearl's 5 stars is because i'm being picky- a 5 star burger must be hand-patted.  also, the eating area isn't particularly comfortable, and because burger-eating can be an intense & messy experience, i'd prefer a more comfortable sort of seating arrangement into which i can slouch while i gorge myself.  but still, pearl's is KILLER and you should eat there next time you're in union square and in need of a damn good burger...
author: genevieve g.

description: I've eaten here twice...best greasy, tasty, unhealthy veggie burger ever! I am shameless! Awesome garlic fries. Cheap cheap cheap. Quick service. Recommended for a hole-in-the-wall burger joint!
author: Anne A.

description:
I rarely bestow five stars on a burger joint because there are just so few of them that actually can bring the holy trinity of burger, fried side and shake together.  Pearl's makes me say HALLELUJAH!  Or something like that which won't get me struck down from a bolt from above if there really DOES happen to be a higher power.
I am in a pot induced food stupor from the Prized Pearl with an upgraded buffalo patty (applewood smoked bacon, blue cheese, sauteed onions), Springs (sweet potato fry and onion ring combo) and peanut butter chocolate shake.  My wallet is also $17.50 lighter but this is going to be the only meal I eat today so I'm good with that.  This was a HUGE meal as the burger was a 1/2lber to say nothing of the king size shake and the large portion of sweet potato fries and onion rings.  However, I danced and hooked up with *that guy* all night long and we decided to forego the early morning grub for the dessert of each other and so at 2:30pm I was RAVENOUS.  So it's good for that kind of situation for sure.
I can't say enough about how good these burgers are and my only complaint is that I neglected to ask for my burger rare and they automatically prepare all burgers medium.  However, that's my fault and not theirs.
I think I need to take a pot and food stupor induced nap.
author: Jill D.

description: Ok so I had some kind or BBQ bacon burger... And it was awful! The meant was over cooked! And when I say over cook I mean burn! Bacon was on the crunchy side as well. Only moisture in this burger was the BBQ and my saliva!
author: Silvia C.

description: A burger doesn't get much better than this. Big, juicy, tasty, and 100% satisfying. Never fails to meet my burger cravings.
author: Richard K.

description: This place was ok. Definitely not worth the $13 I spent on the Phat Bob (which was decent) and the Sweet Potato fries (which were soggy), I didn't even get a drink! So lame. Not going back...
author: Chris R.

description:
A precautionary message for those of you who are thinking about eating here... come hungry, I mean REALLY hungry! The size of the burgers are pretty mighty and of course you have to get a side so... be prepared to stuff your face! I definitely got my money's worth because it was lunch AND dinner!
I decided to satisfy my 2-day old burger craving here. I ordered a Pearl Deluxe burger with cheddar and bacon. My boyfriend ordered the same thing but updated to Kobe beef. My beef was cooked medium and the whole thing was just DRIPPING with juicy and fatty goodness. It was a burger's burger. The only thing that could have improved my experience was a pickle- which I saw after I finished (they're on the counter next to the register for free!). :( The fries were meh... if I go back I'm going to try the onion rings instead.
In conclusion, it was a very good burger and it definitely satisfied my craving. However, I'm not sure my insides appreciated that as much. lol. I'm not used to eating so much meat! I'll be back though...
author: Amanda W.

description:
This place freakin' rocks.  I love it more than life itself.  I should back up and explain that I have been on a hamburger kick lately--at least one per week, and don't feel satisfied.  So, while hanging out in the neighborhood, I stumbled upon this place and almost began praying in the entryway for the burger of my dreams.
Well, my prayers were answered.  The burgers here are huge and the toppings plentiful.  My favorite is just a hamburger with avocado and red onions--the best mix of flavors ever.  But, in an unexpected leap of faith, I ordered the sweet potato fries.  I was suspicious since  most places have these tiny little fries with barely any "potato meat."  Well, Pearl's has the most delicious, chunky fries and I crave them even as I write this.
But, the best part of all, was the unlimited pickle option.  I loaded up and never got one dirty look.  It was a dream come true.
ps--why are you guys closed on Sundays??!?!  It kills me.
author: Jessica L.

description: I've been to Pearls many times and every single time I go there I leave absolutely stuffed.. Not only are their burgers the best in the TenderNob, but  they're definitely my favorite burgers I've ever had at a restaurant. I'm a starving college student and am almost always low on cash - I try to be very frugal. The good thing about Pearl's is that it's actually decently affordable for San Francisco. It's not ridiculously expensive... at the same time, it's not dirt cheap. Go here if you like delicious, thick, juicy burgers and delicious fries (not to mention sweet potato fries)!
author: Matthew M.

description: the burger was decent if you order medium well, but the fries were too oily, they flour them or something, makes em crispier if you like that, but more oily, more indigestion, unless you have a strong stomach for fried food, skip the fries, better yet go to custom down the street, better burger and fries.
author: Charlie M.

description: WOW. Their burgers were the best I've had since my move to San Francisco, possibly the best I've had....ever. Eat here, you wont be disappointed! YUMMY!
author: Joelle B.

description: A little on the pricey side for a good ole fashion greasy burger, but the quality is stellar. Great location and open late for those weekend-bar excursions. No frills, just good grub.
author: Darrell L.

description: So two years without a burger. We go to Pearl's for one of our rare "any food you want" occasion meals. And man, that was really somethin' else. Screw fancy restaurants for the occasion meals when you can walk up to a counter and have a kick ass burger in a few minutes. Buffalo meat was great - they're very generous with the portion (OK, I don't think I've eaten that much meat in a sitting for two years), and the toppings. Onion rings were awesome too.  I'm still recovering. Sentences. So. Short.
author: Jen D.

description: Great-tasting burger, ignoring the fact that it's dripping in grease. There is a variety of unique selections for burgers. The sweet potato fries are good to try, but I think I'm more of a french fries kind of guy. I came here twice with my cousin and my friends.
author: Agent G.

description: absolutely deliciously thumb-lickingly great. if you're in downtown san francisco, don't make the mistake to miss their awesome burgers.
author: Paolo B.

description: Nice way to round out the holiday weekend of eating!  Phat boy burger, chili cheese fries, and nutella shake.  My friend summed up Pearl's, "You can't go wrong, I'm pretty sure nothing is healthy here."  Well, we didn't make any wrong choices.  All the food came out in approximately 10 minutes with my nutella shake coming out in 2-3 minutes, which was not a rich chocolate milk shake, but was nice and fluffy.  I was perfectly content with eating that for dinner, but of course that wouldn't be healthy either, and who wants to neglect the phat boy?  Not me!  BBQ sauce is the salient taste in this burger so if you don't like bbq sauce, probably wouldn't recommend this burger.  However, the bbq sauce nicely flavored the patty and complemented the fried onion rings and bacon.  The chili on the fries had a little kick, and was atop nicely cripsed fries.  If I am in the neighborhood, I want to try the Bula Burger, which is what they won awards for.  Saved the rest of the shake for dessert, and left a happy customer.
author: Steph W.

description:
like my man gabronimus maximus in the banana suit says, "i like it". (yeah, i can piecemeal a quote, too!) i had been planning a trip to pearl's for a few weeks with a bud of mine. she heard about it somewhere and i totally trust her word of mouth opinion.

when we walked in i only knew to expect 'good hamburgers', but i was in for a surprise. first, i almost had a krystal flashback when i saw they had mini burgers, although this is a misnomer. by "mini" burger, they mean to say "the same size of a burger you'd grill in your backyard," it just takes up too much menu space to write that. in the realm of their "normal-sized" burgers, your world of options opens up. you can upgrade your meat to either organic beef, turkey, veggie, or buffalo meat. you can do a classic cheeseburger or step it up to one of their twelve special burgers like a teriyaki burger. fries? forget that plain french fries noise and try out the garlic fries, or the springs, or my favorite, the sweet potato fries. and as for a lovely beverage? how about a malt? yeah, you heard me. pearl's has malts.

basically, this place is great. it's simple, small and cheaper than taylor's automatic refresher. just be prepared to get your hands a bit greasy.
author: Jeremiah W.

description: Went here a few Saturdays ago and it was great.  It was amazing that the place was quite busy from the time they opened.  I ordered a "safe" burger ... mushroom and swiss and it was a very tasty, high quality burger.  My friends ordered Bola burgers and one loved it and the other was not that impressed.  I suppose if you like super fancy burgers, like the foie gras they have at Burger Bar, you may not like the Bola.  I would definitely go back to try the Bola.
author: Rod C.

description:
Three Second MindF*ck - The Better Mind Wins
Unaware that my mind is lurking in the dark, waiting to sabotage my burger rendezvous, I arrive at Pearl's around 6pm and I am greeted by a very nice guy behind the counter and we proceed to exchange some friendly greetings and small talk.  At this point, I am unaware that there will be three seconds in which I will have to defend myself from the transgressions of my own brain and its attempt to impose unrealistic expectations on this innocent encounter with the burger of my dreams.

It went something like this...
Me - Hey, how's it going, you guys working hard today?  
Him - It's been busy and crazy busy but it's always nice when we get friendly customers.  It changes up the day.  What can I get for you?
Me - I'll have the Bula Burger with cheddar instead of swiss, an order of fries and a chocolate shake.
Him - Ok that will be 14 bucks
First second - 
Mind - "14 bucks -ouch."  
Better mind - "f*ck it, it's worth every penny and you don't have one every day"
Me - OK here you go.  Oh yeah, can you make that a chocolate malt and add red onion to the burger?
Him - No problem.
Me - Cool
5 minutes later my order arrives and I surrender, throwing myself into the juicy goodness of this perfect burger.  It's pure, "all natural" unadulterated hamburger ecstasy.  mmmm .  I start reaching that moment.  You know the one, when you can't go on another second - not one more single bite.
Second second
Mind - "should we take this home?" 
Better mind - "Hell no, eat it all,  A burger this good doesn't deserve reheat."
I finish up every last tasty bit of the burger, leaving most of the fries and taking the chocolate malt with me.  As I proceed on my walk up the hill toward home on Russian Hill, I realize it's a bit chilly out and having a very delicious cold chocolate malt in hand I start getting colder and colder. 
Third second 
Mind - "Maybe you should just ditch the malt."  
Better mind - "Oh hell no to that - this shake is too damn tasty to toss.  Suck it up bitch, drink and keep walking."

I arrive at home unscathed by the three seconds of mindf*ck and feel victorious over the battle of the brain that tried to spoil being in the moment with my dream burger.  Oh happy days - life is beautiful and my belly is happy joyous and free. 

*note added on Sunday.  
The saying "The World is Your Oyster" comes to mind and I realize that sometimes we even get a Pearl[s Burger] along the way.   When I got on the scale this morning, I had actually LOST 2 pounds.  :)
author: Kathleen K.

description: I love the fact that they are open late. I went to Pearl's last night around 12:30 am for the first time after reading good things about it on yelp. I ordered a turkey burger with cheese and my boyfriend ordered a chicken pesto burger. They both were really good. We also had an order of garlic fries which were made fresh with lots of chunks of garlic. The guy that took our order was really nice and food came out quick. Overall, I would definitely come back.
author: Diane M.

description:
Some friends and I stopped in for lunch a couple days ago and it was just fantastic.  Very reasonable prices (less than $8 for a very generous specialty burger) and delicious product.  My burger had a massive piece of cheese, bacon that was probably 3/8" thick, two large onion rings and delicious bbq sauce.  The chili cheese fries were also delicious and very generous (a large container, the size of a large take-out box, heaping with fries, cheese and chili).  Others in the group loved their burgers and the regular and sweet-potato fries (which were nice and crisp).

I only wish we had room to try the shakes which also looked delicious.
author: Steve F.

description: Dam good casual burger, tiny welcoming store in out-of-the-way location.  Not cheap but approaches a sit-down restaurant burger for quality, perhaps  best in town at what it does.
author: Gil S.

description:
I'm so lucky to only live a few doors down.

I'd say in the past 30 days, 20 of my dinners have been at Pearls. (I'm gonna cut down...) It's a running joke as our group of friends that become Pearls junkies grows larger. When I first saw the place, the decor really put me off- the walls are a horrible lavender color, and the place just isn't aesthetically pleasing. I do tend to judge a book by it's cover, and I was wrong. Bad interior design aside- you can get one of many creative burgers (one has a spicy pumpkin chutney sauce), and for $1.25 more get organic beef (that's what I do- it makes an already excellent burger perfect), or for $1.50 more you can get your burger made out of buffalo. They have great onion rings, fries, garlic fries, and sweet potato fries that are cooked in rice bran oil (which doesn't raise cholestorol...they say it lowers it....that's my excuse for eating the fries....). They have shakes and malts, with your usual flavors, or you can get black cherry and orange cream or oreo shakes. It's really easy to drop $ here (my order is usually a chocolate malt, garlic fries, and a pearls burger with cheddar and organic beef, and it's around $17). But this food is well worth it. It is just as addictive, more expensive, more fattening than crack, but when you leave you leave sane...so I'd say I choose Pearls as my drug of choice.
author: Nick M.

description:
EPIC burger! We came here after a drunken night, and although I was not able to take my sunglasses off (because the light was blinding w/ 4 hours sleep), , I could see the beautiful burger in front of me.  Outstanding! I had the Phat Boy, and ate it in 9 bites. 
Thanks Pearl~
author: steve k.

description: Orgasm in my mouth.  One of the best cheeseburgers I've ever had thus far!  It's a small little joint.  No fuss, no mess just like their burgers!  If you're looking for gourmet then go some where fancy where you can eat your burger with a fork and knife with crisp white linens for double the price.
author: Lynda N.

description:
now this place serves quality burgers.  

my first time here i got the pesto burger (i love pesto, why have i never thought about putting it on a burger b4?!) and it was delish.  most recently i had a pearl's burger while recovering from hand surgery, and though the one-handed grab was a little tricky, the avocado burger was worth it.  i also tried a bite of the chicken burger which was better than i expected (aka super moist and tasty just like the regular burgers).  

The fries are good...if you like them a little thicker than thin-cut fries, but not as fat as wedges.  And I enjoyed the shake I ordered my first time there.  I really want to try the buffalo meat patty at some point to see if i can taste a difference.  

The best part about these burgers is probably that they have just the right amount of juiciness (mmm fat drippings).  They don't get the buns soggy, but you do need to keep the napkins handy.
author: Anne Marie B.

description: Pearl's was a great experience. I ordered the classic cheeseburger and a side of chilli fries. The meat was real large and juicy....perfect medium well, good melted jack cheese and a good portion of fresh letuce, tomatoes, red onion. The only thing that might have been better was the bread which got all soggy...maybe ask for the bread to be toasted? The interior was roomy and well lit and INCREADIBLY clean. I sat by the window on a warm SF day. The chilli fries were huge. Order it and share w/ a friend or order it as the main course. I could barely finish it. Service was friendly and real fast. The condoments were easily accessible and they had large pickles on the front counter. This place could be my fav burger joint in the Nob Hill area.
author: Angelo F.

description: Because of the Pride festival the next day the street I had parked in was closed to parking. Unfortunately the signs were placed after I had parked there. My car among with maybe 15 others were towed. After a hour long ordeal at the police station and the impound yard to get my car back I was hungry and disappointingly sober. We ended up at Pearl for the hungry and the Owl Tree across the street for drinks. The Pearl provided the goods in the form of the Spicy Sly Burger. It was delicious and well ... thats enough. I suppose yelp already knows this so I'll take this opportunity to thank you, the yelp community for recommending this place to me and by proxy comforting me in a dark time. Then there was the drinks afterward.
author: Don L.

description: I love their veggie burgers with mushrooms.  Amazing garlic fries, and great shakes (lots of flavors).  What is not to love?  Prices are a little high, but I've seen worse.
author: John K.

description: Like several have said, the tenderloin, lower nob hill deserve a good burger joint, and they got one in Pearl's on Post between Leavenworth and Jones.  A small, well lighted and clean place with a friendly staff and great, great burgers.  They use good beef in large patties, cook them to order, serve them on a bun that has just the right density to absorb the juices of the meat and condiments and hold it all together.  Good meat, bun, cheese, condiments and lettuce, tomato and onion and all the pickles you want make this a great burger joint.  Prices are reasonable and value is good.  Fries are great and generous like the burgers, dogs, chicken, turkey, veggie and other sandwiches and the salads are monstrous and delicious.  This place is my favorite new diner type place in the city.
author: Stu S.

description: Dudes, beware of this place if you're intimidated by large chunks of meat. I've been around and taken a bite of many supposed "best burgers" but Pearl's lives up to the hype. I had the Pearl Deluxe with peper jack and bacon and it was pure gluttonous delight. Topped off with an order of frings (fries and onion rings) and washed down with a big can of Arizona iced tea (that sells for the advertised 99 cents as opposed to the $2.25 you get at other spots) I can and I will be back to this place to start exploring the other burger adventures that await. The only reason I'm not giving them a 5th star is because they forgot the avocado on my friends burger. I understand that oversights can happen, and they did quite happily provide the avo, but being presented with a separate bill for the avocado was a bit strange.
author: Andrus H.

description: I'm not much of a burger fan, but my friend said it was a good greasy burger. The turkey burger I had wasn't too greasy and was tasty. I was craving a milk shake, and Pearl's sort of did the trick. It wasn't very thick, but it did hit the spot. I love that they have pickles in a container for you to take at will. Those hit the spot too. The only gripe would be the garlic fries. I like garlic, but there was a little much of it that it was overwhelming. You can't really talk to anyone you want to impress after having some of those.
author: Ellen S.

description: It says something when u ar rated the best burger by bobby flay and ann burrell. And it was great. They have loads of options for you to try. And their designer burgers even come in mini sizes now. I nearly missed that cos their menu board was kind of a mess with letter sized posters being stuck all over the place. I had the spicy burger and that was really good. The burger was so juicy and halfway through...my burger was already falling apart in my hands but thats the best way to finish it off by licking your fingers if you have to. I love their sides options too! We had the springs...sweet potato and onion rings and they have the frings too (french fries and onion rings). This is great especially when you want to try 2 things!
author: Topazskye L.

description: Veryyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy Good Burgersssssss..Just Try It :)))))
author: azin o.

description: This place is really convenient to local hotels and the international hostel. I had the Delux Cheese burger and was lpleasantly surprised at how good it was. The place is clean and the owners are pleasant and effficient.  If you are looking for a good old fashion burger this is the place. I will be back
author: Kevin L.

description: I woke up craving a burger.  Sometimes you just do.  A long yelp session later and I was on my way to Pearl's.  I ordered a cheeseburger and garlic fries (which I had never even heard of and must be some bizarre west coast mutation) and a coke.  The coke was good.  The burger was so-so.  Gristly meat that tasted kind of like a Costco frozen burger patty.  The fries were mediocre- really meaty, kind of soggy.  The addition of garlic was good, but because they were so big, the potato flavor took over.  Now don't get me wrong, had this meal cost me $6 instead of $15, I would have been thrilled.  It would have been good CHEAP food, but for the price, it was mediocre.
author: Connor S.

description: I try very hard to stop myself from going here because frequent burgers are the last things I need to add to my diet.  They make it very difficult.
author: Melissa G.

description:
A couple months ago my boyfriend and I went to Pearl's Deluxe Burgers for the first time. I'd never been there before, even though I used to live a block away from it, and now live 3 blocks away from it, because on first glance, (well, also on second and third glance) it appears to be just a hole-in-the-wall, mediocre, doesn't-even-have-a-beer-and-wine-license kinda place. 
The first thing you see when you look through the door is a Coca-Cola soda fountain - not exactly the feng shui equivalent of a fish tank. The interior is painted almost entirely in a pale lilac color. What happened to good old orange? Psychology has proven that it makes you hungry. Or even a red, though they would have to refurbish the dark-blue plastic-cushioned chairs. There also is not alot of seating, although it's more than my all-time favorite San Francisco burger place, Sam's (618 Broadway). But Sam's has character that Pearl's desperately lacks. Of course, if Pearl's looked like Sam's, no one in Lower Nob Hill would ever eat there. But I love Sam's. 
I'm getting off track. After entering Pearl's and being somewhat disgusted at the lack of interior taste, I took a look at the menu. The first thing I noticed was buffalo burgers. That's right! We eat buffalo here in California! It's both healthier AND manlier than beef! Full of omega-3 fatty acids! They also offer all-natural beef, hormone free, organically-grown, non-gmo. And they deep-fry their deep-fried stuff in rice bran oil, which has a mild flavor, 400-something degree smoke-point, and no trans fatty acids. And some other good stuff. And the best part yet: I asked if they had pickles, and the guy behind the counter (the owner, I later found out) pointed to a BIN of kosher dill pickles over with the condiments! I could take as many as I wanted! I had four. 
Also of note, when we got our food, the lettuce was perfectly green (not iceberg) neatly folded to fit within the boundaries of the bun, and the tomato was ripe and red. The 1/4 pound buffalo patty was cooked a proper medium-well, which I was a little disappointed with, as I'm used to the SF-fine-restaurant medium-well, which is really like medium-rare. But they get points for doing it right; next time I'll ask for medium-rare. The only thing that would have improved the meal itself would have been a big cold pint of beer. Or even a bottle of Corona, Sam's-style. So I asked the man whom I now understood to be the owner about the disappointing lack of beer, and he informed me that the "Neighborhood" would cause him some problems if he tried to serve alcohol... despite, or maybe because of, the overpriced liquor store right next door. He also told me that the "Neighborhood" got rid of the trashcan on that block because they were sick of having trash there. I myself have purposefully littered on that block after noticing the frustrating lack of trashcan. I will continue to do so.
So despite the lack of any kind of atmosphere or alcohol, Pearl's Deluxe Burgers gets four stars. Also, they're open until 2am on Friday and Saturday!
author: Thea K.

description: Pearl's has a long list of different kinds of burgers. They even have half size burgers! I believe their burgers are way better than In-N-Out.  I was a little wasted from a reggae concert, so my recollection is not that good. Their bacon burger was a lil greasy but I guess thats good for drunks.  The bacon was ridiculously good! Their fries.....  BOMB DIGGITY! Garlic fries and its way better than the ballparks or Gordon busch! The tenderloin is ghetto? I don't think so.
author: Calvin T.

description:
Best Burgers close to Union Square.

I've tried the special burgers but I keep coming back to the plain cheeseburger because you can hold it in your hand and taste the meat. And maybe have room for a few of the garlic or sweet potato fries.  Come another day and try one of their milkshakes.  

Pesto chicken is good too, as is the chicken club.  But I always prefer the beef.

I just can't get enough of this place!

We buy 2 burgers for 3 people and one order of fries.  And we are not small people.
author: Brenda B.

description: I'm reviewing a take out order. My girlfriend and I ordered a "the bomb" burger, "deluxe burger", sweet potato fries, onion rings, wild cherry shake.
