Out of everything the only thing that was great was the shake. The bomb was a dud as the forgot the chilli. The fries suffered from being in a to go container and the burgers were lackluster which was a big disappointment after reading so many rave reviews about them. The place is about the size of a shoe box. Service was fast and friendly. The shake was so good my girlfriend ordered another. If you're willing to give them a try look close as we missed the place because of it being sandwiched between and Indonesian and Thai place. I'm not sure I would go back as there are many other places in the area to get a good burger. To be honest we would have been better off at an in and out burger. What we ordered came to nearly $31 not counting the second shake. For that price we could have gotten more and better quality elsewhere and even been able to sit down and eat.
author: Brian J.

description: I knocked a star off for how tiny my mouth is.
author: Cameron Scott C.

description: Pearl's, round two. Ding! Returned to try other items on the menu. This time I ordered a Teriyaki chicken sandwich with crinkle cut sweet potato fries. The former didn't blow me away taste-wise but I will say that the chicken was cooked nicely. My fries were soggy and plain. It was a bit disappointing considering my love for sweet potato fries...but I definitely recommend going to Pacific Catch for them instead -- sorry, Pearl! Again, just okay.
author: Novi M.

description: One of the best burger places in SF, anyone that thinks otherwise either doesn't know what they're talking about or were too drunk to remember how good the food was but remembered how tiny and packed the place was.
author: Ed D.

description: Great Burgers and selection.  The prices are reasonable for the area and they have great Onion Rings and shakes!!!
author: T D.

description: Really delicious juicy mouthwatering burgers...they also have Buffalo if you're in the mood... I work dangerously close to Pearls...I am hooked. Its def. the best in union Sq!
author: Michele K.

description: Meh, maybe I just hit this place on an off night, but I just wasn't THAT impressed.  I got a Spicy Sly and frankly it was just a bit blah.  Not near spicy enough, the bun was average, and the patty was a pretty generic greasy spoon burger patty.  To top it off, a burger (without fries) and a coke was over $10 which seems a little high given the type of place this is.  In contrast I could have had this http://www.joshwillis.net/meals/122906d.jpg back in Austin at Casino el Camino WITH fries and a beer for less money.  I wouldn't mind eating here again, but I won't make a special effort to come back.
author: Joshua W.

description:
somehow today i acquired a craving for a burger and fries.

one excited dog,
two hipsters,
three women celebrating someone's 35th birthday
and four middle-aged ladies later,

that desire has been sated.  and oh my goodness, it was so good.  thank you, yelp.  what a delicious place for my partner to slip out of his vegetarianism, and my veggie patty was also amazing.

the fries were good, i was happy with them.  about two of mine (maybe there were four, then, because we shared) were oversalted, and some were undersalted - but then, i like salt too much.  so.  they were still delicious, so we're sticking with the five-star rating.

oh, yum.  and not too expensive - $21 plus tip for the above, plus two sodas and a milkshake.  and all the pickles you can scoop, adds my partner.
author: Puck F.

description: Oh man the burgers are good, and nice that they have a few different types of fries.  Everytime i have a craving I just go across the street and grab some fries.  There's sweet potato fries too, but theyre not as good as ones in Pacific Catch or the Counter in Palo Alto.  May have to do with the oil they fry it in cuz it turns out way darker than the other places.  They have special burgers, different sizes, and organic beef patties or buffalo patties at extra charge.  Pickles in the pickle jar for you to take.
author: Teresa Y.

description: I'm not into bashing restaurants but Pearl's is overrated. I have given it three chances. I have tried both the regular beef burger and the kobe beef burger. I was really excited bc they also serve bison but I decided to pass bc the man working said they didnt sell the bison much. Thanks for the insight but bad for your business. The burger has been overcooked everytime, which to me isnt too big of a deal but I was really disapointed when they overcooked the kobe. I feel mid rare is the way to enjoy a burger.. they havent been close.
author: Tony M.

description: These are the best burgers I've found in san francisco! I've been in search of the perfect burger and this is it! What makes these burgers so great? After all, it's just beef n bun n basic condiments right? Well at Pearls they start with high quality beef, and you can even opt for Kobe beef! The patties are hand done NOT in a press and frozen for future use. Loosely packed patties mean the juices can flow freely thru the burger during the cooking process and get trapped inside for an altogether juicier experience.  Then there's the bun.  These seem to me to be baked fresh onsite daily... No day old or week old buns like most places I've tried in the city. Soft, yeasty homemade taste.... Amazing! And of course the condiments and toppings .... Well most places can't screw this part up, but as for pearls, I can say the cheese is very high quality and fully immersed onto the patty once u get it, and if you order the mushroom burger, it will be completely smothered with them! Unlike other burger joints that make you search and find them to be sure the cook got your order right. Anyway, this is worth the trip from anywhere in the city, so just try it! I dare you to find a juicier burger with a fresher bun!
author: Chrys K.

description: Really good burger! And the side order of fries was pretty big. It was more than enough, even with the "mini" 1/4 pounder instead of the regular 1/2. And my friend had a peanut butter and chocolate milkshake........................ sooooooooooo good. Not a whole lot of room to sit, and the prices can add up if you're getting everything separately, but you can share and still fill up while saving some cash.
author: Teressa C.

description: OMG this place makes the most amazing burgers!!!!!! mabe it was cause i came in at a quarter till 2am and this place was open for munchies... but I had the delux for the my first time here and it was AMAZING!!!!! these guys are cool- they work long ass hours and are burger artists.  major props. i will definetely be coming back.
author: Vincent N.

description: Pearls burgers, are one of the best burgers I've had in the bay area.  The deluxe burger with bacon and pepper jack cheese plain with a side of sweet potato fries.. is the business. They have a pretty big menu with something for everyone.They also have buffalo,kobe beef and chicken if the regular angus beef isn't your sort of thing. One of my coworkers told me about this place and now everyone in the building is on the pearls hype. The meat is juicy, the bacon crispy, and the fries/onion rings are on point.. there is nothing more i can say about this place but that it is amazing.   A little pricey for my likes but its decent for downtown sf.. 5 stars for my folks at pearls..
author: Voung Y.

description:
i would give pearls 5 stars. 
but, the buns suck! 
they get soggy after 2 -3 bites and then it starts to become a mess. everything disintegrates and it's just embarrasing. you have the burger all over your fingers and it's dripping and breaking apart, it's no fun!
please, dear pearls guys, getter better buns!!!!!!!
author: bmwcafe c.

description: Yes. **** yes. Now this is a burger. Since I moved here about two years ago, I have been looking for a burger to replace my current favorite, which is Rocky's crown point pub in San Diego. Although Pearls doesn't have the "soup nazi" like bartenders that Rocky's does, the service is fantastic and the quality of the burger is on point. Not only are they now open until 2:00am on weekends, they let you take as many pickles as you want. A definite must for that  sweet daytime buzzed going home to eat and nap before hitting the town kind of person. Try the sweet potatoe fries for a change in scenery, and remember, you control your pickle destiny.
author: Matt M.

description: Pearl's have a delicious mushroom burger that may be the greasiest burger I've eaten in my life.  It was really good but I don't think it was worth the money.  At least they had garlic fries to eat with your burger.  It's a very small place so groups larger than 2 have a tough time sitting together.  I spent around $12 for a burger and garlic fries (free water).  This is the place where your stomach wants to make deep passionate love to you but your arteries want to punch you in the face, hard.
author: Patrick T.

description: Very very good burger joint. My buddy and I are sorta on a mission to find all the best burger joints, and bar none pearl's is up there as one of the best we've found. joe's cable cars sets the standard for me as far as tasty burgers go, but you know, joe's cable cars is kinda expensive and you end up paying a lot to get really full. at pearls, you won't leave hungry. the patty is not too salty, which i can appreciate. once you add ketchup and mustard to it, its perfect. i'd be happy to eat here again anytime. i started off giving it a 4 star, the the more i think about eating that damn burger again the more im thinking DAMN it was a good ass burger. 5 stah from me! p.s. i had the deluxe cheese and added avocado for a buck more. very reasonable for a good amount of cado, which i love. next time im trying the buffalo burger.
author: Anderson L.

description: crack - i feel like tyrone biggums - i lay awake feenin for these burgers -  best in the city.
author: Q M.

description: Excellent ,good old fasioned backyard bbq type burger with all the fixin's. Ground beef pattys cooked to order,fresh,juicy,very filling. Add fries and a coke and you have a meal. Only a few tables inside,very small and crowded inside. A real tasty traditional burger. Will not be disappointed. Very difficult to find a great burger these days. No alchohol served here,but who cares,eat here after youre done bar hopping,hits the spot.
author: Lee L.

description: The Kobe Bula Burger is perfect for a burger with a sauce on a little bit of the sweeter side. I Can't make a better burger myself and god knows I've tried.  Shakes are great wish they had whipped cream.   Def. a great burger place and awesome shake selection.  If they delivered I would be a very fat man.
author: Yo Y.

description: If you're not worried about sticking to a diet and want a big, fat, greasy burger...than this is the place for you!! I had the deluxe cheeseburger with bacon and my bf had the prized pearl without bacon. We both enjoyed our burgers, mine was a bit on the dry side cuz it was so over cooked, but my bfs was perfect and juicy. We also had an order of the sweet potato fries and onion rings. I didn't try the onion rings, but the sweet potato fries were a little taste of heaven! :)
author: Lucas N.

description: I thank all that is holy and served rare that Pearl's has come to San Francisco. I've considered driving to Mill Valley just for fix.
author: patrick g.

description: I've been in search of a really good, yet cheap, burger place in San Francisco. And after last night's visit to Pearl's, I think I may have found it.  The Spicy Sly was delicious... the bun was just perfect, the meat was out of this world, and the sweet potato fries & onion rings were dee-lish! The total bill for two of us was $22, which for dinner in San Francisco is great. Bonus points for being a block away from Hidden Vine - the perfect finish to happy hour!
author: Chris B.

description: Their burgers are to die for!!! It's very pricy on the other hand
author: Phil L.

description: Damn good burger. Keep on grilling!
author: James H.

description:
omagad....omagad...omagad!!!!! this is, truly, as good as it gets!!! i just had their phat bob and it was the greasiest, sauciest, crispiest, most tender and delicious bob that i have ever had in my mouth. (haha) i didn't order anything else but the burger but it was cooked to perfection and it satisfied me in ways i didn't know a burger could. i mean, this burger changed my life a little, i swear! 
wonderful little hole in the wall, had to drive by twice because it's so small and discreet i missed it the first time. the service was really good and my burger was up in 7 minutes flat! on this particular day i was just getting over the flu and so i was contemplating....hamburger or soup?....i would be so pissed off at myself if I'd have chosen the latter. i will definitely be coming back here again...probably this Monday to ring in the holiday!...(anybody get that?...no?...aawww.....ok.)
author: Jen S.

description: MMMMM..... I love this place, veggie burger with jalapenos is my favorite... and the fries are amazing.
author: Mia S.

description:
let me tell you what's what.

i'm going to drop some proverbial knowledge on you.

elvis is alive.  man never landed on the moon.  area 51 is real.  my father might have killed a man.

i love burgers but im not in love with burgers.

if youre hungry eat something.  if not have a little something, get a mini-burger.

fact: you'll be glad you went.

little known fact: i know a midget.
author: clever u.

description: good, not great.  burgers are above avg, but nothing special (for the hype, I guess i would have expected amazing).  some of the combos are interesting, some are excessive. almost always busy. prefer the burgers from whole foods grill in potreo (odd, but i think they are consistently excellent).  roommate is obsessed with pearls (and seems to subsist on pizza, burgers, bbq, refuses to consume anything green) so maybe he is a better barometer.  if am craving a burger and in the neighborhood, I'd stop by.  not worth a special trip.
author: Daniel W.

description: I swear there is crack in their burgers...that's how addictive they are! I am fortunate (or unfortunate for my waistline) that I live a couple of blocks away. My favorite thing about Pearl's is that you can get a buffalo burger. Yummy and not so bad for you (until you pile on the bacon and blue cheese...LOL!)
author: Susan L.

description:
Pearl's  has the best burgers. I think that they are better than any other
fast food chain (although they aren't a chain ). If you eat one of their burgers trust me you won't be hungry for the rest of the day. Their sweet potato fries are good , but their regular french fries are better.
This place has the potential to be bad for me (I'll probably gain alot
before coming home on school breaks ) especially because I may 
be living across the street from them. Dang I'm going to fat and broke.
Oh ,and their ice cream is homemade.
author: Michele J.

description: vegetarian or not, try the veggie burger!  i loved the smokey taste, and those caramelized onions... nom nom nom.  definitely a great late night eatery.
author: Jen H.

description: Amazing burgers, hence the four stars. "Then why not 5-stars" you ask? The price.... can suck my balls. Sure everything around here is ungodly expensive but let's get real folks, the only place you should be spending ten dollars on a burger is room service (you lazy twacker). Like I said, the burgers are amazing, I just feel like a shmuck shelling out ten bucks for a hunk of dead cow. The basic Fries aren't anything to jizz on the walls over so keep it simple.
author: Carson L.

description: Tasty THICK burgers and great shakes.  Nice when your craving mean carbs late night.  Good personalities and great service!  Definitely NOT for the Jenny Craigers!!!
author: sara r.

description:
Trusty yelp did not let me down this time.

Ordered the Deluxe Burgers with the springs and strawberry shake. Yum-O. Left in a food coma!

I had to knock one star off since there was a lady who blew her nose behind the counter and started serving food without washing her hands. GROSS!
author: Brian W.

description: I was craving a milkshake and a hamburger and luckily I was parked by Pearl's. I was so excited to walk in and see a plethora of flavors for milkshakes and a good variety of burgers ranging from buffalo , beef and chicken. I ordered a combo milkshake of Strawberry/Coconut and had my craving wonderfully filled. The burger was juicy, cooked to order and overall really good!
author: Sarah N.

description: Had the Prized Pearl burger and it was delicious. Juicy and the blue cheese is a great compliment. I also enjoyed how crispy the sweet potato fries were- makes them stand out from all the others I've had. I really like that you can upgrade the beef and stay open til 2am on weekends. We'll be back I'm sure.
author: Brandi S.

description: Ordered the mini pearl burger with bacon (without cheese) and the garlic fries and diet coke. Absolutely delicious !
author: Rk K.

description:
Pearl's Deluxe Burgers was a let down. I was in from out of town and excited at the great reviews. I ordered the Pearl which includes crummy bacon, tasteless caramelized onion, and decent blue cheese. I upgraded to the buffalo patty which was unseasoned, but otherwise cooked reasonably well. The sum result was a "grease bomb of blandness," but at least there wasn't the card-board like taste that chain fast food tends to exude. 

San Francisco if this the best you've got then Seattle has you beat. Seattle's Redmill Burgers, Blue Moon Burgers, & the signature burger at Palace Kitchen all win with one bun tied behind their respective backs.  

Finally, $16 bucks for a weak burger and reasonable milkshake was too much for something that is decidedly not gourmet. I'm happy to buy and eat a $12-16 dollar hamburger if it is mind blowing.
author: Nathan E.

description: Best burger I've had eating out.  Bacon wasn't all fat,  but all nice thick meat.  Bread was perfect, burger nice and juicy.  Only reason for no five is the fries, not my flavor the ones they served, but great place nonetheless, will be back
author: Jay S.

description: This place obviously puts a lot of love into the food. I did have a couple issues, 1) no place to sit so I took my burger to go 2) burger was overdone. Now they can't do much about (1), which is always a problem for people eating alone, since couples / groups send a squatter to get a table. (2) was at least partly my mistake. I should have ordered medium-rare or rare instead of medium. I had seen all the photos of juicy burgers and assumed my medium would be super juicy. By the time I got it home, it may have cooked itself a little too much. Or maybe Pearl's adjusted and started to cook the burgers longer, due to all the bitchy little reviews about how it was too juicy. If you are European, or just despise the taste of brown/grey well-done meat, I would say err on the side of more rare. My "medium" was more of a "well done" when I tucked into it. Still beats the pants off "Sliders".
author: Anthony B.

description: hands down the best burger i've ever had. teriyaki burger and garlic fries are big and awesome! you're gonna get messy eating them but you probably won't care.
author: Chao L.

description: Theres like four tables and a counter by the window. No room to sit in and eat if other people are there but these burgers are DELICOUS. Cooked perfect, not dry at all and I asked for my burger to be cooked medium and it was super juicy. I ordered a bacon cheese burger which appeared to be small but looks can be decieving because it was super thick. I left full and satisfied. Best burger i've ever had in my entire life.
author: Yoko Rose N.

description:
I used to find that the amount of flavor packed into a burger is directly correlated with the sloppiness of the burger in question.

This place debunks that old truism.  I was pointed toward a burger listed as celebrity chef Michael Mina's favorite, and, though its BBQ-ish, onion-ringy, top-notch beefiness made for one of the best sandwiches I've had in my life, the thing remained structurally sound throughout the eating experience.  Neat trick, I say.

Also highly recommended: the chocolate shake, the sweet potato fries, and the veggie burgers.  Top notch patty, says the vegetarian better half.
author: Garrett D.

description: Pearl's Deluxe Burgers serves Niman Range burgers, and they are delicious. I always like my burger medium rare, and it was so juicy that there are juice dripping on to the basket. Everything on the menu were so appetizing. My favorite has to be the burger with grilled onions, blue cheese and bacon. With onion rings and soda, it defines comfort food.
author: Jose K.

description: OMG.  You can't go wrong here, classic hole in the wall burger joint.  I typically go for the turkey burger with cheese yum, but if your feeling more adventurous or carnivorous they have something for you.  They even have buffalo... if that what you're into?  This place even offers garlic fries that you'll savor long after you have left ;) Check it out if your in need of some real fuel for shopping in Union Square.  PS: They are open late on weekends YES! I'd be happier if they were open on Sundays, for some reason burgers just taste better on Sundays.
author: Mar C.

description: Pearls has a variety of Hamburger I usually get the chicken Terriyaki burger, Very tasty and also they have good garlic fries.
author: R A.

description: Pearl's Burgers are sooooooooo good. I live about 40 steps from the front door of this palace of fine burgers. I personally always steer toward the Bula Burger and a chocolate peanut butter milkshake (the short white guy makes the best ones by far). The burgers are made with fresh ingredients,cooked to perfection, with really good sized pieces of bacon and there sauces are just GOOD!! I compare every burger I eat to these ones.
author: Jason B.

description: This place is literally a hole-in-the wall but don't let that fool you!  The burgers are fabulous and the fries are the best I have ever eaten.  The only thing I would change is a little seasoning in the meat.  I had the Phat Burger upgraded to Buffalo with onion rings and bbq sauce with jack cheese.  It was perfectly cooked, nice and juicy.  Not a lot of room to sit down but they have a rest room which you will definitely need to wash your face and hands!  Worth the walk.
author: Cynthia M.

description: Great burger cooked medium rare, just like I requested.  And best sweet potato fries I've ever had!  Was $8 plus tip.  Walked in and ordered to go.  Order came fast.  Nice employees, too.
author: J H.

description: Who knew buffalo was so much better for you than beef? But regardless, it also tastes great! And the sweet potato fries are super fresh.
author: Rose K.

description: amazing amazing amazing - remember to tell them to put lettuce and tomato on your burger, mmmm.
author: Ben B.

description: Once in a blue moon I will eat a burger and fries.....as long it's not from a fast-food chain (ahem, McD's and BK). I think the last time I had a burger was at a Giants game....last season =). So when my friend told me about this place, I figured it was about that time of the year that I met my quota for a burger and fries. She raved about this place telling me how big and juicy the burgers were. She wasn't kidding. I ordered the Pearl's deluxe w/bacon, no cheese (I know, but I'm lactose) and a small order of onion rings. My friend ordered the same w/cheese and an order of sweet potato fries. Yes, I know, we should've ordered the Springs (onion rings and sweet potato fries combo), but we didn't think about it. Nevertheless, we shared. My burger was huge, at least it was huge in my book and had the fixin's (lettuce, tomato, onions, and mayo). I think there were 3 or 4 strips of bacon in mine. The patty was a 1/2 pounder and it was thick and juicy. However, my friend told me that it's usually juicier and seemed liked they cooked our burgers well-done instead of medium. Didn't matter to me, because I'd rather have it well-done, yet this burger was juicy like it was cooked medium. I used several napkins to wipe off the juices on my fingers and hands. Didn't need to put any ketchup on my burger. It was good the way it was. The onion rings were delish along with the sweet potato fries. I finished my burger.  If I ate burgers on a regular basis, I don't think I would've been able to finish it, but I don't, so I devoured mine =). Needless to say, it was one of the best burgers I've had...next to my Dad's =).
author: Neni E.

description: Everything is excellent, food, service, free chilled pickles. My fave is their chicken pesto..mMmm.. But I feel that their burger/sandwich prices are questionable. I mean, at first i thought it was ridiculous to pay almost 7 bucks for a buger, but they taste awesome so I figured it was worth it. But When I tried Polkers burgers, for 8 bucks you get a big burger (tasty), a salad and a choice of fries or soup! but pearls is still a great joint if your hella hungry!!!
author: kirehleen f.

description:
Okay....now I have been told several times that I must have a tapeworm, as I can potentially eat my entire body weight in sushi.  Given that observation...I had heard Pearl's burgers were GIGANTIC, over filled,and super yummy,  Having said that, me and my coworkers went to Pearls for lunch one day.  Well, they must have eaten there before, because they ordered mini burgers and fries, while I ordered a regular size burger, SWEET POTATO FRIES, the best thing I have ever stuffed my face with, and a chocolate shake.  
I swear to  you, I could  have fed a large village with all the food in front of me.
Like a starving supermodel, I proceeded to eat the entire burger, half of the sweet potato fries ( hey, I needed a snack for later) and the entire shake. ...(fast forward to dinner time, I was still full, and being lactose intolerant is not a good prerequisite for ordering a large shake)
That was the best burger I had ever had in life...the best fries...and the look on my coworkers faces when I ate all of my burger was awesome. 
In fact, I think I want some fries for dinner now...
author: Janet R.

description: The buffalo burger doesn't look gigantic, but it is a half pounder. It's very lean, but it doesn't exactly melt in your mouth. With jack cheese and 'shrooms, it is pretty good. Add a side of frings you'll clear $13 (and that's without a drink). For that price, I wish it tasted better.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Hands down best burgers I've ever had...juicy, very tasty and they use niman ranch beef. Shakes were  yummy too...both my kids really enjoyed their french fries. My husband and I ordered the garlic fries...first bite, they are delicious...but then you keep going and the garlic gets to be too much and they are very salty. This is our only complaint! My hubby had the KING burger which has a hot dog on top of the burger patty...he loved it and ate everything! They only have 3 tables and some bar seating facing the street...take it to go if you can!!! Price isn't too bad for a good burger either...less than Barney's who charges almost $10. We will go back when we are in the city again...
author: Maria C.

description: If I were still 19 and still had the metabolism of a jackrabbit, i would eat a spicy sly veggie burger with onion rings and a banana shake here every night.  damn it.
author: Vince T.

description: My roomie got a burger and fries and I just got fries. Her burger ended up with hair in it and the garlic fries I got tasted so bland with chunks of garlic. Not my kinda burger joint! Prices are too high for what they serve!
author: Meks R.

description:
okay. so i went here during the weekend. And I'm fasting right now on the weekends for Lent. so I couldn't eat anything, but everything LOOKED AND SMELLED SO DELICIOUS. without having eatten anything, I'm already a fan. My friends ordered and they loved it!! 

I ordered a milk shake. yum! it was good. It's what I expected from a milk shake and more, especially because now a days milk shakes aren't thick and natural like they use to be. The shake I had here was very home made and thick and rich.

I can't wait to come back and order!
author: nightlife i.

description: I went to Pearl's on Friday night with my husband and a friend of his. I had the Pearl's Mini Deluxe with pepper jack cheese, my husband had the Prized Pearl, and we shared a side of spries (half sweet potato fries, half regular) and a mint oreo milkshake. The milkshake was yummy, not as big as I've had elsewhere, but big enough.  I also liked the option to get half sweet potato fries and half regular, though I might just get the sweet potato in the future.  Having the option of a mini burger was awesome and it was under $5, which is amazing. I first thought it would be too small after seeing it on some other people's plates, but it was perfect and I was more than full.  The burger was cooked fairly rare, but juicy and delicious.  All in all, I thought it was tasty.  I might give it another star if my husband was more impressed by his burger, but he just thought it was okay. Oh and the place is very small....we were kind of crowded into a corner, but service is quick!
author: Miriam H.

description: I had a mini-cheeseburger and shared an order of half onion rings half sweet potato fries. The burger was good and so were the onion rings. The sweet potato fries are ok but I prefer regular fries. My friend had a coffee shake and said it was excellent. I would go here again. The people next to us had chili cheese fries and they said they were very good. Next time I would get a full order of onion rings!
author: Jack B.

description:
Who doesn't love a good hamburger? I was super-excited to try out Pearl's based on the Yelp reviews. I must say I was a bit disappointed. My favorite is still Hamburgers in Sausalito. 

Here, the patty was cooked perfectly, but wasn't seasoned as well. Moreover, they have many specialty burgers that came with sauces that overwhelmed the taste (my group ordered three different ones and I tried them all). The sweet potato fries were great! Parking was horrible.
author: C K.

description:
I've walked by this place so many times (i live right by it) and i just never got in there until finally tonight i suggested it and we all agreed.  we went in there and there wasn't anyone in there *sigh of relief*, usually there's a long line.  The menu has so many different choices its awesome! I order a bacon cheese mini deluxe with fries and a drink, came to a little under $10.  I was very pleased with the burger, i wanted to try the sweet potato fries but didn't.   the fries were normal, but an extra awesome thing was that they had malt vinegar!!! I'm a big fan of malt vinegar on my fries and when we were in there i was like "o my gosh you have malt vinegar!" the dude gave me  a little container to take some home in (nice guy). Also he asked me if i was from the east coast. being from boston i figured it was my think accent, but he said it was b/c of the malt vinegar request. haha good place i'll definitely drop in on my way home now that i finally tried it!!!

oh PS i have this weird obsession with soda in Styrofoam cups (don't ask b/c i don't know) and they have it there lol
author: Sloane G.

description:
Good burgers and shakes.  Like some of the others, not really Wowed.  
Clean, friendly, nice place.
author: Tommy K.

description: Eh..just ok. Actually didn't think it tasted better than Carls Jr or Jack in the box. Maybe it was just a bad day for them. The medium well patty was pretty dry. The people working at the store were really nice though.
author: T H.

description:
i went to Pearl's based on a recommendation from a friend, so going into this, I had high expectations.

I was less than impressed.  I had the teriyaki chicken burger and my husband had the pesto burger.  The chicken breast was thin, and the bun was huge; there was so much teriyaki sauce on the burger, that on the first bite, the mushrooms and the sauce slipped all out.   My husband's burger was just as messy.  The pesto was all over and he was constantly wiping his fingers and mouth.  There was nothing over the top fancy about the burgers.   The fries were just normal fries.  Nothing exciting. We were really expecting more.

The location is also borderline Tenderloin - not exactly the best part of the City and definitely not worth another trip for a very uneventful burger.

If you want a good burger go to Barney's.
author: apple b.

description: This business needs to serve straws large enough to suck down a whole hamburger.  Their food is great, and always satisfying.
author: N R.

description: Awesome awesome awesome!!!  Best burger in town.  great onion rings, fries and the milk shakes...perfect.   Don't agree with giving them one $ for price though.  burger, rings and shake puts you back about $14, can get a doubledouble, fries and a shake for like $7 at In-N-Out Burger.
author: Shawn S.

description:
5 stars all the way!

I made a special trip after seeing some of the pics here and this place didn't disappoint.   

I ordered the mushroom burger, got fries and a drink $13.   Sign on the wall says that Pearls is invited to represent San Francisco in the best burger competition at the up and coming food and music festival.   They also have KOBE BEEF!   Yup, kobe beef and buffalo too.   

Nice simple menu, delicious food, crisp fries, large portions and friendly staff.     I will be back.
author: Scott R.

description:
Ohmigosh, so so so so good. I got the Pearl Burger which had a ton of cheese - blue cheese -- mmmmm... so so so good. Absolutely dripping with oil, which is the best. Yumm...

Definitely one of the better burgers west of the rockies.

And the staff is sooooooooooo nice too!
author: Karen N.

description:
Tried this place after reading the reviews on Yelp. Glad I took the advice!

The Bula burger with Kobe beef was delicious and the tangy Hawaiian sauce, Swiss cheese and bacon blended perfectly.

I got the sweet potato fries and they were just salty enough and cooked just right.

My wife is kinda picky about how her burgers are cooked (she doesn't like undercooked meat) so we asked for medium well - sure enough the Deluxe burger w/ cheese came out with no pink in the middle, just like she likes it.

She got the chili cheese fries and was a little disappointed there were beans in the chili but she liked them enough to bring the leftovers with her.

Drawbacks: There's not a lot of seating inside.
author: Neal W.

description: With my special super-human abilities, I am able to eat a burger in a single gulp! If it's that good -- and believe me, Pearl's Deluxe Burgers are (pause) that (pause) GOOD!
author: Vanessa J.

description: I really like the convenience of a quick quality alternative meat burger! The onion rings and sweet potato fries are great , the service is friendly. I'll always be a fan!
author: Life L.

description: This place cooks a mean turkey burger, that's rite i said Turkey Burger. As I do not partake in the red meat fetish I stick to turkey and man does this place know how to make a persons mouth water. After driving over 13 hours we reached SF and were starving.  We all walked down to Pearls and made it in an hour before they closed. It was very clean inside and the staff was really friendly.  I had the fat bob and so did the man, but he got grass fed beef as he is a red meat lover.  The BBQ sauce and bacon was awesome on this burger and everything was prepared fresh in an open kitchen.  Although the burgers were yummy the vanilla milkshake really made my night.  The milkshake was creamy and very flavorful, but it came with a HUGE ass straw, the whole was almost the size of a nickle.  I had no problem drinkin my thick shake outta that bad boy...I definitely will be coming back once I end up in SF again.
author: Stephanie M.

description: spot-on burgers cooked to perfection and fantastic 'spries'. an abundance of little kosher dill pickle spears you can take home with you. be careful and don't order too much or you'll explode.
author: Y K.

description: This place was good. I like the option of organic beef for my burger, that was a neat little additive. Their sweet potato fries rocked, and their shakes were rather lovely. There was just something missing in the flavor of my burger that was not as good as Barney's and that made it get three stars. I'd go back there for a quick bite, and they are open late on weekends, score. They also have the Mill Valley location, which is supposed to rock even harder, so maybe I'll try that one next time.
author: Shannon F.

description: We love Pearl's!! My boyfriend and I only live a block away and we've walked passed it a hundred times and have stopped in the coffee shop and italian restaurant right next to it, but never thought about it. We finally said we'd go there and it's amazing! I recommend the Mini w/ cheese if you can barely eat half a burger at any regular restaurant and the split basket of fries so you can share with someone. I also really liked the Pina Colada shake and want to try more flavors. I give it 4 out of 5 stars because the first one I got was a tad too rare for "medium" and it's better to order "medium well" and there's not enough seating. I don't mind taking it home because I live 30 seconds away, but I would not like to be a commuter and have no where to sit, even though that's pretty normal for this neighborhood.
author: Maggie J.

description: tastiest burger i think ever! I go here whenever i can well within reason... their chocolate shake and sweet potato fries are glorious and the burgers... GET A Bacon cheese burger with avocado and you will fall in love! i love pearl's i stumbled in drunk one dark night and have been going back sober ever since.. TASTTTYYYY
author: Chloe C.

description: The Banana milkshake was bomb-diggity!  Served with a fat Boba straw, I love it!  However, the burger was just OK for me.  I have come to the conclusion that I'm just not that much of a meat lover anymore - and this was a bit too much for me (I had the Prized Pearl - grilled onion, blue cheese and I added avo).  Next time will try the turkey burger, and keep it simple!!  Sweet potato fries were just ok, as was the service.  All in all, wasn't blown away but I could see how a true burger lover would dig this place....
author: A B.

description: I came to San Francisco with my family for vacation and had read good things about Pearl's and it was relatively close to our hotel.  It was kind of a hike to get there, go figure SF is hilly!  Upon arriving at around  2pm on a Wednesday with my family out of breath from the hike I was surprised to see that is was tiny, couldn't of been more than 16 seats and they were all taken so I immediately turned around and walked out but fortunately my wife was not walking all the way there not to eat so we headed back to the counter.  We were clueless of what to order so just ordered the 1/4 burgers which are called "mini's" and they were super moist and juicy they are similar to San Diego icon Rocky's Crown Pub in PB.  The buns were amazing and my wife was raving for days about the sweet potato fries.  On top of the food the guy behind the counter (not sure if he is an owner but his attitude was definitely owner worthy!)  was awesome he told us that he would put some tables together and make sure we  all sat together.  He checked on us despite being busy and the place was basically all locals.  Highly recommend if you are in or around Union Square.  One last note, I should have ordered the 1/2 burger the mini's are too good for just one.  Thanks Pearl's Deluxe!!
author: Quinlin H.

description: If you haven't been to The Habit in the Santa Barbara/Ventura area, then read some else's review because you won't know what I'm talking about.  Their Pearl Deluxe Burger reminded me of the Habit Charburger, and their fries were fried to perfection, with just the right amount of garlic.  The dining room was small, but it wasn't too crowded for a Saturday afternoon.  Total bill for the burger with cheese, garlic fries, and a soda was a little bit over $10.00.
author: Mark D.

description: The few times I've been there, I've enjoyed each of the juicy burgers and sweet potato fries. What I especially loved was the fact that I could grab multiple pickles to go with my burger! And for a mere $4, you could upgrade your burger with either buffalo meat or kobe beef! Although the place is small, I haven't had to wait for a table. People are generally in and out pretty quick, so by the time you order and your food arrives, a table is usually available (or it might just be good timing for the times I've been there).
author: Stacey H.

description: Bomb ass buffalo burgers, but not as good as Bull's Head in west portal.  I usually grab these and eat them at HaRa because I usually go at 9:45 and the guy throws us out right when they close at 10.
author: Matt N.

description:
BURGER: The burger was VERY juicy and not overcooked. I would have given it 5 stars if it were charbroiled. They give ample cheese (two pieces) and the lettuce was a good chunk of yummy lettuce, not a wimpy piece. The beef is from Nieman ranch, which was great because they don't use any antibiotics.

SWEET POTATO FRIES: Good, but not to die for. They were yummy, but could have been more flavorful. I would have liked some spices or something on them.

SERVICE: I'm shocked to see that people had a bad experience with service here. I was fairly surprised by how *good* the service was for a small burger joint. They were friendly and quick and attentive.

PRICE: Can't beat it.

Enjoy!
author: suz q.

description:
i had ordered a blue cheeseburger medium rare.  i am gluten free, so i told the guy when i ordered, and i told him that i didn't want any bread.  he said, "would you like me to wrap the burger in lettuce?"  i was thrilled!  awesome!

the burger was amazing!  great flavor,  cooked to a perfect medium and needed only a touch of salt.  very good!

i also ordered fries that were way too crispy.  upon eating a few, i noticed that there was a 'skin' on them...  that's when i realized that they were dredged in flour.  crap.

i asked the guy if they were in fact covered in flour.  he said yes, in a very matter-of-fact manner.  i asked him if i could get it without the flour.  he said no.

bottom line, great burger, but i got glutened.  oh well.  i just won't eat the fries.  

if you can eat flour, this place rocks!
author: Curtis C.

description: Tasty burgers.  I got the Phat Bobb, coulda used some more onion rings on it, but it had a ton of thick bacon which is what i was really craving more than the onion rings.  Bun was a nice and airy, and the burger was really big.  Only complaint really was the lack of condiments in our to-go back for our fries, and the burger was supposed to be medium-rare and was more medium-well.
author: Brett T.

description:
The burger is as good as it gets.  Maybe others are as good, but not better.  My first trip to Pearl's.  I kept it simple so I could taste the beef - of which there was plenty.  Swiss cheese and red onion - a little ketchup later.  Excellent.  I had the O rings.  Deliciously seasoned, and lightly so - I could taste and enjoy the good onion.  
Bottom line:  If you are any where near downtown, this is where to go for a burger!!!
author: Bob M.

description: Great burger and fantastic fries. You will be very happy with this juicy burger.
author: Jennifer K.

description: I think I was building this up in my mind to be better than it was, since I heard friends raving about this place. The burger patty was overcooked and just a dry burger overall, but 3 stars for having good fries and esp. yam fries. I'll give it another chance, and probably try a different burger next time.
author: yolanda f.

description: This place gets a lot of hype,  that I didn't think it really lived up to.  Don't get me wrong, I think it's still really good.  Comparing it to the Mel's and Slider's Burger's that isn't far away.  I'd say eat here.
author: Alan N.

description: Sometimes, it's those small hole in the wall places that have the best food. This place definitely qualifies. The Bula Burger (bacon, swiss, mayo & spicy pineapple teriyaki sauce) was amazing. Finger-licking messy goodness. Their sweet potato fries are some of the best I've had. For variety, go for the basket of half sweet potato fries and half onion rings. Free fountain soda refills are a nice plus. You also get all the pickles you could want. Good stuff!
author: Ryan C.

description: Incredible burgers!!!  The folks there were very nice and we even got to sample some stuff for free!  Highly recommend!
author: Larry L.

description: I went there today for the 1st time and the food is hella good. I got the Kings Burger which was really tasty. I also had a side of Strings which is half sweet potato yam fries and half onion rings those were delicious. Cant wait to go back there and eat! The staff were really friendly.
author: SuZy Q.

description: The upside to working in the "Tender Nob" (also known as the hood):  being able to walk just a few blocks to Pearl's for lunch!  I like the turkey burgers with the habanero pumpkin sauce.  The first time I came here, the cashier wouldn't give me the sauce directly on the burger because he thought it might be too spicy.  Little did he know I've been known to drink hot sauce.  Having proved myself,  I now get the sauce all over the bun.  Hands down, my favorite fast place for a working lunch. (Know that there isn't much room to eat here - getting your burger to go is probably your best bet).
author: Anne D.

description: Drove up from Santa Cruz to enjoy an evening Badger's game with the Bay Area Badgers at Aces down the street, and were pleasantly surprised with burgers pre-game at Pearls. The ambiance is certainly sparse, but the food is just great. I enjoyed the spicey buffalo burger with sly's spicey habanero sauce and onions/peppers...delicious. My date had the chicken sandwitch with mushroom, and we shared the delicious sweet-potato fries. Really a great quick stop pre-game, and I recommend the buffalo burger.
author: Beth P.

description:
I took one bite of a Mushroom, American Cheeeseburger. After one bite, I put it down and I knew it was the best burger I had ever had in my life. The meat was perfect, the mushrooms were perfect and the cheese tasted incredible.

Do yourself a favor, and go to this place. Actually, don't go. No, stay away. Its hard enough to grab a seat here, maybe you should go to Big Mouth Burger in the mission, that place is okay. Yeah, go there.
author: Arnold S.

description:
very good  NEIMAN RANCH IS NOT ORGANIC PEOPLE

buns tend to get stale and there is too much bread.  i get reflux from them sometimes   but they are good.  onion rings are best. springs too.
author: Nicholas C.

description: Best burger in the city. Hands down. Speaking of which, prepare to get your hands messy! But whatever you get on your hands will still be just as delicious as the burger!
author: Christie C.

description: 5 stars alright!!!! These burgers are amazing.....but man...you gotta order 3...hope they have some sort of happy hour deal soon...buy 1, get 2 free!! DO IT!!!!
author: The Beef T.

description: What a juicy burger! They use grass-fed Niman ranch beef. You can get buffalo, chicken, turkey, veggie and even kobe. On my first visit, we rolled in with a group of 20 people, packed the place and overwhelmed the staff. (This place sits about 6-8 people comfortably). The staff was nice however, and accommodated our large group. My first experience with a Pearl burger was semi-epic. It tasted like a backyard BBQ frat party burger; overcooked and tasteless (consumed when drunk+ with major ketchup). I was determined to give the place another shot after hearing so much about this place. Turns out this burger joint is a hit if you don't come with 19 other people. We ordered the Kobe beef burger medium rare 1/2 lbs and it was damn good. Juicy, conservative layer of mayo, soft and fluffy buns... everything you could ask for in a good burger. Sweet potato fries, regular fries, onion rings are okay. It's really about the burger here. Pearls does not have a liquor license but you can bring your own beer here if you are discreet about it.
author: Annie Y.

description: Very heavy meat flavor. Super thick bacon slices. Very good. I was impressed. Garlic is too strong on the fries though. I'd give it a 4.
author: Ben K.

description: would have been five stars but the staff wasn't very friendly. Honestly, after my experience I was destined on only giving one star until I tried the burger. The food is awesome and definitely worth the trip. Maybe if they hired friendly staff they would get a lot more tips. I have to agree with a few about towards closing time how their attitude needs to be adjusted especially to paying customers. I worked in food before and know that it's not polite to deny a seat to a paying customer when it's close to closing time. They have smaller versions of all their burgers which is pretty cool if you're taking a lady friend.
author: Bowser J.

description: Fantastic. Had a cheeseburger and sweet potato fries. Both were great. Couldn't ask for anything more in a burger spot.
author: David S.

description: I had a kobe beef burger.  It was good.  Not the best mind you, but a solid burger.  The fries were good and the sweet potato fries were better, but all in all it was a bit pricey.  The bun did get soggy after a while, so eat it fast.
author: Jerry V.

description: Amazing shakes. Amazing everything. So good.
author: Alexander C.

description: I'm always happy when they offer buffalo meat at a burger joint.  There's a reason buffalo almost went extinct and that's because they're delicious.  Some might find the buffalo a little dry since there's a lot less fat, but nothing a little salt can't fix.  You can definitely taste the quality at this place!  Great ingredients and meat!
author: Andrew R.

description: This place was the bomb.  I've never had as good a burger as the Estancia grass-fed beef burger that they whipped up for us.  Grass-fed beef is as delicious as it is healthy.  No feedlots or hormones.  The taste was bright and beefy with a clean finish.  It didn't sit in my gut like a rock.  Thank you Pearl for making such excellent burgers!
author: tim p.

description: Well, all I can say is that was I thoroughly satisfied.  The burger I devoured here was fantastic.  (Not to mention the onion rings) Need I say more?  All I ask for in a burger joint is huge tasty burgers and great service and Pearl's deluxe burger has it all.
author: Erik U.

description: I'm all about an easy-going, unpretentious place with great food, and to find that in San Francisco's Lower Nob Hill/Tenderloin Heights Area is a little difficult, but fortunately there is Pearl's!  Sure, the prices are a bit high, but you can get completely filled with just one burger and if you really choose to be a pig of yourself, grab some fries, there GREAT!  Since you're already engulfed in gluttony, top it off with a free pickle, it's worth it!  I even had a hangover experience where I needed some food and grease, and rather than be a reasonable man and enjoy Gatorade, soup, etc., I did the right thing and went there...immediately followed by hair of the dog.
author: Kelly S.

description: The Pink's of burgers, I have never had a hot dog in my burger before but it was really really good. One ingenious thing I need to point out is why no one ever though of using the boba straws for shakes. Now you can actually suck that thick ice cream glob up instead of working around it. It is like they fixed every single flaw of a burger joint that we had all come to accept. They deserve fanfare with white doves dropping rose petals at their feet..
author: Ray H.

description: YUM!  I love that they have mini burgers!  The spries (regular AND sweet potato fries) are freaking awesome - I recommend them!  I got the pesto burger with spries and both were great.  For people who like big, fat fries (like moi), this place has 'em!  Check it out!
author: Rise G.

description: The milkshakes are the best. They are very creamy and not thinned out like other places. I enjoyed the burger too. I had The Spicy Sly....mmmmmm spicy!!  The burgers are big. I couldn't finish it, so I saved it for later- AND- it was still yummy. The only thing I didn't like about this place was its size, too many people and not enough room to stand and wait for your order.
author: Mina P.

description: Pearls ranks pretty high on my burger scale in the city. Massive burgers for a good price. Get extra napkins cause it can get kind of messy.
author: mike m.

description:
oh my f'n g!

is it wrong that i want to take the pumpkin habanero sauce from the sly burger and pour its goodness all over my body? seriously get the sly burger, its probably the best burger ive ever had. great spice, but not too spicy, and just an amazing unique taste. ive never had anything like it.

sweet potato fries are great, just make sure to not get too much salt on them. onion rings were good, and not oily either.

service was great (people were friendly), open late (awesome!). very reasonable prices (i think the sly burger is under $7). for an extra $1 or 2 you can get buffalo meat, which i might have to try next time.

also, we came back for some shakes after dinner one night and they were really good (a bit filling though, so stick with the smaller size). strawberry was great, and even the more exotic banana chocolate was great too and some nice chunky banana goodness in it.

the place is small, but it wasnt crowded the two times we went. its about 2/3 the size of starbucks with 1/2 the seating (there are only about 4-5 tables).

i love this place. i might have my wedding and reception here one day.
author: Varun ..

description: Dang skippy, that was a juicy veggie burger.....and huge!  Not a hint of dryness as typically veg-burgers are...very tasty, and worth the trip over to this place.  Huge french fries accompanied our meal.  Very polite proprieter.  Only complaint was it's very small..and packed.  No room left for dessert...oh well.
author: ser s.

description: The hubby and I had both been craving burgers so we asked someone where to go to get a good yummy burger in the area. Being from Texas, we never thought we'd get a burger as good as Pearl's! It was amazing! We both had the Pearl's Deluxe w/ cheddar cheese and bacon, no mayo, add mustard. Yum yum yum. The buns are awesome - sesame seeds add that extra oomph that I expect when paying $8 for a burger (which is a pretty normal price nowadays unless you are at a fast food place....and if you are in this city, you are crazy. there's so much better out there.). Anyway, we also had the garlic fries which were good as well, probably don't need to get them with the garlic next time (there were probably 6-7 fresh cloves diced on top of the fries). We both decided to get shakes to go because that's how we roll - I went with the nutella (amazing!) and he got the peanut butter (also good). Shakes are $3.50 for normal flavors and $4.00 for specialty flavors. Everyone working there was really nice. We'll definitely go back, but not too soon since I'd like to be able to stay in this pant size. :-)
author: Nancy B.

description: found this place on yelp during my lunch hour, wanted something else besides the usual pho,chinese food etc... the kobe burger was good i have to come back and try there reg. burgers..  no comment about the "kobe from japan"
author: jonathan h.

description: cheeseburger, veggie burger, and onion rings for my girls at rye bar, $16 total, gave the dude $20 and told him to keep the change, the onion rings were effin dericious!
author: Pickle R.

description: i don't know why this place got such high reviews for their burgers. we took the advice of a fellow yelper here and asked for our burgers medium rare and our fries crispy which served us well for the most part. we spent $25 here for two burgers, an order of fries (half sweet potato and half onion rings) and a milkshake. i thought that was pretty pricey for a place that resembled more like a fast food place than a high end restaurant. my mushroom burger was not bad but my bf's buffalo burger was cooked too well done despite asking for medium rare. the oreo milkshake is nothing special. the sweet potato fries were the best thing about that meal. i'm not sure if i'll be back.
author: Helen L.

description:
I have enjoyed everything I have ordered at Pearls. I am especially fond of the Veggie burger now that I have cut back on red meat. The fries are off the hook too.

The service is always top notch. I work near Pearls and a lot of my co workers feel the same way.
author: Ronnie M.

description: If your looking for a no frills, hole in the wall joint, then Pearls is your place.  Mighty tasty and fresh burgers.  My favs are the buffalo burger and organic beef..  Officially located in the loin, it's not quite as scary as you think one might seem.  It's is exactly one block from Fleur de Lys and Canteen...   Worth a try
author: j b.
Jimmy F.

description:
Who would've thought the TL could offer this!!  The guys there are super friendly, very patient, the prices are decent, and of course, the burgers are delish.  I tried the Spicy Sly burger and it was good! If you like your food spicy, this is the burger to get.  I also tried the garlic fries and the chili fries, both very very good.  Couldn't get rid of my garlic breath for the rest of the day after that meal..that's how garlicky those fries are.  I hear their Peanut Butter Shake is REALLY good and what they're known for, but I got the raspberry shake this time instead, which was okay.  

I think I'm going to try the Peanut Butter Milkshake next time.  Definitely going back to try the other burgers on the menu, and the fries on the side is a must!
author: Connie Y.

description: Thanks to Yelp for guiding me to this big meat oasis! I loved Pearl's! Read just a few reviews and most were the same...great! There were a few that mentioned the trouble w/ parking, the small size of the restaurant and some even mentioned the price would break the budget! Huh?! Really?! Either you haven't been to San Fran before (parking issue) or you haven't been to McD's or Burger King lately (price). Parking is an issue everywhere here but after circling about 8 times, found a spot 1/2 block away. And that time was well spent in the long run. Price was DEF NOT an issue as it probably cost just a few dollars more than the slop you'd get in McD's or BK! And as for the size of the place..who cares? Are you going for a burger or hosting a party there? Service was quick and super friendly. We met Steve, he's the big cheese, and he was really friendly! I had the Phat Bob & split an order of Springs! Wow...that was a lot of food! Cooked to perfection. Tasted great! Wanted the Nutella shake so badly but knew I would simply burst! Thanks guys for a great, inexpensive dining experience and by the way, sorry Steve for using approximately 327 napkins!! Don't pass up Pearl's if you want a great burger!
author: Tricia G.

description: The dubious honor of my very first Yelp review goes to Pearl's. Only visiting SF but I may come back just for another Pearl's burger. I had the Prized Pearl, and it's Burger Nirvana. Rings also very good, but just short of great. Atmosphere ultracasual,and it's a good thing -- there's no neat way to eat a burger this juicy & topping-laden.
author: Tom G.

description: i got a regular mini burger which was "meh" at best, along with a side of half sweet potato fries and half garlic fries. both kinds of fries were okay, but nothing special. my friend i was with ordered both the king burger and the bomb. both were edible and basically just okay. i think the worst part was that we were expecting to have an extraordinary meal after reading the yelp reviews. we were full but not happy after paying about $30 for a meal that did not make us happy. plus the 30 extra minutes we took to find parking made for a not fun time. the best part: the chocolate peanut butter milkshake that was TO DIE FOR. i highly recommend it for any peanut butter lovers...go for the shake and skip the burger.
author: Riwana T.

description: Went here last night after a night of bar hopping. NOT IMPRESSED. First off, my friend Jen pulled a chair to sit down on after walking for a long time, and all of a sudden the burger flipper who looks like a Pokemon character yells at her to get off the chair, and puts it back. The guy was a douche bag. That is really good customer service there jerkoff. So to the food. I hate to admit but it was terrible. I got a Buffalo Bacon Cheeseburger and asked for it medium well. When I opened the to go box, it was pretty much pink all the way around. It was one of those burgers where the bun is soaked in juice. I do not like my burgers cooked that way. If I did I would have ordered rare. Overall I did not enjoy the time spent ordering or the food itself. I also got garlic fries and they are pretty much regular fries with barely any garlic on them. I will not be going back to this establishment ever. If you want a really good Buffalo Burger, try Bullshead in West Portal.
author: Darius A.

description: Pearl's is without a doubt the best burger joint ever!  The burgers, fries, milk shakes, service, the whole sha-bang is the best.  It can't be beat so get down there to enjoy the taste sensation that is Pearl's and you'll be happy that you did. Love it, love it, love it!
author: Cheryl F.

description:
I live a block away from this place and me and my roommates have been coming here since it first opened. 
It is one of if not THE best burger in SF. 
Great variety of burgers in size and content. (My favorites are: Teriyaki Burger, Pesto Burger and Phat Bob) 
I tried the Cobb salad once, wasnt very good, but what do you expect, its a true burger place! 
Fries are awesome, cut pretty thick the way I like them. Shakes are great, and try the Buffalo burger for a change. 
The cashiers and cooks are really nice and friendly and the owner is an awesome guy.
Two thumbs WAYYY up!!
author: Andy v.

description:
Awesome and really delicious REAL tasty burgers! like that these are healthy choices....such as organic meat and uses real rice oil instead of heart clogging oil.

GOTTA HAVE: the mini deluxe that is really the portion that we should be eating instead of the over the top portion we American are accustomed to.

Sweet Potatoe Fries with the Onion Ring..mmmmmm marvelous!

Wish they would open more locations in the City especially close to home in SOMA/Mission Bay area...we need you PEARL!
author: Liz D.

description: I love this place!  I love that you can get mini-burgers (just enough to satisfy your craving).  The milkshake are tasty and the fries are huge!
author: Carlos C.

description: Hole in the wall with the best burgers of them all. Yay for Pearls!
author: Jen C.

description:
If you love gourmet burgers, yet, you don't want to be all bourgie about it, look no further. 

Here's my story: 

Weeknight. 'Bout to keel over from lack of food, been snackin' all day. Unemployed (how irrelevant!!). Craving a sloppy, juicy, mother of a hamburger, and absolutely nothing else. What to do?? I dial up Yelp on my trusty Firefox, look up the highest rated burger joint in proximity (not willing to wait, or travel far). I discover Pearl's - and I'm not looking any further. I see the reviews and f*&K yes I trust these people and their wordy opinions. Literally 20 minutes later I have a burger in my face that is hot and smothered in cheese and mushrooms and awesomeness. Did I not mention it was buffalo? What the hell is wrong with me? Buffalo: Always nice to have as an option. And at this place, you have all the burgerlicious options you can imagine.  And sweet potato fries, and freakin' peanut butter shakes. Holy gluttony. Success!!! Pearl's is my place for burgers from now on. Thanks Yelpers!
author: Julie H.

description: Bobby Flay thinks this place has the best burger in SF, so I've been bugging my boyf to try it...for the last year! Finally, after an unsuccessful shopping excursion in the city, we walked over here with my good friend. I was actually surprised that it was so tiny and a bit ghetto. We did manage to grab a table. I ordered the Phat Bob burger, and no I did not get a mini. My boyf got a Bula burger, and my friend had a mini Phat Bob burger. I also ordered a side of garlic fries. Oh wow...I did not know that the regular burgers had 1/2 lb of meat. It was huge! The taste was spectacular. It was a well--rounded, solid burger. Real thick bacon, cheese, onion rings, yummy sauce...all the fixins! Even though I was full off of half the burger, I was able somehow to put the rest in my tummy. I looked ridiculous. lol. WOw...I may have to agree with Bobby on this one. Next time I'm trying the sweet potato fries as well. I'm still drooling...
author: yeana j.

description: What can not be said about Pearls?!? Their garlic fries are to die for (if you're in to that type of thing)! I opted for the Phat Burger w/ bacon. Very juicy, seasoned well, and the bacon was perfect (crispy, not too greasy). I will definitely make my way back here when I'm in SF.
author: Marissa g.

description: I have to say that I have been underwhelmed by Pearl's many times over. Tonight was the last chance they had to keep me as a customer and they blew it. This is the third order they've screwed up and I cannot count on them to deliver quality product. Fries have been forgotten entirely from my order in the past, burgers have been under cooked and tonight they failed to serve my deluxe with cheese only. I've had with you Pearl. Skip this joint and head over to Burgerhouse on Powell. Those peeps know how to lay down a prime patty exactly the way you request.
author: Nik G.

description: Awesome burgers, piping hot & tasty!  Nothing like a good 'ol burger after a long day of shopping at Union Square.  Service was excellent, not too many seats at the restaurant though.   Very popular joint and for good reason !
author: Melissa P.

description: Not sure what the hype is all about. The burgers are ok but nothing to go out of your way for. Fries tasted like they were packaged and there certainly isn't much in the way of atmosphere. I can't believe that SF doesn't have a better place for burgers.
author: Joanie S.

description:
So good! You can get the juiciest burger there and the best fries. Just make sure you don't eat it too late or the juice from the burger will make the bun turn into mush which makes it difficult to get down on without making a huge mess.

The buffalo burgers are the best. They taste way fattier (better) but are actually a lot better for your and your heart because of where the meat comes from.

Big cheers to this place. F YEAH!
author: g m.

description:
From the previous reviews I thought this was going to be THE burger place that I have been searching for. I was disappointed. Expensive for one burger w/o cheese, a buffalo burger, one order of sweet potato fries, and two shakes. The burgers were good, but greasy. They were cooked a little too medium for my taste, that is, well done. I asked several times for raw onion on my burger but that didn't happen. He even repeated it back to me as "raw onion grilled". I realized then even when I corrected him that my raw onion was going to be grilled. (Doesn't all grilled onion start out raw?) 

The sweet potato fries needed something. I am not sure what, but it wasn't just salt. 

The shakes were good and the selection is wide. 

I am giving Pearl's an extra star because of the wide thick straws that come with the shakes.
author: Tommy B.

description: Great Burgers!! I just broke my Pearl's cherry last night! i got the spicy sly burger! really really good!! the only complaint was it was way to oily!! the garlic fries were ok, not great! but i will totally go back!!! Love me some pearls!!!
author: Chuckie S.

description: A little more than I like to spend for a burger, but boy oh boy is it worth it!! The owners/employees couldn't be much nicer, either. Its very satisfying going to a burger joint that is such a warm environment! You rock, Pearl's!!
author: Timothy B.

description: I have had some great burgers in my life, but wow I was blown away!  This is a must try from a real picky foodie!
author: Aaron S.

description: ehhh. i really wanna love this place. honestly, i gave them a few tries and i still probably will but their burgers are just not as good as people say. their onion rings are really good i must say. but the burgers are very average. big milkshake menu, wish i can try all of them but im lactose.
author: Frankie L.

description: Went here last night...Wow! So far the best burger I have tasted in San Francisco! I ordered the pesto burger from the special burgers list...it's a burger with tomato, jack cheese, and basil pesto sauce. I had it cooked medium. Once I got the burger I found it was very messy due to it being drenched in the pesto sauce...I loved it because the pesto was so delicious, it was made perfectly. The bun (some kind of Parmesan bun?) was delicious and the meat was cooked just right and was incredibly juicy. I can't stop reiterating how good the pesto sauce was...it was so good that the large amount that got on my hands I ended up licking off of them and the excess that dripped in the basket it was served in ended up have the burger dipped in it. Crazy thing was that was just the normal beef they use I'm definitely going to have to try their buffalo meat and Kobe (yes I said KOBE!!!) beef varieties on subsequent visits which I guarantee there will be. I'll also have to try those sweet potato fries everyone keeps talking about. But as far as their burgers...that alone is worth the 5 stars. Also just as a side note the service was excellent and the staff was very friendly. Definitely check this place out if your in the city and want heaven on a bun.
author: Brian C.

description: craving a burger and have had this place on my radar for about a year.  i finally stopped in last night and, yes, the Yelp reviews are correct - it was amazingly YUMMY!  oh - and they are now open Sundays - thank you!
author: Loralyn S.

description: Food's great but the Sunday night service is what earned the two stars. I love eating here but tonight I called in an order. "Five to ten minutes" was the womans response. I get there about 15 minutes later and stand in line to pay, she acknowledges me and says thank you. I sit down and wait for my order. After 3 people behind me have already gotten their food to which they had ordered after me, I make eye contact with the cashier and she smiles and asks what my number is. They then realize what happened and put in my order. So I figure there's no point in calling in an order since they wont make your food until you actually show up, I know that now because the man behind me also called in his order and they yelled his name saying he'd arrived. Awesome.
author: Grant A.

description: I tried both the buffalo and regular beef burger and both were delicious!  I thought they could have used a little bit more salt on the burger, but that may just be me.
author: Marianne L.

description: Many the day, ok at least on 4 occasions, a juicy burger from Pearls has been included in the hangover resuscitation for myself as well as many of my office mates.  I tend to go here when I have a mid-day craving for either red meat or the blood of people who are stupid and get on my nerves.  The joint is clean, tables are promptly cleared and wiped down and the service is prompt.  Props to them for being man enough to offer American Cheese in a city where all the yuppie burger joints turn up their nose at the stuff.  With that being said, I never order anything very exciting.  The deluxe with American cheese and small order of fries even though they have other more interesting and exciting burger options.  Buffalo, Kobe, are amongst those choices for a higher price, and I like that they have a wall hanging that compares nutrition stats, which is helpful to the calorie conscious.  They offer chicken too, but I didn't walk 6 blocks for a chicken burger!
author: Amy Z.

description: so i ordered "The Bomb" burger which is an open-faced burger completely drenched and swimming in a pool of chili with cheddar and onions.  let me tell you they do NOT mess around with this burger.  it was served in one of those full-sized to-go containers and the chili was easily able to reach all four corners.  great burger and great chili.  i paid the price the next day though, and couldn't contain the gas to save my life.
author: Scott K.

description: Best burger I've had in the city! Pretty pricey, but totally worth it.
author: Morgan F.

description: This is just what the tendernob needs, considering the lack of quality burger joints around.  The buffalo burgers and sweet potato fries are delicious, although not inexpensive.  The staff is really friendly too.
author: Rich C.

description:
God Bless America.... and the owner and his fine food!  Pearl's Deluxe is the absolute best bang for the buck, juicy, rich, tasty burger money can buy.  The onion rings are out of this world... And don't get me started on the malteds!

My favorite is the "Mini Bacon Cheese", but the hot dogs rock too.  The burger is spectacularly cooked to perfection (medium rare) every time.  The meat is high quality and juicy and has a perfect texture.  It would be just fine served plain, sans bun as well!  The rings have a peppery flavor and crunch just right.  I enjoy the fries as well (crunchy and tender in all the right places), but I'm a rings guy...

Very clean, well staffed and a definite bright spot in the neighborhood.  The staff/owner is just a great friendly guy!
author: Peter S.

description:
This place friggen rocks.  
As an East Coaster who moved to California 18 months ago, it took me a good six visits to In and Out before i got over it.  Then i realized that mass produced patties are mass produced patties, no matter how you bend your arches and dress up your employees.  
So in the spirit of all things San Francisco, this nondescript burger joint in lower nob hill sets itself apart from the rest through fresh ingedients, quality, originality and pride.  The employees don't make 399 burgers per hour, and it shows.  The place is small, and wait is a bit longer than normal.....but upon unwrapping the prize, you realize what took so long.  The Phat Burger is the house burger with the usual options (bacon, swiss, mushrooms etc), but the specialty burgers really set this place apart.  
I also must encourage everyone to not leave without a serving of the sweet potato french fries.  I still am not sure if sweet potatoes are better for you than white ones.....but honestly, who gives a shit, they just taste better.
author: Gavin D.

description: Yum! They make great burgers and the Bula Burger is one of my favorites. The Phat Bob is another favorite of mine. The bacon is really thick and their sauces are amazing. Good prices and love the fact that you can get 1/2 fries and 1/2 onion rings. A+
author: Chris B.

description: Every time is a good meal. Great burgers and lots of fries. The employees are friendly too, that's something I always look for.
author: UT V.

description: People say it's the best burger place in SF.  I really hope this isn't true because the rivalry between NY and SF on which city has better food would then be surrendered...  Wasn't bad, wasn't the best though...  One of those places where you gotta be on your feet when you order, no pun intended...  These guys are always in a rush, I guess I can understand that by the crowd that gets in this place but still... I have this thing about trying recommendations from the person taking my order, I do it everywhere, didn't even get a chance to do that here, thats how rushed I was, so if you are under the influence of anything chilled know what you want to order before ordering...
author: Vinnie G.

description: yummy! a really small place, but the burgers are so juicy! i got the mini mushroom burger (which is actually a regular size) with swiss cheese. super flavorful and also a side of onion rings make it the perfect match! one of the best burger places in sf!
author: Karen H.

description: Bula Burger + Nutella Milkshake = Heaven
author: Grace G.

description: This place is great, best burger and shakes I have ever had. The burgers themselves are thick, juicy and filling. The milkshakes are to die for. Thick and creamy and there are plenty of flavors to choose from (like blueberry, yum!) If I could give this place 6 stars I would.
author: Brittani H.

description:
This little burger joint deserves 5 stars simply for their food - they offer a whole universe of impressive burgers, cooked to order and invariably delicious. And I can't fail to mention the ever-friendly staff. 
Also, good sides. More places need to serve sweet potato fries!
author: Phil D.

description: PEARLS IS AMAZING! IT'S SERIOUSLY THE BEST BURGER JOINT IN SAN FRANCISCO! I go there at least once a week. I LOVE the phat bob but I substitute the meat for buffalo meat. It's so juicy and delicious. I also recommend the chicken avocado. A lot of my friends are vegetarian and crave the veggie burgers. Their fries are amazing, and so are their milkshakes! I LOVE PEARLS!
author: Arianna M.

description: It's not often that you find friendly spot-on service, bomtastic beef, AND sweet potato fries all in one convenient little place. Pearl Burger has changed my life (and let's be honest, probably my waistline.) This place couldn't be better. Except for, oh, maybe if you throw a chocolate malt in the mix and maybe an order of frings (they let you order half fries, half onion rings. How thoughtful.)
author: Jessica S.

description: I'm a chicken burger person  myself...and most places use pretty dry flavorless chicken breasts.....but pearl's chicken burgers are so moist and meaty... top them off with a slice of cheddar!!!
author: Young M.

description:
So I've decided to give my Yelp virginity to Pearl's! I finally broke down and joined Yelp because of the amazing buffalo burger I had this afternoon. The meat was just juicy enough and oh-so-flavorful, it made me stop and contemplate every burger I've had before this one, and this one was up there. Way up there. At the tippity-top! I need an excuse to come back really soon. 

Buffalo!
author: Dominique C.

description: omg pretty much sums it up!  miss living two buildings away from this gluttony paradise.  everything is bigger, tastier and just plain that much worse for your health which made it that much better.  highly recommend the malt shakes!   This place instantly put places like Mels drive in, Lorie's Diner , and Cafe Mason and the rest of the local competition to shame.
author: Chris G.

description: Yummzers ! Love this place, burgers was perfect! Perfect! how often can you said that ?!??! Juice free range beef, cheese was melted just right, fries were fresh and crispy, and there are sooooo many choices! Highly recommend this place !
author: Bernie B.

description: The status quo was correct when they established Pearl's as one of the better burger places in the city.  I came here for a late dinner around 11 on a Saturday night.
