It was hard to find parking though, I must warn you; I went around a couple of times in the surrounding area before my friend spotted some parking.  I looked inside and found that much of the place was packed(hard to compare capacity for a hole-in-the wall location.  It was a good sign though because the atmosphere seemed like it was a great hangout spot.  I waited very shortly in line before it was my turn to order and when I did I got the Pearl's Deluxe Burger with Bacon, Frings and a medium soda which came out to $13.  It didn't take too long before my food was ready and the cashier came over to clean our table and wiped down the condiment bottles before that.   I appreciated the customer service that was shown. When my food came, man was I happy.  The first bite of the burger, I felt like I was in heaven; it was so tender, the juice started dripping into the tray.  Although my friend was not eating, I was so impressed with the quality of the burger that I got him a knife and fork and said, "You've got to try this!"  After his first bite, he agreed.  The frings were under seasoned in my opinion but I'm guessing you could ask for salt and pepper among other things.  I also must add that the cashier was very generous with the supplies and requests I made such as the knife and fork and takeout box. In all, it was a very filling and delicious meal.  I ended up taking out the frings which I will season myself at home.
author: Brandon Y.

description: Almost walked right by this non discript no frills tiny facility. Boy, I;m glad I stopped.  Burger was outstanding. Perfectly cooked, great taste, very juicy. If you are looking for a superior tasting high quality, inexpensive treat, than Pearl's is the place.
author: Randy L.

description: I was craving a juicy burger so The Boyfriend Yelped for me. Now, for the sake of full disclosure, I have to say that my craving may have affected my perception of the burger. But the Bula Burger with Kobe beef was de-lic-ious. The half-pound monster was everything I had dreamed about: juicy, thick and flavorful. The Boyfriend and I shared the burger with an order of "frings" (fries and onion rings). The fries were decent - thick, crispy on the outside, mealy on the inside (like the Whopperburger's, for those of you who get the literary allusion). The onion rings were tasty - real onion! They went well with the burger and some ranch sauce. I loved how the bacon in the burger was REAL bacon - thick and juicy. There were some fatty gristly parts I had to not eat but I'm a fan of Pearl's now. I can't wait to go back and try some more. I'm hoping my next experience (I plan to try a regular beef burger and a buffalo burger at future dates and the sweet potato fries) will be just as fantastic!
author: Christine P.

description: The meat at Pearl's is great. The burger toppings had some flair to it, but the classics were great also.  Nutella milkshake was absolutely amazing! The one problem that I did have with the food was the side dishes... We ordered the garlic fries, onion rings and the sweet potato fries, they were all okay, nothing amazing, and they got soggy very quickly. Other than that, very good burger place, will definitely be coming back!
author: Rachel K.

description: when i go and eat at pearls it leaves up to the noise of the best burger. but their have been some issues that haven't like one being a man that works in the kitchen, STEVE. This man is so mean to some customers, like i went on Thursday night it was like 930 pm or so and i didn't get any serves because he said and i quote "WE ARE CLOSED" when the sing said 10pm. Every one else was nice to me but this man, he was a real CAT and i mean a jerk!!!!
author: dan h.

description: One of the best burgers I've ever eaten and a pretty good $3.50 shake too.     I ordered the Phat Burger and my son ordered the Bula Burger.   We also had springs, the sweet potatoes and onion rings combo, and a blue berry shake.   We got there at 2:00 and were able to get a table.  The food was ready in six or seven minutes.   My burger was about five inches high with all the fixings.   The burger must be eaten with two hands and over the basket so all the drippings and fat that flow from the burger are caught.   You also must have at least four napkins as this is a very juicy burger.  The bula burger includes ample bacon and a sweet slightly spicy teriyaki sauce.   Also a winner.   The meat weighs in at 1/2 pound so bring an appetite.   The blueberry shake was thick and filed with bits of blueberry -   The onion rings were much better than the sweet potatoe fries.   I agree with Bobby Flay and Tyler Florence, -  this is a great burger place -
author: Wilfred L.

description: I am writing a review about the "new" Pearl's on 6th. and Market, not yet listed on, YELP! I  ADORE,ADORE,ADORE this location!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! NOT,NOT,NOT because of WHERE it is located,per say. (HATE the street scene.) Thus, only 4 stars. HOWEVER- just forget about it!! The food is incredible... The onion rings: fresh. Made from"grandma Pearl's" own homemade recipe; and honey, get ready to smile! Actually, this is an IDEAL location for local students(Hastings)--local working class lunch, and the harried shopper. Did I mention how SPARKLING CLEAN this place is, despite the area?? TRUE--TRUE--TRUE!!! Then there's the matter of the staff/service- PERFECT. EVERY time you go in you are greeted w/ a smile and" hello," "Welcome!" Which I, as a human being, AND a consumer, find refreshing in today's world where RUDE/INDIFFERENT seems to be more the norm!!! If I were judging this place on service, cleanliness, price, portion ratio(HUGE) for the money, "PEARL'S" on 6th. and Market St. would make 5 whole stars!!  The street scene is DRAMA. But, if you're a local, you can handle it!! We see this stuff ALL THE TIME!!! Get. Real. I'm hoping "Pearl"s" will attract "new blood" to the area. THE BATHROOMS ARE SPOTLESS!!!!!!! This is NOT a dive!!!!!!  Try it. You'll be glad you did! (Buy bigger pants!) ''I'll be back!"  They ARE STILL OPEN. It's 6-29-12.
author: Sabrina R.

description: PHAT BOBBY !!h ahaah..  always get a phat bob with buffalo meat some fries and a shake.  i think all their milkshakes that i have tried are pretty good but i prefer the fruity ones.  this is the best burger in the city.  just wissh that it was open on sundays or later or weeknights
author: David C.

description: Truly don't get the hype.  It's fried not flame grilled or anything special and the meat is good quality but they consistenly overcook my burger.  I order it medium and it comes dry.  Shake was okay - nothing spectacular.  Maybe I will spring for the Kobe one more time and see if it shakes my world.  In the meantime I like the burgers at Savor.
author: oyefunke a.

description: After hearing all the hype & realizing that this place was within a block of the abode of one of my friends, I decided to give it a try.  I was seriously jonesing for a burger.  I ordered a pesto burger & asked for  them to substitute turkey ($7.79), then had the chili cheese fries ($5.49).  Though I thought the pesto burger, which was a specialty burger, was slightly overpriced, it was big & tasty.  The chili cheese fries, though of a healthy serving, were nothing to get excited about.  They advertise their chili as being homemade; theirs is way too soupy for me.  They also skimped on the cheese, though they were kind enough to ask if I wanted the fried with onions or without.  Their selection of specialty burgers is extensive enough & buffalo burgers are on offer as well.  Their regular burgers were more reasonably priced.  I liked the turkey pesto burger well enough to assure my return, but the chili cheese fries are better at Sliders.  The place is really small with no atmosphere to speak of, so it's probably better to get your order to go.
author: Tina B.

description: the burgers AND the shakes here are outstanding. the only downside is that the dining area tends to be a little nippy, especially these days with the cooler weather... bring a jacket!
author: Andrey C.

description: Too many choices! I'm not sure what I was expecting, maybe just tasty hamburger with either cheese or bacon, but I didn't think that there would be this many choices on  the menu. After a lot of himming and haaaing over which burger to order, I finally decided to go for the pesto burger. I chowed that down as fast as I could, without getting messy! That was a tasty burger. My boyfriend got the Bula burger with the pineapple, but they forgot the pineapple. He still thought the burger was still good, though. I wanted fries of course, but then the person taking my order throws out to me me onion rings, fries, sweet potatoes or a mix of two. Huh? That's awesome! Then I had to decide on which two I wanted. The sweet potato fries were delicious, fried just right. The onion rings could of had a little more seasoning on them though. Of course I had to have a milkshake to go the fries.... but there were also too many flavors. What to do? I wanted the coffee, but then I saw Oreo cookie and he said why not have both? OMG that milkshake combo.... there are no words for it. What I really liked about this joint is that they have organic beef and the option to have buffalo or even chicken. I think that Pearl's has a little bit of everything for everyone. The restaurant is teeny tiny, but clean. This location has only been opened for about 14 months. I would come here again to try a different burger.
author: carebear l.

description: I've been living in Nob Hill for over 2 years and I can't believe I just noticed this place. I came here for lunch and had the deluxe burger w/bacon & cheese it was so delicious! The garlic fries was super tasty too and the prices are very reasonable. I will definitely be back!
author: Xuyen H.

description: There may be a difference of opinion, but in my opinion THE BEST burger in the city. I've always gotten the Pearl's Deluxe - bleu cheese, grilled onions, and bacon. It's juicy, greasy and flavorful, everything you look for in a good burger. Trust me when I say you'll need a stack of napkins before you start eating. I try to limit myself from eating here too often since this would be the total opposite of eating healthy unless you order their garden burger and that just wouldn't make any sense. They're generous with their portions so my wife usually orders the kids size burger(I'd like to see the kid that can finish that size a burger). They also have milkshakes. I usually order the nutella milkshake. For those of you that don't know, nutella is a chocolate hazelnut spread that you can put on toast or waffles or make great milkshakes out of. It's a small place so you'd be lucky to grab one of the dozen or so seats. Try to go at odd times. I've been there before 12pm and around 12am, both times were perfect. It's in the middle of the city so parking can be a challenge especially Friday or Saturday nights. This is a must try especially if you're from out of town or just want a really good burger.
author: Lee O.

description: Let's be honest, the ladies come here for the veggie burgers and sweet potato fries as much as for the owner.
author: A W.

description: They weren't kidding when they said "mini" burger... the bun was 3x larger than the patty!  Other than that, it wasn't particularly good or bad.  The "frings" cost over $3 and was nothing special.  When I left I passed by a Jack-in-the-Box and couldn't help but think I could have gotten a tastier meal for $5.95.
author: Robb M.

description: ok so i've been trying to eat healthy of late. in fact, prior to my hung over craving greasy shit last saturday afternoon, it was over 6 months since i've had a burger and/or french fries. so i went for the turkey burger and onion rings. onion rings were a tad soggy, but i think it's because i got them to go - so they had time to get soggy before i devoured them. good burger. hopefully it won;t be another 6 months until i give burgers and fries another go.
author: James J.

description: Yeah, I don't think people in SF know what a good burger is. After reading the reviews here, I expected much better. My burger was dry and the bacon was chewy and fatty. The fries were ok, but overall my meal was almost $20. For $20, I expected better. I'd opt for In-n-Out any day over this.
author: Unknown K.

description: I ordered the Bula Burger with Kobe beef.  It was definitely a good burger, but it wasn't great.  In fairness to Pearl's, that was largely my fault because I foolishly didn't specify how I wanted it cooked.  I would have liked it medium, but I got more of a medium-well, pushing well-done.  Otherwise, the ingredients were pretty good and I'd go back -- I'll just have to remember to tell them to take it easy on the grill.
author: Luke P.

description: Burger craving!  Based on the glowing reviews below, we hop on the scooter and bee-line it to Pearl's.  Ordered the Pearl's Deluxe, which is supposed to come medium.  Result?  Not a speck of pink anywhere in the hard grey burger patty (except for the cold raw center spot that my wife spit out).  And come on, it's the middle of summer, and the tomato on top was white-pink and flavorless.  At least the single leaf of lettuce was nice, green, and crisp.  Really?  This is the best burger in SF?  Really?
author: Kazu S.

description: pretty good. only 3 star because the competition (AKA bistro burger) is far superior. also 3 star because i expected the burger to have more taste. it wasnt bad, it was just typical. sweet potato fries are decent. ill go back and give it one last chance and eat me some buffalo, that will either seal the deal or seal their fate!
author: Evan M.

description: the owner Young is good peeps. excelent customer service and distinctively tasty pearl burgers...harold and kumar need to voyage here!
author: dion l.

description: perfect burger but i was really enraptured by a decent vanilla MALT and the sweet potato fries
author: Mark S.

description: Bobby Flay was on to something when he named Pearl's as the best burger. I cannot remember every burger I have ever eaten, but the burger I had from Pearl's last night was the best. I had a Bula Burger. My wife had a mushroom swiss turkey burger. We split sweet potato and regular fries. Everything was so good. I cannot wait to go back and try the other specialty burgers.
author: Aaron W.

description: Just ate there, for the first time, today. It's the best cheeseburger I've had in while. Definitely, one of my top three burger joints in the city.
author: John C.

description: I never thought my fellow Asians could operate such a great hamburger shack, but they do. The burgers are juicy and huge. The onion rings are spiced up and are delicious. Also the sweet potato fries are probably amongst the best in the city. Don't forget to get a shake - they seem pricey but they're well worth it.
author: Gary H.

description: wow!!!  try the king burger and the prize pearl!!!  the best burger place in the city!!!
author: Jose C.

description: I was hankering for a good burger and decided to check out yelp for some suggestions.  Pearl's looked good, and had great reviews so I thought I'd check it out.  I can see its appeal as a local place, niman ranch beef (decent tasting, lacked seasoning), and an intriguing selection of burgers, but I came away disappointed.  Sweet potato fries were soggy and tasteless, onion rings barely had batter on it, most of the garlic in the garlic fries were raw, the buns looked like a cheap, store-bought brand, and I've had better chili.  I wouldn't go back unless I was in the area and really, really desperate for a blah burger.
author: tom s.

description: I ate at this place yesterday and I had to say that the burger I ordered is the Pearl Prize burger which consists of bacon, onions, mayo, and blue cheese crumbles. It one tasty ass burger. The bacon slices were very thick. Also I know blue cheese is an acquired taste. I also had onion rings that were freshly made. Not the frozen ones. The onions rings weren't that salty like some places that have it. I also got a chocolate banana shake which tasted great.
author: Matt B.

description: My husband and I watched Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle in the afternoon and were craving burgers as soon as the movie started. Yelped a couple of places (there are a gazillion threads on where to find good burgers in SF on this, so thank you guys!) and ended up at Pearl. We both LOVED our burgers! I had one with grilled onions and blue cheese (The Prized Pearl, I think) and he had something with onion rings and barbeque sauce. Also ordered chili cheese fries which hit the spot too. The burgers are big, greasy and heavy, and WILL leave you bloated and wanting to OD on laxatives. It's worth it though!
author: Maria K.

description: This place has really good milkshakes. I had the mint chocolate chip milkshake and it was sooo good! It was thick and I would go back any time to get a shake there. The burgers were decent. I got the cheeseburger and it was pretty decent. The fries are also decent. I would just come here for the mint chocolate milkshake. If you want a good shake and some decent burger and fries, I would come here. Friendly service too!
author: Cat L.

description: Absolutely delicious, inexpensive with incredibly fast service. Perfect for a college student like myself. My boyfriend and I can share a burger and fries and still be totally stuffed. HIGHLY recommend.
author: T D.

description: This place freaking rocks!  The owner is super friendly and your order always come out correct.  I always get the buffalo spicy sly.  Grilled onions, pepper, spicy pumpkin sauce, and swiss cheese.  Count me in.  If you are looking for a super kick ass burget go here.
author: Chris M.

description: I love this place, I only wish it had been there when I lived a block away. The phat bob is great and so is everything else I have had there. This place has some of the best burgers I have ever had.  Plus, they are not really over priced like some places around town.
author: mike V.

description: Addicting! Once you try it you will HAVE to come back, it will echo in the back of your head, "Cheeseburger, garlic fries, milkshake." Do yourself a favor and go now! Open till 2am on Friday and Saturday! Love it.
author: JA C.

description: Not a bad burger but the prices are a little steep, burger, fries, and a coke your lookin at about $12. If you want a better burger for less check out Big Mouth Burgers on 24th and Valencia!!
author: Mike B.

description: great choices on burgers and they are very flavorable, but it is a bit pricey for a burger. the garlic fries and milkshakes are also really delicious . sometimes it's hard to find parking, but it's worth it if you are wanting a hearty burger.
author: Katherine F.

description: i'm probably not qualified to write a review on this place since... i ate a salad here (gasp). but, the cobb salad was exceptionally good considering the price, the fact that this is a *burger* joint, and the huge amount of salad that i got. everything in it was fresh and crisp if vegetable, juicy and tender if chicken, and high quality if either or non of the above. would be a 5 if they used a lettuce other than iceberg. would also have been a 5 if i had eaten a burger.. shame on me. maybe next time i'll try their namesake and come back raving about it.
author: Dana D.

description: The blue cheese burger here is the greatest I've ever had!  Though, there is some inconsistency with the beef patty's juiciness sometimes, it's usually really good.  The garlic fries need a little work in that the garlic doesn't stay on the fries, but the free pickles totally make up for that little fault.  The phone order convenience is perfect for my hectic schedule!
author: John C.

description: i had no ideas this place serves such great burgers. fries are okay. nothing special (i love french fries). but, their burgers are great! love this place!! thank god i live just a block away!!! :-)
author: Superhiro M.

description: After reading about this place I got excited. I work and live in the area. i drive down the block it's on and i have never seen the place. I don't even remember what this place used to be. It's nice to know there is a new burger joint that serves quality burgers in the area. I like the burgers at Grubsteak but it's a little too far. So we finally fopund the place and it's tiny. They have an interesting menu and I am doing to make it a point to try every burger on the menu. they all look really good. I hade the "Bula Burger" and it was delicious. Even the bread was awesome. It's toasted on the flat top and it gives the burger this great texture. The first bite of the burger was unexplainable. i highly recomend this place. They are open til 2am friday's and saturday's. this place is gonna blow up!
author: joe v.

description: If my husband was writing this review he would give this place five stars.  He's addicted to Pearl's.  I am not.  I've eaten here several times when the hubby wins that argument.  They get points for offering organic meat and yummy milkshakes.  However, one time when I ordered the turkey burger, I got food poisoning.  A mixed bag.
author: Shelley N.

description: I've been to Pearls at least one time a week for the past month.  The first three times were awesome because I ordered the Pearl Deluxe and Garlic fries.  A couple of days ago, I tried the Pesto Burger with Buffalo meat and the sweet potato fries on the recommendation for a yelper.  Big mistake.  The Pesto burger was tasteless, and the sweet potatoe fries weren't anything special.  Stick with the Deluxe and the garlic fries.
author: Ian L.

description: Whoever decided to say that this place is high on the ranking list needs to understand what a burger is and isn't.  My girlfriend and I order to different burgers, one being "The Phat Bob" and the other "The Bomb".  The Phat Bob was pretty much bacon and a bun with a HUGE hint of BBQ sauce.  Mine being the The Bomb was a F*^*ing bomb!  Picture chili with two slices of bread.  The bread was so disgustingly sopping wet with Chili you honestly had to eat the thing with a spoon.  I know its open faced but come on, really. Oh and another thing burger meat shouldn't be like Beef Jerky, where's the moistness at???  LUCKILY the one thing they had going for them were the milkshakes, they were pretty decent.  I can honestly say I am never going back there again.
author: Steve C.

description: I don't even really eat burgers but this place Rawks- Buffallo burgers....Sick specialty combination burgers....super attentive staff...Like SMOKES Flippers or Sliders-
author: Michael V.

description: My turkey burger was good... my sweet potato fries were BOMB.  I am on a constant quest for a good turkey burger/sweet potato fry combo.  This place will do for now.  Cute little environment... not a lot of seats, though, so be prepared to wait for a seat.
author: Toni A.

description: Pearl's has the best burgers in San Francisco.  You can get bison burgers or burgers made with organic, grass fed Estancia beef, but I like to just get their standard Niman Ranch burgers.  For those who can't decide whether they want fries or onion rings, they can order a combo called "frings." Can't decide between onion rings and sweet potato fries (yes they have them!)?  Just get the "springs." If you like milkshakes, you'll be in heaven when you see their menu; they have your standard flavors plus all kinds of more creative, or as my friend calls them "fancy flavors" (peach, cookies & cream, peanut butter).  The staff is super efficient and nice; basically they're the kind of people you would least mind being stuck in an elevator with.  The food is best eaten there at the restaurant; although there is limited seating, there is pretty good turnover, so I normally don't have to wait too long for a seat.  Pearl's is open 'till 2 a.m. Fridays & Saturdays, so it's a great place for late-night snacks.  They used to close on Sundays, which was very depressing, but now they are open all week.  I just went there yesterday, and I saw a hand-written sign thanking customers for their support and saying Pearl's was going to be featured on  Food Network's "Best Thing I Ever Ate.". They totally deserve it, as I have been a frequent customer for the past couple years & have found their food & service consistently good.
author: Anis S.

description:
i think this place really deserves 3.5 stars.  this is one of those times that i really wish i could give that other 1/2 star.  however with a lot of other good burger joints that i regular in the city.  a lot of you don't know this but i eat about 5 -7 burgers a week.  no joke.  4 out of 5 workdays that's whats for lunch.  so i was really excited to try pearl's.  what was strange was that this place is in relative close proximity to my apartment i have been living at the last year and i never made the trek down the hill to try it.
its really pretty simple.  there wasn't anything wrong with this burger but there wasn't anything really spectacular either.  it was juicy and cooked to order which is great but when a burger is  that greasy i think you need to season it a little.  i think a little salt goes a long way.  when a burger is dripping sometimes the grease tastes a little just too much like grease and the flesh of the animal.  i really don't know how to explain it, i wish i was a better writer.  also another thing that really kind of turned me off was that the bacon was undercooked for my taste.  especially for how thick it was.  
now i think this is a darn fine burger.  and if I'm in the neighborhood i can count on it i am sure but i don't think it will become a destination for me.  i have had much better burgers at sliders actually.  and believe it or not red's java house bacon cheeseburger with grilled onions has become one of my favorite burgers in the city.  i think I'll give pearl's more chances so that it has the opportunity to wow me.  i really hope it does because i really think the burger has potential.  i am also intrigued by the buffalo burger as i have read good things about it.
all in all solid but not fantastic.
author: Anthony Y.

description: this place is really good. i go here to satisfy my cravings for an ATL style slawdog by ordering a hotdog and dumping a side of cole slaw on it. the burgers are also delicious. lots of wonderful toppings and options. they put mayonaise on them though if you dont say anything, so if you are like me and the thought of mayonaise on a burger is absolutely revolting, make sure you tell them!! also they are not open on sundays, so keep that in mind. i've forgotten a couple of times and it's a drag to show up there envisioning the scrumptious burger you are about to consume only to be shut down. this place is fun and good. friendly service, good sweet potatoe fries and frings, great shakes (try the peanut butter chocolate) go here when you want to sink your teeth into something juicy and fattening. oh and i think they use good meat too for all their burgers now, organic! you can also order mini burgers for less money and they really aren't even that small.
author: Jo L.

description: This place is greeaaatttttt!!!! I've been here four times and each time I've had something delicious. I've had the Phat Bobb which is sooo tastey. The barbecue sauce that dripped out of the burger was great for dipping my onion rings into! I also had the King Burger which was like a heart attack waiting to happen. One whole sausage combined with a burger?! Really really really good. I do recommend adding lettuce and tomatoes and such or else you're just eating meat and cheese, which is good too but i think having a burger requires to get the extras. The sides are also very good. The first time I went I had the onion rings which I considered the best onion rings I've ever had. Pricing is good too. Shouldn't spend more than $12 for a specialty burger and a side. The specialty burgers are all 1/2 lb except for the King burger, which is 1/4 lb, and if those are too big for you you can order a mini burger. They also have buffalo and turkey burgers for the people who have the will to be healthy in a place where it feels sooo good not to be.
author: Craig D.

description: this place is so friggin' good!  i've had the turkey burger and it was extra juicy.  try the frings, but don't pass up on the sweet potato fries.  next time -  i'm coming in for the buffalo burger.
author: meijan w.
